Cables on the ground in areas used by the public in a tent or air-supported structure shall be placed in trenches or protected by covers to prevent damage from traffic.
Smoking and open flame devices shall not be permitted in a tent or air-supported structure while it is occupied by the public.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoking shall not take place and open flame devices shall not be used in a tent or air-supported structure unless provisions have been made for such activities under the fire safety plan.

National Sentence Text: A person shall be employed to watch for fires when a tent or air-supported structure is occupied by more than 1 000 persons.

A person employed to watch for fires as described in Sentence 2.9.3.4. shall be familiar with all fire safety features, including the fire safety plan as provided in conformance with Section 2.8. and the condition of exits, and patrol the area to ensure that the means of egress are kept clear and that requirements of the authority having jurisdiction are enforced.
P/T Sentence Text: A person employed for firewatch duty in accordance with Article 2.9.3.3. shall  be familiarized with all fire safety features, including the fire safety plan as provided in conformance with Section 2.8 and the condition of exits, and  patrol the area to ensure that the means of egress are kept clear and that regulations are enforced.

National Sentence Text: Where tents and air-supported structures are designed to accommodate more than 1 000 persons, a fire alarm and emergency communication system shall be provided. (See Note A-2.9.3.5.(1).)
Daycare centres shall be constructed in conformance with the NBC.

There shall be at least one staff member for each 10 children 2 years of age and older and, where children under the age of 2 years are cared for, there shall be at least one additional staff member for every 5 such children.
Combustible materials, such as artwork and teaching materials, that are attached to walls shall not exceed 20% of the area of such walls.
P/T Article Title: Artwork and teaching materials on walls
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible artwork and teaching materials that are attached to walls shall not exceed 20% of the area of the walls.

National Sentence Text: Where handicapped children are being cared for in a centre, sufficient staff shall be present to escort the children to safety during the period they are in the centre.
P/T Sentence Text: Where children with disabilities are cared for, sufficient staff shall be present at all times during the period the children are in the centre to escort them to safety in the event of a fire emergency.

National Sentence Text: At least one portable extinguisher having a 2-A rating shall be installed on each storey of a building described in Article 2.11.1.1.
Except as permitted in Sentence 2.12.1.1.(2), covered malls designed for ornamental and pedestrian oriented uses only shall not be used for merchandising or public activities.
P/T Sentence Text: Covered malls designed for ornamental and pedestrian uses only shall not be used for merchandising or public activities, except that such activities may occur on a temporary basis where they do not create a fire hazard.

National Sentence Text: Merchandising or public activities in a sprinklered covered mall described in Article 2.12.1.1. shall not be permitted where such activity will create a hazard exceeding the design criteria for which the sprinkler system was designed.
P/T Sentence Text: Merchandising or public activities in a sprinklered covered mall described in Article 2.12.1.1. shall not be carried out where such activity will create a hazard exceeding the design criteria for which the sprinkler system was designed.

National Sentence Text: Where a covered mall is used for merchandising or public activities, the activity shall be arranged so that access to fire protection equipment, including sprinkler control valves, fire hose stations, portable extinguishers and fire alarm stations, is not restricted.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a covered mall is used for merchandising or public activities, the activities shall be arranged so that access to fire protection equipment, including sprinkler control valves, fire hose stations, portable extinguishers and fire alarm stations, is not restricted.

National Article Title: Flammable and Combustible Liquids and Flammable Gases
National Sentence Text: Flammable liquids, combustible liquids and dangerous goods classified as flammable gases shall not be used or displayed in a covered mall.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: A propane-fuelled automotive vehicle shall not be displayed in a covered mall unless the propane fuel tank is permanently installed, the fuel system is equipped with an automatic stop-fill valve, the fuel cut-off valve is closed, fuel tank filling connections are locked or secured against tampering, and batteries are disconnected.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Areas or rooms communicating with the landing area shall be separated therefrom by a fire separation conforming to the NBC.

Smoke alarms within dwelling units shall be installed between each sleeping area and the remainder of the dwelling unit, and where the sleeping areas are served by hallways, the smoke alarms shall be installed in the hallways.
P/T Sentence Text: A smoke alarm shall be installed  if a sleeping area in a dwelling unit is served by a hallway, in the hallway,  if a sleeping area in a dwelling unit is not served by a hallway, between the sleeping area and the remainder of the dwelling unit,  if a sleeping room is not within a dwelling unit, in the sleeping room, and  on each storey without a sleeping area in a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Smoke alarms are permitted to be battery operated.
P/T Sentence Text: A smoke alarm shall  be permanently connected to an electrical circuit with no disconnect switch between the overcurrent device and the smoke alarm, or  be battery-operated.

National Sentence Text: Smoke alarms conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S531-14 Smoke Alarms shall be installed in each dwelling unit and, except for care, treatment or detention occupancies required to have a fire alarm system, in each sleeping room not within a dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: A smoke alarm shall meet the requirements of CAN/ULC-S531, "Standard for Smoke Alarms".

National Sentence Text: Outdoor storage receptacles, such as dumpsters, used for combustible materials shall be located so that they do not create an undue fire hazard to surrounding buildings. (See Note A-2.4.1.1.(6).)
P/T Sentence Text: Outdoor public amusement areas shall be designed so that they do not create a fire hazard to the public using them.

National Sentence Text: Hay, straw, shavings or similar combustible materials other than necessary for the daily feeding and care of animals shall not be permitted within a tent or air-supported structure used for an assembly occupancy, except that sawdust and shavings are permitted to be used if kept damp.
P/T Sentence Text: Hay, straw, shavings, textiles, films or similar combustible materials shall not be used in the design and construction or as decorative features in outdoor public amusement areas unless approved provisions are made to control the hazard.

National Sentence Text: The electrical system in a tent or air-supported structure shall be maintained and operated in a safe manner.
Except as provided in Sentence 5.5.5.1.(1), this Part applies to the storage of combustible products and dangerous goods, both inside and outside of buildings. (See Note A-3.1.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: This Part applies to the use, storage and handling of hazardous materials and combustible materials.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in this Part, the storage and handling of natural gas shall conform to CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code

Classes and divisions of dangerous goods referred to in this Code shall mean their primary and first subsidiary classification as defined in Part 2 of TC SOR/2016-95 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations  or the categories and subcategories established by the HC Hazardous Products Act, Part II Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System  for controlled products determined in Part 7 of HC SOR/2015-17 Hazardous Products Regulations
Dangerous goods shall not be stored in areas where the ambient temperature may cause them to become unstable or susceptible to undesirable reactions.
Dangerous goods shall be stored in refrigerated areas where such refrigeration is necessary to stabilize the substances.

Dangerous goods shall be stored in packages or containers made of materials that are compatible with the product they contain, and of durable construction and designed to resist damage from normal material handling activities.

Where the package or container for a specific type of dangerous goods is subject to a standard established by a transportation regulatory authority, such package or container shall conform with the applicable standard. (See Note A-3.1.2.3.(2).)
Dangerous goods shall be stored in stable piles such that they will not collapse under normal operating conditions.

In addition to the provisions of Article 3.1.2.2., dangerous goods shall not be stored in areas where they may be subject to temperature extremes or atmospheric pressure that could cause their containers to become deformed or rupture, or physical impact or temperature extremes that could cause a chemical reaction or chemical instability such that a fire could occur.
Cylinders of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases shall be transported in devices designed to provide restraint against movement in any direction.

Reactive materials that are unstable and susceptible to reactions, such as polymerization, or self-accelerating decomposition initiated by heat, shock, vibration, light, an increase in pressure, or sound waves, shall be stored in a location and manner that will prevent the undesired reaction.
Reactive materials that may react with water or humidity shall be stored in sealed containers in a dry location.
Reactive materials that ignite spontaneously in air shall be stored in a liquid that is inert to the material, in an inert atmosphere or in sealed containers.
For the purposes of this Code, unstable dangerous goods shall be considered as reactive materials based on their reactive properties.
Battery-powered industrial trucks shall conform to ULC ULC/ORD-C583-14 Guide for the Investigation of Electric Battery Powered Industrial Trucks

Where wiring or electrical equipment is located in areas in which flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres are present in quantities sufficient to create a hazard, such wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.2. of Division B of the NBC.

High rack storage warehouses with storage heights greater than 13 m, where conditions exist that must be addressed by design and operational details specific to the hazard, need not conform to this Section, where alternative protection is provided in conformance with Article 1.2.1.1..
Products covered in this Section shall not be stored beneath electrical power lines.
P/T Sentence Text: Storage piles of tires or shredded tires in storage yards shall not be located beneath electrical power lines with a voltage in excess of 750 volts or that supply power to fire emergency systems.

National Sentence Text: At least one copy of the fire emergency procedures shall be prominently posted at the outdoor storage site.
P/T Sentence Text: At least one copy of the fire emergency procedures shall be prominently posted and maintained at the storage yard.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.2.5.(2), an access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m travelling distance of any part of an individual storage area.
P/T Sentence Text: Each storage yard shall be provided with fire access routes.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.2.5.(2), an access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m travelling distance of any part of an individual storage area.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire access routes shall  have a clear width of at least 6 m,  be designed to support the loads imposed by fire fighting equipment,  be surfaced with material designed to permit accessibility under all climatic conditions,  be connected with a public thoroughfare in at least two places that are located as remotely from each other as is possible in the circumstances,  be located within all storage pile clearances identified in Clauses 3.2.1.4.(2) and  and Article 3.2.1.5.,  be at least 6 m away from any storage pile,  be accessible and unobstructed at all times, and  be located so that every point in the storage yard where storage piles are located is within 50 m of a fire access route.

National Sentence Text: An outdoor storage area shall be surrounded by a firmly anchored fence that is substantially constructed to discourage climbing and unauthorized entry, not less than 1.8 m high, and provided with gates that shall be locked when the storage area is not staffed.
P/T Sentence Text: If the bulk volume of stored tires and shredded tires is more than 600 m3, the storage yard shall be surrounded by a firmly anchored fence or other approved method of security that controls unauthorized access to the storage yard.

National Sentence Text: An outdoor storage area shall be surrounded by a firmly anchored fence that is substantially constructed to discourage climbing and unauthorized entry, not less than 1.8 m high, and provided with gates that shall be locked when the storage area is not staffed.
P/T Sentence Text: If a fence is used, the fence shall be at least 1.8 m high and constructed to discourage climbing.

National Sentence Text: Any access route, gateway or clear space required in this Section shall be maintained in conformance with Section 2.5., and kept free of obstructions and piles of snow.
P/T Sentence Text: The gateways shall be kept clear of obstructions so that the gates may be fully opened at all times.

National Sentence Text: Each motorized vehicle operating in an outdoor storage area shall be equipped with at least one portable extinguisher having a minimum rating of 2-A:30-B:C.
P/T Sentence Text: A motorized vehicle operating in a storage yard shall be equipped with at least one portable extinguisher having a minimum rating of 2A:30B:C.

National Sentence Text: In unsprinklered buildings, a clearance of not less than 1 m between the top of storage and the underside of the floor or roof deck shall be maintained. (See Note A-3.2.2.3.(2).)

Clearance between stored products and ducts of exhaust ventilation systems shall be maintained in conformance with NFPA 91-2010 Exhaust Systems for Air Conveying of Vapors, Gases, Mists, and Noncombustible Particulate Solids (See Note A-3.2.2.3.(5).)
Signs required in Sentence 3.2.2.5. shall have a minimum dimension of 200 mm, and letters not less than 25 mm high.

When the products stored include Group A plastics, rubber products, Level 2 or 3 aerosols, or dangerous goods, the fire safety plan shall identify the location and maximum quantity of product that is being stored.

An outdoor storage area shall be arranged such that there is a clear space of not less than 30 m between stored products and brush or forested areas, and 6 m between stored products and uncontrolled grass or weeds.
P/T Sentence Text: Storage yards shall be maintained free of combustible ground vegetation, including grass and weeds, for 4.5 m from the stored material and 30 m from brush and forested areas.

National Sentence Text: Products covered in this Section shall not be stored beneath electrical power lines.
P/T Sentence Text: Stickered lumber piles, and piles of lumber and timber treated with combustible liquids shall not be stored beneath electrical power lines having a voltage in excess of 750 volts or that supply power to fire emergency systems.

National Sentence Text: Any access route, gateway or clear space required in this Section shall be maintained in conformance with Section 2.5., and kept free of obstructions and piles of snow.
P/T Sentence Text: Gateways shall be kept clear of obstructions so that gates may be opened fully at all times.

National Sentence Text: Unless controlled in a manner that will not create a fire hazard, a device, operation or activity that produces open flames, sparks or heat shall not be permitted in an outdoor storage area. (See Note A-4.1.5.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Salamanders, braziers or other open flames shall not be used in storage yards.

National Sentence Text: A tire storage area designed to contain more than 375 m3 of rubber tires shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation conforming to Article 3.3.6.5. of Division B of the NBC. (See Note A-3.2.4.2.(1).)
This Subsection shall apply to the indoor storage of packaged aerosol products as classified in Article 3.2.5.2. (See Note A-3.2.5.1.(1).)
Packaged Level 1 aerosol products shall be protected as required for Class III commodities, in both palletized and rack storage, in conformance with Article 3.2.3.2.
Where storage of packaged aerosol products is mixed, protection shall be provided for the most hazardous classification present.

Where a sprinkler system is required to accommodate the storage limits in Sentence 3.2.5.4.(1), the sprinkler system shall be designed and installed in conformance with Article 3.2.3.3., with additional sprinkler protection provided in conformance with NFPA 30B-2015 Manufacture and Storage of Aerosol Products for areas in which packaged aerosol products are stored.

Where the sprinkler system required to accommodate the storage limits in Sentence 3.2.5.4. does not conform to Sentence 3.2.5.5.(1), the storage of packaged Level 2 or 3 aerosol products shall conform to Table 3.2.5.4. for unsprinklered buildings.

Where a Type A dedicated storage area is required to accommodate the storage limits stated in Sentence 3.2.5.4.(1), it shall be separated from the remainder of the building by chain link fencing or a noncombustible partition that is capable of withstanding the impact of rocketing cans and that extends to the underside of the roof deck or to the ceiling which must also be capable of withstanding the impact of rocketing cans.

Except as provided in Sentence 3.2.5.8.(2), the height of storage of packaged Level 2 or 3 aerosols shall be not greater than 1.75 m where products are in solid piles or on pallets, or 6.1 m where products are on racks.
Aisles separating racks, shelves, or piles of packaged Level 2 or 3 aerosol products shall be not less than 2.4 m wide.

Where the amount of stored dangerous goods referred to in Sentence 3.2.7.1. does not exceed the amount stated in Column C of Table 3.2.7.1., it shall be exempted from the requirements of this Subsection.

Rooms or parts of buildings used for the storage of dangerous goods shall be dry and cool, and where the products being stored are capable of releasing flammable or toxic gases or vapours under normal ambient conditions, shall be provided with a ventilation system to exhaust such gases or vapours outdoors to an area where they will not return to the building (see Note A-3.2.7.3.(1)(b)).
Areas where dangerous goods are stored shall be kept free of waste packaging materials, debris of any kind, or any spilled product.
Broken packages or containers of dangerous goods shall be moved to a safe location and the product repackaged and labelled as soon as possible.
Storage heights for a protected storage area stated in Table 3.2.7.5. are permitted to be exceeded provided the dangerous goods are stored on racks or shelves.
Stored dangerous goods other than compressed gases shall be kept not less than 100 mm above the floor level.

Except as permitted in Table 3.2.7.6., solid and liquid dangerous goods classified as oxidizers or organic peroxides shall be separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.2. of Division B of the NBC.
Reactive materials shall be separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.2. of Division B of the NBC.
The fire-resistance rating of the fire separations delimiting each fire compartment shall be determined in accordance with the applicable requirements of the Code. (See Note A-3.2.7.6.(2).)
Measures shall be taken to prevent or minimize corrosion or deterioration of shelving, racks, and piping system components due to contact with stored dangerous goods.
Floors in areas where dangerous goods are stored shall be constructed in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.7. of Division B of the NBC, and maintained as an impervious membrane.
Dangerous goods classified as oxidizers or organic peroxides shall not be stored on combustible floors or platforms.

Buildings described in Sentence 3.2.7.9. need not be equipped throughout with a sprinkler system or other fire suppression system, provided that storage consists only of dangerous goods classified as non-flammable, non-toxic gases with no subsidiary class of oxidizing substances.

Where the collective individual storage areas for dangerous goods exceed 10 m2 in a fire compartment, means shall be provided for manual or automatic venting of smoke and toxic gases from the storage area under fire conditions. (See Note A-3.2.7.10.(1).)
Where the dangerous goods identified in Sentence 3.2.7.14. consist of a single product, only the UN number need be posted.

Where the dangerous goods identified in Sentence 3.2.7.14. consist of more than one class of products, a placard for each individual class, or the "Danger" placard shown in TC SOR/2016-95 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations  shall be posted at the entrance to the storage area.
Individual storage areas described in Sentence 3.2.7.14. shall be identified in the fire safety plan as required in Article 3.2.2.5.

In a building regulated by this Subsection, at least one person shall be trained in conformance with Sentence 3.2.7.15.(2), in responsible charge during operating hours, and available to respond to a day or night emergency.
All employees involved in the storage and handling of dangerous goods shall be trained in safe handling procedures and correct responses to an emergency situation.
An area used for the storage of dangerous goods shall be secured against unauthorized access.

National Article Title: Storage of Oxidizers in Mercantile Occupancies
National Sentence Text: This Article applies to mercantile occupancies.

National Article Title: Storage of Oxidizers in Mercantile Occupancies
National Sentence Text: Dangerous goods classified as oxidizers that are located within mercantile occupancies in quantities not exceeding those permitted by Table 3.2.7.1. shall be separated from ordinary combustible material by a distance of at least 1 m.

National Article Title: Indoor Storage of Anhydrous Ammonia and Toxic
National Sentence Text: Cylinders of anhydrous ammonia or dangerous goods classified as toxic or oxidizing gases stored indoors shall be located in a room that is separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.3. of Division B of the NBC, is located on an exterior wall, can be entered from the exterior, and whose closures leading to the interior of the building are in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.3. of Division B of the NBC, and is provided with ventilation to the outdoors.
The occupancy classification of buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC.
This Subsection shall apply to buildings or parts of buildings used for the storage of rubber tires.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to buildings used for the storage of tires in which the bulk volume of tires stored in one fire compartment exceeds 425 m3.

National Sentence Text: In addition to the requirements of Part 2, multi-purpose dry chemical portable extinguishers having a rating of 4-A:80-B shall be installed in every 500 m2 of floor area, and so that the travel distance to any extinguisher does not exceed 25 m.
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to the requirements of Section 6.2, multi-purpose dry chemical portable extinguishers having a rating of 4A:80B shall be installed  in every 500 m2 of floor area, and  so that the distance travelled to any extinguisher does not exceed 25 m.

National Sentence Text: Unless otherwise specified, this Subsection shall apply to the outdoor storage of any product covered in this Section.

This Subsection applies to the indoor storage of Class I to IV commodities, Group A, B or C plastics, and closed containers of distilled beverage alcohol, in solid piles, on pallets, on shelves or in bin boxes or racks.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentences  and , this Subsection applies to the indoor general storage of combustible solids, noncombustible solids with combustible packaging or storage aids, including storage in bin boxes, shelves or racks.

National Sentence Text: When flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored with products covered by this Subsection, the liquids shall meet the requirements of the applicable provisions of Part 4.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection, except Article 3.3.2.6., does not apply to special hazard commodities covered elsewhere in this Code.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.2.3.2.(2), the size of individual storage areas shall not exceed the limits shown in Table 3.2.3.2.
P/T Sentence Text: An individual storage area shall not exceed 500 m2 in buildings that are not sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.2.3.2.(2), the size of individual storage areas shall not exceed the limits shown in Table 3.2.3.2.
P/T Sentence Text: An individual storage area shall not exceed 1000 m2 in sprinklered buildings.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.2.3.2.(2), the size of individual storage areas shall not exceed the limits shown in Table 3.2.3.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Heights of storage in buildings that are not sprinklered shall not exceed 4.5 m.

National Sentence Text: The maximum permitted height of storage in any individual storage area shall be determined according to its base area and shape, and the stability of the stored products, and the height limitations otherwise set in this Section.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum height of storage of any individual storage area shall be determined according to  the stability of the stored products as it relates to the base area and shape, and  the height limitations otherwise set in this Subsection.

National Sentence Text: The maximum permitted height of any individual storage area shall be determined to ensure the physical stability of the stored products under normal circumstances as well as under fire conditions, be determined according to its base area and shape, and the type of packaging, combustibility and chemical reactivity of the stored products, and not exceed the limits specified in Subsections 3.3.3. and 3.3.4.

Except as provided in Sentence 3.2.3.3.(2), where a sprinkler system is required to accommodate individual storage areas referred to in Article 3.2.3.2., the sprinkler system shall be designed and installed in conformance with NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings containing individual storage areas that exceed 6.4 m in height shall be protected with  a sprinkler system designed and installed in accordance with NFPA 13, "Standard for the Installation of Sprinkler Systems", or  a sprinkler system installed before January 1, 2015 that has been approved.

National Sentence Text: If the top of storage in piles, on shelves, in bin boxes or on racks is above the lower chords of floor or roof structural framing members, a clear space of not less than 300 mm shall be maintained between the storage and the structural members.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the top of any storage is above the lower chords of floor or roof structural framing members, a horizontal clear space of at least 300 mm shall be maintained between the storage and the structural members.

National Sentence Text: Aisles separating racks, shelves, or piles of packaged Level 2 or 3 aerosol products shall be not less than 2.4 m wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Aisles separating individual storage areas described in Article 3.3.2.2. shall be at least 2.4 m wide.

National Sentence Text: Adequate access for firefighting purposes shall be provided and maintained to all portions of the storage area.
P/T Sentence Text: Adequate access for fire fighting purposes shall be provided and maintained to all portions of the premises, in conformance with Sentences  to .

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.2.2.2.(6), main access aisles shall have a minimum width of 2.4 m for storage heights of not more than 6 m, and 3.6 m for storage heights of more than 6 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , at least one main access aisle shall extend the length of the building with a minimum width of  2.4 m for storage heights not more than 6 m, and  3.6 m for storage heights of more than 6 m.

National Sentence Text: The width of main access aisles referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.2. need not exceed 2.4 m where the products are stored in racks and the building is sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: Narrower aisles may be approved where the building is sprinklered and the sprinkler design is based on aisle widths less than required by Sentence  but in no case shall the aisle width be less than the aisle width on which the sprinkler design is based.

National Sentence Text: A clear space of not less than 6 m shall be maintained between the stored products and fuel dispensers.

It is permitted to reduce the clear space between individual storage areas prescribed in this Section if a noncombustible fire separation or a dirt berm, not less than 1.5 times the height of the stored products, is provided.
It is permitted to increase the height and size of individual storage areas prescribed in this Section if fire extinguishing measures conforming to good engineering practice are provided.
This Subsection applies to the outdoor storage of products other than dangerous goods.
This Subsection shall apply to the storage of ammonium nitrate mixtures (Class 5.1 oxidizing in quantities exceeding 1 000 kg inside buildings. (See Note A-3.2.9.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the storage of ammonium nitrate in a pure form or in a mixture, if  the storage exceeds 1000 kg, and  the mixture contains 60% or more ammonium nitrate by weight.

National Sentence Text: The height of buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: A building used for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall not be more than 1 storey in building height.

National Sentence Text: All flooring in storage areas shall be constructed of noncombustible materials, as stated in Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: All flooring in storage areas shall be of noncombustible materials.

National Sentence Text: Buildings used for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall incorporate spatial separation and exposure protection in conformance with Subsection 3.2.3. of Division B of the NBC. (See Note A-3.2.9.2.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: The distance between an ammonium nitrate storage facility and the property line of another property shall be not less than  15 m where the other property contains a warehouse for flammable liquids storage or a facility for loading or unloading flammable liquids,  15 m where the other property contains a building classified as medium hazard industrial occupancy or low hazard industrial occupancy provided the ammonium nitrate storage facility does not exceed 200 t of ammonium nitrate,  30 m where the other property contains a building classified as industrial occupancy not covered in Clause (b), flammable liquids storage tanks, flammable gas storage tanks or other tanks containing a hazardous substance, or  90 m for all other occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Buildings used for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall incorporate spatial separation and exposure protection in conformance with Subsection 3.2.3. of Division B of the NBC. (See Note A-3.2.9.2.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: The distance in Clause  may be reduced to 7.5 m if a firewall that has a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h is provided between the storage facility and the building it exposes.

National Sentence Text: Buildings used for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall incorporate spatial separation and exposure protection in conformance with Subsection 3.2.3. of Division B of the NBC. (See Note A-3.2.9.2.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: The distance in Clause  may be reduced to 15 m for a medium hazard industrial occupancy or a low hazard industrial occupancy if a firewall that has a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h is provided between the storage facility and the building it exposes.

National Sentence Text: An internal combustion engine shall not be permitted to remain unattended in a building where ammonium nitrate is stored, unless the engine is located in an area that will prevent the spread of a fire originating in the engine.
P/T Sentence Text: An internal combustion engine shall be continuously monitored at all times in a building where ammonium nitrate is stored unless the engine is located in an area that will prevent the spread of a fire originating in the engine.

National Sentence Text: In addition to the requirements of Part 2, pressurized water portable fire extinguishers having a rating of 2-A or larger shall be installed. (See Note A-3.2.9.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to the requirements of Section 6.2, pressurized-water portable extinguishers having a rating of 2A or larger shall be installed.

National Sentence Text: Signs required in Sentence 3.2.2.5. shall have a minimum dimension of 200 mm, and letters not less than 25 mm high.
P/T Sentence Text: Ammonium nitrate storage shall be identified by signs of contrasting colours indicating the contents with letters 50 mm high.

National Sentence Text: Smoking shall not be permitted within a fire compartment used for the storage of dangerous goods and signs shall be posted in conformance with Article 2.4.2.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoking shall not take place and open flames shall not be used in buildings used for the storage of ammonium nitrate.

National Sentence Text: Smoking shall not be permitted within a fire compartment used for the storage of dangerous goods and signs shall be posted in conformance with Article 2.4.2.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Signs with letters 50 mm high indicating that ammonium nitrate is being stored and that smoking is not permitted shall be prominently displayed near each entrance on the exterior of buildings identified in Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Buildings or parts thereof used for the storage of baled combustible fibres shall conform to Article 3.1.2.6. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Article Title: Building size for storage and handling of combustible fibres
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings used for the storage and handling of combustible fibres shall comply with the height and area limitations of the Building Code for medium hazard industrial occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Except for the distance between a building and cylinders of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases, a clear space of not less than 6 m shall be provided around each individual storage area for dangerous goods. (See Note A-3.3.3.2.(1).)
Dangerous goods shall not be stored to a height greater than 6 m.
Up to 3 m3 of loose combustible fibres are permitted to be kept in a fire compartment provided they are stored in metal-lined bins equipped with self-closing metal-lined covers.
P/T Sentence Text: Up to 3 m3 of loose combustible fibres may be stored in a single fire compartment if they are kept in metal-lined bins equipped with self-closing metal-lined covers.

National Sentence Text: Incompatible dangerous goods that are not allowed in Table 3.2.7.6. to be stored in the same fire compartment are permitted to be separated by a minimum horizontal distance of 3 m in lieu of a fire separation when in an outdoor storage area.

Quantities of loose combustible fibres exceeding 3 m3 but not exceeding 15 m3 shall be stored in rooms separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Quantities of loose combustible fibres exceeding 3 m3 but not exceeding 15 m3 shall be stored in rooms separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation that has a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Quantities of loose combustible fibres exceeding 15 m3 but not exceeding 30 m3 shall be stored in rooms separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Quantities of loose combustible fibres exceeding 15 m3 but not exceeding 30 m3 shall be stored in rooms separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation that has a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Quantities of loose combustible fibres that exceed 30 m3 shall be stored in an individual room that is sprinklered in conformance with NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems that is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h, and except as provided in Sentence 3.2.6.3.(5), with individual storage areas not exceeding the design area of the sprinkler system.
P/T Sentence Text: Quantities of loose combustible fibres that exceed 30 m3 shall be stored in an individual room  that is sprinklered in accordance with NFPA 13, "Standard for the Installation of Sprinkler Systems", and  that is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Dangerous goods and other products described in Sentence 3.3.1.1. shall not be stored in the same individual storage area.
The sides of baled storage piles shall be inclined back from the base of the pile with a slope of not less than 1 m for each 10 m of height.
P/T Sentence Text: The sides of baled storage piles shall be inclined back from the base of the pile with a slope of not less than 1 m for each 10 m of height.

National Sentence Text: The training of personnel involved in the outdoor storage of dangerous goods shall conform to Article 3.2.7.15.

If the top of storage in piles, on shelves, in bin boxes or on racks is above the lower chords of floor or roof structural framing members, a clear space of not less than 300 mm shall be maintained between the storage and the structural members.
P/T Article Title: Clearance for sprinklers and structural framing
P/T Sentence Text: If the storage piles are above the lower chords of floor or roof structural framing members, a horizontal clear space of 300 mm shall be maintained between the storage and the structural members.

National Sentence Text: When dangerous goods are stored outside of a building, safety precautions shall be taken to prevent undesirable reactions from the effects of atmospheric conditions.
Shields shall be provided that will prevent stored material from coming within 300 mm of any part of a heating system's heat distribution network.
P/T Sentence Text: Shields shall be provided that will prevent stored material from coming within 300 mm of any part of a heating system heat distribution network.

National Sentence Text: Intermodal shipping containers used for the transportation of dangerous goods, as well as their contents, shall be stored in conformance with the segregation requirements stated in IMO 2012 International Maritime Dangerous Goods Code (See Note A-3.3.1.1.(2)(c).)
Except as provided in Sentence 3.1.3.2.(3), fuel-fired industrial trucks shall be refuelled only at designated locations outside buildings.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , industrial trucks shall be refuelled only at designated locations outside buildings.

National Sentence Text: Each fuel-fired industrial truck shall be equipped with at least one portable extinguisher having a minimum rating of 2-A:30-B:C.
P/T Sentence Text: Each fuel-fired industrial truck shall be equipped with at least one portable extinguisher having a minimum rating of 2A:30B:C.

National Sentence Text: Battery-charging installations for battery-powered industrial trucks shall be equipped with at least one portable extinguisher having a minimum rating of 2-A:30-B:C.
P/T Sentence Text: Battery charging installations for battery-powered industrial trucks shall be equipped with at least one portable extinguisher having a minimum rating of 2A:30B:C.

National Sentence Text: Unless controlled in a manner that will not create a fire hazard, a device, operation or activity that produces open flames, sparks or heat shall not be permitted in an outdoor storage area. (See Note A-4.1.5.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Open flames shall not be used in a salvage yard, except for the purposes of heating, operating machinery or performing hot works.

National Sentence Text: Areas in process plants, where conditions must be addressed by design and operational details specific to the hazard, need not conform to this Part, where alternative protection is provided in conformance with Article 1.2.1.1.. (See Note A-4.1.1.1.(2).)
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: This Part shall not apply to the transportation of flammable liquids or combustible liquids under TC SOR/2016-95 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations  appliances and their ancillary equipment within the scope of CSA B139-09 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment (see Note A-4.1.1.1.(3)(b)), the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids on farms for individual farm use and on isolated construction projects, or the storage of aerosol products covered under Subsection 3.2.5.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Areas in process plants, where conditions must be addressed by design and operational details specific to the hazard, need not conform to this Part, where alternative protection is provided in conformance with Article 1.2.1.1.. (See Note A-4.1.1.1.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Areas in process plants need not conform to this Part where specific hazards are addressed by design and operational procedures that meet recognized standards and equivalent protection is provided.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: This Part shall not apply to the transportation of flammable liquids or combustible liquids under TC SOR/2016-95 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations  appliances and their ancillary equipment within the scope of CSA B139-09 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment (see Note A-4.1.1.1.(3)(b)), the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids on farms for individual farm use and on isolated construction projects, or the storage of aerosol products covered under Subsection 3.2.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as specifically provided elsewhere in this Part, this Part does not apply to  the transportation of flammable liquids or combustible liquids to which the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Act  and its regulations, or the Dangerous Goods Transportation Act and its regulations apply,  the storage, handling, transportation and use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids to which the Technical Standards and Safety Act, 2000 and its regulations apply,  the storage, handling and use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids at airports, piers and wharves regulated under federal law,  underground areas to which the Occupational Health and Safety Act and its regulations apply,  the storage of aerosol products that fall under the scope of Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of NRC, "National Fire Code of Canada", and  the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids on farms for individual farm use.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Flammable liquids shall be Class I liquids, and shall be subdivided into: Class IA liquids, which shall include those having a flash point below 22.8°C and a boiling point below 37.8°C, Class IB liquids, which shall include those having a flash point below 22.8°C and a boiling point at or above 37.8°C, and Class IC liquids, which shall include those having a flash point at or above 22.8°C and below 37.8°C.
P/T Sentence Text: Flammable liquids shall be Class I liquids, and shall be subdivided into  Class IA liquids, which are those having a flash point below 22.8°C and a boiling point below 37.8°C,  Class IB liquids, which are those having a flash point below 22.8°C and a boiling point at or above 37.8°C, and  Class IC liquids, which are those having a flash point at or above 22.8°C and below 37.8°C.

National Sentence Text: ASTM D 3278-96 Flash Point of Liquids by Small Scale Closed-Cup Apparatus is permitted to be used for paints, enamels, lacquers, varnishes and related products and their components having flash points between 0°C and 110°C, and having a kinematic viscosity less than 150 St at 25°C.
P/T Sentence Text: The flash point for paints, enamels, lacquers, varnishes and related products and their components having flash points between 0°C and 110°C, and having a viscosity less than 15000 mm2/s at 25"°C may be determined in conformance with ASTM D3278, "Flash Point of Liquids by Small Scale Closed-Cup Apparatus".

National Sentence Text: Where refrigerators are used to store Class I liquids, they shall be designed so that electrical equipment located within the storage compartment, within the outer shell, on the door and on the door frame of the refrigerator is in conformance with CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I for Class I, Zone 0 or 1 hazardous locations based on the frequency of occurrence and duration of an explosive gaseous atmosphere, and electrical equipment mounted on the outside surface of the refrigerator is in conformance with CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I for Class I, Zone 2 hazardous locations, or located above the top of the storage compartment.
P/T Sentence Text: Where refrigerators are used to keep Class I liquids, they shall be designed so that  electrical equipment located within the storage compartment, within the outer shell, on the door and on the door frame of the refrigerator is in conformance with the Electrical Safety Code made under the Electricity Act, 1998, for Class I, Zone 0 or 1 hazardous locations based on the frequency of occurrence and duration of an explosive gaseous atmosphere, and  electrical equipment mounted on the outside surface of the refrigerator is  in conformance with the Electrical Safety Code made under the Electricity Act, 1998, for Class I, Zone 2 hazardous locations, or  located above the top of the storage compartment.

National Sentence Text: Fire protection equipment shall be provided where there are special hazards of operation, dispensing or storage.

Unless controlled in a manner that will not create a fire or explosion hazard, a device, operation or activity that produces open flames, sparks or heat shall not be permitted in an area described in Article 4.1.1.1. (See Note A-4.1.5.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Unless controlled in a manner that will not create a fire or explosion hazard, a device, operation or activity that produces open flames, sparks or heat shall not be used or carried out in an area described in Article 4.1.1.1.

National Sentence Text: The fire safety plan required as part of the emergency planning measures in Sentence 4.1.5.5. shall be retained on site for reference by the authority having jurisdiction and personnel.

Required aisles and other access paths shall be maintained to permit the unobstructed movement of personnel and fire department apparatus so that firefighting operations can be carried out in any part of an area used for the storage, use or handling of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: Aisles and other access paths shall be maintained to permit the unobstructed movement of personnel and fire department apparatus so that fire fighting operations can be carried out in any part of an area used for the storage, use or handling of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.1.5.8. and in dwelling units as described in Article 4.2.4.5., and in mercantile occupancies as described in Sentence 4.2.5.3.(3), Class I liquids shall not be stored, handled or used in basements or pits.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentences  to  and Subsection 4.12.10., Class I liquids shall not be stored, handled or used in basements or pits.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.1.5.8. and in dwelling units as described in Article 4.2.4.5., and in mercantile occupancies as described in Sentence 4.2.5.3.(3), Class I liquids shall not be stored, handled or used in basements or pits.
P/T Sentence Text: Class I liquids may be stored in dwelling units in accordance with Article 4.2.4.5.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Class I liquids in closed containers are permitted to be stored in basements of mercantile occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: Class I liquids may be stored in mercantile occupancies in accordance with Subsection 4.2.5.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Up to 10 L of Class I liquid is permitted to be stored in basements, provided it is stored in safety containers conforming to ULC ULC/ORD-C30-1995 Safety Containers
P/T Sentence Text: Up to 5 L of Class I liquids may be stored in basements if the liquids are stored in safety containers that comply with ULC/ORD-C30, "Safety Containers".
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: When barriers required in Sentence 4.1.6.1. are provided to contain accidental spillage from aboveground storage tanks, they shall conform to the requirements for secondary containment in Subsection 4.3.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Where barriers required in Sentence  are provided to contain accidental spillage from aboveground storage tanks, they shall conform to the requirements for secondary containment in Subsection 4.3.7.

National Sentence Text: Water-miscible effluent from spills and firefighting operations is permitted to be directed into a sewer system provided it does not create a fire hazard or any risk to public health or safety.
P/T Sentence Text: Water-miscible effluent from spills and fire fighting operations is permitted to be directed into a sewer system provided it does not create a fire hazard or any risk to public health or safety.

National Sentence Text: The fire safety plan required by Article 4.1.5.5. shall include measures to be taken to direct the overflow of spilled liquids and firefighting water away from buildings, adjoining properties, means of egress, air intakes or openings that could permit vapour entry into the building, fire alarm control panels, fire department access routes, valves controlling the water supply for firefighting, or fire protection systems, fire department pumper connections or wall hydrants, isolation valves controlling processes, and valves controlling the flow of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire safety plan required in Article 4.1.5.6. shall include measures to be taken to direct overflow of spilled liquids and fire fighting water away from  buildings,  adjoining properties,  means of egress,  air intakes or openings that could permit vapour entry into the building,  fire alarm control panels,  fire department access routes,  valves controlling the water supply for fire fighting, or fire protection systems,  fire department pumper connections or wall hydrants,  isolation valves controlling processes, and  valves controlling the flow of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.

National Sentence Text: Closed drainage systems shall be equipped with a trap. (See Note A-4.1.6.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Closed drainage systems shall be equipped with a trap.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.1.6.3.(3), all reasonable steps shall be taken to recover escaped liquid and to remove or treat contaminated soil.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , all reasonable steps shall be taken to recover escaped liquid and to remove or treat contaminated soil, surface water, ground water or aquatic sediments.

National Sentence Text: Where flammable liquids and combustible liquids are processed, handled, stored, dispensed or used within rooms or enclosed spaces, ventilation shall conform to the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or in the absence of such legislation, to this Part and the NBC. (See Note A-4.1.7.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are processed, handled, stored, dispensed or used within rooms or enclosed spaces, ventilation shall conform to this Part and the Building Code.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.1.7.2.(2), a room or enclosed space referred to in Article 4.1.7.1. shall be provided with one of the following ventilation systems: continuous mechanical ventilation where Class I liquids are processed, dispensed or used in a manner that releases flammable vapours into the room or enclosed space, either natural or continuous mechanical ventilation where Class I liquids are stored, processed, dispensed or used in a manner that does not release flammable vapours into the room or enclosed space, or Class II liquids are processed, dispensed or used.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , a room or enclosed space referred to in Article 4.1.7.1. shall be provided with a ventilation system having  continuous mechanical ventilation where Class I liquids are processed, dispensed or used in a manner that releases flammable vapours into the room or enclosed space, or  either natural or continuous mechanical ventilation where  Class I liquids are stored, processed, dispensed or used in a manner that does not release flammable vapours into the room or enclosed space, or  Class II liquids are processed, dispensed or used.

National Sentence Text: Ventilation required in Sentence 4.1.7.2. shall be sufficient to ensure that flammable vapour concentrations outside the zone identified as Class I, Zone 0 or 1 in conformance with Article 4.1.4.1., do not exceed 25% of the lower explosive limit of the flammable vapour. (See Note A-4.1.7.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Ventilation required in Sentence  shall be sufficient to ensure that flammable vapour concentrations outside the zone identified as Class I, Division I in conformance with Article 4.1.4.1. do not exceed 25% of the lower explosive limit of the flammable vapour.

National Sentence Text: A mechanical ventilation system is deemed to comply with Sentence 4.1.7.2. if it is capable of exhausting at least 18 m3/h/m2 of room area, but not less than 250 m3/h.
P/T Sentence Text: A mechanical ventilation system is deemed to meet the requirements of Sentence  if it is capable of exhausting at least 18 m3/h per square metre of room area and not less than 250 m3/h in total.

National Article Title: Location of Air Inlets and Outlets
National Sentence Text: Ventilation air inlets and outlets within a room or enclosed space referred to in Article 4.1.7.1. shall be arranged so as to provide air movement in all portions of the room to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours in conformance with Sentence 4.1.7.2.(3).
P/T Article Title: Location of air inlets and outlets
P/T Sentence Text: Ventilation air inlets and outlets within a room or enclosed space referred to in Article 4.1.7.1. shall be arranged to provide air movement in all areas of the room or enclosed space.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Location of Air Inlets and Outlets
National Sentence Text: Where the flammable vapour being removed is heavier than air, at least one air inlet shall be located at a point near a wall, and no higher than 300 mm from the floor, and at least one air outlet shall be located near the opposite wall, no higher than 300 mm from the floor.
P/T Article Title: Location of air inlets and outlets
P/T Sentence Text: If the flammable vapour being removed is as dense as air or heavier than air  at least one ventilation air inlet shall be located near a wall, no higher than 300 mm from the floor, and  at least one ventilation air outlet shall be located near the opposite wall, no higher than 300 mm from the floor.

National Article Title: Location of Mechanical Ventilation Exhaust Air Outlets
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 4.1.7.6., the exhaust air outlet from a mechanical ventilation system required in Article 4.1.7.2. shall be located outdoors, not less than 3 m from any building opening, and arranged so that the exhaust air does not discharge toward any unprotected opening within 7.5 m of the discharge point.
P/T Article Title: Location of mechanical ventilation exhaust air outlets
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 4.1.7.6., the exhaust air outlet from a mechanical ventilation system required in Article 4.1.7.2. shall be  located outdoors, not less than 3 m from any building opening, and  arranged so that the exhaust air does not discharge toward any unprotected opening within 7.5 m of the discharge point.

National Sentence Text: Ducts used in a ventilation system conforming to Article 4.1.7.2. shall not be used for any other ventilation or exhaust system.
P/T Sentence Text: Ducts used in a ventilation system as required in Article 4.1.7.2. shall not be used for any other ventilation or exhaust system.

National Sentence Text: When Class I liquids are dispensed from or into a container or a storage tank, all metallic or electrically conducting material in the transfer system shall be electrically bonded and grounded, or if the container or tank is made of non-electrically conducting material, measures shall be taken to minimize the potential for static electric charge to develop (see Note A-4.1.8.2.(1)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: When Class I liquids are dispensed into a container or storage tank,  if the container or storage tank is made of metallic or electrically-conducting material, such container or storage tank shall be electrically connected to the fill stem, or rest on a conductive floor that is electrically connected to the fill stem, or  if the container or storage tank is made of non-electrically-conducting material, measures shall be taken to minimize the potential for a static electric charge to develop.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.1.8.2.(3), when Class I liquids are transferred into a storage tank through the top of the tank, the fill pipe shall terminate within 150 mm of the bottom of the tank.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , when Class I liquids are transferred into a storage tank through the top of the tank, the fill pipe shall terminate within 150 mm of the bottom of the tank.

National Sentence Text: Sentence 4.1.8.2. shall not apply when the storage tank vapour space cannot exceed 25% of the lower explosive limit or is filled with an inert gas that prevents the ignition of the vapour mixture, or the liquid being transferred has a minimum conductivity that prevents the accumulation of static electricity (see Note A-4.1.8.2.(3)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  shall not apply when  the storage tank vapour space cannot exceed 25% of the lower explosive limit or is filled with an inert gas that prevents the ignition of the vapour mixture, or  the liquid being transferred has a minimum conductivity that prevents the accumulation of static electricity.

National Sentence Text: Fill pipes referred to in Sentence 4.1.8.2. shall be installed in such a way as to minimize vibration of the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Fill pipes referred to in Sentence  shall be installed in such a way as to minimize vibration of the pipe.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 4.5.9., the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids by means of pressure applied to a container or storage tank shall not be permitted.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Subsection 4.4.10., flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall not be transferred by means of pressure applied to a container or storage tank.

National Sentence Text: It is permitted to use movable tanks for dispensing flammable liquids or combustible liquids into the fuel tanks of vehicles or other motorized equipment provided such movable tanks are used in conformance with the requirements of this Part for storage tanks.
P/T Sentence Text: Moveable tanks may be used to dispense flammable liquids or combustible liquids into the fuel tanks of vehicles or other motorized equipment if the moveable tanks are used in accordance with the requirements of this Part for storage tanks.

National Sentence Text: Only enclosed pumping equipment designed in conformance with good engineering practice shall be used to transfer Class I liquids to or from the fuel tanks of vehicles inside buildings. (See Note A-4.1.8.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Enclosed pumping equipment designed in accordance with good engineering practice shall be used to transfer Class I liquids to or from the fuel tanks of vehicles inside buildings.

National Sentence Text: Flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall not be stored in or adjacent to exits, elevators or principal routes that provide access to exits.
P/T Sentence Text: Flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall not be stored in or adjacent to exits, including outdoors, elevators or principal routes that provide access to exits.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 4.2.3.3., containers and portable tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be built in conformance with the following: TC SOR/2016-95 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations  CSA B376-M1980 Portable Containers for Gasoline and Other Petroleum Fuels CSA B306-M1977 Portable Fuel Tanks for Marine Use ULC ULC/ORD-C30-1995 Safety Containers or CSA B620-14 Highway Tanks and TC Portable Tanks for the Transportation of Dangerous Goods
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 4.2.3.3., containers and portable tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be built in conformance with  the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (Canada),  CSA-B376, "Portable Containers for Gasoline and Other Petroleum Fuels",  CSA-B306, "Portable Fuel Tanks for Marine Use",  ULC/ORD-C30, "Safety Containers", or  Section 6 of CSA-B620, "Highway Tanks and Portable Tanks for the Transportation of Dangerous Goods".

National Sentence Text: Markings referred to in Sentence 4.2.3.2. are not required when the container is labelled in conformance with TC SOR/2016-95 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations  HC R.S.C., 1985, c. H-3 Hazardous Products Act or HC S.C. 2002, c. 28 Pest Control Products Act
P/T Sentence Text: Markings referred to in Sentence  are not required when the container is labelled in conformance with  the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Act  and its regulations,  the Hazardous Products Act  and its regulations, and  the Pest Control Products Act  and its regulations.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection shall apply to the storage and handling of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in buildings classified as assembly or residential occupancies, except that it shall not apply to nonresidential schools, universities or colleges covered in Subsection 4.2.6.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the storage and handling of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in buildings classified as assembly or residential occupancies, except that it shall not apply to nonresidential schools, universities or colleges covered in Subsection 4.2.6.

National Sentence Text: When a single class of flammable liquid or combustible liquid is stored in a fire compartment with a fire-resistance rating of at least 1 h, the total quantity of liquid shall not exceed 30 L of Class I liquids, 150 L of Class II liquids, or 600 L of Class IIIA liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: If a single class of liquid is stored in a building or in a single fire compartment having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, the total quantity of liquid shall not exceed  30 L of Class I liquids,  150 L of Class II liquids, or  600 L of Class IIIA liquids.

National Sentence Text: The location of storage rooms referred to in Sentence 4.2.4.2. shall conform to Article 3.3.2.16. and Sentence 3.3.4.3. of Division B of the NBC.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall not be stored on exterior balconies.
P/T Sentence Text: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall not be stored on exterior balconies.

National Sentence Text: Not more than 50 L of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, of which not more than 30 L shall be Class I liquids, are permitted to be stored in a garage or shed attached to a dwelling unit.
P/T Article Title: Storage in attached garages or sheds
P/T Sentence Text: No more than 50 L of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, of which not more than 30 L may be Class I liquids, shall be stored in a garage or shed attached to a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the storage and handling of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in mercantile occupancies.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: In unsprinklered mercantile occupancies, the maximum quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids permitted to be stored in a single suite shall be the lesser of 8 L/m2 of the total area of the suite, provided that not more than 2 L/m2 are Class I liquids, of which not more than 0.3 L/m2 shall be Class IA, Class IB, or any combination of these 2 classes, or 8 000 L, provided that not more than 2 000 L are Class I liquids, of which not more than 300 L shall be Class IA, Class IB, or any combination of these 2 classes.
P/T Sentence Text: In mercantile occupancies that are not sprinklered, the maximum quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in a single suite shall be the lesser of  8 L for every 1 m2 of the area of the suite, provided that not more than 2 L per m2 is Class I liquid, of which not more than 0.3 L per m2 shall be Class IA, Class IB, or any combination of these two classes, or  8000 L, provided that not more than 2000 L is Class I liquid, of which not more than 300 L shall be Class IA or Class IB or any combination of these two classes.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection shall apply to the storage, handling and use of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in business and personal services, care, treatment or detention occupancies and shall include nonresidential schools, universities and colleges.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the storage, handling and use of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in business and personal services occupancies, care occupancies, care and treatment occupancies, detention occupancies, non-residential schools, universities and colleges.

National Sentence Text: In the automotive shops or industrial arts area of an educational facility, storage of up to 75 L of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, including not more than 25 L of Class I liquids, shall be permitted outside of a cabinet or storage room as required in Article 4.2.6.2.
P/T Sentence Text: In automotive shop or industrial arts areas of an educational facility, storage of up to 75 L of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, including not more than 25 L of Class I liquid, shall be permitted outside of a cabinet or room as specified in Article 4.2.6.2.

National Sentence Text: Where individual containers with a capacity of more than 5 L are required for storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in a building, safety containers of not more than 25 L capacity conforming to ULC ULC/ORD-C30-1995 Safety Containers shall be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Where individual containers with a capacity of more than 5 L are required for storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in a building, safety containers conforming to ULC/ORD-C30, "Safety Containers", and of not more than 25 L capacity, shall be used.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 4.2.12. regarding self-service storage buildings, this Subsection applies to the storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in closed containers in industrial occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the storage, handling and use of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in industrial occupancies, where storage in closed containers is the principal activity.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: In industrial occupancies, flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be stored in conformance with Subsection 4.2.8., in cabinets conforming to Subsection 4.2.10., in rooms conforming to Subsection 4.2.9., or in storage areas conforming to Article 4.2.7.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be stored  in accordance with Subsection 4.2.8.,  in cabinets that comply with Subsection 4.2.10.,  in rooms that comply with Subsection 4.2.9., or  in storage areas that comply with Article 4.2.7.5.

National Sentence Text: Fire compartments regulated by this Subsection shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of at least 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire compartments regulated by this Subsection shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Where containers for 2 or more liquids having different flash points are stored together in a single individual storage area, the maximum quantity permitted in the individual storage area shall equal that permitted for the liquid with the lowest flash point.
P/T Sentence Text: Where containers for two or more liquids having different flash points are stored together in a single individual storage area, the maximum quantity permitted in the individual storage area shall equal that permitted for the liquid with the lowest flash point.

National Sentence Text: A clearance of not less than 400 mm shall be maintained between stored flammable liquids and combustible liquids and walls, except that where the width of storage adjacent to the wall is not more than 1.5 m, such wall clearance is not required. (See Note A-4.2.7.7.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: A clearance of not less than 400 mm shall be maintained between stored flammable liquids and combustible liquids and walls, except that where the width of storage adjacent to the wall is not more than 1.5 m, such wall clearance is not required.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 4.2.7.9., main aisles, access aisles and aisles defining individual storage areas shall be in conformance with Article 3.2.2.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 4.2.7.10., main aisles, access aisles and aisles defining individual storage areas shall be in conformance with Articles 3.3.2.5. and 3.3.2.6.

National Sentence Text: Except for Class I commodities, flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall not be stored in the same individual storage area with other products listed in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible materials, other than those used for the packaging of flammable liquids or combustible liquids, shall not be stored in the same individual storage area with such liquids.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise noted in this Part, this Subsection applies to industrial occupancies where the use, storage and handling of flammable liquids or combustible liquids is secondary to the principal activity. (See Note A-4.2.8.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise noted in this Part, this Subsection applies to industrial occupancies where the use, storage and handling of flammable liquids or combustible liquids is secondary to the principal activity.

National Sentence Text: Where required for normal plant activity, quantities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids are permitted to exceed those specified in Sentence 4.2.8.2.(1), but shall not be greater than the supply for one day of normal operation.
P/T Sentence Text: Where required for normal plant activity, quantities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids are permitted to exceed those specified in Sentence , but shall not be greater than the supply for one day of normal operation.

National Sentence Text: Where larger quantities than those permitted by Sentence 4.2.8.2. are required, such quantities shall be in storage tanks installed in conformance with Sentence 4.3.13.4.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Where larger quantities than are permitted by Sentence  are required, such quantities shall be in storage tanks installed in conformance with Sentence 4.3.12.4.(2).

National Sentence Text: Areas in which flammable liquids or combustible liquids are transferred from one container or storage tank to another, or where they are used in such a way as to release potentially explosive concentrations of flammable vapours, shall be separated from possible sources of ignition by a spatial separation of not less than 6 m, or by a fire separation. (See Note A-4.2.8.3.(1).) (See also Note A-4.1.5.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Areas in which flammable liquids or combustible liquids are transferred from one container or storage tank to another, or are used in such a way as to release potentially explosive concentrations of flammable vapours, shall be  separated from possible sources of ignition by a spatial separation of not less than 6 m, or by a fire separation,  provided with a drainage system to control spills in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.,  provided with absorbent materials to assist in clean-up of small liquid spills in conformance with Article 4.1.6.3.,  provided with either natural or mechanical ventilation in conformance with Subsection 4.1.7., and  separated from other dangerous goods in conformance with Article 4.2.2.3.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The storage area referred to in Sentence 4.2.8.4. shall be sprinklered in conformance with Article 3.2.3.3., providing a level of protection not less than that required for Class IV commodities stored up to a height of 6 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The storage area referred to in Sentence  shall be sprinklered in conformance with Article 3.2.3.3. of Division B of NRC, "National Fire Code of Canada", providing a level of protection not less than that required for Class IV commodities stored up to a height of 6 m.

National Sentence Text: The height of storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be not more than that permitted for unprotected storage in Table 4.2.7.5.-A.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be not more than those permitted for unprotected storage in Table 4.2.7.A.

National Sentence Text: When a single class of liquid is stored, the total quantity in a single fire compartment shall be not more than 2 500 L of Class IB and IC liquids, 5 000 L of Class II liquids, or 10 000 L of Class IIIA liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: When a single class of liquid is stored, the total quantity in a single fire compartment shall be not more than  2500 L of Class IB and IC liquid,  5000 L of Class II liquid, or  10000 L of Class IIIA liquid.

National Sentence Text: When 2 or more classes of liquid are stored in the same individual storage area, the maximum quantity permitted in the individual storage area shall be that permitted for the liquid with the lowest limit listed in Sentence 4.2.8.4.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: When two or more classes of liquid are stored in the same individual storage area, the maximum quantity permitted in the individual storage area shall be that permitted for the liquid with the lowest limit set out in Sentence .

National Sentence Text: The maximum quantities and densities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shown in Table 4.2.9.1. are permitted to be doubled provided the storage room is protected by an automatic fire suppression system conforming to Article 4.2.7.6.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum quantities and densities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shown in Table 4.2.9.A. are permitted to be doubled provided the storage room is protected by an automatic fire suppression system conforming to Article 4.2.7.7.

National Sentence Text: Storage rooms referred to in Article 4.2.9.1. shall be liquid-tight where the walls join the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Storage rooms referred to in Article 4.2.9.1. shall be equipped with  liquid-tight seals between interior walls and the floor and a liquid-tight ramped sill at any door opening in an interior wall, and  a drain connected to a dry sump or holding tank for those occupancies that regulated under by Regulation 851 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990 (Industrial made under the Occupational Health and Safety Act or Ontario Regulation 67/93 (Health Care and Residential made under the Occupational Health and Safety Act.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The contents of flammable liquid and combustible liquid storage rooms referred to in Article 4.2.9.1. shall be arranged to provide aisle widths of not less than 1 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The contents of flammable liquids and combustible liquids storage rooms referred to in Article 4.2.9.1. shall be arranged to provide aisle widths of not less than 1 m.

National Sentence Text: Dispensing of flammable liquids or combustible liquids from containers having a capacity of more than 30 L shall be by pumps or through self-closing valves, designed in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.1.8.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Dispensing of flammable liquids or combustible liquids from containers having a capacity of more than 30 L shall be by pumps or through self-closing valves, designed in conformance with good engineering practice.
