National Sentence Text: Where Class IA or IB liquids are dispensed within a storage room, the room shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with NFPA 68-2013 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(1)(d).)
P/T Sentence Text: If Class IA or IB liquids are dispensed or stored in open containers within a storage room, the room shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in accordance with NFPA 68, "Standard on Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting".
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except for the storage of distilled beverage alcohol, where Class IA or IB liquids are used, dispensed or stored in open containers within a storage room, or where Class IA liquids are stored in containers exceeding 4 L in capacity, the room shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.4. of Division B of the NBC. (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(1)(d).)
P/T Sentence Text: Despite Sentence , if Class IA liquids are stored in closed containers or Class I liquids are dispensed or stored in open containers for those occupancies or facilities that are regulated under Regulation 851 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990 (Industrial made under the Occupational Health and Safety Act or Ontario Regulation 67/93 (Health Care and Residential made under the Occupational Health and Safety Act, the room shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in accordance with NFPA 68, "Standard on Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting".
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except for the storage of distilled beverage alcohol, where Class IA or IB liquids are used, dispensed or stored in open containers within a storage room, or where Class IA liquids are stored in containers exceeding 4 L in capacity, the room shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.4. of Division B of the NBC. (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(1)(d).)
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  does not apply to the storage of distilled beverage alcohol.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The maximum quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in a cabinet shall be 500 L.
P/T Sentence Text: No more than 500 L of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be stored in a cabinet.

National Sentence Text: In care, treatment or detention occupancies, the total quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in cabinets in a single fire compartment shall not exceed the quantity permitted for one cabinet.
P/T Sentence Text: In care occupancies, care and treatment occupancies and detention occupancies, the total quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in cabinets in a single fire compartment shall not exceed the quantity permitted for one cabinet.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Storage cabinets required in this Part shall conform to ULC ULC/ORD-C1275-84 Guide for the Investigation of Storage Cabinets for Flammable Liquid Containers
P/T Sentence Text: Cabinets required in this Part shall  comply with ULC/ORD-C1275, Guide for the Investigation of Storage Cabinets for Flammable Liquid Containers ,  comply with ULI 1275, Flammable Liquid Storage Cabinets ,  be FM APPROVED by FM Global, or  be listed as meeting NFPA 30, Flammable and Combustible Liquids Code .
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.2.11.1.(2), the quantities and clearances for flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in containers in outdoor storage areas shall conform to Table 4.2.11.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the quantities and clearances for flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in containers in outdoor storage areas shall conform to Table 4.2.11.A.

National Sentence Text: An access route not less than 6 m wide constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m of any part of a pile.
P/T Sentence Text: An access route not less than 6 m wide, constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. in Division B of the Building Code, shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m of any part of a pile.

National Sentence Text: An outdoor area used for the container storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be fenced in conformance with Article 3.3.2.6.
P/T Sentence Text: An outdoor area used for the container storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be surrounded by a firmly anchored fence that is  substantially constructed to discourage climbing and unauthorized entry,  not less than 1.8 m high, and  provided with gates that shall be locked when the storage area is not staffed.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Not more than 50 L of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, of which not more than 30 L shall be Class I liquids, are permitted to be stored in individual self-service storage units.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except within a dwelling unit, the dispensing and handling of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall not be permitted within self-service storage buildings.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: When necessitated by possible contamination of the liquid to be stored or possible rapid corrosion of the tank, storage tanks need not conform to Sentence 4.3.1.2.(1), provided that they are designed and built in conformance with good engineering practice for the material being used. (See Note A-4.3.1.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: When necessitated by possible contamination of the liquid to be stored or possible rapid corrosion of the tank, storage tanks need not conform to Sentence , provided that they are designed and built in conformance with good engineering practice for the material being used.

National Sentence Text: Except for perimeter sealing material, floating roof assemblies or internal floating covers installed in storage tanks shall be constructed of metal or other materials and designed in conformance with one of the tank construction standards listed in this Subsection.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for perimeter sealing material, floating roof assemblies or internal floating covers installed in storage tanks shall be constructed of metal, or other materials and design conforming to one of the tank construction standards set out in this Subsection.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 4.3.1.8.(2), a storage tank shall be prevented from being overfilled by providing continuous supervision of the filling operations by personnel qualified to supervise such operations, or an overfill protection device conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S661-10 Overfill Protection Devices for Flammable and Combustible Liquid Storage Tanks (see Note A-4.3.1.8.(1)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: A storage tank that is not a tight-filled storage tank shall be prevented from being overfilled by  continuous supervision of the filling operations by personnel qualified to supervise the filling operations, or  an overfill protection device that complies with ULC/ORD-C58.15, Overfill Protection Devices for Flammable Liquid Storage Tanks .
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: A storage tank is permitted to be refurbished for aboveground use in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in API 653-2009 Tank Inspection, Repair, Alteration, and Reconstruction and STI SP031-2008 Repair of Shop Fabricated Aboveground Tanks for Storage of Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: A storage tank is permitted to be refurbished for aboveground use in conformance with one of the following standards:  ULC-S601(A), Refurbishing of Steel Aboveground Horizontal Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ,  ULC-S630(A), Refurbishing of Steel Aboveground Vertical Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids .
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: A storage tank is permitted to be refurbished for underground use in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in ULC CAN/ULC-S669-14 Internal Retrofit Systems for Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids (See Note A-4.3.1.10.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: A storage tank is permitted to be refurbished for underground use in conformance with one of the following standards:  ULC-S603(A), Refurbishing of Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ,  ULC-S615(A), Refurbishing of Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids .
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: A riveted storage tank shall not be relocated.
P/T Sentence Text: A riveted storage tank shall not be relocated.

National Sentence Text: The minimum distance required in Sentence 4.3.2.1. from a storage tank containing only Class II or IIIA liquids to a building on the same property is permitted to be reduced to 1.5 m provided the tank capacity is not more than 50 000 L, or zero provided the tank capacity is not more than 2 500 L.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum distance required in Sentence  from a storage tank containing only Class II or IIIA liquids to a building on the same property is permitted to be reduced to  1.5 m provided the tank capacity is not more than 50000 L, or  zero provided the tank capacity is not more than 2500 L.

National Sentence Text: The minimum distance required in Sentence 4.3.2.1. is permitted to be waived provided the storage tank is in conformance with ULC ULC-S655-98 Aboveground Protected Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum distance required in Sentence  is permitted to be waived provided the storage tank  is in conformance with ULC-S655, Aboveground Protected Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids , and  has a capacity of not more than 50000 L.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The minimum distance between any 2 storage tanks, neither of which has a capacity of more than 250 000 L, shall be 1 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum distance between any two storage tanks, neither of which has a capacity of more than 250000 L, shall be 1 m.

National Sentence Text: An access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m travelling distance of any storage tank.
P/T Sentence Text: An access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. in Division B of the Building Code shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m of any storage tank.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where the diameter of a storage tank exceeds 45 m, the storage tank shall be provided with protection against fires or explosions in conformance with Sentence 4.3.2.5.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Where the diameter of a storage tank exceeds 45 m, the storage tank shall be provided with protection against fire or explosion in conformance with Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Protection against fires or explosions required for a storage tank shall consist of fixed protection systems designed in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in NFPA 11-2016 Low-, Medium-, and High-Expansion Foam NFPA 15-2012 Water Spray Fixed Systems for Fire Protection and NFPA 69-2014 Explosion Prevention Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Protection against fire or explosion required for a storage tank shall consist of fixed protection systems designed in conformance with good engineering practice such as described in  NFPA 11, Standard for Low , Medium , and High Expansion Foam ,  NFPA 15, Standard for Water Spray Fixed Systems for Fire Protection , and  NFPA 69, Standard on Explosion Prevention Systems .

National Sentence Text: Where the clearance below the base of the tank exceeds 300 mm, tank supports shall have a minimum fire-resistance rating of 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: If the clearance below the base of a storage tank exceeds 300 mm, the supports for the storage tank shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: In areas subject to earthquake forces, storage tanks, supports and connections shall be designed to resist such forces in conformance with Part 4 of Division B of the NBC, and Appendix A2 of ULC CAN/ULC-S601-14 Shop Fabricated Steel Aboveground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: In areas subject to earthquake forces, storage tanks, supports and connections shall be designed to resist such forces in conformance with  Part 4 in Division B of the Building Code, and  Appendix A2 of CAN/ULC-S601, Standard for Shop Fabricated Steel Aboveground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids .

National Sentence Text: When aboveground storage tanks are located in an area that is subject to flooding, the tanks shall be securely anchored to prevent floating.
P/T Sentence Text: Aboveground storage tanks located in an area that may be subject to flooding shall be securely anchored.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Atmospheric and low pressure storage tanks shall be provided with normal and emergency venting in conformance with API 2000-2009 Venting Atmospheric and Low-Pressure Storage Tanks or the tank design standards listed in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Atmospheric and low pressure storage tanks shall be provided with normal and emergency venting in conformance with  API 2000, Venting Atmospheric and Low-Pressure Storage Tanks , or  the appropriate tank design standard set out in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(1).

National Sentence Text: When unstable liquids are stored, the effects of heat or gas resulting from polymerization, decomposition, condensation or self-reactivity shall be allowed for in the determination of the total venting capacity.
P/T Sentence Text: When unstable liquids are stored, the effects of heat or gas resulting from polymerization, decomposition, condensation or self-reactivity shall be included in the determination of the total venting capacity.

National Sentence Text: Normal vent pipe outlets for storage tanks of Class I liquids shall be located outside buildings not less than 3.5 m above the adjacent ground level, and 1.5 m from any building opening, and shall discharge so that flammable vapours will not enter the building or be trapped near any part of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Normal vent pipe outlets for storage tanks of Class I liquids  shall be located outside buildings, not less than  3.5 m above the adjacent ground level, and  1.5 m from any building opening, and  shall discharge so that flammable vapours will not enter the building or be trapped near any part of the building.

National Sentence Text: Normal vent pipe outlets for storage tanks of Class II or IIIA liquids shall discharge outside buildings not less than 2 m above the adjacent ground level, and 1.5 m from any building opening.
P/T Sentence Text: Normal vent pipe outlets for storage tanks of Class II or IIIA liquids shall discharge outside buildings, not less than  2 m above the adjacent ground level, and  1.5 m from any building opening.

National Sentence Text: Emergency vent outlets for storage tanks shall discharge outside buildings not less than 1.5 m from any building opening and from any combustible component of any building's exterior wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency vent outlets for storage tanks shall discharge outside buildings not less than 1.5 m from any building opening and from any combustible component of a building exterior wall.

National Sentence Text: Each connection to an aboveground storage tank through which the liquid can normally flow shall be provided with an internal or external shut-off valve located as close as practical to the shell of the tank.
P/T Sentence Text: Each connection to an aboveground storage tank through which liquid can normally flow shall be provided with an internal or external shut-off valve located as close as practical to the shell of the tank.

National Sentence Text: Valves and their connections to a storage tank shall be made of steel, except that when the chemical characteristics of the liquid stored are incompatible with steel, materials other than steel are permitted to be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Valves and their connections to a storage tank shall be made of steel, except that when the chemical characteristics of the liquid stored are incompatible with steel, materials other than steel shall be used.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.3.6.4.(3), connections used as part of normal operating conditions for filling or emptying storage tanks for flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be located outside buildings, at a location free of sources of ignition, and not less than 1.5 m away from building openings.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , connections used as part of normal operating conditions for filling or emptying storage tanks for flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be located  outside buildings,  at a location free of sources of ignition, and  not less than 1.5 m from building openings.

National Sentence Text: A filling connection described in Sentence 4.3.6.4. is permitted to be located inside a building if this is made necessary by a process or activity located indoors and to which the tank is directly associated, or for the collection of used liquids, and the fill piping is provided with means to prevent flammable vapours from returning to the building.
P/T Sentence Text: A filling connection described in Sentence  is permitted to be located inside a building where  made necessary  by a process or activity located indoors and to which the tank is directly associated, or  for the collection of used liquids, and  the fill piping is provided with means to prevent flammable vapours from returning to the building.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.3.7.2.(4), openings shall not be permitted in a secondary containment.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence , there shall be no openings in a secondary containment.

National Sentence Text: When the secondary containment is designed to prevent the entry of precipitation and water used for firefighting purposes into the contained space, it shall have a volumetric capacity of not less than the capacity of the largest storage tank located in the contained space.
P/T Sentence Text: When the secondary containment is designed to prevent the entry of precipitation and water used for fire fighting purposes into the contained space, it shall have a volumetric capacity of not less than the capacity of the largest storage tank located in the contained space.

National Sentence Text: Aboveground storage tanks shall be protected by posts or guardrails where they are exposed to potential collision damage.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Liquids, debris and precipitation shall not accumulate in the contained space created by the secondary containment.
P/T Sentence Text: Liquids, debris and precipitation shall not be accumulated in the contained space created by the secondary containment.

National Sentence Text: Provisions shall be made for removing liquid from the secondary containment in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Provisions shall be made for removing liquid from the secondary containment in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.

National Sentence Text: Underground storage tanks shall be located so that loads from building foundations and supports are not transmitted to the tank.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground storage tanks shall be located so that  the foundations of buildings will not be undermined during excavation, and  loads from building foundations and supports are not transmitted to the tank.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Underground storage tanks shall be separated by a horizontal distance of not less than 600 mm from adjacent underground tanks or structures, 1 m from a building foundation or a street line, and 1.5 m from other property lines.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground storage tanks shall be separated by a horizontal distance of not less than  600 mm from adjacent underground tanks or structures,  1 m from a building foundation or a street line, and  1.5 m from other property lines.

National Sentence Text: Either a 150 mm reinforced concrete slab or a 200 mm unreinforced concrete slab over not less than 450 mm of sand is permitted in lieu of the protection described in Sentence 4.3.8.3. provided the slab extends at least 300 mm beyond the storage tank.
P/T Sentence Text: An underground storage tank subject to vehicular traffic may be installed under a 150 mm reinforced concrete slab or a 200 mm unreinforced concrete slab over not less than 450 mm of sand if the slab extends at least 300 mm beyond the underground storage tank.

National Sentence Text: Where subsurface conditions make it impracticable to install a storage tank totally below adjacent ground level, an underground storage tank shall be installed so that at least 75% of its mass is below adjacent ground level provided there is not less than 600 mm of ground cover over the portion of the tank above adjacent ground level, or 50% of its mass is below adjacent ground level provided there is not less than 1 m of ground cover over the portion of the tank above adjacent ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: If it is not practical to install an underground storage tank completely below adjacent ground level due to subsurface conditions, an underground storage tank shall be built so that at least  75% of its mass is below adjacent ground level, provided there is not less than 600 mm of ground cover over the portion of the tank above adjacent ground level, or  50% of its mass is below adjacent ground level, provided there is not less than 1 m of ground cover over the portion of the tank above adjacent ground level.

National Sentence Text: Damage to storage tank shells shall not be repaired on site.
P/T Sentence Text: Damage to underground storage tank shells shall not be repaired on site.

National Sentence Text: Underground storage tanks shall be lowered into the excavation by the use of lifting lugs and hooks and, where necessary, spreader bars to prevent damage to the tank shell, protective coating, fittings or anodes.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground storage tanks shall be lowered into the excavation by the use of lifting lugs and hooks and, where necessary, spreader bars to prevent damage to the tank shell, protective coating, fittings or anodes.

National Sentence Text: Any method of handling that might result in damage to the protective coating of the tank shall not be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Any method of handling that may result in damage to the protective coating of the tank shall not be used.

National Sentence Text: Underground steel storage tanks shall be installed in conformance with Appendix A of ULC CAN/ULC-S603.1-11 External Corrosion Protection Systems for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Underground steel storage tanks shall be installed in conformance with Appendix B of CAN/ULC-S603.1, "External Corrosion Protection Systems for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids".
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Underground reinforced plastic storage tanks shall be installed in conformance with Appendix A of ULC CAN/ULC-S615-14 Fibre Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Underground reinforced plastic storage tanks shall be installed in conformance with Appendix A of ULC-S615, "Standard for Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids".

National Sentence Text: Underground storage tanks shall not be placed in direct contact with reinforced concrete slabs but shall be separated by not less than 150 mm of sand or other suitable material to evenly distribute the weight of the tank on the supporting base.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground storage tanks shall not be placed in direct contact with reinforced concrete slabs but shall be separated by not less than 150 mm of sand or other suitable material to distribute evenly the weight of the tank on the supporting base.

National Sentence Text: If a spillage occurs, the escaped liquid and all soil contaminated by the spill shall be removed in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
P/T Sentence Text: If a spillage occurs involving an underground storage tank, the escaped liquid and all soil contaminated by the spill shall be removed in accordance with Subsection 4.1.6.

National Sentence Text: Underground storage tanks shall be protected against hydrostatic forces which can cause the uplift of the tanks once they are empty. (See Note A-4.3.8.9.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Underground storage tanks shall be protected against hydrostatic forces which can cause uplift of the tanks when they are empty.

National Sentence Text: Where anchors and ground straps are used to resist the uplift forces referred to in Sentence 4.3.8.9.(1), they shall be electrically isolated from the tank, and installed in such a manner that they do not damage the tank's shell, protective coating, fittings or anodes.
P/T Sentence Text: Where anchors and ground straps are used to resist the uplift forces referred to in Sentence , they shall be  electrically isolated from the tank, and  installed in such a manner that they do not damage the tank shell, protective coating, fittings or anodes.

National Sentence Text: Underground steel storage tanks and integral fittings subject to corrosion shall be protected in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S603.1-11 External Corrosion Protection Systems for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids or protected by impressed current in conformance with NACE SP0285-2011 External Corrosion Control of Underground Storage Tank Systems by Cathodic Protection
P/T Sentence Text: Underground steel storage tanks and integral fittings subject to corrosion shall be protected  in accordance with CAN/ULC-S603.1, External Corrosion Protection Systems for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids , or  by impressed current in accordance with NACE RP0285, Corrosion Control of Underground Storage Tank Systems by Cathodic Protection .

National Sentence Text: A spill containment sump shall be provided at every underground storage tank fill point.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: A transition sump shall be provided for all mechanical pipe connections located below grade.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: A turbine sump shall be provided for all turbine pump assemblies located below grade or above grade where they are not readily visible.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Dispenser sumps shall conform to the construction and performance requirements of ULC ULC/ORD-C107.21-1992 Under-Dispenser Sumps
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where dispenser sumps, turbine sumps and transition sumps referred to in Article 4.3.9.1. are used in underground applications, they shall be provided with an electronic monitoring device to indicate the presence of liquid.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Vent pipe outlets from underground storage tanks for Class I liquids shall be located outside buildings higher than the fill pipe openings but not less than 3.5 m above the adjacent ground level, 1.5 m from any building opening, and 7.5 m from any dispenser, and shall discharge so that flammable vapours will not enter building openings or be trapped near any part of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Vent pipe outlets from underground storage tanks for Class I liquids shall  be located outside buildings higher than the fill pipe openings but not less than  3.5 m above the adjacent ground level,  1.5 m from any building opening, and  7.5 m from any dispenser, and  discharge so that flammable vapours will not enter building openings or be trapped near any part of the building.

National Sentence Text: Vent pipes from underground storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall not be obstructed by any device that may cause excessive back pressure, except that vent pipes from underground storage tanks for Class II or IIIA liquids are permitted to be fitted with return bends, coarse screens or other devices to minimize the entry of foreign material.
P/T Sentence Text: Vent pipes from underground storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall not be obstructed by any device that may cause excessive back pressure, except that vent pipes from underground storage tanks for Class II or Class IIIA liquids may be fitted with return bends, coarse screens or other devices to minimize the entry of foreign material.

National Sentence Text: Vent piping shall enter the storage tank through the top of the tank and shall not extend into the tank more than 25 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Vent piping shall enter an underground storage tank through the top of the tank and shall not extend more than 25 mm into the tank.

National Sentence Text: Vent piping shall be installed so that any nominally horizontal run shall slope towards the storage tank, constructed without traps, adequately supported to prevent sagging, and where necessary, protected against mechanical damage.
P/T Sentence Text: Vent piping shall be  installed so that any nominally horizontal run shall slope towards the underground storage tank,  constructed without traps,  adequately supported to prevent sagging, and  where necessary, protected against mechanical damage.

National Sentence Text: Where it is not possible to fill the connected storage tanks referred to in Sentence 4.3.11.4. simultaneously, or where the connected vents have a vapour recovery system, the vent piping shall be sized to accommodate the maximum vapour flow possible in the system.
P/T Sentence Text: If it is not possible to fill the connected underground storage tanks referred to in Sentence  simultaneously, or if the connected vents have a vapour recovery system, the vent piping shall be sized to accommodate the maximum vapour flow possible in the system.

National Sentence Text: Vent piping for an underground storage tank containing a Class I liquid shall not be connected to the vent piping for a storage tank containing a Class II or IIIA liquid unless an effective method is provided to prevent the vapours from the Class I liquid storage tank from entering the other tank.
P/T Sentence Text: Vent piping for an underground storage tank containing a Class I liquid shall not be connected to the vent piping for an underground storage tank containing a Class II or IIIA liquid unless an effective method is provided to prevent the vapours from the Class I liquid storage tank from entering the other tank.

National Sentence Text: Connections for all openings in underground storage tanks shall be liquid- and vapour-tight.
P/T Sentence Text: Connections for all openings in underground storage tanks shall be liquid and vapour tight.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.3.12.3.(5), connections used as part of normal operating conditions for filling or emptying storage tanks for flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be located outside buildings, at a location free of sources of ignition, and not less than 1.5 m away from building openings.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence , connections used as part of normal operating conditions for filling or emptying underground storage tanks shall be located outside buildings, at a location free of sources of ignition, and not less than 1.5 m away from building openings.

National Sentence Text: Connections for filling or emptying storage tanks described in Sentence 4.3.12.3. shall be kept closed to prevent leakage when not in use.
P/T Sentence Text: Connections for filling or emptying storage tanks described in Sentence  shall be kept closed to prevent leakage when not in use.

National Sentence Text: A filling connection described in Sentence 4.3.12.3. is permitted to be located inside a building if this is made necessary by a process or activity located indoors and to which the storage tank is directly associated, or for the collection of used liquids, and the fill piping is provided with means to prevent flammable vapours from returning to the building.
P/T Sentence Text: A filling connection described in Sentence  may be located inside a building if made necessary by a process or activity located indoors and to which the tank is directly associated, or for the collection of used liquids, and the fill piping is provided with means to prevent flammable vapours from returning to the building.

National Sentence Text: Where the fill point is below the normal liquid level in the storage tank, the fill line shall be equipped with a manual or automatic valve located at the fill point to prevent spillage when the fill cap is removed, and if the storage tank contains flammable liquids or combustible liquids, the fill line drop tube shall be equipped with a method to prevent siphoning of the tank's content should a leak occur in the fill line.
P/T Sentence Text: If the fill point is below the normal liquid level in the underground storage tank, the fill line shall be equipped with a manual or automatic valve located at the fill point to prevent spillage when the fill cap is removed, and the fill line drop tube shall be equipped with a method to prevent siphoning of the tank"s contents should a leak occur in the fill line.

National Sentence Text: Installations using Class I liquids as fuel supplies for stationary engines inside buildings shall conform to NFPA 37-2015 Installation and Use of Stationary Combustion Engines and Gas Turbines
P/T Sentence Text: A storage tank containing a Class I liquid fuel that is connected to a stationary engine may be installed in any occupancy of a building if the installation complies with NFPA 37, "Standard for the Installation and Use of Stationary Combustion Engines and Gas Turbines".
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Piping systems serving oil-burning equipment, diesel-engine-driven emergency generators and fire pumps shall conform to CSA B139-09 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Fire compartments regulated by this Subsection shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire compartments referred to in this Subsection shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: When 2 or more classes of liquids are stored in a single storage room referred to in Sentence 4.3.13.4.(1), the total quantity permitted for each class of liquid shall be calculated as follows: qIQI+q II+IIIAQII +IIIA 1
P/T Sentence Text: When two or more classes of liquids are stored in a single storage room referred to in Sentence 4.3.12.4.(1), the total quantities of stored liquids shall meet the requirements of the following equation:

National Sentence Text: The use of weak roof-to-side shell seams, designed to rupture before the allowable design stress of the storage tank is reached, shall not be permitted as a means of emergency venting of storage tanks inside buildings.
P/T Sentence Text: Weak roof-to-side shell seams that are designed to rupture before the allowable design stress of the storage tank is reached shall not be used as a means of emergency venting of storage tanks inside buildings.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.3.13.11.(2), where storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids are installed inside buildings, the supports, foundations and anchorage for such storage tanks shall be in conformance with Subsection 4.3.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , where storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids are installed inside buildings, the supports, foundations and anchorage for such storage tanks shall be in conformance with Subsection 4.3.3.

National Sentence Text: Where a storage tank is suspended, rather than supported on a foundation, supports shall be designed and installed in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.3.13.11.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage tank is suspended, rather than supported on a foundation, supports shall be designed and installed in conformance with good engineering practice.

National Sentence Text: Rooms for storage tanks inside buildings, referred to in Sentence 4.3.13.4.(1), shall be separated from the rest of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of at least 2 h, designed to contain a spill equal to at least 100% of the volume of the largest storage tank, or to drain away spilled flammable liquids or combustible liquids, made liquid-tight where the walls join the floor, and used for no other purposes than the storage and handling of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: Rooms for storage tanks inside buildings shall be separated from the rest of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h, designed to contain a spill equal to at least 100% of the volume of the largest storage tank, or to drain away spilled flammable liquids or combustible liquids in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6., made liquid-tight where the walls join the floor, provided with natural or mechanical ventilation in conformance with Subsection 4.1.7., and used for no other purposes than the storage and handling of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: A minimum clear space of 550 mm shall be maintained between the walls of a room described in Article 4.3.14.1. and the sides of any storage tanks within the room.
P/T Sentence Text: A minimum clear space of 550 mm shall be maintained between the walls of a room described in Article 4.3.13.1. and the sides of any storage tanks within the room.

National Sentence Text: Where Class IA or IB liquids are dispensed within a storage room, the room shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with NFPA 68-2013 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(1)(d).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where Class IA or IB liquids are dispensed within a storage room, the room shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with NFPA 68, "Standard on Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting".

National Sentence Text: In buildings not required to be equipped with a standpipe and hose system by the NBC, hose stations shall be provided in the vicinity of the storage room, such that all parts of the room are within reach of a hose stream. (See Note A-4.3.14.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: In buildings not required to be equipped with a standpipe system by the Building Code, hose stations conforming to Articles 3.2.9.2. to 3.2.9.7. of the Building Code, as it read on August 21, 2000, shall be provided in the vicinity of the storage room, such that all parts of the room are within reach of a hose stream.

National Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers for Class B fires shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers for Class B fires shall be provided in conformance with Section 6.2.

National Sentence Text: Placards conforming to Article 3.2.7.14., identifying the liquids stored as flammable liquids or combustible liquids and the capacities of the storage tanks, shall be posted in a conspicuous location outside of the room, and that information shall be included in the fire safety plan required in Article 4.1.5.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Placards conforming to the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations made under the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Act, 1992  shall be posted in a conspicuous location outside the room containing storage tanks.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Openings that are independent of the fill pipe and are used for measuring the liquid level in storage tanks containing Class I or II liquids shall be equipped with a vapour-tight cap which shall be opened only when measuring the liquid level.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings that are independent of the fill pipe and are used for measuring the liquid level in storage tanks containing Class I or II liquids shall be equipped with a vapour-tight cap which shall be opened only when measuring the liquid level.

National Sentence Text: Openings referred to in Sentence 4.3.15.2. shall be protected against overflow and vapour pressure by means of a spring-loaded check valve.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings referred to in Sentence  shall be protected against overflow and vapour pressure by means of a spring-loaded check valve.

National Sentence Text: Pneumatic leak detection tests shall not be performed on field-erected aboveground storage tanks.
P/T Sentence Text: Pneumatic leakage tests shall not be performed on field-erected aboveground storage tanks.

National Article Title: Protocols for Pneumatic Leak Detection Testing of Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: The piping system shall be considered to be leaking if any pressure decline is detected within the time periods stated.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a pneumatic leakage test is performed on an underground storage tank, the tank shall be considered to be leaking when the test indicates a pressure drop within a 2 h period after steady temperature conditions have been established and the source of pressure has been removed.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where a pneumatic leak detection test is conducted before an underground storage tank is backfilled, in the case of a new tank, or after the tank is uncovered, in the case of a previously installed tank, the test pressure shall be in conformance with the production testing requirements of ULC CAN/ULC-S603-14 Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids or ULC CAN/ULC-S615-14 Fibre Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: If a pneumatic leakage test is conducted before an underground tank is backfilled in the case of a new tank, or after the tank is uncovered in the case of a previously installed tank, the test pressure shall comply with the production testing requirements of ULC-S603, "Standard for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids", or ULC-S615, "Standard for Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids".

National Sentence Text: Where a pneumatic leak detection test is conducted before an underground storage tank is backfilled, in the case of a new tank, or after the tank is uncovered, in the case of a previously installed tank, the test pressure shall be in conformance with the production testing requirements of ULC CAN/ULC-S603-14 Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids or ULC CAN/ULC-S615-14 Fibre Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Where a pneumatic leakage test is performed on a completely buried storage tank, the test pressure shall be not less than 35 and not more than 70 kPa (gauge).
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: During a leak detection test on a storage tank, the pressure at the bottom of the tank shall not exceed the tank manufacturer's specifications.
P/T Sentence Text: The pressure at the bottom of a storage tank shall not exceed 70 kPa  during the leakage test referred to in Sentence .
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where inventory reconciliation is required by this Section, the liquid level in any storage tank shall be measured at intervals not greater than 7 days in conformance with Sentences 4.4.4.1. to 4.4.4.1.(4), except that at fuel-dispensing stations the measurements shall be taken each day the station is in operation.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 4.3.16.2., the liquid level in any storage tank shall be measured at intervals not greater than seven days in conformance with Sentences  to , except that at fuel dispensing stations, the measurements shall be taken each day the station is in operation.

National Sentence Text: The level of water at the bottom of an underground storage tank shall be measured at intervals not greater than 7 days, except that at fuel-dispensing stations the measurements shall be taken each day the station is in operation.
P/T Sentence Text: The level of water at the bottom of an underground storage tank shall be measured at intervals not greater than seven days, except that at fuel dispensing stations, the measurement shall be taken each day the station is in operation.

National Sentence Text: A record of the measurements for each storage tank and of the computations described in Sentence 4.4.4.1. shall be retained, in conformance with Article 2.2.1.2..
P/T Sentence Text: A record for each storage tank showing the measurements and computations described in Sentence  shall be retained for examination by the Chief Fire Official, in conformance with Subsection 1.1.2.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring Methods
National Sentence Text: A continuous in-tank leak detection system shall conform to good engineering practice and meet the requirements of a precision leak detection test. (See Note A-4.4.2.1.(6).)
P/T Sentence Text: The measurements described in Article 4.3.16.1. are not required for an underground storage tank when it is provided with a continuous leakage detection device conforming to ULC/ORD-C58.12, Leak Detection Devices (Volumetric for Underground Flammable Liquid Storage Tanks , or ULC/ORD-C58.14, Nonvolumetric Leak Detection Devices for Underground Flammable Liquid Storage Tanks , and its associated underground piping is provided with continuous leakage detection conforming to Article 4.4.6.7.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The removal, abandonment in place, disposal or temporary taking out of service of an underground storage tank shall be in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.3.16.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: When underground storage tanks will be out of service for a period not exceeding 180 days,  the liquid level in the storage tank shall be measured at intervals not greater than one month and a record of such measurements shall be retained for inspection,  fill pipe covers and covers over openings to measure liquid levels, dispensers and power controls shall be kept locked when not in use, and  vent piping shall be kept open.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The removal, abandonment in place, disposal or temporary taking out of service of an underground storage tank shall be in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.3.16.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , when underground storage tanks will be out of service for a period exceeding 180 days,  the storage tanks, connected piping and dispensers shall be emptied of Class I liquid,  the storage tanks, piping and dispensers shall be refilled with a Class II or IIIA liquid, or not less than 1 kg of dry ice for each 500 L of tank capacity shall be added to the storage tank,  measurements of the liquid level of each storage tank containing a Class II or IIIA liquid shall be made at intervals not greater than one month, and a record of such measurements shall be retained for inspection, and  fill pipe covers and covers over openings to measure liquid levels, dispensers and power controls shall be locked.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The removal, abandonment in place, disposal or temporary taking out of service of an underground storage tank shall be in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.3.16.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where underground storage tank facilities are operated on a seasonal basis,  at the close of each season of operation,  the liquid level of each storage tank shall be measured,  a record of such measurements shall be retained for inspection, and  all fill pipe covers and covers over openings for measuring liquid levels, dispensers and power controls shall be locked, and  prior to the start of an operating season,  the liquid level in each storage tank shall be measured,  the measurements shall be compared with those recorded at the close of the previous season, and  when a loss of liquid or water intrusion is apparent, immediate action shall be taken to determine and correct the condition.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The removal, abandonment in place, disposal or temporary taking out of service of an underground storage tank shall be in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.3.16.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage tank has been out of service for more than 12 months, the tank and piping shall be tested for leakage in conformance with Subsections 4.3.15. and 4.4.6.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: When an aboveground storage tank will be out of service or unsupervised for a period not exceeding 180 days, the piping from the tank shall be capped or the valves that are necessary to achieve similar isolation of the tank shall be closed and securely locked.
P/T Sentence Text: When an aboveground storage tank will be out of service or unsupervised for a period not exceeding 180 days, the piping from the tank shall be capped or the valves necessary to achieve similar isolation of the tank shall be closed and securely locked.

National Sentence Text: Where a storage tank referred to in Sentence 4.3.16.2. contains flammable liquids or combustible liquids, the liquid level in the tank shall be measured and compared with subsequent readings taken at intervals not greater than one month.
P/T Sentence Text: When a storage tank referred to in Sentence  contains flammable liquids or combustible liquids, the liquid level in the tank shall be measured and the readings compared at intervals not greater than one month.

National Sentence Text: When an aboveground storage tank will be out of service or unsupervised for a period exceeding 180 days, all liquid and vapours shall be removed from the storage tank and its connected piping.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an aboveground storage tank will be out of service or unsupervised for a period exceeding 180 days, all liquid and vapours shall be removed from the storage tank and its connected piping, and the storage tank markings shall clearly indicate that the tank is empty.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where a storage tank is to be permanently disposed of, sufficient openings shall be cut in the tank to render it unfit for further use.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage tank is to be permanently disposed of, sufficient openings shall be cut in the tank to render it unfit for further use.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to piping and transfer systems for flammable liquids and combustible liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to piping and transfer systems for flammable liquids and combustible liquids.

National Sentence Text: Except where otherwise stated in this Part, this Section shall not apply to the following: tubing or casings and piping for oil or gas wells, transmission pipelines, piping for vehicles, aircraft, watercraft and portable or stationary engines, piping systems in fuel-dispensing stations and distilleries, and piping that falls within the scope of the applicable provincial or territorial codes regulating boilers and pressure vessels.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where otherwise stated in this Part, this Section shall not apply to the following: tubing or casings and piping for oil or gas wells, transmission pipelines, piping for vehicles, aircraft, watercraft and portable or stationary engines, piping systems in fuel dispensing stations and distilleries, and piping within the scope of the applicable provincial boiler and pressure vessel codes.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Frequency and Methods of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: The commissioning testing referred to in Sentence 4.4.1.2. shall be performed at the time of installation once backfill and surfacing have been completed but before being put into service, in the case of an underground storage tank or underground piping system, before being put into service, in the case of an aboveground storage tank or exposed piping system, and once the final surface materials have been installed but before being put into service, in the case of a sump.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Frequency and Methods of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: The frequency of the in-service monitoring referred to in Sentence 4.4.1.2. shall be calculated from the date of the commissioning test.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Frequency and Methods of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: Immediate action shall be taken when a leak is suspected and the leak detection testing referred to in Sentence 4.4.1.2. shall be performed if a loss of liquid or a gain of water is indicated by any of the leak detection measures described in this Section, or the level of water at the bottom of an underground storage tank exceeds 50 mm.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Frequency and Methods of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: Where dispenser sumps, transition sumps and turbine sumps are provided with electronic monitoring devices in accordance with Sentence 4.3.9.3.(1), the devices shall be interlocked with the dispenser or pump to shut it down upon detection of either product or a high liquid level.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Frequency and Methods of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: The minimum requirements referred to in Sentence 4.4.1.2. shall not preclude the appropriate use of alternative solutions, innovative new technologies, or methods capable of achieving the same objectives. (See Note A-4.4.1.2.(7).)
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.4.1.3.(2), when a leak detection test required by this Section detects a leak in a storage tank, piping system or sump, the leaking components or system shall be repaired and tested, replaced, or removed.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Records of the tests referred to in this Section shall be retained in conformance with Article 2.2.1.2..
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Definition and Performance of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the leak detection testing and monitoring methods referred to in this Section.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.5.2.1.(3), the use of the following materials for piping systems referred to in Sentence 4.5.2.1. shall not be permitted: materials that are subject to failure from internal stress or rupture by mechanical damage, or combustible or low-melting-point materials that are subject to failure even in moderate fires.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence , piping systems shall not be made of materials that are subject to failure from internal stress or rupture by mechanical damage, or are subject to failure in fires because they are combustible or have a low melting point.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Definition and Performance of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: A leak detection method that monitors vapours in the soil or liquids on the groundwater shall conform to good engineering practice and meet the requirements of vapour monitoring or groundwater monitoring systems. (See Note A-4.4.2.1.(3).)
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.5.2.1.(6), where steel piping is used, it shall conform to API 5L-2012 Line Pipe ASTM A 53/A 53M-12 Pipe, Steel, Black and Hot-Dipped, Zinc-Coated, Welded and Seamless or CSA Z245.1-14 Steel Pipe
P/T Sentence Text: If steel piping is used, it shall comply with API 5L, "Line Pipe", ASTM A53/A53M, "Pipe, Steel, Black and Hot-Dipped, Zinc-Coated, Welded and Seamless", or CSA Z245.1, "Steel Pipe".

National Article Title: Definition and Performance of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: Where inventory reconciliation is performed using automatic tank gauging referred to in Sentence 4.4.2.1.(2), the system shall conform to good engineering practice and meet the requirements of a precision leak detection test when a leak is suspected in conformance with Table 4.4.1.2.-A. (See Note A-4.4.2.1.(5).)
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where service pressures exceeding 875 kPa  may occur, piping and fittings shall be designed in conformance with ASME B31.3-2016 Process Piping
P/T Sentence Text: If service pressures exceeding 875 kPa  may occur, piping and fittings shall be designed in accordance with ASME B31.3, "Process Piping".

National Article Title: Definition and Performance of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: A continuous in-tank leak detection system shall conform to good engineering practice and meet the requirements of a precision leak detection test. (See Note A-4.4.2.1.(6).)
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Definition and Performance of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: High-tech secondary containment monitoring referred to in this Section shall include the use of an automatic device that continuously monitors the interstitial space between the inner tank or inner piping and the secondary containment. (See Sentence 4.3.7.7.(1).) (See Note A-4.4.2.1. for low-tech method.)
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Definition and Performance of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: Visual inspection referred to in this Section shall, in the case of an exposed piping system, conform to Article 4.5.10.5., and in the case of an aboveground storage tank, consist of a visual examination of the tank shell, or if the bottom of the tank is not amenable to a visual examination, testing the bottom of the tank (see Note A-4.4.2.1.(8)(b)(ii)).
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Definition and Performance of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: A static liquid media leak detection test shall conform to Article 4.4.3.5.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except for vent risers and vertical fill piping systems, underground piping systems shall be of double-walled construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground piping systems shall be of double-walled construction.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except for vent risers and vertical fill piping systems, underground piping systems shall be of double-walled construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  does not apply to vent risers and vertical fill piping systems.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Underground metallic piping systems in contact with the soil or groundwater shall be protected against corrosion in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S603.1-11 External Corrosion Protection Systems for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids or NACE SP0169-2013 Control of External Corrosion on Underground or Submerged Metallic Piping Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Underground metallic piping systems in contact with the soil or groundwater shall be protected against corrosion in accordance with CAN/ULC-S603.1, "External Corrosion Protection Systems for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids", or NACE SP0169, "Control of External Corrosion on Underground or Submerged Metallic Piping Systems".

National Article Title: Protocols for Pneumatic Leak Detection Testing of Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: A pressure decline test using an inert gas is permitted to be used as a leak detection test for piping systems that are new or in use, and convey a volume of less than 1 000 L.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Pneumatic Leak Detection Testing of Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: The design and installation of the piping system permitting, the piping system's contents shall be drained prior to conducting the pressure decline test procedure.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Pneumatic Leak Detection Testing of Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: Pumps, dispensers and other auxiliary equipment that are connected to the piping system and cannot withstand the pressure of the test shall be isolated from the test procedure to prevent damage to the equipment.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Pneumatic Leak Detection Testing of Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: A stabilization period of up to 30 min is required after pressurization.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Pneumatic Leak Detection Testing of Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: Pipe volumes of 500 L or less shall be pressurized for at least 60 min after stabilization.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Pneumatic Leak Detection Testing of Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: Pipe volumes greater than 500 L but less than 1 000 L shall be pressurized for at least 2 h after stabilization.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping
National Sentence Text: Tests shall be conducted by an individual who has been trained in the proper use of the test device and the operating procedures.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping
National Sentence Text: A sufficient amount of time shall be allocated to stabilize the temperature of the liquid throughout the volume of the piping during the test.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping
National Sentence Text: The piping system shall be considered to be leaking if the leak rate exceeds 0.38 L/h.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Leak Detection Testing of Sumps
National Sentence Text: Static liquid media testing of sumps shall be performed at the installation stage after all electrical and mechanical work passing through the sump wall has been completed but before any backfilling around the exterior of the sump is completed.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Leak Detection Testing of Sumps
National Sentence Text: The liquid used for the test shall exceed the elevation of the piping and other points of entry into the sump by at least 50 mm, and not be a flammable liquid or a combustible liquid.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Transfer points in piping systems for flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be identified in conformance with CFA 1990 Using the Canadian Fuels Colour-Symbol System to Mark Equipment and Vehicles for Product Identification
P/T Sentence Text: Transfer points in piping systems for flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be identified in conformance with CPPI, "Using the CPPI Colour-Symbol System to Mark Equipment and Vehicles for Product Identification", or to CAN/CGSB-24.3, "Identification of Piping Systems".
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Documentation on the piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids, including the tank and pumping arrangements, shall be made available to the fire department upon request.
P/T Sentence Text: Documentation on piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids, including tank and pumping arrangements, shall be made available to the fire department upon request.

National Sentence Text: Documents referred to in Sentence 4.5.4.2. shall be kept at two separate locations so that one copy remains readily available in the event the other is inaccessible due to fire.
P/T Sentence Text: Documents referred to in Sentence  shall be kept at two separate locations so that one copy remains readily available in the event the other is inaccessible due to fire.

National Sentence Text: Flanged joints for piping shall be provided in welded systems at intervals that will facilitate dismantling and avoid subsequent in-place cutting and welding operations.
P/T Sentence Text: Flanged joints for piping shall be provided in welded systems at intervals that will facilitate dismantling and avoid subsequent in place hot work operations.

National Sentence Text: Bronze flanges for 50 mm diameter or smaller size piping referred to in Article 4.5.5.2. are permitted to be used where copper and brass piping is permitted.
P/T Sentence Text: Bronze flanges for 50 mm diameter or smaller size piping referred to in Article 4.4.5.2. are permitted to be used where copper and brass piping is permitted.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.4.3.2.(1), pneumatic leak detection tests using compressed air or an inert gas shall include the application of soap and water to the storage tank and piping surface, fittings, joints and connections to help in the detection of leaks.
P/T Sentence Text: When exposed piping systems are subjected to a pneumatic leakage test, it shall be in conformance with Article 4.4.6.4., and the piping, including the joints, shall be soaped to assist in the detection of leaks.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Pneumatic Leak Detection Testing of Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: The piping system shall be considered to be leaking if any pressure decline is detected within the time periods stated.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping systems referred to in Sentence 4.4.6.1. shall be considered to be leaking when the test indicates a pressure drop or a volume loss within a 2 h period after steady temperature conditions have been established and the source of pressure had been removed.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Pneumatic Leak Detection Testing of Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: Test pressures shall be the greater of 350 kPa  or 1.5 times the maximum operating pressure, and not exceed the piping manufacturer's test specifications.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and  and Article 4.4.6.6., piping systems shall be pressure tested at pressures of not less than 350 kPa  or 1.5 times the maximum operating pressure, whichever is greater.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping
National Sentence Text: Test pressures exceeding 700 kPa  shall not be permitted unless the piping system is designed for such pressures.
P/T Sentence Text: Test pressures exceeding 700 kPa  shall not be used except when the piping system is designed for such pressures.

National Sentence Text: Where continuous leak detection is provided on an underground piping system, it shall conform to ULC ULC/ORD-C107.12-1992 Line Leak Detection Devices for Flammable Liquid Piping
P/T Sentence Text: When an underground piping system is provided with continuous leakage detection, it shall be in conformance with ULC/ORD-C107.12, "Line Leak Detection Devices for Flammable Liquid Piping".

National Sentence Text: Where piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids is installed within a building, the length of piping shall be as direct and as short as practicable.
P/T Sentence Text: Where piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids is installed within a building, the length of piping shall be as direct and as short as practicable.

National Sentence Text: It is not permitted to use any portion of a piping system in a manner that could damage it or for any purpose other than the transfer of product.
P/T Sentence Text: No portion of a piping system shall be used in a manner that could cause damage to the piping system.

National Sentence Text: Where vehicular, watercraft or floatplane impact or physical damage is possible, protective guarding devices shall be provided for aboveground outdoor piping.
P/T Sentence Text: When vehicular impact or physical damage is possible, protective guarding devices shall be provided for piping referred to in Sentence  and for fill pipes for storage tanks.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Aboveground piping systems shall be supported such that they are not in direct contact with the surface of the ground.
P/T Sentence Text: Aboveground piping systems shall be supported such that they are not in direct contact with the surface of the ground.

National Sentence Text: Aboveground outdoor piping shall not be located above roofs except above roofs of impermeable and noncombustible construction, with provision for accidental spillage provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Aboveground outdoor piping shall not be located above roofs except above roofs of impermeable and noncombustible construction, with provision for accidental spillage provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.

National Sentence Text: Where aboveground piping crosses roadways or railway sidings, ample overhead clearance and warning signs indicating the clearance height shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Where aboveground piping crosses roadways or railway sidings, ample overhead clearance and warning signs indicating the clearance height shall be provided.

National Sentence Text: Underground piping shall be located so it will not be damaged as a result of vibrations or settling of an adjacent building or structure.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground piping shall be located so it will not be damaged as a result of vibrations or settling of an adjacent building or structure.

National Sentence Text: Underground piping shall be located not less than 300 mm away from the foundations of any building or structure, except where such piping enters the building as permitted in Article 4.5.6.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground piping shall be located not less than 300 mm away from the foundations of any building or structure, except where such piping enters the building as permitted in Article 4.4.7.7.

National Sentence Text: Piping adjacent to railway tracks shall be installed in conformance with TC General Order No. O-32, C.R.C., c1148 Flammable Liquids Bulk Storage Regulations
P/T Sentence Text: Piping adjacent to railway tracks shall be installed in conformance with Flammable Liquids Bulk Storage Regulations made under the Canada Transportation Act.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Underground piping shall be supported on undisturbed or compacted soil, or not less than 150 mm of clean sand, pea gravel or clean crushed stone, and backfilled on the top and sides with not less than 300 mm of pea gravel or clean crushed stone, or 300 mm of clean sand, free of cinders and stones, and compacted in layers not more than 300 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground piping shall be supported on undisturbed or compacted soil, and backfilled on the top and sides with not less than 300 mm of pea gravel or clean crushed stone, or 300 mm of clean sand, free of cinders and stones and compacted in layers not more than 300 mm thick.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall not be located in service tunnels that are used for pedestrian traffic other than maintenance personnel.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall not be located in service tunnels that are used for pedestrian traffic other than for maintenance purposes.

National Sentence Text: Piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be located aboveground where the piping enters a building.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be located aboveground where the piping enters a building.

National Sentence Text: Piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.8. shall be provided with inside and outside shut-off valves.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping referred to in Sentence  shall be provided with inside and outside shut-off valves.

National Sentence Text: Where piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.8. passes through a wall that would restrict the expansion or contraction of the piping, pipe sleeves shall be provided at the wall penetration to facilitate such movement.
P/T Sentence Text: Where piping referred to in Sentence  passes through a wall which would restrict the expansion or contraction of the piping, pipe sleeves shall be provided at the wall penetration to facilitate such movement.

National Sentence Text: Indoor piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall either be supported overhead or be located in trenches conforming to Article 4.5.6.10.
P/T Sentence Text: Indoor piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall either be supported overhead or be located in trenches conforming to Article 4.4.7.9.

National Sentence Text: Piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.9. shall not be installed under combustible flooring.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping referred to in Sentence  shall not be installed under combustible flooring.

National Sentence Text: When piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.10. contains Class I liquids, the trench shall be provided with ventilation designed to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours in accordance with Sentence 6.9.1.2. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: When piping referred to in Sentence  contains Class I liquids, the trench shall be provided with positive ventilation to the outdoors, or designed to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Overhead piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be installed close to the ceiling or beams or along walls not less than 1.8 m above the floor to protect it against mechanical damage.
P/T Sentence Text: Overhead piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be installed close to the ceiling or beams or along walls not less than 1.8 m above the floor to protect it against mechanical damage.

National Sentence Text: Where practicable, overhead piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.11. shall be supported from building framing members.
P/T Sentence Text: Where practical, overhead piping referred to in Sentence  shall be supported from building framing members.

National Sentence Text: Piping shall be supported on pipe hangers or other supports so that allowable stresses in the pipe are not exceeded. (See Note A-4.5.6.12.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Piping shall be supported on pipe hangers or other supports so that allowable stresses in the pipe are not exceeded.

National Sentence Text: Anchors of the expansion shield type used to suspend piping shall not be used to suspend piping from unsound or lightweight concrete or from gypsum assemblies.
P/T Sentence Text: Anchors of the expansion shield type used to suspend piping shall not be used to suspend piping from unsound or lightweight concrete or from gypsum assemblies.

National Sentence Text: Exposed pipe risers shall be protected against mechanical damage by installing such risers adjacent to walls or pilasters, between flanges of steel columns, or within securely anchored larger perforated pipe, and providing mechanical guards where the risers are exposed to mobile equipment.
