National Sentence Text: A laboratory shall be provided with continuous mechanical ventilation that is designed in conformance with Article 6.3.4.2. of Division B of the NBC, and maintained to ensure it fulfills the function for which it was designed.
P/T Sentence Text: A laboratory shall be provided with continuous mechanical ventilation designed and maintained to ensure that flammable vapours do not accumulate in the laboratory, are prevented from migrating to other parts of the building, do not accumulate in the ventilation system, are exhausted to the outdoors, and are not returned to the building.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The use of dangerous goods in a laboratory shall be confined inside a power-ventilated enclosure conforming to Articles 6.3.4.3. and 6.3.4.4. of Division B of the NBC when their use releases flammable vapours or causes runaway or potentially explosive reactions, liquids are heated to a temperature equal to or greater than their flash point, or Class I liquids or unstable liquids are used.
P/T Sentence Text: The use and handling of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in a laboratory shall be confined inside a power-ventilated enclosure conforming to Articles 4.12.8.4. and 4.12.8.5. when indicate that the ventilation system is in operation, and sound an alarm if the ventilation system malfunctions. their use releases flammable vapours which could be potentially explosive, liquids are heated to a temperature equal to or greater than their flash point, or unstable liquids are used.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The power-ventilated enclosure required in Article 5.5.4.2. and its exhaust duct system shall conform to Article 6.3.4.4. of Division B of the NBC and be provided with instructions for its use and the operation of the ventilation system, and be provided with means to control accidental spillage.
P/T Sentence Text: The power-ventilated enclosure required in Article 4.12.8.3. and its exhaust system shall  except as provided in Sentences  and , be constructed of noncombustible materials compatible with and chemically resistant to vapours being exhausted,  be provided with access doors to permit inspection and maintenance of the fan assembly and exhaust ducts,  be provided with instructions for its use and the operation of the ventilation system, and  be provided with means to control accidental spillage in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where wiring or electrical equipment is located in areas in which flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres are present in quantities sufficient to create a hazard, such wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I for hazardous locations. (See Note A-5.1.2.1.(1).)
Hot works shall be performed only by personnel trained in the safe use of equipment in conformance with this Section.
The handling and discharge of fireworks shall conform to NRCan 2010 Display Fireworks Manual
P/T Article Title: Handling and discharge of fireworks and pyrotechnics
P/T Sentence Text: The handling and discharge of fireworks and pyrotechnics shall comply with NRCan, "Display Fireworks Manual" and NRCan, "Pyrotechnics Special Effects Manual".

National Sentence Text: When there is a possibility of sparks or open flames reaching combustible materials in areas adjacent to the area where hot work is carried out, openings in walls, floors or ceilings shall be covered or closed to prevent the passage of sparks or open flames to such adjacent areas, or Sentence 5.2.3.1. shall apply to such adjacent areas.

National Article Title: Work on Containers, Equipment or Piping
National Sentence Text: Hot work shall not be performed on metal objects that are in contact with combustible materials unless safety precautions are taken to prevent their ignition by conduction.
In buildings or areas described in Article 2.8.1.1., the required fire safety plan shall include the safety measures described in this Subsection for the safe conducting of hot works.
P/T Article Title: Measures in a fire safety plan
P/T Sentence Text: Before demolition or construction, including hot surface applications, commences in or on the building or premises, the fire safety plan shall be revised to incorporate  temporary alternative measures for the fire safety of the occupants during the demolition or construction, and  temporary procedures to control fire hazards associated with the demolition or construction, including procedures to mitigate risks to adjacent buildings.

National Sentence Text: Dust-collecting systems shall be provided to prevent the accumulation of dust and keep suspended dusts at a safe concentration inside a building.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to buildings, parts of buildings or equipment where combustible dusts are produced in quantities or concentrations that create an explosion or fire hazard.

National Sentence Text: Static electricity shall be prevented from accumulating on machines or equipment subject to static electricity buildup by appropriate bonding, grounding and static eliminating devices.
P/T Sentence Text: Electrically-conducting parts of duct systems, dust collectors and the machines they serve shall be grounded.

National Sentence Text: Portable electrical equipment used in atmospheres containing combustible dusts shall conform to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I

A product subject to spontaneous heating shall be permitted to be stored in silos or bins only if measures are taken to monitor the temperature of the stored product, and prevent overheating of the stored product from creating a fire or explosion hazard.
Conveying equipment belts shall be made of static conductive materials to prevent buildup of static charges. (See Note A-5.3.3.2.(2).)
Belt conveyor galleries and tunnels and bucket elevator leg enclosures shall be provided with explosion venting to the outdoors in conformance with Sentence 5.3.1.6.(2).
Separators shall be provided at grain receiving points ahead of the conveying equipment. (See Article 5.3.1.9.)
This Subsection applies to process plants where ethanol is produced for fuel purposes.
For the purpose of applying this Subsection, ethanol concentrations greater than or equal to 20% by volume of ethanol in water shall be considered as a flammable liquid.
The laboratory shall be clearly designated as an area containing dangerous goods in conformance with Article 3.2.7.14.
Absorbent and neutralizing materials shall be provided in the laboratory and in the dangerous goods storage areas in conformance with Sentence 3.2.7.11.(2).

Except as provided in Sentence 5.5.3.5.(3), electrical equipment located in areas where the concentration of flammable vapours is sufficient to create a hazard shall conform to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I for the hazardous locations. (See Note A-5.5.3.4.(1).)

Electrical equipment located inside a power-ventilated enclosure required in Article 5.5.4.2. and its exhaust duct system shall conform to Sentence 5.5.3.4.(1), and be designed and maintained to prevent the accumulation of combustible or reactive deposits.
Smoking shall not be permitted in a laboratory and signs shall be posted in conformance with Article 2.4.2.2.

Storage cylinders and piping systems for dangerous goods classified as compressed gases used in a laboratory shall be firmly secured with a noncombustible attachment and protected against mechanical damage.

Each point of supply and each point of use of cylinders or piping systems for dangerous goods classified as compressed gases shall be provided with a label identifying the gas being supplied, and a manual shut-off valve.

The power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.5.6. as well as its exhaust duct system shall be washed after each use to prevent the accumulation of highly unstable deposits. (See Note A-5.5.5.6.(2).)
Perchloric acid shall not be heated with an open flame or in a hot oil bath.

Protection shall be provided for adjacent buildings and facilities that would be exposed to fire originating from buildings, parts of buildings, facilities and associated areas undergoing construction, alteration or demolition operations. (See Note A-5.6.1.2.(1).)
Cylinders and tanks of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases shall be protected against mechanical damage.
P/T Sentence Text: Cylinders containing compressed gas shall be protected against mechanical damage.

National Sentence Text: Cylinders of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases that are in storage shall be protected against valve damage (see Note A-3.1.2.5.(2)(a)), and firmly secured in a position that will not interfere with the operation of the cylinder valve assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: Cylinders containing compressed gas which are in storage shall be protected against valve damage.

National Sentence Text: Where a standpipe system is to be installed in a building under construction or alteration, the system shall be installed progressively in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC in areas permitted to be occupied.
Oil or grease shall not be used with equipment for oxygen.
P/T Sentence Text: Oil or grease shall not be used for the lubrication of valves or fittings on oxygen cylinders.

National Sentence Text: Fuel supplies for heating equipment and internal combustion engines shall conform to CSA B139-09 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment or CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code

Except as permitted in Sentence 5.6.1.13.(2), where a fire protection system is provided, it shall remain operational throughout the construction, alteration or demolition area where reasonably practical.
When any portion of a fire protection system is temporarily shut down during construction, alteration or demolition operations, protection during shutdown shall comply with Article 6.1.1.4.

National Article Title: Storage and Use of Dangerous Goods
National Sentence Text: Combustible liquids and flammable liquids shall be stored and used in conformance with Part 4.

National Article Title: Storage and Use of Dangerous Goods
National Sentence Text: Dangerous goods shall be stored in conformance with Part 3.

Except as provided in Article 5.6.2.2., before excavation begins, building services shall be shut off, terminated and labelled so as to be easily identifiable outside the limits of the excavation. (See also Sentence 5.6.1.9.(1).)

The service company whose service connections will be affected shall be notified before any action mentioned in Sentence 5.6.2.1. is taken and, if it is necessary to maintain any service, it shall be relocated as necessary, and protected from damage.

An outdoor storage area shall be surrounded by a firmly anchored fence that is substantially constructed to discourage climbing and unauthorized entry, not less than 1.8 m high, and provided with gates that shall be locked when the storage area is not staffed.
P/T Sentence Text: Fencing required in Article 5.6.2.1. shall be  firmly anchored and substantially constructed,  designed to discourage climbing,  not less than 1.8 m high,  provided with gates that shall be locked when the storage area is not staffed, and  kept clear of obstructions so that gates may be fully opened at all times.

National Sentence Text: An outdoor storage area shall be arranged such that there is a clear space of not less than 30 m between stored products and brush or forested areas, and 6 m between stored products and uncontrolled grass or weeds.
P/T Sentence Text: An outdoor storage area that exceeds 100 m2 and is used for storage of cylinders containing compressed gas shall be arranged such that there is a clear space of not less than  30 m between stored products, and  6 m between stored products and uncontrolled grass or weeds.

National Sentence Text: The storage of "single-trip" non-refillable cylinders (i.e. TC-39, TC-2P, and TC-2Q) with water capacities of more than 375 g and less than 1.13 kg located within mercantile occupancies shall conform to the provisions stipulated in CSA B149.2-10 Propane Storage and Handling Code
P/T Article Title: Indoor storage of flammable compressed gases
P/T Sentence Text: "Single trip" non-refillable cylinders with water capacities of more than 375 g and less than 1.13 kg located within mercantile occupancies shall conform to the provisions stipulated in Ontario Regulation 211/01 (Propane Storage and made under the Technical Standards and Safety Act, 2000.

National Article Title: Indoor Storage of Anhydrous Ammonia and Toxic
National Sentence Text: Cylinders of gases described in Sentence 3.2.8.3. shall not be stored in a room containing combustible materials.
P/T Sentence Text: Cylinders containing poisonous compressed gas shall not be stored in a room containing combustible or flammable material.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies only to buildings conforming to Articles 3.2.2.50. and 3.2.2.58. of Division B of the NBC.
A sign identifying the civic address of the construction or demolition site shall be visible from the access route at the entrance to the site at all times.

An adequate water supply for firefighting shall be provided as soon as combustible construction materials arrive on the site. (See Note A-5.6.3.5.(1).) (See also Note A-3.2.5.7. of Division B of the NBC.)
Hydrants on a construction, alteration, or demolition site shall be clearly marked with a sign, be accessible, and have an unobstructed clearance of not less than 2 m at all times.
A strongly constructed fence, boarding or barricade not less than 1.8 m high shall be erected around the perimeter of the construction or demolition site.
Barricades shall have a reasonably smooth surface facing the outside, and no openings other than those required for access.

Access openings through barricades shall be equipped with gates, which shall be kept closed and locked when the site is unattended, and maintained in place until completion of the construction or demolition activity.

Fencing, boarding and barricades shall be constructed and maintained in a manner that does not restrict access to the construction or demolition site for firefighting purposes or to fire protection equipment.

Building and machinery surfaces shall be kept clean of accumulations of combustible dusts using cleaning equipment that is made of materials that will not create electrostatic charges or sparks, is electrically conductive and bonded to ground, and except as permitted in Sentence 5.3.1.2.(3), removes the dust to a safe location by vacuum.
P/T Sentence Text: Building and machinery surfaces shall be kept clean of accumulations of combustible dusts using cleaning equipment that  is made of materials that will not create electrostatic charges or sparks,  is electrically conductive and bonded to ground, and  except as permitted in Sentence , removes the dust to a safe location by vacuum.

National Sentence Text: Cleaning equipment required in Sentence 5.3.1.2. that is used in an atmosphere containing combustible dusts shall conform to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I
P/T Sentence Text: When used in atmospheres containing combustible dusts, the cleaning equipment required in Sentence  shall be listed and labelled for use in atmospheres containing combustible dusts.

National Sentence Text: Where it is not possible to effectively remove the dust by vacuum, it is permitted to use compressed air or other means that will cause the dust to become suspended in the air during removal if, in the dust removal area, all sources of ignition are eliminated, and all machinery and equipment is de-energized, unless such machinery or equipment is suitable for use in atmospheres containing combustible dusts, in conformance with CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I
P/T Sentence Text: Where it is not possible to effectively remove dust by vacuum, it is permitted to use compressed air or other means which cause dust to be suspended in air during removal if, in the dust removal area,  all sources of ignition are eliminated, and  all machinery and equipment is de-energized, unless such equipment is listed and labelled for use in atmospheres containing combustible dusts.

National Sentence Text: Electrically conducting parts of conveying systems, dust collectors, dust-producing machines and any equipment capable of accumulating static electricity located in an atmosphere containing combustible dusts shall be electrically bonded and grounded.
P/T Sentence Text: Electrically-conducting parts of duct systems, dust collectors and the machines they serve shall be grounded.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 5.3.1.7., an activity that creates an atmosphere containing significant concentrations of combustible dusts shall be located only in a building provided with explosion venting to the outdoors.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 5.10.1.8., an activity that creates an explosive atmosphere of combustible dusts shall be located only in a building provided with explosion venting to the outdoors.

National Sentence Text: When explosion venting is required in this Section, it shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage to the building in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in NFPA 68-2013 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(1)(d).)
P/T Sentence Text: When explosion venting is required in this Section, it shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage to the building in conformance with NFPA 68, "Standard on Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting".

National Sentence Text: Permanently open vent stacks are permitted to be used for the ventilation of storage bins where mechanical dust-collecting systems are not practical provided that the vent stacks have a cross-sectional area not less than twice that of all spouts discharging into the bin, are installed not more than 30° from the vertical, extend from the top of the bin to a point not less than 1.2 m above the roof, and are designed to prevent the entry of snow and rain.
P/T Sentence Text: Permanently open vent stacks may be used to ventilate storage containers where mechanical dust-collecting systems are not practical, provided that the vent stacks  have a cross-sectional area not less than twice that of spouts discharging into the container,  are installed not more than 30 degrees from the vertical,  extend from the top of the container to a point not less than 1.2 m above the roof, and  are designed to prevent the entry of snow and rain.

National Sentence Text: Separators shall be provided to prevent the entrance of foreign materials that may cause sparks in conveying equipment, dust collectors, dust-producing machines and any equipment located in an atmosphere containing combustible dusts.
P/T Sentence Text: Magnetic or pneumatic separators shall be installed to prevent the entrance of foreign materials that may cause sparks in equipment such as shellers, crackers, crushers, grinding machines, pulverizers or similar machines that produce combustible dusts.

National Sentence Text: Electrically conducting parts of conveying systems, dust collectors, dust-producing machines and any equipment capable of accumulating static electricity located in an atmosphere containing combustible dusts shall be electrically bonded and grounded.
P/T Sentence Text: Machinery and metal parts of the equipment in Article 5.10.1.12. and related conveying systems shall be electrically grounded.

National Sentence Text: Smoking shall not be permitted in atmospheres containing combustible dusts.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoking shall not take place and open flame and spark-producing equipment shall not be used in areas containing combustible dust producing operations.

National Sentence Text: Every machine that produces wood dust, particles or shavings shall be provided with a blower and exhaust system installed in conformance with NFPA 664-2012 Prevention of Fires and Explosions in Wood Processing and Woodworking Facilities
P/T Sentence Text: Every machine that produces sawdust, particles or shavings shall be provided with a blower and exhaust system installed in accordance with NFPA 91, "Standard for Exhaust Systems for Air Conveying of Vapors, Gases, Mists, and Noncombustible Particulate Solids".

National Sentence Text: Bitumen kettles shall not be located on roofs, be provided with adequate metal covers that are close-fitting and constructed of steel having a thickness of not less than No. 14 sheet metal gauge thickness, be under constant supervision when in operation, and be maintained free of excessive residue.
P/T Sentence Text: Bitumen kettles shall  not be located in a building or on a roof of a building,  not be located in a fire access route,  not be located within 3 m of a building exit or means of egress,  be provided with metal lids that are close-fitting and constructed of steel having a thickness of not less than No. 14 sheet metal gauge (2 mm),  be maintained free of excessive residue, and  when in operation  be level, with most of the weight off the tires and legs,  not be heated above 260°C,  be kept clear of combustible debris or materials, and  be under constant supervision by a person who is knowledgeable of operations and hazards and trained in the use of portable extinguishers.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to spray coating processes involving the use of combustible dry powders, flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to spray operations involving the use of flammable liquids, combustible liquids or combustible dry powders.

National Article Title: Containers for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
National Sentence Text: Containers of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be kept closed when not in use.
The design, operation and maintenance requirements relating to spray coating processes shall conform to NFPA 33-2016 Spray Application Using Flammable or Combustible Materials
P/T Sentence Text: Where spraying operations are confined within a spray booth, fire protection may be provided for the spray booth only, in conformance with NFPA 33, "Standard for Spray Application Using Flammable or Combustible Materials".

National Sentence Text: Electric hot work equipment shall be de-energized when not in use.
This Subsection applies to spray coating processes involving the use of combustible dry powders, flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to coating operations involving the use of combustible dry powders applied by powder spray guns or electrostatic powder spray guns.

National Sentence Text: Where overheating of unattended equipment using heat can cause a fire or an explosion, such equipment shall be equipped with a high temperature limit switch fitted to sound an alarm, and shut off the heat.
This Subsection applies to spray coating processes involving the use of combustible dry powders, flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
The design, operation and maintenance requirements relating to spray coating processes shall conform to NFPA 33-2016 Spray Application Using Flammable or Combustible Materials
P/T Sentence Text: Protective finishing systems are deemed to satisfy the requirements of this Subsection if they comply with Article 5.1.3.1. and the design, operation and maintenance requirements in NFPA 33, "Standard for Spray Application Using Flammable or Combustible Materials".

National Sentence Text: The design, operation and maintenance requirements relating to spray coating processes shall conform to NFPA 33-2016 Spray Application Using Flammable or Combustible Materials
P/T Sentence Text: Protective finishing systems are deemed to satisfy the requirements of this Subsection if they comply with Article 5.1.3.1. and the design, operation and maintenance requirements in NFPA 33, "Standard for Spray Application Using Flammable or Combustible Materials".

National Sentence Text: A sign identifying the floor level, stair location and civic address shall be posted at each floor in a stairway required by Sentence 5.6.3.7.(1).
Ventilation shall be provided in areas where floor finishing operations are done to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours.
P/T Sentence Text: Ventilation shall be provided in areas where floor finishing operations are done to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours.

National Sentence Text: All mechanical systems, electric motors and other equipment that might be a source of ignition shall be shut down, and smoking and the use of open flames shall be prohibited during the application of Class I liquids and for at least 1 h after such application.
P/T Article Title: Prohibited activities during flammable liquid application
P/T Sentence Text: During the application of flammable liquids and for at least 1 h after such application  all mechanical systems, electric motors, and other equipment that might be a source of ignition shall be shut down,  smoking shall not take place, and  open flames shall not be used.

National Sentence Text: A receptacle conforming to Article 2.4.1.3. shall be provided for all waste rags and materials used in operations involving flammable liquids or combustible liquids, and the contents shall be removed daily and disposed of in a manner that will not create a fire hazard.
P/T Sentence Text: A receptacle conforming to Sentence 2.4.1.3. shall be provided for all waste rags and materials used in operations involving flammable liquids or combustible liquids, and the contents shall be removed daily and disposed of in a manner that will not create a fire hazard.

National Sentence Text: Dry cleaning plants shall conform to NFPA 32-2016 Drycleaning Plants
P/T Sentence Text: Drycleaning plants shall comply with NFPA 32, "Standard for Drycleaning Plants".

National Sentence Text: Dangerous goods classified as radioactive materials shall be stored in conformance with CNSC SOR/2000-209 Nuclear Safety and Control Act (S.C. 1997, c.9)
P/T Sentence Text: Radioactive nuclear substances shall be stored in accordance with the licence requirements and regulations of the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission.

National Sentence Text: Where the dangerous goods referred to in Sentence 3.1.2.7. consist of dangerous goods classified as radioactive materials, the fire safety plan shall also include methods to control a fire emergency and to recover radioactive materials and equipment containing radioactive materials safely and efficiently, the names, addresses and telephone numbers of primary and alternative sources of expert radiation safety advice and assistance, and the location of primary and alternative sources of radiation survey instruments.
P/T Sentence Text: Persons using or storing radioactive nuclear substances shall establish fire emergency procedures in consultation with the fire department, including  the location and identification of storage and use areas,  methods to control a fire emergency and to recover radioactive nuclear substances and equipment containing radioactive nuclear substances safely and efficiently,  the names, addresses and telephone numbers of primary and alternative sources of expert radiation safety advice and assistance, and  the location of primary and alternative sources of radiation survey instruments.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging of buildings, including the fumigation of equipment or commodities within structures, tanks or bins or under tarpaulins.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to the fumigation or thermal fogging of buildings where this activity creates a fire or explosion hazard, including the fumigation of equipment or commodities within structures, tanks or bins or under tarpaulins.

National Sentence Text: The fire department shall be notified before any operation described in Article 5.4.3.1. is conducted.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 5.16.1.1.(2), the fire department shall  be notified in writing at least 24 h before any building is to be closed for fumigation, and  be advised of the chemicals to be used, the proposed date and time of use, the types of respiratory protective devices required and the degree of flammability of the fumigant or fog being used.

National Sentence Text: The occupants of any premises adjacent to that in which fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging is to take place shall be given prior notice.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 5.16.1.1.(2), prior notice shall be given to the occupants of any premises adjacent to that in which fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging is to take place.

National Sentence Text: All flames and other sources of ignition shall be eliminated in any part of a building undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging.
P/T Sentence Text: Flames and other sources of ignition shall be eliminated in a building undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging.

National Sentence Text: The air temperature in the part of a building undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging shall be kept sufficiently low to prevent the actuation of any sprinkler or fire alarm system.
P/T Sentence Text: The air temperature in a building undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging shall be kept sufficiently low to prevent the actuation of any sprinkler system.

National Sentence Text: No unauthorized person shall be permitted to enter a premise undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging until the premise has been ventilated and is safe.
P/T Sentence Text: No unauthorized person shall be permitted to enter a premises undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging until the premises has been ventilated and is safe.

National Sentence Text: Warning signs shall be posted in a conspicuous location near every entrance to the premises being fumigated.
P/T Sentence Text: Warning signs shall be posted in a conspicuous location near every entrance to the premises being fumigated.

National Sentence Text: One person shall be on duty at each entrance to the premises undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging to prevent any unauthorized person from entering until such premises have been ventilated.
P/T Sentence Text: One person shall be on duty at each entrance to the premises undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging to prevent any unauthorized person from entering until such premises have been ventilated.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to hot works involving open flames or producing heat or sparks, including but not limited to, cutting, welding, soldering, brazing, grinding, adhesive bonding, roofing operations, thermal spraying and thawing pipes.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to hot works that use open flames or produce heat or sparks, including cutting, welding, soldering, brazing, grinding, adhesive bonding, thermal spraying and thawing pipes.

National Sentence Text: The design and installation of oxygen-fuel gas equipment shall conform to NFPA 51-2018 Design and Installation of Oxygen-Fuel Gas Systems for Welding, Cutting, and Allied Processes
P/T Sentence Text: The operation of acetylene generating systems and the storage and generation of hot work fuel gases shall comply with NFPA 51, "Standard for Design and Installation of Oxygen-Fuel Gas Systems for Welding, Cutting and Allied Processes".

National Sentence Text: Unalloyed copper piping shall not be used for acetylene gas.
P/T Sentence Text: Acetylene gas shall not be piped through copper or high copper content alloy, tubing, piping or fittings.

National Sentence Text: Hot work equipment shall be examined for leakage or defects prior to each use.
P/T Sentence Text: Hot work equipment shall be inspected daily or prior to use for defects by personnel in charge of the equipment.
Variation Label: Requirement for equipment to be inspected

National Sentence Text: Leaks or defects found in hot work equipment shall be repaired prior to use.
P/T Sentence Text: Leaks or defects found in hot work equipment shall be repaired prior to use.

National Sentence Text: All valves shall be closed and gas lines bled when hot work equipment using dangerous goods classified as compressed gases is not in use.
P/T Sentence Text: Valves shall be closed and lines bled when equipment is not in actual use.

National Sentence Text: When hot work is to be carried out near piping containing dangerous goods classified as flammable gases, the piping shall conform to Sentence 5.2.3.4.(1), or be protected by a thermal barrier against the passage of heat.
P/T Sentence Text: When hot work is to be carried out near piping containing flammable gas, the section of the piping located within 1 m of the torch shall be covered with wet noncombustible insulating material 6 mm thick.

National Article Title: Work on Containers, Equipment or Piping
National Sentence Text: Hot work shall not be performed on containers, equipment, or piping containing flammable liquids, combustible liquids or dangerous goods classified as flammable gases unless they have been cleaned and tested with a gas detector to ascertain that they are free of explosive vapours, or safety measures are taken in conformance with good engineering practice (see Note A-5.2.3.4.(1)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: Hot work shall not be performed on containers, equipment, or piping containing flammable liquids, combustible liquids or flammable gases unless  they have been cleaned and tested with a listed gas detector, such as one conforming to CSA C22.2 No. 152, "Combustible Gas Detection Instruments", to ascertain that they are free of explosive vapours, or  safety measures are taken in conformance with good engineering practice.

National Article Title: Work on Containers, Equipment or Piping
National Sentence Text: Hot work shall not be performed on a totally enclosed container.
P/T Sentence Text: Hot work operations shall not be undertaken on a totally enclosed container.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to baking and drying processes during which flammable vapours are given off by the products being baked or dried.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to industrial baking and drying ovens which during operation contain flammable vapours given off by the products being baked or dried.

National Sentence Text: The design, operation and maintenance requirements relating to baking and drying processes shall conform to NFPA 86-2015 Ovens and Furnaces
P/T Sentence Text: Ovens in which flammable vapours may be present or through which products of combustion are circulated shall be ventilated in accordance with NFPA 86, "Standard for Ovens and Furnaces".

National Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers shall be inspected, tested and maintained in conformance with NFPA 10-2013 Portable Fire Extinguishers
P/T Sentence Text: Listed portable extinguishers shall be installed when replacing or adding new extinguishers.

National Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers that are subject to corrosion shall not be installed in a corrosive environment unless they are provided with appropriate corrosion protection.
P/T Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers that are subject to corrosion shall not be installed in a corrosive environment unless they are provided with appropriate corrosion protection.

National Sentence Text: Notwithstanding the requirements of Sentence 2.1.5.1.(2), portable extinguishers shall be rated and identified in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S508-02 Rating and Fire Testing of Fire Extinguishers
P/T Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers shall be rated and identified in conformance with CAN/ULC-S508, "Standard for the Rating and Fire Testing of Fire Extinguishers".

National Sentence Text: Fire alarm and detection system components shall be accessible for purposes of inspection or maintenance.
P/T Sentence Text: Access to fire alarm and voice communication system components requiring inspection or servicing shall be kept unobstructed.
Variation Label: Fire alarm and voice communication systems

National Sentence Text: The 2-way communication system from each floor area to the central alarm and control facility shall be tested to ensure proper operation.
Fire alarm systems shall be inspected and tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S536-13 Inspection and Testing of Fire Alarm Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , a fire alarm system, with or without voice communication capability, shall be inspected and tested in conformance with CAN/ULC-S536, "Inspection and Testing of Fire Alarm Systems".

National Sentence Text: Voice communication systems that are integrated with a required fire alarm system shall be tested in conformance with Article 6.3.1.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Voice communication systems that are integrated with a fire alarm system shall be tested in conformance with CAN/ULC-S536, "Inspection and Testing of Fire Alarm Systems".

National Sentence Text: Smoke alarms shall be inspected, tested and maintained in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S552-14 Inspection, Testing and Maintenance of Smoke Alarms
P/T Sentence Text: Interconnected smoke alarms shall be tested and maintained in operating condition in conformance with CAN/ULC-S552, "Standard for the Maintenance and Testing of Smoke Alarms", and as required by this Article.

National Sentence Text: A record shall be kept of all testing of smoke alarms installed in hotels and motels and shall be retained in conformance with Article 2.2.1.2..
P/T Sentence Text: Written records shall be kept of weekly checks of the power supply for at least six months after they are made, and be available upon request to the Chief Fire Official.

National Sentence Text: Carbon monoxide alarms shall be inspected, tested and maintained in conformance with the manufacturer's instructions.
P/T Article Title: Duty to maintain in operating condition
P/T Sentence Text: Carbon monoxide alarms shall be maintained in operating condition.
Variation Label: Duty to maintain in operating condition

National Sentence Text: Where tests, repairs or alterations are made to fire protection installations, including sprinkler and standpipe systems, a procedure of notification shall be established. (See Note A-6.1.1.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where alterations or repairs are made to feed mains, cross mains, or risers in sprinkler systems, the systems shall be tested in conformance with Sentences  to .

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 6.5.1.8.(2), exit signs shall be inspected at intervals not greater than 12 months to ensure that the exit signs will be visible upon failure of the primary power supply.
When any portion of a fire protection system is temporarily shut down, alternative measures shall be taken to ensure that protection is maintained. (See Note A-6.1.1.4.(1).)
P/T Article Title: Sprinkler control valves and water supplies
P/T Sentence Text: Sprinkler control valves and sprinkler water supplies shall not be shut down, disconnected or otherwise impaired for more than 24 h without notifying the Chief Fire Official.
Variation Label: Sprinkler control valves and water supplies

National Sentence Text: Materials installed to protect combustible sprinkler piping, as is required by the NBC, shall be maintained in accordance with the provisions of the same edition of the NBC used for their installation. (See Note A-2.1.3.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Materials installed to protect combustible sprinkler piping, as required by the Building Code current at the time of installation, shall be maintained in accordance with the provisions of the same edition of the Building Code used for their installation.

National Sentence Text: Fire protection installations shall be maintained in operating condition. (See Note A-6.1.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Private and public water supplies for fire protection installations shall be maintained to provide the required flow under fire conditions.

National Sentence Text: Water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected, tested and maintained in conformance with NFPA 25-2017 Inspection, Testing, and Maintenance of Water-Based Fire Protection Systems (See Note A-6.4.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Compliance with the inspection, testing and maintenance provisions of NFPA 25, "Standard for the Inspection, Testing and Maintenance of Water-Based Fire Protection Systems", for tanks is deemed to satisfy the requirements of Subsection 6.6.2.

National Sentence Text: Water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected, tested and maintained in conformance with NFPA 25-2017 Inspection, Testing, and Maintenance of Water-Based Fire Protection Systems (See Note A-6.4.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Compliance with the inspection, testing and maintenance provisions of NFPA 25, "Standard for the Inspection, Testing and Maintenance of Water-Based Fire Protection Systems", for fire pumps is deemed to satisfy the requirements of Subsection 6.6.3.

National Sentence Text: Water-based fire protection systems shall be inspected, tested and maintained in conformance with NFPA 25-2017 Inspection, Testing, and Maintenance of Water-Based Fire Protection Systems (See Note A-6.4.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Compliance with the inspection, testing and maintenance provisions of NFPA 25, "Standard for the Inspection, Testing and Maintenance of Water-Based Fire Protection Systems", for hydrants is deemed to satisfy the requirements of Subsection 6.6.5.

National Sentence Text: When an emergency power system or any part thereof is shut down, the supervisory staff shall be notified in conformance with Section 2.8.
P/T Sentence Text: If an emergency power system or any part thereof is shut down  the fire department and building occupants shall be notified in accordance with Article 1.1.1.1., and  the supervisory staff shall be notified.

National Sentence Text: Where an emergency power system is installed, instructions shall be provided for switching on essential loads and for starting the generator when this is not done automatically.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an emergency power system is installed, instructions shall be provided for switching on essential loads and for starting the generator when this is not done automatically.

National Sentence Text: Written records shall be maintained as required in CSA C282-15 Emergency Electrical Power Supply for Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Despite the requirements of Subsection 1.1.2., written records shall be maintained as required in CSA-C282, "Emergency Electrical Power Supply for Buildings".

National Sentence Text: Interconnections between fire protection and life safety systems shall be tested and maintained in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S1001-11 Integrated Systems Testing of Fire Protection and Life Safety Systems (See Note A-6.8.1.1.(1).)

If a water-based fire suppression system is not compatible with the fire suppression requirements for certain types of dangerous goods, a special fire suppression system conforming to one of the standards listed in Sentence 2.1.3.5. is permitted to be installed in lieu of a water-based system.
P/T Sentence Text: If a water-based fire suppression system is not compatible with fire suppression for specific types of hazards, a special fire suppression system conforming to one of the standards set out in Sentence  is permitted to be installed in lieu of a water-based system.

National Sentence Text: The design and installation of a water-based special fire suppression system shall conform to one of the following standards: NFPA 15-2012 Water Spray Fixed Systems for Fire Protection or NFPA 16-2011 Installation of Foam-Water Sprinkler and Foam-Water Spray Systems
P/T Sentence Text: The design and installation of a water based special fire suppression system shall conform to one of the following standards:  NFPA 15, Standard for Water Spray Fixed Systems for Fire Protection , or  NFPA 16, Standard for the Installation of Foam-Water Sprinkler and Foam-Water Spray Systems .

National Sentence Text: Wetting agents used in conjunction with water-based fire suppression systems shall conform to NFPA 18-2011 Wetting Agents
P/T Sentence Text: Wetting agents used in conjunction with water-based fire suppressions systems shall conform to NFPA 18, "Standard on Wetting Agents".

National Sentence Text: A hazard for which a fire suppression system has been designed is not permitted to be increased unless the level of fire protection is also commensurately increased.
P/T Sentence Text: A hazard for which a fire suppression system has been designed shall not be increased unless the level of fire protection is also commensurately increased.

National Sentence Text: Operating and maintenance instructions for a special fire suppression system shall be posted in proximity to the equipment and, if manual controls are provided, shall be posted near the manual controls.
P/T Sentence Text: Operating and maintenance instructions for a special fire suppression system shall be posted in proximity to the equipment and, if manual controls are provided, shall also be posted near the manual controls.

National Sentence Text: A special fire suppression system that meets the description given in any one of the standards referenced in Article 2.1.3.5. shall be tested, inspected and maintained in conformance with the appropriate requirements of that standard.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a special fire suppression system of a type has been installed in accordance with a standard not referred to in Article 6.8.1.1., inspection and maintenance shall be provided in conformance with the specified standard and in the absence of a standard, to the manufacturer's recommended maintenance instructions.

National Sentence Text: This Part provides for the inspection, testing and maintenance of the fire emergency systems installed in high buildings as defined in Subsection 3.2.6. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: This Part applies to high buildings as described in Article 3.2.6.1. of Division B of the Building Code.

National Sentence Text: A closure in an opening to the outdoors at the top of a smoke shaft shall be tested to ensure that it will open manually from outside the building, on a signal from the smoke detector in the smoke shaft, and when a closure in an opening between a floor area and the smoke shaft opens.
P/T Sentence Text: Every closure in an opening to the outdoors at the top of a smoke shaft shall be inspected annually to ensure that it will open  manually from outside the building,  on a signal from the smoke or heat actuated device in the smoke shaft, and  when a closure in an opening between a floor area and the smoke shaft opens.

National Sentence Text: In addition to the procedures described in Article 7.2.3.1., all elevators in an elevator shaft that is designed for use as a smoke shaft shall be tested to ensure that on activation of the fire alarm system they will return to the street floor level and remain inoperative.
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to the procedures described in Sentences  and , elevators in an elevator shaft that is intended for use as a smoke shaft shall be inspected semi-annually to ensure that on activation of the fire alarm system they will return to the street floor and remain inoperative.

National Sentence Text: Air moving fans in a system serving more than 2 storeys shall be tested to ensure that they will stop on activation of a switch at the central alarm and control facility.

Doors to vestibules that are normally held open by a hold-open device connected to the building fire alarm system shall be tested to ensure that they will close on a signal from the central alarm and control facility.
The keys required to recall elevators and to permit independent operation of each elevator shall be kept in the locations required by Subsection 3.2.6. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Article Title: Maintenance of certain fire emergency systems
P/T Sentence Text: The keys required to recall elevators and to permit independent operation of each elevator shall be kept in the location required by the Building Code.

National Sentence Text: Access to windows and panels required to vent floor areas and vents to vestibules permitted to be manually openable shall be kept free of obstruction.
P/T Article Title: Maintenance of certain fire emergency systems
P/T Sentence Text: Access to windows and panels required to vent floor areas and vents to vestibules that are permitted to be manually openable shall be kept free of obstructions.

National Sentence Text: Windows and panels provided for venting floor areas shall be maintained so as to be openable without the use of keys.
P/T Article Title: Maintenance of certain fire emergency systems
P/T Sentence Text: Windows and panels provided for venting floor areas shall be maintained so as to be openable without the use of keys.

National Sentence Text: Vents to vestibules permitted to be manually openable shall be maintained in an operable condition.
P/T Article Title: Maintenance of certain fire emergency systems
P/T Sentence Text: Vents to vestibules that are permitted to be manually openable shall be maintained in operable condition.

National Sentence Text: Where vestibules or stairshafts are pressurized as a means of smoke control, all doors in the path of exit travel shall be tested to ensure that they can be operated as required in Article 2.7.2.1. when the entire smoke control system is being tested.
Variation Label: Inspection, testing and maintenance of smoke control equipment

National Sentence Text: Pressurized vestibules shall be tested in different seasons by a pressure sensor or by tracer smoke at intervals not greater than 2 years and after any alteration to the building, to ensure that movement of air is from the vestibules to the floor areas on all storeys.

Pressurized vestibules shall be tested in different seasons by pressure sensor or by tracer smoke at intervals not greater than 2 years and after any alteration to the building, to ensure that movement of air is from the vestibules to the floor areas on all storeys.

Pressurized stair and elevator shafts shall be tested in different seasons by a pressure sensor or tracer smoke at intervals not greater than 2 years and after any alteration to the building, to ensure that the movement of air is from the stair or elevator shafts to the floor areas on all storeys.

Pressurized stair and elevator shafts shall be tested in different seasons by a pressure sensor or tracer smoke at intervals not greater than 2 years and after any alteration to the building, to ensure that the movement of air is from the stair or elevator shafts to the floor areas on all storeys.

Pressurized vestibules at or near grade level shall be tested by a pressure sensor or tracer smoke in different seasons at intervals not greater than 2 years and after any alteration to the building, when the building is pressurized but without venting of the fire floor, to ensure that the direction of air movement is from the building to the outdoors.

The pressurized core shall be tested at or near grade in different seasons by a pressure sensor or tracer smoke at intervals not greater than 2 years and after any alteration to the building, to ensure that movement of air is from the pressurized core to the outdoors on all storeys.

The pressurized core shall be tested at or near grade in different seasons by a pressure sensor or tracer smoke at intervals not greater than 2 years and after any alteration to the building, to ensure that the movement of air is from the pressurized core to the outdoors on all storeys.

Pressurized vestibules shall be tested in different seasons by a pressure sensor or tracer smoke at intervals not greater than 2 years and after any alteration to the building, to ensure that the movement of air is from the vestibules to the floor areas on all storeys.

Vestibules and areas of refuge shall be tested in different seasons by a pressure sensor or tracer smoke at intervals not greater than 2 years and after any alteration to the building, to ensure that the movement of air is from the areas of refuge or vestibules to the floor areas on all storeys.

Pressurized vestibules shall be tested in different seasons by a pressure sensor or tracer smoke at intervals not greater than 2 years and after any alteration to the building, to ensure that the movement of air is from the vestibules to adjacent floor areas on all storeys.
This Section applies to fire safety for buildings, parts of buildings, facilities, adjacent buildings or facilities, and associated areas undergoing construction, alteration or demolition operations.
P/T Sentence Text: This Part applies to the prevention or control of fire during any demolition and the protection from fire of neighbouring occupied spaces and neighbouring properties.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 5.6.1.9. and except for water supplies for firefighting, building services shall be terminated at a point located outside the building or part thereof being demolished. (See Note A-5.6.1.9.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence , before demolition of a building or part of a building is commenced, building services other than water supply for fire fighting shall be terminated at a point located outside the building or part under demolition.

National Sentence Text: The service company whose service connections will be affected shall be notified before any action mentioned in Sentence 5.6.1.9. is taken and, if it is necessary to maintain any service, it shall be relocated as necessary, and protected from damage.
P/T Sentence Text: Instead of being terminated under Sentence , a service provider's connection shall be relocated and protected from damage if it is determined that  terminating the service at a point outside the building or part under demolition would interfere with service to a part of the building that is not under demolition or service to another building that is not under demolition, or  maintaining the service is necessary for demolition purposes.

National Sentence Text: The service company whose service connections will be affected shall be notified before any action mentioned in Sentence 5.6.1.9. is taken and, if it is necessary to maintain any service, it shall be relocated as necessary, and protected from damage.
P/T Sentence Text: No steps shall be taken under Sentence  or  in respect of a service provider"s connection unless that service provider and all other service providers whose connections will be affected by the termination or relocation of that connection have been notified.

National Sentence Text: Temporary electrical installations shall be installed in conformance with the requirements of CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I
A watch, with tours at intervals of not more than 1 h, shall be provided throughout demolition sites when there are occupants in the portion of the building not being demolished.
P/T Sentence Text: During periods when demolition operations create a fire hazard to parts of the building not under demolition or to neighbouring occupied spaces or neighbouring properties, a firewatch shall be conducted.

National Sentence Text: Combustible refuse in sufficient quantities to constitute a fire hazard shall be moved to a safe location. (See also Subsection 8.2.5. of Division B of the NBC.)
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible salvage, waste material and rubbish shall not be accumulated on site in such quantity or such location as to cause a fire hazard.

National Sentence Text: A clearance of not less than 3 m shall be maintained between containers used for the disposal of combustible refuse and exits.
Disposal chutes described in Clause 8.2.5.2.(1) of Division B of the NBC shall be constructed of noncombustible material, or terminate not less than 2 m above the disposal bin they serve.
P/T Sentence Text: If temporary chutes are installed on the exterior of a building, the chutes shall  be of noncombustible material, or  be installed a distance of at least 3 m from any opening in the building face.

National Sentence Text: Where a building being demolished floor by floor is equipped with a standpipe system, the system, together with fire department connections and valves, shall be maintained in operable condition on all storeys below the one being demolished, except for the storey immediately below it.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a building being demolished floor by floor is equipped with a standpipe system, the system, together with fire department connections, valves, couplings and hose, shall be maintained in operable condition on all storeys below the one being demolished, except for the storey immediately below it.

National Sentence Text: Access routes for fire department vehicles shall be provided and maintained to construction and demolition sites. (See Note A-5.6.1.4.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: During demolition, fire fighting access routes shall be maintained in accordance with Section 2.5.

National Sentence Text: Unobstructed access to fire hydrants, portable extinguishers and to fire department connections for standpipe and sprinkler systems shall be maintained.
P/T Sentence Text: Unobstructed access to fire hydrants, portable extinguishers and fire department connections for standpipe and sprinkler systems shall be maintained during demolition.

National Sentence Text: A means shall be provided to allow firefighters to perform their duties on all levels of the building.
Where a construction or demolition site is fenced so as to prevent general entry, provision shall be made for access by fire department equipment and personnel.
P/T Sentence Text: If a demolition site is fenced so as to prevent general entry, provision shall be made for access by fire department equipment and personnel.

National Sentence Text: Provision shall be made for the use of existing elevators, hoists or lifts to assist firefighting personnel in reaching all levels of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Elevating devices shall be accessible for the use of firefighters for buildings under demolition that are more than 36 m in building height, measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey.

National Sentence Text: Devices capable of producing ignition, internal combustion engines, temporary heating equipment and associated devices shall be kept at a safe distance from combustible material so as not to cause ignition.
P/T Sentence Text: Internal combustion engines, other devices capable of producing ignition and devices associated with either of the foregoing shall be kept at sufficient distance from combustible material so as to prevent ignition.

National Sentence Text: The clearance between combustible materials and temporary heating equipment, including flues, shall be in conformance with Part 6 of Division B of the NBC or in conformance with the minimum clearances shown on certified heating equipment.
P/T Sentence Text: The clearance between combustible material and temporary heating equipment, including flues, shall comply with  the minimum clearance, if any, shown on certified heating equipment, or  the minimum clearance specified in the Building Code, if no minimum clearance is shown on the heating equipment.

National Sentence Text: Fabrics and films used to temporarily enclose buildings shall be securely fastened to prevent them from being blown against heaters or other ignition sources.
P/T Sentence Text: Fabrics and films used to temporarily enclose buildings shall be securely fastened to prevent them from being blown against heaters or other ignition sources.

National Sentence Text: In buildings being demolished, at least one stairway shall be maintained in usable condition at all times.
A means shall be provided to alert site personnel of a fire and such means shall be capable of being heard throughout the building or facility.
P/T Sentence Text: A means shall be provided that is capable of alerting persons throughout a building under demolition and the property on which the building is located of a fire emergency.

National Article Title: Tank, Piping and Machinery Reservoir Safety at Demolition Sites
National Sentence Text: Tanks, piping and machinery reservoirs at a demolition site that contain combustible liquids or flammable liquids or that are likely to contain flammable vapours shall be drained and, except as permitted by Sentence 5.6.1.11.(3), removed prior to the demolition of the building.
P/T Article Title: Safety of tanks, piping and machinery reservoirs at demolition sites
P/T Sentence Text: Tanks, piping and machinery reservoirs at a demolition site that contain flammable liquids or combustible liquids or that are likely to contain flammable vapours shall be drained, purged with inert materials and then removed before demolition is commenced.

National Article Title: Tank, Piping and Machinery Reservoir Safety at Demolition Sites
National Sentence Text: Where it is impracticable to remove tanks, piping or machinery reservoirs from the building prior to demolition, such equipment shall be conspicuously identified and removed as soon as conditions permit.
P/T Article Title: Safety of tanks, piping and machinery reservoirs at demolition sites
P/T Sentence Text: Despite Sentence , if it is impracticable to remove any tank, piping or machinery reservoir described in Sentence  from the building before demolition is commenced, such equipment shall be  drained and purged with inert materials before demolition is commenced,  clearly identified before demolition is commenced, and  removed from the building as soon as conditions permit.

National Sentence Text: This Part applies to all buildings covered in this Code. (See Article 1.1.1.1..)
P/T Sentence Text: This Part applies to all buildings covered in this Code.

National Sentence Text: Where documents are referenced in this Code, they shall be the editions designated in Table 1.3.1.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Where documents are referenced in this Code, they shall be the editions designated in Column 2 of Table 1.3.1.2.

National Sentence Text: Buildings or parts thereof used for the storage of baled combustible fibres shall be classified as medium-hazard industrial occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings or parts of them used for the storage of baled combustible fibres shall be classified as medium hazard industrial occupancies.

National Sentence Text: In a building not more than 3 storeys in building height, if not more than 2 dwelling units are contained together with a Group E major occupancy, the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation between the 2 major occupancies need not be more than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building not more than 3 storeys in building height, if not more than two dwelling units are contained together with a Group E major occupancy, the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation between the two major occupancies need not be more than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: A building permitted to be of combustible construction is permitted to be constructed of combustible materials, with or without noncombustible components. (See Note A-3.1.4.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by this Part, a building permitted to be of combustible construction is permitted to be constructed of combustible materials, with or without noncombustible components. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Totally enclosed non-metallic raceways used in a plenum in a building permitted to be of combustible construction shall meet the requirements of Clause 3.1.5.23.(1)(a).
P/T Sentence Text: Totally enclosed nonmetallic raceways used in a plenum in a building permitted to be of combustible construction shall meet the requirements of Clause 3.1.5.20.(1)(a).

National Sentence Text: If a material referred to in Sentence 3.1.5.1. consists of a number of discrete layers and testing reveals that the surface layer or layers protect the underlying layers such that complete combustion of the underlying layers does not occur, the test shall be repeated by removing the outer layers sequentially until all layers have been exposed during testing, or until complete combustion has occurred.
P/T Sentence Text: If a material referred to in Sentence  consists of a number of discrete layers and testing reveals that the surface layer or layers protect the underlying layers such that the complete combustion of the underlying layers does not occur, the test shall be repeated by removing the outer layers sequentially until all layers have been exposed during testing, or until complete combustion has occurred.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.4.(4), the combustible vertical glazing permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.4. shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 75.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , the combustible vertical glazing permitted by Sentence  shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 75.

National Sentence Text: A wall assembly permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.5. that includes combustible cladding of fire-retardant-treated wood shall be tested for fire exposure after the cladding has been subjected to an accelerated weathering test as specified in ASTM D 2898-10 Accelerated Weathering of Fire-Retardant-Treated Wood for Fire Testing
P/T Sentence Text: A wall assembly permitted by Sentence  that includes combustible cladding of fire-retardant treated wood shall be tested for fire exposure after the cladding has been subjected to an accelerated weathering test as specified in ASTM D2898, "Accelerated Weathering of Fire-Retardant-Treated Wood for Fire Testing".

National Sentence Text: Wood members more than 50 mm but not more than 300 mm high applied directly to or set into a noncombustible floor slab are permitted for the construction of a raised platform in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided the concealed spaces created are divided into compartments by fire blocks in conformance with Sentence 3.1.11.3.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Wood members more than 50 mm but not more than 375 mm high applied directly to or set into a noncombustible floor slab are permitted for the construction of a raised platform in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided the concealed spaces created are divided into compartments by fire blocks in conformance with Sentence 3.1.11.3.(2).

National Sentence Text: The floor system for the raised platform referred to in Sentence 3.1.5.10. is permitted to include a combustible subfloor and combustible finished flooring.
P/T Sentence Text: The floor system for the raised platform referred to in Sentence  is permitted to include combustible subfloor and combustible finished flooring.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.1.5.12.(4), combustible interior ceiling finishes, other than foamed plastics, that are not more than 25 mm thick are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided they have a flame-spread rating not more than 25 on any exposed surface or on any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, except that not more than 10% of the ceiling area within each fire compartment is permitted to have a flame-spread rating not more than 150.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , combustible interior ceiling finishes, other than foamed plastics, that are not more than 25 mm thick are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided that,  they have a flame-spread rating not more than 25 on any exposed surface or on any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, and  not more than 10% of the ceiling area within each fire compartment where such finishes are installed has a flame-spread rating not more than 150.

National Sentence Text: Foamed plastic insulation shall conform to Article 3.1.5.15.
P/T Sentence Text: Foamed plastic insulation shall conform to Article 3.1.5.12A.

National Sentence Text: Combustible duct linings, duct coverings, duct insulation, vibration isolation connectors, duct tape, pipe insulation and pipe coverings are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided they conform to the appropriate requirements of Subsection 3.6.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible duct linings, duct coverings, duct insulation, vibration isolation connectors, duct tape, pipe insulation and pipe coverings are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided they conform to the appropriate requirements of Part 6.

National Sentence Text: Combustible plumbing fixtures, including wall and ceiling enclosures that form part of the plumbing fixture, are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided they are constructed of material having a flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification not more than that permitted for the wall surface of the room or space in which they are installed.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible plumbing fixtures are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction if they are constructed of material having a flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification permitted in Subsection 3.1.13.

National Sentence Text: A material, assembly of materials or a structural member is permitted to be assigned a fire-resistance rating on the basis of Appendix.
P/T Sentence Text: A material, assembly of materials or a structural member is permitted to be assigned a fire-resistance rating on the basis of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings".

National Sentence Text: Loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting a service room or service space need not conform to Sentence 3.1.7.5.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting a service room or service space need not conform to Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.8.12.(1), the fire-protection rating of a closure shall conform to Table 3.1.8.4. for the required fire-resistance rating of the fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.8.10.(1), the fire-protection rating of a closure shall conform to Table 3.1.8.4. for the required fire-resistance rating of the fire separation.

National Sentence Text: The leakage rate of a door assembly shall be determined in accordance with UL ANSI/UL-1784-04 Air Leakage Tests of Door Assemblies and Other Opening Protectives
P/T Sentence Text: The leakage rate of a door assembly shall be determined in accordance with ANSI/UL-1784, "Air Leakage Tests of Door Assemblies and Other Opening Protectives".

National Sentence Text: Except where fire dampers, window assemblies and glass block are used as closures, closures of the same fire-protection rating installed on opposite sides of the same opening are deemed to have a fire-protection rating equal to the sum of the fire-protection ratings of the closures. (See Note A-3.1.8.1.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where fire dampers, window assemblies and glass block are used as closures, closures of the same fire-protection rating installed on opposite sides of the same opening are deemed to have a fire-protection rating equal to the sum of the fire-protection ratings of the closures.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise specified in this Part, every smoke damper or combination smoke/fire damper used as a closure in a required fire separation shall be installed in conformance with NFPA 105-2013 Smoke Door Assemblies and Other Opening Protectives
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise specified in this Part, every smoke damper used as a closure in a required fire separation shall be installed in conformance with NFPA 105, "Smoke Door Assemblies and Other Opening Protectives".

National Sentence Text: Leakage-rated door assemblies required by Sentence 3.1.8.5. shall be installed in accordance with NFPA 105-2013 Smoke Door Assemblies and Other Opening Protectives
P/T Sentence Text: Leakage-rated door assemblies required by Sentence  shall conform to NFPA 105, "Smoke Door Assemblies and Other Opening Protectives".

National Article Title: Location of Fire Dampers and Smoke Dampers
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.1.8.8., a fire damper having a fire-protection rating conforming to Sentence 3.1.8.4. shall be installed in conformance with Article 3.1.8.10. in ducts or air-transfer openings that penetrate an assembly required to be a fire separation.
P/T Article Title: 3.1.8.7. Location of Fire Dampers and Smoke Dampers
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.1.8.8., a fire damper having a fire-protection rating conforming to Sentence 3.1.8.4. shall be installed in conformance with Article 3.1.8.9. in ducts or air-transfer openings that penetrate an assembly required to be a fire separation.

National Sentence Text: A fire damper shall be arranged so as to close automatically upon the operation of a fusible link conforming to ULC ULC-S505-1974 Fusible Links for Fire Protection Service or other heat-actuated or smoke-actuated device.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire damper shall be arranged to close automatically upon the operation of a fusible link conforming to ULC S505, "Fusible Links for Fire Protection Service", or other heat-actuated or smoke-actuated device.

National Sentence Text: A tightly fitted access door shall be installed for each fire damper to provide access for the inspection of the damper and the resetting of the release device. (See Note A-3.1.8.10.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: A tightly fitted access door shall be installed for each fire damper to provide access for the inspection of the damper and the resetting of the release device. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where combination smoke/fire dampers are used as a closure in a duct, they shall be installed within 610 mm of the plane of the fire separation, provided there is no inlet or outlet opening between the fire separation and the damper.
P/T Sentence Text: Where combination smoke and fire dampers are used as a closure in a duct, they shall be installed within 610 mm of the plane of the fire separation, provided there is no inlet or outlet opening between the fire separation and the damper.

National Sentence Text: Smoke dampers or combination smoke/fire dampers shall be installed in the vertical or horizontal position in which they were tested.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoke dampers or combination smoke and fire dampers shall be installed in the vertical or horizontal position in which they were tested.

National Sentence Text: A tightly fitted access door shall be installed for each smoke damper and combination smoke/fire damper to provide access for their inspection and the resetting of the release device. (See Note A-3.1.8.10.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: A tightly fitted access door shall be installed for each smoke damper and combination smoke and fire damper to provide access for their inspection and the resetting of the release device.

National Sentence Text: The requirements for noncombustible sills and combustible floor coverings in NFPA 80-2013 Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives do not apply to a door described in Sentence 3.1.8.12.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements for noncombustible sills and combustible floor coverings in NFPA 80, "Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives", do not apply to a door described in Sentence .

National Sentence Text: A door described in Sentence 3.1.8.12. shall have clearances of not more than 6 mm at the bottom and not more than 3 mm at the sides and top.
P/T Sentence Text: A door described in Sentence  shall have a clearance not more than 6 mm at the bottom and not more than 3 mm at the sides and top.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.1.8.10. and Sentence 3.1.8.11.(3), a hold-open device is permitted to be used on a closure in a required fire separation, other than on an exit stair door in a building more than 3 storeys in building height and on a door for a vestibule required by Article 3.3.5.7., provided the device is designed to release the closure in conformance with this Article.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.1.8.9. and 3.1.8.9A.(3), a hold-open device is permitted to be used on a closure in a required fire separation, other than on an exit stair door in a building more than 3 storeys in building height and on a door for a vestibule required by Article 3.3.5.7., provided the device is designed to release the closure in conformance with this Article.

National Sentence Text: A hold-open device used on a door located between a corridor used by the public and an adjacent sleeping room in a treatment occupancy need not release automatically as stated in Sentence 3.1.8.14.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: A hold-open device used on a door located between a corridor used by the public and an adjacent sleeping room in a care and treatment occupancy need not release automatically as described in Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.3.3.5., a swing-type door in a fire separation shall be equipped with a positive latching mechanism designed to hold the door in the closed position after each use.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.3.2. and Article 3.3.3.5., a swing-type door in a fire separation shall be equipped with a positive latching mechanism designed to hold the door in the closed position after each use.

National Sentence Text: Wired glass assemblies permitted by Sentence 3.1.8.16. and described in are permitted to be used as closures in vertical fire separations without being tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.8.4.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Wired glass assemblies permitted by Sentence  and described in MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings", are permitted to be used as closures in vertical fire separations without being tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.8.4.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.1.8.19., the maximum temperature rise on the opaque portion of the unexposed side of a door used as a closure in a fire separation in a location shown in Table 3.1.8.17. shall conform to the Table when tested in conformance with Sentence 3.1.8.4.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.1.8.17., the maximum temperature rise on the opaque portion of the unexposed side of a door used as a closure in a fire separation in a location shown in Table 3.1.8.15., shall conform to the Table when tested in conformance with Sentence 3.1.8.4.(1).

National Sentence Text: Penetrations of a fire separation in conformance with Sentence 3.6.4.2. shall be sealed by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in ULC CAN/ULC-S115-11 Fire Tests of Firestop Systems has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating for the fire separation of the assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: Penetrations of a fire separation in conformance with Sentence 3.6.4.2. shall be sealed by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in CAN/ULC-S115, "Fire Tests of Firestop Systems", has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating required for the fire separation of the assembly.
