National Sentence Text: Means of egress shall be provided from every roof which is intended for occupancy, and from every podium, terrace, platform or contained open space.
P/T Sentence Text: Means of egress shall be provided from every roof that is intended for occupancy, and from every podium, terrace, platform or contained open space.

National Sentence Text: At least two separate means of egress shall be provided from a roof, used or intended for an occupant load more than 60, to stairs designed in conformance with the requirements regarding exit stairs stated in Section 3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: At least two separate means of egress shall be provided from a roof, used or intended for an occupant load more than 60, to stairs designed in conformance with the exit stair requirements of Section 3.4.

National Sentence Text: Where 2 egress doorways are required by Sentence 3.3.1.5.(1), they shall be placed at a distance from one another equal to or greater than one third of the maximum overall diagonal dimension of the area to be served, measured as the shortest distance that smoke would have to travel between the nearest required egress doors.
P/T Sentence Text: Where two egress doorways are required by Sentence , they shall be placed at a distance from one another equal to or greater than one-third of the maximum overall diagonal dimension of the room or suite to be served, measured as the shortest distance that smoke would have to travel between the nearest required egress doors.

National Sentence Text: Except within the floor area of a storage garage, the minimum headroom clearance in every access to exit shall conform to the requirements of Article 3.4.3.4. for exits. (See also Sentence 3.3.5.4.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except within the floor area of a storage garage, the minimum headroom clearance in every access to exit shall conform to the requirements of Article 3.4.3.5. for exits.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise stated in this Section, aisles shall be provided in conformance with the NFC.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise required by this Section, aisles shall be provided in conformance with the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.11. and Article 3.3.1.12., a door that opens into a corridor or other facility providing access to exit from a suite or room not located within a suite shall swing on a vertical axis.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence  and Article 3.3.1.11., a door that opens into a corridor or other facility providing access to exit from a suite, or a room not located within a suite, shall swing on a vertical axis.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.3.1.12., a door that opens into a corridor or other facility providing access to exit from a room or suite that is used or intended for an occupant load more than 60 or for a high-hazard industrial occupancy shall swing in the direction of travel to the exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.3.1.11., a door that opens into a corridor or other facility providing access to exit from a room or suite shall swing in the direction of travel to the exit if the room or suite is used or intended for, an occupant load more than 60, a high hazard industrial occupancy, or a hazardous classroom in an elementary or secondary school.

National Sentence Text: Every door that divides a corridor that is not wholly contained within a suite shall swing on a vertical axis in the direction of travel to the exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Every door that divides a corridor that is not wholly contained within a suite shall swing on a vertical axis in the direction of travel to the exit where the corridor provides access to exit for, an occupant load more than 60, a high hazard industrial occupancy, a hazardous classroom in an elementary or secondary school, a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy, or a retirement home.

National Sentence Text: Doors that serve storage suites not more than 28 m2 in area in warehousing buildings need not conform to Sentence 3.3.1.11.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Doors that serve individual storage spaces not more than 28 m2 in area in self-service storage buildings need not conform to Sentence .

National Sentence Text: In a Group B, Division 1 occupancy, or in an impeded egress zone in other occupancies, sliding doors used in an access to exit need not conform to Sentence 3.3.1.12. and Article 3.3.1.11.
P/T Sentence Text: In a Group B, Division 1 occupancy, or in an impeded egress zone in other occupancies, sliding doors used in an access to exit need not conform to Sentence  and Article 3.3.1.10.

National Sentence Text: Controls for the remote release of door locking devices permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.13. shall be located in an area readily available to security personnel.
P/T Sentence Text: Controls for the remote release of door locking devices permitted by Sentence  shall be located in an area readily available to security personnel.

National Sentence Text: Locking devices permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.13. that are electrically operated shall be designed to operate on emergency power, and capable of manual release by security personnel.
P/T Sentence Text: Locking devices permitted by Sentence  that are electrically operated shall be, designed to operate on emergency power, and capable of manual release by security personnel.

National Sentence Text: Ramps and stairways that serve service rooms, service spaces or industrial occupancies need not comply with Sentence 3.3.1.14.(1), provided they are intended only for occasional use for servicing equipment and machinery, and they do not serve as exits.
P/T Sentence Text: Ramps and stairways that do not conform to the requirements of Sentence  and are intended only for occasional use for servicing equipment and machinery are permitted, to serve service rooms and service spaces, and in industrial occupancies.

National Article Title: Tapered Treads in a Curved Flight
National Sentence Text: Flights of stairs shall consist solely of straight flights, or curved flights complying with Sentence 3.3.1.16.(2).
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.15. Tapered Treads in a Curved Flight
P/T Sentence Text: Flights shall consist solely of, straight flights, or curved flights complying with Sentence .

National Article Title: Tapered Treads in a Curved Flight
National Sentence Text: Tapered treads in a curved flight that is not required as an exit shall have a minimum run of 150 mm, a run not less than 280 mm when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrail at the narrow end of the tread, and a riser conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.8.(2).
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.15. Tapered Treads in a Curved Flight
P/T Sentence Text: Tapered treads in a curved flight that is not required as an exit shall have, a minimum run of 150 mm, a run not less than 280 mm when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail, and a riser conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.8.(2).

National Article Title: Tapered Treads in a Curved Flight
National Sentence Text: Tapered treads shall have a consistent angle and uniform run and rise dimensions in accordance with the construction tolerances stipulated in Article 3.4.6.8. when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrail at the narrow end of the tread.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.15. Tapered Treads in a Curved Flight
P/T Sentence Text: Tapered treads shall have a consistent angle and uniform run and rise dimensions in accordance with the construction tolerances described in Article 3.4.6.8. when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail.

National Sentence Text: In an access to exit from a floor area used or intended to be used for patients in a Group B, Division 2 occupancy or residents in a Group B, Division 3 occupancy, the required width of corridors, doorways, and ramps shall be based on not less than 18.4 mm per person.
P/T Sentence Text: In an access to exit from a floor area used or intended to be used for patients or residents in a Group B, Division 2 or Division 3 occupancy, the required width of corridors, doorways, and ramps shall be based on not less than 18.4 mm per person.

National Sentence Text: In a building that is not sprinklered throughout in accordance with Sentence 3.2.5.12.(1), an access to exit that is part of the principal entrance serving a dance hall or a licensed beverage establishment with an occupant load more than 250 shall provide at least one half of the required exit width.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building that is not sprinklered in accordance with Sentence 3.2.5.13.(1), an access to exit that is part of the principal entrance serving a dance hall or a licensed beverage establishment with an occupant load more than 250 shall be at least one-half of the required exit width.

National Sentence Text: Except for guards conforming to Article 3.3.5.10., guards that protect a level located more than one storey or 4.2 m above the adjacent level shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above the level protected by the guard facilitates climbing. (See Note A-9.8.8.6.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings do not present a hazard, a guard shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above the level protected by the guard will facilitate climbing.

National Sentence Text: Sentence 3.3.1.18. does not apply to the front edges of stages, to loading docks, or where access is provided for maintenance purposes only.
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  does not apply, to the front edges of stages, to loading docks, to floor pits in repair garages, or where access is provided for maintenance purposes only.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.19.(5), a glass or transparent door shall be designed and constructed so that the existence and position of the door is readily apparent, by attaching visually contrasting hardware, bars or other permanent fixtures to it.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units and as permitted by Sentence , a glass or transparent door shall be designed and constructed so that the existence and position of the door is readily apparent, by attaching visually contrasting hardware, bars or other permanent fixtures to it.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.19.(5), transparent panels used in an access to exit that, because of their physical configuration or design, could be mistaken as a means of egress shall be made inaccessible by barriers or railings.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , transparent panels used in an access to exit that, because of their physical configuration or design, could be mistaken as a means of egress shall be made inaccessible by barriers or railings.

National Sentence Text: Where vision glass is provided in doors or transparent sidelights, the lowest edge of the glass shall be no higher than 900 mm above floor level.
P/T Sentence Text: (4.1) Glass in a vision panel in a door or in a transparent sidelight shall conform to Sentence 3.8.3.3.(14).

National Sentence Text: A window in a public area that extends to less than 1 000 mm above the floor and is located above the second storey in a building of residential occupancy, shall be protected by a barrier or railing to not less than 1 070 mm above the floor, or the window shall be non-openable and designed to withstand the lateral design loads for balcony guards required by Article 4.1.5.14.
P/T Sentence Text: A window in a public area that extends to less than 1 070 mm above the floor and is located above the second storey in a building of residential occupancy, shall be protected by a barrier or railing from the floor to not less than 1 070 mm above the floor, or the window shall be non-openable and designed to withstand the lateral design loads for balcony guards required by Article 4.1.5.14.

National Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.21. is not required to have a fire-resistance rating if the floor area in which the room or space is located is sprinklered throughout.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence  is not required to have a fire-resistance rating if the floor area in which the room or space is located is sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.22. is not required to have a fire-resistance rating if the floor area in which the laundry room is located is sprinklered throughout.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence  is not required to have a fire-resistance rating if the floor area in which the laundry room is located is sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.1.25.(2), welding and cutting operations shall be carried out in a room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, or protected by an automatic fire extinguishing system.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , welding and cutting operations shall be located in a room, separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, or protected by an automatic fire extinguishing system.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.2.(2), the seating area of a Group A, Division 1 occupancy shall be separated from adjacent occupancies in the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h if the occupant load in the seating area exceeds 200.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , the seating area of a Group A, Division 1 occupancy shall be separated from adjacent occupancies in the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h if the occupant load in the seating area exceeds 200.

National Sentence Text: Aisles shall terminate in a cross aisle, foyer or exit, and the width of the cross aisle, foyer or exit shall be not less than the required width of the widest aisle plus 50% of the total required width of the remaining aisles that it serves.
P/T Sentence Text: An aisle shall terminate at, a converging aisle, an egress doorway from the seating area, or an exit from the seating area.

National Sentence Text: Aisles shall terminate in a cross aisle, foyer or exit, and the width of the cross aisle, foyer or exit shall be not less than the required width of the widest aisle plus 50% of the total required width of the remaining aisles that it serves.
P/T Sentence Text: The width of a converging aisle shall be not less than the required width of the widest aisle plus 50% of the total required width of the remaining aisles that it serves.

National Sentence Text: Side aisles shall be not less than 1 100 mm wide if seating is provided in conformance with Sentence 3.3.2.4.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Side aisles shall be not less than 1 100 mm wide if seating is provided in conformance with Sentence 3.3.2.3.(4).

National Sentence Text: Variations are permitted in riser height provided the height of adjacent risers does not vary by more than 6 mm, and the width of a tread or a platform in the direction of travel is not less than 430 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Variations are permitted in riser height provided, the height of adjacent risers does not vary by more than 6 mm, and the depth of a tread or a platform in the direction of travel is not less than 430 mm.

National Sentence Text: Steps in an aisle shall have a run not less than 230 mm exclusive of nosings, have a tread width not less than 250 mm, extend to the adjacent rows of seats in a manner that will not create a hazard from tripping, and have a finish on the treads conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.1.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Steps in an aisle shall, have a run not less than 230 mm exclusive of nosings, have a tread depth not less than 250 mm, extend to the adjacent rows of seats in a manner that will not create a hazard from tripping, and have a finish on the treads conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.1.(1).

National Sentence Text: A platform in an aisle shall be level, except that a slope not more than 1 in 50 is permitted for a platform that is not less than 430 mm wide in the direction of exit travel.
P/T Sentence Text: A platform in an aisle shall be level, except that a slope not more than 1 in 50 is permitted for a platform that is not less than 430 mm deep in the direction of exit travel.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating required by Sentence 3.3.2.6. is permitted to be waived if the floor area in which the corridor is located is sprinklered throughout.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating required by Sentence  is permitted to be waived if the floor area in which the corridor is located is sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: The requirement for a fire separation stated in Sentence 3.3.2.6. is permitted to be waived if the distance from any point in the floor area to an exit measured along the path of travel to the exit does not exceed the travel distance permitted by Article 3.4.2.5.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence  is permitted to be waived if the distance from any point in the floor area to an exit measured along the path of travel to an exit does not exceed the travel distance permitted by Article 3.4.2.5.

National Sentence Text: A door equipped with a latching mechanism in an access to exit from a room or suite of assembly occupancy containing an occupant load more than 100 shall be equipped with a device that will release the latch and allow the door to swing wide open when a force not more than that specified in Sentence 3.8.3.6. is applied to the device in the direction of travel to the exit.
P/T Sentence Text: A door equipped with a latching mechanism in an access to exit from a room or suite of assembly occupancy containing an occupant load more than 100 shall be equipped with a device that will release the latch and allow the door to swing wide open when a force not more than that specified in Sentence 3.8.3.3. is applied to the device in the direction of travel to the exit.

National Sentence Text: Handrails shall be provided in aisles with steps in conformance with Table 3.3.2.10.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.2.8A. Handrails in Aisles with Steps (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails shall be provided in aisles with steps in conformance with Table 3.3.2.8A.

National Sentence Text: A Group A, Division 4 occupancy and each tier or balcony that has a capacity of more than 1 000 persons shall have not less than 3 separate exits , or 4 000 persons shall have not less than 4 separate exits .
P/T Sentence Text: A Group A, Division 4 occupancy and each tier or balcony that has a capacity of more than, 1 000 persons shall have no fewer than three separate exits, or 4 000 persons shall have no fewer than four separate exits.

National Sentence Text: If the vertical distance between seating platforms in bleachers is more than 450 mm, 2 intermediate steps shall be provided the full width of the aisle so that there are 3 equal risers between platforms.
P/T Sentence Text: If the vertical distance between seating platforms in bleachers is more than 450 mm, two intermediate steps shall be provided the full width of the aisle so that there are three equal risers between platforms.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.13.(2), a library book storage room that is not normally accessible to the public shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h if it is more than 250 m2 in area, or contains book stacks that are more than 10 m high, or penetrate more than one floor assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , a library book storage room that is not normally accessible to the public shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h if it, is more than 250 m2 in area, or contains book stacks that, are more than 10 m high, or penetrate more than one floor assembly.

National Sentence Text: The fire separation referred to in Sentence 3.3.2.14. is not required between a stage and a seating area in a building that is sprinklered throughout, provided a sprinkler deluge system is installed at the boundary between the stage and the seating area.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation referred to in Sentence  is not required between a stage and a seating area in a floor area that is sprinklered, provided a sprinkler deluge system is installed at the boundary between the stage and the seating area.

National Article Title: Separations between Care, Treatment or Detention Occupancies
National Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.5.5. between a care, treatment or detention occupancy and a repair garage shall have no openings.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.5.5. between a care, care and treatment or detention occupancy and a repair garage shall have no openings.

National Sentence Text: The travel distance from any point within each fire compartment referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5. to a door to an adjoining fire compartment shall be not more than 45 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The travel distance from any point within each fire compartment referred to in Sentence  to a door to an adjoining fire compartment shall be not more than 45 m.

National Sentence Text: Each fire compartment referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5. shall be capable of accommodating, in addition to its own occupants, the occupants of the largest adjacent fire compartment based on a clear floor space of 2.5 m2 per patient in the adjacent fire compartment.
P/T Sentence Text: Each fire compartment referred to in Sentence  shall be capable of accommodating, in addition to its own occupants, the occupants of the largest adjacent fire compartment based on a clear floor space of 2.5 m2 per patient or resident in the adjacent fire compartment.

National Sentence Text: A door in a fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.3.5. is permitted to be equipped with a roller latch.
P/T Sentence Text: A door in a fire separation required by Sentence  is permitted to be equipped with a roller latch.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(13), a fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.3.5. shall not have any grilles, louvres or other openings.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire separation required by Sentence  shall not contain any grilles, louvres or other openings.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.3.7.(4), a building that includes a contained use area shall be sprinklered throughout.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , a building that includes a contained use area shall be sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.4.3.(3), a storage room referred to in Sentence 3.3.4.3. shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , a storage room referred to in Sentence  shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: A single exit is permitted from a dwelling unit provided the exit is an exterior doorway not more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level and it is not necessary to travel up or down more than one storey to reach the exit door, or the uppermost floor level opens to a balcony not more than 6 m above adjacent ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: A single exit is permitted from a dwelling unit provided the exit is an exterior doorway not more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level and, it is not necessary to travel up or down more than 1 storey to reach the exit door, or the uppermost floor level opens to a balcony not more than 6 m above adjacent ground level.

National Article Title: Stairs, Ramps, Landings, Handrails and Guards for Dwelling
National Sentence Text: Exterior stairs, ramps, landings, handrails and guards serving a single dwelling unit, and loads on guards serving not more than two dwelling units, shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Section 9.8.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.4.7. Stairs, Ramps, Landings, Handrails and Guards for
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , exterior stairs, ramps, landings, handrails and guards serving a single dwelling unit shall conform to the applicable requirements in Section 9.8. and Sentence 3.1.20.1.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.4.8.(2), openable windows in suites of residential occupancy shall be protected by a guard with a minimum height of 1 070 mm constructed in accordance with Article 3.3.1.18., or a mechanism capable of controlling the free swinging or sliding of the openable part of the window so as to limit any clear unobstructed opening to not more than 100 mm measured either vertically or horizontally where the other dimension is greater than 380 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided by Sentence , openable windows in suites of residential occupancy shall be protected by, a guard with a minimum height of 1 070 mm constructed in accordance with Article 3.3.1.17., or a mechanism capable of controlling the free swinging or sliding of the openable part of the window so as to limit any clear unobstructed opening to a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Basements and rooms referred to in Sentence 3.3.5.3. shall be separated from the remainder of the building with a vapour-tight separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Basements and rooms referred to in Sentence  shall be separated from the remainder of the building with a vapour-tight separation.

National Sentence Text: If access is provided from a storage garage to a stair tower or elevator serving occupancies above the level of the storage garage, the access shall be through a vestibule conforming to Sentence 3.3.5.7.(4).
P/T Article Title: 3.3.5.4. Repair and Storage Garages (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: If access is provided from a storage garage to a stair tower or elevator serving occupancies above the level of the storage garage, the access shall be through a vestibule conforming to Sentence 3.3.5.7.(3).

National Sentence Text: The clear height in a storage garage shall be not less than 2 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.8.2.2.(2), the clear height in a storage garage shall be not less than 2 m

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.5.7.(2), if access is provided through a fire separation between a storage garage and a Group A, Division 1 or Group B occupancy, the access shall be through a vestibule conforming to Sentence 3.3.5.7.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: If access is provided through a fire separation between a storage garage and a Group A, Division 1 or Group B occupancy or a retirement home, the access shall be through a vestibule conforming to Sentence .

National Sentence Text: In a building more than 3 storeys in building height, access through a fire separation between a storage garage and a Group A, Division 2, 3 or 4, or a Group C occupancy, shall be through a vestibule conforming to Sentence 3.3.5.7.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: In a building more than 3 storeys in building height, access through a fire separation between a storage garage and a Group A, Division 2, 3 or 4, or a Group C occupancy, shall be through a vestibule conforming to Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Except where they serve storage garages, guards in industrial occupancies are permitted to consist of a top railing, and one or more intermediate rails spaced such that openings through the guard are of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is 535 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Guards in industrial occupancies, other than guards in storage garages, are permitted to consist of,  a top rail, and  one or more intermediate rails spaced such that the openings through the guard are of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 535 mm.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to design and fire protection requirements for buildings or parts thereof used for the storage, handling, use and processing of dangerous goods, including flammable liquids and combustible liquids, in quantities in excess of those identified in Table 3.2.7.1. of Division B of the NFC. (See Note A-3.3.6.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to design and fire protection requirements for buildings or parts of buildings intended for the storage, handling, use and processing of, dangerous goods, materials that involve a risk of explosion or high flammability, and materials that are highly reactive.

National Sentence Text: Solid and liquid dangerous goods classified as oxidizers or organic peroxides shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: A room intended for the storage of solid and liquid dangerous goods classified as oxidizers or organic peroxides shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: The design of buildings or parts thereof used for the storage of dangerous goods classified as explosives shall conform to the NRCan R.S.C., 1985, c. E-17 Explosives Act and its Regulations, published by Natural Resources Canada.
P/T Sentence Text: The design and construction of a building or part of a building intended for the storage of dangerous goods classified as explosives shall conform to the Explosives Act  and the regulations made under that Act.

National Article Title: Storage and Dispensing Rooms for Flammable Liquids and Combustible
National Sentence Text: Where Class IA or IB liquids specified in Subsection 4.1.2. of Division B of the NFC are dispensed within a storage room, the room shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in NFPA 68-2013 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting (See Note A-3.3.6.4.(2).)
P/T Article Title: 3.3.6.4. Storage and Dispensing Rooms for Flammable Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided by Sentences  and , a room intended for the storage or dispensing of Class IA or Class IB liquids in open containers shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in accordance with good engineering practice, such as that described in NFPA 68, "Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Floors in areas where dangerous goods are stored shall be constructed of impermeable materials to prevent the absorption of chemicals.
P/T Sentence Text: The floor in an area intended for the storage of dangerous goods shall be constructed of impermeable materials to prevent the absorption of chemicals.

National Sentence Text: In process plants, areas where unstable liquids are handled or where small-scale unit chemical processes occur shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: In a process plant, an area intended as a location where unstable liquids are handled or small scale unit chemical processes occur shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Process plants where Class I and II flammable liquids and combustible liquids are handled shall not be constructed with basements or covered pits.
P/T Sentence Text: A process plant intended as a location where Class I and Class II liquids are handled shall not contain a basement or a covered pit.

National Sentence Text: An air-supported structure shall not be located above the first storey on any building.
Combustible sprinkler piping is permitted to penetrate a fire separation provided the fire compartments on each side of the fire separation are sprinklered.

National Article Title: Storage and Process Equipment Located Outdoors
National Sentence Text: Location of outdoor storage and outdoor process equipment in relation to buildings shall conform to Parts 3 and 4 of Division B of the NFC.

Smoke detectors need not be installed in sleeping rooms and in corridors serving the sleeping rooms within a suite of care occupancy where smoke alarms are installed in accordance with Article 3.2.4.20.
Where a fire alarm system is installed, a manually operated fire alarm station shall be installed on the roof at each exit from a helicopter landing area.
Hose connections are not required within a floor area.
Hose stations for 38 mm diam hose shall be installed for a standpipe system in a building that is not sprinklered throughout.
Hose stations shall be located in the floor area within 5 m of exits and at other locations to provide coverage of the entire floor area.
An exit opening into an interconnected floor space shall conform to Sentence 3.4.3.2.(6).

A draft stop shall be provided at each floor level within an interconnected floor space, immediately adjacent to and surrounding the opening, and shall be not less than 500 mm deep measured from ceiling level down to the underside of the draft stop.

An interconnected floor space shall be designed so that the combustible contents, excluding interior finishes, in those parts of a floor area in which the ceiling is more than 8 m above the floor, are limited to not more than 16 g of combustible material for each cubic metre of volume of the interconnected floor space.
Facilities for the dispensing of fuel having a flash point below 37.8°C shall not be installed above any space intended for occupancy.

Except as provided in Sentence 3.9.3.1. or unless the building is sprinklered throughout, each individual tenancy in a multiple tenant self storage warehouse classified as an industrial occupancy shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.
Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.1.2.(2), if more than one exit is required from a floor area, each exit shall be separate from every other exit leading from that floor area.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , if more than one exit is required from a floor area, each exit shall be separate from every other exit leading from that floor area.

National Sentence Text: If more than 2 exits are provided from a floor area, exits are permitted to converge in conformance with Sentence 3.4.3.1.(2), provided the cumulative capacity of the converging exits does not contribute more than 50% of the total required exit width for the floor area.
P/T Sentence Text: If more than two exits are provided from a floor area, exits are permitted to converge in conformance with Sentence 3.4.3.1.(2), provided the cumulative capacity of the converging exits does not contribute more than 50% of the total required exit width for the floor area.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.1.(4), if Sentence 3.4.2.1. permits a single exit from a floor area classified as Group B or Group C occupancy, the exit shall be an exterior doorway not more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , if Sentence  permits a single exit from a floor area classified as Group B or Group C occupancy, the exit shall be an exterior doorway not more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.

National Sentence Text: The minimum distance between exits referred to in Sentence 3.4.2.3. shall be the shortest distance that smoke would have to travel between the exits, assuming that the smoke will not penetrate an intervening fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum distance between exits referred to in Sentence  shall be the shortest distance that smoke would have to travel between the exits, assuming that the smoke will not penetrate an intervening fire separation.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.4.(2), for the purposes of this Subsection, travel distance means the distance from any point in the floor area to an exit measured along the path of travel to the exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , for the purposes of this Subsection, travel distance means the distance from any point in the floor area to an exit measured along the path of travel to the exit.

National Sentence Text: Travel distance to an exit shall be not more than 50 m from any point in a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(8).
P/T Sentence Text: Travel distance to an exit shall be not more than 50 m from any point in a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(9).

National Sentence Text: Except for a high-hazard industrial occupancy, Sentence 3.4.2.5. need not apply if exits are placed along the perimeter of the floor area and are not more than 60 m apart, measured along the perimeter, provided each main aisle in the floor area leads directly to an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for a high hazard industrial occupancy, Sentence  need not apply if exits are placed along the perimeter of the floor area and are not more than 60 m apart, measured along the perimeter, provided each main aisle in the floor area leads directly to an exit.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Section, at least one door at every principal entrance to a building providing access from the exterior at ground level shall be designed in accordance with the requirements for exits.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Section, at least one door at every principal entrance from ground level shall be designed in accordance with the requirements for exits.

National Sentence Text: In a building that is not sprinklered throughout in accordance with Sentence 3.2.5.12.(1), the principal entrance serving a dance hall or a licensed beverage establishment with an occupant load more than 250 shall provide at least one half of the required exit width.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building that is not sprinklered in accordance with Sentence 3.2.5.13.(1), the principal entrance serving a dance hall or a licensed beverage establishment with an occupant load more than 250 shall provide at least one-half of the required exit width.

National Article Title: Exit Width Based on Occupant Load
National Sentence Text: For the purpose of determining the aggregate width of exits, the occupant load of every room or floor area shall be determined in conformance with Subsection 3.1.17.
P/T Article Title: 3.4.3.1. Exit Width Based on Occupant Load
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of determining the aggregate width of exits, the occupant load of every room or floor area shall be determined in conformance with Subsection 3.1.17.

National Article Title: Exit Width Based on Occupant Load
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.3.2.(4), the required exit width shall be cumulative if 2 or more exits converge.
P/T Article Title: 3.4.3.1. Exit Width Based on Occupant Load
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.3.2.(4), the required exit width shall be cumulative if two or more exits converge.

National Sentence Text: The minimum aggregate width of exits serving floor areas intended for a care, treatment or detention occupancy shall be determined by multiplying the occupant load of the area served by 18.4 mm per person.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum aggregate width of exits serving floor areas intended for a care, care and treatment or detention occupancy shall be determined by multiplying the occupant load of the area served by 18.4 mm per person.

National Sentence Text: The clear height of stairways shall be measured vertically over the clear width of the stairway, from the straight line tangent to the tread and landing nosings to the lowest element above. (See Note A-9.8.7.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: The clear height of stairways shall be measured vertically, over the clear width of the stairway, from a straight line tangent to the tread and landing nosings to the lowest point above, and shall not be less than 2 050 mm.

National Sentence Text: The clear height of landings shall be measured within the clear width of the landing vertically to the lowest element above.
P/T Sentence Text: The clear height of landings shall be measured vertically, over the clear width of the landing, to the lowest point above.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation referred to in Sentence 3.4.4.1. need not be more than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation referred to in Sentence  need not be more than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Service spaces referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1. shall not open directly into an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Service spaces referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1. shall not open directly into an exit.

National Article Title: Slip Resistance of Ramps and Stairs
National Sentence Text: Treads and landings of exterior exit stairs more than 10 m high shall be designed to be free of ice and snow accumulations.
P/T Article Title: 3.4.6.1. Surface Finish of Ramps and Stairs
P/T Sentence Text: Treads and landings of exterior exit stairs shall be designed to be free of ice and snow accumulations if the stairs,  are more than 10 m high, or  serve a hotel.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.15.(1), every flight of interior stairs shall have not less than 3 risers.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.13.(1), every flight of interior stairs shall have no fewer than 3 risers.

National Article Title: Maximum Vertical Rise of Stair Flights and Required Landings
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.4.6.3.(3), a landing shall be provided at the top and bottom of each flight of interior and exterior stairs, at the top and bottom of every section of ramp, where a doorway opens onto a stair or ramp, where a ramp opens onto a stair, and where a stair opens onto a ramp.
P/T Article Title: 3.4.6.3. Maximum Vertical Rise of Stair Flights and Required
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided by Sentence , a landing shall be provided, at the top and bottom of each flight of interior and exterior stairs, at the top and bottom of every section of ramp, where a doorway opens onto a stair or ramp, where a ramp opens onto a stair, and where a stair opens onto a ramp.

National Sentence Text: Where a doorway or stairway empties onto a ramp through a side wall, there shall be a level area extending across the full width of the ramp, and for a distance of 300 mm on either side of the wall opening, except one side if it abuts on an end wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a doorway or stair empties onto a ramp through a side wall, there shall be a level area extending across the full width of the ramp, and for a distance of 300 mm on either side of the wall opening, except one side if it abuts on an end wall.

National Sentence Text: Where a doorway or stairway empties onto a ramp through an end wall, there shall be a level area extending across the full width of the ramp and along its length for not less than 900 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a doorway or stair empties onto a ramp through an end wall, there shall be a level area extending across the full width of the ramp and along its length for not less than 900 mm.

National Sentence Text: One handrail shall be provided on stairs that are less than 1 100 mm in width.
P/T Sentence Text: At least one handrail shall be provided on straight flights that are less than 1 100 mm in width.

National Sentence Text: Handrails shall be continuously graspable along their entire length, be free of any sharp or abrasive elements, and have a circular cross-section with an outside diameter not less than 30 mm and not more than 43 mm, or a non-circular cross-section with a perimeter not less than 100 mm and not more than 125 mm and whose largest cross-sectional dimension is not more than 45 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails shall be continuously graspable along their entire length, shall be free of any sharp or abrasive elements, and shall have, a circular cross-section with an outside diameter not less than 30 mm and not more than 43 mm, or any non-circular cross-section with a perimeter not less than 100 mm and not more than 125 mm and whose largest cross-sectional dimension is not more than 45 mm.

National Sentence Text: The height of handrails on stairs, on aisles with steps and on ramps shall be measured vertically from the top of the handrail to a straight line drawn tangent to the tread nosings of the stair or aisle step served by the handrail (see Note A-9.8.7.4.), or the surface of the ramp, floor or landing served by the handrail.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of handrails on stairs, on aisles with steps and on ramps shall be measured vertically from the top of the handrail to, a straight line drawn tangent to the tread nosings of the stair served by the handrail, or the surface of the ramp, floor or landing served by the handrail.

National Sentence Text: Handrails installed in addition to required handrails need not comply with Sentence 3.4.6.5.(7).
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails installed in addition to required handrails need not comply with Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Except where interrupted by doorways, at least one handrail shall be continuous throughout the length of a stairway or ramp, including at landings. (See Note A-3.4.6.5.(10).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence  and except where interrupted by doorways or newels at changes in direction, at least one handrail shall be continuous throughout the length of a stair or ramp, including at landings. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Handrails shall be terminated in a manner that will not obstruct pedestrian travel or create a hazard. (See Note A-3.4.6.5.(10).)
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails shall be terminated in a manner that will not obstruct pedestrian travel or create a hazard.

National Sentence Text: At least one handrail at the side of a stairway or ramp shall extend horizontally not less than 300 mm beyond the top and bottom of the stairway or ramp. (See Note A-3.4.6.5.(10).)
P/T Sentence Text: At least one handrail shall, in the case of a stair, extend horizontally at the required height, not less than 300 mm beyond the top riser, and continue to slope for a depth of one tread beyond the bottom riser followed by a 300 mm horizontal extension, and in the case of a ramp, extend horizontally at the required height, not less than 300 mm beyond the top and bottom edges of the incline.

National Sentence Text: The clearance between a handrail and any surface behind it shall be not less than 50 mm, or 60 mm if the surface behind the handrail is rough or abrasive.
P/T Sentence Text: The clearance between a handrail and any surface behind it shall be not less than, 60 mm, if the surface behind the handrail is rough or abrasive, or 50 mm, in all other cases.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.4.6.6.(4), the height of guards for exit stairs and exit ramps as well as their landings shall be not less than 1 070 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence , the height of guards for exit stairs and exit ramps, as well as their landings, shall be not less than 1 070 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted for dwelling units and by Sentence 3.4.7.5. for fire escapes, steps for stairs shall have a run of not less than 280 mm between successive steps.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted for dwelling units and by Sentence 3.4.7.5. for fire escapes, steps in flights shall have a run of not less than 280 mm and not more than 355 mm between successive steps.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.3.4.7. and except for fire escape stairs, stairs that are principally used for maintenance and service, and stairs that serve industrial occupancies other than storage garages, steps for stairs shall have no open risers.
P/T Sentence Text: Steps in flights shall have no open risers,  except as provided in Article 3.3.4.7., and  except for the following stairs:  fire escape stairs,  stairs that are principally used for maintenance and service, and  stairs that serve industrial occupancies other than storage garages.

National Sentence Text: Treads and risers shall not differ significantly in run and rise in successive flights in any stair system.
P/T Sentence Text: Treads and risers shall not differ significantly in run and rise in successive flights in any stair system. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The slope of treads or landings shall not exceed 1 in 50.
P/T Sentence Text: The slope on treads or landings shall not exceed 1 in 50.

National Sentence Text: The floor area on each side of a horizontal exit shall be sufficient to accommodate the occupants of both floor areas, allowing not less than 0.5 m2 of clear floor space per person, except that 1.5 m2 shall be provided for each person in a wheelchair and 2.5 m2 for each bedridden patient.
P/T Sentence Text: Except in an elementary or secondary school that is subdivided by a firewall, the floor area on each side of a horizontal exit shall be sufficient to accommodate the occupants of both floor areas, allowing not less than 0.5 m2 of clear floor space per person, except that 1.5 m2 shall be provided for each person in a wheelchair and 2.5 m2 for each patient in bed.

National Sentence Text: No stairs or steps shall be used in a horizontal exit.
P/T Sentence Text: No stairs or steps shall be used at a horizontal exit.

National Sentence Text: No door leaf in an exit doorway with more than one leaf shall be less than 610 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: No door leaf in an exit doorway with more than one leaf shall be less than 600 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Where an exit door leading directly to the outside is subject to being obstructed by parked vehicles or storage because of its location, a visible sign or a physical barrier prohibiting such obstructions shall be installed on the exterior side of the door.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exit door leading directly to the outside is subject to being obstructed by a parked vehicle or storage because of its location, a visible sign prohibiting such obstructions shall be permanently mounted on the exterior side of the door.

National Sentence Text: An exit door serving a Group B, Division 1 occupancy, or an impeded egress zone in other occupancies, is permitted to be a sliding door that does not conform to Sentence 3.3.1.12. provided it is designed to be released in conformance with Article 3.3.1.13.
P/T Sentence Text: An exit door serving a Group B, Division 1 occupancy, or an impeded egress zone in other occupancies, is permitted to be a sliding door that does not conform to Sentence 3.3.1.11. provided it is designed to be released in conformance with Article 3.3.1.12.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.6.15.(3), a revolving door shall not be considered to have an exiting capacity for more than 45 persons.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , a revolving door shall not be considered to have an exiting capacity for more than 45 persons.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.8.3.6.(8), every exit door shall be designed and installed so that, when the latch is released, the door will open under a force of not more than 90 N, applied at the knob or other latch releasing device.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.8.3.3.(7), every exit door shall be designed and installed so that, when the latch is released, the door will open under a force of not more than 90 N, applied at the knob or other latch releasing device.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.4.6.18.(2), doors providing access to floor areas from exit stairs shall not have locking devices to prevent entry into any floor area from which the travel distance up or down to an unlocked door is more than 2 storeys.
P/T Article Title: 3.4.6.18. Emergency Crossover Access to Floor Areas
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , doors providing access to floor areas from exit stairs shall not have locking devices to prevent entry into any floor area from which the travel distance up or down to an unlocked door is more than 2 storeys.

National Sentence Text: Locked doors intended to prevent entry into a floor area from an exit stair shall be identified by a sign on the stairway side to indicate the location of the nearest unlocked door in each direction of travel, and be openable with a master key that fits all locking devices and is kept in a designated location accessible to firefighters or be provided with a wired glass panel not less than 0.0645 m2 in area and located not more than 300 mm from the door opening hardware.
P/T Article Title: 3.4.6.18. Emergency Crossover Access to Floor Areas
P/T Sentence Text: Locked doors intended to prevent entry into a floor area from an exit stair shall, be identified by a permanently mounted sign on the stair side to indicate the location of the nearest unlocked door in each direction of travel, and be openable with a master key that fits all locking devices and is kept in a designated location accessible to firefighters or be provided with a wired glass panel not less than 0.0645 m2 in area and located not more than 300 mm from the door opening hardware.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.7.1.(2), fire escapes shall not be erected on a building.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , fire escapes shall not be erected on a building.

National Sentence Text: If a fire escape serves any storey above the second, openings located in a zone described in Sentence 3.4.7.4.(2), including access doorways in the exterior walls of the building to which the fire escape is attached, shall be protected by closures conforming to Subsection 3.1.8.
P/T Sentence Text: If a fire escape serves any storey above the second, openings located in a zone described in Sentence , including access doorways in the exterior walls of the building to which the fire escape is attached, shall be protected by closures conforming to Subsection 3.1.8.

National Sentence Text: If a flight of stairs leading to the ground at the foot of a fire escape is not fixed in position, it shall be held in the raised position without a latch or locking device, and shall be fitted with a counterbalancing device that will permit it to be easily and quickly brought into position for use.
P/T Sentence Text: If a flight leading to the ground at the foot of a fire escape is not fixed in position, it shall,  be held in the raised position without a latch or locking device,  be fitted with a counterbalancing device,  be easily and quickly brought into position for use, and  reach the ground in the lowered position.

National Sentence Text: The top rail of a guard is permitted to serve as a handrail if it is free from obstructions which could break a handhold.
P/T Sentence Text: The top rail of a guard is permitted to serve as a handrail if it is free from obstructions that could break a handhold.

National Sentence Text: Unless it can be shown that the location and size of an opening do not present a hazard, a guard for a fire escape shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above a platform or the nosing of any tread will facilitate climbing.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings do not present a hazard, a guard for a fire escape shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above a platform or the nosing of any tread will facilitate climbing.

National Sentence Text: Passenger elevators, other than those provided for firefighters in accordance with Article 3.2.6.5., are permitted to be located within interconnected floor space without being enclosed in a hoistway separated from the remainder of the building, provided the elevator machinery is located in a room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for hoistways by Sentence 3.5.3.1.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Passenger elevators, other than those provided for firefighters in accordance with Article 3.2.6.5., are permitted to be located within or adjacent to the opening of an interconnected floor space protected in conformance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.11., Sentences 3.2.8.2. and  without being enclosed in a hoistway separated from the remainder of the interconnected floor space provided the elevator machinery is located in a room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation whose fire-resistance rating is not less than that required for hoistways by Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Electrical equipment that is required to be located in a service room according to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I shall be installed in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical equipment that is required to be located in a service room by a regulation made under the Electricity Act, 1998, shall be installed in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Where a service room contains a limited quantity of service equipment, and the service equipment neither constitutes a fire hazard nor is essential to the operation of fire safety systems in the building, the requirements for a fire separation shall not apply.
P/T Sentence Text: If a service room referred to in Sentence  contains a limited quantity of service equipment, and the service equipment neither constitutes a fire hazard nor is essential to the operation of fire safety systems in the building, the requirements for a fire separation shall not apply.

National Sentence Text: If a building is sprinklered throughout, an electrical equipment vault referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7. need not be sprinklered provided the vault is designed for no purpose other than to contain the electrical equipment, and the vault contains a smoke detector which will actuate the building fire alarm system in the event of a fire in the vault.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a building is required to be sprinklered, the electrical equipment vault described in Sentence  need not be sprinklered provided, the vault is designed for no purpose other than to contain the electrical equipment, and a smoke detector is provided in the vault that will actuate the building fire alarm system in the event of a fire in the vault.

National Sentence Text: Explosion-relief devices and vents or other protective measures conforming to Sentence 3.3.1.20. shall be provided for an electrical equipment vault referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7. that contains dielectric-liquid-filled electrical equipment. (See Note A-3.6.2.7.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Explosion-relief devices and vents or other protective measures shall be provided for every electrical equipment vault containing dielectric liquid filled electrical equipment in conformance with Sentence 3.3.1.19.(4).

National Sentence Text: Foamed plastic insulation in a vertical service space shall be protected in conformance with Article 3.1.5.14.
P/T Sentence Text: Foamed plastic insulation in a vertical service space shall be protected in conformance with Article 3.1.5.12A.

National Sentence Text: A horizontal service space, consisting of ceiling and duct spaces, which is more than 1 200 mm high and 600 mm wide shall have inspection doors not less than 300 mm in both horizontal and vertical dimensions placed so that the entire interior of the duct or space can be viewed.
P/T Sentence Text: A horizontal service space, consisting of ceiling and duct spaces, that is more than 1 200 mm high and 600 mm wide shall have inspection doors not less than 300 mm in both horizontal and vertical dimensions placed so that the entire interior of the duct or space can be viewed.

National Sentence Text: Exits shall be located and arranged so that they are clearly visible or their locations are clearly indicated and they are accessible at all times.
Platforms for a fire escape shall be provided in conformance with the requirements for stair landings in Articles 3.4.6.3.and 3.4.6.4.
The unobstructed height in dwelling units shall conform to Subsection 9.5.3.
P/T Sentence Text: The unobstructed height in dwelling units and sleeping rooms in Group C occupancies shall conform to Subsection 9.5.3.

National Sentence Text: Urinals are permitted to be substituted for two thirds of the number of water closets required by this Article for males, except that if only 2 water closets are required for males, one urinal is permitted to be substituted for one of the water closets.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , urinals are permitted to be substituted for water closets required by this Subsection for males and may be counted as water closets provided the number of urinals is not more than,  one-fifth of the required number of water closets in hospitals and long-term care homes, and  two-thirds of the required number of water closets in any other occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Urinals are permitted to be substituted for two thirds of the number of water closets required by this Article for males, except that if only 2 water closets are required for males, one urinal is permitted to be substituted for one of the water closets.
P/T Sentence Text: If only two water closets are required for males, one urinal is permitted to be substituted for one of the water closets.

National Sentence Text: Wash fountains in circular form are permitted to be provided in lieu of lavatories required by Sentence 3.7.2.3. provided each 500 mm of circumference is considered to be the equivalent of one lavatory.
P/T Sentence Text: Wash fountains in circular or straight trough form are permitted to be provided in lieu of required lavatories provided each 500 mm of circumference or trough length is considered to be the equivalent of one lavatory.

National Sentence Text: The number of water closets required for primary schools and daycare centres shall be at least one for each 30 males and one for each 25 females.
P/T Sentence Text: In a child care facility the maximum number of children per water closet and lavatory shall conform to Table 3.7.4.3.I.

National Sentence Text: The number of water closets required for primary schools and daycare centres shall be at least one for each 30 males and one for each 25 females.
P/T Sentence Text: The number of water closets required for elementary and secondary schools shall be at least one fixture for each 30 males and one fixture for each 26 females.

National Sentence Text: The number of water closets required for places of worship and undertaking premises shall be at least one for each 150 persons of each sex.
P/T Sentence Text: The number of water closets required for places of worship and undertaking premises shall be at least one fixture for each 150 persons of each sex.

National Sentence Text: The number of water closets required for a treatment or detention occupancy shall be determined on the basis of the special needs of the occupancy.
P/T Article Title: 3.7.4.4. Plumbing Fixtures for Care, Care and Treatment or
P/T Sentence Text: The number of water closets and lavatories required for Group B, Division 1 occupancies shall be determined on the basis of the special needs of these occupancies.

National Sentence Text: At least one water closet shall be provided for each dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: A dwelling unit where a piped water supply is available shall be provided with a,  kitchen sink,  lavatory,  water closet or drainless composting water closet, and  bathtub or shower stall.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.7.2.2.(4), the number of water closets required for a business and personal services occupancy shall conform to Table 3.7.2.2.-B.
P/T Article Title: 3.7.4.7. Plumbing Fixtures for Business and Personal Services
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the number of water closets required for business and personal services occupancies shall conform to Table 3.7.4.7.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.7.2.2.(4), the number of water closets required for an industrial occupancy shall conform to Table 3.7.2.2.-C.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the number of water closets and lavatories required for industrial occupancies shall conform to Table 3.7.4.9.

National Sentence Text: If mobile homes do not have individual sanitary facilities connected to a central water supply and drainage system, a service building shall be provided for public use.
P/T Article Title: 3.7.4.10. Plumbing Fixtures for Mobile Home Facilities
P/T Sentence Text: If mobile homes do not have individual plumbing facilities connected to a central water supply and drainage system, a service building shall be provided for public use.

National Sentence Text: The service building required by Sentence 3.7.2.4. shall contain at least one water closet for each sex if the service building facilities serve not more than 10 mobile homes, and an additional water closet for each sex for each additional 10 mobile homes.
P/T Article Title: 3.7.4.10. Plumbing Fixtures for Mobile Home Facilities
P/T Sentence Text: The service building required by Sentence  shall contain,  at least one water closet for each sex if the service building facilities serve not more than 10 mobile homes, and  an additional water closet for each sex for each additional 10 mobile homes.

National Sentence Text: If a service building is required by Sentence 3.7.2.4.(1), it shall contain lavatories as required by Sentence 3.7.2.3. and at least one laundry tray or similar facility, and one bathtub or shower for each sex.
P/T Article Title: 3.7.4.10. Plumbing Fixtures for Mobile Home Facilities
P/T Sentence Text: If a service building is required by Sentence  it shall contain lavatories as required by Sentence 3.7.4.2. and at least, one laundry tray or similar facility, and one bathtub or shower for each sex.

National Sentence Text: Floor surfaces around a water closet shall be protected from deterioration by an impervious and durable material for a distance not less than 900 mm from the projected outline of the water closet on the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor surfaces around a water closet shall be protected from deterioration by impervious and durable material for a distance not less than 900 mm from the projected outline of the water closet on to the floor.

National Sentence Text: A floor drain shall be installed in a washroom containing a urinal equipped with an automatic flushing device.
P/T Sentence Text: A floor drain shall be installed in a washroom for public use that contains a urinal or a water closet equipped with an automatic flushing device. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: A suite of assembly occupancy, business and personal services occupancy or mercantile occupancy that is located in the first storey of a building, or in a storey to which a barrier-free path of travel is provided, and that is completely separated from the remainder of the building so that there is no access to the remainder of the building, shall have at least one barrier-free entrance.
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to the barrier-free entrances required by Sentence , a suite of assembly occupancy, business and personal services occupancy or mercantile occupancy that is located in the first storey of a building or in a storey to which a barrier-free path of travel is provided, and that is separated from the remainder of the building so that there is no access to the remainder of the building, shall have at least one barrier-free entrance.

National Sentence Text: At a barrier-free entrance that includes more than one doorway, only one of the doorways is required to be designed in accordance with Subsection 3.8.3.
P/T Sentence Text: At a barrier-free entrance that includes more than one doorway, only one of the doorways is required to be designed in accordance with Article 3.8.3.3.

National Sentence Text: Except as required elsewhere in this Part or as permitted by Article 3.8.3.6. pertaining to doorways, the unobstructed width of a barrier-free path of travel shall be not less than 920 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence  and except as permitted in Subsection 3.8.3., every barrier-free path of travel shall provide an unobstructed width of at least 1 100 mm for the passage of wheelchairs.

National Sentence Text: Where a washroom is not designed to accommodate persons with physical disabilities in a storey to which a barrier-free path of travel is required, signs shall be provided to indicate the location of barrier-free facilities.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a washroom is not designed to accommodate persons with disabilities in a storey that is required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel, signs shall be provided to indicate the location of a washroom required to be barrier-free.

National Sentence Text: Every doorway that is located in a barrier-free path of travel shall have a clear width not less than 800 mm when the door is in the open position. (See Note A-3.8.3.6.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Every doorway that is located in a barrier-free path of travel shall have a clear width of not less than 860 mm when the door is in the open position. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Floors or walks in a barrier-free path of travel having a slope steeper than 1 in 20 shall be designed as ramps.
P/T Sentence Text: Floors or walks in a barrier-free path of travel having a slope steeper than 1 in 20 shall be designed as ramps. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: In a building of assembly occupancy, all classrooms, auditoria, meeting rooms and theatres with an area of more than 100 m2 shall be equipped with an assistive listening system complying with Subsection 3.8.3.
P/T Sentence Text: In buildings of assembly occupancy, all classrooms, auditoria, meeting rooms and theatres with an area of more than 100 m2 and an occupant load of more than 75 shall be equipped with assistive listening systems encompassing the entire seating area. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Mirrors required by Sentence 3.8.2.8. shall be mounted with their bottom edge not more than 1 000 mm above the floor, or fixed in an inclined position so as to be usable by a person in a wheelchair.
P/T Sentence Text: If mirrors are installed in a washroom described in Sentence 3.8.2.3.(2),  or , at least one mirror shall be, installed above a lavatory required by Sentence , and mounted with its bottom edge not more than 1 000 mm above the finished floor or inclined to the vertical to be usable by a person in a wheelchair.

National Sentence Text: Any shelf or projection above a lavatory shall be located so that it will not be a hazard.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a shelf is installed above a lavatory required by Sentence , it shall, be located not more than 200 mm above the top of the lavatory and not more than 1 100 mm above the finished floor, and project not more than 100 mm from the wall.

National Sentence Text: Where drinking fountains are provided, at least one shall comply with Subsection 3.8.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Where more than one drinking fountain is provided, at least one shall be a barrier-free fountain that conforms to Sentences  and .

National Sentence Text: Waterless urinals are permitted to be used in buildings provided with a water supply.

In a building whose floor area is more than 600 m2 and that includes one or more individual tenant spaces for a business and personal services occupancy or mercantile occupancy, water closets shall be located so that they are accessible to the public when the building is occupied.
Built-in shelves and counters provided for public telephones shall comply with Subsection 3.8.3.
A barrier-free washroom shall be provided with a lavatory that complies with Subsection 3.8.3.
Except where stated otherwise, this Article applies to swinging and sliding doors.
Self-service storage buildings shall be classified as Group F, Division 2 major occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: A self-service storage building,  shall comply with the requirements for a Group F, Division 2 major occupancy, and  shall not contain a Group F, Division 1 occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Not more than one dwelling unit is permitted to be contained within one of the self-service storage buildings on a property.
P/T Sentence Text: Not more than two dwelling units shall be contained within one of the buildings on the property.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.7.2.1.(1), two public washrooms, each containing a water closet and a lavatory, shall be provided within one of the self-service storage buildings on the property. (See Note A-3.9.3.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 3.7.4.1. and , two washrooms, each containing a water closet and a lavatory, shall be provided within one of the buildings on the property.

National Sentence Text: The distance between each group of self-service storage buildings shall be not less than 9 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the building area conforms to Clause 3.10.4.2.(1)(c),  the limiting distance requirements shall apply between each group of buildings, but not between individual buildings within a group, and  the distance between each group of buildings shall be not less than 9 m.

National Sentence Text: The ground enclosed by a tent or air-supported structure and not less than 3 m of ground outside the structure shall be cleared of all flammable material or vegetation that will spread fire.
P/T Sentence Text: The ground enclosed by a tent and for not less than 3 m outside of such structure shall be cleared of all flammable or combustible material or vegetation that will carry fire.

National Sentence Text: Cables on the ground in areas used by the public in a tent or air-supported structure shall be placed in trenches or protected by covers to prevent damage from traffic.
P/T Sentence Text: Cables on the ground in areas used by the public in a tent shall be placed in trenches or protected by covers to prevent damage from traffic.

National Sentence Text: An air-supported structure shall not be used for Groups B, C, or Group F, Division 1 major occupancies or for classrooms.
P/T Sentence Text: Air-supported structures shall not be used for Groups B, C or Group F, Division 1 major occupancies or for classrooms.

National Sentence Text: An air-supported structure shall be designed as open floor space without interior walls, mezzanines, intermediate floors or similar construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Air-supported structures may be designed with interior walls, mezzanines, or similar construction.

National Sentence Text: The ground enclosed by a tent or air-supported structure and not less than 3 m of ground outside the structure shall be cleared of all flammable material or vegetation that will spread fire.
P/T Sentence Text: The ground enclosed by an air-supported structure and for not less than 3 m outside of such structure shall be clear of all flammable or combustible material or vegetation that will carry fire.

National Sentence Text: An air-supported structure used as a place of assembly for more than 200 persons shall have either an automatic emergency engine-generator set capable of powering one blower continuously for 4 h, or a supplementary blower powered by an automatic internal combustion engine.
P/T Sentence Text: An air-supported structure designed for an assembly occupancy with an occupant load of more than 200 persons shall have either an automatic emergency engine-generator set capable of powering one blower continuously for 4 h, or a supplementary blower powered by an automatic internal combustion engine.

National Sentence Text: Cables on the ground in areas used by the public in a tent or air-supported structure shall be placed in trenches or protected by covers to prevent damage from traffic.
P/T Sentence Text: Cables on the ground in areas used by the public in an air-supported structure shall be placed in trenches or protected by covers to prevent damage from traffic.

National Sentence Text: Buildings and their structural members and connections, including formwork and falsework, shall be designed to have sufficient structural capacity and structural integrity to safely and effectively resist all loads, effects of loads and influences that may reasonably be expected, having regard to the expected service life of buildings, and shall in any case satisfy the requirements of this Section. (See Note A-4.1.1.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings and their structural members and connections including formwork and falsework shall be designed to have sufficient structural capacity and structural integrity to safely and effectively resist all loads, effects of loads and influences that may reasonably be expected, having regard to the expected service life of buildings, and shall in any case satisfy the requirements of this Section. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Precautions shall be taken during all phases of construction to ensure that the building is not damaged or distorted due to loads applied during construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Precautions shall be taken during all stages of construction to ensure that the building is not damaged or distorted due to loads applied during construction.

National Sentence Text: Other load combinations that must also be considered are the principal loads acting with the companion loads taken as zero.
P/T Sentence Text: Other load combinations that must also be considered are the principal loads acting with the companion loads taken as zero.

National Sentence Text: Where the effects due to lateral earth pressure, H, restraint effects from pre-stress, P, and imposed deformation, T, affect the structural safety, they shall be taken into account in the calculations, with load factors of 1.5, 1.0 and 1.25 assigned to H, P and T respectively. (See Note A-4.1.3.2.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the effects due to lateral earth pressure, H, restraint effects from pre-stress, P, and imposed deformation, T, affect the structural safety, they shall be taken into account in the calculations, with load factors of 1.5, 1.0 and 1.25 assigned to H, P and T respectively. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: A principal-load factor of 1.5 shall be applied to the weight of saturated soil used in load combination case 1 of Table 4.1.3.2.-A.
P/T Sentence Text: A principal-load factor of 1.5 shall be applied to the weight of saturated soil used in load combination case 1 of Table 4.1.3.2.A.

National Sentence Text: Earthquake load, E, in load combination cases 5 of Table 4.1.3.2.-A and 6 of Table 4.1.3.2.-B includes horizontal earth pressure due to earthquake determined in accordance with Sentence 4.1.8.16.(7).
