P/T Sentence Text: Underground ducts shall, be constructed and installed with a slope to provide interior drainage to all low points,  not be connected directly to a sewer, and  be installed and constructed of materials in conformance with ASHRAE Handbooks, SMACNA Manuals and the HRAI Digest.

National Sentence Text: Fire dampers shall conform to Article 3.1.8.10.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire dampers shall conform to the requirements of Subsection 3.1.8.

National Sentence Text: Air handling systems shall incorporate smoke detectors where and as required by Article 3.2.4.12.
P/T Sentence Text: Air handling systems shall incorporate smoke detector control where required by Article 3.2.4.13.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 6.3.2.10.(2), exhaust ducts of non-mechanical ventilating systems serving separate rooms or spaces shall not be combined.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , exhaust ducts of nonmechanical ventilating systems serving separate rooms or spaces shall not be combined.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 6.3.2.10. and except for self-contained systems serving individual dwelling units, exhaust ducts serving rooms containing residential cooking equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence  and except for self-contained systems serving individual dwelling units, exhaust ducts serving rooms containing residential cooking equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.

National Sentence Text: Where exhaust ducts containing air from conditioned spaces pass through or are adjacent to unconditioned spaces, the ducts shall be constructed to prevent condensation from forming on the inside or outside of the ducts.
P/T Sentence Text: Where exhaust ducts containing air from conditioned spaces pass through or are adjacent to unconditioned spaces, the ducts shall be constructed to prevent condensation from forming inside or outside of the ducts.

National Sentence Text: In a care or residential occupancy, air from one suite shall not be circulated to any other suite or to a public corridor.
P/T Sentence Text: In a residential occupancy, air from one suite shall not be circulated to any other suite or to a public corridor or public stairway.

National Sentence Text: Return-air systems shall comply with Article 3.6.5.8.
Where a ceiling space is used as a return-air plenum, the requirements of Article 3.6.4.3. shall apply.
Makeup air facilities required by Sentence 6.3.2.8. shall be interlocked with the exhaust devices they serve so that both operate together.
P/T Sentence Text: Make-up air facilities required by Sentence  shall be interlocked with the exhaust devices they serve so that both operate together.

National Sentence Text: Where makeup air facilities are intended to introduce air directly from the outdoors to occupied parts of the building in winter, they shall incorporate means of tempering that air to maintain the indoor design temperature.
P/T Sentence Text: Where make-up air facilities are intended to introduce air directly from the outdoors to occupied parts of the building in winter, they shall incorporate means of tempering that air to maintain the indoor design temperature.

National Article Title: Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
National Sentence Text: Supply, return and exhaust air openings located less than 2 m above the floor in rooms or spaces in buildings shall be protected by grilles having openings of a size that will not allow the passage of a 15 mm diam sphere.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.12. Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
P/T Sentence Text: Supply, return and exhaust air openings located less than 2 000 mm above the floor in rooms or spaces in buildings shall be protected by grilles having openings of a size that will not allow the passage of a 15 mm diameter sphere.

National Article Title: Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
National Sentence Text: Exterior openings for outdoor air intakes and exhaust outlets shall be shielded from the entry of snow and rain and shall be fitted with corrosion-resistant screens of mesh having openings not larger than 15 mm, except where experience has shown that climatic conditions require larger openings to prevent the screen openings from icing over.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.12. Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior openings for outdoor air intakes and exhaust outlets shall be shielded from the entry of snow and rain and shall be fitted with corrosion-resistant screens of mesh having openings not larger than 15 mm, except where experience has shown that climatic conditions require larger openings to avoid icing over of the screen openings.

National Article Title: Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
National Sentence Text: Screens required in Sentence 6.3.2.9. shall be accessible for maintenance.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.12. Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
P/T Sentence Text: Screens required in Sentence  shall be accessible for maintenance.

National Sentence Text: When electrostatic-type filters are used, they shall be installed so as to ensure that the electric circuit is automatically de-energized when filter access doors are opened or, in dwelling units, when the furnace circulation fan is not operating.
P/T Sentence Text: When electrostatic-type filters are used, they shall be installed so as to ensure that the electric circuit is automatically de-energized when filter access doors are opened and, in dwelling units, when the system circulating fan is not operating.

National Article Title: Evaporative Cooling Towers, Evaporative Fluid Coolers and Evaporative
National Sentence Text: Discharge from evaporative cooling towers to ventilation air intakes shall comply with Sentence 6.3.2.9.(2), and CSA CAN/CSA-Z317.2-10 Special Requirements for Heating, Ventilation, and Air-Conditioning  Systems in Health Care Facilities
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.14. Evaporative Cooling Towers, Evaporative Fluid Coolers
P/T Sentence Text: Discharge from evaporative cooling towers to ventilation air intakes shall comply with CAN/CSA-Z317.2, "Special Requirements for Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning  Systems in Health Care Facilities".

National Sentence Text: The filter and water evaporation medium of every air washer and evaporative air cooler enclosed within a building shall be made of noncombustible material.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.14A. Evaporative Cooling Sections, Evaporative Air Coolers, Misters, Atomizers, Air Washers andHumidifiers
P/T Sentence Text: The filter and water evaporation medium of every air washer and evaporative cooling section enclosed within a building shall be made of noncombustible material.

National Sentence Text: Sumps for air washers and evaporative air coolers shall be constructed and installed so that they can be flushed and drained.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.14A. Evaporative Cooling Sections, Evaporative Air Coolers,
P/T Sentence Text: Sumps for air washer and evaporative cooling sections shall be constructed and installed so that they can be flushed and drained.

National Sentence Text: The filter and water evaporation medium of every air washer and evaporative air cooler enclosed within a building shall be made of noncombustible material.

Fans for heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall be located and installed so that their operation does not adversely affect the draft required for proper operation of fuel-fired appliances, and does not allow the air in the duct system to be contaminated by air or gases from the boiler room or furnace room.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.15. Fans and Associated Air Handling Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: Fans for heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall be located and installed so that their operation,  does not adversely affect the draft required for proper operation of fuel-fired appliances, and  does not allow the air in the air duct system to be contaminated by air or gases from the boiler-room or furnaceroom.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the design, construction and installation of air duct distribution systems serving heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems other than those in dwelling units covered by Part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of this Subsection apply to the design, construction and installation of air duct distribution systems serving heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems that serve a house or an individual dwelling unit within the scope of Part 9.
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

National Sentence Text: Underground ducts shall be constructed and installed to provide interior drainage from and access to all low points, not be connected directly to a sewer, and be installed and constructed of materials recommended by ASHRAE and SMACNA Standards and HRAI Manuals.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.4.3. Construction and Installation of Ducts and Plenums
P/T Sentence Text: Underground ducts shall,  be constructed and installed with a slope to provide interior drainage to all low points,  not be connected directly to a sewer, and  be installed and constructed of materials in conformance with ASHRAE Handbooks, SMACNA Manuals and the HRAI Digest.
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

National Article Title: Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
National Sentence Text: Screens required in Sentence 6.3.2.9. shall be accessible for maintenance.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.4.13. Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
P/T Sentence Text: Screens required in Sentence  shall be accessible for maintenance.
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

National Sentence Text: When electrostatic-type filters are used, they shall be installed so as to ensure that the electric circuit is automatically de-energized when filter access doors are opened or, in dwelling units, when the furnace circulation fan is not operating.
P/T Sentence Text: When electrostatic-type filters are used, they shall be installed so as to ensure that the electric circuit is automatically de-energized when filter access doors are opened or when the system circulating fan is not operating.
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

National Sentence Text: Every unit heater using either steam or hot water as the heating medium shall be installed such that the clearances between the appliance and adjacent combustible material conform to Table 6.7.1.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Every unit heater using either steam or hot water as the heating medium shall be installed such that the clearances between the appliance and adjacent combustible material conform to Table 6.2.9.3.

National Sentence Text: No flame-spread rating or smoke developed classification limits are required for combustible insulation and coverings used on piping located within a concealed space in a wall, floor slab, or noncombustible enclosure.
P/T Sentence Text: No flame-spread rating or smoke developed classification limitations are required where combustible insulation and coverings are used on piping when such piping is,  located within a concealed space in a wall,  located in a floor slab, or  enclosed in a noncombustible raceway or conduit.
Variation Label: Piping for Heating and Cooling Systems

National Sentence Text: Clearances between combustible material and bare pipes carrying steam or hot water shall conform to Table 6.7.1.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Clearances between combustible material and bare pipes carrying steam or hot water shall conform to Table 6.2.9.3.
Variation Label: Piping for Heating and Cooling Systems

National Sentence Text: Unprotected steam or hot water pipes that pass through a storage space shall be covered with not less than 25 mm thickness of noncombustible insulation to prevent direct contact with the material stored.
P/T Sentence Text: Unprotected steam or hot water pipes that pass through a storage space shall be covered with not less than 25 mm of noncombustible insulation to prevent direct contact with the material stored.
Variation Label: Piping for Heating and Cooling Systems

National Sentence Text: Except for fuel-thawing pipes, every pipe designed to operate at a temperature of 50°C or above shall be located where solid fuel cannot be stored in contact with it.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for fuel-thawing pipes, every pipe designed to operate at a temperature of 50°C or above shall be located where fuel cannot be stored in contact with it.

National Sentence Text: A storage bin for solid fuel shall not be located above a sewer opening or drain opening.
P/T Sentence Text: A storage bin for solid fuel shall not be located above a sewer opening or drain opening

National Sentence Text: Storage bins for solid fuel shall be designed and constructed so that the air temperature in the bin or the surface temperature of any part of the floor or walls is below 50°C.
P/T Sentence Text: Storage bins for solid fuel shall be designed and constructed so that the air temperature in the bin or the surface temperature of any part of the floor or walls is below 50°C.

National Sentence Text: This Article applies to every building that contains a residential occupancy, a care occupancy with individual suites, or a care occupancy containing sleeping rooms not within a suite, and that also contains a fuel-burning appliance, or a storage garage.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to every building that,  contains a residential occupancy, and  contains a fuel-burning appliance or a storage garage.

National Sentence Text: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a suite of residential occupancy or in a suite of care occupancy, a CO alarm shall be installed inside each bedroom, or outside each bedroom, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a suite of residential occupancy, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed adjacent to each sleeping area in the suite.

National Sentence Text: For each suite of residential occupancy or suite of care occupancy that shares a wall or floor/ceiling assembly with a storage garage or that is adjacent to an attic or crawl space to which the storage garage is also adjacent, a CO alarm shall be installed inside each bedroom, or outside each bedroom, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage garage is located in a building containing a residential occupancy, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed adjacent to each sleeping area in every suite of residential occupancy that is adjacent to the storage garage.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to laboratories where dangerous goods, including flammable liquids and combustible liquids, are used in normal laboratory operations in quantities or in a manner that creates a fire or explosion hazard.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to laboratories intended as a location where flammable liquids and combustible liquids are used in normal laboratory operations in quantities or in a manner that create a fire or explosion hazard.

National Sentence Text: A laboratory shall be provided with continuous mechanical ventilation designed to ensure that dangerous goods vapours and particles do not accumulate in the laboratory, are prevented from migrating to other parts of the building, do not accumulate in the ventilation system, are exhausted to the outdoors, and are not returned to the building.
P/T Sentence Text: A laboratory shall be provided with continuous mechanical ventilation designed to ensure that flammable vapours, do not accumulate in the laboratory,  are prevented from migrating to other parts of the building,  do not accumulate in the ventilation system,  are exhausted to the outdoors, and  are not returned to the building.

National Sentence Text: A ventilation system required by this Subsection shall be maintained in conformance with Article 5.5.4.1. of Division B of the NFC.

The ventilation system for a power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.4.2. of Division B of the NFC shall conform to NFPA 91-2010 Exhaust Systems for Air Conveying of Vapors, Gases, Mists, and Noncombustible Particulate Solids provide continuous exhaust ventilation at an air velocity sufficient to prevent the accumulation of combustible or reactive deposits in the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system, confine dangerous goods vapours and particles to the area where they are generated and exhaust them to the outdoors, not return the exhausted air to the building, and be provided with well identified control switches that are located outside of the power-ventilated enclosure, and readily accessible in case of an emergency.
P/T Sentence Text: The ventilation system for a power-ventilated enclosure referred to in Article 6.2.13.3. shall, conform to NFPA 91, "Exhaust Systems for Air Conveying of Vapors, Gases, Mists and Noncombustible Particulate Solids",  provide continuous exhaust ventilation at an air velocity sufficient to prevent the accumulation of combustible or reactive deposits in the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system,  confine flammable vapours and particles to the area where they are generated and exhaust them to the outdoors,  not return the exhausted air to the building, and  be provided with well identified control switches that are,  located outside the power-ventilated enclosure, and  readily accessible in case of an emergency.

National Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating required by Sentence 6.3.4.4. is permitted to be greater than 25 if an automatic fire suppression system is provided inside the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system.
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating required in Sentence  is permitted to be greater than 25 if an automatic fire suppression system is provided inside the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system.

National Sentence Text: Rungs for external ladders shall begin at not less than 2.5 m from ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Rungs for external ladders shall begin at not less than 2 500 mm from ground level.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.3.1.1.(4), reinforced concrete shall be designed to conform to the requirements of Part 4.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , Subsection 9.15.4. and Section 9.39., reinforced concrete shall be designed to conform to the requirements of Part 4.

National Sentence Text: Cement shall meet the requirements of CSA A3001-13 Cementitious Materials for Use in Concrete
P/T Sentence Text: Cement shall meet the requirements of CSA A3001, "Cementitious Materials for Use in Concrete".

National Article Title: Concrete in Contact with Sulphate Soil
National Sentence Text: Concrete in contact with sulphate soil, which is deleterious to normal cement, shall conform to the requirements in Clause 4.1.1.6 of CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction
P/T Article Title: 9.3.1.3. Concrete in Contact With Sulfate Soil
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete in contact with sulfate soil, which is deleterious to normal cement, shall conform to the requirements in Clause 4.1.1.6. of CSA A23.1, "Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction".

National Sentence Text: For pre-mixed concrete and for the site-batched concrete mixes described in Table 9.3.1.7., the maximum ratio of water to cementing materials measured by weight shall not exceed 0.70 for walls, columns, fireplaces and chimneys, footings, foundation walls, grade beams and piers, 0.65 for floors other than those in garages and carports, and 0.45 for garage and carport floors, and exterior steps.
P/T Sentence Text: For pre-mixed concrete and for the site-batched concrete mixes described in Table 9.3.1.7., the maximum ratio of water to cementing materials measured by weight shall not exceed, 0.45 for garage floors, carport floors and all exterior flatwork,  0.65 for interior floors other than those for garages and carports, and  0.70 for all other applications.

National Sentence Text: The size of aggregate in unreinforced site-batched concrete mixes referred to in Sentence 9.3.1.7. shall not exceed 1/5 the distance between the sides of vertical forms, or 1/3 the thickness of flatwork.
P/T Sentence Text: The size of aggregate in unreinforced site-batched concrete mixes referred to in Sentence  shall not exceed, 1/5 the distance between the sides of vertical forms, or  1/3 the thickness of flatwork.

National Sentence Text: Admixtures shall conform to ASTM C 260/C 260M-10a Air-Entraining Admixtures for Concrete or ASTM C 494/C 494M-13 Chemical Admixtures for Concrete as applicable.
P/T Sentence Text: Admixtures shall conform to ASTM C260 / C260M, "Air-Entraining Admixtures for Concrete", or ASTM C494 / C494M, "Chemical Admixtures for Concrete", as applicable.

National Sentence Text: No frozen material or ice shall be used in concrete described in Sentence 9.3.1.9.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: No frozen material or ice shall be used in concrete described in Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Except for joists, rafters, trusses and beams, visually graded lumber shall conform to the grades in Table 9.3.2.1. (See Article 9.23.4.2. for joists, rafters and beams and Article 9.23.14.11. for trusses.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for joists, rafters, trusses and beams, visually graded lumber shall conform to the grades in Table 9.3.2.1.

National Sentence Text: OSB, waferboard and plywood used for roof sheathing, wall sheathing and subflooring shall be legibly identified on the face of the material indicating the manufacturer of the material, the standard to which it is produced, and that the material is of an exterior type.
P/T Sentence Text: OSB, waferboard and plywood used for roof sheathing, wall sheathing and subflooring shall be legibly identified on the face of the material indicating, the manufacturer of the material,  the standard to which it is produced, and  that the material is of an exterior type.

National Sentence Text: Lumber dimensions referred to in this Part are actual dimensions determined in conformance with CSA O141-05 Softwood Lumber
P/T Sentence Text: Lumber dimensions referred to in this Part are actual dimensions determined in conformance with CSA O141, "Softwood Lumber".

National Sentence Text: The thicknesses specified in this Part for plywood, hardboard, particleboard, OSB and waferboard shall be subject to the tolerances permitted in the standards referenced for these products unless specifically indicated herein.
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness specified in this Part for plywood, hardboard, particleboard, OSB and waferboard shall be subject to the tolerances permitted in the standards referenced for these products unless specifically indicated in this Part.

National Sentence Text: Where wood is required by this Article to be treated to resist termites or decay, such treatment shall be in accordance with Table 2, Use Categories for Specific Products, Uses, and Exposures, of CSA CAN/CSA-O80.1-08 Specification of Treated Wood as follows: Use Category 1 (UC1), where the wood member is used in interior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member remains dry, Use Category 2 (UC2), where the wood member is used in interior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member may be subjected to occasional sources of moisture, Use Category 3.2 (UC3.2), where the wood member is used in exterior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member is uncoated or is used in a configuration conducive to moisture accumulation, Use Category 4.1 (UC4.1), where the wood member is in contact with the ground, the wood member is in contact with fresh water, or the vertical clearance between the wood element and the finished ground level is less than 150 mm and the wood elements are not separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier, or Use Category 4.2 (UC4.2), where the wood member is used in critical structural components, including permanent wood foundations.
P/T Sentence Text: Where wood is required by this Article to be treated to resist termites or decay, such treatment shall be in accordance with Table 2, "Use Categories for Specific Products, Uses, and Exposures", of CAN/CSA-O80.1, "Specification of Treated Wood", as follows: Use Category 1, where the wood member is used in,  interior construction,  above-ground applications, and  applications where the wood member remains dry,  Use Category 2, where the wood member is used in,  interior construction,  above-ground applications, and  applications where the wood member may be subjected to occasional sources of moisture,  Use Category 3.2, where the wood member is used in,  exterior construction,  above-ground applications, and  applications where the wood member is uncoated or is used in a configuration conducive to moisture accumulation,  Use Category 4.1, where,  the wood member is used in contact with the ground,  the wood member is used in contact with fresh water, or  the vertical clearance between the wood element and the finished ground level is less than 150 mm and the wood elements are not separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier, or  Use Category 4.2, where the wood member is used in critical structural components, including permanent wood foundations.

National Sentence Text: Where sheet steel is required to be galvanized, it shall be metallic-coated with zinc or an alloy of 55% aluminum-zinc meeting the requirements of ASTM A 653/A 653M-13 Steel Sheet, Zinc-Coated  or Zinc-Iron Alloy-Coated  by the Hot-Dip Process or ASTM A 792/A 792M-10 Steel Sheet, 55% Aluminum-Zinc Alloy-Coated by the Hot-Dip Process
P/T Sentence Text: Where sheet steel is required to be galvanized, it shall be metallic-coated with zinc or an alloy of 55% aluminum-zinc meeting the requirements of, ASTM A653 / A653M, "Steel Sheet, Zinc-Coated  or Zinc-Iron Alloy-Coated  by the Hot-Dip Process", or  ASTM A792 / A792M, "Sheet Steel, 55% Aluminum-Zinc Alloy-Coated by the Hot-Dip Process".

National Sentence Text: Subject to the application limitations defined elsewhere in this Part, structural members and their connections shall conform to requirements provided elsewhere in this Part, be designed according to good engineering practice such as that provided in CWC 2014 Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction or be designed according to Part 4 using the loads and deflection and vibration limits specified in Part 9, or Part 4.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to the application limitations defined elsewhere in this Part, structural members and their connections shall, conform to requirements provided elsewhere in this Part,  be designed according to good engineering practice such as provided in the CWC, "Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction", or  be designed according to Part 4 using the loads and deflection and vibration limits specified in,  this Part, or  Part 4.

National Sentence Text: The ceiling joists or truss bottom chords in residential attic or roof spaces having limited accessibility that precludes the storage of equipment or material shall be designed for a total specified load of not less than 0.35 kPa, where the total specified load is the sum of the specified dead load plus the specified live load of the ceiling. (See Note A-9.4.2.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Ceiling joists or truss bottom chords in residential attic or roof spaces having limited accessibility that precludes the storage of equipment or material shall be designed for a total specified load of not less than 0.35 kPa, where the total specified load is the sum of the specified dead load plus the specified live load of the ceiling. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Dead loads need not be considered in computing deflections referred to in Sentence 9.4.3.1.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Dead loads need not be considered in computing deflections referred to in Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Except where constructed in accordance with Section 9.15., walls supporting drained earth shall be designed for a pressure equivalent to that exerted by a fluid that has a density of not less than 480 kg/m3 and a depth equal to that of the retained earth, or in accordance with Section 4.2. so as to be able to resist the loads and effects described in Article 4.1.2.1.
P/T Article Title: 9.4.4.6. Walls Supporting Drained Earth (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where constructed in accordance with Section 9.15., walls supporting drained earth shall be designed,  for a pressure equivalent to that exerted by a fluid with a density of not less than 480 kg/m3 and a depth equal to that of the retained earth, or  in accordance with 4.2. so as to be able to resist the loads and effects described in Article 4.1.2.1.

National Sentence Text: Two or more areas may be considered as a combination room if the opening between the areas occupies the larger of 3 m2 or 40% or more of the area of the wall measured on the side of the dependent area.
P/T Sentence Text: Two or more areas may be considered as a combination room if the opening between the areas occupies the larger of 3 m2 or 40% or more of the wall measured on the side of the dependent area.

National Sentence Text: The ceiling height above and below a mezzanine floor assembly in occupancies other than residential occupancies shall be not less than 2.1 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The ceiling height above and below a mezzanine floor assembly in all occupancies shall be not less than 2 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: The unobstructed width of a hallway within a dwelling unit shall be not less than 860 mm, except that the hallway width is permitted to be 710 mm where there are only bedrooms and bathrooms at the end of the hallway furthest from the living area, and a second exit is provided in the hallway near the end farthest from the living area, or in each bedroom served by the hallway.
P/T Sentence Text: The unobstructed width of a hallway within a dwelling unit shall be not less than 860 mm, except that the hallway width is permitted to be 710 mm, where, there are only bedrooms and bathrooms at the end of the hallway furthest from the living area, and  a second exit is provided,  in the hallway near the end furthest from the living area, or  in each bedroom served by the hallway.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to glass in interior doors and interior windows and their sidelights, clothes closets, site-built exterior windows, doors and skylights, shower or bathtub enclosures, glazed panels and partitions, and the protection of glass.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to, glass in,  interior windows and interior doors and their sidelights,  clothes closets,  site-built exterior windows, doors and skylights,  shower or bathtub enclosures,  glazed panels and partitions, and  the protection of glass.

National Sentence Text: Glass shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.2-M91 Flat, Clear Sheet Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.3-M91 Flat, Clear Float Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.4-M91 Heat Absorbing Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.8-97 Insulating Glass Units CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.10-M76 Glass, Light and Heat Reflecting CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass or ASTM E 2190-10 Insulating Glass Unit Performance and Evaluation
P/T Sentence Text: Glass shall conform to, CAN/CGSB-12.1-M, "Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass,"  CAN/CGSB-12.2-M, "Flat, Clear Sheet Glass",  CAN/CGSB-12.3-M, "Flat, Clear Float Glass",  CAN/CGSB-12.4-M, "Heat Absorbing Glass,"  CAN/CGSB-12.8, "Insulating Glass Units",  CAN/CGSB-12.10-M, "Glass, Light and Heat Reflecting",  CAN/CGSB-12.11-M, "Wired Safety Glass", or  ASTM E2190, "Insulating Glass Unit Performance and Evaluation".

National Sentence Text: Mirrored glass doors are only permitted to be used at the entrance to clothes closets and shall conform to the requirements of CGSB CAN/CGSB-82.6-M86 Doors, Mirrored Glass, Sliding or Folding, Wardrobe (See Note A-9.6.1.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Mirrored glass doors reinforced with a film backing shall meet the impact resistance requirements specified in CAN/CGSB-12.5-M, "Mirrors, Silvered".

National Article Title: Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
National Sentence Text: Glass sidelights greater than 500 mm wide that could be mistaken for doors, glass in storm doors and glass in sliding doors within or at every entrance to a dwelling unit and in public areas shall be safety glass of the tempered or laminated type conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or wired glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass
P/T Article Title: 9.6.1.4. Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Glass sidelights greater than 500 mm wide that could be mistaken for doors, glass in storm doors and glass in sliding doors within or at every entrance to a house or an individual dwelling unit and in public areas shall be, safety glass of the tempered or laminated type conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.1-M, "Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass", or  wired glass conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.11-M, "Wired Safety Glass".

National Article Title: Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(4), glass in entrance doors to dwelling units and in public areas, other than the entrance doors described in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(1), shall be safety glass or wired glass of the type described in Sentence 9.6.1.4. where the glass area exceeds 0.5 m2 and extends to less than 900 mm from the bottom of the door.
P/T Article Title: 9.6.1.4. Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , glass in entrance doors to houses or individual dwelling units and in public areas, other than the entrance doors described in Sentence , shall be safety glass or wired glass of the type described in Sentence  where the glass area exceeds 0.5 m2 and extends to less than 900 mm from the bottom of the door.
Variation Label: Types of Glass and Protection of Glass

National Article Title: Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(4), transparent panels that could be mistaken as a means of egress shall be protected by barriers or railings.
P/T Article Title: 9.6.1.4. Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , transparent panels that could be mistaken as a means of egress shall be protected by barriers or railings.

National Article Title: Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(4), every glass or transparent door accessible to the public shall be equipped with hardware, bars or other permanent fixtures designed so that the existence and position of such doors is readily apparent.
P/T Article Title: 9.6.1.4. Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , every glass or transparent door accessible to the public shall be equipped with hardware, bars or other permanent fixtures designed so that the existence and position of such doors is readily apparent.

National Sentence Text: Main entrance doors to dwelling units shall be provided with a door viewer or transparent glazing in the door, or a sidelight.
P/T Sentence Text: Main entrance doors to dwelling units shall be provided with, a door viewer or transparent glazing in the door, or  a sidelight.

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: The protection of window and door openings to protect persons from falling through them shall conform to Article 9.8.8.1.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.2.2. Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: The protection of window and door openings against persons falling through the window or door opening shall conform to Article 9.8.8.1.

National Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights and their components described in Sentence 9.7.1.1. shall be designed, constructed and installed to minimize surface condensation on the warm side of the component (see Note A-9.7.3.2.(1)(a)), and ensure comfortable conditions for occupants.
P/T Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights described in Clause 9.7.1.1.(1) and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed to, minimize surface condensation on the warm side of the component, and (See Appendix A.)  ensure comfortable conditions for the occupants.

National Sentence Text: Compliance with the heat transfer performance requirements described in Sentence 9.7.3.2. shall be demonstrated by complying with the requirements in Article 9.7.3.3., or design and construction conforming to Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Compliance with the heat transfer performance requirements described in Sentence  shall be demonstrated by, compliance with the requirements in Article 9.7.3.3., or  design and construction conforming to Part 5.

National Article Title: Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows and doors described in Sentence 9.7.3.3. do not require a thermal break where they are installed as vehicular access doors, storm windows and doors, or windows and doors that are required to have a fire-resistance rating.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.3.3. Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Windows and doors described in Sentence  do not require a thermal break where they are installed as, vehicular access doors,  storm windows and doors, or  windows and doors that are required to have a fire-resistance rating.

National Article Title: Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights with or without storm doors or sash that are installed in buildings where the intended use of the interior space will not result in high moisture generation shall have a maximum thermal transmittance (U-value) or minimum temperature index  in accordance with Table 9.7.3.3.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.3.3. Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights, with or without storm doors or sash, that are installed in buildings where the intended use of the interior space will not result in high moisture generation shall have a maximum thermal transmittance  or minimum temperature index  in accordance with Table 9.7.3.3.
Variation Label: Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights

National Sentence Text: Exterior wood doors shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-O132.2 Series-90 Wood Flush Doors and shall have legibly indicated on them the name of the manufacturer, the standard according to which they were produced, and that they are of an exterior type.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior wood doors shall conform to CAN/CSA-O132.2 Series, "Wood Flush Doors" and shall have legibly indicated on them, the name of the manufacturer,  the standard to which they were produced, and  that they are of an exterior type.

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
National Sentence Text: Except for exterior doors to garages and to other ancillary spaces, this Article applies to swinging entrance doors to dwelling units, swinging doors between dwelling units and attached garages or other ancillary spaces, and swinging doors that provide access directly or indirectly from a storage garage to a dwelling unit. (See Note A-9.7.5.2.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.2. Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Except for exterior doors to garages and to other ancillary spaces, this Article applies to, swinging entrance doors to dwelling units,  swinging doors between dwelling units and attached garages or other ancillary spaces, and  swinging doors that provide access directly or indirectly from a storage garage to a dwelling unit. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(2), wood doors as described in Sentence 9.7.5.2. shall be solid core or stile-and-rail type, be not less than 45 mm thick, and if of the stile-and-rail type, have a panel thickness of not less than 19 mm, with a total panel area not more than half of the door area.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.2. Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , wood doors described in Sentence  shall,  be solid core or stile-and-rail type,  be not less than 45 mm thick, and  if of the stile-and-rail panel type, have a panel thickness of not less than 19 mm, with a total panel area not more than half of the door area.

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(2), an inactive leaf in double doors used in locations specified in Sentence 9.7.5.2. shall be provided with heavy-duty bolts top and bottom having an engagement of not less than 15 mm.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.2. Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , an inactive leaf in double doors used in locations specified in Sentence  shall be provided with heavy-duty bolts top and bottom having an engagement of not less than 15 mm.

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
National Sentence Text: Except for storm or screen doors, doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2. that swing outward shall be provided with hinges or pins so that the doors cannot be removed when they are in the closed position. (See Note A-9.7.5.2.(8).)
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.2. Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Except for storm doors or screen doors, doors described in Sentence  that swing outward shall be provided with hinges or pins so that the doors cannot be removed when they are in the closed position. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to the design and construction of interior and exterior stairs, steps, ramps, handrails and guards.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to the design and construction of interior and exterior stairs, steps, ramps, landings, handrails and guards.
Variation Label: Interior and Exterior Stairs, Steps, Ramps, Landings, Handrails, and Guards

National Sentence Text: Escalators and moving walkways shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Part 3.
P/T Sentence Text: Escalators and moving walks shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Part 3.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.2.1. and Article 9.8.4.7., required exit stairs and public stairs serving buildings of residential occupancy shall have a width of not less than 900 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence  and Article 9.8.4.5A., required exit stairs and public stairs serving buildings of residential occupancy shall have a width, measured between wall faces or guards, of not less than 900 mm.

National Sentence Text: Exit stairs serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall have a width of not less than 860 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Required exit stairs serving a house or an individual dwelling unit shall have a width of not less than 860 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.7., required exit stairs and public stairs serving buildings of other than residential occupancy shall have a width of not less than the greater of 900 mm, or 8 mm per person based on the occupant load limits specified in Table 3.1.17.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.5A., required exit stairs and public stairs serving buildings of other than residential occupancy shall have a width of not less than the greater of,  900 mm, or  8 mm per person based on the occupant load limits specified in Table 3.1.17.1.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.7., at least one stair between each floor level within a dwelling unit, and exterior stairs serving a single dwelling unit except required exit stairs, shall have a width of not less than 860 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.5A., at least one stair between each floor level within a dwelling unit and exterior stairs serving a house or an individual dwelling unit shall have a width of not less than 860 mm.

National Sentence Text: The clear height over stairs shall be measured vertically, over the clear width of the stair, from a straight line tangent to the tread and landing nosings to the lowest point above. (See Note A-3.4.3.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: The clear height over stairs shall be measured vertically, over the clear width of the stair, from a straight line tangent to the tread and landing nosings to the lowest point above. (See A-3.4.3.4. in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.7., the clear height over stairs serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall not be less than 1 950 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Ã Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.5A., the clear height over stairs serving a house or an individual dwelling unit shall not be less than 1 950 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except for stairs within a dwelling unit, at least 3 risers shall be provided in interior flights.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for stairs within a dwelling unit, at least three risers shall be provided in interior flights.

National Article Title: Uniformity and Tolerances for Risers, Runs and Treads
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.4.(2), risers shall be of uniform height in any one flight, with a maximum tolerance of 5 mm between adjacent treads or landings, and 10 mm between the tallest and shortest risers in a flight.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.4.4. Uniformity and Tolerances for Risers, Runs and Treads
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , risers shall be of uniform height in any one flight with a maximum tolerance of, 5 mm between adjacent treads or landings, and  10 mm between the tallest and shortest risers in a flight.

National Article Title: Uniformity and Tolerances for Risers, Runs and Treads
National Sentence Text: Rectangular treads shall have a uniform run with a maximum tolerance of 5 mm between adjacent treads, and 10 mm between the deepest and shallowest treads in a flight.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.4.4. Uniformity and Tolerances for Risers, Runs and Treads
P/T Sentence Text: Rectangular treads shall have uniform run with a maximum tolerance of,  5 mm between adjacent treads, and  10 mm between the deepest and shallowest treads in a flight.

National Article Title: Uniformity and Tolerances for Risers, Runs and Treads
National Sentence Text: Tapered treads in a flight shall have a uniform run in accordance with the construction tolerances stipulated in Sentence 9.8.4.4. when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrail as described in Sentence 9.8.7.1.(5).
P/T Article Title: 9.8.4.4. Uniformity and Tolerances for Risers, Runs and Treads
P/T Sentence Text: Tapered treads in a flight shall have a uniform run in accordance with the tolerances described in Sentence  when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail.
Variation Label: Uniformity and Tolerances for Risers, Runs and Treads

National Sentence Text: Except for stairs within a dwelling unit, at least 3 risers shall be provided in interior flights.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.4.4. Uniformity and Tolerances for Risers, Runs and Treads
P/T Sentence Text: The slope of treads shall not exceed 1 in 50. 9.8.4.4A. Uniformity of Runs in Flights with Mixed Treads within a House or Dwelling Unit

National Sentence Text: Spiral stairs shall have handrails on both sides, the outer handrail being not less than 1 070 mm high, a clear width not less than 660 mm between the handrails, risers that are not more than 240 mm high, treads that are a minimum of 190 mm deep at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrails at the narrower edge, have a consistent angle and uniform dimension, and turn in the same direction, and not less than 1 980 mm clear height.
P/T Sentence Text: Spiral stairs shall have, handrails on both sides, the outer handrail being not less than 1 070 mm high,  a clear width not less than 660 mm between handrails,  risers that are not more than 240 mm high,  treads that,  are a minimum of 190 mm deep at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail,  have a consistent angle and uniform dimension, and  turn in the same direction, and  a clear height not less than 1 980 mm.

National Sentence Text: Spiral stairs conforming to Sentence 9.8.4.7. are permitted to be used as the only means of egress where they serve not more than 3 persons.
P/T Sentence Text: Spiral stairs conforming to Sentence  are permitted to be used as the only means of egress where they serve not more than 3 persons.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.5.2.(2), ramps shall be not less than 1 100 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , ramps shall not be less than 1 100 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 860 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Ramps serving a house or an individual dwelling unit shall not be less than 860 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: The clear height over ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 1 950 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The clear height over ramps shall be not less than, 1 950 mm for ramps serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, and  2 050 mm for ramps not serving a house or an individual dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: The slope of ramps shall be not more than 1 in 10 for exterior ramps, 1 in 10 for interior ramps serving residential occupancies, 1 in 6 for industrial occupancies, and 1 in 8 for all other occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: The slope of ramps shall be not more than, 1 in 10 for exterior ramps,  1 in 10 for interior ramps serving residential occupancies,  1 in 6 for industrial occupancies, and  1 in 8 for all other occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Landings for ramps in a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.8.3.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Landings for ramps in a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.8.3.4.

National Sentence Text: A landing may be omitted at the top of an exterior flight serving a secondary entrance to a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, provided the stair does not contain more than 3 risers, the principal door is a sliding door or swings away from the stair, and only a storm or screen door, if any, swings over the stair and is equipped with hardware to hold it open.
P/T Sentence Text: A landing may be omitted at the top of an exterior stair serving a garage or a secondary entrance to a house or an individual dwelling unit, including an entrance from an attached garage, provided,  the stair does not contain more than three risers,  except as provided in Clause (c), the door is a sliding door or swings away from the stair, and  where a storm or screen door is provided, it may swing over the stair if it is equipped with hardware to hold it open. (3.1) Sentence  does not apply to an exterior stair serving a secondary entrance to a house that is also a main entrance to a dwelling unit in the house.

National Sentence Text: The length of a landing shall be measured perpendicular to the nosings of adjacent steps or to the end of the ramp, at a distance equal to half the length required in Sentence 9.8.6.3. from the narrow edge of the landing.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.6.3. Dimensions of Landings (See A-3.4.6.4. in Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: The length of a landing described in Sentence  shall be measured perpendicular to the nosings of adjacent treads or to the end of the ramp, at a distance equal to half the length required by Sentence  from the narrow edge of the landing.

National Sentence Text: Where a doorway or stairway opens onto the side of a ramp, the landing shall extend for a distance of not less than 300 mm on either side of the doorway or stairway, except on a side abutting an end wall.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.6.3. Dimensions of Landings (See A-3.4.6.4. in Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Where a doorway or stair opens onto the side of a ramp, the landing shall extend for a distance of not less than 300Ã mm on either side of the doorway or stair, except on a side abutting an end wall.

National Sentence Text: The clear height over landings serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 1 950 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The clear height over landings shall be not less than, 1 950 mm for landings serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, and  2 050 mm for landings not serving a house or an individual dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Except where a stair or ramp serves not more than two dwelling units, at least one handrail shall be located not more than 750 mm from the natural path of travel on the stair or ramp. (See Note A-9.8.7.1.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a stair or a ramp is required to be at least 2 200 mm wide due to the occupant load, a handrail shall be installed such that no position on the stair or ramp is more than 825 mm from a handrail. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Handrails are not required for stairs and ramps serving a single dwelling unit, where interior stairs have not more than 2 risers, exterior stairs have not more than 3 risers, or ramps rise not more than 400 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: A handrail is not required for stairs and ramps serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, where,  interior stairs have not more than two risers,  exterior stairs have not more than three risers, or  ramps rise not more than 400 mm.

National Sentence Text: Only one handrail is required on exterior stairs having more than 3 risers provided such stairs serve not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Only one handrail is required on exterior stairs having more than three risers, provided such stairs serve a house or an individual dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Except for stairs or ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, at least one required handrail shall be continuous throughout the length of the stair or ramp, including at the landing except where interrupted by doorways. (See Note A-3.4.6.5.(10).)
P/T Sentence Text: For stairs or ramps serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, at least one required handrail shall be continuous throughout the length of the stair or ramp, except where interrupted by, doorways,  landings, or  newel posts at changes in direction. (See A-3.4.6.5. in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The height of handrails on stairs and ramps shall be measured vertically from the top of the handrail to a straight line drawn tangent to the tread nosings of the stair served by the handrail, or the surface of the ramp, floor or landing served by the handrail.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of handrails on stairs and ramps shall be measured vertically from the top of the handrail to, a straight line drawn tangent to the tread nosings of the stair served by the handrail, or  the surface of the ramp, floor or landing served by the handrail.

National Sentence Text: Handrails installed in addition to required handrails need not comply with Sentence 9.8.7.4.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails installed in addition to required handrails need not comply with Sentence .

National Sentence Text: All handrails shall be constructed so as to be continually graspable along their entire length with no obstruction on or above them to break a handhold. (See Note A-9.8.7.5.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: All handrails shall be constructed so as to be continually graspable along their entire length with no obstruction on or above them to break a handhold. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.8.1.(2), every surface to which access is provided, including but not limited to flights of steps and ramps, exterior landings, porches, balconies, mezzanines, galleries and raised walkways, shall be protected by a guard on each side that is not protected by a wall for the length where there is a difference in elevation of more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or the adjacent surface within 1.2 m of the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , every surface to which access is provided, including but not limited to flights, ramps, exterior landings, porches, balconies, mezzanines, galleries and raised walkways, shall be protected by a guard on each side that is not protected by a wall for the length, where, there is a difference in elevation of more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or  the adjacent surface within 1.2 m from the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2.

National Sentence Text: Doors in buildings of residential occupancy, where the finished floor on one side of the door is more than 600 mm above the floor or other constructed surface or ground level on the other side of the door, shall be protected by a guard, or a mechanism capable of controlling the free swinging or sliding of the door so as to limit any clear unobstructed opening to not more than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Doors in buildings of residential occupancy, where the finished floor on one side of the door is more than 600 mm above the floor or other surface or ground level on the other side of the door, shall be protected by,  a guard in accordance with this Subsection, or  a mechanism capable of controlling the free swinging or sliding of the door so as to limit any clear unobstructed opening to not more than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.8.1.(7), glazing installed over stairs, ramps and landings that extends to less than 1 070 mm above the surface of the treads, ramp or landing shall be protected by guards, in accordance with this Subsection, or non-openable and designed to withstand the specified lateral loads for balcony guards as provided in Article 4.1.5.14.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , glazing installed over stairs, ramps and landings that extends to less than 1Ã 070Ã mm above the surface of the treads, ramp or landing shall be, protected by guards in accordance with this Subsection, or  non-openable and designed to withstand the specified lateral loads for guards as provided in Article 4.1.5.14.

National Sentence Text: In dwelling units, glazing installed over stairs, ramps and landings that extends to less than 900 mm above the surface of the treads, ramp or landing shall be protected by guards, in accordance with this Subsection, or non-openable and designed to withstand the specified lateral loads for balcony guards as provided in Article 4.1.5.14.
P/T Sentence Text: In dwelling units, glazing installed over stairs, ramps and landings that extends to less than 900 mm above the surface of the treads, ramp or landing shall be, protected by guards in accordance with this Subsection, or  non-openable and designed to withstand the specified lateral loads for guards as provided in Article 4.1.5.14.

National Sentence Text: None of the loads specified in Table 9.8.8.2. need be considered to act simultaneously.
P/T Sentence Text: None of the specified loads prescribed in Table 9.8.8.2. need be considered to act simultaneously.

National Sentence Text: Exterior guards serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 900 mm high where the walking surface served by the guard is not more than 1 800 mm above the finished ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior guards serving a house or an individual dwelling unit shall be not less than 900 mm high where the walking surface served by the guard is not more than 1 800 mm above the finished ground level.

National Sentence Text: Guards for flights of steps, except in required exit stairs, shall be not less than 900 mm high.
P/T Sentence Text: Guards for flights, except in required exit stairs, shall be not less than 900 mm high.

National Sentence Text: The height of guards for flights of steps shall be measured vertically from the top of the guard to a line drawn through the tread nosing served by the guard.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of guards for flights shall be measured vertically from the top of the guard to a straight line tangent to tread nosings served by the guard.

National Sentence Text: Glass in guards shall be safety glass of the laminated or tempered type conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or wired glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Glass in guards shall be, safety glass of the laminated or tempered type conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.1-M, "Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass", or  wired glass conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.11-M, "Wired Safety Glass".

National Sentence Text: Exterior concrete stairs with more than 2 risers and 2 treads shall be supported on unit masonry or concrete walls or piers not less than 150 mm in cross section, or cantilevered from the main foundation wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior concrete stairs with more than two risers and two treads shall be, supported on unit masonry or concrete walls or piers not less than 150 mm in cross-section, or  cantilevered from the main foundation wall.

National Sentence Text: Wooden stair stringers shall have a minimum effective depth of 90 mm, measured perpendicularly to the bottom of the stringer at the point of minimum cross-section, and an overall depth of not less than 235 mm, be supported and secured top and bottom, be not less than 25 mm actual thickness if supported along their length and 38 mm actual thickness if unsupported along their length, and except as permitted in Sentence 9.8.9.4.(2), be spaced not more than 900 mm o.c. in stairs serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, and 600 mm o.c. in other stairs.
P/T Sentence Text: Wooden stair stringers shall, have a minimum effective depth of 90 mm, measured perpendicularly to the bottom of the stringer at the point of minimum cross-section, and an overall depth of not less than 235 mm,  be supported and secured top and bottom,  be not less than 25 mm actual thickness if supported along their length and 38 mm actual thickness if unsupported along their length, and  except as permitted in Sentence , be spaced not more than 900 mm o.c. for stairs serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, and 600 mm o.c. in other stairs.

National Sentence Text: For stairs serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, where risers support the front portion of the tread, the space between stringers shall be not more than 1 200 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: For stairs serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, where risers support the front portion of the tread, the space between stringers shall be not more than 1 200 mm.

National Sentence Text: Treads and landings of interior and exterior stairs and ramps, other than those within dwelling units or within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces, shall have a slip-resistant finish or be provided with slip-resistant strips that extend not more than 1 mm above the surface.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.9.6. Finish for Treads, Landings and Ramps (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence , the finish for treads, landings and ramps shall be,  wear-resistant,  slip-resistant, and  smooth, even and free from open defects
Variation Label: Finish for Treads, Landings and Ramps

National Sentence Text: The finish for treads and landings of interior stairs in dwelling units, other than stairs to unfinished basements, shall consist of hardwood, vertical grain softwood, resilient flooring or other material providing equivalent performance.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.9.6. Finish for Treads, Landings and Ramps (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: The finish for treads, landings and ramps within a house or an individual dwelling unit, including those from an attached garage serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, shall be deemed to comply with Sentence  where these treads, landings or ramps are finished with, hardwood,  vertical grain softwood,  resilient flooring,  low-pile carpet,  mat finish ceramic tile,  concrete, or  for stairs to unfinished basements and to garages, plywood.
Variation Label: Finish for Treads, Landings and Ramps

National Sentence Text: Treads and landings of interior and exterior stairs and ramps, other than those within dwelling units or within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces, shall have a slip-resistant finish or be provided with slip-resistant strips that extend not more than 1 mm above the surface.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.9.6. Finish for Treads, Landings and Ramps (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Treads and landings of interior and exterior stairs and ramps, other than those within dwelling units, shall have a slip-resistant finish or be provided with slip-resistant strips that extend not more than 1 mm above the surface.
Variation Label: Finish for Treads, Landings and Ramps

National Sentence Text: Cantilevered concrete steps referred to in Article 9.8.10.1. shall be anchored to concrete foundation walls not less than 200 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Cantilevered concrete steps referred to in Article 9.8.10.1. shall be anchored to concrete foundation walls at least 200Ã mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Section, an exit from any floor area shall be one of the following used singly or in combination: an exterior doorway, an exterior passageway, an exterior ramp, an exterior stairway, a fire escape, a horizontal exit, an interior passageway, an interior ramp, or an interior stairway.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Section, an exit from any floor area shall be one of the following used singly or in combination: an exterior doorway,  an exterior passageway,  an exterior ramp,  an exterior stairway,  a fire escape (as described in Subsection 3.4.7.),  a horizontal exit,  an interior passageway,  an interior ramp, or  an interior stairway.

National Sentence Text: Fire escapes shall only be used as exits on existing buildings and shall be designed and installed in conformance with Subsection 3.4.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire escapes are permitted to be used as exits on existing buildings provided they are designed and installed in conformance with Subsection 3.4.7.

National Article Title: Elevators, Slide Escapes and Windows as Means of Egress
National Sentence Text: Elevators, slide escapes and windows shall not be considered as part of a required means of egress.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.2.3. Elevators, Slide Escapes and Windows as Means of Egress
P/T Sentence Text: Elevators, slide escapes or windows shall not be considered as part of a required means of egress.

National Sentence Text: Except for doors and corridors, the width of every exit facility shall be not less than 900 mm. (See Article 9.9.6.3. for doors, Article 9.8.2.1. for stairs, and Article 9.8.5.2. for ramps.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for doors and corridors, the width of every exit facility shall be not less than 900 mm.

National Sentence Text: The width of every public corridor, corridor used by the public, and exit corridor shall be not less than 1 100 mm. (See also Subsection 9.9.5. for obstructions in corridors.)
P/T Sentence Text: The width of every public corridor, corridor used by the public, and exit corridor shall be not less than 1 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except for stairways, doorways and storage garages, the minimum clear height in exits and access to exits shall be 2.1 m. (See Article 9.8.2.2. for stairs, Article 9.8.5.3. for ramps, Article 9.8.6.4. for landings and Article 9.9.6.2. for doorways.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for stairways, doorways and storage garages, the minimum clear height in exits and access to exits shall be 2Ã 100Ã mm.

National Sentence Text: The clear height in exits and access to exits in storage garages shall be not less than 2 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The clear height in exits and access to exits in a storage garage shall be not less than 2Ã 000 mm.

National Sentence Text: Where an exit is located in a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, the exit shall be protected by a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board installed on both sides of walls separating the exit from the remainder of the building, and the underside of floor-ceiling framing separating the exit from the remainder of the building. (See Sentence 9.10.9.3. for closures.)
A fire separation common to 2 exits shall be smoke-tight and not be pierced by doorways, duct work, piping or any other opening that may affect the continuity of the separation.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire separation common to two exits shall be smoke-tight and not be pierced by doorways, duct work, piping or any other opening that may affect the continuity of the separation.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.5.5.(3), no obstructions, such as counter gates, that do not meet the requirements for exit doors, shall be placed in a required means of egress from a floor area or part of a floor area unless an alternate unobstructed means of egress is provided adjacent to and plainly visible from the restricted egress.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , no obstructions, such as counter gates, that do not meet the requirements for exit doors, shall be placed in a required means of egress from a floor area or part of a floor area unless an alternate unobstructed means of egress is provided adjacent to and plainly visible from the restricted egress.

National Sentence Text: Obstructions, such as counter gates, that do not satisfy Sentence 9.9.5.5.(2), are permitted to be placed in a required means of egress from a part of a floor area in mercantile occupancies and business and personal services occupancies, provided that the part of the floor area served by the obstructed means of egress is not generally accessible to the public.
P/T Sentence Text: Obstructions, such as counter gates, that do not satisfy Sentence , are permitted to be placed in a required means of egress from a part of a floor area in mercantile occupancies and business and personal services occupancies, provided that the part of the floor area served by the obstructed means of egress is not generally accessible to the public.

National Sentence Text: No mirror shall be placed in or adjacent to any exit so as to confuse the direction of exit, and no mirror or draperies shall be placed on or over exit doors.
P/T Sentence Text: No mirror shall be placed in or adjacent to any exit so as to cause confusion regarding the direction of exit, and no mirror or draperies shall be placed on or over exit doors.

National Sentence Text: Except in houses with a secondary suite, ancillary rooms such as storage rooms, washrooms, toilet rooms, laundry rooms and service rooms shall not open directly into an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Ancillary rooms such as storage rooms, washrooms, toilet rooms, laundry rooms and service rooms shall not open directly into an exit.

National Sentence Text: When fully open, doors described in Sentence 9.9.6.1. shall not decrease the required exit width by more than 100 mm in exit corridors, and 50 mm for other exit facilities.
P/T Sentence Text: When fully open, doors described in Sentence  shall not decrease the required exit width by more than, 100 mm in exit corridors, and  50 mm for other exit facilities.

National Sentence Text: The swing of doors described in Sentence 9.9.6.1. shall not reduce the width of the path of travel to less than the required exit width in exit corridors and passageways, and 750 mm on exit stairs or landings.
P/T Sentence Text: The swing of doors described in Sentence  shall not reduce the width of the path of travel to less than, the required exit width in exit corridors and passageways, and  750 mm on exit stairs or landings.

National Sentence Text: The clear opening height under door closers and other devices in doorways described in Sentence 9.9.6.2. shall be not less than 1 980 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The clear opening height under door closers and other devices in doorways described in Sentence  shall be not less than 1 980 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.6.4.(5), breakaway sliding doors, installed as required exit doors or required doors in means of egress, shall be identified as swinging doors by means of a label or decal affixed to the door.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , breakaway sliding doors, installed as required exit doors or required doors in means of egress, shall be identified as swinging doors by means of a label or decal affixed to the door.

National Sentence Text: Except for doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, exit doors that are required to swing shall swing in the direction of exit travel.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence  and except for doors serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, exit doors that are required to swing shall swing in the direction of exit travel.

National Sentence Text: Doors that open onto a corridor or other facility that provides access to exit from a room or suite having an occupant load of more than 60 persons shall swing on the vertical axis in the direction of exit travel.
P/T Sentence Text: An exit door need not swing in the direction of exit travel where it serves, a room, suite or floor area having an occupant load of not more than 60 persons, or  as part of a means of egress from more than one floor area and the floor areas so served have a total occupant load of not more than 60 persons.

National Sentence Text: Where a pair of doors is installed in a corridor that provides access to exit in both directions, the doors shall swing in opposite directions, with the door on the right-hand side swinging in the direction of exit travel, or swing in both directions.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a pair of doors is installed in a corridor that provides access to exit in both directions, the doors shall, swing in opposite directions, with the door on the right hand side swinging in the direction of exit travel, or  swing in both directions.

National Sentence Text: Where there is a danger of blockage from ice or snow, an exit door, including doors serving a single dwelling unit, may open onto not more than one step, provided the riser of such a step does not exceed 150 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where there is a danger of blockage from ice or snow, an exit door, including a door serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, may open onto not more than one step provided the riser of such step does not exceed 150 mm.

National Article Title: Door Latching, Locking and Opening Mechanisms
National Sentence Text: Except for hotels and motels, a door opening onto a public corridor that provides access to exit from suites shall be designed not to lock automatically if it is equipped with an automatic self-closing device. (See Note A-3.3.4.5.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.9.6.7. Door Latching, Locking and Opening Mechanisms
P/T Sentence Text: Except for hotels, a door opening onto a public corridor that provides access to exit from suites shall be designed not to lock automatically when such doors are equipped with an automatic self-closing device.
Variation Label: Door Latching, Locking and Opening Mechanisms

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.9.9.3.(1), each suite in a floor area occupied by more than one suite shall have an exterior exit doorway, a doorway to a public corridor, or a doorway to an exterior passageway.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 9.9.9.3.(1), each suite in a floor area occupied by more than one suite shall have, an exterior exit doorway,  a doorway to a public corridor, or  a doorway to an exterior passageway.

National Sentence Text: Except for a dead-end corridor that is entirely within a suite and except as permitted in Sentence 9.9.9.2.(1), a dead-end corridor is permitted provided it is not more than 6 m long.
P/T Sentence Text: A dead-end public corridor is permitted in an occupancy shown in Table 9.9.7.3., where, the dead-end corridor,  does not exceed the distance of travel measured from the most remote point of the dead-end to a point where it is possible to go in opposite directions to each of two separate exits, and  is provided with doors equipped with self-closing devices, or  there is a second and separate egress doorway from each room or suite not leading into the dead-end corridor.

National Article Title: Number and Spacing of Egress Doors
National Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units, at least 2 egress doors shall be provided when the area of a room or suite, or the distance measured from any point within the room or suite to the nearest egress door, exceeds the values in Table 9.9.7.4.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.7.4. Number and Spacing of Egress Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units, at least two egress doors shall be provided where, the area of a room or suite exceeds 200 mÃÂ² in a Group D, E, F2 and F3 occupancy, or 150 mÃÂ² in a Group C occupancy, or  the distance measured from any point within a room or suite to the nearest egress door exceeds 25 m.
Variation Label: Number and Spacing of Egress Doors

National Sentence Text: Not more than one exit from a floor area above or below the first storey is permitted to lead through a lobby.
P/T Sentence Text: Not more than one exit from a floor area is permitted to lead through a lobby.

National Sentence Text: The lobby referred to in Sentence 9.9.8.5. shall conform in all respects to the requirements for exits, except that rooms other than service rooms, storage rooms and rooms of residential or industrial occupancy are permitted to open directly onto such lobby.
P/T Sentence Text: The lobby referred to in Sentence  shall conform in all respects to the requirements for exits, except that rooms other than service rooms, storage rooms and rooms of residential or industrial occupancy are permitted to open directly onto such lobby.

National Sentence Text: One of the means of egress from a mezzanine that is not required to terminate at a fire separation, as permitted by Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2), and that exceeds the limits of Sentence 9.9.8.6. is permitted to lead through the room in which the mezzanine is located, provided all other means of egress from that mezzanine lead to exits accessible at the mezzanine level.
