P/T Sentence Text: One of the means of egress from a mezzanine that is not required to terminate at a fire separation as permitted by Sentence 9.10.12.1. and that exceeds the limits of Sentence , is permitted to lead through the room in which the mezzanine is located provided all other means of egress from that mezzanine lead to exits accessible at the mezzanine level.

National Article Title: Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors
National Sentence Text: Where a dwelling unit is not located above or below another suite, the travel limit from a floor level in the dwelling unit to an exit or egress door may exceed 1 storey where that floor level is served by an openable window providing an unobstructed opening of not less than 1 m in height and 0.55 m in width, and located so that the sill is not more than 1 m above the floor, and 7 m above adjacent ground level.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.9.1. Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Where a dwelling unit is not located above or below another suite, the travel limit from a floor level in the dwelling unit to an exit or egress door is permitted to exceed 1 storey where that floor level is served by an openable window or door, providing an unobstructed opening of not less than 1 000 mm in height and 550 mm in width, and  located so that the sill is not more than,  1 000 mm above the floor, and  7 m above adjacent ground level.
Variation Label: Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors

National Article Title: Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors
National Sentence Text: The travel limit from a floor level in a dwelling unit to an exit or egress door may exceed 1 storey where that floor level has direct access to a balcony.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.9.1. Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors
P/T Sentence Text: The travel limit from a floor level in a dwelling unit to an exit or egress door is permitted to exceed 1 storey where that floor level has direct access to a balcony.

National Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite, a dwelling unit shall be provided with a second and separate means of egress where an egress door from the dwelling unit opens onto an exit stairway serving more than one suite, a public corridor serving more than one suite, and served by a single exit, an exterior passageway serving more than one suite, served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level, or a balcony serving more than one suite, served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: A dwelling unit shall be provided with a second and separate means of egress where an egress door from the dwelling unit opens onto, an exit stairway serving more than one suite,  a public corridor,  serving more than one suite, and  served by a single exit,  an exterior passageway,  serving more than one suite,  served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and  more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level, or  a balcony,  serving more than one suite,  served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and  more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.

National Article Title: Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
National Sentence Text: Except where the suite is sprinklered, each bedroom or combination bedroom shall have at least one outside window or exterior door openable from the inside without the use of keys, tools or special knowledge and without the removal of sashes or hardware. (See Article 9.5.1.2. and Note A-9.9.10.1.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.9.10.1. Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
P/T Sentence Text: Except where a door on the same floor level as the bedroom provides direct access to the exterior, every floor level containing a bedroom in a suite shall be provided with at least one outside window that, is openable from the inside without the use of tools,  provides an individual, unobstructed open portion having a minimum area of 0.35 mÃÂ² with no dimension less than 380 mm, and  maintains the required opening described in Clause  without the need for additional support. (See Appendix A.)
Variation Label: Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms

National Article Title: Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
National Sentence Text: Where the sash of a window referred to in Sentence 9.9.10.1. swings towards the window well, the operation of the sash shall not reduce the clearance in a manner that would restrict escape in an emergency.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.10.1. Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
P/T Sentence Text: Where the sash of a window referred to in Sentence  swings towards the window well, the operation of the sash shall not reduce the clearance in a manner that would restrict escape in an emergency.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to all exits except those serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to all exits except those serving a house or an individual dwelling unit.
Variation Label: Exits Except those Serving a house or Individual Dwelling Unit

National Sentence Text: Every exit door shall have an exit sign placed over it or adjacent to it if the exit serves a building that is 3 storeys in building height, a building having an occupant load of more than 150, or a room or floor area that has a fire escape as part of a required means of egress.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence , every exit door shall have an exit sign placed over it or adjacent to it if the exit serves, a building that is 3 storeys in building height,  a building having an occupant load of more than 150, or  a room or floor area that has a fire escape as part of a required means of egress.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the lighting of all means of egress except those within dwelling units or a house with a secondary suite.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the lighting of all means of egress except those within dwelling units.

National Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall be provided in exits, principal routes providing access to exit in an open floor area, corridors used by the public, underground walkways, and public corridors.
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall be provided in, exits,  principal routes providing access to exit in an open floor area,  corridors used by the public,  underground walkways, and  public corridors.

National Sentence Text: Emergency lighting required in Sentence 9.9.12.3. shall be provided from a source of energy separate from the electrical supply for the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency lighting required in Sentence  shall be provided from a source of energy separate from the electrical supply for the building.

National Sentence Text: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentence 9.9.12.3. shall be not less than 1 lx.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentence  shall be not less than 1 1x.

National Sentence Text: Where incandescent lighting is provided, lighting equal to 1 W/m2 of floor area shall be considered to meet the requirement in Sentence 9.9.12.3.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Where incandescent lighting is provided, lighting equal to 1 W/mÃÂ² of floor area shall be considered to meet the requirement in Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Where an assembly is required to be of noncombustible construction and to have a fire-resistance rating, it shall be supported by noncombustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an assembly is required to be of noncombustible construction and to have a fire-resistance rating, it shall be supported by noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: Chutes and shafts shall conform to Subsection 3.6.3. except where they are entirely contained within a dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Chutes and shafts shall conform to Subsection 3.6.3. except where they are contained entirely within a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: In kitchens containing commercial cooking equipment used in processes producing grease-laden vapours, the equipment shall be designed and installed in conformance with Article 6.3.1.7. (See Note A-9.10.1.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: In kitchens containing commercial cooking equipment used in processes producing grease-laden vapours, the equipment shall be designed and installed in conformance with Part 6. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.10.2.2., every building or part thereof shall be classified according to its major occupancy as belonging to one of the groups or divisions described in Table 9.10.2.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Every building or part of it shall be classified according to its major occupancy as belonging to one of the groups or divisions described in Table 9.10.2.1.

National Article Title: Major Occupancies above Other Major Occupancies
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.2.4., in any building containing more than one major occupancy in which one major occupancy is located entirely above another, the requirements of Article 9.10.8.1. for each portion of the building containing a major occupancy shall be applied to that portion as if the entire building was of that major occupancy.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.2.3. Major Occupancies Above Other Major Occupancies
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.2.4., in any building containing more than 1 major occupancy in which one major occupancy is located entirely above another, the requirements of Article 9.10.8.1. for each portion of the building containing a major occupancy shall be applied to that portion as if the entire building was of that major occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Where a ceiling construction has a suspended membrane ceiling with lay-in panels or tiles which contribute to the required fire-resistance rating, hold down clips or other means shall be provided to prevent the lifting of such panels or tiles in the event of a fire.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a ceiling construction has a suspended membrane ceiling with lay-in panels or tiles that contribute to the required fire-resistance rating, hold down clips or other means shall be provided to prevent the lifting of such panels or tiles in the event of a fire.

National Article Title: More Than One Level of Mezzanine
National Sentence Text: Each level of mezzanine that is partly or wholly superimposed above the first level of mezzanine shall be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.4.2. More Than One Level of Mezzanine
P/T Sentence Text: Where more than 1 level of mezzanine is provided in a storey, each level additional to the first shall be considered as a storey.
Variation Label: More Than One Level of Mezzanine

National Sentence Text: Roof-top enclosures provided for elevator machinery, stairways or service rooms, used for no purpose other than for service to the building, shall not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.
P/T Sentence Text: Rooftop enclosures provided for elevator machinery, stairways or service rooms, used for no purpose other than for service to the building, shall not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.

National Article Title: Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
National Sentence Text: Where boxes referred to in Sentence 9.10.5.1. are located on both sides of walls required to provide a fire-resistance rating, they shall be offset where necessary to maintain the integrity of the fire separation.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.5.1. Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
P/T Sentence Text: Where boxes referred to in Sentence  are located on both sides of walls required to provide a fire-resistance rating, they shall be offset where necessary to maintain the integrity of the fire separation.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 3.2.2.3., structural steel members used in construction required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be protected to provide the required fire-resistance rating.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.2.2.3., structural steel members used in construction required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be protected to provide the required fire-resistance rating.

National Article Title: Fire-Resistance Ratings for Floors and Roofs
National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, the fire-resistance ratings of floors and roofs shall conform to Table 9.10.8.1. (See Subsection 9.10.2. for mixed occupancies and Subsection 9.10.21. for construction camps.)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.8.1. Fire-Resistance Ratings for Floors and Roofs
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, the fire-resistance ratings of floors and roofs shall conform to TableÃ 9.10.8.1.
Variation Label: Fire-Resistance Ratings for Floors and Roofs

National Sentence Text: No fire-resistance rating is required for floors of exterior passageways serving a house with a secondary suite, or a single dwelling unit where no suite is located above or below the dwelling unit (see also Sentence 9.9.9.3.(2)).
P/T Sentence Text: No fire-resistance rating is required for floors of exterior passageways serving,  a house or an individual dwelling unit in a house, or  an individual dwelling unit in a building other than a house where no suite is located above or below the dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Table 9.10.8.1. does not apply to a dwelling unit that has no other dwelling unit above or below it, houses with a secondary suite, where the floor framing is protected on the underside by a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board, or a dwelling unit that is not above or below another major occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: Table 9.10.8.1. does not apply to houses.

National Sentence Text: Floor assemblies contained within dwelling units and within houses with a secondary suite need not be constructed as fire separations.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor assemblies contained within dwelling units need not be constructed as fire separations.

National Sentence Text: Penetrations of a firewall shall be sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in ULC CAN/ULC-S115-11 Fire Tests of Firestop Systems has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating for the fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Penetrations of a firewall shall be sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in CAN/ULC-S115, "Fire Tests of Firestop Systems", has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating for the fire separation.

National Sentence Text: Single conductor metal-sheathed cables with combustible jacketting that are more than 25 mm in overall diameter are permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), provided the cables are not grouped and are spaced a minimum of 300 mm apart.
P/T Sentence Text: Single conductor metal-sheathed cables with combustible jacketing that are more than 25 mm in overall diameter are permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence , provided the cables are not grouped and are spaced a minimum of 300 mm apart.

National Sentence Text: Electrical wires or cables, single or grouped, with combustible insulation or jacketting that is not totally enclosed in raceways of noncombustible material, are permitted to partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), provided the overall diameter of the wiring is not more than 25 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical wires or cables, single or grouped, with combustible insulation or jacketing that is not totally enclosed in raceways of noncombustible material, are permitted to partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence , provided the overall diameter of the wiring is not more than 25 mm.

National Sentence Text: Combustible totally enclosed raceways which are embedded in a concrete floor slab are permitted in an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), where the concrete provides not less than 50 mm of cover between the raceway and the bottom of the slab.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible totally enclosed raceways that are embedded in a concrete floor slab are permitted in an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence , where the concrete provides at least 50 mm of cover between the raceway and the bottom of the slab.

National Sentence Text: Sprinklers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence 9.10.9.6.(1), provided the annular space created by the penetration of a fire sprinkler is covered by a metal escutcheon plate in accordance with NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Sprinklers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence , provided the annular space created by the penetration of a fire sprinkler is covered by a metal escutcheon plate in accordance with NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems".

National Article Title: Combustible Drain, Waste and Vent Piping
National Sentence Text: The rating referred to in Sentence 9.10.9.7. shall be based on ULC CAN/ULC-S115-11 Fire Tests of Firestop Systems with a pressure differential of 50 Pa between the exposed and unexposed sides, with the higher pressure on the exposed side.
P/T Sentence Text: The rating referred to in Sentence  shall be based on CAN/ULC-S115, "Fire Tests of Firestop Systems", with a pressure differential of 50 Pa between the exposed and unexposed sides, with the higher pressure on the exposed side.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.10.(2), a horizontal service space or other concealed space located above a required vertical fire separation shall be divided at the fire separation by an equivalent fire separation within the space.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , a horizontal service space or other concealed space located above a required vertical fire separation shall be divided at the fire separation by an equivalent fire separation within the space.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.11.(2), residential occupancies shall be separated from all other major occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , residential occupancies shall be separated from all other major occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.11.(3), a major occupancy classified as a residential occupancy shall be separated from other major occupancies classified as mercantile or medium-hazard industrial occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , a major occupancy classified as a residential occupancy, including live/work units, shall be separated from other major occupancies classified as mercantile or medium hazard industrial occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Not more than one suite of residential occupancy shall be contained within a building classified as a Group F, Division 2 major occupancy.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.9.12.  Residential Suites, Live/Work Units and Industrial
P/T Sentence Text: Except where a Group F Division 2 major occupancy is directly related to live/work units, not more than one suite of residential occupancy shall be contained within a building classified as Group F, Division 2 major occupancy.
Variation Label: Residential Suites, Live/Work Units and Industrial

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Article 9.10.9.14. and as permitted by Sentence 9.10.9.13.(2), each suite in other than business and personal services occupancies shall be separated from adjoining suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Article 9.10.9.14. and as permitted by Sentence , each suite in other than business and personal services occupancies shall be separated from adjoining suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: In other than residential occupancies, no fire-resistance rating is required for fire separations between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if the floor area is sprinklered, the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3), and the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: In other than residential occupancies, no fire-resistance rating is required for fire separations between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if, the floor area is sprinklered,  the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.10.(3), and  the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.8.(4).

National Sentence Text: In other than residential occupancies, no fire separation is required between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if the floor area is sprinklered, the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3), the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4), and the corridor exceeds 5 m in width.
P/T Sentence Text: In other than residential occupancies, no fire separation is required between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if, the floor area is sprinklered,  the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.10.(3),  the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.8.(4), and  the corridor exceeds 5 m in width.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.9.16.(3), storage garages containing 5 motor vehicles or fewer shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation of not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , storage garages containing 5 motor vehicles or fewer shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation of not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Ancillary spaces directly serving a repair garage, including waiting rooms, reception rooms, tool and parts storage areas and supervisory office space, need not be separated from the repair garage but shall be separated from other occupancies as required in Sentence 9.10.9.17.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Ancillary spaces directly serving a repair garage, including waiting rooms, reception rooms, tool and parts storage areas and supervisory office space, need not be separated from the repair garage but shall be separated from other occupancies as required in Sentence .

National Sentence Text: The fire separation referred to in Sentence 9.10.9.17. shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h, where the building is not more than one storey in building height, the building is operated as a single suite, and the only occupancy other than the repair garage is a mercantile occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation referred to in Sentence  shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h, where,  the building is not more than one storey in building height,  the building is operated as a single suite, and  the only occupancy other than the repair garage is a mercantile occupancy.

National Article Title: Exhaust Ducts Serving More Than One Fire Compartment
National Sentence Text: Individual fire compartments referred to in Sentence 9.10.9.18. shall not have fans that exhaust directly into the duct in the vertical service space.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.9.18. Exhaust Ducts Serving More Than One Fire Compartment
P/T Sentence Text: Individual fire compartments referred to in Sentence  shall not have fans that exhaust directly into the duct in the vertical service space.

National Sentence Text: A central vacuum system shall serve not more than one suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 9.10.18.7.(1), a central vacuum system shall serve not more than one suite.

National Sentence Text: Where a room contains a limited quantity of service equipment and the service equipment does not constitute a fire hazard, the requirements in Sentence 9.10.10.3. shall not apply.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a room contains a limited quantity of service equipment and the service equipment does not constitute a fire hazard, the requirements in Sentence  shall not apply.

National Sentence Text: Sentence 9.10.10.4. does not apply to fireplaces and cooking appliances.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.10.4. Appliances and Equipment to be Located in a Service
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  does not apply to fireplaces and cooking appliances.

National Sentence Text: The design, construction, installation and alteration of each indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82-2014 Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: The design, construction, installation and alteration of each indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82, "Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment".

National Article Title: Solid Core Wood Door as a Closure
National Sentence Text: Doors described in Sentence 9.10.13.2. shall have not more than a 6 mm clearance beneath and not more than 3 mm at the sides and top.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.13.2. Solid Core Wood Door as a Closure
P/T Sentence Text: Doors described in Sentence  shall have not more than a 6 mm clearance beneath and not more than 3 mm at the sides and top.

National Sentence Text: Wired glass conforming to Article 9.6.1.2. which has not been tested in accordance with Article 9.10.3.1. is permitted as a closure in a vertical fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating of not more than 1 h provided such glass is not less than 6 mm thick and is mounted in conformance with Sentence 9.10.13.5.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Wired glass conforming to Article 9.6.1.2. that has not been tested in accordance with Article 9.10.3.1. is permitted as a closure in a vertical fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating of not more than 1 h provided such glass is not less than 6 mm thick and is mounted in conformance with Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Steel door frames forming part of a closure in a fire separation, including anchorage requirements, shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S105-16 Fire Door Frames Meeting the Performance Required by CAN/ULC-S104
P/T Sentence Text: Steel door frames forming part of a closure in a fire separation, including anchorage requirements, shall conform to CAN/ULC-S105, "Fire Door Frames Meeting the Performance Required by CAN/ULC-S104".

National Sentence Text: Except as described in Sentence 9.10.13.10.(2), every door in a fire separation shall have a self-closing device.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as described in Sentence , every door in a fire separation shall have a self-closing device.

National Sentence Text: Self-closing doors are not required between public corridors and suites in business and personal services occupancies, except in dead-end corridors.
P/T Sentence Text: Self-closing devices are not required between public corridors and suites in business and personal services occupancies, except in, dead-end corridors, or  a corridor that serves a hotel.

National Article Title: Doors between Garages and Dwelling Units
National Sentence Text: A door between an attached or built-in garage and a dwelling unit shall be tight fitting and weather-stripped to provide an effective barrier against the passage of gas and exhaust fumes and shall be fitted with a self-closing device.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.13.15. Doors Between Garages and Houses or Dwelling Units
P/T Sentence Text: A door between an attached or built-in garage and the house or the individual dwelling unit it serves shall be tight-fitting and weatherstripped to provide an effective barrier against the passage of gases and exhaust fumes and shall be fitted with a self-closing device.
Variation Label: Doors Between Garages and Houses or Dwelling Units

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: The area of an exposing building face shall be taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a building, and calculated as the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, or the area for each fire compartment, where a building is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.2. Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
P/T Sentence Text: The area of an exposing building face shall be, taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a building, and  calculated as,  the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, or  the area for each fire compartment, where a building is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min.

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.14.4.-A to determine the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.2. Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.14.4. to determine the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings permitted in an irregularly-shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which limiting distance is measured.
Variation Label: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face

National Sentence Text: Openings in a wall having a limiting distance of less than 1.2 m shall be protected by closures, of other than wired glass or glass block, whose fire-protection rating is in conformance with the fire-resistance rating required for the wall. (See Table 9.10.13.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.6.(1), openings in a wall having a limiting distance of less than 1.2 m shall be protected by closures, of other than wired glass or glass block, whose fire protection rating is in conformance with the fire-resistance rating required for the wall.

National Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings shall be not more than twice the area determined according to Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), where the unprotected openings are glazed with wired glass in steel frames, as described in Article 9.10.13.5., or glass blocks, as described in Article 9.10.13.7.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings shall be not more than twice the area determined according to Sentence  where the unprotected openings are glazed with,  wired glass in steel frames as described in Article 9.10.13.5., or  glass blocks, as described in Article 9.10.13.7.

National Sentence Text: Where the building is sprinklered, the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings shall be not more than twice the area determined according to Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), provided all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, that are adjacent to the exposing building face and that have unprotected openings are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exemptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.12.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the building is sprinklered, the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings shall be not more than twice the area determined according to Sentence  provided all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, that are adjacent to the exposing building face and that have unprotected openings are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exemptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.13.

National Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storage garage need not comply with Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), where all storeys are constructed as open-air storeys, and the storage garage has a limiting distance of not less than 3 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storage garage need not comply with Sentence  where,  all storeys are constructed as open-air storeys, and  the storage garage has a limiting distance of not less than 3 m.

National Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storey that faces a street and is at the same level as the street need not comply with Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), where the limiting distance is not less than 9 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storey that faces a street and is the same level as the street need not comply with Sentence  where the limiting distance is not less than 9 m.

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.5.(5), where a garage or accessory building serves one dwelling unit only and is detached from any building, the exposing building face need not conform to the minimum required fire-resistance rating stated in Table 9.10.14.5.-A, where the limiting distance is 0.6 m or more, shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min, where the limiting distance is less than 0.6 m, and need not conform to the type of cladding required by Table 9.10.14.5.-A, regardless of the limiting distance.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , where a garage or accessory building serves a house or an individual dwelling unit in a house and is detached from the house and any other building, the exposing building face, need not conform to the minimum required fire-resistance rating in Table 9.10.14.5., where the limiting distance is 0.6 m or more,  shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min where the limiting distance is less than 0.6 m, and  need not conform to the type of cladding required in Table 9.10.14.5. regardless of the limiting distance.
Variation Label: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
National Sentence Text: The requirements regarding fire-resistance rating, type of construction and type of cladding need not apply to the exposing building face of a detached garage or accessory building facing a dwelling unit, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements for fire-resistance rating, type of construction and type of cladding need not apply to the exposing building faces of a house and a detached garage or accessory building that face each other, where, the detached garage or accessory building serves the house or an individual dwelling unit in the house,  the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as the house, and  the house is the only major occupancy on the property.
Variation Label: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.5.(7), combustible projections on the exterior of a wall that are more than 1 m above ground level and that could expose an adjacent building to fire spread shall not be permitted within 1.2 m of a property line or the centre line of a public way, or 2.4 m of a combustible projection on another building on the same property.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls
P/T Sentence Text: Except for houses, combustible projections on the exterior of a wall that are more than 1 000 mm above ground level, such as balconies, platforms, canopies, eave projections and stairs, and that could expose an adjacent building to fire spread, shall not be permitted within, 1.2 m of a property line or the centre line of a public way, or  2.4 m of a combustible projection on another building on the same property.
Variation Label: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
National Sentence Text: Heavy timber and steel columns need not conform to the requirements of Sentence 9.10.14.5.(1), provided the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls
P/T Sentence Text: Heavy timber and steel columns need not conform to the requirements of Sentence  provided the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.15.4. to determine the maximum permitted area of glazed openings in an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no glazed openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.15.2. Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.15.4. to determine the maximum permitted area of glazed openings in an irregularly-shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no glazed openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured.

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: In determining the required cladding-sheathing assembly and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that no portion of the actual exposing building face is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Article 9.10.15.5. and Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.15.2. Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
P/T Sentence Text: In determining the required cladding-sheathing assembly and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly-shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that no portion of the actual exposing building face is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured.

National Article Title: Glazed Openings in Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: The limits on the area of glazed openings shall not apply to the exposing building face of a dwelling unit facing a detached garage or accessory building, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.15.4. Glazed Openings in Exposing Building Face
P/T Sentence Text: The limits on the area of glazed openings shall not apply to the exposing building face of a house facing a detached garage or accessory building, where,  the detached garage or accessory building serves the house or an individual dwelling unit in the house,  the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as the house, and  the house is the only major occupancy on the property.
Variation Label: Glazed Openings in Exposing Building Face

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.5.(5), where a garage or accessory building serves one dwelling unit only and is detached from any building, the exposing building face need not conform to the minimum required fire-resistance rating stated in Table 9.10.14.5.-A, where the limiting distance is 0.6 m or more, shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min, where the limiting distance is less than 0.6 m, and need not conform to the type of cladding required by Table 9.10.14.5.-A, regardless of the limiting distance.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.15.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  does not apply where, the limiting distance is not less than 1.2 m,  the limiting distance is less than 1.2 m but not less than 0.6 m, provided that the exposing building face has a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min, or  the limiting distance is less than 0.6 m, provided that the exposing building face has a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min and is clad with noncombustible material.
Variation Label: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
National Sentence Text: The requirements regarding fire-resistance rating and type of cladding-sheathing assembly shall not apply to the exposing building face or projections from an exposing building face of a dwelling unit facing a detached garage or accessory building, or a garage or accessory building facing a dwelling unit, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.15.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements for fire-resistance rating, type of construction and type of cladding need not apply to the exposing building faces of a house and a detached garage or accessory building that face each other, where, the detached garage or accessory building serves the house or an individual dwelling unit in the house,  the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as the house, and  the house is the only major occupancy on the property.
Variation Label: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Horizontal concealed spaces in attics, roof spaces, ceilings, floors, and crawl spaces shall be separated by fire blocks one from the other, and from vertical concealed spaces.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.16.1. Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: Concealed spaces in interior walls, ceilings, floors and crawl spaces shall be separated by fire blocks from concealed spaces in exterior walls and attic or roof spaces.
Variation Label: Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Unsprinklered concealed spaces of combustible construction created by a ceiling, roof space or unoccupied attic space shall be separated by fire blocks into compartments not more than 60 m in greatest dimension, and where such space contains exposed construction materials having a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25, not more than 300 m2 in area.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.16.1. Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: Unsprinklered concealed spaces of combustible construction created by a ceiling, roof space or unoccupied attic space shall be separated by fire blocks into, compartments having no dimension greater than 60 m, if such space contains exposed construction materials having a surface flame-spread rating of 25 or less, and  compartments of not more than 300 mÃÂ² in area, if such space contains exposed construction materials having a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25.

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Wall Assemblies
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.16.2.(2), fire blocks shall be provided to block off concealed spaces within wall assemblies, including spaces created by furring, at each floor level, at each ceiling level where the ceiling contributes to part of the required fire-resistance rating, and at other locations within the wall, so that the distance between fire blocks does not exceed 20 m horizontally and 3 m vertically.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.16.2. Required Fire Blocks in Wall Assemblies
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , fire blocks shall be provided to block off concealed spaces within wall assemblies, including spaces created by furring, at each floor level,  at each ceiling level where the ceiling contributes to part of the required fire-resistance rating, and  at other locations within the wall, so that the distance between fire blocks does not exceed 20 m horizontally and 3 m vertically.

National Sentence Text: In a building permitted to be of combustible construction, semi-rigid fibre insulation board produced from glass, rock or slag is permitted to be used to block the vertical space in a double-frame wall assembly formed at the intersection of the floor assembly and the walls, provided the width of the vertical space does not exceed 25 mm and the insulation board has a density not less than 45 kg/m3, is securely fastened to one set of studs, extends from below the bottom of the top plates in the lower storey to above the top of the bottom plate in the upper storey, and completely fills the portion of the vertical space between the headers and between the wall plates. (See Note A-3.1.11.7.(7).)
P/T Sentence Text: In a building permitted to be of combustible construction, semi-rigid fibre insulation board produced from glass, rock or slag, is permitted to be used to block the vertical space in a double-frame wall assembly formed at the intersection of the floor assembly and the walls, provided the width of the vertical space is not more than 25 mm and the insulation board, has a density not less than 45 kg/m3,  is securely fastened to one set of studs,  extends from below the bottom of the top plates in the lower storey to above the top of the bottom plate in the upper storey, and  completely fills the nominal gap of 25 mm between the headers and between the wall plates.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.17.1.(3), doors need not conform to Sentence 9.10.17.1. provided they have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 200.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , doors need not conform to Sentence  provided they have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 200.

National Article Title: Ceilings in Exits or Public Corridors
National Sentence Text: At least 90% of the exposed surface of every ceiling in an exit or unsprinklered ceiling in a public corridor shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See Article 9.10.17.6.)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.17.2. Ceilings in Exits or Public Corridors
P/T Sentence Text: At least 90% of the exposed surface of every ceiling in an exit or unsprinklered ceiling in a public corridor shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25.

National Sentence Text: At least 75% of the wall surface of a lobby used as an exit in Article 9.9.8.5. shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See Article 9.10.17.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: At least 75% of the wall surface of a lobby used as an exit in Article 9.9.8.5. shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25.

National Sentence Text: At least 90% of the total wall surface in any unsprinklered public corridor shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 75, or at least 90% of the upper half of such walls shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See Article 9.10.17.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: At least 90% of the total wall surface in any unsprinklered public corridor shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 75, or at least 90% of the upper half of such walls shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25.

National Sentence Text: Thermosetting foamed plastic insulation having a flame-spread rating of not more than 200 is permitted to be used in factory-assembled doors in storage garages serving single dwelling units provided that the insulation is covered on the interior with a metallic foil, the assembly has a flame-spread rating of not more than 200, and the assembly incorporates no air spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Thermosetting foamed plastic insulation having a flame-spread rating of not more than 200 is permitted to be used in factory-assembled doors in storage garages serving buildings of residential occupancy provided that, the insulation is covered on the interior with a metallic foil,  the assembly has a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 200, and  the assembly incorporates no air spaces.

National Sentence Text: Where a covering or a lining is used with a duct, such lining or covering shall have a flame-spread rating conforming to Article 3.6.5.4. or Article 9.33.6.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a covering or a lining is used with a duct, such lining or covering shall have a flame-spread rating conforming to Part 6.

National Sentence Text: A fire alarm system is not required in a storage garage conforming to Article 3.2.2.90. provided there are no other occupancies in the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Article 9.10.18.1., a fire alarm system is not required in a storage garage conforming to ArticleÃ 3.2.2.83. provided there are no other occupancies in the building.

National Sentence Text: The sound patterns of smoke alarms shall meet the temporal patterns of alarm signals (see Note A-3.2.4.18.(2)), or be a combination of temporal pattern and voice relay.
P/T Sentence Text: The sound patterns of smoke alarms shall, meet the temporal patterns of alarm signals, or (See A-3.2.4.20. in Appendix A.)  be a combination of temporal pattern and voice relay.

National Sentence Text: Suites of residential occupancy equipped with smoke detectors installed to ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systems which are part of the fire alarm system in lieu of smoke alarms as permitted in Sentence 9.10.19.4.(3), need not incorporate the manually operated device required in Sentence 9.10.19.6.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Suites of residential occupancy equipped with smoke detectors installed to CAN/ULC-S524, "Installation of Fire Alarm Systems", which are part of the fire alarm system in lieu of smoke alarms as permitted in Sentence 9.10.19.4.(3), need not incorporate the manually operated device required in Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.20.1.(3), a window or access panel providing an opening not less than 1 100 mm high and 550 mm wide and having a sill height of not more than 900 mm above the floor shall be provided on the second and third storeys of every building in at least one wall facing on a street if such storeys are not sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , a window or access panel providing an opening not less than 1 100 mm high and 550 mm wide and having a sill height of not more than 900 mm above the floor shall be provided on the second and third storeys of every building in at least one wall facing on a street if such storeys are not sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Access panels required in Sentence 9.10.20.1. shall be readily openable from both inside and outside or be glazed with plain glass.
P/T Sentence Text: Access panels required in Sentence  shall be readily openable from both inside and outside or be glazed with plain glass.

National Sentence Text: Except for basements in houses with a secondary suite or basements serving not more than one dwelling unit, each unsprinklered basement exceeding 25 m in length or width shall be provided with direct access to the outdoors to at least one street.
P/T Sentence Text: Except in basements of houses, each unsprinklered basement exceeding 25 m in length or width shall be provided with direct access to the outdoors to at least one street.

National Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers shall be installed in all buildings, except within dwelling units, in conformance with the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, the NFC.
P/T Sentence Text: Portable fire extinguishers shall be installed in all buildings, except within dwelling units, in conformance with the provisions of the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997.

National Sentence Text: Construction camp buildings shall be separated from each other by a distance of not less than 10 m except as otherwise permitted in Subsections 9.10.14. and 9.10.15.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings in a camp for housing of workers shall be separated from each other by a distance of not less than 10 m unless otherwise permitted in Subsection 9.10.14.

National Sentence Text: Except in dwelling units, corridors providing access to exit from sleeping rooms in construction camp buildings with sleeping accommodation for more than 10 persons shall be provided with a smoke detector connected to the building alarm system.
P/T Sentence Text: Except in dwelling units, corridors providing access to exit from sleeping rooms in every building in a camp for housing of workers with sleeping accommodation for more than 10 persons shall have a smoke detector connected to the building alarm system.

National Sentence Text: Every construction camp building providing sleeping accommodation for more than 30 persons shall be provided with a hose station that is protected from freezing and is equipped with a hose of sufficient length so that every portion of the building is within reach of a hose stream.
P/T Sentence Text: Every building in a camp for housing of workers providing sleeping accommodation for more than 30 persons shall be provided with a hose station that is protected from freezing and equipped with a hose of sufficient length so that every portion of the building is within the range of a hose stream.

National Sentence Text: Hose stations required in Sentence 9.10.21.9. shall be located near an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Hose stations required in Sentence  shall be located near an exit.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.22.2.(2), framing, finishes and cabinetry installed directly above the location of the cooktop shall be not less than 750 mm above the level of cooktop burners or elements.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , framing, finishes and cabinetry installed directly above the location of the cooktop shall be not less than 750 mm above the level of cooktop burners or elements.

National Sentence Text: Construction separating a dwelling unit from an elevator shaft or refuse chute shall have an STC rating of not less than 55.
P/T Sentence Text: Construction separating a dwelling unit or suite in a hotel from an elevator shaft or refuse chute shall have an STC rating of at least 55.

National Sentence Text: The STC ratings shall be determined in accordance with ASTM E 413-10 Classification for Rating Sound Insulation using the results from measurements carried out in accordance with ASTM E 90-09 Laboratory Measurement of Airborne Sound Transmission Loss of Building Partitions and Elements
P/T Sentence Text: The STC ratings shall be determined in accordance with ASTM E413, "Classification for Rating Sound Insulation", using the results from measurements carried out in accordance with ASTM E90, "Laboratory Measurement of Airborne Sound Transmission Loss of Building Partitions and Elements".

National Sentence Text: The foundation depths required in Sentence 9.12.2.2. are permitted to be decreased where experience with local soil conditions shows that lesser depths are satisfactory, or where the foundation is designed for lesser depths.
P/T Sentence Text: The foundation depths required in Sentence  are permitted to be decreased where experience with local soil conditions shows that lesser depths are satisfactory, or where the foundation is designed for lesser depths.

National Sentence Text: Backfill shall be placed to avoid damaging the foundation wall, the drainage tile, externally applied thermal insulation and waterproofing or dampproofing of the wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Backfill shall be placed to avoid damaging the foundation wall, the drainage tile, drainage layer, externally applied thermal insulation, waterproofing and dampproofing of the wall.

National Sentence Text: Backfill that is within 600 mm of the foundation shall be free of deleterious debris and boulders larger than 250 mm diam. (See Note A-9.12.3.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Backfill within 600 mm of the foundation shall be free of deleterious debris and boulders larger than 250 mm diam. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.12.3.3.(3), backfill shall not contain pyritic material or material that is susceptible to ice lensing in concentrations that will damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies. (See Note A-9.4.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , backfill shall not contain pyritic material or material that is susceptible to ice lensing in concentrations that will damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies separating dissimilar environments. (See A-9.4.4.4. in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: This Section presents measures to control the ingress of water, moisture and soil gas.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section prescribes measures to control the ingress of water, moisture and soil gas.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.13.2.1. and Article 9.13.3.1., floors-on-ground shall be dampproofed.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence  and Article 9.13.3.1., floors-on-ground shall be dampproofed.

National Sentence Text: Materials installed to provide required dampproofing shall be capable of protecting assemblies against moisture transfer from the ground, compatible with adjoining materials, and resistant to mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected, given the nature, function and exposure of the materials.
P/T Sentence Text: Materials installed to provide required dampproofing shall be, capable of protecting assemblies against moisture transfer from the ground,  compatible with adjoining materials, and  resistant to mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected, given the nature, function and exposure of the materials.

National Sentence Text: The surface required to be dampproofed shall be clean and dry and free of ice, snow, frost, dust, dirt, oil, grease, cracks, projections and depressions, loose particles and debris that could be detrimental to the performance of the material to be applied.
P/T Sentence Text: The surface required to be dampproofed shall be clean and dry and free of ice, snow, frost, dust, dirt, oil, grease, cracks, projections, depressions, loose particles and debris that could be detrimental to the performance of the membrane to be applied.

National Sentence Text: The interior surface of foundation walls below ground level shall be protected by means that minimize the ingress of moisture from the foundation wall into interior spaces, where a separate interior finish is applied to a concrete or unit masonry wall that is in contact with the soil, or wood members are placed in contact with such walls for the installation of insulation or finish.
P/T Article Title: 9.13.2.5. Moisture Protection for Interior Finishes (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: The interior surface of foundation walls below ground level shall be protected by means that minimize the ingress of moisture from the foundation wall into interior spaces where, a separate interior finish is applied to a concrete or unit masonry wall that is in contact with the soil, or  wood members are placed in contact with such walls for the installation of insulation or finish.

National Sentence Text: Where dampproofing is installed below the floor, it shall consist of polyethylene not less than 0.15 mm thick with joints lapped not less than 100 mm, type S roll roofing with joints lapped not less than 100 mm, or rigid extruded/expanded polystyrene with sealed or ship-lapped joints that has sufficient compressive strength to support the floor assembly, and a water vapour permeance complying with Clause 9.13.2.2.(2)(a).
P/T Sentence Text: Where dampproofing is installed below the floor, it shall consist of, polyethylene not less than 0.15 mm thick with joints lapped not less than 100 mm,  Type S roll roofing with joints lapped not less than 100 mm, or  rigid extruded/expanded polystyrene with sealed or ship-lapped joints that has,  sufficient compressive strength to support the floor assembly, and  a water vapour permeance complying with Clause 9.13.2.2.(2)(b). (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Materials installed to provide required waterproofing shall be compatible with adjoining materials, and resistant to mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected, given the nature, function and exposure of the materials.
P/T Sentence Text: Materials installed to provide required waterproofing shall be, compatible with adjoining materials, and  resistant to mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected, given the nature, function and exposure of the materials.

National Sentence Text: Unless it can be shown to be unnecessary, the bottom of every exterior foundation wall shall be drained by drainage tile or pipe laid around the exterior of the foundation in conformance with Subsection 9.14.3. or by a layer of gravel or crushed rock in conformance with Subsection 9.14.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless it can be shown to be unnecessary, drainage shall be provided at the bottom of every foundation wall that contains the building interior.

National Sentence Text: The top half of joints referred to in Sentence 9.14.3.3. shall be covered with sheathing paper, 0.10 mm polyethylene or No. 15 asphalt or tar-saturated felt.
P/T Sentence Text: The top half of joints referred to in Sentence  shall be covered with sheathing paper, 0.10 mm polyethylene or No.Ã 15 asphalt or tar-saturated felt.

National Sentence Text: Where because of wet site conditions soil becomes mixed with the granular drainage material, sufficient additional granular material shall be provided so that the top 125 mm are kept free of soil.
P/T Sentence Text: Where because of wet site conditions soil becomes mixed with the granular drainage material, sufficient additional granular material shall be provided so that the top 125 mm is kept free of soil.

National Sentence Text: Where gravity drainage is not practical, an automatic sump pump shall be provided to discharge the water from the sump pit described in Sentence 9.14.5.2. into a sewer, drainage ditch or dry well.
P/T Sentence Text: Where gravity drainage is not practical, a covered sump with an automatic pump shall be installed to discharge the water into a sewer, drainage ditch or dry well.

National Sentence Text: Covers for sump pits shall be designed to resist removal by children, and to be airtight in accordance with Sentence 9.25.3.3.(7).
P/T Sentence Text: Covers for sump pits shall be, designed to resist removal by children, and  sealed in accordance with Sentence 9.25.3.3.(16).

National Sentence Text: Dry wells may be used only when located in areas where the natural groundwater level is below the bottom of the dry well.
P/T Sentence Text: Dry wells are permitted to be used only when located in areas where the natural groundwater level is below the bottom of the dry well.

National Sentence Text: The building shall be located or the building site graded so that water will not accumulate at or near the building.
P/T Sentence Text: The building shall be located or the building site graded so that water will not accumulate at or near the building and will not adversely affect adjacent properties.

National Article Title: Drainage away from Wells or Septic Disposal Beds
National Sentence Text: Surface drainage shall be directed away from the location of a water supply well or septic tank disposal bed.
P/T Article Title: 9.14.6.2. Drainage away from Wells or Leaching Beds
P/T Sentence Text: Surface drainage shall be directed away from the location of a water supply well or leaching bed.
Variation Label: Drainage away from Wells or Leaching Beds

National Sentence Text: Concrete block shall conform to CSA A165.1-14 Concrete Block Masonry Units and shall have a compressive strength over the average net cross-sectional area of the block of not less than 15 MPa.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete block shall conform to CSA A165.1, "Concrete Block Masonry Units", and shall have a compressive strength over the average net cross-sectional area of the block of not less than 15 MPa.

National Sentence Text: For concrete block foundation walls required to be reinforced, mortar shall be Type S, conforming to CSA A179-14 Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry grout shall be coarse, conforming to CSA A179-14 Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry and placement of grout shall conform to CSA A371-14 Masonry Construction for Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: For concrete block foundation walls required to be reinforced, mortar shall be Type S, conforming to CSA A179, "Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry",  grout shall be coarse, conforming to CSA A179, "Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry", and  placement of grout shall conform to CSA A371, "Masonry Construction for Buildings".

National Sentence Text: The height of piers described in Sentence 9.15.2.3. shall not exceed 3 times their least dimension at the base of the pier.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of piers described in Sentence  shall not exceed 3 times their least dimension at the base of the pier.

National Sentence Text: Where concrete block is used for piers described in Sentence 9.15.2.3.(2), they shall be laid with cores placed vertically, and where the width of the building is 4.3 m or less, placed with their longest dimension at right angles to the longest dimension of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Where concrete block is used for piers described in Sentence , they shall be laid with cores placed vertically, and where the width of the building is 4.3 m or less, placed with their longest dimension at right angles to the longest dimension of the building.

National Sentence Text: Footings shall be provided under walls, pilasters, columns, piers, fireplaces and chimneys that bear on soil or rock, except that footings may be omitted under piers or monolithic concrete walls if the safe loadbearing capacity of the soil or rock is not exceeded.
P/T Sentence Text: Footings shall be provided under walls, pilasters, columns, piers, fireplaces and chimneys that bear on soil or rock, except that footings are permitted to be omitted under piers or monolithic concrete walls if the safe loadbearing capacity of the soil or rock is not exceeded.

National Sentence Text: Granular fill shall not contain pyritic material in a concentration that will damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies. (See also Article 9.4.4.4. and Note A-9.4.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Granular fill shall not contain pyritic material in a concentration that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies separating dissimilar environments.

National Article Title: Adjustments to Footing Widths for Exterior Walls
National Sentence Text: The strip footing widths for exterior walls shown in Table 9.15.3.4. shall be increased by 65 mm for each storey of masonry veneer over wood-frame construction supported by the foundation wall, 130 mm for each storey of masonry construction supported by the foundation wall, and 150 mm for each storey of flat insulating concrete form wall construction supported by the foundation wall.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.3.5. Adjustments to Footing Widths for Exterior Walls
P/T Sentence Text: The strip footing widths for exterior walls shown in Table 9.15.3.4. shall be increased by, 65 mm for each storey of masonry veneer over wood frame construction supported by the foundation wall,  130 mm for each storey of masonry construction supported by the foundation wall, and  150 mm for each storey of flat insulating concrete form wall construction supported by the foundation wall.

National Sentence Text: Where step footings are used, the vertical rise between horizontal portions shall not exceed 600 mm, and the horizontal distance between risers shall not be less than 600 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where step footings are used, the vertical rise between horizontal portions shall not exceed 600 mm, and  the horizontal distance between risers shall be not less than 600 mm.

National Sentence Text: Insulating concrete form units shall be manufactured of polystyrene conforming to the performance requirements of ULC CAN/ULC-S701.1-17 Thermal Insulation, Polystyrene Boards for Type 2, 3 or 4 polystyrene.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulating concrete form units shall be manufactured of polystyrene conforming to the performance requirements of CAN/ULC-S701.1, "Thermal Insulation, Polystyrene Boards", for Type 2, 3 or 4 polystyrene.

National Article Title: Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.15.4.2.(2), the thickness of foundation walls made of unreinforced concrete block or solid concrete and subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to Table 9.15.4.2.-A for walls not exceeding 3.0 m in unsupported height.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.2. Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence , the thickness of foundation walls made of unreinforced concrete block or solid concrete and subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to Table 9.15.4.2.A. for walls not exceeding 3.0 m in unsupported height.

National Article Title: Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
National Sentence Text: The thickness of concrete in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be not less than the greater of 140 mm, or the thickness of the concrete in the wall above.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.2. Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness of concrete in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be not less than the greater of, 140 mm, or  the thickness of the concrete in the wall above.

National Article Title: Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
National Sentence Text: For concrete block walls required to be reinforced, continuous vertical reinforcement shall be provided at wall corners, wall ends, wall intersections, at changes in wall height, at the jambs of all openings and at movement joints, extend from the top of the footing to the top of the foundation wall, and where foundation walls are laterally supported at the top, have not less than 50 mm embedment into the footing, if the floor slab does not provide lateral support at the wall base.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.2. Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
P/T Sentence Text: For concrete block walls required to be reinforced, continuous vertical reinforcement shall, be provided at wall corners, wall ends, wall intersections, at changes in wall height, at the jambs of all openings and at movement joints,  extend from the top of the footing to the top of the foundation wall, and  where foundation walls are laterally supported at the top, have not less than 50 mm embedment into the footing, if the floor slab does not provide lateral support at the wall base.

National Article Title: Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
National Sentence Text: For concrete block walls required to be reinforced, a continuous horizontal bond beam containing not less than one 15M bar shall be installed along the top of the wall, at the sill and head of all openings greater than 1.20 m in width, and at structurally connected floors.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.2. Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
P/T Sentence Text: For concrete block walls required to be reinforced, a continuous horizontal bond beam containing at least one 15M bar shall be installed,  along the top of the wall,  at the sill and head of all openings greater than 1.2 m in width, and  at structurally connected floors.

National Article Title: Foundation Walls Considered to be Laterally Supported at the
National Sentence Text: Unless the wall around an opening is reinforced to withstand earth pressure, the portion of the foundation wall beneath an opening shall be considered laterally unsupported if the opening is more than 1.2 m wide, or the total width of the openings in the foundation wall constitutes more than 25% of the length of the wall.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.3. Foundation Walls Considered to be Laterally Supported
P/T Sentence Text: Unless the wall around an opening is reinforced to withstand earth pressure, the portion of the foundation wall beneath an opening shall be considered laterally unsupported, if, the opening is more than 1.2 m wide, or  the total width of the openings in the foundation wall constitutes more than 25% of the length of the wall.

National Article Title: Foundation Walls Considered to be Laterally Supported at the
National Sentence Text: For the purposes of Sentence 9.15.4.3.(3), the combined width of the openings shall be considered as a single opening if the average width is greater than the width of solid wall between them.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.3. Foundation Walls Considered to be Laterally Supported
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of Sentence , the combined width of the openings shall be considered as a single opening if the average width is greater than the width of solid wall between them.

National Article Title: Foundation Walls Considered to be Laterally Supported at the Bottom
National Sentence Text: Flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be considered to be laterally supported at the bottom where the foundation wall supports backfill not more than 1.2 m in height, is supported at the footing by a shear key and at the top by the ground floor framing, or is doweled to the footing with not less than 15M bars spaced not more than 1.2 m o.c.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.4. Foundation Walls Considered to be Laterally Supported at the Bottom
P/T Sentence Text: Flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be considered to be laterally supported at the bottom where the foundation wall, supports backfill not more than 1.2 m in height,  is supported at the footing by a shear key and is supported at the top by the ground floor framing, or  is dowelled to the footing with not less than 15M bars spaced not more than 1.2 m o.c.

National Article Title: Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form Foundation
National Sentence Text: Vertical reinforcement in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be provided in accordance with Table 9.15.4.5.-A for 140 mm walls, Table 9.15.4.5.-B for 190 mm walls, and Table 9.15.4.5.-C for 240 mm walls, located in the inside half of the wall section with a minimum cover of 30 mm from the inside face of the concrete wall, and where interrupted by wall openings, placed not more than 600 mm from each side of the openings.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.5. Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form Foundation
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical wall reinforcement in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall, conform to,  Table 9.15.4.5.A. for 140 mm walls,  Table 9.15.4.5.B. for 190 mm walls, and  Table 9.15.4.5.C. for 240 mm walls,  be located in the inside half of the wall section with a minimum cover of 30 mm from the inside face of the concrete wall, and  where interrupted by wall openings, be placed not more than 600 mm from each side of the openings.

National Article Title: Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form Foundation
National Sentence Text: Cold joints in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be reinforced with no less than one 15M bar spaced at not more than 600 mm o.c. and embedded 300 mm on both sides of the joint.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.5. Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form Foundation
P/T Sentence Text: Cold joints in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be reinforced with at least one 15M bar spaced not more than 600 mm o.c. and embedded not less than 300 mm on both sides of the joint.
Variation Label: Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form Foundation

National Sentence Text: Where the top of a foundation wall is reduced in thickness to permit the installation of a masonry exterior facing, the reduced section shall be not less than 90 mm thick, and tied to the facing material with metal ties conforming to Sentence 9.20.9.4. spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. vertically, and 900 mm o.c. horizontally.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the top of a foundation wall is reduced in thickness to permit the installation of a masonry exterior facing, the reduced section shall be, not less than 90 mm thick, and  tied to the facing material with metal ties conforming to Sentence 9.20.9.4. spaced not more than,  200 mm o.c. vertically, and  900 mm o.c. horizontally.

National Sentence Text: The space between wall and facing described in Sentence 9.15.4.7. shall be filled with mortar.
P/T Sentence Text: The space between wall and facing described in Sentence  shall be filled with mortar.
