National Sentence Text: Where the distance between the framing over the opening referred to in Sentence 9.24.2.4. and the top runner exceeds 400 mm in such walls, intermediate support shall be installed at intervals of not more than 400 mm above the opening.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the distance between the framing over the opening referred to in Sentence  and the top runner exceeds 400Ã mm in such walls, intermediate support shall be installed at intervals of not more than 400 mm above the opening.

National Sentence Text: Runners required in Sentence 9.24.3.1. shall be securely attached to the building at approximately 50 mm from the ends, and at intervals of not more than 600 mm o.c. for interior walls and 300 mm o.c. for exterior walls.
P/T Sentence Text: Runners required in Sentence  shall be securely attached to the building at approximately 50 mm from the ends, and at intervals of not more than 610 mm o.c. for interior walls and 305 mm o.c. for exterior walls.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners used for attachment described in Sentence 9.24.3.1. shall consist of the equivalent of 63 mm nails or 25 mm screws.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners used for attachment described in Sentence  shall consist of the equivalent of 63 mm nails or 25 mm screws.

National Sentence Text: Studs at openings and which are not full wall height shall be supported by a runner at the ends of the studs, securely fastened to the full length studs at the sides of the opening.
P/T Sentence Text: Studs at openings and that are not full wall height shall be supported by a runner at the ends of the studs, securely fastened to the full length studs at the sides of the opening.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.24.3.6., studs in walls referred to in Sentence 9.24.3.2. shall not be attached to the runners in a manner that will prevent such expansion.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.24.3.6., studs in walls referred to in Sentence  shall not be attached to the runners in a manner that will prevent such expansion.

National Sentence Text: Framing above doors with steel door frames in non-loadbearing fire separations required to have a fire-resistance rating shall consist of 2 runners on the flat fastened back to back. (See Note A-9.24.3.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Framing above doors with steel door frames in non-loadbearing fire separations required to have a fire-resistance rating shall consist of two runners on the flat fastened back to back. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The upper runner required in Sentence 9.24.3.2. shall be bent at each end to extend upwards not less than 150 mm and fastened to the adjacent studs.
P/T Sentence Text: The lower runner required in Sentence  shall be cut through the flanges and be bent at each end to extend upwards at least 150 mm and fastened to the adjacent studs.

National Sentence Text: Studs described in Sentence 9.24.3.5. shall be fastened together by screws, crimping or welding to act as a single structural unit in resisting transverse loads.
P/T Sentence Text: Studs described in Sentence  shall be fastened together by screws, crimping or welding to act as a single structural unit in resisting transverse loads.

National Sentence Text: Where clearance for expansion is required in Article 9.24.3.2., attachment required in Sentence 9.24.3.6. shall be applied between studs and bottom runners only.
P/T Sentence Text: Where clearance for expansion is required in Article 9.24.3.2., attachment required in Sentence  shall be applied between studs and bottom runners only.

National Sentence Text: The sill and header for openings described in Sentence 9.24.3.7. shall consist of a runner track with right angle bends made on each end so as to extend 300 mm above the header or below the sill and fastened to the studs.
P/T Sentence Text: The sill and header for openings described in Sentence  shall consist of a runner track with right angle bends made on each end so as to extend 300 mm above the header or below the sill and fastened to the studs.

National Sentence Text: This Section is concerned with heat, air and water vapour transfer and measures to control condensation.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to heat, air and water vapour transfer and measures to control condensation.

National Sentence Text: Insulation and sealing of heating and ventilating ducts shall conform to Sections 9.32., 9.33. and 9.36.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulation and sealing of heating and ventilating ducts shall conform to Sections 9.32. and 9.33.

National Sentence Text: Insulation in contact with the ground shall be inert to the action of soil and water and shall be such that its insulative properties are not significantly reduced by moisture.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulation in contact with the ground shall be inert to the action of soil and water and be such that its insulative properties are not significantly reduced by moisture.

National Sentence Text: Where insulation is exposed to the weather and subject to mechanical damage, it shall be protected with not less than 6 mm preservative-treated plywood, or 12 mm cement parging on wire lath applied to the exposed face and edge.
P/T Sentence Text: Where insulation is exposed to the weather and subject to mechanical damage, it shall be protected with not less than, reserved,  6 mm preservative-treated plywood, or  12 mm cement parging on wire lath applied to the exposed face and edge.

National Sentence Text: Where polyethylene sheet is used to provide airtightness in the air barrier system, it shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction
P/T Sentence Text: In unfinished basements, the protection required in Sentence  need not be provided for mineral fibre insulation, provided it is covered with polyethylene vapour barrier of at least 0.15 mm in thickness.

National Sentence Text: Where loose-fill insulation is installed in an unconfined sloped space, such as an attic space over a sloped ceiling, the supporting slope shall not be more than 4.5 in 12 for mineral fibre or cellulose fibre insulation, and 2.5 in 12 for other types of insulation.
P/T Sentence Text: Where loose-fill insulation is installed in an unconfined sloped space, such as an attic space over a sloped ceiling, the supporting slope shall not be more than, 4.5 in 12 for mineral fibre or cellulose fibre insulation, and  2.5 in 12 for other types of insulation.

National Sentence Text: Where blown-in insulation is installed in above-ground or below-ground wood-frame walls of new buildings, the density of the installed insulation shall be sufficient to preclude settlement, the insulation shall be installed behind a membrane that will permit visual inspection prior to the installation of the interior finish, the insulation shall be installed in a manner that will not interfere with the installation of the interior finish, and no water shall be added to the insulation, unless it can be shown that the added water will not adversely affect other materials in the assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: Where blown-in insulation is installed in above-ground or below-ground wood frame walls of new buildings,  the density of the installed insulation shall be sufficient to preclude settlement,  the insulation shall be installed behind a membrane that will permit visual inspection prior to installation of the interior finish,  the insulation shall be installed in a manner that will not interfere with the installation of the interior finish, and  no water shall be added to the insulation, unless it can be shown that the added water will not adversely affect other materials in the assembly.

National Sentence Text: Where soffit venting is used, measures shall be taken to prevent loose-fill insulation from blocking the soffit vents and to maintain an open path for circulation of air from the vents into the attic or roof space, and to minimize airflow into the insulation near the soffit vents to maintain the thermal performance of the material. (See Article 9.19.1.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where soffit venting is used, measures shall be taken,  to prevent loose-fill insulation from blocking the soffit vents and to maintain an open path for circulation of air from the vents into the attic or roof space, and  to minimize air flow into the loose-fill insulation near the soffit vents to maintain the thermal performance of the material.

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Where an interior wall meets an exterior wall, ceiling, floor or roof required to be provided with air barrier protection, the air barrier system shall extend across the intersection.
P/T Sentence Text: The continuity of the air barrier system shall extend throughout the basement.

National Sentence Text: Where polyethylene sheet is used to provide airtightness in the air barrier system, it shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Where polyethylene sheet is used to provide the air-tightness in the air barrier system, it shall conform to CAN/CGSB-51.34-M, "Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction".

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Where the air barrier system consists of an air-impermeable panel-type material, all joints shall be sealed to prevent air leakage.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Where the air barrier system consists of an air-impermeable panel-type material, all joints shall be sealed to minimize air leakage.

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Where an interior wall meets an exterior wall, ceiling, floor or roof required to be provided with air barrier protection, the air barrier system shall extend across the intersection.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Where an interior wall meets an exterior wall, ceiling, floor or roof required to be provided with an air barrier protection, the air barrier system shall extend across the intersection and shall be sealed in accordance with Sentences  and .
Variation Label: Continuity of the Air Barrier System

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Where an interior wall projects through a ceiling or extends to become an exterior wall, spaces in the wall shall be blocked to provide continuity across those spaces with the air barrier system in the abutting walls or ceiling.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Where an interior wall projects through a ceiling or extends to become an exterior wall, spaces in the wall shall be blocked to provide continuity across those spaces with the air barrier system in the abutting walls or ceiling by, sealing each air barrier to the blocking, or  wrapping each air barrier around the transition and sealing in accordance with Sentences  and .
Variation Label: Continuity of the Air Barrier System

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of doors, windows, electrical wiring, electrical boxes, piping or ductwork, shall be sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of electrical wiring, electrical boxes, piping or ductwork, shall be sealed with compatible material such as tape or caulking to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.
Variation Label: Continuity of the Air Barrier System

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of doors, windows, electrical wiring, electrical boxes, piping or ductwork, shall be sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of doors, windows and other fenestration shall be sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of doors, windows, electrical wiring, electrical boxes, piping or ductwork, shall be sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Where an interior air barrier is penetrated by doors, windows and other fenestration, the air barrier shall be sealed to the door frame or window frame with, compatible tape, or  spray foam insulation.
Variation Label: Continuity of the Air Barrier System

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of doors, windows, electrical wiring, electrical boxes, piping or ductwork, shall be sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exterior air barrier is penetrated by doors, windows and other fenestration, the air barrier shall be sealed to the door frame or window frame with, compatible flexible flashing material,  caulking, or  spray foam insulation.
Variation Label: Continuity of the Air Barrier System

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Where access hatches and sump pit covers are installed through assemblies constructed with an air barrier system, they shall be weatherstripped around their perimeters to prevent air leakage.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: An access hatch installed through an assembly constructed with an air barrier system shall be weatherstripped around the perimeter to minimize air leakage.

National Sentence Text: Thermally insulated wall, ceiling and floor assemblies shall be constructed with a vapour barrier so as to provide a barrier to diffusion of water vapour from the interior into wall spaces, floor spaces or attic or roof spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Thermally insulated wall, ceiling and floor assemblies shall be constructed with a vapour barrier sufficient to prevent condensation in the wall spaces, floor spaces or attic or roof spaces.
Variation Label: Vapour Barriers Used as Air Barriers

National Sentence Text: Membrane-type vapour barriers other than polyethylene shall conform to the requirements of CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.33-M89 Vapour Barrier Sheet, Excluding Polyethylene, for Use in Building Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Membrane-type vapour barriers other than polyethylene shall conform to CAN/CGSB-51.33-M, "Vapour Barrier, Sheet, Excluding Polyethylene, for Use in Building Construction".

National Sentence Text: Where a coating is applied to gypsum board to function as the vapour barrier, the permeance of the coating shall be determined in accordance with CGSB CAN/CGSB-1.501-M89 Method for Permeance of Coated Wallboard
P/T Sentence Text: Where a coating is applied to gypsum board to function as the vapour barrier, the permeance of the coating shall be determined in accordance with CAN/CGSB-1.501-M, "Method for Permeance of Coated Wallboard".

National Sentence Text: Where foamed plastic insulation functions as the vapour barrier, it shall be sufficiently thick so as to meet the requirement of Sentence 9.25.4.2.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Where insulation functions as the vapour barrier, it shall be sufficiently thick so as to meet the requirement of Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Where different products are used for the vapour barrier and the insulation, the vapour barrier shall be installed sufficiently close to the warm side of the insulation to prevent condensation at design conditions. (See Note A-9.25.4.3. and Note A-9.25.5.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where different products are used for the vapour barrier and the insulation, the vapour barrier shall be installed sufficiently close to the warm side of the insulation to prevent condensation at design conditions. (See Appendix A and Appendix Note A-9.25.5.1.(1))

National Sentence Text: Wood-based sheathing materials not more than 12.5 mm thick and complying with Article 9.23.17.2. need not comply with Sentence 9.25.5.1.(1). (See Note A-9.25.5.1.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Wood-based sheathing materials not more than 12.5 mm thick and complying with Article 9.23.16.2. need not comply with Sentence . (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Sheet and panel-type materials described in Article 9.25.5.1. shall be installed on the warm face of the assembly (see also Article 9.25.4.2.), at a location where the ratio between the total thermal resistance of all materials outboard of its innermost impermeable surface and the total thermal resistance of all materials inboard of that surface is not less than that required by Table 9.25.5.2., or outboard of an air space that is vented to the outdoors.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.5.2. Position of Low Permeance Materials (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Sheet and panel-type materials described in Article 9.25.5.1. shall be installed, on the warm face of the assembly,  at a location where the ratio between the total thermal resistance of all materials outboard of its innermost impermeable surface and the total thermal resistance of all materials inboard of that surface is not less than that required by Table 9.25.5.2., or  outboard of an air space that is vented to the outdoors.

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of this Section, the term "roof" shall mean sloped or near-horizontal assemblies that protect the spaces beneath them, including platforms that effectively serve as roofs with respect to the accumulation or drainage of precipitation. (See Note A-9.26.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: In this Section, "roof" means sloped or near-horizontal assemblies that protect the spaces beneath them and includes platforms that effectively serve as roofs with respect to the accumulation or drainage of precipitation, and  "roofing" means the primary covering for roofs. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Roofs shall be protected with roofing, including flashing, installed so as to effectively shed water, prevent the ingress of water and moisture into building assemblies and occupied space, and minimize the ingress of water due to ice damming into building assemblies.
P/T Sentence Text: Roofs shall be protected with roofing, including flashing, installed so as to, effectively shed water,  prevent the ingress of water and moisture into building assemblies and occupied space, and  minimize the ingress of water due to ice damming into building assemblies.

National Sentence Text: Compliance with Sentence 9.26.1.2. shall be demonstrated by conforming to the remainder of this Section, or Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Compliance with Sentence  shall be demonstrated by conforming to,  this Section, or  Part 5.

National Sentence Text: Methods described in CSA CAN3-A123.51-M85 Asphalt Shingle Application on Roof Slopes 1:3 and Steeper or in CSA CAN3-A123.52-M85 Asphalt Shingle Application on Roof Slopes 1:6 to Less Than 1:3 are permitted to be used for asphalt shingle applications not described in this Section.
P/T Sentence Text: Methods described in CAN3-A123.51-M, "Asphalt Shingle Application on Roof Slopes 1:3 and Steeper", or CAN3-A123.52-M, "Asphalt Shingle Application on Roof Slopes 1:6 to Less than 1:3", are permitted to be used for asphalt shingle applications not described in this Section.

National Sentence Text: Nails used for roofing shall be corrosion-resistant roofing or shingle nails conforming to ASTM F 1667-13 Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes, and Staples or CSA B111-1974 Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples
P/T Sentence Text: Nails used for roofing shall be corrosion-resistant roofing or shingle nails conforming to, ASTM F1667, "Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes, and Staples", or  CSA B111, "Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples".

National Sentence Text: Nails used with wood shingles or shakes shall have a head diameter of not less than 4.8 mm and a shank thickness of not less than 2.0 mm and shall be stainless steel, aluminum or hot-dipped galvanized. (See Note A-9.26.2.3.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Nails used with wood shingles or shakes shall have a head diameter of not less than 4.8 mm and a shank thickness of not less than 2.0 mm and shall be stainless steel, aluminum or hot-dipped galvanized. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Staples used with wood shingles shall be not less than 29 mm long, 1.6 mm diam or thickness, with not less than a 9.5 mm crown and shall be stainless steel or aluminum. (See Note A-9.26.2.3.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Staples used with wood shingles shall be not less than 29 mm long, 1.6 mm diam or thickness, with not less than a 9.5 mm crown and shall be stainless steel or aluminum.

National Sentence Text: Asphalt and gravel or coal tar and gravel roofs may be constructed with lower slopes than required in Sentence 9.26.3.1. when effective drainage is provided by roof drains located at the lowest points on the roofs.
P/T Sentence Text: Asphalt and gravel or coal tar and gravel roofs may be constructed with lower slopes than required in Sentence  when effective drainage is provided by roof drains located at the lowest points on the roofs.

National Sentence Text: Except where the omission of flashing will not adversely affect adjacent supported or supporting constructions, flashing shall be installed at junctions between roofs and walls that rise above the roof, and guards that are connected to the roof by more than pickets or posts.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where the omission will not adversely affect adjacent supported or supporting elements, flashing shall be installed at junctions between roofs and, walls that rise above the roof, and  guards that are connected to the roof by other than pickets or posts.

National Sentence Text: Sheet metal flashing shall consist of not less than 1.73 mm thick sheet lead, 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, 0.33 mm thick copper, 0.35 mm thick zinc, or 0.48 mm thick aluminum.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheet metal flashing shall consist of not less than, 1.73 mm thick sheet lead,  0.33 mm thick galvanized steel,  0.33 mm thick copper,  0.35 mm thick zinc, or  0.48 mm thick aluminum.

National Sentence Text: The top layer of roofing required in Sentence 9.26.4.3. shall consist of at least Type M mineral surface roll roofing (mineral surface up), 914 mm wide, centred in the valley, applied over a 100 mm wide strip of cement along each edge of the bottom layer, and fastened with a sufficient number of nails to hold it in place until the shingles are applied.
P/T Sentence Text: The top layer of roofing required in Sentence  shall consist of not less than Type M mineral surface roll roofing (mineral surface up), 914 mm wide, centred in the valley, applied over a 100 mm wide strip of cement along each edge of the bottom layer, and fastened with a sufficient number of nails to hold it in place until the shingles are applied.

National Article Title: Intersection of Shingle Roofs and Masonry
National Sentence Text: Counter flashing required in Sentence 9.26.4.4. shall be embedded not less than 25 mm in the masonry and shall extend not less than 150 mm down the masonry and lap the lower flashing not less than 100 mm.
P/T Article Title: 9.26.4.4. Intersection of Shingle Roofs and Masonry
P/T Sentence Text: Counter flashing required in Sentence  shall be embedded not less than 25 mm in the masonry and shall extend not less than 150 mm down the masonry and lap the lower flashing not less than 100 mm.

National Article Title: Intersection of Shingle Roofs and Masonry
National Sentence Text: Flashing along the slopes of a roof described in Sentence 9.26.4.4. shall be stepped so that there is not less than a 75 mm head lap in both the lower flashing and counter flashing.
P/T Article Title: 9.26.4.4. Intersection of Shingle Roofs and Masonry
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing along the slopes of a roof described in Sentence  shall be stepped so that there is not less than a 75 mm head lap in both the lower flashing and counter flashing.

National Article Title: Intersection of Shingle Roofs and Masonry
National Sentence Text: Where the roof described in Sentence 9.26.4.4. slopes upwards from the masonry, the flashing shall extend up the roof slope to a point equal in height to the flashing on the masonry, but not less than 1.5 times the shingle exposure.
P/T Article Title: 9.26.4.4. Intersection of Shingle Roofs and Masonry
P/T Sentence Text: Where the roof described in Sentence  slopes upwards from the masonry, the flashing shall extend up the roof slope to a point equal in height to the flashing on the masonry, but not less than 1.5 times the shingle exposure.

National Article Title: Intersection of Built-Up Roofs and Masonry
National Sentence Text: Counter flashing installed over the intersection referred to in Sentence 9.26.4.6. shall be embedded not less than 25 mm in the masonry, and shall be of sufficient length to extend down not less than 150 mm, lapping the membrane on the masonry not less than 100 mm.
P/T Article Title: 9.26.4.6. Intersection of Built-Up Roofs and Masonry
P/T Sentence Text: Counter flashing installed over the intersection referred to in Sentence  shall be embedded not less than 25 mm in the masonry, and shall be of sufficient length to extend down not less than 150 mm, lapping the membrane on the masonry not less than 100 mm.

National Article Title: Intersection of Built-Up Roofs and Walls other than Masonry
National Sentence Text: Flashing plies shall extend not less than 150 mm up the wall referred to in Sentence 9.26.4.7. behind the sheathing paper.
P/T Article Title: 9.26.4.7. Intersection of Built-Up Roofs and Walls Other Than
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing plies shall extend not less than 150 mm up the wall referred to in Sentence  behind the sheathing paper.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise permitted in Sentence 9.26.4.8.(5), chimney saddles shall be installed where the upper side of a chimney on a sloping roof is more than 750 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise permitted in Sentence , chimney saddles shall be installed where the upper side of a chimney on a sloping roof is more than 750 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: The intersection of the saddle and the chimney shall be flashed and counterflashed as described in Article 9.26.4.4.
P/T Sentence Text: The intersection of the saddle and the chimney shall be flashed and counterflashed as required in Article 9.26.4.4.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.26.5.1.(2), eave protection shall be provided on shingle, shake or tile roofs, extending from the edge of the roof a minimum of 900 mm up the roof slope to a line not less than 300 mm inside the inner face of the exterior wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , eave protection shall be provided on shingle, shake or tile roofs, extending from the edge of the roof a minimum of 900 mm up the roof slope to a line not less than 300 mm inside the inner face of the exterior wall.

National Sentence Text: The top edge of each strip of underlay referred to in Sentence 9.26.6.2. shall be fastened with sufficient roofing nails to hold it in place until the shingles are applied.
P/T Sentence Text: The top edge of each strip referred to in Sentence  shall be fastened with sufficient roofing nails to hold it in place until the shingles are applied.

National Sentence Text: The underlay referred to in Sentence 9.26.6.2. shall overlap the eave protection by not less than 100 mm. (See Article 9.26.10.2. for underlay beneath wood shakes.)
P/T Sentence Text: The underlay referred to in Sentence  shall overlap the eave protection by not less than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Starter strips shall be at least Type M mineral-surfaced roll roofing not less than 300 mm wide, shingles of the same weight and quality as those used as a roof covering with tabs facing up the roof slope, or pre-manufactured starter strips installed with sealant at the eaves.
P/T Sentence Text: Starter strips shall be, at least Type M mineral-surfaced roll roofing not less than 300 mm wide,  shingles of the same weight and quality as those used as a roof covering with tabs facing up the roof slope, or  pre-manufactured starter strips installed with sealant at the eaves.

National Sentence Text: Starter strips need not be provided where eave protection of not less than Type M mineral-surfaced roll roofing is provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Starter strips need not be provided where eave protection of not less than Type M mineral-surfaced roll roofing is provided or self-sealing composite membranes consisting of polyethylene and bituminous material is provided.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.26.7.4.(2), shingles shall be fastened with at least 4 nails or staples for 1 m wide shingles so that no nails or staples are exposed.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , shingles shall be fastened with at least four nails or staples for 1 000 mm wide shingles so that no nails or staples are exposed.

National Sentence Text: Where staples with an 11 mm crown are used, shingles shall be fastened with at least 6 staples.
P/T Sentence Text: Where staples with an 11 mm crown are used, shingles shall be fastened with at least six staples.

National Sentence Text: Shingles referred to in Sentence 9.26.7.6. shall be fastened with nails or staples on each side located not more than 25 mm from the edge and 25 mm above the butt of the overlying shingle.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles referred to in Sentence  shall be fastened with nails or staples on each side located not more than 25 mm from the edge and 25 mm above the butt of the overlying shingle.

National Sentence Text: Except for the first 2 courses, coverage shall be not less than 3 thicknesses of shingle over the entire roof, disregarding cutouts.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for the first two courses, coverage shall be not less than three thicknesses of shingle over the entire roof, disregarding cutouts.

National Sentence Text: Starter strips required in Sentence 9.26.8.2. shall be laid in a continuous band of cement not less than 200 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Starter strips required in Sentence  shall be laid in a continuous band of cement not less than 200 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Shingle tabs shall be secured with cold application cement applied at the rate of not less than 0.5 L/m2 of cemented area, or hot application asphalt applied at the rate of 1 kg/m2 of cemented area.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingle tabs shall be secured with cold application cement applied at the rate of not less than 0.5 L/mÃÂ² of cemented area, or hot application asphalt applied at the rate of 1 kg/mÃÂ² of cemented area.

National Sentence Text: The band required in Sentence 9.26.8.4. shall be located not more than 50 mm above the butt of the overlying course of shingles.
P/T Sentence Text: The band required in Sentence  shall be located not more than 50 mm above the butt of the overlying course of shingles.

National Sentence Text: Shingles referred to in Sentence 9.26.8.5. shall be cemented to the roof shingles and to each other with a coat of cement and fastened with nails or staples located 40 mm above the butt of the overlying shingle and 50 mm from each edge.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles referred to in Sentence  shall be cemented to the roof shingles and to each other with a coat of cement and fastened with nails or staples located 40 mm above the butt of the overlying shingle and 50 mm from each edge.

National Sentence Text: Shingles shall be fastened with 2 nails or staples located approximately 20 mm from the sides of the shingle and 40 mm above the exposure line.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles shall be fastened with two nails or staples located approximately 20 mm from the sides of the shingle and 40Ã mm above the exposure line.

National Sentence Text: A strip of material similar to that described in Sentence 9.26.10.2. not less than 450 mm wide shall be interlaid between each course of shakes with the bottom edge of the strip positioned above the butt line at a distance equal to double the exposure of the shakes.
P/T Sentence Text: A strip of material similar to that described in Sentence  not less than 450 mm wide shall be interlayed between each course of shakes with the bottom edge of the strip positioned above the butt line at a distance equal to double the exposure of the shakes.

National Sentence Text: Interlaid strips referred to in Sentence 9.26.10.2. shall be lapped not less than 150 mm at hips and ridges in a manner that will prevent water from reaching the roof sheathing.
P/T Sentence Text: Interlayed strips in Sentence  shall be lapped at least 150 mm at hips and ridges in a manner that will prevent water from reaching the roof sheathing.

National Sentence Text: Shakes shall be spaced 6 mm to 9 mm apart and the joints in any one course shall be separated not less than 40 mm from joints in adjacent courses.
P/T Sentence Text: Shakes shall be spaced 6 mm to 9 mm apart and the joints in one course shall be separated not less than 40 mm from joints in adjacent courses.

National Sentence Text: The exposure of wood shakes shall not exceed 190 mm for shakes not less than 450 mm long, and 250 mm for shakes not less than 600 mm long.
P/T Sentence Text: The exposure of wood shakes shall not exceed, 190 mm for shakes not less than 450 mm long, and  240 mm for shakes not less than 600 mm long.

National Sentence Text: Bitumen roofing felts shall be at least No. 15 felt.
P/T Sentence Text: Bitumen roofing felts shall be not less than No.15 felt.

National Sentence Text: Built-up roofing shall consist of not less than 3 mopped-down layers of roofing felt flood coated with bitumen.
P/T Sentence Text: Built-up roofing shall consist of at least three mopped-down layers of roofing felt flood coated with bitumen.

National Sentence Text: The full width under each lap referred to in Sentence 9.26.11.7. shall be coated with bitumen so that in no place does felt touch felt.
P/T Sentence Text: The full width under each lap referred to in Sentence  shall be coated with bitumen so that in no place does felt touch felt.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.26.11.8.(2), built-up roofing applied over wood, plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing shall be laid over an additional base layer of felt laid dry over the entire roof deck with not less than a 50 mm headlap and a 50 mm sidelap between each sheet.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , built-up roofing applied over wood, plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing shall be laid over an additional base layer of felt laid dry over the entire roof deck with at least a 50 mm headlap and a 50Ã mm sidelap between each sheet.

National Sentence Text: Where plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing is used, the dry layer of felt required in Sentence 9.26.11.8. may be omitted when the joints are taped and the sheathing is primed with asphalt.
P/T Sentence Text: Where plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing is used, the dry layer of felt required in Sentence  may be omitted when the joints are taped and the sheathing is primed with asphalt.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.26.11.10.(4), a cant strip shall be provided at the edges of roofs.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , a cant strip shall be provided at the edges of roofs.

National Sentence Text: At least 2 plies of the roofing membrane shall be carried over the top of the cant strip.
P/T Sentence Text: No fewer than two plies of the roofing membrane shall be carried over the top of the cant strip.

National Sentence Text: The cant strip required in Sentence 9.26.11.10. need not be provided where a gravel stop is installed at the edge of roofs.
P/T Sentence Text: The cant strip required in Sentence  may be omitted where a gravel stop is provided at the edge of roofs.

National Sentence Text: The roofing membranes shall be carried over the edge of the roof before the gravel stop referred to in Sentence 9.26.11.10. is fastened and 2 plies of roofing membrane mopped to the top surface of the gravel stop before the flood coat is applied.
P/T Sentence Text: The roofing membranes shall be carried over the edge of the roof before the gravel stop referred to in Sentence  is fastened and two plies of roofing membrane mopped to the top surface of the gravel stop before the flood coat is applied.

National Sentence Text: The gravel stop referred to in Sentence 9.26.11.10. shall extend over the edge of the roof to form a drip or shall be flashed so that the flashing extends over the edge to form a drip.
P/T Sentence Text: The gravel stop referred to in Sentence  shall extend over the edge of the roof to form a drip or shall be flashed so that the flashing extends over the edge to form a drip.

National Sentence Text: Sheet metal roofing shall be not less than 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, 0.46 mm thick copper, 0.46 mm thick zinc, or 0.48 mm thick aluminum.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheet metal roofing shall be not less than, 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel,  0.46 mm thick copper,  0.46 mm thick zinc, or  0.48 mm thick aluminum.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.16.1.(1), where sheet metal roofing is not supported by roof decking but spans between spaced supports, the panels shall be designed to support the specified live loads for roofs.
P/T Sentence Text: Where sheet metal roofing is not supported by roof decking but spans between spaced supports, the panels shall be designed to support the specified live loads for roofs.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.16.1.(1), where glass-reinforced polyester roofing panels are not supported by roof decking but span between spaced supports, the panels shall be designed to support the specified live roof loads.
P/T Sentence Text: Where glass reinforced polyester roofing panels are not supported by roof decking but span between spaced supports, the panels shall be designed to support the specified roof loads.

National Sentence Text: Hot applied rubberized asphalt roofing shall be installed in accordance with CGSB CAN/CGSB-37.51-M90 Application for Hot-Applied Rubberized Asphalt for Roofing and Waterproofing
P/T Sentence Text: Hot applied rubberized asphalt roofing shall be installed in accordance with CAN/CGSB-37.51-M, "Application for Hot Applied Rubberized Asphalt for Roofing and Waterproofing".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.16.1.(1), concrete roof tiles shall be installed according to CSA CAN/CSA-A220 Series-06 Concrete Roof Tiles (See Note A-9.26.17.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete roof tiles shall be installed according to CAN/CSA-A220.1-M, "Installation of Concrete Roof Tiles". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where downspouts are provided and are not connected to a sewer, extensions shall be provided to carry rainwater away from the building in a manner which will prevent soil erosion.
P/T Sentence Text: Where downspouts are provided and are not connected to a sewer, extensions shall be provided to carry rainwater away from the building in a manner that will prevent soil erosion.

National Article Title: Minimizing and Preventing Ingress and Damage
National Sentence Text: Except where exterior walls are protected from precipitation or where it can be shown that precipitation ingress will not adversely affect occupant health or safety, exterior walls shall be designed and constructed to minimize the ingress of precipitation into the assembly, and prevent the ingress of precipitation into interior space. (See Note A-9.27.2.1.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.27.2.1. Minimizing and Preventing Ingress and Damage
P/T Sentence Text: Except where exterior walls are protected from precipitation or where it can be shown that ingress will not adversely affect occupant health or safety, exterior walls shall be designed and constructed to, minimize the ingress of precipitation into the assembly, and  prevent ingress into interior space. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: First and Second Planes of Protection
National Sentence Text: Where walls required to provide protection from precipitation comprise cladding assemblies with first and second planes of protection, the first plane of protection shall consist of cladding with appropriate trim, accessory pieces and fasteners, and be designed and constructed to minimize the passage of rain and snow into the wall by minimizing holes and managing precipitation ingress caused by the kinetic energy of raindrops, surface tension, capillarity, gravity, and air pressure differences (see Subsection 9.27.4.), the second plane of protection shall be designed and constructed to (see Subsection 9.27.3.) intercept all rain and snow that gets past the first plane of protection, and effectively dissipate any rain or snow to the exterior, and the protection provided by the first and second planes of protection shall be maintained at wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and at the interface with other wall assemblies.
P/T Article Title: 9.27.2.3. First and Second Planes of Protection
P/T Sentence Text: Where walls required to provide protection from precipitation comprise assemblies with first and second planes of protection, the first plane of protection shall,  consist of cladding, with appropriate trim, accessory pieces and fasteners, and  be designed and constructed to minimize the passage of rain and snow into the wall by minimizing holes and managing precipitation ingress caused by kinetic energy of raindrops, surface tension, capillarity, gravity, and air pressure differences,  the second plane of protection shall be designed and constructed to,  intercept all precipitation that gets past the first plane of protection, and  effectively dissipate any precipitation to the exterior, and  the protection provided by the first and second planes of protection shall be maintained at,  wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and  the interface with other wall assemblies.

National Article Title: Elements of the Second Plane of Protection
National Sentence Text: The second plane of protection shall consist of a drainage plane having an appropriate inner boundary and flashing to dissipate rainwater to the exterior.
P/T Article Title: 9.27.3.1. Elements of the Second Plane of Protection (See
P/T Sentence Text: The second plane of protection shall consist of a drainage plane with appropriate inner boundary and flashing to dissipate rainwater to the exterior.

National Sentence Text: Sheathing membrane required in Sentence 9.27.3.3. shall be applied so that joints are lapped not less than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheathing membrane required in Sentence  shall be applied so that joints are lapped not less than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Where sheathing membrane required in Sentence 9.27.3.3. is applied horizontally, the upper sheets shall overlap the lower sheets.
P/T Sentence Text: Where sheathing membrane required in Sentence  is applied horizontally, the upper sheets shall overlap the lower sheets.

National Article Title: Sheathing Membranes in lieu of Sheathing
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.27.3.6., where no sheathing is used, at least 2 layers of sheathing membrane shall be applied beneath the cladding. (See Article 9.23.17.1. and Note A-9.27.3.5.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.27.3.5. Sheathing Membranes in Lieu of Sheathing
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.27.3.6., where no sheathing is used, at least two layers of sheathing membrane shall be applied beneath the cladding. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Sheathing Membranes in lieu of Sheathing
National Sentence Text: All joints in the sheathing membrane required in Sentence 9.27.3.5. shall occur over framing, and the membrane shall be fastened to the framing with roofing nails or staples spaced not more than 150 mm along the edges of the outer layer of sheathing membrane.
P/T Article Title: 9.27.3.5. Sheathing Membranes in Lieu of Sheathing
P/T Sentence Text: All joints in the sheathing membrane required in Sentence  shall occur over framing, and the membrane shall be fastened to the framing with roofing nails or staples spaced not more than 150 mm along the edges of the outer layer of sheathing paper.

National Sentence Text: Cladding consisting of sheets of plywood, hardboard, OSB, waferboard or fibre cement is considered to meet the requirements of Sentence 9.27.3.6.(1), provided the cladding is applied so that all edges are directly supported by framing, the vertical joints between adjacent sheets are sealed and covered with battens, shiplapped, or otherwise matched to provide weathertight joints, and the horizontal joints between adjacent sheets are sealed and shiplapped, or otherwise matched to provide weathertight joints.
P/T Sentence Text: Cladding consisting of sheets of plywood, hardboard, OSB, waferboard or fibre cement is considered to meet the requirements of Sentence , provided the cladding is applied so that, all edges are directly supported by framing,  the vertical joints between adjacent sheets are sealed and,  covered with battens,  shiplapped, or  otherwise matched to provide weathertight joints, and  the horizontal joints between adjacent sheets are sealed and,  shiplapped, or  otherwise matched to provide weathertight joints.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall consist of not less than 1.73 mm thick sheet lead, 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, 0.46 mm thick copper, 0.46 mm thick zinc, 0.48 mm thick aluminum, or 1.02 mm thick vinyl.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall consist of not less than, 1.73 mm thick sheet lead,  0.33 mm thick galvanized steel,  0.46 mm thick copper,  0.46 mm thick zinc,  0.48 mm thick aluminum, or  1.02 mm thick vinyl.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall be installed over exterior wall openings where the vertical distance from the bottom of the eave to the top of the trim is more than one-quarter of the horizontal overhang of the eave. (See Note A-9.27.3.8.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall be installed over exterior wall openings where the vertical distance from the bottom of the eave to the top of the trim is more than one-quarter of the horizontal overhang of the eave. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where the sills of windows and doors installed in exterior walls are not self-flashing, flashing shall be installed between the underside of the window or door and the wall construction below. (See Note A-9.27.3.8.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the sills of windows and doors installed in exterior walls are not self-flashing, flashing shall be installed between the underside of the window or door and the wall construction below. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Sealants shall be a non-hardening type suitable for exterior use, selected for their ability to resist the effects of weathering, and compatible with and adhere to the substrate to which they are applied. (See Note A-9.27.4.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Sealants shall be, non-hardening types suitable for exterior use,  selected for their ability to resist the effects of weathering, and  compatible with, and adhere to, the substrate to which they are applied. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Sealants shall conform to ASTM C 834-10 Latex Sealants ASTM C 920-14 Elastomeric Joint Sealants ASTM C 1184-13 Structural Silicone Sealants or ASTM C 1311-10 Solvent Release Sealants
P/T Sentence Text: Sealants shall conform to, ASTM C834, "Latex Sealants",  ASTM C920, "Elastomeric Joint Sealants",  ASTM C1184, "Structural Silicone Sealants", or  ASTM C1311, "Solvent Release Sealants".

National Sentence Text: Vertical lumber and stucco lath or reinforcing are permitted to be attached to sheathing only where the sheathing consists of not less than 14.3 mm lumber, 12.5 mm plywood, or 12.5 mm OSB or waferboard.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical lumber and stucco lath or reinforcing are permitted to be attached to sheathing only where the sheathing consists of not less than, 14.3 mm lumber,  12.5 mm plywood, or  12.5 mm OSB or waferboard.

National Sentence Text: Blocking for the attachment of cladding shall be not less than 38 mm by 38 mm lumber securely nailed to the framing and spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Blocking for the attachment of cladding shall be not less than 38 mm by 38 mm lumber securely nailed to the framing and spaced not more than 610 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners for cladding other than that described in Sentence 9.27.5.7. shall penetrate through the nail-holding base or not less than 25 mm into the framing.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners for cladding other than that described in Sentence  shall penetrate through the nail-holding base or not less than 25 mm into the framing.

National Sentence Text: Bevel siding shall be not less than 5 mm thick at the top, and not less than 12 mm thick at the butt for siding 184 mm or less in width, and 14.3 mm thick at the butt for siding wider than 184 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Bevel siding shall be, not less than 5 mm thick at the top, and  not less than,  12 mm thick at the butt for sidings 184 mm or less in width, and  14.3 mm thick at the butt for sidings wider than 184 mm.

National Sentence Text: Siding shall overlap not less than 1 mm per 16 mm width of lumber, but not less than 9.5 mm for matched siding, 25 mm for lapped bevel siding, or 12 mm for vertical battens.
P/T Sentence Text: Siding shall overlap not less than 1 mm per 16 mm width of lumber, but not less than, 9.5 mm for matched siding,  25 mm for lapped bevel siding, or  12 mm for vertical battens.

National Sentence Text: Eastern white cedar shingles shall be at least B  grade, except that C grade may be used for the lower course of double course applications.
P/T Sentence Text: Eastern white cedar shakes shall be at least B  grade, except that C grade may be used for undercoursing.

National Sentence Text: In single-course application, joints in succeeding courses shall be offset not less than 40 mm so that joints in any 2 of 3 consecutive courses are staggered.
P/T Sentence Text: In single-course application, joints in succeeding courses shall be offset at least 40 mm so that joints in any two of three consecutive courses are staggered.

National Sentence Text: The butts of the under-course of the application referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5. shall rest on the top edge of the lath.
P/T Sentence Text: The butts of the under-course of the application referred to in Sentence  shall rest on the top edge of the lath.

P/T Sentence Text: The outer course of the application referred to in Sentence  shall be fastened to the lath with nails of sufficient length to penetrate through the lath.

National Sentence Text: If wood lath is not used, the butts of the under-course shingles or shakes of the application referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5. shall be located 12 mm above the butts of the outer course.
P/T Sentence Text: If wood lath is not used, the butts of the under-course shingles or shakes of the application referred to in Sentence  shall be located 12 mm above the butts of the outer course.

National Sentence Text: Plywood cladding shall be exterior type conforming to HPVA ANSI/HPVA HP-1-2009 Hardwood and Decorative Plywood CSA O121-08 Douglas Fir Plywood CSA O151-09 Canadian Softwood Plywood or CSA O153-13 Poplar Plywood
P/T Sentence Text: Plywood cladding shall be exterior type conforming to, ANSI/HPVA HP-1, "Hardwood and Decorative Plywood",  CSA O121, "Douglas Fir Plywood",  CSA O151, "Canadian Softwood Plywood", or  CSA O153, "Poplar Plywood".

National Sentence Text: Not less than a 2 mm gap shall be provided between panels referred to in Sentence 9.27.8.4.(1).

P/T Sentence Text: The horizontal joints of siding described in Sentence  shall be lapped not less than 25 mm.

National Sentence Text: Factory-finished hardboard cladding shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.5-M87 Hardboard, Precoated, Factory Finished, for Exterior Cladding
P/T Sentence Text: Factory-finished hardboard cladding shall conform to CAN/CGSB-11.5M, "Hardboard, Precoated, Factory-Finished, for Exterior Cladding".

P/T Sentence Text: Hardboard cladding that is not factory finished shall conform to Types 1, 2 or 5 in CAN/CGSB-11.3-M, "Hardboard".

National Sentence Text: Not less than 3 mm clearance shall be provided between hardboard cladding and door or window frames.

National Sentence Text: Not less than a 3 mm gap shall be provided between sheets in cladding described in Sentence 9.27.10.3.(1).

P/T Sentence Text: Steel sheet cladding shall have a minimum thickness of 0.3 mm and conform to CAN/CGSB-93.3-M, "Prefinished Galvanized and Aluminum-Zinc Alloy Steel Sheet for Residential Use".

P/T Sentence Text: Nails for fastening gypsum board to wood supports shall conform to, ASTM F1667, "Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes and Staples", or  CSA B111, "Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples".

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 9.29.5.8.(4), for single-layer application on walls, nails shall be spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports, or every 300 mm o.c. along vertical wall supports, in pairs about 50 mm apart.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence , for single-layer application on walls, nails shall be spaced,  not more than 200 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports, or  every 300 mm o.c. along vertical wall supports, in pairs about 50 mm apart.

National Sentence Text: Where a fire-resistance rating is determined based on Table 9.10.3.1.-A, Sentence 9.29.5.9. need not apply for the purpose of fire protection.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fire-resistance rating is determined based on Table 1 of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-3, "Fire and Sound Resistance of Building Assemblies", Sentence  need not apply for the purpose of fire protection.

National Sentence Text: Screws shall be located not less than 10 mm from the edge of the board.
P/T Sentence Text: Screws shall be located not less than 10 mm from the side or edge of the board.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.29.6.2.(2), where plywood for interior finish is grooved, the grooves shall not extend through the face ply and into the plies below the face ply unless the groove is supported by framing or furring.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , where plywood for interior finish is grooved, the grooves shall not extend through the face ply and into the plies below the face ply unless the groove is supported by framing or furring.

National Sentence Text: If the grain of the face ply is at right angles to the supporting members, the groove is permitted to extend into plies below the face ply provided the thickness of the plywood exceeds the value shown in Table 9.29.6.1. by an amount equal to not less than the depth of penetration of the grooves into the plies below the face ply.
P/T Sentence Text: If the grain of the face ply is at right angles to the supporting members, the groove is permitted to extend into the plies below the face ply provided the thickness of the plywood exceeds the value shown in Table 9.29.6.1. by an amount equal to not less than the depth of penetration of the grooves into the plies below the face ply.

National Sentence Text: Hardboard shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.3-M87 Hardboard
P/T Sentence Text: Hardboard shall conform to CAN/CGSB-11.3-M, "Hardboard".

National Sentence Text: Insulating fibreboard shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S706.1-16 Wood Fibre Insulating Boards for Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Insulating fibreboard shall conform to CAN/ULC-S706.1, "Wood Fibre Insulating Boards for Buildings".

National Sentence Text: Insulating fibreboard sheets shall be not less than 11.1 mm thick on supports not more than 400 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulating fibreboard sheets shall be not less than 11.1 mm thick on supports not more than 406 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Particleboard finish shall conform to ANSI A208.1-2009 Particleboard
P/T Sentence Text: Particleboard finish shall conform to ANSI A208.1, "Particleboard".

National Sentence Text: OSB or waferboard finish shall conform to CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing or CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard
P/T Sentence Text: OSB or waferboard finish shall conform to, CSA O325, "Construction Sheathing", or  CSA O437.0, "OSB and Waferboard".

National Sentence Text: Thicknesses listed in Table 9.29.6.1. shall permit a manufacturing tolerance of  0.4 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Thickness listed in Table 9.29.6.1. shall permit a manufacturing tolerance of -0.4 mm.

National Sentence Text: OSB conforming to O-1 grade, waferboard conforming to R-1 grade and particleboard shall be not less than 6.35 mm thick on supports not more than 400 mm o.c., not less than 9.5 mm thick on supports not more than 600 mm o.c., and not less than 6.35 mm thick on supports not more than 600 mm o.c. in walls where blocking is provided at midwall height.
P/T Sentence Text: OSB conforming to O-1 grade, waferboard conforming to R-1 grade and particleboard shall be, not less than 6.35 mm thick on supports not more than 406 mm o.c.,  not less than 9.5 mm thick on supports not more than 610 mm o.c., and  not less than 6.35 mm thick on supports not more than 610 mm o.c. in walls where blocking is provided at midwall height.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.29.9.3.(2), nails for fastening particleboard, OSB or waferboard shall be not less than 38 mm casing or finishing nails spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along edge supports and 300 mm o.c. along intermediate supports.
P/T Sentence Text: Nails for fastening particleboard, OSB or waferboard shall be not less than 38 mm casing or finishing nails spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along edge supports and 300 mm o.c. along intermediate supports.

National Sentence Text: The cementitious material described in Sentence 9.29.10.2. shall be mixed with not less than 3 nor more than 5 parts of aggregate per part of cementitious material by volume.
P/T Sentence Text: The cementitious material described in Sentence  shall be mixed with no fewer than three nor more than five parts of aggregate per part of cementitious material by volume.

National Sentence Text: The joints between wall tiles and a bathtub shall be suitably caulked with material conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-19.22-M89 Mildew-Resistant Sealing Compound for Tubs and Tiles
P/T Sentence Text: The joints between wall tiles and a bathtub or shower shall be suitably caulked with material conforming to CAN/CGSB-19.22-M, "Mildew Resistant Sealing Compound for Tubs and Tile".

National Sentence Text: A panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring, parquet flooring, ceramic tile, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings or carpeting laid over lumber subflooring. (See Sentence 9.30.3.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring, parquet flooring, ceramic tile, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings or carpeting laid over lumber subflooring.

National Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring, parquet flooring, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings or carpeting on panel-type subflooring whose edges are unsupported. (See Article 9.23.15.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: A panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring, parquet flooring, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings or carpeting on panel-type subflooring whose edges are unsupported.

National Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay shall be not less than 6 mm thick and shall conform to ANSI A208.1-2009 Particleboard CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.3-M87 Hardboard HPVA ANSI/HPVA HP-1-2009 Hardwood and Decorative Plywood CSA O121-08 Douglas Fir Plywood CSA O151-09 Canadian Softwood Plywood CSA O153-13 Poplar Plywood or CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard
P/T Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay shall be not less than 6 mm thick and shall conform to, ANSI A208.1, "Particleboard",  CAN/CGSB-11.3-M, "Hardboard",  ANSI/HPVA HP-1, "Hardwood and Decorative Plywood",  CSA O121, "Douglas Fir Plywood",  CSA O151, "Canadian Softwood Plywood",  CSA O153, "Poplar Plywood", or  CSA O437.0, "OSB and Waferboard".

National Sentence Text: Staples for panel-type underlay shall have not less than a 1.2 mm shank diameter or thickness with a 4.7 mm crown, and be not less than 22 mm long for 6 mm underlay, and 28 mm long for 7.9 mm and 9.5 mm underlay.
P/T Sentence Text: Staples for panel-type underlay shall,  have not less than a 1.2 mm shank diameter or thickness with a 4.7 mm crown, and  be not less than,  22 mm long for 6 mm underlay, and  28 mm long for 7.9 mm and 9.5 mm underlay.

National Sentence Text: Where panel-type underlay is required to be installed over plywood, OSB or waferboard, the joints in the underlay shall be offset not less than 200 mm from the joints in the underlying subfloor.
P/T Sentence Text: Where panel-type underlay is required to be installed over plywood, or OSB or waferboard, the joints in the underlay shall be offset at least 200 mm from the joints in the underlying subfloor.

National Sentence Text: If the flooring is end matched, it shall be laid so that no 2 adjoining strips break joints in the same space between supports and each strip bears on no fewer than 2 supports.
P/T Sentence Text: If the flooring is end matched, it shall be laid so that no two adjoining strips break joints in the same space between supports and each strip bears on no fewer than two supports.

National Sentence Text: When nails are used, wood strip flooring shall be toe nailed or face nailed with not less than one nail per strip at the spacings shown in Table 9.30.3.3., except that face nailed strips more than 25 mm in width shall have at least 2 nails per strip.
P/T Sentence Text: When nails are used, wood strip flooring shall be toe nailed or face nailed with at least one nail per strip at the spacings shown in Table 9.30.3.3., except that face nailed strips of more than 25 mm in width shall have at least two nails per strip.

National Sentence Text: Flooring described in Sentence 9.30.5.1. shall be attached to the base with a suitable waterproof and alkali-resistant adhesive.
P/T Sentence Text: Flooring described in Sentence  shall be attached to the base with a suitable waterproof and alkali-resistant adhesive.

National Sentence Text: Panel-type subfloor to which ceramic tile is to be applied with adhesive shall have its edges supported according to Article 9.23.15.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Panel-type subfloor to which ceramic tile is to be applied with adhesive shall have its edges supported according to Article 9.23.14.3.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to the plumbing facilities and plumbing systems within dwelling units.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , this Section applies to plumbing facilities and plumbing systems serving dwelling units.

National Sentence Text: The construction, extension, alteration, renewal or repair of plumbing systems and sewage disposal systems shall conform to Part 7.
P/T Sentence Text: The construction of plumbing systems shall conform to Part 7.

National Sentence Text: Where a piped water supply is available, piping for hot and cold water shall be connected to every kitchen sink, lavatory, bathtub, shower, slop sink and laundry area.
P/T Sentence Text: In a dwelling unit with a water distribution system, piping for hot and cold water shall be connected to every kitchen sink, lavatory, bathtub, shower, slop sink and laundry area.

National Sentence Text: A kitchen sink, lavatory, bathtub or shower, and water closet shall be provided for every dwelling unit where a piped water supply is available.
P/T Sentence Text: A dwelling unit with a water distribution system shall contain, a kitchen sink,  a lavatory,  a bathtub or shower stall, and  a water closet or a drainless composting toilet.

National Sentence Text: Where gravity drainage to a sewer, drainage ditch or dry well is possible, a floor drain shall be installed in a basement forming part of a dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: A floor drain shall be installed in a basement forming part of a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Where hot water is required to be supplied in accordance with Article 9.31.4.2., equipment shall provide an adequate supply of hot water, and be installed in conformance with Part 7.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a hot water supply is required by Article 9.31.4.3., equipment shall be installed to provide to every dwelling unit an adequate supply of service hot water with a temperature range from 45ÃÂ°C to 60ÃÂ°C.

National Sentence Text: Service water heaters shall conform to appropriate provincial or territorial requirements or, in the absence of such requirements, to the NPC.
P/T Sentence Text: Every service water heater and its installation shall conform to Part 7.

National Sentence Text: Where storage tanks for service water heaters are of steel, they shall be coated with zinc, vitreous enamel (glass lined), hydraulic cement or other corrosion-resistant material.
P/T Sentence Text: Where storage tanks for service water heaters are steel, they shall be coated with zinc, vitreous enamel (glass lined), hydraulic cement or other corrosion-resistant material.

National Sentence Text: Ventilation of all other occupancies shall comply with Part 6.
P/T Sentence Text: Ventilation of rooms and spaces in other than residential occupancies shall conform to Part 6.

National Sentence Text: A storage garage for up to 4 motor vehicles that serves a residential occupancy may be considered to be part of that occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: A storage garage for more than five cars shall be ventilated in accordance with Part 6.

National Sentence Text: Where a habitable room or space is not provided with natural ventilation as described in Article 9.32.2.2. and is not mechanically cooled, the non-heating-season mechanical ventilation system shall have the capacity to exhaust indoor air from the room or space or to introduce outdoor air to that room or space at a rate of one air change per hour.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a room or space is not provided with natural ventilation as described in Sentence , mechanical ventilation shall be provided to exhaust inside air from or to introduce outside air to that room or space at the rate of one-half air change per hour if the room or space is mechanically cooled in summer, and one air change per hour if it is not.

National Sentence Text: Where collective venting of multiple installations of laundry-drying equipment is used, the ventilation system shall be connected to a common exhaust duct that is vented by one central exhaust fan and incorporates one central lint trap, include an interlock to activate the central exhaust fan when laundry-drying equipment is in use, and where required by Article 9.32.3.8., be provided with make-up air.
P/T Sentence Text: Where collective venting of multiple installations of laundry-drying equipment is used, the ventilation system shall, be connected to a common exhaust duct that is vented by one central exhaust fan and incorporates one central lint trap,  include an interlock to activate the central exhaust fan when laundry-drying equipment is in use, and  where required by Article 9.32.3.8., be provided with make-up air.

National Sentence Text: The unobstructed openable ventilation area to the outdoors for rooms and spaces in residential buildings ventilated by natural means shall conform to Table 9.32.2.2.
P/T Sentence Text: The unobstructed openable ventilation area to the outdoors for rooms and spaces in a residential occupancy ventilated by natural means shall conform to Table 9.32.2.1.

National Sentence Text: Screening shall be of corrosion-resistant material.
P/T Sentence Text: Screening shall be of rust-proof material.

National Sentence Text: This Article applies to dwelling units that contain a fuel-fired space-heating appliance or fuel-fired water-heating appliance of other than direct-vented or mechanically vented types, and ancillary spaces that contain an exhaust device, where the space is not within a dwelling unit in a house with a secondary suite and where the house with a secondary suite contains a fuel-fired space-heating appliance or fuel-fired water-heating appliance of other than direct-vented or mechanically vented types.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Subsection, a dwelling unit shall be categorized as, Type I when,  all fuel-fired combustion appliances serving the dwelling unit are direct vented or, except for fireplaces, are mechanically vented induced draft, and  the dwelling unit is not served by a solid fuel-fired combustion appliance,  Type II when a solid fuel-fired combustion appliance serves a Type I dwelling unit,  Type III when a mechanically vented induced draft non-solid fuel-fired fireplace or a natural draft appliance is present, or  Type IV when electric space heating is present.

National Sentence Text: Where a habitable room or space is not provided with natural ventilation as described in Article 9.32.2.2. and is mechanically cooled, its non-heating-season mechanical ventilation system shall have the capacity to exhaust air from inside the room or space, or to introduce outdoor air into that room or space, at a rate conforming with Table 9.32.2.3., or comply with Subsection 9.32.3.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum total ventilation capacity of the ventilation system required in Clause 9.32.3.2.(1) shall be the sum of the individual room capacities given in Table 9.32.3.3.

National Sentence Text: Where a vestibule opens directly off a living or dining room within a dwelling unit, ventilation to the outdoors for such rooms may be through the vestibule.
P/T Sentence Text: Ventilation capacities assigned to any combined living/dining or family/dining space shall be determined as if the spaces were individual rooms.

National Article Title: Modeling HVAC System of Proposed House
National Sentence Text: Where a forced-air system is installed in the proposed house, the energy model calculations shall determine the flow rate, in L/s, of the circulation fan in the reference house by multiplying the capacity, in W, of the heating system in the proposed house by 0.0604 for heat pumps, and 0.0251 for all other types of heating systems.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a basement incorporates rooms of the types designated in this Table, the assigned ventilation capacities for each room shall be as specified for those types of rooms. Basement areas used for other purposes that exceed Ã¢â¦" of the total basement floor area shall be assigned a fan capacity of 10 L/s. Those that are less than Ã¢â¦" of the total floor area shall be assigned 5 L/s.

National Article Title: Modeling HVAC System of Reference House
National Sentence Text: Where a forced-air system is installed in the reference house, the circulation fan flow rate, in L/s, shall be multiplied by 2.30 W/L/s to determine the circulation fan power capacity, in W.
P/T Sentence Text: Other habitable rooms shall be assigned a ventilation capacity of 5 L/s. This does not include spaces intended solely for access, egress, storage or service equipment.

National Sentence Text: Where an exhaust air intake for the principal ventilation fan is connected directly to the return side of the duct system of a forced air heating system or other forced air distribution system, it shall be connected, where applicable, not less than 1 m upstream from the connection of the outdoor air supply duct required by Sentence 9.32.3.4.(5).
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exhaust air intake for the principal exhaust fan is connected directly to the duct system of a forced air heating system or other central air circulating system, it shall, be connected to the return air side of the system, and  be connected not less than 1 000 mm upstream from any outdoor air supply duct.

National Sentence Text: Where the intake for a supplemental exhaust fan other than a cooking appliance exhaust fan serving a cooktop is installed in a kitchen, it shall be installed in the ceiling or on the wall at not less than 2 m above the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the intake for a supplemental exhaust fan, other than a cooking appliance exhaust fan serving a cooktop, is installed in a kitchen, it shall be installed in the ceiling or on the wall within 300 mm of the ceiling.

National Sentence Text: A supplemental exhaust fan required by this Article shall be controlled by a manual switch located in the room served by the fan.
P/T Sentence Text: A supplemental exhaust fan required by this Article shall be controlled by a manual switch located in the room served by the exhaust fan.

National Article Title: Modeling HVAC System of Reference House
National Sentence Text: Where outdoor air is to be introduced to the dwelling unit through a forced air heating system, the provision of outdoor air shall comply with this Article.
P/T Article Title: 9.32.3.6. Ventilation Systems Coupled With Forced Air Heating
P/T Sentence Text: This Article applies to a mechanical ventilation system serving a house or an individual dwelling unit that contains a forced air heating system which is used for delivery of ventilation air.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Coupled With Forced Air Heating

National Article Title:
Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air Heating
Systems
National Sentence Text: Where outdoor air is to be introduced to the dwelling unit through means other than a forced air heating system, the provision of outdoor air shall comply with this Article.
P/T Article Title: 9.32.3.7. Ventilation Systems Not Coupled With Forced Air Heating
P/T Sentence Text: This Article applies to a mechanical ventilation system in a dwelling unit that, does not contain a forced air heating system, or  contains a forced air heating system which is not used for circulation of the ventilation air.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Not Coupled With Forced Air Heating

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.32.3.5.(11), outdoor air shall be distributed by a system of trunk and branch supply ducts, from the outdoor air supply fan required by Sentence 9.32.3.5. to each bedroom, any storey, including basements and heated crawl spaces, without a bedroom, and if there is no storey without a bedroom, to the principal living area.
P/T Article Title: 9.32.3.7. Ventilation Systems Not Coupled With Forced Air Heating
P/T Sentence Text: Outdoor air shall be distributed by a ductwork system from the heat recovery ventilator required in Sentence  to each bedroom, to any storey without a bedroom and, if there is no storey without a bedroom, to the principal living area.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Not Coupled With Forced Air Heating

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air
National Sentence Text: All branch supply ducts that are not fitted with diffusers with adjustable balance stops shall be supplied with balancing dampers that can be fixed in their adjusted positions, and include devices to indicate the positions of the dampers.
P/T Article Title: 9.32.3.7. Ventilation Systems Not Coupled With Forced Air Heating
P/T Sentence Text: All branch supply ducts that are not fitted with diffusers with adjustable balance stops shall be supplied with accessible dampers that can be adjusted and fixed in their adjusted positions and that include devices to indicate the positions of the dampers.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.32.3.10.(4), capacity ratings for required fans shall be determined in accordance with CSA CAN/CSA-C260-M90 Rating the Performance of Residential Mechanical Ventilating Equipment or HVI HVI Publication 916-2013 Airflow Test Procedure
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , capacity ratings for required fans shall be determined in accordance with, CAN/CSA-C260-M, "Rating the Performance of Residential Mechanical Ventilating Equipment", or  HVI 916, "Airflow Test Procedure".

National Sentence Text: Capacity ratings for fans shall be measured at the external static pressure differentials shown in Table 9.32.3.10.-A.
P/T Sentence Text: Capacity ratings for required fans shall be based on a static pressure differential of 50 Pa, 25 Pa or 7.5 Pa depending on whether the fan is installed with ductwork connected on both sides, one side or neither side, respectively.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.32.3.11.(6), ventilation ducts and their fittings shall conform to the requirements of Article 9.33.6.2., except that exhaust ducts serving only a bathroom or water-closet room are permitted to be of combustible material, provided they are reasonably airtight and constructed of a material impervious to water.
P/T Sentence Text: Ventilation ducts shall conform to the requirements of Part 6 for supply ducts, except that exhaust ducts that serve only a bathroom or water closet room may be of combustible material provided the duct is reasonably airtight and constructed of a material impervious to water.

National Sentence Text: Where a duct carrying outdoor air that is not tempered and not mixed with indoor air passes through heated space, it shall be insulated to not less than RSI 0.5, and provided with a vapour barrier.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a duct carrying outdoor air that is not tempered or not mixed with indoor air passes through heated space, it shall be insulated to not less than RSI 0.5 except that, where such a duct is exposed in the heated space for more than 3 m of length in the heated space, it shall be, insulated to not less than the values listed in Table 9.32.3.10.A., and  provided with a vapour barrier.

National Sentence Text: Ductwork for cooking appliance exhaust fans shall be of noncombustible, corrosion-resistant material, lead directly to the outdoors with no connections to other exhaust fans or ducts, and be equipped with a grease filter at the intake end.
P/T Sentence Text: Ductwork for cooking appliance exhaust fans shall,  be of noncombustible, corrosion-resistant material, and  lead directly to the outdoors without connection to other exhaust fans or ducts.

National Sentence Text: All exhaust intakes located within 3 m horizontally of a cooktop shall be equipped with a grease filter at the intake end.
P/T Sentence Text: Ductwork for cooking appliance exhaust fans shall be equipped with a grease filter at the intake.
