National Sentence Text: All ductwork shall be installed to avoid crushing and shall be permanently supported to prevent sagging.
P/T Sentence Text: All ductwork shall be permanently supported or clipped to prevent sagging, excessive movement and vibration.

National Sentence Text: This Article shall apply to heat recovery ventilators installed to provide one or more of the fans required by this Subsection.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a heat recovery ventilator is installed to provide all or part of the requirements of this Subsection, this Article shall apply.

National Sentence Text: Two or more heat recovery ventilators shall not be connected in parallel airflow to a common air supply duct, unless specifically permitted by the manufacturer.
P/T Sentence Text: Two or more heat recovery ventilators shall not be connected in parallel air flow to a common air supply duct unless specifically recommended by the manufacturer.

National Sentence Text: All start-up procedures recommended by the manufacturer, including air balancing and airflow determination, shall be followed.
P/T Sentence Text: All start-up procedures recommended by the manufacturer including air balancing and air-flow determination shall be followed.

National Sentence Text: Air intakes shall be clearly labeled as such for identification from locations outside the dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Air intakes shall be clearly labelled as such for identification from locations outside the dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: The distance from the bottom of an exhaust outlet to finished ground or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The distance from the bottom of an exhaust outlet to finished ground level or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Screens, grilles and filters installed in air intake and exhaust openings shall be easily removable for cleaning purposes, without the need for special tools.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a screen or grille required by Sentences  and  has a screen mesh less than 6 mm, the screen or grille shall be removable for cleaning.

National Sentence Text: Where screens or grilles are installed in air intake and exhaust openings, the net free area of the air intake or exhaust opening shall be equal to or greater than the required cross-sectional area of the duct served or such openings shall comply with Table 9.32.3.13.
P/T Sentence Text: The net free area of an air intake or exhaust outlet shall be equal to or greater than the cross-sectional area of the duct served.

National Sentence Text: Except where mounted on concrete foundations, fans and heat recovery ventilators shall be isolated from structural components by resilient mountings to minimize the transmission of noise and vibration to occupied spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Installation of fans and heat recovery ventilators shall be in accordance with manufacturerÃ¢â¬â¢s instructions for minimizing noise and vibration transmission and achieving the required sound rating.
Variation Label: Installation - Fans and Heat Recovery Ventilators

National Sentence Text: Where flow-regulating dampers are required, they shall be adjustable and accessible without requiring the removal of fans, motors or insulating materials, or the use of specialized tools, and a device on the outside of the duct or device in which they are installed shall indicate the position of the damper.
P/T Sentence Text: Where flow-regulating dampers are required, they shall be adjustable and accessible without requiring the removal of fans, motors, or insulating materials and without the need for specialized tools.

National Article Title: Design, Construction and Installation Standard for Solid-Fuel-Burning
National Sentence Text: The design, construction and installation, including the provision of combustion air, of solid-fuel-burning appliances and equipment, including stoves, cooktops, ovens and space heaters, shall conform to CSA B365-17 Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: The design, construction and installation, including the provision of combustion air, of solid-fuel burning appliances and equipment, including stoves, cooktops and space heaters, shall conform to CSA B365, "Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where the building is in a location where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.55, heating and air-conditioning equipment with fuel or power connections shall be secured to the structure to resist overturning and displacement. (See Note A-9.31.6.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the building is in a location where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.55, heating and air-conditioning equipment with fuel or power connections shall be secured to the structure to resist overturning and displacement.

National Sentence Text: This Article applies to every building that contains a residential occupancy and that also contains a fuel-burning appliance, or a storage garage.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to every building that, contains a residential occupancy, and  contains a fuel-burning appliance or a storage garage.

National Sentence Text: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a suite of residential occupancy, a CO alarm shall be installed inside each bedroom, or outside each bedroom, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a suite of residential occupancy, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed adjacent to each sleeping area in the suite.

National Sentence Text: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a service room that is not in a suite of residential occupancy, a CO alarm shall be installed either inside each bedroom, or if outside, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways, in every suite of residential occupancy that shares a wall or floor/ceiling assembly with the service room, and in the service room.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a service room that is not in a suite of residential occupancy, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed, adjacent to each sleeping area in every suite of residential occupancy that is adjacent to the service room, and  in the service room.

National Sentence Text: For each suite of residential occupancy that shares a wall or floor/ceiling assembly with a storage garage or that is adjacent to an attic or crawl space to which the storage garage is also adjacent, a CO alarm shall be installed inside each bedroom, or outside each bedroom, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage garage serves only the dwelling unit to which it is attached or built in, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed adjacent to each sleeping area in the dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: An exterior lighting outlet with fixture controlled by a wall switch located within the building shall be provided at every entrance to buildings of residential occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: An exterior lighting outlet with fixture controlled by a wall switch located within the building shall be provided at every entrance to buildings of residential occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.34.2.2.(2), a lighting outlet with fixture controlled by a wall switch shall be provided in kitchens, bedrooms, living rooms, utility rooms, laundry rooms, dining rooms, bathrooms, water-closet rooms, vestibules and hallways in dwelling units.
P/T Article Title: 9.34.2.2. Lighting Outlets in Houses and Dwelling Units
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , a lighting outlet with fixture controlled by a wall switch shall be provided in kitchens, bedrooms, living rooms, utility rooms, laundry rooms, dining rooms, bathrooms, water closet rooms, vestibules and hallways in a house or an individual dwelling unit.
Variation Label: Lighting Outlets in Houses and Dwelling Units

National Sentence Text: Where a receptacle controlled by a wall switch is provided in bedrooms or living rooms, such rooms need not conform to the requirements in Sentence 9.34.2.2.(1).
P/T Article Title: 9.34.2.2. Lighting Outlets in Houses and Dwelling Units
P/T Sentence Text: Where a receptacle controlled by a wall switch is provided in bedrooms or living rooms, such rooms need not conform to the requirements of Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.34.2.3.(3), 3-way wall switches located at the head and foot of every stairway shall be provided to control at least one lighting outlet with fixture for stairways with 4 or more risers in dwelling units and houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , 3-way wall switches located at the head and foot of every stairway shall be provided to control at least one lighting outlet with fixture for stairways with four or more risers in a house or an individual dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.34.2.6.(3), outlets required in Sentence 9.34.2.6. shall be controlled by a wall switch near the doorway.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , lighting outlets required in Sentence  shall be controlled by a wall switch near the doorway.

National Sentence Text: Where the outlet and fixture required in Sentence 9.34.2.6. are ceiling mounted above an area not normally occupied by a parked car, or are wall mounted, a fixture with a built-in switch accessible to an adult of average height is permitted to be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the lighting outlet and fixture required in Sentence  are ceiling mounted above an area not normally occupied by a parked car, or are wall mounted, a fixture with a built-in switch is permitted to be used.

National Sentence Text: Every public or service area in buildings shall be provided with lighting outlets with fixtures controlled by a wall switch or panel to illuminate every portion of such areas.
P/T Sentence Text: Every public or service area in buildings, including a recreational camp and a camp for housing of workers, shall have lighting outlets with fixtures controlled by a wall switch or panel to illuminate such areas.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to garages and carports serving not more than one dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to garages and carports serving a house or an individual dwelling unit.
Variation Label: Garages and Carports serving house or individual dwelling unit

National Sentence Text: Where a roofed enclosure used for the storage or parking of motor vehicles has more than 60% of the total perimeter enclosed by walls, doors or windows, the enclosure shall be considered a garage.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a roofed enclosure used for the storage or parking of motor vehicles has more than 60 percent of the total perimeter enclosed by walls, doors or windows, the enclosure shall be considered a garage.

National Sentence Text: Piers referred to in Sentence 9.35.3.4. shall project not less than 25 mm beyond the base of the column but in no case be less than 190 mm by 190 mm in size.
P/T Sentence Text: Piers referred to in Sentence  shall project not less than 25 mm beyond the base of the column but in no case be less than 190 mm by 190 mm in size.

National Article Title: Requirements for High Wind and Seismic Forces
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.23.13.1., this Article applies in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.70 but not more than 1.8 and the lowest exterior frame wall supports not more than 1 floor in buildings of heavy construction (see Note A-9.23.13.2.(1)(a)(i)), or the lowest exterior frame wall supports not more than 2 floors in other types of construction, and the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is less than 1.20 kPa.
Variation Label: Requirements for High Wind and Seismic Forces

National Sentence Text: Braced wall bands shall be full storey height, be not more than 1.2 m wide, lap at both ends with another braced wall band, be aligned with braced wall bands on storeys above and below, and conform to the spacing and dimensions given in Table 9.23.13.5.
The perimeter of the building shall be located within braced wall bands.
For split-level buildings, a braced wall band shall be located where there is a change in floor level greater than the depth of one floor joist.
Gypsum board interior finish shall not be considered as an acceptable sheathing material to provide the required bracing in exterior walls. (See Note A-9.23.13.6. and .)
At braced wall band spacing intervals of not more than 15 m, braced wall panels shall be constructed with OSB, plywood or diagonal lumber. (See Note A-9.23.13.6. and .)

Where the exterior wall of the uppermost storey is set back from the exterior wall of the storey below, the roof and floor space supporting the setback wall shall be sheathed with a wood-based material between the exterior wall of the storey below the setback and the adjacent interior braced wall bands of the storey below the setback.

The maximum distance between adjacent required braced wall panels in a braced wall band, measured from the edge of the panels, may be increased to 7.3 m provided that, throughout the height of the building, the length of any braced wall panel within the braced wall band is not less than 1.2 m.

The maximum distance between adjacent required braced wall panels in a braced wall band, measured from the edge of the panels, may be increased to 7.3 m provided that, throughout the height of the building, the length of any braced wall panel within the braced wall band is not less than 1.2 m.

National Article Title: Floor Area Limits for Secondary Suites
National Sentence Text: The total floor area of all storeys of a secondary suite shall be not more than the lesser of 80% of the total floor area of all storeys of the other dwelling unit, excluding the garage floor area and common spaces serving both dwelling units, and 80 m2.
Variation Label: Floor Area Limits for Secondary Suites

National Article Title: Ceiling Heights of Rooms or Spaces
National Sentence Text: Ceiling heights in secondary suites shall be not less than 1.95 m.
Variation Label: Ceiling Heights of Rooms or Spaces

National Sentence Text: Doorway openings within secondary suites shall be designed to accommodate swing-type and folding doors not less than 1 890 mm high where the ceiling height complies with Sentence 9.5.3.1.(2).

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the energy efficiency requirements in Section 9.36.
Variation Label: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights

National Sentence Text: Only one set of winders described in Article 9.8.4.6. shall be permitted between floor levels.
P/T Sentence Text: Where more than one set of winders described in Sentence  is provided in a single stairway between adjacent floor levels, such winders shall be separated in plan by at least 1 200 mm.

National Sentence Text: The clear height over ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 1 950 mm.
The clear height over landings serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 1 950 mm.
The occupant load for dwelling units shall be based on 2 persons per bedroom or sleeping area.
P/T Sentence Text: The occupant load of a floor area or part of a floor area, or of a building or part of a building not having a floor area, shall be based on, (a)	two persons per sleeping room or sleeping area in a dwelling unit or suite, and for occupancies other than as described in Clause (a), the number of persons,  for which the area is designed, or  determined from Table 3.1.17.1.

National Sentence Text: Where a dwelling unit is located above another dwelling unit or common space in a house with a secondary suite, the upper dwelling unit shall be provided with a second and separate means of egress where an egress door from that dwelling unit opens onto an exterior passageway that has a floor assembly with a fire-resistance rating less than 45 min, is served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and is located more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.

For the purpose of determining occupant load, the areas of mezzanines that are not considered as storeys shall be added to the floor area of the storey on which they are located. (See Note A-9.10.4.1.(4).)

Platforms and catwalks intended solely for periodic inspection and maintenance need not be considered as floor assemblies or mezzanines for the purpose of calculating building height, provided they are not used for storage, and they are constructed with noncombustible materials, unless the building is permitted to be of combustible construction.

National Article Title: Fire-Resistance Ratings for Walls, Columns and Arches
National Sentence Text: Light-frame walls, columns, arches and beams as well as loadbearing steel elements that support floors between dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be protected by not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board. (See Note A-9.10.8.3.(2).)
Variation Label: Fire-Resistance Ratings for Walls, Columns and Arches

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.9.3., a wall or floor assembly required to be a smoke-tight barrier shall be constructed as a continuous barrier against the spread of smoke.

National Article Title: Openings to be Protected with Closures
National Sentence Text: Doors in smoke-tight barriers shall be solid-core, wood doors at least 45 mm thick, and have a self-closing device. (See Note A-9.10.9.3.(2).)
Variation Label: Openings to be Protected with Closures

National Sentence Text: Where a public corridor is located in a house with a secondary suite, a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board shall be installed on both sides of walls separating the corridor from the remainder of the building, and the underside of floor-ceiling framing separating the corridor from the remainder of the building. (See Sentence 9.10.9.3. for closures.)

Smoke alarms in a house with a secondary suite shall be wirelessly interconnected or interconnected by hard-wiring so that the activation of any one smoke alarm causes all smoke alarms within the house with a secondary suite to sound. (See Note A-9.10.19.5.(2).)

Where decks or other accessible exterior platforms are supported on surface foundations supported on other than coarse-grained soil with good drainage or rock, access to the foundation positions to permit re-levelling of the platform shall be provided by passageways with a clear height under the platform of not less than 600 mm and a width of not less than 600 mm, or by installing the decking in a manner that allows easy removal.

This Subsection applies to wall, roof and floor assemblies separating conditioned space from the ground, and the rough-in to allow the future protection of conditioned space that is separated from the ground by a wall, roof or floor assembly.
This Subsection addresses the leakage of soil gas from the ground into the building.

Where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is equal to or greater than 0.8 kPa, roof rafters, joists or trusses shall be tied to the wall framing with connectors that will resist a factored uplift load of 3 kN.

Fastening of roof sheathing and sheathing in required braced wall panels shall conform to Table 9.23.3.5.-C, where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure  is equal to or greater than 0.8 kPa and less than 1.2 kPa and the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not more than 1.8, or the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.90 and not more than 1.8.

Fastening of sheathing shall conform to Part 4, where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is equal to or greater than 1.2 kPa, or for required braced wall panels, where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 1.8.

For buildings supported by frame walls that are in areas where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.70 but not greater than 1.8 and the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure  is not greater than 1.20 kPa, anchorage shall be provided by fastening the sill plate to the foundation with not less than two anchor bolts per braced wall panel located within 0.5 m of the end of the foundation and spaced in accordance with Table 9.23.6.1.

Loadbearing and non-loadbearing walls constructed with required braced wall panels shall be continuously supported by floor joists, blocking or rim joists to allow for the required fastening (see Table 9.23.3.4.).

Where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.70 but not more than 1.8, doubled top plates in braced wall bands shall be fastened on each side of a splice with 76 mm long common steel wire nails or spiral nails in accordance with Table 9.23.11.4.
Where plywood finish provides required bracing in braced wall panels, the plywood shall be fastened in accordance with the fastening requirements for sheathing stated in Sentence 9.23.3.5.(2).

Where OSB or waferboard provides required bracing in braced wall panels, the OSB or waferboard shall be fastened in accordance with the fastening requirements for sheathing stated in Sentence 9.23.3.5.(2).

Panel-type underlay under ceramic tile applied with adhesive shall be not less than 6 mm thick where the supports are spaced up to 300 mm o.c., and 11 mm thick where the supports are spaced wider than 300 mm o.c.
Systems used for service water heating shall conform to the energy efficiency requirements in Section 9.36.

Where a habitable room or space is not provided with natural ventilation as described in Article 9.32.2.2. and is not mechanically cooled, the non-heating-season mechanical ventilation system shall have the capacity to exhaust indoor air from the room or space or to introduce outdoor air to that room or space at a rate of one air change per hour.
Ventilation equipment shall be accessible for inspection, maintenance, repair and cleaning.

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air
National Sentence Text: An outdoor air supply fan shall be installed with a rated capacity within ±10% of the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the exhaust fan installed to satisfy the requirement for a principal ventilation fan.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air
National Sentence Text: The outdoor air supply fan shall be connected to the outdoors through an outdoor air supply duct.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air
National Sentence Text: In a dwelling unit in which there is no storey without a bedroom, if an exhaust air intake for the principal ventilation fan is located in the principal living area and the principal ventilation fan has no more than 2 exhaust air intakes located in other rooms, distribution of outdoor air to the principal living area is not required.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air
National Sentence Text: The air supply outlets through which outdoor air is delivered to the rooms shall be located in the ceiling or in a wall at not less than 2 m above the floor and shall be designed and installed to promote diffusion across the ceiling.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air

National Sentence Text: A storage garage for up to 4 motor vehicles that serves a residential occupancy may be considered to be part of that occupancy.
Systems used for ventilation shall conform to the energy efficiency requirements in Section 9.36.

This Section is concerned with the energy used by buildings as a result of the design and construction of the building envelope, and the design and construction or specification of systems and equipment for heating, ventilating or air-conditioning, and service water heating. (See Note A-9.36.1.1.(1).)
The maximum deflection of structural members shall conform to Table 9.4.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum deflection of structural members shall conform to Table 9.4.3.1

National Sentence Text: The maximum area of individual panes of glass for doors shall conform to Table 9.6.1.3.-G.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum area of individual panes of glass for doors shall conform to Table 9.6.1.3.G

National Sentence Text: Flanking floor assemblies connected to a separating wall assembly shall be constructed with concrete having a mass per area greater than 300 kg/m2, or in accordance with Section 9.16., or supported on joists or trusses that are not continuous across the junction and are covered with floor treatments in accordance with Table 9.11.1.4. for the applicable wall construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Flanking floor assemblies connected to a separating wall assembly shall be, (a)constructed,  with concrete having a mass per area greater than 300 kg/m2 , or  in accordance with Section 9.16., or (b)supported on joists or trusses that are not continuous across the junction and are covered with floor treatments in accordance with Table 9.11.1.4. for the applicable wall construction.

National Sentence Text: Materials used for flashing shall conform to Table 9.20.13.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Materials used for flashing shall conform to Table 9.20.13.1.

National Sentence Text: Carbon steel connectors required to be corrosion-resistant shall be galvanized to at least the minimum standards in Table 9.20.16.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Carbon steel connectors required to be corrosion-resistant shall be galvanized to at least the minimum standards in Table 9.20.16.1.

National Sentence Text: When applied directly to framing or over furring strips, plywood cladding thickness shall conform to Table 9.27.8.2.
P/T Sentence Text: When applied directly to framing or over furring strips, plywood cladding thickness shall conform to Table 9.27.8.2

National Sentence Text: Wood furring for the attachment of wall and ceiling finishes shall conform to Table 9.29.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Wood furring for the attachment of wall and ceiling finishes shall conform to Table 9.29.3.1.

National Sentence Text: When other types of lighting are used, illumination equivalent to that shown in Table 9.34.2.7. shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: When other types of lighting are used, illumination equivalent to that shown in Table 9.34.2.7. shall be provided.

National Article Title:
Ventilation Systems Used in Conjunction with Forced Air Heating
Systems
National Sentence Text: Where the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the fan installed to satisfy the requirement for a principal ventilation fan exceeds the maximum outdoor airflow permitted by Table 9.32.3.4. for a mixed air temperature of 15°C or exceeds the minimum acceptable return air temperature specified by the manufacturer of the furnace, whichever is less, then either the system shall incorporate a means for tempering outdoor air introduced to the heating system ducts so that a mixed air temperature of 15°C or the minimum acceptable return air temperature specified by the manufacturer of the furnace, whichever is less, is achieved when the outdoor air is at the January 2.5% temperature and the indoor air temperature is 22°C, or this Article shall be considered to be no longer applicable and the mechanical ventilation system shall comply with either Clause 9.32.3.1.(1) or with Article 9.32.3.5.
Variation Label:
Ventilation Systems Used in Conjunction with Forced Air Heating
Systems

National Article Title: Galvanized Steel or Aluminum Supply Ducts
National Sentence Text: Galvanized steel or aluminum supply ducts shall conform to Table 9.33.6.5.
Variation Label: Galvanized Steel or Aluminum Supply Ducts

National Sentence Text: Clearances between combustible material and bare pipes carrying steam or hot water shall conform to Table 9.33.8.3.
Except as provided in Subsection 2.7.4., every sanitary drainage system shall be connected to a public sanitary sewer, a public combined sewer or a private sewage disposal system.
P/T Sentence Text: Every sanitary drainage system shall be connected to a public sanitary sewer, a public combined sewer or a private sewage disposal system.

National Sentence Text: A combined building drain shall not be installed. (See Note A-2.1.2.1.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: A combined building drain or a combined building sewer shall not be installed.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 2.7.4., every storm drainage system shall be connected to a public storm sewer, a public combined sewer or a designated storm water disposal location.
P/T Sentence Text: Every storm drainage system shall be connected to a public storm sewage works, a public combined sewage works or a designated storm water disposal location but shall not be connected to a sanitary sewage works.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 2.7.4., every water distribution system shall be connected to a public water main or a potable private water supply system.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , every water distribution system shall be connected, to a watermain that is part of a municipal drinking water system, or  to a drinking water system, if a watermain described in Clause  is not available.

National Sentence Text: Piping in any building connected to the public services shall be connected separately from piping of any other building, except that an ancillary building on the same property may be served by the same service. (See Note A-2.1.2.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , piping in any building shall be connected to the public services separately from piping of any other building. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Piping in any building connected to the public services shall be connected separately from piping of any other building, except that an ancillary building on the same property may be served by the same service. (See Note A-2.1.2.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: An ancillary building on the same property as the main building may be served by the same service.

National Sentence Text: Every fixture, appliance, interceptor, cleanout, valve, device or piece of equipment shall be located so that it is readily accessible for use, cleaning and maintenance.
P/T Sentence Text: Every fixture, plumbing appliance, interceptor, cleanout, valve, device or piece of equipment shall be so located that it is readily accessible for use, cleaning and maintenance.

National Sentence Text: Where unusual conditions exist, such as excessively corrosive soil or water, only materials suited for use in such locations shall be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Where unusual conditions exist such as excessively corrosive soil or water, only materials suited for use in such locations shall be used.

National Article Title: Working Pressure of a Water Service Pipe
National Sentence Text: The working pressure rating of a water service pipe shall not be less than the maximum water main pressure at their point of connection as established by the water supply authority.
Shower receptors shall be constructed and arranged so that water cannot leak through the walls or floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Shower receptors shall be constructed and arranged so that water cannot leak through the walls or floor.

National Sentence Text: Where 2 or more shower heads are served by a shower drain, the floor shall be sloped and the drain located so that water from one head cannot flow over the area that serves another head. (See Note A-2.2.2.3.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where two or more shower heads are served by a shower drain, the floor shall be sloped and the drain located so that water from one head cannot flow over the area that serves another head.

National Sentence Text: Except for column showers, when a battery of shower heads is installed, the horizontal distance between 2 adjacent shower heads shall be not less than 750 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for column showers, when a battery of shower heads is installed, the horizontal distance between two adjacent shower heads shall be at least 750 mm.

National Sentence Text: A dishwashing sink and a food preparation sink shall not have concealed overflows. (See Note A-2.2.2.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A dishwashing sink and a food preparation sink shall not have concealed overflows.

National Sentence Text: A bell trap shall not be installed in a drainage system. (See Note A-2.2.3.1.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: A bell trap or an S-trap shall not be installed in a drainage system.

National Sentence Text: A drum trap shall not be used as a fixture trap unless required to serve as an interceptor and access for servicing is provided.
P/T Sentence Text: A drum trap shall not be installed in a drainage system.

National Sentence Text: Grease interceptors shall be designed so that they do not become air bound, and not have a water jacket.
P/T Sentence Text: Every grease interceptor shall be designed so that it does not become air bound.

National Sentence Text: A T fitting shall not be used in a drainage system, except to connect a vent pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: A T fitting shall not be used in a drainage system except to connect a vent pipe.

National Sentence Text: A single or double sanitary T fitting shall not be used in a nominally horizontal soil-or-waste pipe, except that a single sanitary T fitting may be used to connect a vent pipe.
A double sanitary T fitting shall not be used to connect the trap arms of back outlet water closets installed back-to-back, or 2 urinals where no cleanout fitting is provided above the connection.
P/T Sentence Text: A double sanitary T fitting shall not be used to connect the fixture drains of two urinals where no cleanout fitting is provided above the connection.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 2.2.4.3.(2), 90° elbows of 4 inch size or less whose centre-line radius is less than the size of the pipe shall not be used to join 2 soil-or-waste pipes.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences  and , 90° elbows of 4 in. size or less that have a centre-line radius that is less than the size of the pipe shall not be used to join two soil or waste pipes.

National Sentence Text: For sanitary drainage systems of 4 inch size or less, 90° elbows described in Sentence 2.2.4.3. shall only be permitted to change the direction of piping from horizontal to vertical, in the direction of flow, where a trap arm enters a wall, or to connect trap arms as permitted by Sentence 2.5.6.3.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: 90° elbows of 4 in. size or less in sanitary drainage systems may be used, to change the direction of piping from horizontal to vertical, in the direction of flow,  where a trap arm enters a wall, or  to connect trap arms as permitted by Sentence 7.5.6.3.(2).

National Sentence Text: Joints with internal elastomeric gaskets shall conform to CSA A257.3-14 Joints for Circular Concrete Sewer and Culvert Pipe, Manhole Sections, and Fittings Using Rubber Gaskets
Concrete fittings fabricated on the site from lengths of pipe shall not be used. (See Note A-2.2.5.1.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete fittings field fabricated from lengths of pipe shall not be used. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Concrete pipe shall not be used above ground inside a building.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete pipe shall not be used above ground inside a building.

National Sentence Text: Vitrified clay pipe and fittings shall not be used except for an underground part of a drainage system.
P/T Sentence Text: Vitrified clay pipe and fittings shall not be used except for an underground part of a drainage system.

National Sentence Text: Polyethylene water pipe shall not be used except for a water service pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 7.2.5.7.(1), polyethylene water pipe shall not be used except for a water service pipe.

National Sentence Text: PVC water pipe and fittings referred to in Sentences 2.2.5.6.(1), 2.2.5.6. and 2.2.5.6. shall not be used in a hot water system.
P/T Sentence Text: PVC water pipe and fittings in Sentence  shall not be used in a hot water system.

National Article Title: CPVC Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cements
National Sentence Text: The design temperature and design pressure of a CPVC piping system shall conform to Table 2.2.5.7.
P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.9. CPVC Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cements
P/T Sentence Text: The design temperature and design pressure of a CPVC piping system shall conform to Table 7.2.5.9.

National Article Title: Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
National Sentence Text: Requirements for combustible piping in relation to fire safety shall conform to Sentences 3.1.5.19. and 9.10.9.6. to , and Articles 3.1.9.5. and 9.10.9.7. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.12. Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Requirements for combustible piping in relation to fire safety shall conform to Sentences 3.1.5.16. and 9.10.9.6. to  and Articles 3.1.9.4. and 9.10.9.7.

National Article Title: Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
National Sentence Text: Where noncombustible piping pierces a fire separation or a fire stop, the requirements of fire stopping of Subsection 3.1.9., Sentence 9.10.9.6. and Article 9.10.16.4. of Division B of the NBC shall apply.
P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.12. Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Where noncombustible piping pierces a fire separation or a fire block, the requirements for fire stopping of Subsection 3.1.9., Sentence 9.10.9.6. and Article 9.10.16.4. shall apply.

National Sentence Text: PE/AL/PE pipe with a pressure rating of 690 kPa or greater at 82°C shall be permitted for hot water systems.
P/T Sentence Text: PE/AL/PE pipe with a pressure rating of 690 kPa or greater at 82ºC shall be permitted in a hot water system.

National Sentence Text: Screwed cast-iron water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.
P/T Sentence Text: Screwed cast iron water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.

National Sentence Text: Screwed malleable iron water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.
P/T Sentence Text: Screwed malleable iron water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 2.2.6.7. and 2.2.6.7.(3), welded and seamless steel pipe shall not be used in a plumbing system.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , welded and seamless steel pipe shall not be used in a plumbing system.

National Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe is permitted to be used in a drainage system or a venting system above ground inside a building.
P/T Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe may be used in a drainage system or a venting system above ground inside a building.

National Sentence Text: Couplings for corrugated steel pipe shall be constructed so that when installed they shall maintain the pipe alignment, resist the separation of adjoining lengths of pipe, prevent root penetration, and prevent the infiltration of surrounding material.
P/T Sentence Text: Couplings for corrugated steel pipe shall be constructed so that when installed they shall,  maintain the pipe alignment,  resist the separation of adjoining lengths of pipe,  prevent root penetration, and  prevent the infiltration of surrounding material.

National Article Title: Stainless Steel Butt Weld Pipe Fittings
National Sentence Text: Stainless steel butt weld pipe fittings shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.
P/T Article Title: 7.2.6.11. Stainless Steel Butt Weld Pipe Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel butt weld pipe fittings shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.

National Sentence Text: Stainless steel pipe flanges shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel pipe flanges shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.

National Sentence Text: Stainless steel threaded fittings shall be schedule 40s or greater conforming to ASTM A 182/A 182M-16a Forged or Rolled Alloy and Stainless Steel Pipe Flanges, Forged Fittings, and Valves and Parts for High-Temperature Service or ASTM A 351/A 351M-16 Castings, Austenitic, for Pressure-Containing Parts
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel threaded fittings shall be Schedule 40 or greater and shall conform to, ASTM A182 / A182M, "Forged or Rolled Alloy and Stainless Steel Pipe Flanges, Forged Fittings, and Valves and Parts for High-Temperature Service", or  ASTM A351 / A351M, "Castings, Austenitic, for Pressure-Containing Parts".

National Sentence Text: Stainless steel threaded fittings shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel threaded fittings shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.

National Sentence Text: The use of stainless steel pipe and tube shall conform to Table 2.2.6.15.
P/T Sentence Text: The use of stainless steel pipe and tube shall conform to Table 7.2.6.15.

National Article Title: Brass or Bronze Threaded Water Fittings
National Sentence Text: Brass or bronze threaded water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.
P/T Article Title: 7.2.7.3. Brass or Bronze Threaded Water Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Brass or bronze threaded water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.

National Sentence Text: Copper tube shall not be used for the fixture drain or the portion of the vent pipe below the flood level rim of manually flushing or waterless urinals.
P/T Sentence Text: Copper tube shall not be used for the fixture drain or the portion of the vent pipe below the flood level rim of manually flushing or waterless urinals.

National Sentence Text: Solder-joint fittings for drainage systems shall not be used in a water system.
P/T Sentence Text: Solder-joint fittings for drainage systems shall not be used in a water system.

National Sentence Text: Lead waste pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water system or as a building sewer.
P/T Sentence Text: Lead waste pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water system or for a building sewer.

National Sentence Text: When there is a change in size of a lead closet bend, the change shall be in the vertical section of the bend or made in a manner that prevents the retention of liquid in the bend.
P/T Sentence Text: When there is a change in size of a lead closet bend, the change shall be in the vertical section of the bend or made in such a manner that there shall be no retention of liquid in the bend.

National Sentence Text: Cement mortar shall not be used for jointing.
P/T Sentence Text: Cement-mortar shall not be used for jointing.

National Sentence Text: Solders and fluxes having a lead content in excess of 0.2% shall not be used in a potable water system.
P/T Sentence Text: Solders and fluxes having a lead content in excess of 0.2 percent shall not be used in a potable water system.

National Sentence Text: Every screw, bolt, nut and washer shall be of corrosion-resistant materials when used to connect a water closet to a floor flange, to anchor the floor flange to the floor, or to anchor the water closet to the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Every screw, bolt, nut and washer shall be of materials that are resistant to corrosion, when used, to connect a water closet to a floor flange,  to anchor the floor flange to the floor,  to anchor the water closet to the floor, or  to hold cleanout covers or floor drain grates.

National Sentence Text: A cleanout fitting that, as a result of normal maintenance operations, cannot withstand the physical stresses of removal and reinstallation or cannot ensure a gas-tight seal shall not be installed.
P/T Sentence Text: A cleanout fitting that as a result of normal maintenance operations cannot withstand the physical stresses of removal and reinstallation or cannot ensure a gas-tight seal shall not be installed.

National Sentence Text: A saddle hub or fitting shall not be installed in drainage, venting or water systems. (See Note A-2.2.10.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , a saddle hub or fitting shall not be installed in drainage systems, venting systems or water systems.

National Sentence Text: Except for lavatories in health care facilities, emergency eye washes, and emergency showers, supply fittings and individual shower heads shall have an integral means of limiting the maximum water flow rate to that specified in Table 2.2.10.6. (See Note A-2.2.10.6.(2).)

An automatic compensating valve serving an individual shower head addressed in Sentence 2.2.10.6. shall have a water flow rate equal to or less than the shower head it serves. (See Note A-2.2.10.6.(3).)

Individual pressure-balanced or thermostatic-mixing valves shall not be required for shower heads having a single tempered water supply that is controlled by an automatic compensating valve conforming to CSA B125.3-12 Plumbing Fittings

Mixing valves that supply shower heads shall be of the pressure-balanced, thermostatic, or combination pressure-balanced/thermostatic type capable of maintaining a water outlet temperature that does not exceed 49°C, and limiting thermal shock.
The temperature of water discharging into a bathtub shall not exceed 49°C.
The orifice of drinking fountain bubblers shall be of the shielded type, and direct the water upward at an angle of approximately 45°.
P/T Sentence Text: The orifice of every drinking fountain bubbler shall, be of the shielded type, and  direct the water upward to an angle of approximately 45°.

National Sentence Text: Drinking fountain bubblers shall include a means of regulating the flow to the orifice.
P/T Sentence Text: Every drinking fountain bubbler shall include a means of regulating the flow to the orifice.

National Sentence Text: Bubblers shall be installed only on drinking fountains. (See Note A-2.2.10.9.(3).)

Flashing fabricated on-site for vent pipes shall be fabricated from copper sheet not less than 0.33 mm thick, aluminum sheet not less than 0.48 mm thick, alloyed zinc sheet not less than 0.35 mm thick, lead sheet not less than 1.73 mm thick, galvanized steel sheet not less than 0.33 mm thick, or polychloroprene  not less than 2.89 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing fabricated on site for vent pipes shall be fabricated from, copper sheet at least 0.33 mm thick,  aluminum sheet at least 0.48 mm thick,  alloyed zinc sheet at least 0.35 mm thick,  lead sheet at least 1.73 mm thick,  galvanized steel sheet at least 0.33 mm thick, or  polychloroprene  at least 2.89 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Air admittance valves shall conform to ASSE 1051-2009G Individual and Branch Type Air Admittance Valves  for Sanitary Drainage Systems (See Note A-2.2.10.16.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Air admittance valves shall conform to ASSE 1051, "Individual and Branch Type Air Admittance Valves for Sanitary Drainage Systems". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Caulked lead drainage joints shall not be used except for cast-iron pipe in a drainage system or venting system, or between such pipe and other ferrous pipe, brass and copper pipe, a caulking ferrule, or a trap standard.
P/T Sentence Text: Caulked lead drainage joints shall not be used except for cast iron pipe in a drainage system or venting system, or between such pipe and,  other ferrous pipe,  brass and copper pipe,  a caulking ferrule, or  a trap standard.

National Sentence Text: Every caulked lead drainage joint shall be firmly packed with oakum and tightly caulked with lead to a depth of not less than 25 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Every caulked lead drainage joint shall be firmly packed with oakum and tightly caulked with lead to a depth of at least 25 mm.

National Sentence Text: No paint, varnish or other coating shall be applied on the lead until after the joint has been tested.
P/T Sentence Text: No paint, varnish or other coating shall be applied on the lead until after the joint has been tested.

National Sentence Text: Wiped joints shall not be used except for sheet lead or lead pipe, or between such pipe and copper pipe or a ferrule.
P/T Sentence Text: Wiped joints shall not be used except for sheet lead or lead pipe, or between such pipe and copper pipe or a ferrule.

National Sentence Text: Caulking compound used in cold-caulked joints shall be applied according to the manufacturer's directions.
P/T Sentence Text: The caulking compound used in cold-caulked joints shall be applied according to the manufacturer s directions.

National Sentence Text: Cold-caulked joints in a drainage system shall be firmly packed with oakum and tightly caulked with cold caulking compound to a depth of not less than 25 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Every cold-caulked joint in a drainage system shall be firmly packed with oakum and tightly caulked with cold caulking compound to a depth of at least 25 mm.

National Sentence Text: Drilled and tapped joints shall not be made in a soil-or-waste pipe or vent pipe and fittings unless suitable provision has been made for drilling and tapping.

Tees may be extracted from the wall thickness of Types K and L copper tube used in a water distribution system provided that a tool specifically designed for the purpose is used, the branch is at least one size smaller than the tube in which the tee is formed, the end of the branch incorporates a means to prevent it from penetrating into the run and thereby obstructing flow, and the joint at the tee is brazed with a filler metal having a melting point not below 540°C.

National Article Title: Prohibition of Welding of Pipes and Fittings
National Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall not be welded.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.3.3. Prohibition of Welding of Pipes and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall not be welded.

National Sentence Text: Slip joints shall not be used in a venting system, or in a drainage system, except to connect a fixture trap to a fixture drain in an accessible location.
P/T Sentence Text: A slip joint shall not be used, in a venting system, or  in a drainage system, except to connect a fixture trap to a fixture drain in an accessible location.

National Article Title: Connection of Roof Drain to Leader
National Sentence Text: Roof drains shall be securely connected to a leader and provision shall be made for expansion.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.3.7. Connection of Roof Drain to Leader
P/T Sentence Text: Every roof drain shall be securely connected to a leader and provision shall be made for expansion.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.3.3.8.(3), floor flanges shall be brass.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , every floor flange shall be of brass.

National Sentence Text: Where cast-iron or plastic pipe is used, a floor flange of the same material is permitted to be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Where cast iron or plastic pipe is used, a floor flange of the same material may be used.

National Sentence Text: Floor flanges and fixtures shall be securely set on a firm base and fastened to the floor or trap flange of the fixture.
P/T Sentence Text: Every floor flange and fixture shall be securely set on a firm base and fastened to the floor or trap flange of the fixture.

National Sentence Text: Joints in a floor flange or between a fixture and the drainage system shall be sealed with a resilient watertight and gas-tight seal.
P/T Sentence Text: Every joint in a floor flange or between a fixture and the drainage system shall be sealed with a resilient, watertight and gas-tight seal.

National Sentence Text: Where a lead water-closet stub is used, the length of the stub below the floor flange shall be not less than 75 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a lead water closet stub is used, the length of the stub below the floor flange shall be at least 75 mm.

National Sentence Text: The size of the air break shall at least equal the size of the fixture drain, branch or pipe that terminates above the directly connected fixture, and it shall be not less than 25 mm. (See Note A-2.3.3.11.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: The size of the air break shall be at least 25 mm.

National Sentence Text: Wall-mounted fixtures shall be supported so that no strain is transmitted to the piping.
P/T Sentence Text: Every wall mounted fixture shall be supported so that no strain is transmitted to the piping.

National Sentence Text: Piping, fixtures, tanks or devices shall be supported independently of each other.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping, fixtures, tanks or devices shall be supported independently of each other.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.3.4.4.(2), vertical piping shall be supported at its base and at the floor level of alternate storeys by rests, each of which can bear the weight of pipe that is between it and the rest above it.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , vertical piping shall be supported at its base and at the floor level of alternate storeys by rests, each of which can bear the weight of pipe that is between it and the rest above it.

National Sentence Text: The maximum spacing of supports shall be 7.5 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum spacing of supports shall be 7.5 m.

National Sentence Text: Nominally horizontal piping shall be supported as stated in Table 2.3.4.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Nominally horizontal piping shall be supported so that, galvanized iron or steel pipe is supported at intervals not exceeding,  3.75 m if the pipe size is 6 in. or more, and  2 500 mm if the pipe size is less than 6 in.,  lead pipe is supported throughout its length,  cast iron pipe is supported,  at or adjacent to each hub or joint,  at intervals not exceeding 3 m, and  at intervals not exceeding 1 000 mm if the pipe has mechanical joints and the length of pipe between adjacent fittings is 300 mm or less,  reserved  ABS or PVC plastic DWV pipe is supported,  at intervals not exceeding 1 200 mm,  at the ends of branches,  at changes of direction or elevation, and  if the pipe is a fixture drain that is more than 1 000 mm in length, as close as possible to the trap,  plastic water pipe is supported at intervals not exceeding 1 000 mm,  copper tube and copper and brass pipe is supported at intervals not exceeding,  3 m if the tube or pipe is hard temper and larger than 1 in. in size,  2 500 mm if the tube or pipe is hard temper and 1 in. in size or less, and  2 500 mm if the tube is soft temper,  aluminum DWV pipe is supported,  at intervals not greater than 3 m,  at both sides of all joints,  at all branch ends,  at all points where there is a change in direction, and  as close to all traps as possible,  supports and hangers for aluminum DWV pipe shall have a broad support base and shall be free of burrs and rough edges to prevent abrasion of the pipe,  where joints in the piping are less rigid than the pipe, the support points shall be selected so as to minimize the shear and bending forces imposed on the joints,  PE/AL/PE or PEX/AL/PEX composite pipe is supported at intervals not exceeding 1 000 mm,  PP-R plastic pipe is supported,  at intervals not exceeding 1 000 mm,  at the end of branches, and  at changes of direction and elevation, and  stainless steel pipe or tube is supported at intervals not exceeding,  3 000 mm if the pipe or tube size is 1 in. or more, and  2 500 mm if the pipe or tube size is less than 1 in.

National Sentence Text: Where PVC, CPVC or ABS plastic pipe is installed the pipe shall be aligned without added strain on the piping, the pipe shall not be bent or pulled into position after being welded, and hangers shall not compress, cut or abrade the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Where plastic pipe or a composite pipe incorporating a plastic component is installed, the pipe shall be aligned without added strain on the piping,  the pipe shall not be bent or pulled into position after being welded or joined, and  hangers shall not compress, cut or abrade the pipe.

National Sentence Text: Where hangers are used to support nominally horizontal piping, the hangers shall be supported by metal rods of not less than 6 mm diam to support piping 2 inches or less in size, 8 mm diam to support piping 4 inches or less in size, and 13 mm diam to support piping over 4 inches in size, or solid or perforated metal straps of not less than 0.6 mm nominal thickness and 12 mm wide to support piping 2 inches or less in size, and 0.8 mm nominal thickness and 18 mm wide to support piping 4 inches or less in size.
P/T Sentence Text: Where hangers are used to support nominally horizontal piping, the hangers shall be,  supported by metal rods of not less than,  6 mm diam for supporting pipe 2 in. or less in size,  8 mm diam for supporting pipe 4 in. or less in size, and  13 mm diam for supporting pipe over 4 in. in size, or  solid or perforated metal straps not less than,  0.6 mm nominal thickness, 12 mm wide for pipe 2 in. or less in size, and  0.8 mm nominal thickness, 18 mm wide for pipe 4 in. or less in size.

National Sentence Text: Nominally horizontal piping installed underground that is not supported as described in Sentence 2.3.4.6. may be installed using hangers fixed to a foundation or structural slab provided that the hangers are capable of keeping the pipe in alignment, and supporting the weight of the pipe, its contents, and the fill over the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Nominally horizontal piping installed underground that is not supported as described in Sentence  may be installed using hangers fixed to a foundation or structural slab provided that the hangers are capable of, keeping the pipe in alignment, and  supporting the weight,  of the pipe,  its contents, and  the fill over the pipe.

National Sentence Text: Where piping passes through or under a wall, it shall be installed so that the wall does not bear on the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Where piping passes through or under a wall, it shall be installed so that the wall does not bear on the pipe.

National Sentence Text: Plumbing, piping and equipment exposed to mechanical damage shall be protected.
P/T Sentence Text: Plumbing, piping and equipment exposed to mechanical damage shall be protected.

National Article Title: Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
National Sentence Text: Except in the case of an external leader, after a section of a drainage system or a venting system has been roughed in, and before any fixture is installed or piping is covered, a water pressure test or an air pressure test shall be conducted.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.6.1. Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Except in the case of an external leader, after a section of drainage system or a venting system has been roughed in, and before any fixture is installed or piping is covered, a water or an air test shall be conducted.

National Article Title: Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
National Sentence Text: After every fixture is installed and before any part of the drainage system or venting system is placed in operation, a final test shall be carried out when requested.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.6.1. Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Where a chief building official requires a final test, it shall be carried out after every fixture is installed and before any part of the drainage system or venting system is placed in operation.

National Article Title: Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
National Sentence Text: Where a prefabricated system is assembled off the building site in such a manner that it cannot be inspected and tested on site, off-site inspections and tests shall be conducted.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.6.1. Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Where a prefabricated system is assembled off the building site in such a manner that it cannot be inspected and tested on site, off-site inspections and tests shall be conducted.

National Article Title: Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
National Sentence Text: Where a prefabricated system is installed as part of a drainage system or venting system, all other plumbing work shall be tested and inspected and a final test shall be carried out on the complete system when requested.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.6.1. Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Where a prefabricated system is installed as part of a drainage system and venting system, all other plumbing work shall be tested and inspected and a final test shall be carried out on the complete system.

National Article Title: Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
National Sentence Text: When requested, a ball test shall be made to any pipe in a drainage system.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.6.1. Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
P/T Sentence Text: A ball test shall be carried out on a sanitary building drain, sanitary building sewer, storm building drain and a storm building sewer buried underground.

National Article Title: Tests of Pipes in Drainage Systems
National Sentence Text: Pipes in a drainage system, except an external leader or fixture outlet pipe, shall be capable of withstanding without leakage a water pressure test, air pressure test and final test.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.6.2. Tests of Pipes in Drainage Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Every pipe in a drainage system, except an external leader or fixture outlet pipe, shall be capable of withstanding without leakage a water test, air test and final test.

National Article Title: Tests of Pipes in Drainage Systems
National Sentence Text: Pipes in a drainage system shall be capable of meeting a ball test.
Venting systems shall be capable of withstanding without leakage a water pressure test, air pressure test and final test.
P/T Sentence Text: Every venting system shall be capable of withstanding without leakage a water test, air test and final test.

National Sentence Text: A water pressure test shall consist in applying a water column of at least 3 m to all joints.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.6.4. Water Tests in Drain, Waste and Vent Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Where a water test is made, all joints shall be tested with a water column of not less than 3 m.

National Sentence Text: In making a water pressure test, every opening except the highest shall be tightly closed with a testing plug or a screw cap, and the system or the section shall be kept filled with water for 15 min.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.6.4. Water Tests in Drain, Waste and Vent Systems
P/T Sentence Text: In making a water test, every opening except the highest shall be tightly closed with a testing plug or a test cap, and  the system or the section shall be kept filled with water for 15 min.

National Sentence Text: Where a final test is made, every trap shall be filled with water, the bottom of the system being tested shall terminate at a building trap, test plug or cap, except as provided in Sentence 2.3.6.6.(2), smoke from smoke-generating machines shall be forced into the system, when the smoke appears from all roof terminals they shall be closed, and a pressure equivalent to a 25 mm water column shall be maintained for 15 min without the addition of more smoke.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a final test is made, every trap shall be filled with water,  the bottom of the system being tested shall terminate at the building trap, test plug or cap,  except as provided in Sentence , smoke from smoke-generating machines shall be forced into the system,  when the smoke appears from all roof terminals they shall be closed, and  a pressure equivalent to a 25 mm water column shall be maintained for 15 min without the addition of more smoke.

National Sentence Text: The diameter of the ball shall be not less than 50 mm where the size of the pipe is 3 inches or more, or 25 mm where the size of the pipe is less than 3 inches.
P/T Sentence Text: The diameter of the ball shall be not less than 50 mm where the size of the pipe is 4 in. or more.

National Sentence Text: After a section of a potable water system has been completed, and before it is placed in operation, a water pressure test shall be conducted, except that an air pressure test may be used in freezing conditions.
P/T Sentence Text: After a section of a potable water system has been completed, and before it is placed in operation, a water test or an air test shall be conducted.

National Sentence Text: A pressure test may be applied to each section of the system or to the system as a whole.
P/T Sentence Text: A test may be applied to each section of the system or to the system as a whole.

National Sentence Text: Where a prefabricated system is assembled off the building site in such a manner that it cannot be inspected and tested on site, off-site inspections and pressure tests shall be conducted.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a prefabricated system is assembled off the building site in such a manner that it cannot be inspected and tested on site, off-site inspections and tests shall be conducted.

National Sentence Text: Where a prefabricated system is installed as part of a water system, all other plumbing work shall be tested and inspected, and the complete system shall be pressure tested when requested.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a prefabricated system is installed as part of a water system, all other plumbing work shall be tested and inspected, and  the complete system shall be pressure tested.

National Article Title: Pressure Tests of Potable Water Systems
National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 2.3.7.2.(2), potable water systems shall be able to withstand without leaking, a water pressure that is at least equal to the maximum in-service pressure, or an air pressure of not less than 700 kPa for at least 2 h without a drop in pressure.
P/T Sentence Text: Every potable water system shall be capable of, withstanding without leakage a water pressure that is at least 1 000 kPa for at least 1 h, or  withstanding for at least 2 h without a drop in pressure an air pressure that is at least 700 kPa.

National Article Title: Pressure Tests of Potable Water Systems
National Sentence Text: If a manufacturer states that an air pressure test is not recommended, a water pressure test shall be performed. (See Note A-2.3.7.2.(2).)
Where a water pressure test is made, all air shall be expelled from the system before fixture control valves or faucets are closed.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a water test is made, all air shall be expelled from the system before fixture control valves or faucets are closed.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to sanitary drainage systems, storm drainage systems, combined building drains or combined building sewers.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to sanitary drainage systems and storm drainage systems.

National Sentence Text: Where a vent pipe is connected into the suds pressure zone referred to in Sentence 2.4.2.1.(4), no other vent pipe shall be connected to that vent pipe within the height of the suds pressure zone. (See Note A-2.4.2.1.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a vent pipe is connected into a suds pressure zone referred to in Sentence , no other vent pipe shall be connected to that vent pipe within the height of the suds pressure zone.

National Sentence Text: Urinals shall not be installed adjacent to wall and floor surfaces that are pervious to water. (See Article 3.7.2.6. of Division B of the NBC.)
P/T Sentence Text: Sanitary units, bathtubs and shower baths shall not be installed adjacent to wall and floor surfaces that are pervious to water.

National Article Title: Equipment Restrictions Upstream of Grease Interceptors
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.4.3.3.(2), equipment discharging waste with organic solids shall not be located upstream of a grease interceptor. (See Note A-2.4.3.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , equipment discharging waste with organic solids shall not be located upstream of an interceptor.

National Article Title: Equipment Restrictions Upstream of Grease Interceptors
National Sentence Text: An organic solids interceptor is permitted to be installed upstream of a grease interceptor.
P/T Sentence Text: If a food scrap interceptor has been installed upstream of the grease interceptor, equipment discharging waste with organic solids may discharge through a grease interceptor.

National Sentence Text: A macerating toilet system shall only be installed where no connection to a gravity sanitary drainage system is available.
P/T Sentence Text: A maceration toilet system shall only be installed, where no connection to a gravity sanitary drainage system is available, and  in accordance with the manufacturer s instructions.

National Sentence Text: Where a drain is provided in an elevator pit, it shall be connected directly to a sump located outside the elevator pit, and the drain pipe that connects the sump to the drainage system shall have a backwater valve.
P/T Sentence Text: If a floor drain is provided in an elevator pit, it shall be installed in accordance with 2.2. of ASME A17.1 / CSA B44, "Safety Code for Elevators and Escalators".

National Sentence Text: Where a fixture discharges sewage that includes fats, oils or grease and is located in a public kitchen, in a restaurant or in a care or detention occupancy, it shall discharge through a grease interceptor. (See Note A-2.4.4.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for suites of residential occupancy, where a fixture discharges sewage that includes fats, oils or grease and is located in an area where food is cooked, processed or prepared, it shall discharge through a grease interceptor.

National Sentence Text: Where the discharge from a fixture may contain oil or gasoline, an oil interceptor shall be installed. (See Article 2.5.5.2. for venting requirements for oil interceptors.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , oil interceptors shall be provided as follows: service stations, repair shops and garages or any establishment where motor vehicles are repaired, lubricated or maintained shall be provided with an oil interceptor, and  establishments which use oily or flammable liquids or have such wastes as a result of an industrial process shall be provided with an engineered oil interceptor.

National Sentence Text: Where a fixture discharges sand, grit or similar materials, an interceptor designed for the purpose of trapping such discharges shall be installed.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fixture discharges sand, grit or similar materials, an interceptor designed for the purpose of intercepting such discharges shall be installed.

National Sentence Text: Interceptors shall have sufficient capacity to perform the service for which it is provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Every interceptor shall have sufficient capacity to perform the service for which it is provided.

National Sentence Text: Neutralizing and dilution tanks shall have a method for neutralizing the liquid.
P/T Sentence Text: Each neutralizing or diluting tank shall have a method for neutralizing the liquid.

National Sentence Text: An interceptor with an effective water seal of not less than 38 mm is permitted to serve as a trap. (See Note A-2.4.5.1.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: A grease interceptor shall not serve as a fixture trap and each fixture discharging through the interceptor shall be trapped and vented.

National Sentence Text: Where a domestic dishwashing machine equipped with a drainage pump discharges through a direct connection into the fixture outlet pipe of an adjacent kitchen sink or disposal unit, the pump discharge line shall rise as high as possible to just under the counter and connect on the inlet side of the sink trap by means of a Y fitting, or to the disposal unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a domestic dishwashing machine equipped with a drainage pump discharges through a direct connection into the fixture outlet pipe of an adjacent kitchen sink or disposal unit, the pump discharge line shall, rise as high as possible to just under the counter, and  connect,  on the inlet side of the sink trap by means of a Y fitting, or  to the disposal unit.

National Sentence Text: A floor drain that drains to a storm drainage system shall be protected by a trap that is located between the floor drain and a leader, storm building drain or storm building sewer, may serve all floor drains located in the same room, and need not be protected by a vent pipe.
Where freezing conditions could cause storm drainage systems to freeze due to air circulation within the piping, a trap with a cleanout shall be installed in a heated location.

National Article Title: Connection of Subsoil Drainage Pipe to a Sanitary Drainage
National Sentence Text: Where a subsoil drainage pipe is connected to a sanitary drainage system, the connection shall be made on the upstream side of a trap with a cleanout or a trapped sump. (See Note A-2.4.5.3.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 7.4.5.3. Connection of Subsoil Drainage Pipe to a Sanitary Drainage System
P/T Sentence Text: Where a subsoil drainage pipe may be connected to a sanitary drainage system, the connection shall be made on the upstream side of a trap with a cleanout or a trapped sump.

National Sentence Text: No vertical soil-or-waste pipe shall conduct both sewage and storm water.
P/T Sentence Text: No vertical soil or waste pipe shall conduct both sanitary sewage and storm sewage.

National Sentence Text: A combined building drain shall not be installed. (See Note A-2.1.2.1.(2).)
There shall be no unused open ends in a drainage system and dead ends shall be so graded that water will not collect in them.
P/T Sentence Text: There shall be no unused open ends in a drainage system and dead ends shall be so graded that water will not collect in them.

National Sentence Text: A soil-or-waste pipe shall not be located directly above non-pressure potable water storage tanks, manholes in pressure potable water storage tanks, or food-handling or food-processing equipment.
P/T Article Title: 7.4.6.2. Location of Soil or Waste Pipes
P/T Sentence Text: A soil or waste pipe shall not be located directly above, non-pressure potable water storage tanks,  manholes in pressure potable water storage tanks, or  food-handling or processing equipment.

National Sentence Text: Piping that is too low to drain into a building sewer by gravity shall be drained to a sump or receiving tank.
P/T Sentence Text: Only piping that is too low to drain into a building sewer by gravity shall be drained to a sump or receiving tank.

National Sentence Text: Where the sump or tank receives sewage, it shall be water- and air-tight and shall be vented.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the sump or tank receives sanitary sewage it shall be water and air-tight and shall be vented.

National Sentence Text: Equipment such as a pump or ejector that can lift the contents of the sump or tank and discharge it into the building drain or building sewer shall be installed.
P/T Sentence Text: Equipment such as a pump or ejector that can lift the contents of the sump or tank and discharge it into the sanitary building drain or sanitary building sewer shall be installed.

National Sentence Text: Where the equipment does not operate automatically, the capacity of the sump shall be sufficient to hold at least a 24 h accumulation of liquid.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the equipment does not operate automatically, the capacity of the sump shall be sufficient to hold at least a 24 hour accumulation of liquid.

National Sentence Text: Where there is a building trap, the discharge pipe from the equipment shall be connected to the building drain downstream of the trap.
P/T Sentence Text: Where there is a building trap, the discharge pipe from the equipment shall be connected to the sanitary building drain downstream of the trap.

National Sentence Text: The discharge pipe from every pumped sump shall be equipped with a union, a backwater valve and a shut-off valve installed in that sequence in the direction of discharge.
P/T Sentence Text: The discharge pipe from every pumped sanitary sewage sump shall be equipped with a union, a check valve and a shut-off valve installed in that sequence in the direction of discharge.

National Sentence Text: The discharge piping from a pump or ejector shall be sized for optimum flow velocities at pump design conditions.
P/T Sentence Text: The discharge piping from a pump or ejector shall be sized for optimum flow velocities at pump design conditions.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 2.4.6.4.(2), a backwater valve or a gate valve that would prevent the free circulation of air shall not be installed in a building drain or in a building sewer. (See Note A-2.4.6.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , a backwater valve that would prevent free circulation of air shall not be installed in a building drain or in a building sewer.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 2.4.6.4. to 2.4.6.4.(6), where a building drain or a branch may be subject to backflow, a gate valve or a backwater valve shall be installed on every fixture drain connected to them when the fixture is located below the level of the adjoining street.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , where a building drain or a branch may be subject to backflow, a backwater valve shall be installed on every fixture drain connected to it when the fixture is located below the level of the adjoining street, or  a backwater valve shall be installed to protect fixtures which are below the upstream sanitary manhole cover when a residential building is served by a public sanitary sewer.

National Sentence Text: Where the fixture is a floor drain, a removable screw cap is permitted to be installed on the upstream side of the trap.
Where more than one fixture is located on a storey and all are connected to the same branch, the gate valve or backwater valve is permitted to be installed on the branch.
P/T Sentence Text: Where more than one fixture is located on a storey and all are connected to the same branch, the backwater valve may be installed on the branch.

National Sentence Text: A cleanout fitting shall be provided on the upstream side and directly over every running trap.
P/T Sentence Text: A cleanout fitting shall be provided on the upstream side and directly over every running trap.

National Sentence Text: Interior leaders shall be provided with a cleanout fitting at the bottom of the leader or not more than 3 m upstream from the bottom of the leader.
P/T Sentence Text: Every interior leader shall be provided with a cleanout fitting at the bottom of the leader or not more than 1 000 mm upstream from the bottom of the leader.
