P/T Sentence Text: If the floor area of a tire storage location exceeds 250 m2, the floor area shall be provided with a sprinkler system installed in accordance with NFPA 13, "Standard for the Installation of Sprinkler Systems".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.2.3.(2), the size limits and clearances for individual storage areas shall conform to Subsections 3.3.3. and 3.3.4.
In sprinklered buildings, the clearance between the top of storage and ceiling sprinkler deflectors shall conform to the standard used to design the sprinkler system.
P/T Sentence Text: The clearance between sprinkler head deflectors and the top of any storage shall not be less than 457 mm.

National Sentence Text: Where the total storage area exceeds 6 000 m2 , the access route required in Sentence 3.3.2.5. shall be connected with a public thoroughfare in at least 2 locations.

Private hydrants, fire department connections and private valves controlling water supplies to fire protection systems shall be maintained in conformance with part 6., and kept accessible to firefighters and their equipment at all times.
Except as permitted in Sentences 3.2.2.4. and 3.2.2.4.(3), combustible pallets shall be stored outdoors in conformance with Section 3.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences  and , combustible pallets shall be stored outdoors in conformance with Section 2.4.

National Sentence Text: In a sprinklered building, the storage of combustible pallets is permitted to exceed the values stated in Sentence 3.2.2.4. provided such storage conforms to NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems (See Note A-3.2.2.4.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: In a sprinklered building, the storage of combustible pallets is permitted to exceed the values in Sentence  provided such storage conforms to NFPA 13, "Standard for the Installation of Sprinkler Systems".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in part 2., smoking shall not be permitted in an indoor storage area.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoking shall not take place in indoor storage areas, except as provided in Subsection 2.4.3.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.2.12.(2), the dispensing of flammable liquids or combustible liquids into the fuel tank of a vehicle shall conform to part 4.

Provision shall be made for the safe drainage and containment of waste oils or dangerous goods emptied or escaping from stored products under normal storage conditions or in a fire situation, in conformance with part 4.
It is permitted to waive the clearance required in Sentence 3.3.3.2. if an individual storage area has a base area not greater than 5 m2 .

In addition to the requirements of Subsection 3.1.3. part 3., industrial trucks used or stored within buildings where ammonium nitrate is also stored shall be maintained so that fuels or hydraulic fluids do not contaminate the ammonium nitrate. (See Note A-3.2.9.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to the requirements of Section 3.4, industrial trucks used or stored within the building shall be maintained so that fuels or hydraulic fluids do not contaminate the ammonium nitrate.

National Sentence Text: The requirements of Subsection 3.2.3. part 3. regarding Class II commodities shall also apply to bagged storage of ammonium nitrate. (See Note A-3.2.1.1.(1)(a).)
P/T Sentence Text: Individual storage areas of bagged ammonium nitrate shall not exceed 1500 m2 in area and 9 m in height.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in part 4. or otherwise specified in this Code, this Subsection applies to the outdoor storage of dangerous goods in packages or containers.

Where a product has multiple classes, the applicable small quantity exemption referred to in Sentence 3.3.4.1. shall be determined using Column A of Table 3.2.7.1. based on the class having precedence, as established in Section 2.8 of TC SOR/2016-95 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations  Column B of Table 3.2.7.1. based on the class having precedence, as established in Table A-3.2.7.1.(3)(b), for controlled products under the HC Hazardous Products Act, Part II Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System  as classified in Part 7 of HC SOR/2015-17 Hazardous Products Regulations or when the class having precedence cannot be established, Column C of Table 3.2.7.1. based on the lesser of the two small quantity exemptions.
An individual storage area for dangerous goods shall not be greater than 1 000 m2 .
The individual storage areas for loose combustible fibres described in Sentence 3.2.6.3. shall not exceed 250 m2 .
P/T Sentence Text: Quantities of loose combustible fibres stored in an individual room referred to in Sentence  shall be arranged so that an individual pile does not exceed 250 m2 in area and is separated from other piles by aisles that are at least 2.4 m wide.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 3.2.6.4. , 3.2.6.4. and 3.2.6.4.(4), baled combustible fibres shall be stored so that no individual storage area exceeds 250 m2 , the height of storage in an individual storage area does not exceed 4.5 m, subsidiary aisles within individual storage areas are not less than 1 m wide, and the clearance between piles and building walls is not less than 1 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Baled combustible fibres shall be stored so that  a single pile will not contain more than 700 m3,  the maximum height of any single pile will not exceed 4.5 m,  piles are separated by aisles not less than 1.5 m wide, and  the clearance between piles and building walls is not less than 1 m.

National Sentence Text: The outdoor storage of dangerous goods shall conform to Articles 3.2.7.13. and 3.2.7.14.
In sprinklered buildings, the clearance between the top of storage and ceiling sprinkler deflectors shall conform to the standard used to design the sprinkler system.
P/T Article Title: Clearance for sprinklers and structural framing
P/T Sentence Text: The clearance between sprinkler head deflectors and the tops of storage piles shall not be less than 457 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in part 3., this Subsection applies to the outdoor storage of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases.

For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Sentence 1.2.1.1.(1), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in Table 3.4.1.1. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)

Except as provided in Sentences 3.1.3.1. and 3.1.3.1.(3), the designation, use, maintenance and operation of industrial trucks shall conform to NFPA 505-2013 Powered Industrial Trucks Including Type Designations, Areas of Use, Conversions, Maintenance, and Operations
P/T Sentence Text: The designation, use, maintenance and operation of industrial trucks, including fork lifts, tractors, sweepers and motorized hand trucks, shall comply with NFPA 505, "Fire Safety Standard for Powered Industrial Trucks Including Type Designations, Areas of Use, Conversions, Maintenance, and Operation".

National Sentence Text: Fuel-fired industrial trucks that are fuelled by replaceable propane cylinders are permitted to have their cylinders replaced indoors provided cylinder replacement is done at a safe location that is at least 7.5 m from ignition sources, open pits and underground entrances, the cylinders valves are closed, when an automatic quick-closing coupling that closes in both directions when uncoupled is not provided, the engine is operated until the fuel in the system is consumed, and spare propane cylinders are stored in conformance with Subsection 3.3.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Industrial trucks that are fuelled by replaceable propane cylinders are permitted to have their cylinders replaced indoors provided  cylinder replacement is done at a safe location that is at least 7.5 m from ignition sources, open pits and underground entrances,  the cylinder valves are closed, and  when an automatic quick-"losing coupling that closes in both directions when uncoupled and listed to ANSI/UL 558, "Industrial Trucks, Internal Combustion Engine"Powered", is not provided, the engine is operated until the fuel in the system is consumed.

National Sentence Text: Fuel-fired industrial trucks that are fuelled by replaceable propane cylinders are permitted to have their cylinders replaced indoors provided cylinder replacement is done at a safe location that is at least 7.5 m from ignition sources, open pits and underground entrances, the cylinders valves are closed, when an automatic quick-closing coupling that closes in both directions when uncoupled is not provided, the engine is operated until the fuel in the system is consumed, and spare propane cylinders are stored in conformance with Subsection 3.3.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Propane cylinders shall be stored in conformance with Section 5.6.

National Sentence Text: When in a fire department access route, the gates required in Sentence 3.3.2.6. shall be of adequate width and design, and in a location that readily permits the entry of fire department vehicles, in conformance with Article 3.3.2.5. (See Note A-3.3.2.6.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where storage areas are fenced or otherwise enclosed, gates having a clear width of 3.5 m shall be provided to permit the entry of fire department vehicles.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.1.1.1. and 4.1.1.1.(3), this Part applies to the storage, handling, use and processing of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in buildings, structures and open areas, and dangerous goods classified as flammable gases at fuel-dispensing stations.
P/T Sentence Text: This Part applies to the storage, handling, processing, dispensing and use, in buildings, structures and open areas, of  flammable liquids,  combustible liquids, and  liquids with flash points greater than 93.3°C, when processed, stored, handled or used at temperatures above their flash points.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: In addition to the requirements in this Part, the storage, handling and use of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in laboratories shall be in conformance with part 5.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Unless otherwise specified, this Section shall apply to all areas involved in the storage, handling or use of flammable liquids and combustible liquids covered in this Part.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: When Class I or II liquids are added to the used oils described in Sentence 4.1.2.3.(1), the resulting mixture shall be classified through tests conforming to Subsection 4.1.3., or in the absence of the tests referred to in Sentence 4.1.2.3.(2), as a Class IC liquid if Class I liquids are added, or as a Class II liquid if only Class II liquids are added.
P/T Sentence Text: When Class I or II liquids are added to the used oils described to in Sentence , the resulting mixture shall be classified  through tests conforming to Subsection 4.1.3., or  in the absence of tests referred to in Clause (a),  as a Class IC liquid if Class I liquids are added, or  as a Class II liquid if only Class II liquids are added.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.1.3.1. and 4.1.3.1.(4), the flash point of liquids having a kinematic viscosity of 6 cSt or more at 37.8°C or a flash point of 93.3°C or higher shall be determined in conformance with ASTM D 93-13e1 Flash Point by Pensky-Martens Closed Cup Tester
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , the flash point of liquids having a viscosity of 6 mm2/s or more at 37.8°C or a flash point of 93.3°C or higher shall be determined in conformance with ASTM D93, "Flash Point by Pensky-Martens Closed Cup Tester".

National Sentence Text: Where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are present, electrical equipment shall conform to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I for hazardous locations. (See Notes A-4.1.4.1. and A-5.1.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical equipment in a location where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are present shall conform to the Electrical Safety Code made under the Electricity Act, 1998.

National Sentence Text: Except for designated safe smoking areas conforming to part 2., smoking shall not be permitted in areas described in Article 4.1.1.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoking shall not take place in areas described in Article 4.1.1.1., except as provided in Subsection 2.4.3.

National Sentence Text: Except for designated safe smoking areas conforming to part 2., smoking shall not be permitted in areas described in Article 4.1.1.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoking shall not take place in areas described in Article 4.1.1.1., except as provided in Subsection 2.4.3.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.1.5.5.(2), emergency planning measures conforming to part 2. shall be provided for all buildings, parts of buildings and open areas described in Article 4.1.1.1.
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of Section 2.8 shall apply to buildings and open areas where the quantities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids exceeds 500 L in total or exceeds 250 L of Class I liquids.

National Sentence Text: Hot works shall be performed in conformance with Section 5.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Hot works shall be performed in conformance with Section 5.17.

National Sentence Text: The fire safety plan required by Article 4.1.5.5. shall include measures to be taken to direct the overflow of spilled liquids and firefighting water away from buildings, adjoining properties, means of egress, air intakes or openings that could permit vapour entry into the building, fire alarm control panels, fire department access routes, valves controlling the water supply for firefighting, or fire protection systems, fire department pumper connections or wall hydrants, isolation valves controlling processes, and valves controlling the flow of flammableliquids or combustible liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: A spill control procedure shall be approved and implemented for any occupancy where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored, handled, processed or used.

National Article Title: Location of Air Inlets and Outlets
National Sentence Text: Inlets and outlets conforming to Sentence 4.1.7.3. or 4.1.7.3. shall be deemed to have met the requirements of Sentence 4.1.7.3.(1).
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Subject to the provisions in Sentence 3.2.8.2.(1), where make-up air for a mechanical ventilation system is taken from within the building, the opening into the room or enclosed space shall be provided with a fire damper.
P/T Sentence Text: Where make-up air for a mechanical ventilation system is taken from within the building, the opening into the room or enclosed space shall be provided with a fire damper.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where a mechanical ventilation system is installed in conformance with Article 4.1.7.2., and where exhaust air is recirculated, a fail-safe vapour detection and alarm system shall be provided to continuously monitor the flammable vapour concentration in the exhaust air, and if the vapour concentration in Sentence 4.1.7.6. exceeds 25% of the lower explosive limit of the vapour, to sound an alarm in an attended area, stop the recirculation of air, and redirect the exhaust air to an outdoor location.
P/T Sentence Text: A mechanical ventilation system referred to in Article 4.1.7.2. that recirculates exhaust air shall be provided with a fail-safe vapour detection and alarm system to continuously monitor the flammable vapour concentration in the exhaust air.

National Sentence Text: Where a mechanical ventilation system is installed in conformance with Article 4.1.7.2., and where exhaust air is recirculated, a fail-safe vapour detection and alarm system shall be provided to continuously monitor the flammable vapour concentration in the exhaust air, and if the vapour concentration in Sentence 4.1.7.6. exceeds 25% of the lower explosive limit of the vapour, to sound an alarm in an attended area, stop the recirculation of air, and redirect the exhaust air to an outdoor location.
P/T Sentence Text: If the flammable vapour concentration in the exhaust air exceeds 25% of the lower explosive limit of the vapour, the vapour detection and alarm system shall  sound an alarm in an attended area,  stop the recirculation of air, and  redirect the exhaust air to an outdoor location.

National Sentence Text: Class I liquids shall be drawn from or transferred into containers or storage tanks within a building through a piping or transfer system conforming to part 4., by means of a pump designed in conformance with good engineering practice on top of the container or storage tank, or by gravity through a self-closing valve designed in conformance with good engineering practice.
P/T Sentence Text: Class I liquids shall be drawn from or transferred into containers or storage tanks within a building  through a piping or transfer system conforming to Section 4.4,  by means of a pump designed in conformance with good engineering practice on top of the container or storage tank, or  by gravity through a self-closing valve designed in conformance with good engineering practice.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise stated in this Code, this Section shall not apply to bulk plants covered in Section 4.7., refineries covered in Section 4.9. and distilleries covered in Section 4.10., liquids in the fuel tank of motors or engines, distilled beverage alcohol in closed containers when stored in conformance with Part 3, food and pharmaceutical products when in closed containers having a capacity of not more than 5 L, or products containing not more than 50% by volume of water-miscible flammable liquids or combustible liquids with the remainder of the solution being non-flammable, when in closed containers having a capacity of not more than 5 L.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise stated in this Part, this Section does not apply to  properties subject to Section 4.6, refineries subject to Section 4.8 and distilleries subject to Section 4.9,  liquids in the fuel tank of motors or engines,  distilled beverage alcohol in closed containers that are stored in accordance with Part 3 of Division B of NRC, National Fire Code of Canada ,  food and pharmaceutical products that are stored in closed containers with a capacity of not more than 5 L,  alcohol-based hand sanitizer products that have a capacity of not more than 1.2 L and that are in use, or  products that contain no more than 50% by volume of water-miscible flammable liquids or combustible liquids, with the remainder of the solution being non-flammable, that are stored in closed containers with a capacity of not more than 5 L.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.2.2.3.(2), flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be separated from other dangerous goods in conformance with Sections 3.2. and 3.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be separated from other dangerous goods in conformance with Sections 3.2 and 3.3 of Division B of NRC, "National Fire Code of Canada".
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of applying Table 3.2.7.6., Class IIIA and B3 liquids shall be treated as dangerous goods classified as flammable liquids . (See Note A-4.2.2.3.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of applying Table 3.2.7.6. of Division B of NRC, "National Fire Code of Canada", Class IIIA liquids shall be treated as Class 3 dangerous goods.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.2.4.2. and in Articles 4.2.4.5. and 4.2.4.6., the maximum quantity of flammable liquids or combustible liquids stored in a fire compartment with a fire-resistance rating of at least 1 h shall conform to Sentences 4.2.4.2. and 4.2.4.2.(3).
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence  and Articles 4.2.4.5. and 4.2.4.6., the maximum quantity of flammable liquids or combustible liquids stored in a building or in a single fire compartment having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h shall meet the requirements of Sentences  and .

National Sentence Text: When 2 or more classes of flammable liquid or combustible liquid are stored in the same building, the total quantity permitted for each class of liquid shall be calculated as follows: qI30+qII150+qIIIA600 1where qI = the actual quantity of Class I liquids present, qII = the actual quantity of Class II liquids present, qIIIA = the actual quantity of Class IIIA liquids present.
P/T Sentence Text: If two or more classes of liquid are stored in the same building or in a single fire compartment having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, the total quantity of stored liquid shall meet the requirements of the following equation: qI/30 + qII/150 + qIIIA/600   1 where qI = the actual quantity of Class I liquid present, in litres, qII = the actual quantity of Class II liquid present, in litres, and qIIIA = the actual quantity of Class IIIA liquid present, in litres.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Quantities of flammable liquids or combustible liquids exceeding those permitted in Sentence 4.2.4.2. are permitted, provided they are kept in storage cabinets conforming to part 4., except that the total quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in such cabinets shall not exceed the quantity permitted for one cabinet, or in a storage room conforming to part 4. and having no openings that communicate directly with the public portions of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Quantities of flammable liquids or combustible liquids exceeding those permitted by Sentence  are permitted if they are kept  in cabinets that comply with Subsection 4.2.10., but only if the total quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in the cabinets does not exceed the quantity permitted for one cabinet, or  in a room that complies with Subsection 4.2.9. and has no openings that communicate directly with the public portions of the building.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.2.5.2.(5), the quantities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in mercantile occupancies shall not exceed those in Sentences 4.2.5.2. to 4.2.5.2.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the quantities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in mercantile occupancies shall not exceed those in Sentences  to .

National Sentence Text: In sprinklered mercantile occupancies, the maximum quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids permitted to be stored in a single suite shall be the lesser of 24 L/m2 of the total area of the suite, provided that not more than 6 L/m2 are Class I liquids, of which not more than 1 L/m2 shall be Class IA, Class IB, or any combination of these 2 classes, or 24 000 L, provided that not more than 6 000 L are Class I liquids, of which not more than 1 000 L shall be Class IA, Class IB, or any combination of these 2 classes.
P/T Sentence Text: In sprinklered mercantile occupancies, the maximum quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in a single suite shall be the lesser of  24 L for every 1 m2 of the area of the suite, provided that not more than 6 L per m2 is Class I liquid, of which not more than 1 L per m2 shall be Class IA or Class IB or any combination of these two classes, or  24000 L, provided that not more than 6000 L is Class I liquid, of which not more than 1000 L shall be Class IA or Class IB or any combination of these two classes.

National Sentence Text: Quantities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in excess of those permitted in Sentences 4.2.5.2. to 4.2.5.2. shall be kept in a storage area conforming to Subsection 4.2.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Quantities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in excess of those permitted in Sentences  to  shall be kept in a storage area conforming to Subsection 4.2.7.

National Sentence Text: Tinting operations involving paint containers not exceeding 25 L in capacity may be carried out in mercantile occupancies outside of a storage room conforming toSubsection 4.2.9.
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  does not apply to tinting operations for paints that involve containers of up to 25 L in capacity.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 4.2.6.3., flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be kept in closed containers and stored in cabinets conforming to Subsection 4.2.10. except that the total quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in such cabinets shall not exceed the quantity permitted for one cabinet, or in a room having no openings communicating directly with the public portions of the building and conforming to Subsection 4.2.9.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 4.2.6.3., flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be kept in closed containers and stored  in cabinets conforming to Subsection 4.2.10., except that the total quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in such cabinets shall not exceed the quantity permitted for one cabinet, or  in a room having no openings communicating directly with the public portions of the building and conforming to Subsection 4.2.9.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.2.7.5.(2), the storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in storage areas specified in Sentence 4.2.7.2. shall conform to Table 4.2.7.5.-A where it consists of palletized or solid piled storage, or where stored in racks in buildings not protected in conformance with Article 4.2.7.6., or conform to Table 4.2.7.5.-B where stored in racks in buildings protected in conformance with Article 4.2.7.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in storage areas specified in Clause 4.2.7.2.(1) shall  conform to Table 4.2.7.A.  where it consists of palletized or solid piled storage, or  where stored in racks in buildings not protected in conformance with Article 4.2.7.7., or  conform to Table 4.2.7.B. where stored in racks in buildings protected in conformance with Article 4.2.7.7.

National Sentence Text: Where a building or part of building is designed for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids, there is no limit on the total quantity of storage per fire compartment provided the building or part of building is separated from adjacent buildings or parts of buildings by a firewall having a fire-resistance rating of at least 4 h, or spatial separation in conformance with the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a building is designed for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids, there is no limit on the total quantity of storage per fire compartment provided  the building is separated from adjacent buildings by  a firewall having a fire-resistance rating of at least 4 h, or  spatial separation in conformance with the Building Code, and  in protected rack storage, the quantities in each individual storage area do not exceed those specified in Table 4.2.7.B.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: When flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored in solid pile or rack storage configurations or a combination of both in a single fire compartment, the maximum quantity permitted for each class of liquid shall be calculated as follows: qIAQ IA+qIBQIB +qICQIC+qII QII+qIIIA QIIIARack +qIAQIA+qIBQIB +qICQIC+ qIIQII+qIII AQIIIASolidPile 1where qIA, IB or IC = the actual quantity of Class IA, IB or IC liquids present in a rack or solid pile, qII = the actual quantity of Class II liquids present in a rack or solid pile, qIIIA = the actual quantity of Class IIIA liquids present in a rack or solid pile, QIA, IB, IC = the maximum quantity of Class IA, IB or IC liquids permitted in Table 4.2.7.5.-A or Table 4.2.7.5.-B for the arrangement, QII = the maximum quantity of Class II liquids permitted in Table 4.2.7.5.-A or Table 4.2.7.5.-B for the arrangement, QIIIA = the maximum quantity of Class IIIA liquids permitted in Table 4.2.7.5.-A or Table 4.2.7.5.-B for the arrangement.
P/T Sentence Text: If two or more classes of liquids are stored in a single fire compartment, the total quantities of stored liquids shall meet the requirements of the following equation: [qIA/QIA + qIB/QIB + qIC/QIC + qII/QII + qIIIA/QIIIA]rack + [qIA/QIA + qIB/QIB + qIC/QIC + qII/QII + qIIIA/QIIIA]solid pile or pallet   1 where qIA, IB or IC = the actual quantity of Class IA, IB or IC liquid present in a rack, solid pile or on pallets, qII = the actual quantity of Class II liquid present in a rack, solid pile or on pallets, qIIIA = the actual quantity of Class IIIA liquid present in a rack, solid pile or on pallets, QIA, IB or IC = the maximum quantity of Class IA, IB or IC liquid permitted in Table 4.2.7.A. or 4.2.7.B. for the arrangement, QII = the maximum quantity of Class II liquid permitted in Table 4.2.7.A. or 4.2.7.B. for the arrangement, and QIIIA = the maximum quantity of Class IIIA liquid permitted in Table 4.2.7.A. or 4.2.7.B. for the arrangement.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where protection is required by this Code, storage areas for flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be sprinklered in conformance with NFPA 30-2012 Flammable and Combustible Liquids Code or protected by an automatic fire suppression system.
P/T Sentence Text: Where protection is required by this Part, storage areas for flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be  sprinklered in conformance with NFPA 30, "Flammable and Combustible Liquids Code", or  protected by an automatic special fire suppression system in conformance with an applicable standard set out in Article 6.8.1.1.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: In a general storage area covered in Subsection 3.2.3., quantities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids are permitted to exceed those in Sentence 4.2.8.2. provided the storage area is in conformance with Sentences  to .
P/T Sentence Text: In a general storage area covered in Subsection 3.2.3. of Division B of NRC, "National Fire Code of Canada", quantities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids may exceed those in Sentence 4.2.8.2. if the storage area complies with Sentences  to .

National Sentence Text: When 2 or more classes of liquid are stored in the same fire compartment, the total quantity permitted for each class of liquid shall be calculated as follows: qI2500+qII5000+qIIIA10,000 1where qI = the actual quantity of Class IB and IC liquids present, qII = the actual quantity of Class II liquids present, qIIIA = the actual quantity of Class IIIA liquids present.
P/T Sentence Text: When two or more classes of liquid are stored in the same fire compartment, the total quantities of stored liquids shall meet the requirements of the following equation: qI/2500 + qII/5000 + qIIIA/10000   1 where qI = the actual quantity of Class IB and IC liquid present, qII = the actual quantity of Class II liquid present, and qIIIA = the actual quantity of Class IIIA liquid present.

National Sentence Text: The maximum quantities of Class I liquids in an unprotected storage room with a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h shall not exceed those specified for unprotected storage in Table 4.2.7.5.-A, and comply with Sentences 4.2.7.5. and 4.2.7.5.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum quantities of Class I liquids in an unprotected storage room with a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h shall  not exceed those specified for unprotected storage in Table 4.2.7.A., and  comply with Sentences 4.2.7.5. and .

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.2.10.3. and 4.2.10.3.(3), the total quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in cabinets in a single fire compartment shall not exceed the quantity permitted in Article 4.2.10.2. for 3 cabinets.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , the total quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in cabinets in a single fire compartment shall not exceed the quantity permitted in Article 4.2.10.2. for three cabinets.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.3.1.2. and in part 4., atmospheric storage tanks shall be built in conformance with the following: except as provided in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(2), API 12B-2008 Bolted Tanks for Storage of Production Liquids except as provided in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(2), API 12D-2008 Field Welded Tanks for Storage of Production Liquids except as provided in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(2), API 12F-2008 Shop Welded Tanks for Storage of Production Liquids API 650-2013 Welded Tanks for Oil Storage ULC CAN/ULC-S601-14 Shop Fabricated Steel Aboveground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC CAN/ULC-S602-14 Aboveground Steel Tanks for Fuel Oil and Lubricating Oil ULC CAN/ULC-S603-14 Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC CAN/ULC-S603.1-11 External Corrosion Protection Systems for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC CAN/ULC-S615-14 Fibre Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC CAN/ULC-S652-16 Tank Assemblies for the Collection, Storage and Removal of Used Oil ULC CAN/ULC-S653-16 Aboveground Steel Contained Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC ULC-S655-98 Aboveground Protected Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC CAN/ULC-S677-14 Fire Tested Aboveground Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids or ULC ULC/ORD-C80.1-12 Non-metallic Tank for Oil Burner Fuels and Other Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentences , , , , ,  and  and Section 4.9, atmospheric storage tanks shall be built in accordance with  API 12B, Bolted Tanks for Storage of Production Liquids ,  API 12D, Field Welded Tanks for Storage of Production Liquids ,  API 12F, Shop Welded Tanks for Storage of Production Liquids ,  API 650, Welded Tanks for Oil Storage ,  CAN/ULC-S601, Standard for Shop Fabricated Steel Aboveground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ,  CAN/ULC-S602, Aboveground Steel Tanks for Fuel Oil and Lubricating Oil ,  ULC-S603, Standard for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ,  CAN/ULC-S603.1, External Corrosion Protection Systems for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ,  ULC-S615, Standard for Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ,  CAN/ULC-S652, Standard for Tank Assemblies for the Collection, Storage and Removal of Used Oil ,  CAN/ULC-S653, Standard for Aboveground Steel Contained Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ,  ULC-S655, Aboveground Protected Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids , or  ULC/ORD-C142.5, Concrete Encased Steel Aboveground Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids .
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Aboveground storage tanks and their integral fittings that are subject to corrosion shall be protected by any means against exposure to conditions that would initiate corrosion.
P/T Sentence Text: The exposed surface of every aboveground storage tank for flammable liquids or combustible liquids which is fabricated of any ferrous substance shall be thoroughly coated with rust-resisting material compatible with the tank.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: A storage tank that has been taken out of service shall not be reused for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids unless it has been refurbished so as to conform to one of the standards listed in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(1), or refurbished in conformance with Sentence 4.3.1.10. or 4.3.1.10.(3).
P/T Sentence Text: A storage tank that has been taken out of service shall not be reused for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids unless it has been  refurbished so as to conform to one of the standards set out in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(1), or  refurbished in conformance with Sentence  or .

National Sentence Text: Every outside aboveground storage tank for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be located in conformance with Sentences 4.3.2.1. to 4.3.2.1. with respect to a property line or a building on the same property.
P/T Sentence Text: Every outside aboveground storage tank for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be located in conformance with Sentences  to  with respect to the property line and any building on the same property.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.3.2.1. and 4.3.2.1.(7), every aboveground storage tank containing stable liquids and having a working pressure of not more than 17 kPa  shall be separated from a property line or a building on the same property by distances half those in Table 4.3.2.1., where protection is provided against fire or explosion in the tank in conformance with Sentence 4.3.2.5.(2), or equal to those in Table 4.3.2.1., where protection referred to in Sentence 4.3.2.1. is not provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , every aboveground storage tank containing stable liquids and having a working pressure of not more than 17 kPa  shall be separated from a property line and any building on the same property by distances  half those in Table 4.3.2.A. where protection is provided against fire or explosion in the tank in conformance with Sentence 4.3.2.5.(2), or  equal to those in Table 4.3.2.A. where protection referred to in Clause  is not provided.

National Sentence Text: Where a storage tank containing stable liquids or unstable liquids has a working pressure greater than 17 kPa (gauge), the distances from a property line or a building on the same property shall be those specified in Sentences 4.3.2.1. and 4.3.2.1. multiplied by 1.5, but shall be not less than 7.5 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage tank containing stable liquids or unstable liquids has a working pressure greater than 17 kPa (gauge), the distances from a property line and any building on the same property shall be those specified in Sentences  and  multiplied by 1.5, but shall be not less than 7.5 m.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentences 4.3.2.2. and 4.3.2.2. and in Article 4.3.2.3., the minimum distance between every combination of 2 aboveground storage tanks shall be 0.25 times the sum of their diameters, but shall be not less than 1 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentences  and  and in Article 4.3.2.3., the minimum distance between every combination of two aboveground storage tanks shall be 0.25 times the sum of their diameters, but shall be not less than 1 m.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.3.2.4. and 4.3.2.4.(3), storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be spaced so that each storage tank is accessible for firefighting purposes.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be spaced so that each storage tank is accessible for fire fighting purposes.

National Sentence Text: Vent piping for storage tanks forClass I liquids shall not be connected to vent piping for storage tanks for Class II or IIIA liquids unless an effective arrangement is provided to prevent the vapours from the Class I liquids from entering the other tanks.
P/T Sentence Text: Vent piping for storage tanks for Class I liquids shall not be connected to vent piping for storage tanks for Class II or IIIA liquids unless an effective arrangement is provided to prevent the vapours from the Class I liquids from entering the other tanks.

National Sentence Text: Openings for measuring liquid levels in storage tanks forClass I liquids shall be equipped with caps or covers which shall be opened only when measuring the liquid level.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings for measuring liquid levels in storage tanks for Class I liquids shall be equipped with caps or covers which shall be opened only when measuring the liquid level.

National Sentence Text: A storage tank conforming to Sentence 4.3.7.4. shall be considered as conforming to this Subsection provided it is used and maintained in conformance with Articles 4.3.7.8. and 4.3.7.9.
P/T Sentence Text: A storage tank conforming to Sentence 4.3.7.4. shall be considered as conforming to this Subsection provided it is used and maintained in conformance with Articles 4.3.7.8. and 4.3.7.9.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.3.7.3.(3), a secondary containment for more than one storage tank shall have a volumetric capacity of not less than the sum of the capacity of the largest storage tank located in the contained space, and 10% of the greater of the capacity specified in Sentence 4.3.7.3.(2), or the aggregate capacity of all other storage tanks located in the contained space.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , a secondary containment for more than one storage tank shall have a volumetric capacity of not less than the sum of  the capacity of the largest storage tank located in the contained space, and  10% of the greater of  the capacity specified in Clause (a), or  the aggregate capacity of all other storage tanks located in the contained space.

National Sentence Text: The distance required in Sentence 4.3.7.4. is permitted to be waived, provided the storage tank has a capacity of not more than 80 000 L and is constructed in accordance with Clauses 4.3.1.2. , 4.3.1.2. or 4.3.1.2.(1), incorporating secondary containment, or Sentence 4.3.1.2. for double-walled storage tanks, or conforms to ULC ULC-S655-98 Aboveground Protected Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: It is permitted to waive the distance required in Sentence  provided the storage tank  is constructed in accordance with  Clause 4.3.1.2.(1)(j), (k),  or (m), incorporating secondary containment, or  Clause 4.3.1.2.(1) for double-walled storage tanks,  has a capacity of not more than 50000 L, and  is protected by posts or guardrails when exposed to collision damage.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Access to Storage Tanks and Ancillary Equipment
National Sentence Text: Where a storage tank contains Class I liquids, provisions shall be made for the normal operation of valves and for access to the storage tank roof without entering the contained space created by the secondary containment when the average height of the secondary containment exceeds 3.5 m, measured from the ground level of the interior of the contained area, or the distance between the tank shell and the top inside edge of the secondary containment wall is less than the height of this wall.
P/T Article Title: Access to storage tanks and ancillary equipment
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage tank contains Class I liquids, provision shall be made for the normal operation of valves and for access to the storage tank roof without entering the contained space created by the secondary containment when  the average height of the secondary containment exceeds 3.5 m, measured from the ground level of the interior of the contained area, or  the distance between the tank shell and the top inside edge of the secondary containment wall is less than the height of this wall.

National Sentence Text: Controls for the liquid removal system required in Sentence shall be normally closed, accessible under fire exposure conditions, and located so they can be operated from outside the contained space.
P/T Sentence Text: Controls for the liquid removal system required in Sentence  shall be  normally closed,  accessible under fire exposure conditions, and  located so they can be operated from outside the contained space.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 4.3.13.2., storage tanks inside buildings shall conform to Subsections 4. to 4., be permitted in industrial occupancies, and be permitted in all occupancies where combustible liquids are stored and used as fuel for oil-burning equipment, emergency generators and fire pumps.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence , storage tanks in buildings shall only be located in industrial occupancies.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 4.2.8. and in Sentence 4.3.13.4.(2), storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be located in dedicated storage rooms conforming to part 4., and located in conformance with Tables 4.3.13.4.-A and 4.3.13.4.-B (see Note A-4.3.13.4.(1)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 4.2.8. and in Sentence , storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be located in dedicated rooms conforming to Subsection 4.3.13., and located in conformance with Table 4.3.12.A.

National Sentence Text: When quantities greater than those permitted for incidental use in Subsection 4.2.8. are required for special process operations, storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids are permitted to be located outside of a storage room referred to in Sentence 4.3.13.4.(1), provided that total quantities per fire compartment are not more than one-half the quantities permitted in Table 4.3.13.4.-A, they are located on the first storey, and the installation conforms to Articles 4.3.13.9. to 4.3.13.12. and Article 4.3.14.4.
P/T Sentence Text: When quantities greater than are permitted for incidental use in Subsection 4.2.8. are required for special process operations, storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids are permitted to be located outside of a storage room referred to in Sentence , provided that total quantities per fire compartment are not more than one-half the quantities permitted in Table 4.3.12.A., they are located on the first storey, and the installation conforms to Articles 4.3.12.7. to 4.3.12.10. and Article 4.3.13.4.

National Sentence Text: Where storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids are located outside of storage rooms conforming to Subsection 4.3.13., provision shall be made to contain a spill equal to at least 100% of the volume of the largest storage tank, or to drain away spilled flammable liquids or combustible liquids, and the area in which the storage tanks are located shall be ventilated (see Note A-4.3.13.9.(1)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: Where storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids are located outside of storage rooms conforming to Subsection 4.3.13., provision shall be made, in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6., to contain a spill equal to at least 100% of the volume of the largest storage tank or to drain away spilled flammable liquids or combustible liquids, all electrical equipment and wiring in the vicinity of the storage tank and the exterior vent shall be installed in conformance with Subsection 4.1.4., and the area in which the storage tank is located shall be ventilated in conformance with Subsection 4.1.7., where designated a Class I, Zone 0, 1 or 2 hazardous location under the Electrical Safety Code made under the Electricity Act, 1998.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.3.13.10.(2), normal and emergency vents for storage tanks in buildings shall be provided in conformance with Subsections 4. and 4. (See Note A-4.3.13.10.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , normal and emergency vents for storage tanks in buildings shall be provided in conformance with Subsections 4.3.4. and 4.3.5.

National Sentence Text: Storage tanks with an individual capacity exceeding 20 000 L that are used in conformance with Table 4.3.13.4.-B shall conform to Sentence 4.3.1.2.(1), and be monitored for leakage in conformance with Sentence 4.4.2.1.(7).
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Frequency and Methods of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: Every storage tank, piping system and sump, including those at fuel-dispensing stations, shall be tested and monitored for leaks in conformance with Tables 4.4.1.2.-A to 4.4.1.2.-E, which establish the minimum requirements regarding the frequency and methods to be used for commissioning testing, subsequent in-service monitoring, and testing when a leak is suspected.
P/T Sentence Text: Every storage tank shall be tested for leakage in conformance with Sentences  to  whenever a leak is suspected, and at the time of installation before backfilling in the case of an underground tank, or before filling or putting into service in the case of an aboveground tank.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where field test methods are included in the storage tank construction standards referred to in Articles 4.3.1.2. and 4.3.1.3., such tests shall be permitted for storage tanks conforming to those standards.
P/T Sentence Text: Where field test methods are included in the tank construction standards referred to in Articles 4.3.1.2. and 4.3.1.3., such tests shall be permitted for storage tanks conforming to those standards.

National Article Title: Frequency and Methods of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: Every storage tank, piping system and sump, including those at fuel-dispensing stations, shall be tested and monitored for leaks in conformance with Tables 4.4.1.2.-A to 4.4.1.2.-E, which establish the minimum requirements regarding the frequency and methods to be used for commissioning testing, subsequent in-service monitoring, and testing when a leak is suspected.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Frequency and Methods of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: The methods referred to in Sentence 4.4.1.2. shall conform to Subsections 4. to 4.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: When a leak detection test required by this Section detects a leak in a single-walled construction underground storage tank or piping system, the leaking components or system shall be replaced in conformance with Articles 4.3.8.1. and 4.5.6.1., or taken out of service in conformance with part 4.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Definition and Performance of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: Statistical inventory reconciliation  methodology shall be capable of detecting a leak of 0.38 L/h with a probability of detection of 0.95 or greater and a probability of false alarm of 0.05 or less, based on an inventory record of specified length to be considered as an annual test, or of 0.76 L/h with a probability of detection of 0.95 or greater and a probability of false alarm of 0.05 or less, based on an inventory record of specified length to be considered as a monthly test.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Definition and Performance of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: A single vertical check valve referred to in this Section shall consist of a vertical check valve located immediately under the pump, be installed with no other check valve between the suction pump and the storage tank, and be part of an installation where lines must be sufficiently sloped so that any liquid in the line will drain back into the storage tank should a leak occur in the piping system.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where problems of corrosion, contamination, or sanitation or standards of purity require special materials, it is permitted to use non-metallic materials for piping, valves and fittings in conformance with Sentence 1.2.1.1.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Where problems of corrosion, contamination or sanitation or standards of purity require special materials, it is permitted to use non-metallic materials for piping, valves and fittings in conformance with Article 4.1.1.4.

National Article Title: Protocols for Pneumatic Leak Detection Testing of Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: A pressure decline test performed on a piping system shall conform to Sentences 4.4.3.3. to 4.4.3.3.(9).
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping
National Sentence Text: Liquid media leak detection testing of piping systems shall conform to Sentences 4.4.3.4. to 4.4.3.4.(9).
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Leak Detection Testing of Sumps
National Sentence Text: Static liquid media leak detection testing of turbine, transition, dispenser and pump sumps shall conform to Sentences 4.4.3.5. to 4.4.3.5.(4).
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Welding of piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall conform to part 5. and to the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or in the absence of such regulations, to API 1104-2013 Welding of Pipelines and Related Facilities
P/T Sentence Text: Welding of piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall comply with Section 5.17 and API 1104, "Welding of Pipelines and Related Facilities", or API RP 1107, "Recommended Pipeline Maintenance Welding Practices".
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Gaskets in flanged connections shall be of a material resistant to the liquid being carried and capable of withstanding temperatures of at least 650°C without damage that would impair their function.
P/T Sentence Text: Gaskets in flanged connections shall be of a material resistant to the liquid being carried and capable of withstanding temperatures of at least 650" without damage that would impair its function.

National Article Title: Frequency and Methods of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: Every storage tank, piping system and sump, including those at fuel-dispensing stations, shall be tested and monitored for leaks in conformance with Tables 4.4.1.2.-A to 4.4.1.2.-E, which establish the minimum requirements regarding the frequency and methods to be used for commissioning testing, subsequent in-service monitoring, and testing when a leak is suspected.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping systems including those at fuel dispensing stations shall be tested for leakage in conformance with Sentences  and   whenever a leak is suspected, and  at the time of installation  before backfilling in the case of underground piping, or  before putting into service in the case of exposed piping.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where a leak is detected as described in Sentence 4.4.1.3. or 4.4.1.3.(2), the escaped liquid shall be removed in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
P/T Sentence Text: If a leak is detected in a piping system during the leakage test, the piping system shall be repaired or replaced and the escaped liquid shall be removed in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.4.3.4. and 4.4.3.4.(7), test pressure shall be the greater of 350 kPa  or 1.5 times the maximum operating pressure, and not exceed the piping manufacturer's test specifications.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and  and Article 4.4.6.6., piping systems shall be pressure tested at pressures of not less than 350 kPa  or 1.5 times the maximum operating pressure, whichever is greater.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.5.7.1. and 4.5.7.1.(3), valves in piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be designed to accommodate the temperatures and pressures of those systems and shall conform to ULC ULC/ORD-C842-84 Guide for the Investigation of Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences ,  and , valves in piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be designed to accommodate the temperatures and pressures of those systems and shall conform to ULC-C842, Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids .

National Sentence Text: Electrical heating cables including electrical induction heating shall conform to part 4.
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical heating cables including electrical induction heating, shall conform to Subsection 4.1.4.

National Sentence Text: Vent piping and connections for filling and emptying storage tanks shall be located in conformance with part 4.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Outside aboveground storage tanks at fuel-dispensing stations shall be provided with physical protection against collision damage, measures to prevent unauthorized access to the storage tank and its ancillary equipment, measures to contain accidental spillage in conformance with part 4., an overfill protection device in conformance with Sentence 4.3.1.8.(2), where a tight-filled connection is provided, and where the piping is connected to the storage tank at a point that is lower than the maximum fill level, an external valve to prevent gravity discharge in the event the piping is severed.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Joints in piping systems shall comply with part 4.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Control valves referred to in Sentence 4.7.4.4. shall be held open manually, except where automatic devices are provided for shutting off the flow in order to prevent the overfilling of tank vehicle or tank car compartments. (See Note A-4.7.4.4.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Control valves referred to in Sentence  shall be held open manually, except where automatic devices are provided for shutting off the flow in order to prevent the overfilling of tank vehicle or tank car compartments.

National Sentence Text: At marine fuel-dispensing stations or at card- or key-activated dispensers, the length of extended hose is permitted to exceed the values in Sentences 4.6.5.1. and 4.6.5.1.(3).
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.6.5.2. to 4.6.5.2.(5), a hose nozzle valve shall be constructed so that the valve can be kept open only by the continuous application of manual pressure, or is equipped with a hold-open device that is an integral part of the nozzle and that will allow automatic dispensing, automatically shut off when the vehicle tank is filled, and shut off if the nozzle is dropped or falls from the fill pipe.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: A hose nozzle valve at a marine fuel-dispensing station shall be of the type without a hold-open device, in conformance with Sentence 4.6.5.2.(2).
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Facilities to control possible spills of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be provided at loading and unloading points in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Facilities to control possible spills of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be provided at loading and unloading points in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.

National Sentence Text: Where shore locations would result in excessively long supply lines to the dispenser, storage tanks are permitted to be installed on a pier provided that the applicable portions of part 4. relating to spacing, secondary containment and piping are complied with, and the quantity stored does not exceed 5 000 L aggregate capacity.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Piping between storage tanks located on shore and dispensers at a marine fuel-dispensing station shall conform to part 4., except that where dispensing is from a floating structure, it is permitted to use suitable lengths of flexible hose designed in conformance with good engineering practice between the piping on shore and the piping on the floating structure. (See Note A-4.8.8.1.(1)(a).)
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Areas where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are dispensed shall be designed to be able to handle accidental spillage in conformance with part 4., and control a spill of not less than 1 000 L.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Duties of attendants and fuel-dispensing procedures, as stated in Articles 4.6.8.5. and 4.6.8.6., shall be posted at every fuel-dispensing station.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Card- or key-activated dispensers are permitted at unattended self-service outlets and fuel-dispensing stations that are not open to the general public, in conformance with Sentences 4.6.8.4. to 4.6.8.4.(6). (See Note A-4.6.8.4.(1).)
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.6.8.4. to 4.6.8.4.(6), the installation of card- or key-activated dispensers shall conform to the requirements for self-service outlets and fuel-dispensing stations in this Section.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: At least one weather-resistant sign conforming to Sentences 4.6.8.8. to 4.6.8.8. shall be provided for each dispenser in a location visible to every driver approaching the dispenser.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The sign required in Sentence 4.6.8.8. is permitted to display the international "No Smoking Ignition Off" symbol not less than 100 mm in diameter.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to flammable liquid and combustible liquid installations on piers and wharves, but does not include marine fuel dispensing stations.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to flammable liquid and combustible liquid installations on piers and wharves, but does not include marine fuel dispensing stations.

National Sentence Text: Storage tanks are permitted to be located in buildings on piers and wharves of solid-fill or noncombustible construction provided they conform to Subsections 4.3.13. to 4.3.15.
P/T Sentence Text: Storage tanks are permitted to be located in buildings on piers and wharves of solid-fill or noncombustible construction provided they conform to Subsections 4.3.12. to 4.3.14.

National Sentence Text: Storage tanks are permitted to be buried in piers and wharves of the solid-fill type provided they conform to Subsections 4.3.8. to 4.3.12.
P/T Sentence Text: Storage tanks are permitted to be buried in piers and wharves of the solid-fill type provided they conform to Subsections 4.3.8. to 4.3.11.

National Sentence Text: The location of outdoor processing equipment in process plants shall be based on its flammable liquid or combustible liquid capacity as described in Sentences 4.9.2.1. to 4.9.2.1.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: The location of outdoor processing equipment in process plants shall be based on its flammable liquid and combustible liquid capacity as described in Sentences  to .

National Sentence Text: Where protection is not provided against fires or explosions in processing equipment, the distances in Sentences 4.9.2.1. and 4.9.2.1. shall be doubled. (See Sentence 4.3.2.5.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where protection is not provided against fires or explosions in processing equipment, the distances in Sentences  and  shall be doubled.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The storage, handling and use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids other than distilled beverage alcohols in a distillery shall conform to Part 4.
P/T Sentence Text: The storage, handling and use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids, other than distilled beverage alcohols, in a distillery shall conform to this Part.

National Sentence Text: Where there is a conflict between the requirements of this Section and other requirements in part 4., this Section shall govern.
P/T Sentence Text: If there is a conflict between the requirements of this Section and any other requirement in this Part, other than a requirement of Section 4.12, this Section shall prevail.

National Sentence Text: Storage tanks, wooden vats, barrels, drums or containers used for the storage or processing of distilled beverage alcohols shall be designed, fabricated and tested for the anticipated maximum working pressure, operating temperature, internal corrosion conditions and structural stresses to which they could be subjected.
P/T Sentence Text: Storage tanks, wooden vats, barrels, drums or containers used for the storage or processing of distilled beverage alcohols shall be designed, fabricated and tested for the anticipated maximum working pressure, operating temperature, internal corrosion conditions and structural stresses to which they could be subjected.

National Sentence Text: Hotworks performed o nor in close proximity to a tank vehicle shall conform to Section 5.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Hot works performed on or in close proximity to a tank vehicle shall conform to Section 5.17.

National Sentence Text: A tank vehicle shall not be parked inside a building unless the building isspecifically designed for that purpose, there is sufficient space in the tank vehicle compartment to accommodate the thermal expansion of the flammable liquid or combustible liquid,and the tank vehicle has no leaks of flammable liquid or combustible liquid.
P/T Sentence Text: A tank vehicle shall not be parked inside a building unless  the building is specifically designed for that purpose,  there is sufficient space in the tank vehicle compartment to accommodate the thermal expansion of the flammable liquid or combustible liquid, and  the tank vehicle has no leaks of flammable liquid or combustible liquid.

National Sentence Text: During loading and unloading operations, a tank vehicle and its delivery equipment shall be separated from ignition sources by distances conforming to the requirements for dispensers in Articles 4.6.3.3. and 4.6.8.7.
P/T Sentence Text: During loading and unloading operations, a tank vehicle and its delivery equipment shall be separated from other ignition sources by not less than 6 m.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: During loading and unloading of a tank vehicle, measures shall be taken against static electric charges in conformance with Articles 4.1.8.2. and 4.7.4.5.
P/T Sentence Text: During loading and unloading of a tank vehicle, measures shall be taken against static electric charges in conformance with Articles 4.1.8.2. and 4.6.4.5.

National Sentence Text: Dispensing Class II or IIIA liquids into the fuel tank of vehicles directly from a tank vehicle having a capacity greater than 3 000 L shall be permitted only if the vehicles are located outdoors on a property where they are not less than 6 m away from any building, and not exposed to undue hazard from accident or collision, at least 2 portable extinguishers having a minimum rating of 80-B:C are provided on the tank vehicle, the delivery hoses and automatically closing hose nozzle valves used for the fuel-dispensing operations conform to part 4., the tank vehicle operator is given training and equipment for controlling any spillage that may occur during the fuel-dispensing operations, and in cases where fuel-dispensing operations are carried out at a site not conforming to part 4., measures are in place to control a spill of not less than 1 000 L.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Sentence 1.2.1.1.(1), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in Table 4.12.1.1. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)
Except as otherwise specified in this Section, the use, handling and storage of dangerous goods, including flammable liquids and combustible liquids, shall conform to Parts 3. , 4. and 5..
P/T Sentence Text: If there is a conflict between the requirements in this Section and other requirements in this Part, the requirements in this Section shall prevail.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The quantity of dangerous goods kept in a laboratory shall be minimized and shall not exceed the lesser of the supply necessary for normal operation, or when located in a Group A, Division 2 educational or a Group D major occupancy, 300 L of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, of which not more than 50 L shall be Class I liquids, or a Group B major occupancy, the quantities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids permitted in Sentence 4.2.6.3.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence  and Subsection 4.12.10., no more than 300 L of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, of which no more than 50 L may be flammable liquids, shall be kept in the open area of a laboratory.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Quantities of dangerous goods other than flammable liquids and combustible liquids in excess of those permitted in Sentence 5.5.5.1. shall be stored outside of the laboratory in conformance with part 3..
Class I liquids that are stored in refrigerators shall be kept in closed containers.
P/T Sentence Text: Class I liquids stored in refrigerators shall be kept in closed containers.

National Sentence Text: The flash points of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be determined in conformance with part 4.
Except as provided in Sentences 5.1.5.1. and 5.1.5.1.(3), a fire safety plan conforming to part 2. shall be prepared for areas where processes and operations described in Article 5.1.1.1. take place.

In addition to the information required in part 2., the fire safety plan shall include the location and identification of storage and use areas for specific products, in conformance with Article 3.2.2.5., and the names, addresses and telephone numbers of persons to be contacted in case of fire during non-operating hours.

In addition to the information required in Sentence 5.1.5.1.(2), where dangerous goods classified as radioactive materials are used or handled, the fire safety plan shall include the information specified in part 3.
The manufacturing, handling, transportation, sale and use of dangerous goods classified as explosives shall be in conformance with NRCan R.S.C., 1985, c. E-17 Explosives Act and its Regulations.
P/T Article Title: Manufacture, storage, handling, transportation, sale and use
P/T Sentence Text: The manufacture, storage, handling, transportation, sale and use of explosives shall meet the requirements of the Act and the Regulations.

National Sentence Text: In addition to the information required in part 2., the fire safety plan shall include the location and identification of storage and use areas for specific products, in conformance with Article 3.2.2.5., and the names, addresses and telephone numbers of persons to be contacted in case of fire during non-operating hours.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence , no explosives shall be manufactured, stored, handled, transported, sold or used unless fire emergency procedures are established in accordance with Section 2.8 and such procedures specify  the location and identification of storage and handling areas,  the methods to control a fire emergency safely and efficiently, and  the names, addresses and telephone numbers of persons to be contacted in case of fire during non-operating hours.

National Sentence Text: Cylinders of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases shall conform to part 3.

National Article Title: Protection of Combustible and Flammable Materials
National Sentence Text: The fire watch described in Clauses 5.2.3.1. and 5.2.3.1. shall be carried out by more than one person if combustible materials are exposed to the hot work operations but cannot be directly observed by the initial person performing the fire watch.

The exposed areas described in Sentences 5.2.3.1. and 5.2.3.1. shall be continuously examined for ignition of combustible materials by personnel equipped with and trained in the use of fire extinguishing equipment. (See Note A-5.2.3.3.(1).)

Belt conveyors and bucket elevator legs shall be equipped with safety devices to detect excessive misalignment, blockage, slipping or slow-down of the conveying equipment, and prevent conditions described in Sentence 5.3.3.2. from creating a fire or explosion hazard by alerting personnel trained in taking appropriate actions, or automatically stopping the conveying equipment.
The use, handling and storage of dangerous goods, excluding flammable liquids and combustible liquids, shall conform to part 3..

Interior finish materials, floors, fixed furniture and equipment shall be chemically resistant to dangerous goods being used in a laboratory to minimize their deterioration, in conformance with Articles 3.2.7.7. and 3.2.7.8.
Combustible materials in excess of those permitted in Sentence 5.5.3.2. shall be stored outside of the laboratory in conformance with part 3.

A power-ventilated enclosure required in Sentence 5.5.4.2. shall not be used for the storage of dangerous goods, and any quantity in excess of the supply necessary for normal operations shall conform to part 5.

National Article Title: Containers for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
National Sentence Text: Containers used for the preservation of animal, human or plant specimens that contain flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be properly sized for the specimens, be stored in a room conforming to part 4., and be protected against breakage and spillage.

Cylinders of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases shall not be located in laboratories unless they are in use and connected to a regulator to deliver gas, or to a manifold being used to deliver gas, or one is serving as a single reserve cylinder for a cylinder described in Sentence 5.5.5.3. to which it is firmly secured with a noncombustible attachment.

Except as provided in Article 5.5.5.6., the heating of dangerously reactive materials above normal ambient temperature or as specified in the Safety Data Sheet shall be carried out in a separate power-ventilated enclosure conforming to Articles 5.5.4.2. to 5.5.4.4., and displaying conspicuously posted instructions specifying that the enclosure is to be used for this application only.

The power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.5.5. as well as its exhaust duct system shall be washed after each use to prevent the possible accumulation of highly reactive or unstable deposits. (See Note A-5.5.5.5.(2).)

Where perchloric acid is heated above normal ambient temperature, it shall be done in a separate power-ventilated enclosure conforming to Articles 5.5.4.3. and 5.5.4.4., and displaying conspicuously posted instructions specifying that the enclosure is to be used for this application only.

Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.5.3.(2), cylinders of anhydrous ammonia or dangerous goods classified as flammable or toxic gases that are stored outdoors shall be not less than 1.5 m from any building opening, if the aggregate capacity of expanded gas is not more than 170 m3 , 7.5 m from any building opening, if the aggregate capacity of expanded gas is more than 170 m3 but less than 500 m3 , and 15 m from any building opening, if the aggregate capacity of expanded gas is 500 m3 or more.
P/T Sentence Text: Cylinders containing compressed gas and located outdoors shall be  at least 1.5 m from any building opening if the aggregate capacity of expanded gas is not more than 170 m3,  at least 7.5 m from any building opening if the aggregate capacity of expanded gas is over 170 m3 but not more than 500 m3, or  at least 15 m from any building opening if the aggregate capacity of expanded gas is over 500 m3.

National Sentence Text: The distances required in Sentence 3.3.5.3. need not apply where the building opening leads into a room conforming to part 3. that is used for storing dangerous goods classified as compressed gases.
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  does not apply if the building opening is into a room that conforms to Sentence 5.6.2.4.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.8.2. and 3.2.8.2.(3), cylinders of dangerous goods classified as flammable gases stored indoors shall be located in a room that is separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.3. of Division B of the NBC, is located on an exterior wall of the building, can be entered from the exterior, and whose closures leading to the interior of the building are in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.3. of Division B of the NBC, is designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in NFPA 68-2013 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting (see Note A-3.2.8.2.(1)(d)), is provided with natural or mechanical ventilation in conformance with part 4., does not contain fuel-fired appliances or high-temperature heating elements, and is used for no purpose other than the storage of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases.
P/T Article Title: Indoor storage of flammable compressed gases
