P/T Sentence Text: Foamed plastic insulation with a flame-spread rating more than 25 but not more than 500 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, is permitted in the interior walls, within ceilings and within roof assemblies of a building required to be of noncombustible construction, that is not sprinklered and is more than 18 m high, measured from grade to the underside of the roof, provided the insulation is protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within wall assemblies, by a thermal barrier that,  consists of Type X gypsum board not less than 15.9 mm thick, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation and with all joints either backed or taped and filled, conforming to,  ASTM C1177 / C1177M, "Glass Mat Gypsum Substrate for Use as Sheathing",  ASTM C1178 / C1178M, "Coated Glass Mat Water-Resistant Gypsum Backing Panel",  ASTM C1396 / C1396M, "Gypsum Board", or  CAN/CSA-A82.27-M, "Gypsum Board",  consists of non-loadbearing masonry or concrete not less than 50 mm thick,  consists of loadbearing masonry or concrete not less than 75 mm thick, or  when tested in conformance with CAN/ULC-S101, "Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials",  does not develop an average temperature rise more than 140°C or a maximum temperature rise more than 180°C at any point on its unexposed face within 20 min, and  remains in place for not less than 40 min.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.16.(2), solid lumber partitions not less than 38 mm thick and wood framing in partitions located in a fire compartment not more than 600 m2 in area are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction in a floor area that is not sprinklered throughout provided the partitions  are not required fire separations, and  are not located in a care, treatment or detention occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , solid lumber partitions not less than 38 mm thick and wood framing in partitions located in a fire compartment not more than 600 m2 in area are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction in a floor area that is not sprinklered provided the partitions,  are not required fire separations, and  are not located in a care, care and treatment or detention occupancy or in a retirement home.

National Sentence Text: Partitions installed in a building of noncombustible construction are permitted to contain wood framing provided  the building is not more than 3 storeys in building height,  the partitions are not located in a care, treatment or detention occupancy, and  the partitions are not installed as enclosures for exits or vertical service spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Partitions installed in a building required to be of noncombustible construction are permitted to contain wood framing provided,  the building is not more than 3 storeys in building height,  the partitions are not located in a care, care and treatment or detention occupancy or in a retirement home, and  the partitions are not installed as enclosures for exits or vertical service spaces.

National Sentence Text: Solid lumber partitions not less than 38 mm thick and partitions that contain wood framing are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided  the building is sprinklered throughout, and  the partitions are not  located in a care, treatment or detention occupancy,  installed as enclosures for exits or vertical service spaces, or  used to satisfy the requirements of Clause 3.2.8.1.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Solid lumber partitions not less than 38 mm thick and partitions that contain wood framing are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided,  the floor area containing the partitions is sprinklered, and  the partitions are not,  located in a care, care and treatment or detention occupancy or in a retirement home,  installed as enclosures for exits or vertical service spaces, or  used to satisfy the requirements of Clause 3.2.8.1.(1)(a).

National Sentence Text: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, combustible ducts need not comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.6.5.1. and  provided the ducts are  part of a duct system conveying only ventilation air, and  contained entirely within a dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, combustible ducts need not comply with the requirements of Part 6 provided the ducts are,  part of a duct system conveying only ventilation air, and  contained entirely within a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.2. and Sentences 3.1.5.19. and 3.1.5.19.(3), combustible piping and tubing and associated adhesives are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided that, except when concealed in a wall or concrete floor slab, they  have a flame-spread rating not more than 25, and  if used in a building described in Subsection 3.2.6., have a smoke developed classification not more than 50.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  and  and by Clause 3.1.5.2.(1) and Article 3.1.5.22., combustible piping and tubing and associated adhesives are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided that, except when concealed in a wall or concrete floor slab, they,  have a flame-spread rating not more than 25, and  if used in a building described in Subsection 3.2.6., have a smoke developed classification not more than 50.

National Sentence Text: Polypropylene pipes and fittings are permitted to be used for drain, waste and vent piping for the conveyance of highly corrosive materials and for piping used to distribute distilled or dialyzed water in laboratory and hospital facilities in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided  the building is sprinklered throughout,  the piping is not located in a vertical shaft, and  piping that penetrates a fire separation is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation when subjected to the fire test method in ULC CAN/ULC-S115-11 Fire Tests of Firestop Systems with a pressure differential of 50 Pa between the exposed and unexposed sides, with the higher pressure on the exposed side.
P/T Sentence Text: Polypropylene pipes and fittings are permitted to be used for drain, waste and vent piping for the conveyance of highly corrosive materials and for piping used to distribute distilled or dialyzed water in laboratory and hospital facilities in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided,  the building is sprinklered,  the piping is not located in a vertical shaft, and  piping that penetrates a fire separation is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation when subjected to the fire test method in CAN/ULC-S115, "Fire Tests of Firestop Systems", with a pressure differential of 50 Pa between the exposed and unexposed sides, with the higher pressure on the exposed side.

National Sentence Text: On buildings required to be of noncombustible construction, decorative wood cladding is permitted to be used on the exterior fascias and soffits of marquees or canopies on the building face of a storey having direct access to a street or access route, provided the wood cladding is fire-retardant-treated wood that has been conditioned in conformance with ASTM D 2898-10 Accelerated Weathering of Fire-Retardant-Treated Wood for Fire Testing before being tested in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102-10 Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Building Materials and Assemblies
P/T Sentence Text: Wood decorative cladding is permitted to be used on exterior marquee fascias, of a storey having direct access to a street or access route, of a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the cladding is fire-retardant treated wood that, before testing to CAN/ULC-S102, "Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Building Materials and Assemblies", has been conditioned in conformance with ASTM D2898, "Accelerated Weathering of Fire-Retardant-Treated Wood for Fire Testing".

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.7.1. and Articles 3.1.7.2. and 3.6.3.5. , the rating of a material, assembly of materials or a structural member that is required to have a fire-resistance rating, shall be determined on the basis of the results of tests conducted in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence  and Articles 3.1.7.2. and 3.6.3.5., the rating of a material, assembly of materials or a structural member that is required to have a fire-resistance rating, shall be determined on the basis of the results of tests conducted in conformance with CAN/ULC-S101, "Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials".

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.7.5. and by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90. for mixed types of construction, all loadbearing walls, columns and arches in the storey immediately below a floor or roof assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported floor or roof assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence  and by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83. for mixed types of construction, all loadbearing walls, columns and arches in the storey immediately below a floor or roof assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported floor or roof assembly.

National Sentence Text: Except for noncombustible roof assemblies required by Clauses 3.2.2.50. and 3.2.2.58.(2), if an assembly is required to be of noncombustible construction and have a fire-resistance rating, it shall be supported by noncombustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for noncombustible construction required by Subclauses 3.2.2.43A.(2)(c) and 3.2.2.50A.(2)(c)(i), if an assembly is required to be of noncombustible construction and have a fire resistance rating, it shall be supported by noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: The continuity of a fire separation shall be maintained where it abuts another fire separation, a floor, a ceiling, a roof, or an exterior wall assembly. (See Note A-3.1.8.3.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: The continuity of a fire separation shall be maintained where it abuts another fire separation, a floor, a ceiling, or an exterior wall assembly. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The leakage rate of smoke dampers and combination smoke/fire dampers shall  be determined in accordance with the applicable provisions in ULC CAN/ULC-S112.1-10 Leakage Rated Dampers for Use in Smoke Control Systems and  conform to Class I, II or III of that standard.
P/T Sentence Text: The leakage rate of smoke dampers and combination smoke and fire dampers shall,  be determined in accordance with the applicable provisions in CAN/ULC-S112.1, "Leakage Rated Dampers for Use in Smoke Control Systems", and  conform to Class I, II or III of that standard.

National Sentence Text: A leakage-rated door assembly complying with Sentence 3.1.8.4. shall be installed in  fire separations in protected floor areas referred to in Clause 3.3.1.7.(1)(b),  fire separations in care or treatment occupancies referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5.(4),  except as provided in Sentence 3.1.8.5.(8), fire separations of public corridors serving dwelling units in storeys that are not sprinklered, and  firewalls that are a horizontal exit referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5.(3).
P/T Sentence Text: A leakage-rated door assembly rated in accordance with Sentence 3.1.8.4. shall,  be installed in fire separations in protected floor areas described in Clause 3.3.1.7.(1)(b),  be installed in fire separations in care or care and treatment occupancies referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5. and installed in fire separations in retirement homes referred to in Sentence 3.3.4.11.(4),  except as provided in Sentence , be installed in fire separations of public corridors serving dwelling units in storeys that are not sprinklered, and  be installed in firewalls that are a horizontal exit referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5.(3).

National Article Title: Location of Fire Dampers and Smoke Dampers
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.1.8.9., a smoke damper or a combination smoke/fire damper shall be installed in conformance with Article 3.1.8.11. in ducts or air-transfer openings that penetrate an assembly required to be a fire separation, where the fire separation  separates a public corridor,  contains an egress door referred to in Sentence 3.4.2.4.(2),  serves an assembly, care, treatment, detention or residential occupancy, or  is installed to meet the requirements of Sentence 3.3.1.7. or Sentence 3.3.3.5.(4).
P/T Article Title: 3.1.8.7. Location of Fire Dampers and Smoke Dampers
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.1.8.8A., a smoke damper or a combination smoke and fire damper shall be installed in conformance with Article 3.1.8.9A. in ducts or air-transfer openings that penetrate an assembly required to be a fire separation, where the fire separation,  separates a public corridor,  contains an egress door referred to in Sentence 3.4.2.4.(2),  serves an assembly, care, care and treatment, detention or residential occupancy, or  is installed to meet the requirements of Clause 3.3.1.7.(1) or Sentence 3.3.3.5. or 3.3.4.11.(4).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.1.8.8.(2), the requirement for fire dampers stated in Sentence 3.1.8.7. is permitted to be waived for  ducts that serve commercial cooking equipment (see also Article 6.3.1.7.),  continuous noncombustible ducts having a melting point above 760Â°C that penetrate a vertical fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.1. between suites of assembly, mercantile, low-hazard industrial, medium-hazard industrial or high-hazard industrial occupancy,  ducts or air-transfer openings that penetrate a vertical fire separation not required to have a fire-resistance rating, or  noncombustible ducts or air-transfer openings that penetrate a horizontal fire separation not required to have a fire-resistance rating.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences  to , the requirement for fire dampers described in Sentence 3.1.8.7. is permitted to be waived for,  ducts that serve commercial cooking equipment,  continuous noncombustible ducts having a melting point above 760ÃÂ°C that penetrate a vertical fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.1. between suites of assembly, mercantile, low hazard industrial, medium hazard industrial or high hazard industrial occupancy,  ducts or air-transfer openings that penetrate a vertical fire separation not required to have a fire-resistance rating, and  noncombustible ducts or air-transfer openings that penetrate a horizontal fire separation not required to have a fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.1.8.9.(2), the requirement for smoke dampers or combination smoke/fire dampers stated in Sentence 3.1.8.7. is permitted to be waived for ducts  that serve commercial cooking equipment (see also Article 6.3.1.7.),  in which all inlet and outlet openings serve not more than one fire compartment, or  that penetrate a vertical fire separation referred to in Sentence 3.3.1.7. or in Sentence 3.3.3.5.(4), provided  the movement of air is continuous, and  the configuration of the air-handling system prevents the recirculation of exhaust or return air under fire emergency conditions.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , the requirement for smoke dampers or combination smoke and fire dampers described in Sentence 3.1.8.7. is permitted to be waived for ducts,  that serve commercial cooking equipment,  in which all inlet and outlet openings serve not more than one fire compartment, or  that penetrate a vertical fire separation referred to in Clause 3.3.1.7.(1) or in Sentence 3.3.3.5.(4), provided,  the movement of air is continuous,  and the configuration of the air-handling system prevents the recirculation of exhaust or return air under fire emergency conditions.

National Sentence Text: The requirement for smoke dampers or combination smoke/fire dampers stated in Sentence 3.1.8.7. is permitted to be waived for noncombustible branch ducts having a melting point above 760Â°C that penetrate a fire separation,  provided the ducts  have a cross-sectional area not more than 0.013 m2 and serve only air-conditioning units or combined air-conditioning and heating units discharging air not more than 1.2 m above the floor,  extend not less than 500 mm inside exhaust duct risers that are under negative pressure and in which the airflow is upward as required by Article 3.6.3.4., or  are required to function as part of a smoke control system, or  where the fire separation separates a vertical service space from the remainder of the building, provided each individual duct exhausts directly to the outdoors at the top of the vertical service space.
P/T Sentence Text: The requirement for smoke dampers or combination smoke and fire dampers described in Sentence 3.1.8.7. is permitted to be waived for noncombustible branch ducts having a melting point above 760ÃÂ°C that penetrate a fire separation,  provided the ducts,  have a cross-sectional area not more than 130 cmÃÂ² and serve only air-conditioning units or combined air-conditioning and heating units discharging air not more than 1.2 m above the floor,  extend not less than 500 mm inside exhaust duct risers that are under negative pressure and in which the airflow is upward as required by Article 3.6.3.4., or  are required to function as part of a smoke control system, or  provided the fire separation separates a vertical service space from the remainder of the building and provided each individual duct exhausts directly to the outdoors at the top of the vertical service space.

National Sentence Text: A heat-actuated device referred to in Sentence 3.1.8.10. shall  be located where it is readily affected by an abnormal rise in temperature in the duct, and  have a temperature rating approximately 30Â°C above the maximum temperature that would exist in the system, whether it is in operation or shut down.
P/T Sentence Text: A heat-actuated device referred to in Sentence  shall,  be located where it is readily affected by an abnormal rise of temperature in the duct, and  have a temperature rating approximately 30ÃÂ°C above the maximum temperature that would exist in the system either with the system in operation or shut down.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by a smoke control system, smoke dampers and combination smoke/fire dampers shall be configured so as to close automatically upon a signal from an adjacent smoke detector located as described in ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systems within 1.5 m horizontally of the duct or air-transfer opening in the fire separation  on both sides of the air-transfer opening, or  in the duct downstream of the smoke damper or combination smoke/fire damper.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by a smoke control system, smoke dampers and combination smoke and fire dampers shall be configured so as to close automatically upon a signal from an adjacent smoke detector located as described in CAN/ULC-S524, "Installation of Fire Alarm Systems", within 1.5 m horizontally of the duct or air-transfer opening in the fire separation,  on both sides of the air-transfer opening, or  in the duct downstream of the smoke damper or combination smoke and fire damper.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.1.8.14. and 3.1.8.14.(6), where the building is provided with a fire alarm system, a hold-open device permitted by Sentence 3.1.8.14. shall release  in a single-stage system, upon any signal from the fire alarm system, and  in a 2-stage system,  upon any alert signal from the fire alarm system, or  upon actuation of any adjacent smoke detectors.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , where the building is provided with a fire alarm system, a hold-open device permitted by Sentence  shall release,  in a single-stage system, upon any signal from the fire alarm system, and  in a two-stage system,  upon any alert signal from the fire alarm system, or  upon actuation of any adjacent smoke detectors.

National Sentence Text: Where the building is provided with a fire alarm system, a hold-open device permitted by Sentence 3.1.8.14. shall release upon a signal from a smoke detector connected to the fire alarm system and located as described in ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systems where the hold-open device is used on  an exit door,  a door opening into a public corridor,  an egress door referred to in Sentence 3.4.2.4.(2),  a closure serving an assembly, care, treatment, detention, or residential occupancy,  a door in a fire separation referred to in Sentence 3.3.1.7. or Sentence 3.3.3.5.(4), or  a door required to function as part of a smoke control system.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the building is provided with a fire alarm system, a hold-open device permitted by Sentence  shall release upon a signal from a smoke detector connected to the fire alarm system and located as described in CAN/ULC-S524, "Installation of Fire Alarm Systems", where the hold-open device is used on,  an exit door,  a door opening into a public corridor,  an egress door referred to in Sentence 3.4.2.4.(2),  a door serving an assembly, care, care and treatment, detention, or residential occupancy,  a door in a fire separation referred to in Clause 3.3.1.7.(1) or in Sentence 3.3.3.5. or 3.3.4.11.(4), or  a door required to function as part of a smoke control system.

National Sentence Text: Where the building is not provided with a fire alarm system, a hold-open device permitted by Sentence 3.1.8.14. shall release upon a signal from a smoke alarm located on each side of the fire separation at ceiling level within 1.5 m horizontally of the closure opening in the fire separation, where the hold-open device is used on closures described in Clauses 3.1.8.14.(3) to 3.1.8.14.(3)(e).
P/T Sentence Text: Where the building is not provided with a fire alarm system, a hold-open device permitted by Sentence  shall release upon a signal from a smoke alarm located on either side of the fire separation at ceiling level within 1.5 m horizontally of the closure opening in the fire separation, where the hold-open device is used on closures described in Clauses  to (e).

National Sentence Text: Where a hold-open device is used on closures other than those described in Sentences 3.1.8.14. and 3.1.8.14.(4), it is permitted to be released upon actuation of a heat-actuated device.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a hold-open device is used on closures other than those described in Sentences  and , it is permitted to be released upon actuation of a heat-actuated device.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.1.8.18. and 3.1.8.19. for the separation of exits, an opening in a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not more than 1 h is permitted to be protected with fixed wired glass assemblies or glass blocks installed in conformance with NFPA 80-2013 Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.1.8.16. and 3.1.8.17. for the separation of exits, an opening in a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not more than 1 h is permitted to be protected with fixed wired glass assemblies or glass blocks installed in conformance with NFPA 80, "Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives".

National Sentence Text: Glass blocks permitted by Sentence 3.1.8.16. shall be installed in accordance with part 4. and reinforced with steel reinforcement in each horizontal joint.
P/T Sentence Text: Glass blocks permitted by Sentence  shall be installed in accordance with Subsection 4.3.2. and reinforced with steel reinforcement in each horizontal joint.

National Article Title: Temperature Rise and Area Limits Waived
National Sentence Text: The temperature rise limits and glass area limits required by Articles 3.1.8.17. and 3.1.8.18. are waived for a closure between an exit enclosure and an enclosed vestibule or corridor, provided the vestibule or corridor is separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, the fire separation required by Sentence 3.1.8.19. contains no wired glass or glass block within 3 m of the closure into the exit enclosure, and the vestibule or corridor contains no occupancy.
P/T Article Title: 3.1.8.17. Temperature Rise and Area Limits Waived
P/T Sentence Text: The temperature rise limits and glass area limits required by Articles 3.1.8.15. and 3.1.8.16. are waived for a closure between an exit enclosure and an enclosed vestibule or corridor provided, the vestibule or corridor is separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, the fire separation required by Clause  contains no wired glass or glass block within 3 m of the closure into the exit enclosure, and the vestibule or corridor contains no occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Unless specifically designed with a fire stop, fire dampers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentences 3.1.9.1. to 3.1.9.1.(3), provided the fire damper is installed in conformance with NFPA 80-2013 Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives
P/T Sentence Text: Unless specifically designed with a fire stop, fire dampers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence ,  or , provided the fire damper is installed in conformance with NFPA 80, "Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives".

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.1.9.3. and 3.1.9.5., pipes, ducts, electrical outlet boxes, totally enclosed raceways or other similar service equipment that penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be noncombustible, unless the assembly was tested incorporating that service equipment. (See Note A-3.1.9.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.1.9.3. and 3.1.9.4., pipes, ducts, electrical outlet boxes, totally enclosed raceways or other similar service equipment that penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be noncombustible unless the assembly has been tested incorporating that service equipment. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Penetration by Wires, Cables and Outlet Boxes
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.9.3.(3), totally enclosed non-metallic raceways conforming to Article 3.1.5.23., optical fibre cables, and electrical wires and cables, single or grouped, with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that conform to the requirements of Sentence 3.1.5.21. and that are not installed in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways are permitted to penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required by Article 3.1.9.2., provided the overall diameter of the single or grouped wires or cables, or the raceways is not more than 25 mm.
P/T Article Title: 3.1.9.3. Penetration by Wires, Cables and Outlet Boxes
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , totally enclosed nonmetallic raceways conforming to Article 3.1.5.20., optical fibre cables, and electrical wires and cables, single or grouped, with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that conform to the requirements of Clause 3.1.5.18.(1) and that are not installed in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways are permitted to penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required by Article 3.1.9.2., provided the overall diameter of the single or grouped wires or cables, or the raceways is not more than 25 mm.

National Article Title: Penetration by Wires, Cables and Outlet Boxes
National Sentence Text: Combustible outlet boxes are permitted in an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required by Article 3.1.9.2., provided the opening through the membrane into the box is not more than 0.016 m2 .
P/T Article Title: 3.1.9.3. Penetration by Wires, Cables and Outlet Boxes
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible electrical outlet boxes are permitted in an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required by Article 3.1.9.2., provided the opening through the membrane into the box is not more than 160 cm2.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.9.5. to 3.1.9.5.(5), combustible piping shall not be used in a drain, waste and vent piping system if any part of that system penetrates  a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating, or  a membrane that forms part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  to , combustible piping shall not be used if any part of the piping system penetrates, a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating, or a membrane that forms part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: A membrane ceiling forming part of an assembly assigned a fire-resistance rating on the basis of Appendix is permitted to be penetrated by openings leading into ducts within the ceiling space, provided  the ducts are sheet steel, and  the number of openings and their protection conform to the requirements of Appendix.
P/T Sentence Text: A membrane ceiling forming part of an assembly assigned a fire-resistance rating on the basis of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings", is permitted to be penetrated by openings leading into ducts within the ceiling space provided,  the ducts are sheet steel, and  the amount of openings and their protection conform to the requirements of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings".

National Sentence Text: Sentence 3.1.10.1. does not apply to a firewall consisting of two separate wall assemblies each tied to its respective building frame but not to each other, provided each wall assembly is a fire separation having one half of the fire-resistance rating required for the firewall by Sentences 3.1.10.2. and 3.1.10.2.(2), and designed so that the collapse of one wall assembly will not cause collapse of the other.
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  does not apply to a firewall consisting of two separate wall assemblies each tied to its respective building frame but not to each other, provided each wall assembly is, a fire separation having one-half of the fire-resistance rating required for the firewall by Sentences 3.1.10.2. and , and designed so that the collapse of one wall assembly will not cause the collapse of the other.

National Sentence Text: A firewall permitted to have a fire-resistance rating not more than 2 h need not be constructed of masonry or concrete, provided  the assembly providing the fire-resistance rating is protected against damage that would compromise the integrity of the assembly, and  the design conforms to Article 4.1.5.17. (See Note A-3.1.10.2.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: A firewall permitted to have a fire-resistance rating not more than 2 h need not be constructed of masonry or concrete provided, the assembly providing the fire-resistance rating is protected against damage that would compromise the integrity of the assembly, the design conforms to Article 4.1.5.17., the level of performance of the firewall is not less than of masonry or concrete in the areas of, performance during fire conditions, mechanical damage during the normal use of the building, and resistance to damage from moisture, the firewall separates buildings or buildings with floor areas that do not contain, a Group B, Division 1 major occupancy, or a Group B, Division 2 major occupancy, and the firewall does not separate a building regulated by the provisions of Subsection 3.2.6. or a building within the scope of Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A. from another building unless the buildings on both sides of the firewall are sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: A firewall shall extend from the ground continuously through, or adjacent to, all storeys of a building or buildings so separated, except that a firewall located above a basement storage garage conforming to Article 3.2.1.2. is permitted to commence at the floor assembly immediately above the storage garage. (See also Sentence 3.1.10.1.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: A firewall shall extend from the ground continuously through, or adjacent to, all storeys of a building or buildings so separated, except that a firewall located above a basement storage garage conforming to Article 3.2.1.2. is permitted to commence at the floor assembly immediately above the storage garage.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.10.4. and 3.1.10.3.(2), a firewall shall extend above the roof surface to form a parapet not less than 150 mm high for a firewall required to have a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, and 900 mm high for a firewall required to have a fire-resistance rating not less than 4 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  and 3.1.10.3.(2), a firewall shall extend above the roof surface to form a parapet not less than, 150 mm high for a firewall required to have a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, and 900 mm high for a firewall required to have a fire-resistance rating not less than 4 h.

National Sentence Text: If buildings are separated by a firewall, combustible projections on the exterior of one building, including balconies, platforms, canopies, eave projections and stairs, that extend outward beyond the end of the firewall, shall not be permitted within 2.4 m of combustible projections and window or door openings of the adjacent building. (See also Article 3.2.3.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: If buildings are separated by a firewall, combustible projections on the exterior of one building, including balconies, platforms, canopies, eave projections and stairs, that extend outward beyond the end of the firewall, shall not be permitted within 2.4 m of combustible projections and window or door openings of the adjacent building.

National Article Title: Fire Blocks in Horizontal Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Except for crawl spaces conforming to Sentence 3.1.11.6. and as required in Sentence 3.1.11.5. , horizontal concealed spaces within a floor assembly or roof assembly of combustible construction, in which sprinklers are not installed, shall be separated by construction conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. into compartments not more than 600 m2 in area with no dimension more than 60 m if the exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating not more than 25, and not more than 300 m2 in area with no dimension more than 20 m if the exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating more than 25.
P/T Article Title: 3.1.11.5. Fire Blocks in Horizontal Concealed Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: Except for a crawl space conforming to Sentence 3.1.11.6.(1), a horizontal concealed space within a floor assembly or roof assembly of combustible construction, in which sprinklers are not installed, shall be separated by construction conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. into compartments not more than, 600 m2 in area with no dimension more than 60 m, if the exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating not more than 25, and 300 m2 in area with no dimension more than 20 m, if the exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating more than 25.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.11.7. to 3.1.11.7. and 3.1.11.7.(7), fire blocks shall remain in place and prevent the passage of flames for not less than 15 min when subjected to the standard fire exposure in ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  to  and  fire blocks shall remain in place and prevent the passage of flames for not less than 15 min when subjected to the standard fire exposure in CAN/ULC-S101, "Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials".

National Sentence Text: Where materials referred to in Sentences 3.1.11.7. to 3.1.11.7. are penetrated by construction elements or by service equipment, a fire stop shall be used to seal the penetration. (See Note A-3.1.11.7.(6).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where fire blocks are penetrated by construction elements or by service equipment, a fire stop shall be used to seal the penetration. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  and , the flame-spread rating shall be not more than 75 for the interior wall finish of  a public corridor,  a corridor used by the public in an assembly occupancy, or  a corridor serving classrooms.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  and , the flame-spread rating shall be not more than 75 for the interior wall finish of,  a public corridor,  a corridor used by the public in,  an assembly occupancy, or  a care, care and treatment or detention occupancy,  a corridor serving classrooms, or  a corridor serving sleeping rooms in a care, care and treatment or detention occupancy.

National Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating for corridors specified in Sentence 3.1.13.6. is permitted to be waived, provided the flame-spread rating is not more than 25 on the upper half of the wall, and 150 on the lower half of the wall.
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating limit specified in Sentence  does not apply to corridors referred to in Sentence  provided the flame-spread rating is not more than, 25 on the upper half of the wall, and 150 on the lower half of the wall.

National Sentence Text: Where the floor area is sprinklered throughout, the flame-spread ratings for corridors specified in Sentences  and  shall be not more than 150.
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating limits specified in Sentences  and  for corridors referred to in Sentence  do not apply to a corridor in which the flame-spread rating is not more than 150 provided the floor area is sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: The flame-spread ratings specified in Sentences 3.1.13.6. , 3.1.13.6. and 3.1.13.6. apply to occupancies in the corridor as well as to the corridor itself.
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating limits specified in Sentences  to  apply to occupancies in the corridor as well as to the corridor itself.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.1.13.6.(6), the interior ceiling finish of corridors and occupancies referred to in Sentences 3.1.13.6. and 3.1.13.6. shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 25.
P/T Sentence Text: Except in a floor area that is sprinklered and as permitted in Sentence , the interior ceiling finish of corridors and occupancies referred to in Sentences  and  shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 25.

National Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating for corridors specified in Sentence 3.1.13.6. is permitted to be waived, provided the flame-spread rating is not more than 25 on the upper half of the wall, and 150 on the lower half of the wall.
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating limits specified in Sentence  do not apply to a corridor in which the flame-spread rating is not more than 150 provided the floor area is sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.13.7. to 3.1.13.7.(4), the interior wall, ceiling and floor finishes in a building regulated by the provisions of part 3. shall conform to the flame-spread rating requirements in Articles 3.1.13.2. and 3.1.13.11. and to the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification values in Table 3.1.13.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  and , the interior wall, ceiling and floor finishes in a building regulated by the provisions of Subsection 3.2.6. shall conform to the flame-spread rating requirements in Articles 3.1.13.2. to 3.1.13.6. and to the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification values in Table 3.1.13.7.

National Sentence Text: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, the flame-spread ratings required by part 3. shall apply in addition to the requirements in this Subsection, and the flame-spread ratings for exits in this Subsection shall also apply to any surface in the exit that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, except that this requirement does not apply to doors, heavy timber construction in a sprinklered building and fire-retardant-treated wood.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, the flame-spread ratings required by Subsection 3.1.5. shall apply in addition to the requirements in this Subsection, and the flame-spread ratings for exits in this Subsection shall also apply to any surface in the exit that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, except that this requirement does not apply to doors, heavy timber construction in a sprinklered building and fire-retardant treated wood.

National Sentence Text: If a fire-retardant-treated wood roof system is used to comply with the requirements of part 3., the roof deck assembly shall meet the conditions of acceptance of ULC CAN/ULC-S126-14 Test for Fire Spread Under Roof-Deck Assemblies
P/T Sentence Text: If a fire-retardant treated wood roof system is used to comply with the requirements of Subsection 3.2.2., the roof deck assembly shall meet the conditions of acceptance of CAN/ULC-S126, "Test for Fire Spread Under Roof-Deck Assemblies".

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.14.2.(2), a metal roof deck assembly shall meet the conditions of acceptance of ULC CAN/ULC-S126-14 Test for Fire Spread Under Roof-Deck Assemblies if it supports a combustible material above the deck that could propagate a fire beneath the roof deck assembly, and the deck is used to comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.2.2.25.(2), Sentence 3.2.2.32.(2), Sentence 3.2.2.60.(2), Sentence 3.2.2.66.(2), Sentence 3.2.2.76. and 3.2.2.83. for noncombustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , a metal roof deck assembly shall meet the conditions of acceptance of CAN/ULC-S126, "Test for Fire Spread Under Roof-Deck Assemblies", if, it supports a combustible material above the deck that could propagate a fire beneath the roof deck assembly, and the deck is used to comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.2.2.25.(2), 3.2.2.32.(2), 3.2.2.53.(2), 3.2.2.59.(2), 3.2.2.70. and 3.2.2.76. for noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentence 3.1.14.2. are waived provided the combustible material above the roof deck is protected by not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly if located beneath the roof deck, or by a thermal barrier conforming to one of Clauses 3.1.5.15. to 3.1.5.15. that is located on the underside of the combustible material, or beneath the roof deck, the building is sprinklered throughout, or the roof assembly has a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentence  are waived provided, the combustible material above the roof deck is protected, by not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly if located beneath the roof deck, or by a thermal barrier conforming to Clause 3.1.5.12.(4) or  that is located on the underside of the combustible material or beneath the roof deck, the building is sprinklered, or the roof assembly has a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , roof coverings on buildings conforming to Article 3.2.2.50. or 3.2.2.58. shall have a Class A classification where the roof height is greater than 25m measured from the floor of the first storey to the highest point of the roof.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible roof coverings on buildings within the scope of Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A. shall have a Class A classification.

National Sentence Text: The occupant load of a floor area or part of a floor area shall be based on the number of seats in an assembly occupancy having fixed seats, 2 persons per sleeping room in a dwelling unit, or the number of persons for which the area is designed, but not less than that determined from Table 3.1.17.1. for occupancies other than those described in Clauses 3.1.17.1. and 3.1.17.1.(1), unless it can be shown that the area will be occupied by fewer persons.
P/T Sentence Text: The occupant load of a floor area or part of a floor area, or of a building or part of a building not having a floor area, shall be based on, the number of seats in an assembly occupancy having fixed seats, two persons per sleeping room or sleeping area in a dwelling unit or suite, or the number of persons, for which the area is designed, or determined from Table 3.1.17.1. for occupancies other than those described in Clauses  and (b).

National Sentence Text: If a floor area or part thereof has been designed for an occupant load other than that determined from Table 3.1.17.1., a permanent sign indicating that occupant load shall be posted in a conspicuous location.
P/T Sentence Text: If a floor area or part of it has been designed for an occupant load other than that determined from Table 3.1.17.1., a permanent sign indicating that occupant load shall be posted in a conspicuous location.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.1.1.(5), the space above a mezzanine need not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height, provided the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed does not exceed 40% of the open area of the room in which they are located (see Note A-3.2.1.1.(3)(a)), and except as permitted in Sentences 3.2.1.1. and 3.3.2.13.(3), the space above the mezzanine is used as an open area without partitions or subdividing walls higher than 1 070 mm above the mezzanine floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence , the space above a mezzanine need not be considered as a storey in calculating building height provided, the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed does not exceed 40% of the open area of the room in which they are located, and (See Appendix A.) except as permitted in Sentence  and Sentence 3.3.2.11. the space above the mezzanine is used as an open area without partitions or subdividing walls higher than 1 070 mm above the mezzanine floor.

National Sentence Text: A service space in which facilities are included to permit a person to enter and to undertake maintenance and other operations pertaining to building services from within the service space need not be considered a storey if it conforms to Articles 3.2.5.14. and 3.3.1.24., and Sentences 3.2.4.18.(10), Sentence 3.2.7.3.(2), Sentence 3.3.1.3.(7), Sentence 3.4.2.4. and 3.4.4.4.(9). (See Note A-3.2.1.1.(8).)
P/T Sentence Text: A service space in which facilities are included to permit a person to enter and to undertake maintenance and other operations pertaining to building services from within the service space need not be considered a storey if it conforms to Articles 3.2.5.15. and 3.3.1.23. and Sentences 3.2.4.20.(12), 3.2.7.3.(2), 3.3.1.3.(7), 3.4.2.4. and 3.4.4.4.(9). (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Storage Garage Considered as a Separate Building
National Sentence Text: A basement used primarily as a storage garage is permitted to be considered as a separate building for the purposes of part 3. and Sentences 3.2.5.12. and 3.2.5.12.(3), provided the floor and roof assemblies above the basement and the exterior walls of the basement above the adjoining ground level are constructed as fire separations of noncombustible construction having a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h and protected in conformance with Sentence 3.1.10.2.(4), except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.1.2.(2). (See Notes A-3.1.10.2. and A-3.2.5.12.(2).)
P/T Article Title: 3.2.1.2. Storage Garage Considered as a Separate Building
P/T Sentence Text: A basement used primarily as a storage garage is permitted to be considered as a separate building for the purposes of Subsection 3.2.2. and Sentences 3.2.5.13. and , provided the floor and roof assemblies above the basement and, except as permitted by Sentence , the exterior walls of the basement above the adjoining ground level are constructed as fire separations of, masonry or concrete having a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, or noncombustible construction having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h, where the building conforms to Clauses 3.1.10.2.(4) and  to (e).

National Article Title: Storage Garage Considered as a Separate Building
National Sentence Text: The exterior wall of a basement that is required to be a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating in accordance with Sentence 3.2.1.2. is permitted to be penetrated by openings that are not protected by closures provided  the storage garage is sprinklered throughout,  every opening in the exterior wall is separated from storeys above the opening by a projection of the floor or roof assembly above the basement, extending not less than  1 m beyond the exterior face of the storage garage if the upper storeys are required to be of noncombustible construction, or  2 m beyond the exterior face of the storage garage if the upper storeys are permitted to be of combustible construction, or  the exterior walls of any storeys located above the floor or roof assembly referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.2. are recessed behind the outer edge of the assembly by not less than  1 m if the upper storeys are required to be of noncombustible construction, or  2 m if the upper storeys are permitted to be of combustible construction.
P/T Article Title: 3.2.1.2. Storage Garage Considered as a Separate Building
P/T Sentence Text: The exterior wall of a basement that is required to be a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating in accordance with Sentence  is permitted to be penetrated by openings that are not protected by closures provided,  the storage garage is sprinklered,  every opening in the exterior wall is separated from storeys above the opening by a projection of the floor or roof assembly above the basement, extending not less than,  1 m beyond the exterior face of the storage garage if the upper storeys are required to be of noncombustible construction, or  2 m beyond the exterior face of the storage garage if the upper storeys are permitted to be of combustible construction, or  the exterior walls of any storeys located above the floor or roof assembly referred to in Sentence  are recessed behind the outer edge of the assembly by not less than,  1 m if the upper storeys are required to be of noncombustible construction, or  2 m if the upper storeys are permitted to be of combustible construction.

National Article Title: Storage Garage Considered as a Separate Building
National Sentence Text: The floor or roof assembly projection referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.2. shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h and shall have no openings within the projection.
P/T Article Title: 3.2.1.2. Storage Garage Considered as a Separate Building
P/T Sentence Text: The floor or roof assembly projection referred to in Clause  shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h and shall have no openings within the projection

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.47.(3), Sentence 3.2.2.48.(3), Sentence 3.2.2.49.(3), Sentence 3.2.2.51.(3), Sentence 3.2.2.52.(3), Sentence 3.2.2.53. or 3.2.2.54.(3), a floor assembly immediately above a basement shall be constructed as a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating conforming to the requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90. for a floor assembly, but not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.42.(3), 3.2.2.43.(3), 3.2.2.44.(3), 3.2.2.45.(3), 3.2.2.46.(3), 3.2.2.47. or 3.2.2.48.(3), a floor assembly immediately above a basement shall be constructed as a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating conforming to the requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83. for a floor assembly, but not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.1.5. and 3.2.2.15.(3), in a building in which an automatic sprinkler system is not required to be installed by Article 3.2.2.18., every basement shall  be sprinklered throughout, or  be subdivided into fire compartments not more than 600 m2 in area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly immediately above the basement.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  and 3.2.2.15.(3), in a building in which an automatic sprinkler system is not required to be installed by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83., every basement shall,  be sprinklered, or  be subdivided into fire compartments not more than 600 m2 in area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly immediately above the basement.

National Sentence Text: The floor assembly of a mezzanine that is required to be considered as a storey in calculating the building height shall be constructed in conformance with the fire separation requirements for floor assemblies stated in Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90.
P/T Sentence Text: The floor assembly of a mezzanine that is required to be considered as a storey in calculating building height shall be constructed in conformance with the fire separation requirements for floor assemblies in Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.3., a building shall be constructed in conformance with this Subsection to prevent fire spread and collapse caused by the effects of fire. (See part 3. for fire separations between major occupancies.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.3., a building shall be constructed in conformance with this Subsection to prevent fire spread and collapse caused by the effects of fire.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.8., in a building containing more than one major occupancy, the requirements of this Subsection for the most restricted major occupancy contained shall apply to the whole building.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.8. and Sentences 3.2.2.43A. and 3.2.2.50A.(4), in a building containing more than one major occupancy, the requirements of this Subsection for the most restricted major occupancy contained shall apply to the whole building.

National Sentence Text: If one major occupancy is located above another major occupancy, the fire-resistance rating of the floor assembly between the major occupancies shall be determined on the basis of the requirements of this Subsection for the lower major occupancy. (See also Article 3.1.3.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: If one major occupancy is located above another major occupancy, the fire-resistance rating of the floor assembly between the major occupancies shall be determined on the basis of the requirements of this Subsection for the lower major occupancy.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of Articles 3.1.11.6. , 3.2.1.4. and 3.2.1.5., a crawl space shall be considered as a basement if it is  more than 1.8 m high between the lowest part of the floor assembly and the ground or other surface below,  used for any occupancy,  used for the passage of flue pipes, or  used as a plenum in combustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of Articles 3.2.1.4. and 3.2.1.5., a crawl space shall be considered as a basement if it is,  more than 1 800 mm high between the lowest part of the floor assembly and the ground or other surface below,  used for any occupancy,  used for the passage of flue pipes, or  used as a plenum in combustible construction.

National Sentence Text: A building conforming to Article 3.2.2.50. or 3.2.2.58. is considered to face 1 street where not less than 25% of the building perimeter is located within 15 m of a street or streets.
P/T Sentence Text: A building within the scope of Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A. is considered to face one street provided not less than 10% of the building perimeter is located within 15 m of a street or streets.

National Sentence Text: An exterior balcony shall be constructed in accordance with the type of construction required by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90., as applicable to the occupancy classification of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: An exterior balcony shall be constructed in accordance with the type of construction required by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83., as applicable to the occupancy classification of the building.

National Sentence Text: An elevated exterior passageway used as part of a means of egress shall conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90. for mezzanines.
P/T Sentence Text: An elevated exterior passageway used as part of a means of egress shall conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83. for mezzanines.

National Sentence Text: A portion of a roof that supports an occupancy shall be constructed in conformance with the fire separation requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90. for floor assemblies, and not the fire-resistance rating for roof assemblies.
P/T Sentence Text: A portion of a roof that supports an occupancy shall be constructed in conformance with the fire separation requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83. for floor assemblies.

National Sentence Text: A roof-top enclosure for a stairway shall be constructed in accordance with the type of construction required by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90.
P/T Sentence Text: A rooftop enclosure for a stairway shall be constructed in accordance with the type of construction required by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83.

National Sentence Text: Unless otherwise permitted by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90., a roof assembly in a building up to 2 storeys in building height is permitted to be of heavy timber construction regardless of building area or type of construction required, provided the building is sprinklered throughout.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless otherwise permitted by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83., a roof assembly in a building up to 2 storeys in building height is permitted to be of heavy timber construction regardless of building area or type of construction required, provided the building is sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: A building containing an impeded egress zone and conforming to the appropriate requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90. is not required to conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.2.36. and 3.2.2.37. for a Group B, Division 1 major occupancy provided  the building is sprinklered throughout,  it is not more than 1 storey in building height,  it does not include  a contained use area,  sleeping accommodation,  a high-hazard industrial occupancy, or  a mercantile occupancy,  the building area is not more than 6400 m2 if the building includes a medium-hazard industrial occupancy,  the impeded egress zone does not extend beyond the boundaries of the fire compartment in which it is located, and  the occupant load of the impeded egress zone is not more than 100.
P/T Sentence Text: A building containing an impeded egress zone and conforming to the appropriate requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83. is not required to conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.2.36. and 3.2.2.37. for a Group B, Division 1 major occupancy provided,  the building is sprinklered,  it is not more than 1 storey in building height,  it does not include,  a contained use area,  sleeping accommodation,  a high hazard industrial occupancy, or  a mercantile occupancy,  the building area is not more than 6 400 m2 if the building includes a medium hazard industrial occupancy,  the impeded egress zone does not extend beyond the boundaries of the fire compartment in which it is located, and  the occupant load of the impeded egress zone is not more than 100.

National Article Title: Group A, Division 1, Any Height, Any Area, Sprinklered
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.21. and 3.2.2.22., a building classified as Group A, Division 1 shall conform to Sentence 3.2.2.20.(2).
P/T Article Title: 3.2.2.20. Group A, Division 1, Any Height, Any Area, Sprinklered
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.21. and 3.2.2.22., a building classified as Group A, Division 1 shall conform to Sentence .

National Article Title: Group A, Division 1, Any Height, Any Area, Sprinklered
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence  shall be of noncombustible construction, and  except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building shall be sprinklered throughout,  floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h,  mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and  loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
P/T Article Title: 3.2.2.20. Group A, Division 1, Any Height, Any Area, Sprinklered
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence  shall be of noncombustible construction, and,  except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.7.(1), the building shall be sprinklered,  floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h,  mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and  loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

National Article Title: Group A, Division 1, One Storey, Sprinklered
