(See Note A-3.2.5.12.(7).)
P/T Sentence Text: Despite the requirements of the standards referenced in Sentences  and  for the installation of automatic sprinkler systems, sprinklers shall be provided for all balconies and decks forming part of a building within the scope of Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A., other than,  balconies or decks that are not more than 610 mm in depth measured perpendicular to the exterior wall of the building, or decks on the uppermost roof of the building. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.5.13.(5), combustible sprinkler piping shall be separated from the area served by the sprinkler system, and from any other fire compartment, by ceilings, walls, or soffits consisting of, as a minimum, lath and plaster, gypsum board not less than 9.5 mm thick, plywood not less than 13 mm thick, or a suspended membrane ceiling with steel suspension grids, and lay-in panels or tiles having a mass not less than 1.7 kg/m2 .
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , combustible sprinkler piping shall be separated from the area served by the sprinkler system, and from any other fire compartment, by ceilings, walls, or soffits consisting of, as a minimum, lath and plaster, gypsum board not less than 9.5 mm thick, plywood not less than 13 mm thick, or a suspended membrane ceiling with, steel suspension grids, and lay-in panels or tiles having a mass not less than 1.7 kg/m2.

National Sentence Text: Where combustible sprinkler piping has been tested in conformance with ULC ULC/ORD-C199P-2002 Combustible Piping for Sprinkler Systems and has been shown to meet the requirements therein without additional protection, conformance to Sentences 3.2.5.13. and 3.2.5.13. is not required.
P/T Sentence Text: The protection required by Sentences  and  is permitted to be waived where combustible sprinkler piping has been tested in conformance with ULC/ORD-C199P, "Combustible Piping for Sprinkler Systems", and has been shown to meet the requirements in that document without additional protection.

National Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers shall be provided and installed in accordance with  provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or  the NFC, in the absence of the regulations or by laws referred to in Clause (a).
P/T Sentence Text: Portable fire extinguishers shall be installed in all buildings, except within dwelling units, in conformance with the provisions of Part 6 of Division B of the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997.

National Sentence Text: A building to which this Subsection applies shall be designed in accordance with Sentences 3.2.6.2. to 3.2.6.2. and Article 3.2.6.3. to limit the danger to occupants and firefighters from exposure to smoke in a building fire.
P/T Sentence Text: A sprinklered building shall be designed in accordance with Sentences  to (5.1) and MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-4, "Measures for Fire Safety in High Buildings", to limit the danger to occupants and firefighters from exposure to smoke in a building fire.

National Sentence Text: A building referred to in Sentence 3.2.6.2. shall be designed so that, during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire, each exit stair serving storeys below the lowest exit level will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the fire floor, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in accordance with part 1. (See Note A-3.2.6.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: A building referred to in Sentence , shall be designed so that, during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire, each exit stair serving storeys below the lowest exit level will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the fire floor, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in conformance with MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-1, "Climatic and Seismic Data".

National Sentence Text: If a building described in Article 3.2.6.1. is connected to any other building, measures shall be taken to limit movement of contaminated air from one building into another during a fire. (See Note A-3.2.6.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: If a building described in Article 3.2.6.1. is connected to any other building, measures shall be taken to limit movement of contaminated air from one building into another during a fire.

National Sentence Text: Keys to operate the switches required by Sentences 3.2.6.4. and 3.2.6.4. shall be provided in a suitably identified box conspicuously located on the outside of an elevator hoistway near the central alarm and control facility required by Article 3.2.6.7., and kept at the central alarm and control facility.
P/T Sentence Text: Keys to operate the switches required by Sentences  and  shall be, provided in a suitably identified box conspicuously located on the outside of an elevator hoistway near the central alarm and control facility required by Article 3.2.6.7., and kept at the central alarm and control facility.

National Sentence Text: At least one elevator shall be provided for use by firefighters in conformance with Sentences 3.2.6.5. to 3.2.6.5.(6).
P/T Sentence Text: At least one elevator shall be provided for use by firefighters in conformance with Sentences  to .

National Sentence Text: The elevator referred to in Sentence 3.2.6.5. shall have a useable platform area not less than 2.2 m2 and shall be capable of carrying a load of 900 kg to the top floor that it serves from a landing on the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5. within 1 min.
P/T Sentence Text: The elevator referred to in Sentence  shall have a useable platform area not less than 2.2 m2 and shall be capable of carrying a load of 900 kg to the top floor that it serves from a landing on the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5. within 1 min.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.6.5.(5), an elevator referred to in Sentence 3.2.6.5. shall be capable of providing transportation from the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5. to every floor that is above grade in the building and that is normally served by the elevator system.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , an elevator referred to in Sentence  shall be capable of providing transportation from the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5. to every floor that is above grade in the building and that is normally served by the elevator system.

National Sentence Text: If it is necessary to change elevators to reach any floor referred to in Sentence 3.2.6.5.(4), the system shall be designed so that not more than one change of elevator is required when travelling to any floor in the building from the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5.
P/T Sentence Text: If it is necessary to change elevators to reach any floor referred to in Sentence , the system shall be designed so that not more than one change of elevator is required when travelling to any floor in the building from the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5.

National Sentence Text: A central alarm and control facility shall be provided on the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5. in a location that is readily accessible to firefighters entering the building, and takes into account the effect of background noise likely to occur under fire emergency conditions, so that the facility can properly perform its required function under these conditions.
P/T Sentence Text: A central alarm and control facility shall be provided on the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5. in a location that, is readily accessible to firefighters entering the building, and takes into account the effect of background noise likely to occur under fire emergency conditions, so that the facility can properly perform its required function under such conditions.

National Sentence Text: The central alarm and control facility required in Sentence  shall include,  means to control the voice communication system required by Article 3.2.6.8., so that messages can be sent to,  all loudspeakers simultaneously,  individual floor areas, and  exit stairwells,  means to indicate audibly and visually alert signals and alarm signals and a switch to,  silence the audible portion of these signals, and  indicate visually that the audible portion has been silenced,  means to indicate visually that elevators are on emergency recall,  an annunciator conforming to Article 3.2.4.8.,  means to transmit alert signals and alarm signals to the fire department in conformance with Article 3.2.4.7.,  means to release hold-open devices on doors to vestibules,  means to manually actuate alarm signals in the building selectively to any zone or zones,  means to silence the alarm signals referred to in Clause  in conformance with Sentences 3.2.4.22. and ,  means, as appropriate to the measure for fire safety provided in the building, to,  actuate auxiliary equipment identified in Articles 3.2.6.2., 3.2.6.3. and 3.2.6.6., or  communicate with a continually staffed auxiliary equipment control centre,  means to communicate with telephones in elevator cars, separate from connections to firefighters telephones, if elevator cars are required by ASME A17.1/CSA B44, Safety Code for Elevators and Escalators, to be equipped with a telephone ,  means to indicate visually, individual sprinkler system waterflow signals,  means to indicate audibly and visually, sprinkler and standpipe system supervisory signals and trouble signals,  a switch to silence the audible portion of a supervisory signal or a trouble signal, and  visual indication that the audible portion of a supervisory signal or a trouble signal has been silenced.
P/T Sentence Text: The central alarm and control facility required in Sentence  shall include,  means to control the voice communication system required by Article 3.2.6.8., so that messages can be sent to,  all loudspeakers simultaneously,  individual floor areas, and  exit stairwells,  means to indicate audibly and visually alert signals and alarm signals and a switch to,  silence the audible portion of these signals, and  indicate visually that the audible portion has been silenced,  means to indicate visually that elevators are on emergency recall,  an annunciator conforming to Article 3.2.4.9.,  means to transmit alert signals and alarm signals to the fire department in conformance with Article 3.2.4.8.,  means to release hold-open devices on doors to vestibules,  means to manually actuate alarm signals in the building selectively to any zone or zones,  means to silence the alarm signals referred to in Clause  in conformance with Sentences 3.2.4.23. and , (i means, as appropriate to the measure for fire safety provided in the building, to,  actuate auxiliary equipment identified in Articles 3.2.6.2., 3.2.6.3. and 3.2.6.6., or  communicate with a continually staffed auxiliary equipment control centre,  means for two-way communications with every elevator car,  means to indicate visually, individual sprinkler system waterflow signals,  means to indicate audibly and visually, sprinkler and standpipe system supervisory signals and trouble signals,  a switch to silence the audible portion of a supervisory signal or a trouble signal, and  visual indication that the audible portion of a supervisory signal or a trouble signal has been silenced.

National Sentence Text: An exit, a public corridor, or a corridor providing access to exit for the public or serving patientsâ sleeping rooms or classrooms shall be equipped to provide illumination to an average level not less than 50 lx at floor or tread level and at angles and intersections at changes of level where there are stairs or ramps.
P/T Sentence Text: An exit, a public corridor, a corridor providing access to exit for the public, a corridor serving patients or residents in a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy, a corridor serving classrooms, an electrical equipment room, a transformer vault and a hoistway pit shall be equipped to provide illumination to an average level not less than 50 lx at floor or tread level and at all points such as angles and intersections at changes of level where there are stairs or ramps.

National Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall be provided to an average level of illumination not less than 10 lx at floor or tread level in  exits,  principal routes providing access to exit in open floor areas and in service rooms,  corridors used by the public,  corridors serving sleeping rooms in a treatment occupancy,  corridors serving sleeping rooms in a care occupancy, except corridors serving sleeping rooms within individual suites of care occupancy,  corridors serving classrooms,  underground walkways,  public corridors,  floor areas or parts thereof where the public may congregate  in Group A, Division 1 occupancies, or  in Group A, Division 2 and 3 occupancies having an occupant load of 60 or more,  floor areas or parts thereof of daycare centres where persons are cared for,  food preparation areas in commercial kitchens, and  public washrooms that are equipped to serve more than one person at a time.
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall be provided to an average level of illumination not less than 10 lx at floor or tread level in,  exits,  principal routes providing access to exit in an open floor area and in service rooms,  corridors used by the public,  corridors serving patients or residents sleeping rooms in a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy,  corridors serving classrooms,  underground walkways,  public corridors,  floor areas or parts of them where the public may congregate in,  Group A, Division 1 occupancies, or  Group A, Divisions 2 and 3 occupancies having an occupant load of 60 or more,  floor areas or parts of them in day care centres where persons are cared for,  food preparation areas in commercial kitchens,  principal routes providing access to exit in a floor area that is not subdivided into rooms or suites of rooms served by corridors in a business and personal services occupancy, a mercantile occupancy or an industrial occupancy,  internal corridors or aisles serving as principal routes to exits in a business and personal services occupancy, a mercantile occupancy or an industrial occupancy that is subdivided into rooms or suites of rooms, and is not served by a public corridor, and  washrooms with fixtures for public use.

National Sentence Text: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentences  and  shall be not less than 1 lx.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentences  and  shall not be less than 1 lx.

National Sentence Text: In addition to the requirements of Sentences 3.2.7.3. to 3.2.7.3.(3), the installation of battery-operated emergency lighting in buildings or part thereof where treatment is provided shall conform to the appropriate requirements of CSA Z32-09 Electrical Safety and Essential Electrical Systems in Health Care Facilities
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to the requirements of Sentences  to , the installation of battery-operated emergency lighting in health care facilities shall conform to the appropriate requirements of CSA Z32, "Electrical Safety and Essential Electrical Systems in Health Care Facilities".

National Sentence Text: An emergency power supply shall be  provided to maintain the emergency lighting required by this Subsection from a power source such as batteries or generators that will continue to supply power in the event that the regular power supply to the building is interrupted, and  so designed and installed that upon failure of the regular power it will assume the electrical load automatically for a period of  2 h for a building within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6.,  1 h for a building of Group B major occupancy classification that is not within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6.,  1 h for a building constructed in accordance with Article 3.2.2.50. or 3.2.2.58., and  30 min for a building of any other occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: An emergency power supply shall be,  provided to maintain the emergency lighting required by this Subsection from a power source such as batteries or generators that will continue to supply power in the event that the regular power supply to the building is interrupted, and  so designed and installed that upon failure of the regular power it will assume the electrical load automatically for a period of,  2 h for a building within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6.,  1 h for a building of Group B major occupancy classification that is not within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6., (ii.1) 1 h for a building that contains a Group C major occupancy retirement home and that is not within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6.,  1 h for a building within the scope of Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A., and  30 min for any other building.

National Sentence Text: An emergency power supply capable of operating under a full load for not less than 2 h shall be provided by an emergency generator for  every elevator serving storeys above the first storey in a building that is more than 36 m high measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey and every elevator for firefighters in conformance with Sentence 3.2.7.9.(2), water supply for firefighting in conformance with Article 3.2.5.7., if the supply is dependent on electrical power supplied to the building,  fans and other electrical equipment that are installed to maintain the air quality specified in Articles 3.2.6.2. and 3.3.3.6. ,  fans required for venting by Article 3.2.6.6., and  fans required by Sentence 3.2.8.4. and Article 3.2.8.7. in buildings within the scope of part 3.
P/T Sentence Text: An emergency power supply capable of operating under a full load for not less than 2 h shall be provided by an emergency generator for,  every elevator serving storeys above the first storey in a building that is more than 36 m high measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey and every elevator for firefighters in conformance with Sentence , water supply for firefighting in conformance with Article 3.2.5.7., if the supply is dependent on electrical power supplied to the building, and the building is within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6.,  fans and other electrical equipment that are installed to maintain the air quality specified in Articles 3.2.6.2. and 3.3.3.6., other than air handling systems described in Sentence 3.2.6.2.(6), and  fans required for venting by Article 3.2.6.6.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.7.9.(3), the emergency power supply for elevators required by Sentence 3.2.7.9. shall be capable of operating all elevators for firefighters plus one additional elevator simultaneously.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , the emergency power supply for elevators required by Clause  shall be capable of operating all elevators for firefighters plus one additional elevator simultaneously.

National Sentence Text: Sentence 3.2.7.9. does not apply if the time to recall all elevators under emergency power supply is not more than 5 min, each from its most remote storey to the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5., or to a transfer lobby.
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  does not apply if the time to recall all elevators under emergency power supply is not more than 5 min, each from its most remote storey to, the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4 and 3.2.5.5., or to a transfer lobby.

National Sentence Text: Electrical conductors identified in Sentence 3.2.7.10. shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S139-12 Fire Test for Evaluation of Integrity of Electrical Power, Data and Optical Fibre Cables including the hose stream application, to provide a circuit integrity rating of not less than 2 h (see Note A-3.2.7.10.(2)(a)), or be located in a service space that is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation that has a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical conductors that are used in conjunction with systems referred to in Clause  shall, conform to CAN/ULC-S139, "Fire Test for Evaluation of Integrity of Electrical Power, Data and Optical Fibre Cables", including the hose stream application, to provide a circuit integrity rating of not less than 2 h, or (See A-3.2.7.10.(2) in Appendix be located in a service space that is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation that has a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: The service spaces referred to in Clauses 3.2.7.10.(2) and 3.2.7.10.(3) shall not contain any combustible materials other than the conductors being protected.
P/T Sentence Text: The service spaces referred to in Clause  or  shall not contain any combustible materials other than the electrical conductors being protected.

National Sentence Text: Except as stated in Sentences 3.2.7.10. and 3.2.7.10.(9), the electrical conductors referred to in Sentence 3.2.7.10. are those that extend from the source of emergency power to the equipment served, or the distribution equipment supplying power to the equipment served, if both are in the same room (see Note A-3.2.7.10.(5)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  and , the electrical conductors referred to in Sentence  are those that extend from the source of emergency power to, the equipment served, or the distribution equipment supplying power to the equipment served, if both are in the same room. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: A mezzanine need not terminate at a vertical fire separation nor be protected in conformance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.8. provided the mezzanine  serves a Group A, Division 1 major occupancy,  serves a Group A, Division 3 major occupancy in a building not more than 2 storeys in building height, or  serves a Group A, C, D, E or F major occupancy and  is 500 m2 or less in area, and  conforms to Sentence 3.2.1.1. or 3.2.1.1.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: A mezzanine need not terminate at a vertical fire separation nor be protected in conformance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.11. provided the mezzanine,  serves a Group A, Division 1 major occupancy,  serves a Group A, Division 3 major occupancy in a building not more than 2 storeys in building height,  serves a Group A, C, D, E or F major occupancy and the mezzanine conforms to Sentence 3.2.1.1. or ,  is not considered a storey in Sentence 3.2.1.1. in calculating building height provided the mezzanine is not more than 500 m2 in area and does not contain a Group B occupancy, or  is not considered a storey in calculating building height in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(7).

National Sentence Text: If a closure in an opening in a fire separation would disrupt the nature of a manufacturing process, such as a continuous flow of material from storey to storey, the closure for the opening is permitted to be omitted provided precautions are taken to offset the resulting hazard. (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: If a closure in an opening in a fire separation would disrupt the nature of a manufacturing process, such as a continuous flow of material from storey to storey, the closure for the opening is permitted to be omitted provided precautions are taken to offset the resulting hazard. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.8.2.(6), openings for escalators and inclined moving walks need not conform to the requirements in Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.8. provided  the opening for each escalator or walk does not exceed 10 m2 ,  the building is sprinklered throughout, and  the interconnected floor space contains only Group A, Division 1, 2 or 3, Group D or Group E major occupancies (see Note A-3.2.8.2.(6)(c)).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , openings for stairways, escalators and inclined moving walks need not conform to the requirements in Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.11. provided,  the opening for each stairway, escalator or walk does not exceed 10 m2,  the building is sprinklered throughout, and  the interconnected floor space contains only Group A, Division 1, 2 or 3, Group D or Group E occupancies.

National Sentence Text: An interconnected floor space need not conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.8., provided  it consists of the first storey and the storey next above or below it, but not both,  it is sprinklered throughout or, where the building area is not more than one half of the area permitted by Subsection 3.2.2., the openings through the floor are used only for stairways, escalators or moving walks (see Note A-3.2.8.2.(6)(b)), and  it contains only Group A, Division 1, 2 or 3, Group D, Group E, or Group F, Division 2 or 3 major occupancies (see Note A-3.2.8.2.(6)(c)).
P/T Sentence Text: An interconnected floor space need not conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.11. provided,  the interconnected floor space consists of the first storey and the storey next above or below it, but not both,  the interconnected floor space is sprinklered, and  the interconnected floor space contains only Group A, Division 1, 2 or 3, Group D, Group E, or Group F, Division 2 or 3 occupancies.

National Sentence Text: An exit opening into an interconnected floor space shall be protected at each opening into the interconnected floor space by a vestibule  with doorways that are not less than 1.8 m apart,  that is separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation that is not required to have a fire-resistance rating (see Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b)), and  that is designed to limit the passage of smoke so that the exit stair shaft does not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the fire floor, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in accordance with Subsection 1.1.3. (see Note A-3.2.8.4.(1)(c)).
P/T Sentence Text: A building that is more than 18 m in height, measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey, and that contains an interconnected floor space, shall be designed to limit the passage of smoke from a fire into exit stairshafts opening into an interconnected floor space so that during a 2 h period after the start of fire, such stairshafts will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the fire floor, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis.

National Sentence Text: A protected floor space used to satisfy the requirements of Clause 3.4.3.2.(6) shall  be separated from the interconnected floor space by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly of the storey in which it is located,  have all openings in the vertical fire separation between a protected floor space and the adjacent interconnected floor space protected by vestibules conforming to Sentence 3.2.8.4.(1), and  be designed so that it is not necessary to enter the interconnected floor space to reach an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a portion of a floor area is not within an interconnected floor space, required access to exit from such portion of a floor area shall not lead through an interconnected floor space.

National Sentence Text: If a fire alarm system is installed, smoke detectors shall be installed in  except as permitted in Sentence , each sleeping room and each corridor serving as part of a means of egress from sleeping rooms in portions of a building classified as a Group B major occupancy,  each room in a contained use area and corridors serving those rooms,  each corridor in portions of a building classified as a Group A, Division 1 major occupancy,  each public corridor in portions of a building classified as a Group C major occupancy,  each exit stair shaft other than those serving only a Group A, Division 4 major occupancy or an open storage garage,  the vicinity of draftstops required by Article 3.2.8.6., and  elevator machine rooms. (See Note A-3.2.4.11.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A building containing an interconnected floor space shall be provided with, a fire alarm system and electrically supervised annunciator conforming to Subsection 3.2.4., a system of smoke detectors located, on the ceiling of each storey in the vicinity of the openings through floor assemblies described in Article 3.2.8.3., except within dwelling units, heat detectors may be installed instead of smoke detectors, and as required for the activation of the smoke control system described in Sentences 3.2.8.9.(3), ,  and , and (See Appendix A.) facilities for transmitting a signal to the fire department in conformance with Article 3.2.4.8.

National Sentence Text: The mechanical exhaust system required by Sentence  shall be actuated by a switch located on the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5. near the annunciator for the fire alarm system.
P/T Sentence Text: Overriding manual controls for the smoke control system shall be provided for fire department use at an acceptable location in the vicinity of the fire alarm annunciator.

National Sentence Text: An emergency power supply capable of operating under a full load for not less than 2 h shall be provided by an emergency generator for  every elevator serving storeys above the first storey in a building that is more than 36 m high measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey and every elevator for firefighters in conformance with Sentence ,  water supply for firefighting in conformance with Article 3.2.5.7., if the supply is dependent on electrical power supplied to the building,  fans and other electrical equipment that are installed to maintain the air quality specified in Articles 3.2.6.2. and 3.3.3.6.,  fans required for venting by Article 3.2.6.6., and  fans required by Clause 3.2.8.4.(1) and Article 3.2.8.7. in buildings within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6. (See Note A-3.2.7.9.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: In a building that is more than 18 m in height, measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey, an emergency power supply capable of operating under a full load for at least 2 h shall be provided by an emergency generator or by a separate service not supplied by the same substation as the primary source for fans required for smoke control purposes in Articles 3.2.8.4., 3.2.8.5., 3.2.8.6. and 3.2.8.9.

National Sentence Text: Where fire protection and life safety systems and systems with fire protection and life safety functions are integrated with each other, they shall be tested as a whole in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S1001-11 Integrated Systems Testing of Fire Protection and Life Safety Systems, to verify that they have been properly integrated. (See Note A-3.2.9.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The systems for smoke control and venting described in Articles 3.2.8.4., 3.2.8.5., 3.2.8.6. and 3.2.8.9. shall be tested to ensure satisfactory operation.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.5.9. to 3.2.5.9.(6), Articles 3.2.5.10. and 3.2.5.11., and Sentence 3.2.4.9.(2), the design, construction, installation and testing of a standpipe system shall conform to NFPA 14-2013 Installation of Standpipe and Hose Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, if a standpipe system is required, the design, construction, installation and testing of the system shall be in conformance with NFPA 14, "Installation of Standpipe and Hose Systems".

National Sentence Text: The residual water pressure at the design flow rate at the topmost hose connection of a standpipe system that is required to be installed in a building is permitted to be less than 690 kPa provided  the building is sprinklered throughout, the water supply at the base of the sprinkler riser is capable of meeting, without a fire pump, the design flow rate and pressure demand of the sprinkler system, including the inside and outside hose allowance, and  fire protection equipment is available to deliver, by means of the fire department connection, the full demand flow rate at a residual water pressure of 690 kPa at the topmost hose connection of the standpipe system (see Note A-3.2.5.9.(5)(c)).
P/T Sentence Text: The residual water pressure at the design flow rate at the hydraulically most remote hose connection of a standpipe system that is required to be installed in a building is permitted to be less than 450 kPa provided that,  the building is sprinklered,  the water supply at the base of the sprinkler riser is capable of meeting the design flow rate and pressure demand of the sprinkler system, including the inside and outside hose allowance, and  fire protection equipment is available to deliver, by means of the fire department connection, the full demand flow rate at a residual water pressure of 450 kPa at the hydraulically most remote hose connection of the standpipe system. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where fire protection and life safety systems and systems with fire protection and life safety functions are integrated with each other, they shall be tested as a whole in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S1001-11 Integrated Systems Testing of Fire Protection and Life Safety Systems to verify that they have been properly integrated. (See Note A-3.2.9.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where fire protection and life safety systems, and systems with fire protection and life safety functions, are integrated with each other, the systems shall be tested as a whole in accordance with CAN/ULC-S1001, "Integrated Systems Testing of Fire Protection and Life Safety Systems", to verify that the systems have been properly integrated. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence  is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for  the floor assembly above the floor area, or  the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence  is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for,  the floor assembly above the floor area, or  the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: Occupancies that are served by public corridors conforming to Sentence 3.3.1.4.(4) in a building that is sprinklered throughout, are not required to be separated from one another by fire separations provided the occupancies are  suites of business and personal services occupancy,  fast food vending operations that do not provide seating for customers,  suites of mercantile occupancy, or  any combination of these occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: Occupancies that are served by public corridors conforming to Clause 3.3.1.4.(4) in a building that is sprinklered, are not required to be separated from one another by fire separations provided the occupancies are,  suites of business and personal services occupancy,  fast food vending operations that do not provide seating for customers,  suites of mercantile occupancy, or  any combination of these occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsections 3.3.5. and 3.3.6., the storage, handling and use of hazardous substances shall be in conformance with  provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or  in the absence of the regulations or bylaws referred to in Clause (a), the NFC. (See Note A-3.3.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 3.3.6., the storage, handling and use of the hazardous substances shall be in conformance with,  the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997, or  the CCBFC NRCC 56192, National Fire Code of Canada , in the absence of regulations referred to in Clause (a).

National Sentence Text: Systems for the ventilation of cooking equipment that is not within a dwelling unit and is used in processes producing grease-laden vapours shall be designed and installed in conformance with Articles 3.6.3.5., 6.3.1.7.and 6.9.1.3.(See Note A-3.3.1.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Systems for the ventilation of cooking equipment that is not within a dwelling unit and is used in processes producing grease-laden vapours shall be designed and installed in conformance with Articles 3.6.3.5 and 6.2.2.6.

National Sentence Text: Access to exit within floor areas shall conform to Subsections 3.3.2. to 3.3.5.,in addition to the requirements of this Subsection.
P/T Sentence Text: Access to exit within floor areas shall conform to Subsections 3.3.2. to 3.3.6., in addition to the requirements of this Subsection.

National Sentence Text: Two points of egress shall be provided for a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1. if  the area is more than 200 m2 , or  the travel distance measured from any point in the service space to a point of egress is more than 25 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Two points of egress shall be provided for a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1. if,  the area is more than 200 m2, or  the travel distance measured from any point in the service space to a point of egress is more than 25 m.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.4.4. and 3.3.4.4.(6), each suite in a floor area that contains more than one suite shall have  an exterior exit doorway, or  a doorway  into a public corridor, or  to an exterior passageway.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.3.4.4. and permitted by Sentences 3.3.4.4. and , each suite in a floor area that contains more than one suite shall have,  an exterior exit doorway, or  a doorway,  into a public corridor, or  to an exterior passageway.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by this Section and by Sentence 3.4.2.1.(2), at the point where a doorway referred to in Sentence  opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway, it shall be possible to go in opposite directions to each of 2 separate exits.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by this Section and by Sentence 3.4.2.1.(2), at the point where a doorway referred to in Sentence  opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway, it shall be possible to go in opposite directions to each of two separate exits.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise required by this Part or as permitted by Sentence , a public corridor shall be separated from the remainder of the storey by a fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise required by this Part or as permitted by Sentence , a public corridor shall be separated from the remainder of the storey by a fire separation. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence  and Clauses  and (b), the fire separation between a public corridor and the remainder of the storey shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence  and Clauses  and (b), the fire separation between a public corridor and the remainder of the storey shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: No fire separation is required in a sprinklered floor area between a public corridor and  except as required by Sentences 3.3.3.5. and 3.3.4.2.(1), and notwithstanding Sentence 3.4.2.4.(2), the remainder of a storey, provided the travel distance from any part of the floor area to an exit is not more than 45 m,  a room or a suite, provided the public corridor complies with Sentence 3.3.1.9. and Sentence 3.4.2.5.(1), or  a space containing plumbing fixtures required by Subsection 3.7.2., provided the space and the public corridor are separated from the remainder of the storey by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required between the public corridor and the remainder of the storey.
P/T Sentence Text: No fire separation is required in a sprinklered floor area between a public corridor and,  except as required by Sentences 3.3.3.5. and 3.3.4.2. and notwithstanding Sentences 3.4.2.4.(2), the remainder of a storey provided the travel distance from any part of the floor area to an exit is not more than 45 m.,  a room or suite provided the public corridor complies with Sentence 3.3.1.9. and Clause 3.4.2.5.(1)(d), or  a space containing plumbing fixtures required by Subsection 3.7.4. provided the space and the public corridor are separated from the remainder of the storey by a fire separation that has a fire-resistance rating not less than that required between the public corridor and the remainder of the storey.

National Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units, a minimum of 2 egress doorways located so that one doorway could provide egress from the room or suite as required by Article 3.3.1.3. if the other doorway becomes inaccessible to the occupants due to a fire which originates in the room or suite, shall be provided for every room and every suite  that is used for a high-hazard industrial occupancy and whose area is more than 15 m2 ,  intended for an occupant load more than 60,  in a floor area that is not sprinklered throughout, and  the area of a room or suite is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.-A, or  the travel distance within the room or suite to the nearest egress doorway is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.-A, or  in a floor area that is sprinklered throughout and does not contain a high-hazard industrial occupancy and  the travel distance to an egress doorway is more than 25 m, or  the area of the room or suite is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units, a minimum of two egress doorways located so that one doorway could provide egress from the room or suite as required by Article 3.3.1.3. if the other doorway becomes inaccessible to the occupants due to a fire that originates in the room or suite, shall be provided for every room and every suite,  whose area is more than 15 m2 and is used for,  a high hazard industrial occupancy, or  a hazardous room,  intended for an occupant load more than 60,  in a floor area that is not sprinklered if,  the area of a room or suite is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.A., or  the travel distance within the room or suite to the nearest egress doorway, is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.A.,  in a floor area that is sprinklered and does not contain a high hazard industrial occupancy if,  the travel distance to an egress doorway is more than 25 m, or  the area of the room or suite is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.B., or  where the area of the room is more than 100 m2 and it is a hazardous classroom in elementary or secondary school.

National Article Title: Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
National Sentence Text: Every floor area above or below the first storey that is not sprinklered throughout and that has a barrier-free path of travel shall  be served by an elevator  conforming to Sentences 3.2.6.5. to 3.2.6.5.(6),  protected against fire in conformance with Clauses 3.2.6.5.(3) or (c), and  in a building over 3 storeys in building height, protected against smoke movement so that the hoistway will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from a fire floor during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.3,  be divided into at least 2 zones by fire separations conforming to Sentences 3.3.1.7. , 3.3.1.7. and 3.1.8.5. so that (see Note A-3.3.1.7.(1)(b))  persons with physical disabilities can be accommodated in each zone, and  the travel distance from any point in one zone to a doorway leading to another zone shall be not more than the value for travel distance permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.5. for the occupancy classification of the zone,  in the case of residential occupancies, be provided with balconies conforming to Sentence 3.3.1.7.(4), except on the storey containing the barrier-free entrance required by Article 3.8.2.2.,  have an exterior exit at ground level, or  have a ramp leading to ground level.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.7. Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , every floor area above or below the first storey that has a barrier-free path of travel shall,  be served by an elevator,  conforming to Sentences 3.2.6.5. to ,  protected against fire in conformance with Clause 3.2.6.5.(3) or (c), and  in a building over 3 storeys in building height, protected against smoke movement so that the hoistway will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from a fire floor during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in conformance with MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-1, "Climatic and Seismic Data", or  be divided into at least two zones by fire separations conforming to Sentences  and  and 3.1.8.5. so that, (See Appendix A.)  persons with physical disabilities can be accommodated in each zone,  the travel distance from any point in one zone to a doorway leading to another zone shall be not more than the value for travel distance permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.5. for the occupancy classification of the zone, and  a barrier-free path of travel is provided to an exit.

National Article Title: Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
National Sentence Text: Every floor area above or below the first storey that is not sprinklered throughout and that has a barrier-free path of travel shall  be served by an elevator  conforming to Sentences 3.2.6.5. to ,  protected against fire in conformance with Clauses 3.2.6.5.(3) or (c), and  in a building over 3 storeys in building height, protected against smoke movement so that the hoistway will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from a fire floor during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.3., be divided into at least 2 zones by fire separations conforming to Sentences ,  and 3.1.8.5. so that (see Note A-3.3.1.7.(1)(b))  persons with physical disabilities can be accommodated in each zone, and  the travel distance from any point in one zone to a doorway leading to another zone shall be not more than the value for travel distance permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.5. for the occupancy classification of the zone,  in the case of residential occupancies, be provided with balconies conforming to Sentence , except on the storey containing the barrier-free entrance required by Article 3.8.2.2.,  have an exterior exit at ground level, or  have a ramp leading to ground level. (See Note A-3.3.1.7.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.7. Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path
P/T Sentence Text: In residential occupancies, the requirements of Sentence  are waived if a balcony conforming to Sentence  is provided for each suite, except for suites on the storey containing the barrier-free entrance described in Article 3.8.1.2.

National Article Title: Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
National Sentence Text: Every floor area above or below the first storey that is not sprinklered throughout and that has a barrier-free path of travel shall  be served by an elevator  conforming to Sentences 3.2.6.5. to ,  protected against fire in conformance with Clauses 3.2.6.5.(3) or (c), and  in a building over 3 storeys in building height, protected against smoke movement so that the hoistway will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from a fire floor during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.3., be divided into at least 2 zones by fire separations conforming to Sentences ,  and 3.1.8.5. so that (see Note A-3.3.1.7.(1)(b))  persons with physical disabilities can be accommodated in each zone, and  the travel distance from any point in one zone to a doorway leading to another zone shall be not more than the value for travel distance permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.5. for the occupancy classification of the zone,  in the case of residential occupancies, be provided with balconies conforming to Sentence , except on the storey containing the barrier-free entrance required by Article 3.8.2.2.,  have an exterior exit at ground level, or  have a ramp leading to ground level. (See Note A-3.3.1.7.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.7. Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentences  and  are waived when the building is sprinklered.

National Article Title: Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , the fire separations referred to in Clause  shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.7. Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , the fire separations referred to in Clause  shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Article Title: Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separations referred to in Clause  is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for  the floor assembly above the floor area, or  the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.7. Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separations referred to in Clause  is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for, the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.3.3.3.(3), the minimum unobstructed width of a corridor used by the public or a corridor serving classrooms or patients sleeping rooms shall be 1 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentences 3.3.3.3. and , the minimum unobstructed width shall be 1 100 mm for every,  corridor used by the public,  corridor serving classrooms, and  corridor in a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy where the corridor  serves a service room,  serves an administrative area,  will not be used by non-ambulatory outpatients, or  will not be used by non-ambulatory residents.

National Sentence Text: If a public corridor conforming to Clause 3.4.2.5.(1) contains an occupancy,  the occupancy shall be located so that for pedestrian travel there is an unobstructed width not less than 3 m at all times adjacent and parallel to all rooms and suites that front onto the public corridor, and  the combined area of all occupancies in the public corridor shall be not more than 15% of the area of the public corridor.
P/T Sentence Text: If a public corridor conforming to Clause 3.4.2.5.(1) contains an occupancy, the occupancy shall be located so that for pedestrian travel there is an unobstructed width not less than 3 m at all times adjacent and parallel to all rooms and suites that front onto the public corridor, and the combined area of all occupancies in the public corridor shall be not more than 15% of the area of the public corridor.

National Sentence Text: Except for a dead-end corridor that is entirely within a suite or as permitted by Sentences 3.3.3.3. and 3.3.4.4.(6), a dead-end corridor is permitted provided it is not more than 6 m long.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.3.3.(1), a dead end corridor shall conform to Sentences  to .

National Sentence Text: Except for a dead-end corridor that is entirely within a suite or as permitted by Sentences 3.3.3.3. and 3.3.4.4.(6), a dead-end corridor is permitted provided it is not more than 6 m long.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.4.11. and except for corridors served by a single exit as described in Sentence 3.3.4.4.(6), a dead end public corridor is permitted in a residential occupancy provided it is not more than 6 m long.

National Sentence Text: Except for a dead-end corridor that is entirely within a suite or as permitted by Sentences 3.3.3.3. and 3.3.4.4.(6), a dead-end corridor is permitted provided it is not more than 6 m long.
P/T Sentence Text: A dead end public corridor is permitted in a business and personal services occupancy where, the dead end corridor, serves an occupant load of not more than 30 persons, is not more than 9 m long, and is provided with doors having self-closing devices, or there is a second and separate egress doorway from each room or suite not leading into a dead end corridor.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.1.12. and 3.3.1.11. , a sliding door provided in the locations described in Article 3.3.1.11. shall be designed and installed to swing on the vertical axis in the direction of travel to the exit when pressure is applied, and be identified as a swinging door by means of a label or decal affixed to it.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  and 3.3.1.10.(5), a sliding door provided in the locations described in Article 3.3.1.10. shall, be designed and installed to swing on the vertical axis in the direction of travel to the exit when pressure is applied, and be identified as a swinging door by means of a label or decal affixed to it.

National Sentence Text: Movable partitions used to separate a public corridor from an adjacent business and personal services occupancy or a mercantile occupancy need not conform to Sentence 3.3.1.12. and Sentences 3.3.1.11. and 3.3.1.11.(2), provided the partitions are not located in the only means of egress. (See Note A-3.3.1.12.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Movable partitions used to separate a public corridor from an adjacent business and personal services occupancy or a mercantile occupancy need not conform to Sentence  and Sentences 3.3.1.10. and  provided the partitions are not located in the only means of egress. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Article 3.3.3.4., a door that opens into or is located within a public corridor or other facility that provides access to exit from a suite shall provide a clear opening of not less than 800 mm if there is only one door leaf, in a doorway with multiple leaves, have the active leaf providing a clear opening of not less than 800 mm, not open onto a step, and have a threshold not more than 13 mm higher than the surrounding finished floor surface, except where it is used to confine the spillage of flammable liquids within a service room or within a room in an industrial occupancy, or provides access to an exterior balcony, unless the balcony is required by Sentence 3.3.1.7.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Article 3.3.3.4. and Sentences 3.3.4.11.(11), 3.8.3.3. and , a door that opens into or is located within a public corridor or other facility that provides access to exit from a suite, shall provide a clear opening of not less than 800 mm, if there is only one door leaf, shall, in a doorway with multiple leaves, have the active leaf providing a clear opening of not less than 800 mm, shall not open onto a step, and shall not have a threshold more than 13 mm higher than the floor surface except where, the threshold is used to contain spillage, or the doorway provides access to an exterior balcony, other than a balcony required by Sentence 3.3.1.7.(2).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences and , a door in an access to exit shall be readily openable in travelling to an exit without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door-opening mechanism.
P/T Sentence Text: A door in an access to exit shall be readily openable in travelling to an exit without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door opening mechanism, except that this requirement does not apply to a door serving a contained use area, or an impeded egress zone, provided the locking devices conform to Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.13.(4), door release hardware shall comply with Sentence 3.8.3.8. and the door shall be openable with not more than one releasing operation. (See also Sentence 3.8.3.6.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , door release hardware shall be operable by one hand and the door shall be openable with not more than one releasing operation.

National Sentence Text: An egress door from an individual dwelling unit or from a suite of residential occupancy is permitted to be provided with additional devices that require a releasing operation additional to the main door release hardware, provided the devices are readily operable from the inside without the use of keys, special devices or specialized knowledge. (See Note A-3.3.1.13.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except in a retirement home, an egress door from an individual dwelling unit or from a suite of residential occupancy is permitted to be provided with additional devices that require a releasing operation additional to the main door release hardware, provided the devices are readily operable from the inside without the use of keys, special devices or specialized knowledge. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: An egress door in an access to exit serving a contained use area or an impeded egress zone is permitted to be equipped with locking devices, provided they can be released either locally or remotely in conformance with Sentence 3.3.1.13. or 3.3.1.13.(9). (See Note A-3.3.1.13.(6).)
P/T Sentence Text: A door in a means of egress serving a contained use area or an impeded egress zone is permitted to be equipped with locking devices that can be released either locally or remotely in conformance with Sentence  or . (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: A door in an access to exit is permitted to be equipped with an electromagnetic lock conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.16. or 3.4.6.16.(5).
P/T Sentence Text: A door in an access to exit is permitted to be equipped with an electromagnetic locking device conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.16.(4), except that this permission does not apply to a door,  in an elementary or secondary school,  a door leading from a Group F, Division 1 occupancy, or  except as provided in Sentence , requiring a latch release device by Article 3.3.2.6.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , Article 3.3.4.7. and Subsectin 3.3.2., ramps and stairways that do not serve as exits shall conform to the requirements for exit ramps and stairways stated in Sentence 3.4.3.2. and Articles 3.4.3.4., and 3.4.6.1. to 3.4.6.9.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , Article 3.3.4.7. and Subsection 3.3.2., ramps and stairways that do not serve as exits shall conform to the dimensional, guard, handrail and slip-resistance requirements for exit ramps and stairways of Sentence 3.4.3.2. and Articles 3.4.3.5. and 3.4.6.1. to 3.4.6.9.

National Sentence Text: An exterior passageway leading to a required exit shall conform to the requirements of part 3. for exterior exit passageways.
P/T Sentence Text: An exterior passageway leading to a required exit shall conform to the requirements of Section 3.4. for exterior exit passageways.

National Sentence Text: The capacity of stairs in an access to exit shall conform to the requirements for stairs in Sentences 3.4.3.2. to 3.4.3.2.(3).
P/T Sentence Text: The capacity of stairs in an access to exit shall conform to the requirements for stairs in Sentences 3.4.3.2. to .

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.1.18. and Article 3.3.2.9., a guard not less than 1 070 mm high shall be provided around any roof to which access is provided for purposes other than maintenance, at openings into smoke shafts referred to in part 3. that are less than 1 070 mm above the floor, and at each raised floor, mezzanine, balcony, gallery, interior or exterior vehicular ramp, and at other locations where (see Note A-9.8.8.1.) the difference in elevation is more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or the adjacent surface within 1.2 m of the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence  and Articles 3.3.2.8. and 3.3.4.7., a guard not less than 1 070 mm high shall be provided, around each roof to which access is provided for other than maintenance, at openings into smoke shafts referred to in Subsection 3.2.6. that are less than 1 070 mm above the floor, and at each raised floor, mezzanine, balcony, gallery, interior or exterior vehicular ramp, and at other locations where, the difference in level is more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or the adjacent surface within 1 200 mm of the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2 away from the walking surface.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and 3.3.2.9. and Articles 3.3.4.7. and 3.3.5.10., openings through guards shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is more than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence  and Sentence 3.3.2.8.(4), openings through any guard that is required by Sentence  shall be of a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings that exceed this limit do not represent a hazard.

National Sentence Text: Openings through guards other than those required by Sentence 3.3.1.18. that serve occupancies other than industrial occupancies shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is 100 mm, or permits the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is 200 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings through any guard that is not required by Sentence  and that serves a building of other than industrial occupancy, shall be of a size that,  will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm, or  will permit the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 200 mm unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings that exceed these limits do not represent a hazard.

National Sentence Text: The visibility of fully glazed transparent doors, sidelights and panels shall be enhanced through the inclusion of mullions, markings or other elements that  are visually contrasting,  are at least 50 mm high,  extend the full width of the door, sidelight or panel, and  are located between 1 350 mm and 1 500 mm above the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: (1.1) Fully glazed transparent doors, and fully glazed transparent sidelights and panels with widths greater than 300 mm, shall be marked in conformance with Sentence 3.8.3.3.(15).

National Sentence Text: Sliding glass partitions that separate a public corridor from an adjacent occupancy and that are open during normal working hours need not conform to Sentences 3.3.1.19. and 3.3.1.19.(4), provided the partitions are suitably marked in conformance with Sentence 3.3.1.19. to indicate their existence and position.
P/T Sentence Text: Sliding glass partitions that separate a public corridor from an adjacent occupancy and that are intended to be open during normal working hours need not conform to Sentences  and , provided the partitions are marked in conformance with Sentence 3.8.3.3.(15).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.1.20.(2), an exhaust ventilation system designed in conformance with the appropriate requirements of part 6. shall be provided in a building or part of a building in which dust, fumes, gases, vapour or other impurities or contaminants have the potential to create a fire or explosion hazard. (See also Article 4.2.4.13.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , an exhaust ventilation system designed in conformance with the appropriate requirements of Part 6 shall be provided in a building or part of a building in which dust, fumes, gases, vapour or other impurities or contaminants have the potential to create a fire or explosion hazard.

National Sentence Text: Where a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating is penetrated by a ventilation system required by Sentence 3.3.1.20. for power-ventilated enclosures in laboratories, the ducts shall be  continuously enclosed from the first penetrated fire separation to any subsequent fire separations or concealed spaces and all the way through to the outdoors so that the highest fire-resistance rating of all the penetrated fire separations is maintained, and  exempted from the requirement to be equipped with a fire damper, smoke damper and fire/smoke damper as stated in Article 3.1.8.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating is penetrated by a ventilation system required by Sentence  for power-ventilated enclosures in laboratories, the ducts shall be continuously enclosed from the first penetrated fire separation to any subsequent fire separations or concealed spaces and to the outdoors so that the highest fire-resistance rating of all the penetrated fire separations is maintained.

National Sentence Text: Where a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating is penetrated by a ventilation system required by Sentence 3.3.1.20. for power-ventilated enclosures in laboratories, the ducts shall be  continuously enclosed from the first penetrated fire separation to any subsequent fire separations or concealed spaces and all the way through to the outdoors so that the highest fire-resistance rating of all the penetrated fire separations is maintained, and  exempted from the requirement to be equipped with a fire damper, smoke damper and fire/smoke damper as stated in Article 3.1.8.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Ducts described in Sentence  need not be equipped with a fire damper, a smoke damper or a combination smoke and fire damper.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.1.21. and 3.3.1.21.(3), a room or space within a floor area for the storage of janitorial supplies shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  and , a room or space within a floor area for the storage of janitorial supplies shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.1. is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by part 3. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence  is permitted to be not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for, the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.1.22. and 3.3.1.22.(3), in a building of residential occupancy, a laundry room in a floor area that is not within a dwelling unit shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

P/T Sentence Text: Except for the requirements of Article 3.3.2.7. for bench-type seats and except as required or permitted by Sentence  and Articles 3.3.2.9. and 3.3.2.10., fixed seats in places of assembly shall be, attached or secured to the floor, platform or platform riser, provided with arms and back, and arranged in rows having an unobstructed passage not less than 400 mm wide measured horizontally between plumb lines from the backs of the seats in one row and the edges of the furthest forward projection of the seats in the next row in the unoccupied position.

National Sentence Text: For fixed seats with backs and with folding tablet arms, the value of 400 mm required by Sentence 3.3.2.4. shall be measured when the tablet arms are in the use position, but is permitted to be measured in the stored position provided there are not more than 7 seats between any seat and the nearest aisle, the seats are located in a lecture hall or an auditorium used for instructional purposes, and the tablet arm, when raised manually to a vertical position, falls by the force of gravity to the stored position.

P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentence  do not apply if, egress doorways are provided to serve both ends of rows of seats, each doorway referred to in Clause  serves not more than three rows of seats, and each row contains not more than 100 seats.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentences 3.3.2.9. to 3.3.2.9. for bleacher seats, guards shall be installed in outdoor and indoor places of assembly with fixed seats so that at the fascia of every box, balcony or gallery where the seats extend to the edge, the height of guards is not less than 760 mm in front of the seats, and 920 mm if located at the end of aisles or at the foot of steps, the height of guards along every cross aisle other than those adjacent to the fascia of every box, balcony or gallery is not less than 660 mm, except that guards need not be provided if the backs of the seats along the front side of the aisle are not less than 600 mm above the floor of the aisle, and where the seating is arranged in successive tiers and the height of rise between platforms is more than 450 mm, the height of guards is not less than 660 mm along the entire row of seats at the edge of the platform.

National Sentence Text: A contained use area shall conform to Sentences 3.3.3.7. to 3.3.3.7.(5).
P/T Sentence Text: A contained use area shall conform to Sentences  to .

National Sentence Text: A contained use area, in a building for which Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90. do not require the installation of an automatic sprinkler system, is not required to be sprinklered as required by Sentence 3.3.3.7. provided  the building is designed so that during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire in the contained use area other fire compartments will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the contained use area,  the building is designed so that during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire in another part of the building the contained use area will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the other part of the building,  all doors are designed to be remotely released in conformance with Sentence 3.3.1.13.(6), and  the contained use area does not contain any rooms lined with combustible padding.

P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence  is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for, the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: Floor assemblies within a dwelling unit need not be constructed as fire separations provided  the distance between the lowest floor level and the upper most floor level within the dwelling unit is not more than 6m, and  the dwelling unit is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than  1h if the building is not sprinklered throughout,  45min if the building is sprinklered throughout and it is not more than 3 storeys in building height, or  1h if the building is sprinklered throughout and it is more than 3 storeys in building height.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor assemblies within a dwelling unit need not be constructed as fire separations provided,  the distance between the lowest floor level and the uppermost floor level within the dwelling unit is not more than 6 m, and  the dwelling unit is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than,  45 min if the building is sprinklered and is not more than 3 storeys in building height,  1 h if the building is sprinklered and is more than 3 storeys in building height,  1 h if the building is not sprinklered and is not more than 6 storeys in building height, or  2 h if the building is not sprinklered and is more than 6 storeys in building height.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.5.6. is permitted to be waived if the fire separation is located between a dwelling unit and an attached storage garage containing not more than 5 vehicles, provided the dwelling unit and the attached storage garage are sprinklered, the dwelling unit and the attached storage garage are separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentences 3.3.4.2. , 3.3.4.2. and 3.3.4.2.(3), there are no air duct systems connecting the storage garage and the dwelling unit, the construction between the storage garage and the dwelling unit provides an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes, and every door between the storage garage and the dwelling unit is tight fitting and weather-stripped to provide an effective barrier against the passage of gas and exhaust fumes, fitted with a self-closing device, and not located in a room intended for sleeping.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.4.3. is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by part 3. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence  is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for, the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: Except for the storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids inside a single-family dwelling unit and garages or sheds attached to these dwelling units, where storage rooms are required by Part 4 of Division B of the NFC for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in residential occupancies ,such rooms shall not be located above or below the first storey.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where located within a dwelling unit, a room intended for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids required by the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997 shall not be located above or below the first storey of the building.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.4.4. and 3.3.4.4.(4), a dwelling unit containing more than one storey shall have an exit door or an egress door opening directly into a public access to exit from the uppermost storey and from the lowest storey of the dwelling unit so that each of these storeys is served by an exit or egress door located not more than 1.5 m above or below its floor level.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence  and as permitted by Sentences  and , a dwelling unit containing more than 1 storey shall have an exit door or an egress door opening directly into a public access to exit from the uppermost storey and from the lowest storey of the dwelling unit so that each storey is served by an exit or egress door located not more than 1.5 m above or below its floor level.

National Sentence Text: An egress door from either the uppermost storey or the lowest storey of a dwelling unit, as required by Sentence , need not be provided if that storey is served by a stairway that  leads to a public access to exit,  has no direct access to any other storey in the dwelling unit, and  is separated from the other storeys in the dwelling unit by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: An egress door from either the uppermost storey or the lowest storey in a dwelling unit, as required in Sentence , need not be provided,  except as required by Sentence , if that storey is served by a stairway that,  leads to a public access to exit,  has no direct access to any other storey in the dwelling unit, and  is separated from the other storeys in the dwelling unit by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min,  on the uppermost storey in the dwelling unit if the dwelling unit has not more than 2 storeys above the first storey of the building,  if it is not necessary to travel either more than 18 m or more than 1 storey up or down within the dwelling unit to reach the egress door, or  if that storey is,  provided with a balcony conforming to Sentence ,  not more than 2 storeys above or below the dwelling unit egress door, and  in a building that is not more than 6 storeys in building height.

National Sentence Text: Except for hotels and motels, a door opening onto a public corridor which provides access to exit from a suite shall be designed not to lock automatically. (See Note A-3.3.4.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for hotels, a door opening onto a public corridor that provides access to exit from a suite shall be designed not to lock automatically. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Occupants of dwelling units shall be protected from airborne noise in conformance with Section 5.8
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings containing dwelling units shall be constructed so that airborne noise is controlled in conformance with Section 5.8.

National Sentence Text: Windows need not be protected in accordance with Sentence 3.3.4.8. where the only opening having greater dimensions than those allowed by Sentence 3.3.4.8. is located higher than 1 070 mm above the finished floor, or the bottom edge of the openable portion of the window is located less than 1 800 mm above the floor or ground on the other side of the window.
P/T Sentence Text: Windows need not be protected in accordance with Sentence  where, the only opening having greater dimensions than those allowed by Clause  is located higher than 1 070 mm above the finished floor, or the bottom edge of the openable portion of the window is located less than 1 800 mm above the floor or ground on the other side of the window.
