National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 6.3.1.4. and 6.3.1.4.(6), an enclosed storage garage for five or more motor vehicles shall have a mechanical ventilation system designed to limit the concentration of carbon monoxide to not more than 100 parts per million parts of air, limit the concentration of nitrogen dioxide to not more than 3 parts per million parts of air, where the majority of the vehicles stored are powered by diesel-fuelled engines, or provide, during operating hours, a continuous supply of outdoor air at a rate of not less than 3.9 L/s for each square metre of floor area (see Article 3.3.1.20.).
P/T Article Title: 6.2.2.3. Ventilation of Storage and Repair Garages
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , an enclosed storage garage shall have a mechanical ventilation system designed to, limit the concentration of carbon monoxide to not more than 100 parts per million of air when measured between 900 mm and 1 800 mm from the floor, where the majority of the vehicles stored are powered by gasoline fuelled engines,  limit the concentration of nitrogen dioxide to not more than 3 parts per million parts of air when installed in accordance with manufacturer's instructions, where the majority of the vehicles stored are powered by diesel fuelled engines, or  provide, during operating hours, a continuous supply of outdoor air at a rate of not less than 3.9 L/s for each square metre of floor area. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: In storage garages subject to the requirements of Sentences 6.3.1.4. and 6.3.1.4.(2), where motor vehicles are parked by mechanical means, the ventilation requirements may be reduced by one half.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.2.3. Ventilation of Storage and Repair Garages
P/T Sentence Text: In storage garages subject to the requirements of Sentence , where motor vehicles are parked by mechanical means, the ventilation requirements may be reduced by one half.

National Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentences 6.3.1.4. to 6.3.1.4. shall not apply to open-air storeys in a storage garage.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.2.3. Ventilation of Storage and Repair Garages
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentences  to  shall not apply to open-air storeys in a storage garage.

National Sentence Text: Characteristics referred to in Sentence include but are not limited to  use of combustible materials in duct systems,  flame-spreadratings and smoke-developed ratings of duct and pipe materials and coverings, installation of equipment relative to property lines, and  requirements for fire dampers and fire stop flaps.

Except as provided in Article 3.6.3.5 ., systems for the ventilation of commercial cooking equipment shall be designed, constructed and installed to conform to NFPA 96 Ventilation Control and Fire Protection of Commercial Cooking Operations
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.6.3.5., all commercial cooking equipment shall be provided with ventilation systems designed, constructed and installed to conform to NFPA 96, "Ventilation Control and Fire Protection of Commercial Cooking Operations".

National Sentence Text: Fire protection systems for commercial cooking equipment referred to in Sentence 6.3.1.7. using vegetable oil or animal fat shall conform to UL ANSI/UL 300, Fire Testing of Fire Extinguishing Systems for Protection of Commercial Cooking Equipment or ULC ULC/ORD-C1254.6, Fire Testing of Restaurant Cooking Area Fire Extinguishing System Units
P/T Sentence Text: Fire protection systems for high efficiency, high temperature commercial cooking equipment using vegetable oil or animal fat shall conform to, ANSI/UL 300, "Fire Extinguishing Systems for Protection of Commercial Cooking Equipment", or  ULC/ORD-C1254.6, "Fire Testing of Restaurant Cooking Area Fire Extinguishing System Units".

National Sentence Text: Dehumidifying cooling coil assemblies and condensate-producing heat exchangers shall be equipped with drain pans beneath them that are designed in accordance with Section 5.11, Drain Pans, of ASHRAE ANSI/ASHRAE 62.1, Ventilation for Acceptable Indoor Air Quality provided with an outlet that is piped to the outside of the airstream in a location where condensate can be eliminated, and installed so that water drains freely from the pan.
P/T Sentence Text: Dehumidifying cooling coil assemblies and condensate-producing heat exchangers shall be equipped with drain pans beneath them that are, designed in accordance with Section 5.11, Drain Pans, of ANSI/ASHRAE 62.1, "Ventilation for Acceptable Indoor Air Quality",  provided with an outlet that is piped to the outside of the airstream in a location where condensate can be eliminated,  installed so that water drains freely from the pan, and  provided with a drain line that is indirectly connected to a drainage system in accordance with Article 7.4.2.1.

National Sentence Text: Ducts that are used in a location where they may be subjected to excessive moisture shall have no appreciable loss of strength when wet and shall be resistant to moisture induced corrosion.
P/T Sentence Text: Materials in Sentences  to  installed in a location where they may be subjected to excessive moisture shall have no appreciable loss of strength when wet and shall be corrosion-resistant.

National Sentence Text: Air duct systems shall have tight-fitting connections throughout.
Coverings,linings and associated adhesives and insulation used in air ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems shall comply with Article 3.6.5.4.
Except as permitted in Sentence 6.3.2.10.(6), exhaust systems shall discharge directly to the outdoors. (See Note A-6.3.2.10.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , exhaust systems shall discharge directly to the outdoors. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts connected to laundry-drying equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts, accessible for inspection and cleaning, and constructed of a smooth corrosion-resistant material.
P/T Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts connected to laundry drying equipment shall be, independent of other exhaust ducts,  designed and installed so that the entire duct can be cleaned, and  constructed of smooth corrosion-resistant material. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Two or more exhaust systems described in Sentences 6.3.2.10. and 6.3.2.10. may be interconnected or connected with exhaust ducts serving other areas of the building, provided the connections are made at the inlet of an exhaust fan, and all interconnected systems are equipped with suitable back pressure devices to prevent the passage of odours from one system to another when the fan is not in operation, or the exhaust ducts discharge to a shaft that is served by an exhaust fan having a capacity that is equal to or greater than the combined capacity of the exhaust fans discharging to the plenum multiplied by the operation diversity factor, provided that the exhaust fan serving the shaft operates continuously (see Note A-6.3.2.10.(12)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: Two or more exhaust systems described in Sentences  and  may be interconnected or connected with exhaust ducts serving other areas of the building provided, the connections are made at the inlet of an exhaust fan, and all interconnected systems are equipped with suitable back pressure devices to prevent passage of odours from one system to another when the fan is not in operation, or  the exhaust ducts discharge to a shaft that is served by an exhaust fan having a capacity that is equal to or greater than the combined capacity of the exhaust fans discharging to the plenum multiplied by the operation diversity factor, provided that the exhaust fan serving the shaft operates continuously. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where collective venting of multiple installations of laundry-drying equipment is used, the ventilation system shall be connected to a common exhaust duct that is vented by one central exhaust fan and incorporates one central lint trap, include an interlock to activate the central exhaust fan when laundry-drying equipment is in use, and be provided with make-up air.
P/T Sentence Text: Where collective venting of multiple installations of laundry-drying equipment is used, the ventilation system shall,  be connected to a common exhaust duct that is vented by one central exhaust fan,  incorporate one central lint trap,  include an interlock to activate the central exhaust fan when laundry-drying equipment is in use, and  be provided with make-up air. (See Appendix Note A-6.2.3.8.(7))

National Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts referred to in Sentence 6.3.2.10. are permitted to exhaust through an enclosed storage garage prior to exhausting to the outdoors, provided the storage garage's exhaust system runs continuously, the capacity of the storage garage's exhaust system is equal to or exceeds the volume of the exhaust entering the garage, and a leakage rate 1 smoke/fire damper rated in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S112.1 Leakage Rated Dampers for Use in Smoke Control Systems is provided near the duct outlet location in the storage garage to prevent air from the storage garage from entering the exhaust ductwork system in the event the building's exhaust fan is shut down.
P/T Sentence Text: Where exhaust ducts are provided in conformance with Sentence 6.2.3.8.(6), they may exhaust through an enclosed storage garage prior to exhausting to the outdoors provided,  the storage garage exhaust system runs continuously,  the capacity of the storage garage exhaust system is equal to or exceeds the volume of the exhaust entering the garage, and  a leakage rate 1 smoke/fire damper rated in accordance with CAN/ULC-S112.1, "Leakage Rated Dampers for Use in Smoke Control Systems", is provided near the duct outlet location in the storage garage to prevent air from the storage garage from entering the exhaust ductwork system in the event the building's exhaust fan is shut down.

National Sentence Text: Where outdoor air quality conditions do not meet the requirements of Sentence 6.2.1.2.(2), ventilation required by Sentence 6.3.1.1. shall be provided by a ventilation system designed to include devices that reduce particles and gases to the maximum acceptable levels described in Sentence 6.2.1.2.(2)prior to the introduction of outdoor air to indoor occupied spaces.

Where contaminants of concern are present in the outdoor air of the local area of the building site, ventilation required by Sentence 6.3.1.1.(1)shall be provided by a ventilation system designed to include devices that reduce the concentrations of contaminants to those permitted in the ACGIH s Industrial Ventilation: A Manual of Recommended Practice for Design prior to the introduction of outdoor air to indoor occupied spaces.

National Article Title: Evaporative Cooling Towers, Evaporative Fluid Coolers and Evaporative
National Sentence Text: Make-up water connections shall be equipped with backflow prevention devices that conform to Article2.6.2.1. of Division B of the NPC.

National Article Title: Evaporative Cooling Towers, Evaporative Fluid Coolers and Evaporative
National Sentence Text: Water treatment equipment for biological growth control shall be provided in accordance with Sub-Section 7.6.2. of ASHRAE Guideline 12, Minimizing the Risk of Legionellosis Associated with Building Water Systems.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.14. Evaporative Cooling Towers, Evaporative Fluid Coolers
P/T Sentence Text: Evaporative cooling towers, evaporative fluid coolers and evaporative condensers shall be provided with water treatment equipment for biological growth control in accordance with Subsection 7.6.2. of ASHRAE Guideline 12, "Minimizing the Risk of Legionellosis Associated with Building Water Systems".

National Article Title: Evaporative Cooling Towers, Evaporative Fluid Coolers and Evaporative
National Sentence Text: Drains, overflows and blow-downs shall be connected to the building s drainage system in accordance with Clause 2.4.2.1.(1) of Division B of the NPC.

Evaporative air coolers, misters, atomizers, air washers and humidifiers shall be designed in accordance with Sections 8 and 9 of ASHRAE Guideline 12, Minimizing the Risk of Legionellosis Associated with Building Water Systems
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.14A. Evaporative Cooling Sections, Evaporative Air Coolers,
P/T Sentence Text: Evaporative air coolers, misters, atomizers, air washers and humidifiers shall be designed in accordance with Sections 8 and 9 of ASHRAE Guideline 12, "Minimizing the Risk of Legionellosis Associated with Building Water Systems".

National Sentence Text: Linings of ducts shall be installed so that they will not interfere with the operation of volume or balancing dampers or of fire dampers, fire stop stop flaps and other closures.
P/T Sentence Text: Linings of ducts shall be installed so that they will not interfere with the operation of volume or balancing dampers.
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

National Sentence Text: The design, construction, installation and alteration of every indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82 Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: The design, construction, installation and material alteration of every indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82, "Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment".

National Sentence Text: Piping shall be made from materials designed to withstand the effects of temperatures and pressures that may occur in the system. (See Articles 3.1.5.19., 3.1.9.1., 9.10.9.6. and 9.10.9.7. for fire safety requirements.)
P/T Sentence Text: Piping shall be made from materials designed to withstand the effects of temperatures and pressures that may occur in the system.
Variation Label: Piping for Heating and Cooling Systems

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , where combustible insulation is used on piping in a horizontal service space or a vertical service space, the insulation and coverings on that piping shall have a flame-spread rating, on any exposed surface and on any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, not more than 25 in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, or not more than 75 in a building permitted to be of combustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , where combustible insulation is used on piping in a horizontal or vertical service space, the insulation and coverings on such pipes shall have a flame-spread rating throughout the material of not more than 25 in buildings of noncombustible construction and not more than 75 in buildings of combustible construction.
Variation Label: Piping for Heating and Cooling Systems

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , insulation and coverings on piping located in rooms and spaces other than the service spaces described in Sentence  shall have a flame-spread rating not more than that required for the interior finish of the ceiling of the room or space.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , insulation and coverings on piping located in rooms and spaces other than the service spaces described in Sentence  shall have a flame-spread rating of not more than that required for the interior finish for the ceiling of the room or space.
Variation Label: Piping for Heating and Cooling Systems

National Sentence Text: Exposed piping or equipment subject to human contact shall be insulated so that the temperature of the exposed surface does not exceed 70° C. (See Note A-6.5.1.1.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Exposed piping or equipment subject to human contact shall be insulated so that the temperature of the exposed surface does not exceed 70° C. (See Appendix A.)
Variation Label: Piping for Heating and Cooling Systems

National Sentence Text: Where a pipe carrying steam or hot water at a temperature above l20°C passes through a combustible floor, ceiling or wall, the construction shall be protected by a sleeve of metal or other noncombustible material not less than 50 mm larger in diameter than the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a pipe carrying steam or hot water at a temperature above 120°C passes through a combustible floor, ceiling or wall, the construction shall be protected by a sleeve of metal or other noncombustible material not less than 50 mm larger in diameter than the pipe.
Variation Label: Piping for Heating and Cooling Systems

National Sentence Text: Where a cooling unit is combined with a fuel-fired fumace in the same duct system, the cooling unit shall be installed in parallel with the heating furnace, upstream of the fumnce, provided the fumace is designed for such application, or downstream of the furnace, provided the cooling unit is designed to prevent excessive temperature or pressure in the refrigeration system.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a cooling unit is combined with a fuel-fired furnace in the same duct system, the cooling unit shall be installed,  in parallel with the heating furnace,  upstream of the furnace, provided the furnace is designed for such application, or  downstream of the furnace, provided the cooling unit is designed to prevent excessive temperature or pressure in the refrigeration system.
Variation Label: Refrigerating Systems and Equipment for Air-Conditioning

National Sentence Text: Carbon monoxide  alarms required by this Article shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-6.19, Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices be equipped with an integral alarm that satisfies the audibility requirements of CSA CAN/CSA-6.19, Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices have no disconnect switch between the overcurrent device and the CO alarm, where the CO alarm is powered by the electrical system serving the suite (see Note A-6.9.3.1.(2)(c)), and be mechanically fixed at a height above the floor as recommended by the manufacturer.
P/T Sentence Text: The carbon monoxide alarms required by Article 6.2.12.2. shall, except as permitted in Sentence , be permanently connected to an electrical circuit and shall have no disconnect switch between the overcurrent device and the carbon monoxide alarm,  be wired so that its activation will activate all carbon monoxide alarms within the suite, where located within a suite of residential occupancy,  be equipped with an alarm that is audible within bedrooms when the intervening doors are closed, where located in a suite of residential occupancy, and  conform to,  CAN/CSA-6.19, "Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices", or  UL 2034, "Single and Multiple Station Carbon Monoxide Alarms".

National Sentence Text: The power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.4.2. of Division B of the NFC and its exhaust duct system shall except as provided in Sentences 6.3.4.4. and 6.3.4.4.(3), be constructed of noncombustible materials compatible with and chemically resistant to the dangerous goods vapours and particles being exhausted, and be provided with access doors to permit inspection and maintenance of the fan assembly and exhaust ducts.
P/T Sentence Text: The power-ventilated enclosure referred to in Article 6.2.13.3. and its exhaust duct system shall, except as provided in Sentences  and , be constructed of noncombustible materials compatible with and chemically resistant to the flammable vapours and particles being exhausted, and  be provided with access doors to permit inspection and maintenance of the fan assembly and exhaust ducts.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 6.3.3.2. and 6.3.3.3., the products of combustion from oil-, gas- and solid-fuel-burning appliances shall be vented in conformance with the requirements in the applicable appliance installation standard listed in Article 6.2.1.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 6.3.1.2. and 6.3.1.3., the products of combustion from solid fuel-burning appliances shall be vented in conformance with the requirements in the applicable appliance installation standards listed in Article 6.2.1.4.

National Sentence Text: Rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys not more than 12 m in height shall conform to part 9. if they serve appliances with a combined total rated heat output of 120 kW or less, or fireplaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys not more than 12 m in height shall conform to Part 9 if they serve, appliances with a combined total rated heat output of 120 kW or less, or  fireplaces.

P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence  and Articles 9.3.1.6. and 9.3.1.7., unreinforced and nominally reinforced concrete shall be designed, mixed, placed, cured and tested in accordance with the requirements for "R" class concrete stated in 9 of CSA A23.1, "Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction".

National Sentence Text: For flat insulating concrete form walls not exceeding 2 storeys in building height and having a maximum floor to floor height of 3 m, in buildings of light-frame construction containing only a single dwelling unit, the concrete and reinforcing shall comply with Part 4 or the concrete shall conform to CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction with a maximum aggregate size of 19 mm, and the reinforcing shall conform to CSA G30.18-09 Carbon Steel Bars for Concrete Reinforcement have a minimum specified yield strength of 400 MPa, and be lapped a minimum of 450 mm for 10M bars and 650 mm for 15M bars (see also Articles 9.15.4.5. and 9.20.17.2. to 9.20.17.4.).

National Sentence Text: Mirrored glass doors are only permitted to be used at the entrance to clothes closets and shall conform to the requirements of CAN/CGSB-82.6-M, Doors, Mirrored Glass, Sliding or Folding, Wardrobe. (See Note A-9.6.1.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Mirrored glass doors are permitted to be used only at the entrance to clothes closets and shall conform to the requirements of CAN/CGSB-82.6-M, "Doors, Mirrored Glass, Sliding or Folding, Wardrobe". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where the building has an essentially uniform distribution of paths for air leakage, including operable openings, but no large openings that would permit wind gusts to rapidly enter the building and the building is not in an exceptionally exposed location such as a hilltop, the maximum area of individual panes of glass for windows shall conform to Tables 9.6.1.3.-A to 9.6.1.3.-C, where the building has a height from grade to the uppermost roof of 12 m or less, and is located in a built-up area, no less than 120 m away from the boundary between this area and open terrain, or Tables 9.6.1.3.-D to 9.6.1.3.-F. (See Note A-9.6.1.3.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the building has an essentially uniform distribution of paths for air leakage, including operable openings, but no large openings that would permit wind gusts to rapidly enter the building and the building is not in an exceptionally exposed location such as a hilltop, the maximum area of individual panes of glass for windows is permitted to conform to, Tables 9.6.1.3.A. to 9.6.1.3.C., where the building has a height from grade to the uppermost roof of 12 m or less and is located in a built-up area, no less than 120 m away from the boundary between this area and open terrain, or  Tables 9.6.1.3.D. to 9.6.1.3.F. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
National Sentence Text: Sliding glass partitions that separate a public corridor from an adjacent occupancy and that are open during normal working hours need not conform to Sentences 9.6.1.4. , 9.6.1.4. and 9.6.1.4.(5), except that such partitions shall be suitably marked to indicate their existence and position.
P/T Article Title: 9.6.1.4. Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Sliding glass partitions that separate a public corridor from an adjacent occupancy and that are open during normal working hours need not conform to Sentences ,  and , except that such partitions shall be suitably marked to indicate their existence and position.

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows and doors installed to provide the required means of egress from bedrooms shall conform to part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.2.2. Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Windows and doors installed to provide the required means of egress from bedrooms shall conform to Subsection 9.9.10.

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: The location and protection of windows, doors and skylights in order to control the spread of fire shall conform to part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.2.2. Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: The location and protection of windows, doors and skylights in order to control the spread of fire shall conform to Subsection 9.10.12.

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows and doors installed to provide the required access to a building for firefighting purposes shall conform to part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.2.2. Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Windows and doors installed to provide the required access to a building for firefighting purposes shall conform to Subsection 9.10.20.

National Article Title: Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights with or without storm doors or sash that are installed in portions of buildings where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation shall be designed in conformance with part 5. (See Note A-9.25.5.2.)
P/T Article Title: 9.7.3.3. Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights, with or without storm doors or sash, that are installed in portions of buildings where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation shall be designed in conformance with Subsection 5.3.

National Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the performance grades selected in Sentence  when tested in accordance with the Harmonized Standard referenced in Clause 9.7.4.2.(1)(a).
P/T Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the performance grades selected under Sentence  when tested in accordance with AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, "NAFS - North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights".

National Sentence Text: Materials, design, construction and installation of windows, doors and skylights that separate conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior but that are not covered in the scope of AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, NAFS North American Fenestration Standard/Specification forWindows, Doors, and Skylights, shall conform to the remainder of this Subsection or Subsection 9.7.4., and the applicable requirements in Subsection 9.7.6., or to Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Materials, design, construction and installation of windows, doors and skylights that separate conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior but that are not within the scope of AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, "NAFS - North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights" shall, conform to,  this Subsection or Subsection 9.7.4., and  the applicable requirements in Subsection 9.7.6., or  conform to Part 5.

National Sentence Text: Glass for site-built windows, doors, sidelights for doors, and skylights shall comply with part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Glass for site-built windows, doors, sidelights for doors, and skylights shall comply with Section 9.6.

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
National Sentence Text: Doors, frames and hardware that conform to a security level of at least Grade 10 as described in the Annex to ASTM F 476, Security of Swinging Door Assemblies, are not required to conform to Sentences  to . (See Note A-9.7.5.2.(2).)
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.2. Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Doors, frames and hardware that conform to a security level of at least Grade 10 as described in the Annex to ASTMÃ F476, "Security of Swinging Door Assemblies", are not required to conform to Sentences  to . (SeeÃ AppendixÃ A.)

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(2), doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2. shall be provided with a deadbolt lock with a cylinder having no fewer than 5 pins, and a bolt throw not less than 25 mm long, protected with a solid or hardened free-turning ring or beveled cylinder housing.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.2. Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , doors described in Sentence  shall be provided with, a deadbolt lock with a cylinder having no fewer than five pins, and  a bolt throw not less than 25 mm long, protected with a solid or hardened free-turning ring or bevelled cylinder housing.

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(2), hinges for doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2. shall be fastened to wood doors with wood screws not less than 25 mm long and to wood frames with wood screws so that at least 2 screws per hinge penetrate not less than 30 mm into solid wood, or to metal doors and metal frames with machine screws not smaller than No. 10 and not less than 10 mm long.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.2. Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , hinges for doors described in Sentence  shall be fastened,  to wood doors with wood screws not less than 25 mm long and to wood frames with wood screws such that at least two screws per hinge penetrate not less than 30 mm into solid wood, or  to metal doors and metal frames with machine screws not smaller than No. 10 and not less than 10 mm long. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Windows
National Sentence Text: In dwelling units, windows, any part of which is located within 2 m of adjacent ground level, shall conform to the requirements for resistance to forced entry as described in Clause 5.3.5 of CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS â North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights (See Note A-9.7.5.3.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.3. Resistance to Forced Entry for Windows
P/T Sentence Text: In dwelling units, windows, any part of which is located within 2 m of adjacent ground level, shall conform to the requirements for resistance to forced entry as described in Clause 5.3.5 of AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, "NAFSÃ - North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Sealants shall be applied between window frames or trim and the exterior cladding or masonry in conformance with part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Sealants shall be applied between window frames or trim and the exterior cladding or masonry in conformance with Subsection 9.27.4.

National Sentence Text: Stairs within dwelling units and houses with a secondary suite, including their common spaces, shall consist of straight flights, except as provided in Sentence , curved flights, except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.7.(2), spiral stairs, except as provided in Sentence , flights with rectangular treads and winders, or flights with a mix of rectangular and tapered treads.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.3.1. Straight and Curved Runs in Stairs (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Stairs within houses and individual dwelling units may consist of, flights with rectangular treads and winders provided winders as described in Article 9.8.4.5. are installed between floor levels, or  flights with a mix of rectangular and tapered treads provided all tapered treads within a flight turn in the same direction.
Variation Label: Straight and Curved Runs in Stairs

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.7. and except for stairs serving areas only used as service rooms or service spaces, the rise, which is measured as the vertical nosing-to-nosing distance, shall comply with Table 9.8.4.1.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.4.1. Dimensions for Risers (See A-9.8.4. in Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.5A., the rise, which is measured as the vertical nosing-to-nosing distance, shall conform to Table 9.8.4.1.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.3. and Articles 9.8.4.6. and 9.8.4.7., tapered treads shall have a run that is not less than 150 mm at the narrow end of the tread, and complies with the dimensions stated in Table 9.8.4.2. when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrail at the narrow end of the tread.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.4.3. Dimensions for Tapered Treads (See A-9.8.4. in Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence  and Articles 9.8.4.5. and 9.8.4.5A., tapered treads shall have a run that, is not less than 150 mm at the narrow end of the tread, and  complies with the dimensions for rectangular treads specified in Table 9.8.4.1. when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail.

National Sentence Text: Spiral stairs shall not serve as an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , spiral stairs shall not serve as an exit.

National Sentence Text: Ramps in a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.8.3.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Ramps in a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.8.3.4.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.6.3. to 9.8.6.3.(7), landings shall be at least as wide and as long as the width of the stair or ramp in which they occur.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.6.3. Dimensions of Landings (See A-3.4.6.4. in Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to , landings shall be, at least as wide as the width of the stair or ramp in which they occur, and  at least as long as the width of the stair or ramp in which they occur.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , the clear height over landings shall be not less than 2 050 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The clear height over landings shall be not less than,  1 950 mm for landings serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, and (b)	2 050 mm for landings not serving a house or an individual dwelling unit

National Sentence Text: Except for stairs with winders, where a flight of stairs within a dwelling unit consists of tapered treads, or a mix of tapered treads and rectangular treads, one handrail shall be installed along the narrow end of the treads.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for stairs with winders, where a flight of stairs within a house or an individual dwelling unit consists of tapered treads, or a mix of tapered treads and rectangular treads, one handrail shall be installed along the narrow end of the treads.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , required handrails shall be continuously graspable throughout the length of ramps, and flights of stairs, from the bottom riser to the top riser.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for stairs or ramps serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, at least one required handrail shall be continuous throughout the length of the stair or ramp, including at the landings, except where interrupted by doorways.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.7.4. and Sentence 3.8.3.5. , required handrails shall be 865 mm to 1 070 mm high.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , Clause 3.8.3.4.(1) and Sentence 9.8.4.5A.(1), handrails shall be 865 mm to 1Ã 070 mm high.

National Sentence Text: Handrails and their supports shall be designed and constructed to withstand the following loads, which need not be considered to act simultaneously: a concentrated load of not less than 0.9 kN applied at any point and in any direction for all handrails, and for handrails other than those serving a single dwelling unit, a uniform load of not less than 0.7 kN/m .
P/T Article Title: 9.8.7.7. Design and Attachment of Handrails (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails and their supports shall be designed and constructed to withstand the following loads, which need not be considered to act simultaneously: a concentrated load of not less than 0.9 kN applied at any point and in any direction for all handrails, and  for handrails other than those serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, a uniform load of not less than 0.7Ã kN/m.

National Sentence Text: Where exterior or interior handrails serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces are attached to wood studs or blocking, the attachment shall be deemed to comply with Sentence 9.8.7.7.(1), where the attachment points are spaced not more than 1.2 m apart measured on the horizontal plane, the first attachment point at either end is located no more than 300 mm from the end of the handrail, and the fasteners consist of not less than 2 No. 8 wood screws at each point, penetrating not less than 32 mm into solid wood.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.7.7. Design and Attachment of Handrails (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Where exterior or interior handrails serving a house or an individual dwelling unit are attached to wood studs or blocking, the attachment shall be deemed to comply with Sentence , where, the attachment points are spaced not more than 1.2 m apart measured on the horizontal plane,  the first attachment point at either end is located not more than 300 mm from the end of the handrail, and  the fasteners consist of no fewer than two No. 8 wood screws at each point, penetrating not less than 32 mm into solid wood.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.8.1.(5), openable windows in buildings of residential occupancy shall be protected by a guard, or a mechanism capable of controlling the free swinging or sliding of the openable part of the window so as to limit any clear unobstructed opening to not more than 100 mm measured either vertically or horizontally where the other dimension is greater than 380 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , openable windows in buildings of residential occupancy shall be protected by, a guard in accordance with this Subsection, or  a mechanism capable of controlling the free swinging or sliding of the openable part of the window so as to limit any clear unobstructed opening to a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Windows need not be protected in accordance with Sentence 9.8.8.1.(4), where the window serves a dwelling unit that is not located above another suite, the window serves a house with a secondary suite, the only opening greater than 100 mm by 380 mm is a horizontal opening at the top of the window, the window sill is located more than 450 mm above the finished floor on one side of the window, or the window is located in a room or space with the finished floor described in Sentence 9.8.8.1. located less than 1 800 mm above the floor or ground on the other side of the window.
P/T Sentence Text: Windows need not be protected in accordance with Sentence , where, the window serves a dwelling unit that is not located above another suite,  the only opening having greater dimensions than those allowed by Clause  is a horizontal opening at the top of the window,  the top surface of the window sill is located more than 480 mm above the finished floor on one side of the window, or  the window is located in a room or space with the finished floor described in Clause  located less than 1 800 mm above the floor or ground on the other side of the window.

National Sentence Text: Glazing installed in public areas that extends to less than 1 m from the floor and is located above the second storey in buildings of residential occupancy shall be protected by guards in accordance with this Subsection, or non-openable and designed to withstand the specified lateral loads for balcony guards as provided in Article 4.1.5.14.
P/T Sentence Text: Glazing installed in public areas that extends to less than 1 000 mm from the floor and is located above the second storey in buildings of residential occupancy shall be, protected by guards in accordance with this Subsection, or  non-openable and designed to withstand the specified lateral loads for guards as provided in Article 4.1.5.14. 9.8.8.2.Ã Ã Loads on Guards (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: For guards within dwelling units and within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces and for exterior guards serving not more than 2 dwelling units , Table 9.8.8.2. need not apply where the guard construction used has been demonstrated to provide effective performance.
P/T Sentence Text: For guards within dwelling units and for exterior guards serving not more than 2 dwelling units, Table 9.8.8.2. need not apply where the guard construction has been demonstrated to provide effective performance.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.8.3. to 9.8.8.3.(4), all guards shall be not less than 1 070 mm high.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences , ,  and , all guards shall be not less than 1 070 mm high.

National Article Title: Guards for Floors and Ramps in Garages
National Sentence Text: Except for floors of garages referred to in part 9., where garage floors or ramps are 600 mm or more above the adjacent ground or floor level, every opening through a garage floor and the perimeter of floors and ramps that have no exterior walls shall be provided with a continuous curb not less than 140 mm in height, and a guard not less than 1 070 mm above the floor level.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.8.4. Guards for Floors and Ramps in Garages
P/T Sentence Text: Except for floors of garages referred to in Section 9.35., where garage floors or ramps are 600 mm or more above the adjacent ground or floor level, every opening through a garage floor and the perimeter of floors and ramps that have no exterior walls shall be provided with, a continuous curb not less than 140 mm in height, and  a guard not less than 1 070 mm above the floor level.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.8.8.5. and 9.8.8.5.(3), openings through guards shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 100 mm. (See Note A-9.8.8.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences  and , openings through guards shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 100 mm. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except where they serve storage garages, guards in industrial occupancies are permitted to consist of a top railing, and one or more horizontal intermediate rails spaced such that the size of the openings through the guard prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 535 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where they serve storage garages, guards in industrial occupancies are permitted to consist of, a top railing, and  one or more horizontal intermediate rails spaced such that the size of the openings through the guard prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 535 mm. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Openings through any guard that is not required by Article 9.8.8.1. and that serves an occupancy other than an industrial occupancy shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 100 mm, or permits the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 200 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings through any guard that is not required by Article 9.8.8.1. and that serves an occupancy other than industrial occupancy, shall be of a size that, prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 100 mm, or  permits the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 200 mm. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as specified in Articles 9.8.9.4. and 9.8.9.5., stairs and ramps shall be designed for strength and rigidity under uniform loading criteria to support specified loads of 1.9 kPa for stairs and ramps serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, and 4.8 kPa for other stairs and ramps.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Articles 9.8.9.4. and 9.8.9.5., stairs and ramps shall be designed for strength and rigidity under uniform loading criteria to support specified loads of, 1.9 kPa for stairs and ramps serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, and  4.8 kPa for other stairs and ramps.

National Sentence Text: Stairs described in Sentence 9.8.9.2.(1), when cantilevered from the foundation wall, shall be constructed and installed in conformance with part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Stairs described in Sentence , when cantilevered from the foundation wall, shall be constructed and installed in conformance with Subsection 9.8.10.

National Sentence Text: Stairways, handrails and guards in a means of egress shall conform to the requirements in part 9. as well as to the requirements in this Section.
P/T Sentence Text: Stairways, handrails and guards in a means of egress shall conform to the requirements in 9.8. as well as to the requirements in this Section.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.9.4.4. and 9.9.4.6., this Subsection applies to the fire protection of all exits except exits serving not more than one dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.9.4.4. and 9.9.4.6., this Subsection applies to the fire protection of all exits except exits serving an individual dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: The requirements in Sentences  and  do not apply to an exterior exit passageway provided the passageway has not less than 50% of its exterior sides open to the outdoors and is served by an exit stair at each end of the passageway.
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements in Sentence  do not apply to an exterior exit passageway provided the passageway has at least 50Ã percent of its exterior sides open to the outdoors and is served by an exit stair at each end of the passageway.

National Sentence Text: Either openings in exterior walls of an exit or openings in adjacent exterior walls of the building the exit serves shall be protected with wired glass in fixed steel frames or glass block installed in accordance with Articles 9.10.13.5. and 9.10.13.7., where the exit enclosure has exterior walls that intersect the exterior walls of the building at an angle of less than 135° measured on the outside of the building, and the openings in the exterior walls of the building are within 3 m horizontally and less than 2 m above the openings in the exterior walls of the exit. (See Note A-9.9.4.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the combined area of glazing in doors and sidelights shall not exceed 0.8 mÃÂ².

National Sentence Text: Where an exit enclosure connects with a floor area through an enclosed vestibule or corridor separated from the floor area by fire separations having not less than a 45 min fire-resistance rating, the glazed areas described in Sentence 9.9.4.3. need not be limited as required in Sentence 9.9.4.3.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exit enclosure connects with a floor area through an enclosed vestibule or corridor separated from the floor area by fire separations having not less than a 45 min fire-resistance rating, the glazed areas described in Sentence  need not be limited as required in Sentence .

National Article Title: Openings in Exterior Walls of Exits
National Sentence Text: Either openings in exterior walls of an exit or openings in adjacent exterior walls of the building the exit serves shall be protected with wired glass in fixed steel frames or glass block installed in accordance with Articles 9.10.13.5. and 9.10.13.7., where the exit enclosure has exterior walls that intersect the exterior walls of the building at an angle of less than 135° measured on the outside of the building, and the openings in the exterior walls of the building are within 3 m horizontally and less than 2 m above the openings in the exterior walls of the exit. (See Note A-9.9.4.5.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.9.4.5. Openings in Exterior Walls of Exits
P/T Sentence Text: Either openings in the exterior walls of an exit or openings in adjacent exterior walls of the building the exit serves shall be protected with wired glass in fixed steel frames or glass block installed in accordance with Articles 9.10.13.5. and 9.10.13.7., where, the exit enclosure has exterior walls that intersect the exterior walls of the building at an angle of less than 135ÃÂ° measured on the outside of the building, and  the openings in the exterior walls of the building are within 3 m horizontally and less than 2 m above the openings in the exterior walls of the exit. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Stairways in 2 Storey, Group D or E Buildings
National Sentence Text: Where a suite of Group D or E occupancy is located partly on the first storey and partly on the second storey, stairways serving the second storey of that suite need not be constructed as exit stairs provided, the building is not greater than 2 storeys in building height, the suite is separated from other occupancies by at least a 45 min fire separation, the area occupied by the suite is not greater than 100 m2 per storey, the maximum travel distance from any point in the suite to an exterior exit is not greater than 25 m, the floor assemblies have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min or are of noncombustible construction, and the basement and first storey are separated by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min
P/T Article Title: 9.9.4.7. Stairways in Group D or E Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Notwithstanding the requirements of Sentences 9.9.4.2.(1), 9.9.8.2. and Article 9.10.9.5., where a suite of Group D or E occupancy is located partly on the first storey and partly on the second storey or partly on the second storey and partly on the third storey, stairways serving that suite need not be constructed as exit stairs, provided, the building is not greater than three storeys in building height,  the suite is separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45Ã min,  the area occupied by the suite is not greater than 100 mÃÂ² per storey, other than the exit level storey,  the maximum travel distance from any point in the suite to an exterior exit is not greater than 25 m,  the floor assemblies have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min or are of noncombustible construction,  the basement and first storey are separated by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45Ã min, and  a smoke alarm is installed on each floor of the suite, including the basement, in accordance with Subsection 9.10.19.
Variation Label: Stairways in 2  Group D or E Buildings

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , obstructions located within 1 980 mm of the floor shall not project horizontally more than 100 mm into exit passageways, corridors used by the public or public corridors in a manner that would create a hazard for visually impaired persons travelling adjacent to walls.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , obstructions located within 1 980 mm of the floor shall not project horizontally more than 100 mm into exit passageways, corridors used by the public or public corridors in a manner that would create a hazard for persons with no or low vision travelling adjacent to walls.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in part 9. and Article 9.8.7.6., no fixture, turnstile or construction shall project within the required width of an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Subsection 9.9.6. and Article 9.8.7.6., no fixture, turnstile or construction shall project within the required width of an exit.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , obstructions created by doors shall be limited in accordance with Sentences  and  at exit doors, at doors that open into or are located within a public corridor, and at doors that open into or are located within another facility that provides access to exit from a suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , swinging doors in their swing shall conform to Sentences  and , at exit doors,  at doors that open into or are located within a public corridor, and  at doors that open into or are located within another facility that provides access to exit from a suite.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.6.2. and 9.9.6.2.(3), the clear opening height of doorways shall be not less than 2 030 mm high at exit doors, doors that open into or are located within a public corridor, and doors that open into or are located within another facility that provides access to exit from a suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , the clear opening height of doorways shall be not less than 2 030 mm high at, exit doors,  doors that open into or are located within a public corridor, and  doors that open into or are located within another facility that provides access to exit from a suite.

National Sentence Text: Doorways serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite need not comply with Sentences  and . (See also Article 9.5.5.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Doorways serving a house or an individual dwelling unit need not comply with Sentences  and .

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the clear opening width of doorways shall comply with Sentence  at exit doors, and doors that open into or are located within a public corridor or other facility that provides access to exit from a suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the clear opening width of doorways shall comply with Sentence  at, exit doors, and  doors that open into or are located,  within a public corridor, or  within another facility that provides access to exit from a suite.

National Sentence Text: Doorways described in Sentence  shall be not less than 800 mm wide where there is only one door leaf, not less than 800 mm wide where multiple-leaf doors are installed with only one active leaf having a latching mechanism described in Article 9.9.6.7., and not less than 1 210 mm wide where multiple-leaf doors are installed with two active leaves.
P/T Sentence Text: Doorways described in Sentence  shall be not less than, 800 mm wide where there is only one door leaf,  800 mm wide where multiple-leaf doors are installed with only one active leaf with a latching mechanism described in Article 9.9.6.7., and  1Ã 210 mm wide where multiple-leaf doors are installed with two active leaves.

National Sentence Text: Doorways serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite need not comply with Sentence . (See also Article 9.5.5.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Doorways serving a house or an individual dwelling unit need not comply with Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.6.4. and 9.9.6.4.(5), required exit doors and doors in required means of egress, except doors in means of egress within dwelling units, shall swing on the vertical axis.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , required exit doors and doors in required means of egress, except doors in means of egress within dwelling units, shall swing on the vertical axis.

National Sentence Text: Movable partitions used to separate a public corridor from an adjacent business and personal services occupancy or a mercantile occupancy need not conform to Sentence , provided the partitions are not located in the only means of egress. (See Note A-3.3.1.12.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Movable partitions used to separate a public corridor from an adjacent business and personal services occupancy or a mercantile occupancy need not conform to Sentence , provided the partitions are not located in the only means of egress.

National Sentence Text: Exit doors need not conform to Sentences  or , where the doors serve accessory buildings where life safety is not adversely affected, the doors serve storage garages or other accessory buildings serving not more than one dwelling unit, or the doors serve storage suites of not more than 20 m2 in gross area that are in warehousing buildings of not more than one storey, and open directly to the exterior at ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Exit doors need not conform to Sentence  or , where,  the doors serve accessory buildings where life safety is not adversely affected, or  the doors serve storage garages or other accessory buildings serving a house or an individual dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the distance between a stair riser and the leading edge of a door during its swing, except for doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, shall be not less than 300 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the distance between a stair riser and the leading edge of a door in its swing, except for doors serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, shall be not less than 300 mm.

National Article Title: Door Latching, Locking and Opening Mechanisms
National Sentence Text: Principal entrance doors, exit doors and doors to suites, including exterior doors of dwelling units, and other doors in an access to exit shall be openable from the inside or in travelling to an exit without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door-openingmechanism, or be controlled by electromagnetic locking mechanisms in accordance with Sentence 3.4.6.16.(4)
P/T Article Title: 9.9.6.7. Door Latching, Locking and Opening Mechanisms
P/T Sentence Text: Principal entrance doors, exit doors and doors to suites, including exterior doors serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, and other doors in an access to exit shall, be openable from the inside or in travelling to an exit without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door opening mechanism, or  be controlled by electromagnetic locking mechanisms in accordance with Sentence 3.4.6.16.(4).
Variation Label: Door Latching, Locking and Opening Mechanisms

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.7.3. and 9.9.8.2.(2), from the point where a doorway described in Clause  or  enters the public corridor or exterior passageway, it shall be possible to go in opposite directions to each of 2 separate exits.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.7.3. and 9.9.8.2.(2), from the point where a doorway described in Clause  or  enters the public corridor or exterior passageway, it shall be possible to go in opposite directions to each of two separate exits.

National Article Title: Number and Spacing of Egress Doors
National Sentence Text: Doors required in Sentence  shall be spaced so that in the event that one door is made inaccessible by a fire within such room or suite, the other door will provide safe egress.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.7.4. Number and Spacing of Egress Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Doors required in Sentence  shall be spaced so that in the event one door is made inaccessible by a fire within such a room or suite, the other door will provide safe egress.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.8.1. and 9.9.8.1.(3), for the purposes of this Subsection, travel distance means the distance from any point in the floor area to an exit measured along the path of exit travel.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , for the purposes of this Subsection, travel distance means the distance from any point in the floor area to an exit measured along the path of exit travel.

National Sentence Text: Where a room or suite is separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of at least 45 min or, in a sprinklered building, by a fire separation which is not required to have a fire-resistance rating, the travel distance may be measured from an egress door of the room or suite to the nearest exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a room or suite is separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of at least 45 min, or in a sprinklered building, by a fire separation that is not required to have a fire-resistance rating, the travel distance is permitted to be measured from an egress door of the room or suite to the nearest exit.

National Sentence Text: Where a public corridor is not less than 9 m wide and conforms to Subclauses 3.4.2.5.(1)(d) to (d)(iv), the travel distance may be determined in accordance with those Subclauses.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a public corridor is not less than 9 m wide and conforms to Clause 3.4.2.5.(1)(d), the travel distance is permitted to be determined in accordance with that Clause.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence  and Subsection 9.9.9., at least 2 exits shall be provided from every floor area, spaced so that the travel distance to the nearest exit is not more than 40 m in the case of business and personal services occupancies, 45 m for all occupancies where the floor area is sprinklered, and 30 m for all other occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and  and Subsection 9.9.9., at least two exits shall be provided from every floor area, spaced so that the travel distance to the nearest exit is not more than, 40 m in the case of business and personal services occupancies,  45 m for all occupancies where the floor area is sprinklered, and  30 m for all other occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in part 9., a single exit is permitted from each storey in buildings of 1 and 2 storeys in building height provided the floor area and travel distance requirements conform to those required in Article 9.9.7.4. and the total occupant load served by an exit facility does not exceed 60 persons.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 9.9.9., a single exit is permitted from each storey in buildings of 1 and 2 storeys in building height provided the floor area and travel distance requirements conform to those required in Article 9.9.7.4. and the total occupant load served by an exit facility does not exceed 60 persons.

National Sentence Text: Where more than one exit is required from a floor area, at least 2 exits shall be independent of each other and be placed remote from each other along the path of travel between them. (See Note A-9.9.8.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where more than one exit is required from a floor area, at least two exits shall be independent of each other and be placed remote from each other along the path of travel between them. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The lobby referred to in Sentence  shall be not more than 4.5 m above grade, and the path of travel through the lobby to the outdoors shall not exceed 15 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The floor of the lobby referred to in Sentence  shall be not more than 4.5 m above grade, and the path of travel through the lobby to the outdoors shall not exceed 15 m.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  and , the space above a mezzanine shall be served by means of egress leading to exits accessible at the mezzanine level, on the same basis as floor areas.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided by Sentences  and , the space above a mezzanine shall be served by at least two means of egress leading to exits accessible at the mezzanine level on the same basis as floor areas.

National Sentence Text: The means of egress from a mezzanine need not conform to Sentence , provided the mezzanine is not required to terminate at a vertical fire separation, as permitted by Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2), the occupant load of the mezzanine is not more than 60, the area of the mezzanine does not exceed the area limits stated in Table 9.9.7.4., and the distance limits stated in Table 9.9.7.4., measured along the path of travel, are not exceeded from any point on the mezzanine to an egress door serving the space that the mezzanine overlooks if the space is served by a single egress door, or an egress stairway leading to an access to exit in the space below if that space is required to be served by 2 or more egress doorways in conformance with Sentence 9.9.7.4.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: One means of egress from a mezzanine is permitted, where, the mezzanine is not required to terminate at a vertical fire separation, as permitted by Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2),  the occupant load of the mezzanine is not more than 60,  the area of the mezzanine does not exceed the area limits of Clause 9.9.7.4.(1)(a), and  the distance limits of Clause 9.9.7.4.(1) measured along the path of travel, are not exceeded from any point on the mezzanine to,  an egress door serving the space that the mezzanine overlooks if the space is served by a single egress door, or  an egress stairway leading to an access to exit in the space below if that space is required to be served by two or more egress doorways in conformance with Sentence 9.9.7.4.(1).

National Article Title: Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
National Sentence Text: Where a window required in Sentence  opens into a window well, a clearance of not less than 760 mm shall be provided in front of the window. (See Note A-9.9.10.1.(3).)
P/T Article Title: 9.9.10.1. Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
P/T Sentence Text: Where a window required in Sentence  opens into a window well, a clearance of not less than 550 mm shall be provided in front of the window. (See Appendix A.)
Variation Label: Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms

National Article Title: Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
National Sentence Text: Where a protective enclosure is installed over the window well referred to in Sentence , the enclosure shall be openable from the inside without the use of keys, tools or special knowledge of the opening mechanism.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.10.1. Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
P/T Sentence Text: Where a protective enclosure is installed over the window well referred to in Sentence , such enclosure shall be openable from the inside without the use of keys, tools or special knowledge of the opening mechanism.

National Sentence Text: The circuitry serving lighting for externally and internally illuminated exit signs shall serve no equipment other than emergency equipment, and be connected to an emergency power supply as described in Sentences 9.9.12.3.(2),  and .
P/T Sentence Text: The circuitry serving lighting for externally and internally illuminated exit signs shall,  serve no equipment other than emergency lighting in the area where the exit signs are installed, and  be connected to an emergency power supply as described in Sentences 9.9.12.3.(2),  and .

National Sentence Text: Lighting required in Sentence  shall be designed to be automatically actuated for a period of at least 30 min when the electric lighting in the affected area is interrupted.
P/T Sentence Text: Lighting required in Sentence  shall be designed to be automatically actuated for a period of not less than 30 min when the electric lighting in the affected area is interrupted.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Section, roofs with slopes of 60Â° or more to the horizontal that are adjacent to a room or space intended for occupancy shall be considered as a wall.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Section, roofs with slopes of 60ÃÂ° or more to the horizontal and that are adjacent to a room or space intended for occupancy shall be considered as a wall.

National Sentence Text: Openings through floors that are not protected by shafts or closures shall be protected in conformance with part 3. (See also Sentence 9.9.4.7.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Openings through floors that are not protected by shafts or closures shall be protected in conformance with Subsection 3.2.8.

National Sentence Text: Sprinkler systems shall be designed, constructed and installed in conformance with Articles 3.2.5.12. to 3.2.5.15. and 3.2.5.17.
P/T Sentence Text: Sprinkler systems shall be designed, constructed and installed in conformance with Sentence 3.2.5.7.(1), Articles 3.2.5.13. to 3.2.5.16. and Article 3.2.5.18. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Standpipe and hose systems shall be designed, constructed and installed in conformance with Articles 3.2.5.8. to 3.2.5.11. and 3.2.5.17.
P/T Sentence Text: Standpipe and hose systems shall be designed, constructed and installed in conformance with Article 3.2.5.18. and Subsection 3.2.9.

National Sentence Text: Where a fire-resistance rating or a fire-protection rating is required in this Section for an element of a building, such rating shall be determined in conformance with the test methods described in Part 3, the calculation method presented in , or the construction specifications presented in Tables 9.10.3.1.-A and 9.10.3.1.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fire-resistance rating or a fire-protection rating is required in this Section for an element of a building, such rating shall be determined in conformance with the test methods described in Part 3, or in accordance with MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings", or MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-3, "Fire and Sound Resistance of Building Assemblies". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where a flame-spread rating is required in this Section for an element of a building, such rating shall be determined in accordance with the test methods described in Part 3, or in accordance with Appendix D.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a flame-spread rating is required in this Section for an element of a building, such rating shall be determined in accordance with the test methods described in Part 3, or in accordance with MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings".

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentences 9.10.4.1. and 9.10.4.2.(1), the space above a mezzanine is permitted to be excluded from the calculation of building height, provided the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed does not exceed 10% of the floor area of the building in which they are located, and the area of mezzanine in a suite does not exceed 10% of the area of that suite on the storey on which it is located.
P/T Sentence Text: Mezzanines shall not be considered as storeys for the purpose of determining building height where the aggregate area of mezzanine floors does not exceed 10% of, the suite in which it is located, where there is more than one suite in the storey, or  the storey in which it is located, in all other cases.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 9.10.4.2.(1), the space above a mezzanine is permitted to be excluded from the calculation of building height, provided the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed does not exceed 40% of the open area of the room in which they are located (see Note A-3.2.1.1.(3)(a)), and except as permitted in Sentence , the space above the mezzanine floor is used as an open area without partitions or subdividing walls higher than 1 070 mm above the mezzanine floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Mezzanines shall not be considered as storeys for the purpose of determining building height where they occupy an aggregate area not exceeding 40% of the area of the room or the storey in which they are located provided the space above the mezzanine floor has no visual obstructions more than 1 070 mm above such floors.

National Article Title: Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.5.1. and 9.10.5.1.(4), a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall not be pierced by openings into the assembly unless the assembly has been tested and rated for such openings.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.5.1. Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences  and , a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall not be pierced by openings into the assembly unless the assembly has been tested and rated for such openings.

National Article Title: Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
National Sentence Text: A membrane ceiling forming part of an assembly assigned a fire-resistance rating on the basis of Table 9.10.3.1.-B or Appendix D is permitted to be pierced by openings leading to ducts within the ceiling space provided the ducts, the amount of openings and their protection conform to the requirements of Appendix D.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.5.1. Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
P/T Sentence Text: A membrane ceiling forming part of an assembly assigned a fire-resistance rating on the basis of Table 2 of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-3, "Fire and Sound Resistance of Building Assemblies", is permitted to be pierced by openings leading to ducts within the ceiling space provided the ducts, the amount of openings and their protection conform to Sentence 9.10.13.1.4. and the requirements in MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings".
Variation Label: Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes

National Sentence Text: Where a building or part of a building is required to be of noncombustible construction, combustible elements shall be limited in conformance with the requirements in part 3.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a building or part of a building is required to be of noncombustible construction, combustible elements shall be limited in conformance with the requirements in Subsection 3.1.5.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance ratings of floors, roofs, loadbearing walls, columns and arches need not conform to this Subsection if such assemblies conform in all respects to the appropriate requirements in part 3.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance ratings of floors, roofs, loadbearing walls, columns and arches need not conform to this Subsection if such assemblies conform in all respects to the appropriate requirements in Section 3.2.

National Article Title: Openings to be Protected with Closures
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Articles 9.10.9.5., 9.10.9.6. and 9.10.9.7., openings in required fire separations shall be protected with closures conforming to Subsection 9.10.13.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.9.3. Openings to be Protected With Closures
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Articles 9.10.9.5. to 9.10.9.7., openings in required fire separations shall be protected with closures conforming to Subsection 9.10.13.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.9.4. to 9.10.9.4.(4), all floor assemblies shall be constructed as fire separations.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences  to , all floor assemblies shall be constructed as fire separations.

National Sentence Text: Floor assemblies for which no fire-resistance rating is required by Subsection 9. and floors of mezzanines not required to be counted as storeys in Articles 9.10.4.1. and 9.10.4.2. need not be constructed as fire separations.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor assemblies for which no fire-resistance rating is required by Subsection 9.10.8. and floors of mezzanines not required to be counted as storeys in Articles 9.10.4.1. and 9.10.4.2. need not be constructed as fire separations.

National Sentence Text: Piping, tubing, ducts, chimneys, wiring, conduit, electrical outlet boxes and other similar service equipment that penetrate a required fire separation shall be tightly fitted or fire stopped to maintain the integrity of the separation. (See Note A-9.10.9.6.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Piping, tubing, ducts, chimneys, wiring, conduit, electrical outlet boxes and other similar service equipment that penetrate a required fire separation shall be tightly fitted or fire stopped to maintain the integrity of the separation. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to  and Article 9.10.9.7., pipes, ducts, electrical boxes, totally enclosed raceways or other similar service equipment that partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be noncombustible unless the assembly has been tested incorporating such equipment. (See Note A-3.1.9.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to  and Article 9.10.9.7., pipes, ducts, electrical outlet boxes, totally enclosed raceways or other similar service equipment that partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be noncombustible unless the assembly has been tested incorporating such equipment.

National Sentence Text: Combustible water distribution piping is permitted to partly or wholly penetrate a fire separation that is required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence , provided the piping is protected with a fire stop in conformance with Sentence 3.1.9.5.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible water distribution piping is permitted to partly or wholly penetrate a fire separation that is required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence , provided the piping is protected with a fire stop in conformance with Sentence 3.1.9.4.(4).

National Article Title: Combustible Drain, Waste and Vent Piping
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences  to , combustible piping shall not be used in any part of a drain, waste and vent piping system where any part of that system partly or wholly penetrates a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or penetrates a membrane that contributes to the required fire-resistance rating of an assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences  to , combustible piping shall not be used where any part of a piping system partly or wholly penetrates a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or penetrates a membrane that contributes to the required fire-resistance rating of an assembly.

National Article Title: Reduction in Thickness of Fire Separation by Beams and Joists
National Sentence Text: Where pockets for the support of beams or joists are formed in a masonry or concrete fire separation, the remaining total thickness of masonry and/or grout and/or concrete shall be not less than the required equivalent thickness shown for Type S monolithic concrete in Table D-2.1.1. in Appendix D for the required fire-resistance rating.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.9.9. Reduction in Thickness of Fire Separation by Beams
P/T Sentence Text: Where pockets for the support of beams or joists are formed in a masonry or concrete fire separation, the remaining total thickness of solid masonry and/or grout and/or concrete shall be not less than the required equivalent thickness shown for Type S monolithic concrete in Table 2.1.1. of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings", for the required fire-resistance rating.
Variation Label: Reduction in Thickness of Fire Separation by Beams
