National Sentence Text: Where a horizontal service space or other concealed space is located above a required vertical fire separation other than a vertical shaft, such space need not be divided as required in Sentence  provided the construction between such space and the space below is constructed as a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the vertical fire separation, except that where the vertical fire separation is not required to have a fire-resistance rating greater than 45 min, the fire-resistance rating of the ceiling may be reduced to 30 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a horizontal service space or other concealed space is located above a required vertical fire separation other than a vertical shaft, such space need not be divided as required in Sentence  provided the construction between such space and the space below is constructed as a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the vertical fire separation, except that where the vertical fire separation is not required to have a fire-resistance rating greater than 45 min, the fire-resistance rating of the ceiling is permitted to be reduced to 30 min.

National Sentence Text: Where not more than 2 dwelling units are located in a building containing a mercantile occupancy, such mercantile occupancy shall be separated from the dwelling units by a fire separation having not less than 1 h fire-resistance rating.
P/T Sentence Text: Where not more than 2 dwelling units or live/work units are located in a building containing a mercantile occupancy, such mercantile occupancy shall be separated from the dwelling units or live/work units by a fire separation having not less than 1 h fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Not more than one suite of residential occupancy shall be contained within a building classified as a Group F, Division 2 major occupancy .
P/T Article Title: 9.10.9.12.  Residential Suites, Live/Work Units and Industrial
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , not more than 1 suite of residential occupancy shall be contained within a building classified as a Group F, Division 2 major occupancy.
Variation Label: Residential Suites, Live/Work Units and Industrial

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.14. , 9.10.9.14. and 9.10.9.14. and Article 9.10.21.2., suites in residential occupancies shall be separated from adjacent rooms and suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and  and Article 9.10.21.2., suites in residential occupancies shall be separated from adjacent rooms and suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: Where a storage garage serves only the dwelling unit to which it is attached or in which it is built, it shall be considered as part of that dwelling unit and the fire separation required in Sentence  need not be provided between the garage and the dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage garage serves only the house or the individual dwelling unit it is attached to or built into, it shall be considered as part of that house or dwelling unit and the fire separation required in Sentence  need not be provided between the garage and the house or dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.16.(5), where a storage garage is attached to or built into a building of residential occupancy, an air barrier system conforming to part 9. shall be installed between the garage and the remainder of the building to provide an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes, and every door between the garage and the remainder of the building shall conform to Article 9.10.13.15.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage garage is attached to or built into a building of residential occupancy, an air barrier system conforming to Subsection 9.25.3. shall be installed between the garage and the remainder of the building to provide an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes, and  every door between the garage and the remainder of the building shall conform to Article 9.10.13.15. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.17.(5), where a building containing a repair garage also contains a dwelling unit, an air barrier system conforming to part 9. shall be installed between the dwelling unit and the suite containing the garage to provide an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes. (See Note A-9.10.9.16.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a building containing a repair garage also contains a dwelling unit, an air barrier system conforming to Subsection 9.25.3. shall be installed between the dwelling unit and the suite containing the garage to provide an effective air barrier to gas and exhaust fumes.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.10.3. and Articles 9.10.10.5. and 9.10.10.6., service rooms shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h when the floor area containing the service room is not sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence  and Articles 9.10.10.5. and 9.10.10.6., service rooms shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h when the floor area containing the service room is not sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.10.4. and 9.10.10.4. and Article 9.10.10.5., fuel-fired appliances shall be located in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.10.4. Appliances and Equipment to be Located in a Service
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and  and Article 9.10.10.5., fuel-fired appliances shall be located in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Except as stated in Sentence 9.10.11.2.(2), a party wall on a property line of a building of residential occupancy need not be constructed as a firewall, provided it is constructed as a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating, where the party wall separates two dwelling units where there is no dwelling unit above another dwelling unit, a dwelling unit and a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, or two houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: A party wall on a property line need not be constructed as a firewall provided it is constructed as a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating if,  the property line is between houses, or  the property line is between dwelling units in a building of residential occupancy, other than a house, in which there is no dwelling unit above another dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: The wall described in Sentence  shall provide continuous protection from the top of the footings to the underside of the roof deck.
P/T Sentence Text: The wall described in Sentence  shall provide continuous protection from the top of the footings to the underside of the roof deck.

National Sentence Text: Any space between the top of the wall described in Sentence  and the roof deck shall be tightly filled with mineral wool or noncombustible material.
P/T Sentence Text: Any space between the top of the wall described in Sentence  and the roof deck shall be tightly filled with mineral wool or noncombustible material.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.12.1. and in Articles 9.10.1.3. and 9.10.9.5., the portions of a floor area or mezzanine that do not terminate at an exterior wall, a firewall or a vertical shaft, shall terminate at a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly that terminates at the separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence  and in Articles 9.10.1.3. and 9.10.9.5., the portions of a floor area or mezzanine that do not terminate at an exterior wall, a firewall or a vertical shaft, shall terminate at a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly that terminates at the separation.

National Article Title: Exterior Walls Meeting at an Angle
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.9.4.5., where exterior walls of a building meet at an external angle of 135Â° or less, the horizontal distance from an unprotected opening in one exterior wall to an unprotected opening in the other exterior wall shall be not less than 1.2 m, where these openings are in different fire compartments, or in different dwelling units, ancillary spaces or common spaces in a house with a secondary suite.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.12.3. Exterior Walls Meeting at an Angle
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.9.4.5., where exterior walls of a building meet at an external angle of less than 135ÃÂ°, the horizontal distance from an opening in one wall to an opening in the other wall shall be not less than 1.2 m where the openings are in different fire compartments.
Variation Label: Exterior Walls Meeting at an Angle

National Sentence Text: This Article applies to the portion of any soffit enclosing a projection that is less than 2.5 m vertically above a window or door, and less than 1.2 m from either side of the window or door.
P/T Sentence Text: This Article applies to the portion of any soffit enclosing a projection that is, less than 2.5 m vertically above a window or door, and  less than 1.2 m from either side of the window or door. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , the construction described in Sentence  shall have no unprotected openings and shall be protected in accordance with Sentence , where the soffit encloses a common attic or roof space that spans more than 2 suites of residential occupancy and projects beyond the exterior wall of the building, a floor spacewhere an upper storey projects beyond the exterior wall of a lower storey and a fire separation is required at the floor between the two, or the floor separates dwelling units from each other or a dwelling unit from an ancillary space or a common space in a house with a secondary suite, or a floor spacewhere an upper storey projects beyond the exterior wall of a lower storey, and the projection is continuous across a vertical fire separation separating two suites, or a wall separating dwelling units from each other or a dwelling unit from an ancillary space or a common space in a house with a secondary suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , the soffit described in Sentence  shall be protected in accordance with Sentence  where the soffit encloses, a common attic or roof space that spans more than 2 suites of residential occupancy and projects beyond the exterior wall of the building,  a floor space where an upper storey projects beyond the exterior wall of a lower storey and a fire separation is required at the floor between the two storeys, or  a floor space where an upper storey projects beyond the exterior wall of a lower storey, and the projection is continuous across a vertical fire separation separating two suites.

National Sentence Text: Protection required by Sentence  shall be provided by noncombustible material having a minimum thickness of 0.38 mm and a melting point not below 650°C, not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum board installed according to CSA A82.31-M, Gypsum Board Application, not less than 11 mm thick plywood, not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or not less than 11 mm thick lumber. (See Note A-9.10.12.4.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Protection required by Sentence  shall be provided by, noncombustible material having a minimum thickness of 0.38 mm and a melting point not below 650ÃÂ°C,  not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum wallboard installed according to CSA A82.31-M, "Gypsum Board Application,"  not less than 11 mm thick plywood,  not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or  not less than 11 mm thick lumber. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.10.13.2., openings in required fire separations shall be protected with a closure conforming to Table 9.10.13.1. and shall be installed in conformance with Chapters 2 to 14 of NFPA 80, Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives, unless otherwise specified herein. (See also Article 9.10.3.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.10.13.2., openings in required fire separations shall be protected with a closure conforming to Table 9.10.13.1. and shall be installed in conformance with NFPA 80, "Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives", unless otherwise specified in this Part.

National Article Title: Solid Core Wood Door as a Closure
National Sentence Text: A 45 mm thick solid core wood door is permitted to be used where a minimum fire-protection rating of 20 min is permitted or between a public corridor and a suite provided that the door conforms to CAN/ULC-S113, Wood Core Doors Meeting the Performance Required by CAN/ULC-S104 for Twenty Minute Fire Rated Closure Assemblies. (See Note A-9.10.13.2.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.13.2. Solid Core Wood Door as a Closure
P/T Sentence Text: A 45 mm thick solid core wood door is permitted to be used where a minimum fire-protection rating of 20 min is permitted or between a public corridor and a suite provided the door conforms to CAN/ULC-S113, "Wood Core Doors Meeting the Performance Required by CAN/ULC-S104 for Twenty Minute Fire Rated Closure Assemblies". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Doors required to provide a 20 min fire-protection rating or permitted to be 45 mm solid core wood shall be mounted in a wood frame of not less than 38 mm thickness where the frame has not been tested and rated.
P/T Sentence Text: Doors required to provide a 20 min fire-protection rating or permitted to be 45 mm solid core wood shall be mounted in a wood frame of at least 38 mm thickness where the frame has not been tested and rated.

National Article Title: Doors as a Means of Egress
National Sentence Text: Doors forming part of an exit or a public means of egress shall conform to part 9. in addition to this Subsection.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.13.4. Doors as a Means of Egress
P/T Sentence Text: Doors forming part of an exit or a public means of egress shall conform to Subsection 9.9.6. in addition to this Subsection.

National Sentence Text: Wired glass described in Sentence  shall be mounted in fixed steel frames having a metal thickness of not less than 1.35 mm and a glazing stop of not less than 20 mm on each side of the glass.
P/T Sentence Text: Wired glass described in Sentence  shall be mounted in fixed steel frames having a minimum metal thickness of not less than 1.35 mm and a glazing stop of not less than 20 mm on each side of the glass.

National Sentence Text: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 11 m2 , with no dimension greater than 3.7 m, when the fire compartments on both sides of the fire separation are not sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 11 mÃÂ², with no dimension greater than 3.7 m, if a fire compartment on either side of the fire separation is not sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 22 m2 , with no dimension greater than 6 m, when the fire compartments on both sides of the fire separation are sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 22 mÃÂ², with no dimension greater than 6 m, when the fire compartments on both sides of the fire separation are sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 9.10.13.13. to 9.10.13.13. and Sentence 9.10.5.1.(4), a duct that penetrates an assembly required to be a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating shall be equipped with a fire damper in conformance with Articles 3.1.8.4. and 3.1.8.10.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences  to  and Sentence 9.10.5.1.(4), a duct that penetrates an assembly required to be a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating shall be equipped with a fire damper in conformance with ArticlesÃ 3.1.8.4. and 3.1.8.9.

National Sentence Text: A fire damper is not required where a noncombustible branch duct pierces a required fire separation provided the duct has a melting point not below 760Â°C, has a cross-sectional area less than 130 cm2 , and supplies only air-conditioning units or combined air-conditioning and heating units discharging air at not more than 1.2 m above the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire damper is not required where a noncombustible branch duct pierces a required fire separation provided the duct, has a melting point not below 760ÃÂ°C,  has a cross-sectional area less than 130 cmÃÂ², and  supplies only air-conditioning units or combined air-conditioning and heating units discharging air at not more than 1.2 m above the floor.

National Sentence Text: A fire damper is not required where a noncombustible branch duct pierces a required fire separation around an exhaust duct riser in which the airflow is upward provided the melting point of the branch duct is not below 760Â°C, the branch duct is carried up inside the riser not less than 500 mm, and the exhaust duct is under negative pressure as described in Article 9.10.9.18.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire damper is not required where a noncombustible branch duct pierces a required fire separation around an exhaust duct riser in which the air flow is upward provided, the melting point of the branch duct is not below 760ÃÂ°C,  the branch duct is carried up inside the riser at least 500 mm, and  the exhaust duct is under negative pressure as described in Article 9.10.9.18.

National Sentence Text: Noncombustible ducts that penetrate a fire separation separating a vertical service space from the remainder of the building need not be equipped with a fire damper at the fire separation provided the ducts have a melting point above 760Â°C, and each individual duct exhausts directly to the outside at the top of the vertical service space.
P/T Sentence Text: Noncombustible ducts that penetrate a fire separation separating a vertical service space from the remainder of the building need not be equipped with a fire damper at the fire separation provided, the ducts have a melting point above 760ÃÂ°C, and  each individual duct exhausts directly to the outside at the top of the vertical service space.

National Sentence Text: Fire stop flaps in ceiling membranes referred to in Sentence 9.10.5.1. shall conform to CAN/ULC-S112.2, Fire Test of Ceiling Firestop Flap Assemblies, and activate at a temperature approximately 30°C above the normal maximum temperature that occurs in the ducts, whether the air duct system is operating or shut down.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire stop flaps in ceiling membranes required in Sentence 9.10.5.1. shall conform to CAN/ULC-S112.2, "Fire Test of Ceiling Firestop Flap Assemblies", and  activate at a temperature approximately 30ÃÂ°C above the normal maximum temperature that occurs in the ducts, whether the air duct system is operating or shut down.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to buildings other than those to which Subsection 9.10.15.applies.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Subsection 9.10.15., this Subsection applies to all buildings.

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.14.5.-A to determine the required type of construction, cladding and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that no portion of the actual exposing building face is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured, and the value for the maximum area of unprotected openings (see second column of Table 9.10.14.5.-A) shall be determined using the limiting distance measured from the location described in Sentence 9.10.14.2.(3). (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.2. Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.14.5. to determine the required type of construction, cladding and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly-shaped or skewed exterior wall,  the exposing building face is permitted to be divided into any number of portions and the fire-resistance rating, type of cladding and percentage of unprotected openings limitations is permitted to be determined individually for each portion based on the limiting distance for each portion so divided,  the exposing building face shall be taken as the projection of the exterior wall onto a vertical plane located so that no portion of the exterior wall of the building is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is established in Clause (a), and  for the purpose of determining the actual area of unprotected openings permitted in an exterior wall, the unprotected openings shall be projected onto the vertical plane established in Clause (b).
Variation Label: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face

National Sentence Text: The limits on the area of glazed openings stated in Sentence  need not apply to the exposing building face of a detached garage or accessory building facing a dwelling unit, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.
P/T Sentence Text: The limits on the area of unprotected openings need not apply to the exposing building face of a detached garage or accessory building facing a house, where,  the detached garage or accessory building serves the house or an individual dwelling unit in the house,  the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as the house, and  the house is the only major occupancy on the property.

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.14.5. to 9.10.14.5.(14), each exposing building face and any exterior wall located above an exposing building face that encloses an attic or roof space shall be constructed in conformance with Table 9.10.14.5.-A. (See Note A-9.10.14.5.(1).) (See also part 9.)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to , each exposing building face and any exterior wall located above an exposing building face that encloses an attic or roof space shall be constructed in conformance with Table 9.10.14.5. and Subsection 9.10.8.
Variation Label: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls

National Article Title:
Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
Building Face
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to , cladding on exposing building faces and exterior walls located above exposing building faces that enclose an attic or roof space, for buildings or fire compartments where the maximum permitted area of unprotected openings is more than 10% of the exposing building face, need not be noncombustible where the wall assembly complies with the requirements of Clause 3.1.5.5.(1) when tested in conformance with CAN/ULC-S134, Fire Test of Exterior Wall Assemblies.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls
P/T Sentence Text: Cladding on exposing building faces and exterior walls located above exposing building faces need not conform to the type of cladding required by Table 9.10.14.5. where, the exposing building face is constructed with no unprotected openings,  the limiting distance is not less than 0.6 m, and  the cladding,  conforms to Subsection 9.27.12.,  is installed without furring members over not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum sheathing or over masonry,  has a flame-spread rating not more than 25 when tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(2), and  is not more than 2 mm in thickness exclusive of fasteners, joints and local reinforcements.
Variation Label: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
National Sentence Text: Non-loadbearing wall components need not have a minimum fire-resistance rating, where the building is 1 storey in building height, is of noncombustible construction, is classified as a low-hazard industrial occupancy and used only for low fire load occupancies, such as power-generating plants or plants for the manufacture or storage of noncombustible materials, and has a limiting distance of 3 m or more.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls
P/T Sentence Text: Non-loadbearing wall components need not have a minimum fire-resistance rating where,  the building is 1 storey in building height,  the building is of noncombustible construction,  the building is classified as low hazard industrial occupancy and is used only for low fire load occupancies such as power generating plants or plants for the manufacture or storage of noncombustible materials, and  the exposing building face has a limiting distance of 3 m or more.

National Article Title: Limiting Distance and Fire Department Response
National Sentence Text: Except for the purpose of applying Sentences 9.10.15.2.(2), 9.10.15.4. and 9.10.15.5.(13), a limiting distance equal to half the actual limiting distance shall be used as input to the requirements of this Subsection, where the time from receipt of notification of a fire by the fire department until the first fire department vehicle arrives at the building exceeds 10 min in 10% or more of all calls to the building, and any storey in the building is not sprinklered. (See Notes A-3.2.3. and A-3.2.3.1.(8).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where there is no fire department or where a fire department is not organized, trained and equipped to meet the needs of the community, the required limiting distance determined from Sentences 9.10.15.4. and  and Sentence 9.10.15.5.(6), shall be doubled for a building that is not sprinklered.

National Article Title: Glazed Openings in Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: Where the limits on the area of glazed openings are determined for individual portions of the exterior wall, as described in Sentence 9.10.15.2.(1), the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings for any portion shall conform to the values in the row of Table 9.10.15.4. corresponding to the maximum total area of exposing building face (see column 1 of the that is equal to the sum of all portions of the exposing building face. (See Note A-9.10.15.4.(2).)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.15.4. Glazed Openings in Exposing Building Face
P/T Sentence Text: Where the limits on the area of glazed openings are determined for individual portions of the exterior wall, as described in Subclause 9.10.15.2.(1)(b)(iii), the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings for any portion shall not exceed the values in the row of Table 9.10.15.4. for the total area of the entire exposing building face based on the limiting distance of the individual portion. (See Appendix A.)
Variation Label: Glazed Openings in Exposing Building Face

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , each exposing building face and any exterior wall located above an exposing building face that encloses an attic or roof space shall be constructed in conformance with Sentences  and  for the exposing building face as a whole, or for any number of separate portions of the exposing building face (see Subclause 9.10.15.2.(1)(b)(iii), Sentence 9.10.15.4.(2), and Note A-9.10.15.4.(2)). (See also Subsection 9.10.8.)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.15.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to  and , each exposing building face and any exterior wall located above an exposing building face that encloses an attic or roof space shall be constructed in conformance with Subsection 9.10.8., for the exposing building face as a whole, or  for any number of separate portions of the exposing building face.
Variation Label: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , where the limiting distance is equal to or greater than 0.6 m and less than 1.2 m, the exposing building face and any exterior wall located above the exposing building face that encloses an attic or roof space shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min, and the cladding shall be metal or noncombustible cladding installed in accordance with Section 9.20., Subsection 9.27.11. or Section 9.28. (see Note A-9.10.14.5.(1)), the cladding shall conform to Subsection 9.27.6., 9.27.7., 9.27.8., 9.27.9., or 9.27.10., be installed without furring members, or on furring not more than 25 mm thick, over gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, and after conditioning in conformance with ASTM D 2898, Accelerated Weathering of Fire-Retardant-Treated Wood for Fire Testing, have a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 when tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(2), the cladding shall conform to Subsection 9.27.12., be installed with or without furring members over gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, have a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 when tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(2), and not exceed 2 mm in thickness exclusive of fasteners, joints and local reinforcements, or the wall assembly shall comply with Clause 3.1.5.5.(1) when tested in conformance with CAN/ULC-S134, Fire Test of Exterior Wall Assemblies.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.15.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
P/T Sentence Text: Where the limiting distance is less than 0.6 m, cladding on the exposing building face and on exterior walls located above the exposing building face that enclose an attic or roof spaces need not be noncombustible, provided the cladding, conforms to Subsection 9.27.12.,  is installed without furring members over not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum sheathing or over masonry,  has a flame-spread rating not more than 25 when tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(2), and  is not more than 2 mm in thickness exclusive of fasteners, joints and local reinforcements.
Variation Label: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , combustible projections on the exterior of a wall that are more than 1 m above ground level and that could expose an adjacent building to fire spread shall not be permitted within 1.2 m of a property line or the centre line of a public way, or 2.4 m of a combustible projection on another building on the same property.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.15.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
P/T Sentence Text: Except for houses, combustible projections on the exterior of a wall that are more than 1 000 mm above ground level, such as balconies, platforms, canopies, eave projections and stairs, and that could expose an adjacent building to fire spread, shall not be permitted within, 1.2 m of a property line or the centre line of a public way, or  2.4 m of a combustible projection on another building on the same property.
Variation Label: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
National Sentence Text: Heavy timber and steel columns need not conform to the requirements of Sentence , provided the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.15.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
P/T Sentence Text: Heavy timber and steel columns need not conform to the requirements of Sentence  provided the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: No dimension of the concealed space described in Clause  shall exceed 20 m.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.16.1. Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: No dimension of the compartment described in Clause  shall exceed 20 m.

National Sentence Text: Fire blocks are deemed to comply with Sentence  if they are constructed of not less than 0.38 mm sheet steel, 12.7 mm gypsum board, 12.5 mm plywood, OSB or waferboard, with joints having continuous supports, 2 layers of 19 mm lumber with joints staggered, or 38 mm lumber.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire blocks are deemed to comply with Sentence , if they are constructed of not less than, 0.38 mm sheet steel,  12.7 mm gypsum wallboard,  12.5 mm plywood, OSB or waferboard, with joints having continuous supports,  2 layers of 19 mm lumber with joints staggered, or  38 mm lumber.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , at least 90% of the exposed surfaces of every wall in an exit shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See Article 9.10.17.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , at least 90% of the exposed surfaces of every wall in an exit shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25.

National Sentence Text: Individual combustible skylights in corridors required to be separated from the remainder of the building by fire separations shall not exceed 1 m2 in area and shall be spaced not less than 1.2 m apart.
P/T Sentence Text: Individual combustible skylights in corridors required to be separated from the remainder of the building by fire separations shall not exceed 1 mÃÂ² in area and shall be spaced not less than 1.2 m apart.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , foamed plastics that form part of a wall or ceiling assembly shall be protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within attic or roof spaces, crawl spaces, wall assemblies and ceiling assemblies by one of the interior finishes described in Subsections 9.29.4. to 9.29.9., provided the building does not contain a Group C major occupancy, by sheet metal that is mechanically fastened to the supporting assembly independent of the insulation, is not less than 0.38 mm thick, and has a melting point not less than 650°C, or by any thermal barrier that meets the requirements of Sentence 3.1.5.15.(2). (See Note A-3.1.4.2.(1)(c).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , foamed plastics that form part of a wall or ceiling assembly shall be protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within attic or roof spaces, crawl spaces, wall assemblies and ceiling assemblies, by any of the following: one of the finishes described in Subsections 9.29.4. to 9.29.9.,  provided the building does not contain a Group C major occupancy, sheet metal that,  is mechanically fastened to the supporting assembly independent of the insulation,  is not less than 0.38 mm thick, and  has a melting point not less than 650ÃÂ°C, or  any thermal barrier that meets the requirements of Sentence 3.1.5.12A.(2).

National Sentence Text: A walk-in cooler or freezer consisting of factory-assembled wall, floor or ceiling panels containing foamed plastics is permitted to be used, provided the panels are protected on both sides by sheet metal not less than 0.38 mm thick having a melting point not less than 650Â°C, do not contain an air space, and have a flame-spread rating, determined by subjecting a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation to the applicable test described in part 3., that is not more than that permitted for the room or space in which they are located or that they bound.
P/T Sentence Text: Ã A walk-in cooler or freezer consisting of factory-assembled wall, floor or ceiling panels containing foamed plastics is permitted to be used, provided the panels, are protected on both sides by sheet metal not less than 0.38 mm thick having a melting point not less than 650ÃÂ°C,  do not contain an air space, and  have a flame-spread rating that is not more than that permitted for the room or space in which they are located or that they bound.

National Sentence Text: A walk-in cooler or freezer consisting of factory-assembled wall, floor or ceiling panels containing foamed plastics is permitted to be used, provided the panels are protected on both sides by sheet metal not less than 0.38 mm thick having a melting point not less than 650Â°C, do not contain an air space, and have a flame-spread rating, determined by subjecting a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation to the applicable test described in part 3., that is not more than that permitted for the room or space in which they are located or that they bound.
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating of panels required in Clause  shall be determined by subjecting a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation to the applicable test described in Subsection 3.1.12.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , a fire alarm system shall be installed in every building that contains more than 3 storeys, including storeys below the first storey, where the total occupant load exceeds 300, or when the occupant load for any major occupancy in Table 9.10.18.2. is exceeded.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , a fire alarm system shall be installed, in every building that contains more than 3 storeys, including storeys below the first storey,  where the total occupant load exceeds 300, or  when the occupant load for any major occupancy in Table 9.10.18.2. is exceeded.

National Sentence Text: Except as stated in Sentence  and as required by this Subsection, where fire alarm, fire detection and smoke detection devices and systems are installed, these devices and systems and their installation shall conform to Subsection 3.2.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , fire alarm, fire detection and smoke detection devices and systems, and their installation, shall conform to Subsection 3.2.4. and Articles 3.2.7.8. and 3.2.7.10. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Rooms and Spaces Requiring Heat Detectors or Smoke Detectors
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.18.4.(3), if a fire alarm system is required in a building that is not sprinklered, fire detectors shall be installed in the following spaces: storage rooms not within dwelling units, service rooms not within dwelling units, janitors' rooms, rooms in which hazardous substances are to be used or stored (see Note A-3.3.1.2.(1)), elevator hoistways, chutes and dumbwaiter shafts, and laundry rooms in buildings of residential occupancy, but not those within dwelling units.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.18.4. Rooms and Spaces Requiring Heat Detectors or Smoke
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , if a fire alarm system is required in a building, fire detectors shall be installed in the following spaces: storage rooms not within dwelling units,  service rooms not within dwelling units,  janitors' rooms,  rooms in which hazardous substances are to be used or stored,  elevator hoistways, chutes and dumbwaiter shafts, and  laundry rooms in buildings of residential occupancy, except those within dwelling units.
Variation Label: Rooms and Spaces Requiring Heat Detectors or Smoke

National Article Title: Rooms and Spaces Requiring Heat Detectors or Smoke Detectors
National Sentence Text: Heat detectors and smoke detectors described in Sentence  are not required in dwelling units or in sprinklered buildings in which the sprinkler system is electrically supervised and equipped with a water flow alarm.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.18.4. Rooms and Spaces Requiring Heat Detectors or Smoke
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence , heat detectors and smoke detectors described in Sentence , are not required in dwelling units or in sprinklered buildings in which the sprinkler system is electrically supervised and equipped with a water flow alarm.
Variation Label: Rooms and Spaces Requiring Heat Detectors or Smoke

National Article Title: Portions of Buildings Considered as Separate Buildings
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , where a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h separates a portion of a building from the remainder of the building and there are no openings through the fire separation other than those for piping, tubing, wiring and conduit, the requirements for fire alarm and detection systems may be applied to each portion so separated as if it were a separate building.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.18.6. Portions of Buildings Considered as Separate Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , where a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of at least 1 h separates a portion of a building from the remainder of the building and there are no openings through the fire separation other than those for piping, tubing, wiring and conduit, the requirements for fire alarm and detection systems is permitted to be applied to each portion so separated as if it were a separate building.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 9.10.19.8., smoke alarms conforming to CAN/ULC-S531, Smoke Alarms, shall be installed in each dwelling unit, each sleeping room not within a dwelling unit, and ancillary spaces and common spaces not in dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.19.8., smoke alarms conforming to CAN/ULC-S531, "Smoke Alarms", shall be installed in, each dwelling unit,  each sleeping room not within a dwelling unit, and  each interior shared means of egress and common area in a house.

National Sentence Text: Smoke alarms required in Article 9.10.19.1. and Sentence  shall be installed on or near the ceiling.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoke alarms required in Sentence  shall be installed on or near the ceiling.

National Sentence Text: Smoke alarms required in Article 9.10.19.1. and Sentence  shall be installed on or near the ceiling.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.19.3. Location of Smoke Alarms (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Smoke alarms required in Sentences  and  shall be installed on or near the ceiling.

National Sentence Text: Suites of residential occupancy are permitted to be equipped with smoke detectors in lieu of smoke alarms, provided the smoke detectors are capable of independently sounding audible signals within the individual suites, except as permitted in Sentence , are installed in conformance with CAN/ULC-S524, Installation of Fire Alarm Systems, and form part of the fire alarm system. (See Note A-3.2.4.20.(8).)
P/T Sentence Text: Suites of residential occupancy are permitted to be equipped with smoke detectors in lieu of smoke alarms, provided the smoke detectors,  are capable of independently sounding audible signals within the individual suites,  except as provided by Sentence , are installed in conformance with CAN/ULC-S524, "Installation of Fire Alarm Systems", and  form part of the fire alarm system.

National Sentence Text: Smoke detectors permitted to be installed in lieu of smoke alarms as stated in Sentence  are permitted to sound localized alarms within individual suites, and need not sound an alarm throughout the rest of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoke detectors permitted to be installed in lieu of smoke alarms as provided in Sentence  are permitted to sound localized alarms within individual suites, and need not sound an alarm throughout the rest of the building.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , a manually operated device shall be incorporated within the circuitry of a smoke alarm installed in a dwelling unit so that the signal emitted by the smoke alarm can be silenced for a period of not more than 10 min, after which the smoke alarm will reset and sound again if the level of smoke in the vicinity is sufficient to re-actuate it.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , a manually operated device shall be incorporated within the circuitry of a smoke alarm installed in a house or an individual dwelling unit so that the signal emitted by the smoke alarm can be silenced for a period of not more than 10 min, after which the smoke alarm will reset and sound again if the level of smoke in the vicinity is sufficient to reactuate it.

National Sentence Text: Except where a fire alarm system is installed or required in a building, smoke detectors forming part of a residential fire warning system installed in conformance with CAN/ULC-S540, Residential Fire and Life Safety Warning Systems: Installation, Inspection, Testing and Maintenance, are permitted to be installed in lieu of all smoke alarms required by Articles 9.10.19.1. and 9.10.19.3., provided that the fire warning system is capable of sounding audible signals as stated in Articles 9.10.19.2. and 9.10.19.5., is powered as stated in Article 9.10.19.4., and is equipped with a silencing device as stated in Article 9.10.19.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where a fire alarm system is installed or required in a building, smoke detectors forming part of a residential fire warning system installed in conformance with CAN/ULC-S540 "Residential Fire and Life Safety Warning Systems: Installation, Inspection, Testing and Maintenance", are permitted to be installed in lieu of all smoke alarms required by Articles 9.10.19.1. and 9.10.19.3., provided that the fire warning system, is capable of sounding audible signals in accordance with Articles 9.10.19.2. and 9.10.19.5.,  is powered in accordance with Article 9.10.19.4., and  is equipped with a silencing device conforming to Article 9.10.19.6.

National Sentence Text: Access required in Sentence  may be provided by a door, window or other means that provides an opening not less than 1 100 mm high and 550 mm wide, the sill height of which shall not be more than 900 mm above the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Access required in Sentence  is permitted to be provided by a door, window or other means that provides an opening not less than 1 100 mm high and 550 mm wide, the sill height of which shall not be more than 900 mm above the floor.

P/T Sentence Text: Access for fire department equipment shall be provided to each building by means of a street, private roadway or yard. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.10.21.2. to 9.10.21.9., construction camps shall conform to Subsections 9.10.1. to 9.10.20.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.10.21.2. to 9.10.21.9., camps for housing of workers shall conform to Subsections 9.10.1. to 9.10.20.

National Article Title: Floor Assemblies between the First and Second Storey

National Sentence Text: Except in dwelling units and except as provided in Sentence , the surface flame-spread rating of wall and ceiling surfaces in corridors and walkways, exclusive of doors, shall not exceed 25 over not less than 90% of the exposed surface area and not more than 150 over the remaining surface area.
