National Sentence Text: Dampproofing and waterproofing shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Dampproofing and waterproofing shall conform to Section 9.13.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , not less than 100 mm of coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve shall be placed beneath floors-on-ground. (See also Subsection 9.13.4. and Note A-9.13.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , not less than 100 mm of coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve shall be placed beneath floors-on-ground.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to columns used to support beams carrying loads from not more than 2 wood-frame floors where the supported length of joists bearing on such beams does not exceed 5 m, and the live load on any floor does not exceed 2.4 kPa (see Table 4.1.5.3.), beams or header joists carrying loads from not more than 2 levels of wood-frame balconies, decks or other accessible exterior platforms, or 1 level plus the roof, where the supported length of joists bearing on such beams or joists does not exceed 5 m, the sum of the specified snow and occupancy loads does not exceed 4.8 kPa (see Sentence 9.4.2.3. for the determination of load on platform-type constructions), and the platform serves only a single suite of residential occupancy, or carport roofs (see part 9.).
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to columns used to support, beams carrying loads from not more than 2 wood frame floors where,  the supported length of joists bearing on such beams does not exceed 5 m, and  the live load on any floor does not exceed 2.4 kPa,  beams or header joists carrying loads from not more than 2 levels of wood frame balconies, decks or other accessible exterior platforms, or 1 level and the roof, where,  the supported length of joists bearing on such beams or joists does not exceed 5 m,  the sum of the specified snow load and the load due to use and occupancy does not exceed 4.8 kPa, and  the platform serves only a single suite of residential occupancy, or  carport roofs.

National Sentence Text: Columns for applications other than as described in Sentence 9.17.1.1. shall be designed in accordance with part 4..
P/T Sentence Text: Columns for applications other than as described in Sentence  shall be designed in accordance with Part 4.

National Sentence Text: Columns shall be centrally located on a footing conforming to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Columns shall be centrally located on a footing conforming to Section 9.15.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , columns shall be laterally supported to resist racking directly, or by connection to the supported members. (See Note A-9.17.2.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , columns shall be laterally supported, directly, or  by connection to the supported members. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Columns need not be provided with lateral support as described in Sentence , where the distance from finished ground to the underside of the joists is not more than 600 mm, and the columns support a deck with no superstructure.
P/T Sentence Text: Columns need not be provided with lateral support as described in Sentence  where, the length of the columns are not more than 600 mm measured from the finished ground to the underside of the supported member, and  the columns support a deck with no superstructure.

National Sentence Text: Glued-laminated columns shall conform to part 4.
P/T Sentence Text: Glued-laminated columns shall conform to Section 4.3.

National Sentence Text: In localities where termites are known to occur, clearance between structural wood elements and the finished ground level directly below them shall be not less than 450 mm and, except as provided in Sentence 9.3.2.9.(2), all sides of the supporting elements shall be visible to permit inspection, or structural wood elements, supported by elements in contact with the ground or exposed over bare soil, shall be pressure-treated with a chemical that is toxic to termites.
P/T Sentence Text: Where termites are known to exist, exterior wood columns, such as porch supports, shall be, pressure-treated with a chemical that is toxic to such termites, in accordance with Article 9.3.2.9., or  supported on non-cellulosic material extending not less than 150 mm above the finished ground and shall be located not less than 50 mm from the exterior wall of an adjacent building.

National Sentence Text: Insulation, an air barrier system and a vapour barrier shall be installed in the walls of heated crawl spaces in accordance with part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulation, an air barrier system and a vapour barrier shall be installed in the walls of heated crawl spaces in accordance with Section 9.25.

National Sentence Text: Drainage of the ground cover or floor-on-ground in the crawl space shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Drainage of the ground cover or floor-on-ground in the crawl space shall conform to Subsection 9.16.3.

National Sentence Text: Drains shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Drains shall conform to Section 9.14.

National Article Title: Ground Cover in Heated Crawl Spaces
National Sentence Text: Where a crawl space is heated, a ground cover consisting of not less than 0.15 mm polyethylene sheet conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction shall be installed as part of an air barrier system in accordance with part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.18.6.2. Ground Cover in Heated Crawl Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: Where a crawl space is heated, a ground cover consisting of not less than 0.15 mm polyethylene sheet conforming to CAN/CGSB-51.34-M, "Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet, for Use in Building Construction", shall be installed as part of an air barrier system in accordance with Subsection 9.25.3.

National Article Title: Ground Cover in Heated Crawl Spaces
National Sentence Text: The perimeter of the ground cover required in Sentence  shall be sealed to the foundation wall. (See Notes A-9.13.4., A-9.25.3.4. and 9.25.3.6., and A-9.25.3.6. and .)
P/T Article Title: 9.18.6.2. Ground Cover in Heated Crawl Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: The perimeter of the ground cover required in Sentence  shall be sealed to the foundation wall.

National Sentence Text: The upper portion of roofs described in Sentence 9.19.1.4. shall be ventilated in conformance with Articles 9.19.1.1. to 9.19.1.3.
P/T Sentence Text: The upper portion of roofs described in Sentence  shall be ventilated in conformance with the requirements in Articles 9.19.1.1. to 9.19.1.3.

National Sentence Text: Every attic or roof space shall be provided with an access hatch where the open space in the attic or roof space measures 3 m2 or more in area, 1 m or more in length or width, and 600 mm or more in height over at least the area described in Clauses  and (b).(See Note A-9.19.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Every attic or roof space shall be provided with an access hatch where the attic or roof space, measures not less than,  10 mÃÂ² in area,  1 000 mm in length or width, and  600 mm in height over at least the area described in Subclauses  and (ii), or  contains a fuel-fired appliance.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.20.1.2., this Section applies to unreinforced masonry and masonry veneer walls not in contact with the ground, where the height of the walls constructed on the foundation walls does not exceed 11 m, and the roof or floor assembly above the first storey is not of concrete construction, and flat insulating concrete form walls not in contact with the ground that (see Note A-9.15.1.1.(1)(c)) have a maximum floor-to-floor height of 3 m, are erected in buildings not more than 2 storeys in building height and containing only a single dwelling unit, and are erected in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not greater than 0.4 (see Note A-9.20.1.2.).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.20.1.2., this Section applies to, unreinforced masonry and masonry veneer walls not in contact with the ground, where,  the height of the walls constructed on the foundation walls does not exceed 11 m, and  the roof or floor assembly above the first storey is not of concrete construction, and  flat insulating concrete form walls not in contact with the ground that,  have a maximum floor to floor height of 3 m,  are erected in houses not more than 2 storeys in building height, and  are erected in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not greater than 0.4. (See Appendix Note A-9.15.1.1(1)(c))
Variation Label: Unreinforced Masonry and Masonry Veneer Walls not in Contact with the Ground

National Sentence Text: Permitted tolerances in head and bed joints shall be not more than Â± 5 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Permitted tolerances in head and bed joints shall be -5 mm to +10 mm.

National Sentence Text: Beams shall have even and level bearing and the bearing at end supports shall be not less than 89 mm long, except as stated in the notes to Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-H to 9.23.4.2.-K.
P/T Sentence Text: Steel lintels described in Sentences  and  shall, have even and level bearing and shall have not less than 150 mm length of bearing at end supports, and  bear on masonry, concrete or steel.

National Sentence Text: The thickness of loadbearing interior walls shall be determined on the basis of the maximum lateral support spacing as provided in Sentences 9.20.10.1. and 9.20.10.1.(3).
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness of loadbearing interior walls shall be determined on the basis of the maximum lateral support spacing as provided in Sentences 9.20.10.1. and .

National Sentence Text: The thickness of interior non-loadbearing walls shall be determined on the basis of the maximum lateral support spacing as provided in Sentences 9.20.10.1. and 9.20.10.1.(3), and in any case, not less than 65 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness of interior non-loadbearing walls shall be, determined on the basis of the maximum lateral support spacing as provided in Sentences 9.20.10.1. and , and  in any case, not less than 65 mm.

National Sentence Text: Masonry veneer shall conform to part 4., where the masonry units are required to be individually supported by the structural backing.
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry veneer shall conform to Subsection 4.3.2. where the masonry units are required to be individually supported by the structural backing.

National Sentence Text: Metal ties of the individual rod type shall be corrosion-resistant, have a minimum cross-sectional area of not less than 17.8 mm2 , and have not less than a 50 mm portion bent at right angles at each end.
P/T Sentence Text: Metal ties of the individual rod type shall,  be corrosion-resistant,  have a minimum cross-sectional area of not less than 17.8 mmÃÂ², and  have not less than a 50 mm portion bent at right angles at each end.

National Sentence Text: Floor and roof constructions providing lateral support for walls as required in Sentence  shall be constructed to transfer lateral loads to walls or buttresses approximately at right angles to the laterally supported walls.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor and roof structural elements providing lateral support for walls as required in Sentence  shall be constructed to transfer lateral loads to walls or buttresses approximately at right angles to the laterally supported walls.

National Article Title: Anchorage to Floor or Roof Assemblies where Masonry Walls Require
National Sentence Text: When joists are parallel to the wall, anchors required in Sentence  shall extend across not less than 3 joists.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.11.1. Anchorage of Floor or Roof Assemblies
P/T Sentence Text: When joists are parallel to the wall, anchors required in Sentence  shall extend across no fewer than three joists.

National Sentence Text: Where the foundation wall referred to in Sentence  is unit masonry, it is permitted to be corbelled to meet flush with the inner face of a cavity wall provided the projection of each course does not exceed half the height or one third the thickness of the corbelled unit, and the total corbel does not exceed one third of the foundation wall thickness. (See Note A-9.20.12.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the foundation wall referred to in Sentence  is unit masonry, it is permitted to be corbelled to meet flush with the inner face of a cavity wall provided, the projection of each course does not exceed half the height or one-third the width of the corbelled unit, and  the total corbel does not exceed one-third of the foundation wall thickness. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , where the interior finish of the exterior walls of a building is a type that may be damaged by moisture, exterior masonry walls, other than cavity walls or walls that are protected for their full height by a roof of a carport or porch, shall be covered on the interior surface with sheathing membrane conforming to CAN/CGSB-51.32-M, Sheathing, Membrane, Breather Type, lapped not less than 100 mm at the joints.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , where the interior finish of the exterior walls of a building is a type that may be damaged by moisture, exterior masonry walls, other than cavity walls or walls that are protected for their full height by a roof of a carport or porch, shall be, parged on the interior surface, and  covered with No. 15 breather-type asphalt-saturated paper conforming to CAN/CGSB-51.32-M, "Sheathing, Membrane, Breather Type", and shall be lapped not less than 100 mm at the joints.

National Sentence Text: Where insulation that effectively limits the passage of water is applied by a waterproof adhesive or mortar directly to parged masonry, the requirements for sheathing membrane in Sentence 9.20.13.9. do not apply. (See Note A-9.20.13.9.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the insulation effectively limits the passage of water vapour and is applied by a waterproof adhesive or by mortar directly to the masonry, the requirements for sheathing paper do not apply. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Caulking at Door and Window Frames
National Sentence Text: The junction of door and window frames with masonry shall be caulked in conformance with part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.13.11. Caulking at Door and Window Frames
P/T Sentence Text: The junction of door and window frames with masonry shall be caulked in conformance with Subsection 9.27.4.

National Article Title: Openings in Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
National Sentence Text: Lintels described in Sentence  shall be constructed in accordance with Span Table 9.20.17.4.-A, 9.20.17.4.-B or 9.20.17.4.-C.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.17.4. Openings in Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete
P/T Sentence Text: Lintels described in Sentence  shall be constructed in accordance with Table A-17, A-18 or A-19.

National Article Title: Openings in Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
National Sentence Text: Lintels described in Sentence  over openings wider than 1 200 mm shall be reinforced for shear with 10M stirrups at a maximum spacing of half the distance from the bottom reinforcing bar to the top of the lintel.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.17.4. Openings in Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete
P/T Sentence Text: Lintels described in Sentence  over openings wider than 1.2 m shall be reinforced for shear with 10M stirrups at a maximum spacing of half the distance from the bottom reinforcing bar to the top of the lintel.

National Sentence Text: Above-ground flat insulating concrete form walls shall be protected from precipitation and damage in conformance with part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Above ground flat insulating concrete form walls shall be protected from precipitation and damage in conformance with Section 9.27.

National Sentence Text: Factory-built chimneys serving solid-fuel-burning appliances, and their installation, shall conform to CAN/ULC-S629, 650°C Factory-Built Chimneys. (See Note A-9.33.10.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Factory-built chimneys serving solid fuel-burning appliances, and their installation, shall conform to CAN/ULC-S629-M, "650ÃÂ°C Factory-Built Chimneys". (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title:
Design, Construction and Installation Standard for Solid-Fuel-Burning
Appliances
National Sentence Text: The design, construction and installation, including the provision of combustion air, of solid-fuel-burning appliances and equipment, including stoves, cooktops, ovens and space heaters, shall conform to CSA B365, Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment.
P/T Sentence Text: Flue pipes serving solid fuel-burning stoves, cooktops and space heaters shall conform to CSA B365, "Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment".

National Article Title: Connections of More Than One Appliance
National Sentence Text: Except as required by Article 9.21.2.1., where two or more fuel-burning appliances are connected to the same chimney flue, the connections shall be made as described in Sentences  to  and an adequate draft shall be provided for the connected appliances in conformance with the requirements of applicable provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, with the requirements of the relevant standards listed in Subsection 9.33.10.
P/T Article Title: 9.21.2.2. Connections of More Than One Appliance
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Article 9.21.2.1., two or more fuel-burning appliances are permitted to be connected to the same chimney flue provided adequate draft is maintained for the connected appliances and the connections are made as described in Sentences  and .

National Article Title: Connections of More Than One Appliance
National Sentence Text: Where 2 or more fuel-burning appliances are connected to the same chimney flue, the appliances shall be located on the same storey.
P/T Article Title: 9.21.2.2. Connections of More Than One Appliance
P/T Sentence Text: Where two or more solid fuel-burning appliances are connected to the same chimney flue, the appliances must be located on the same storey.

National Sentence Text: Except for chimneys serving fireplaces, the size of a chimney flue shall conform to the requirements of the appliance installation standards referenced in Sentences 9.33.5.2. and 9.33.5.3.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Except for chimneys serving fireplaces, the size of a chimney flue shall conform to the requirements of the solid fuel-burning appliance installation standard referenced in Sentence 6.2.1.4. and Article 9.33.1.2.

National Sentence Text: Where a chimney flue serves only one appliance, the flue area shall be at least equal to that of the flue pipe connected to it.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a chimney flue serves only one solid fuel-burning appliance, the flue area shall be at least equal to that of the flue pipe connected to it.

National Sentence Text: The size of a chimney flue serving a masonry fireplace shall conform to Table 9.21.2.5.-A or 9.21.2.5.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: The size of a chimney flue serving a masonry fireplace shall be within the allowable range specified in Table 9.21.2.5.A. or Table 9.21.2.5.B.

National Sentence Text: Liners referred to in Sentence 9.21.3.3. shall be not less than 15.9 mm thick and shall be capable of resisting, without softening or cracking, a temperature of 1 100Â°C.
P/T Sentence Text: Liners referred to in Sentence  shall be not less than 15.9 mm thick and shall be capable of resisting, without softening or cracking, a temperature of 1100ÃÂ°C.

National Sentence Text: Unit masonry shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Unit masonry shall conform to Section 9.20.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , chimneys shall be braced in accordance with Subsection 4.3.2. to provide lateral stability under wind loads.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , chimneys shall be braced in accordance with Subsection 4.3.2. to provide stability under wind loads.

National Sentence Text: A cleanout opening with a metal frame and a tight-fitting metal door shall be installed near the base of the chimney flue.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for a chimney flue constructed to serve a masonry fireplace, a cleanout opening with a metal frame and tight-fitting metal door shall be installed near the base of the chimney flue.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise stated in this Section, unit masonry shall conform to part 9. and concrete to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise stated in this Section, unit masonry shall conform to Section 9.20. and concrete to Section 9.3.

National Sentence Text: Footings for masonry and concrete fireplaces shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Footings for masonry and concrete fireplaces shall conform to Section 9.15.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence , fireplaces shall have a noncombustible hearth extending not less than 400 mm in front of the fireplace opening and not less than 200 mm beyond each side of the fireplace opening.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence , fireplaces shall have a noncombustible hearth extending not less than 400 mm in front of the fireplace opening measured from the facing, and not less than 200 mm beyond each side of the fireplace opening.

National Sentence Text: Where the conditions in Sentence  are exceeded for wood constructions, the design of the framing and fastening shall conform to Subsection 4.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the conditions in Sentence  are exceeded for wood construction, the design of the framing and fastening shall conform to Subsection 4.3.1.

National Sentence Text: Wood screws specified in this Section shall conform to ASME B18.6.1, Wood Screws (Inch Series). (See Note A-9.23.3.1.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Wood screws specified in this Section shall conform to ANSI/ASME B18.6.1., "Wood Screws (Inch Series)". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Splitting of wood members shall be minimized by staggering the nails in the direction of the grain and by keeping nails well in from the edges. (See Note A-9.23.3.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Splitting of wood members shall be minimized by staggering the nails in the direction of the grain and by keeping nails well in from the edges. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , nailing of framing shall conform to Table 9.23.3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , nailing of framing shall conform to Table 9.23.3.4.

National Sentence Text: Where the bottom wall plate or sole plate of an exterior wall is not nailed to floor joists, rim joists or blocking in conformance with Table 9.23.3.4., the exterior wall is permitted to be fastened to the floor framing by having plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing extend down over floor framing and fastened to the floor framing by nails or staples conforming to Article 9.23.3.5., or tying thewall framing to the floor framing by galvanized-metal strips 50 mm wide, not less than 0.41 mm thick, spaced not more than 1.2 m apart, and fastened at each end with at least two 63 mm nails.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the bottom wall plate or sole plate of an exterior wall is not nailed to joists or blocking in conformance with Table 9.23.3.4., the exterior wall may be fastened to the floor framing by, having plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing extend down over floor framing and fastened to the floor framing by nails or staples conforming to Article 9.23.3.5., or  tying the wall framing to the floor framing by 50 mm wide galvanized-metal strips,  not less than 0.41 mm in thickness,  spaced not more than 1.2 m apart, and  fastened at each end with at least two 63 mm nails.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.23.3.5. to 9.23.3.5. , fastening of sheathing and subflooring shall conform to Table 9.23.3.5.-A.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence , fastening of sheathing and subflooring shall conform to Table 9.23.3.5.

National Article Title: Spans for Joists, Rafters and Beams
National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence  and Article 9.23.14.10., spans for wood joists and rafters shall conform to the spans shown in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-A to 9.23.4.2.-G for the uniform live loads shown in the Tables. (See Article 9.4.2.2.)
P/T Article Title: 9.23.4.2. Spans for Joists, Rafters and Beams (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence  and Article 9.23.13.10., the spans for wood joists and rafters shall conform to the spans shown in Tables A-1 to A-7 for the uniform live loads shown in the Tables.
Variation Label: Spans for Joists, Rafters and Beams

National Article Title: Spans for Joists, Rafters and Beams
National Sentence Text: Spans for floor joists that are not selected from Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-A and 9.23.4.2.-B and that are required to be designed for the same loading conditions, shall not exceed the design requirements for uniform loading and vibration criteria. (See Note A-9.23.4.2.(2).)
P/T Article Title: 9.23.4.2. Spans for Joists, Rafters and Beams (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Spans for floor joists that are not selected from Tables A-1 and A-2 and that are required to be designed for the same loading conditions, shall not exceed the design requirements for uniform loading and vibration criteria. (See AppendixÃ A.)

National Sentence Text: Where a roof is required to support an additional uniform dead load from roofing materials such as concrete roofing tile, or materials other than as specified in part 9., such as clay roofing tiles, the additional load shall be allowed for by reducing the spans for roof joists and rafters in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-D to 9.23.4.2.-G, or the spacing of the members, and the spans for ridge beams and lintels in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-L and 9.23.12.3.-A to 9.23.12.3.-D.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a roof is required to support an additional uniform dead load from roofing materials such as concrete roofing tile, or materials other than as specified in Section 9.26., such as clay roofing tiles, the additional load shall be allowed for by reducing, the spans for roof joists and rafters in Tables A-4 to A-7, or the spacing of the members, and  the spans for ridge beams and lintels in Tables A-12 to A-16.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to , anchorage shall be provided by embedding the ends of the first floor joists in concrete, or fastening the sill plate to the foundation with not less than 12.7 mm diam anchor bolts spaced not more than 2.4 m o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.23.6.3., anchorage shall be provided by embedding the ends of the first floor joists in concrete, or fastening the sill plate to the foundation with not less than 12.7 mm diam anchor bolts spaced not more than 2.4 m o.c.

National Sentence Text: Anchor bolts referred to in Sentences  to  shall be fastened to the sill plate with nuts and washers, embedded not less than 100 mm in the foundation, and so designed that they may be tightened without withdrawing them from the foundation
P/T Sentence Text: Anchor bolts referred to in Sentence  shall be fastened to the sill plate with nuts and washers and shall be embedded not less than 100 mm in the foundation and so designed that they may be tightened without withdrawing them from the foundation.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.23.6.2. and 9.23.6.2.(3), exterior columns and posts shall be anchored to resist uplift and lateral movement.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , exterior columns and posts shall be anchored to resist uplift and lateral movement.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , where columns or posts support balconies, decks, verandas or other exterior platforms, and the distance from finished ground to the underside of the joists is not more than 600 mm, the columns or posts shall be anchored to the foundation to resist uplift and lateral movement, or the supported joists or beams shall be directly anchored to the ground to resist uplift.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , where columns or posts support balconies, decks, verandas and other exterior platforms, and the columns or posts extend not more than 600 mm above finished ground level, the supported joists or beams shall be, anchored to a foundation to resist uplift and lateral movement, or  directly anchored to the ground to resist uplift.

National Sentence Text: Anchorage is not required for platforms described in Sentence  that are not more than 1 storey in height, are not more than 55 m2 in area, do not support a roof, and are not attached to another structure, unless it can be demonstrated that differential movement will not adversely affect the performance of the structure to which the platform is attached.
P/T Sentence Text: Anchorage is not required for platforms described in Sentence  that, are not more than 1 storey,  are not more than 55 mÃÂ² in area,  do not support a roof, and  are not attached to another structure, unless it can be demonstrated that differential movement will not adversely affect the performance of that structure.

National Sentence Text: Buildings not more than 4.3 m wide and not more than 1 storey in building height that are not anchored in accordance with Sentence 9.23.6.1. shall be anchored in conformance with the requirements of CSA Z240.10.1, Site Preparation, Foundation, and Installation of Buildings.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings not more than 4.3 m wide and not more than 1 storey in building height are permitted to be anchored in conformance with the requirements of CSA Z240.10.1, "Site Preparation, Foundation, and Installation of Buildings".

National Article Title: Levelling and Sealing of Sill Plates
National Sentence Text: The joint between the sill plate for exterior walls and the foundation shall be sealed in accordance with part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: The joint between the sill plate for exterior walls and the foundation shall be sealed in accordance with SubsectionÃ 9.25.3.

National Sentence Text: Beams shall have even and level bearing and the bearing at end supports shall be not less than 89 mm long, except as stated in the notes to Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-H to 9.23.4.2.-K.
P/T Sentence Text: Beams shall have even and level bearing and shall have not less than 89 mm length of bearing at end supports, except as required in notes to Tables A-8 to A-11.

National Sentence Text: Exterior steel beams shall be shop primed.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior steel beams susceptible to corrosion shall be shop primed with rust-inhibitive paint.

National Article Title: Strapping, Bridging, Furring and Ceilings in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-A
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , where strapping is specified in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-A, it shall be not less than 19 mm by 64 mm, nailed to the underside of floor joists, located not more than 2 100 mm from each support or other rows of strapping, and fastened at each end to a sill or header
P/T Article Title: 9.23.9.4. Strapping and Bridging in Tables A-1 and A-2
P/T Sentence Text: Where bridging is specified in Table A-1, it shall consist of not less than 19 mm by 64 mm or 38 mm by 38 mm cross bridging located not more than 2.1 m from each support or other rows of bridging.

National Article Title: Strapping, Bridging, Furring and Ceilings in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-A
National Sentence Text: Where bridging and strapping are specified in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-A, bridging shall comply with Sentence , or consist of 38 mm solid blocking located not more than 2 100 mm from each support or other rows of bridging and securely fastened between the joists, and except as provided in Sentence , strapping shall comply with Sentence  and be installed under the bridging.
P/T Article Title: 9.23.9.4. Strapping and Bridging in Tables A-1 and A-2
P/T Sentence Text: Bridging specified in Table A-2 shall consist of, bridging as described in Sentence , or  38 mm solid blocking located not more than 2.1 m from each support or other rows of bridging and securely fastened between the joists.

National Sentence Text: Blocking referred to in Sentence  for the support of non-loadbearing walls shall be not less than 38 mm by 89 mm lumber, and except as required for the fastening of walls constructed with required braced wall panels, spaced not more than 1.2 m apart.
P/T Sentence Text: Blocking referred to in Sentence  for the support of non-loadbearing walls shall be not less than 38 mm by 89Ã mm lumber, spaced not more than 1.2 m apart.

National Sentence Text: Where cantilevered floor joists described in Sentences  and  are at right angles to the main floor joists, the tail joists in the cantilevered portion shall extend inward away from the cantilever support a distance equal to not less than 6 times the length of the cantilever, and shall be end nailed to an interior doubled header joist in conformance with Table 9.23.3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Where cantilevered floor joists described in Sentences  and  are at right angles to the main floor joists, the tail joists in the cantilevered portion shall,  extend inward away from the cantilever support a distance equal to not less than six times the length of the cantilever, and  shall be end nailed to an interior doubled header joist in conformance with Table 9.23.3.4.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.23.10.3. and 9.23.10.3.(3), all studs shall be placed at right angles to the wall face.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences  and , all studs shall be placed at right angles to the wall face.

National Article Title: Support for Cladding, Sheathing and Finishing Materials
National Sentence Text: Where the vertical edges of interior finishes at wall intersections are supported at vertical intervals by blocking or furring, the vertical distance between such supports shall not exceed the maximum distance between supports specified in part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the vertical edges of interior finishes at wall intersections are supported at vertical intervals by blocking or furring, the vertical distance between such supports shall not exceed the maximum distance between supports specified in Section 9.29.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , where the lintel spanning the opening is not more than 3 m long, studs shall be doubled on each side of the opening so that the inner studs on each side extend from the bottom of the supported lintel to the top of the bottom wall plate, and the outer stud on each side extends from the bottom of the top wall plate to the bottom wall plate.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , studs shall be doubled on each side of openings so that the inner studs extend from the lintel to the bottom wall plate and the outer studs extend from the top wall plates to the bottom wall plate.

National Sentence Text: The top plates in loadbearing walls shall be lapped or otherwise tied at corners and intersecting walls in accordance with Sentence .
P/T Sentence Text: The top plates in loadbearing walls shall be lapped or otherwise suitably tied at corners and intersecting walls in accordance with Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Openings in loadbearing walls greater than the required stud spacing shall be framed with lintels designed to carry the superimposed loads to adjacent studs. (See Note A-9.23.10.6.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Openings in loadbearing walls greater than the required stud spacing shall be framed with lintels designed to carry the superimposed loads to adjacent studs.

National Sentence Text: Spans and sizes of wood lintels shall conform to the spans shown in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-L and 9.23.12.3.-A to 9.23.12.3.-D for buildings of residential occupancy, where the wall studs exceed 38 mm by 64 mm in size, where the spans of supported joists do not exceed 4.9 m, and where the spans of trusses do not exceed 9.8 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Spans and sizes of wood lintels shall conform to the spans shown in Tables A-12 to A-16, for buildings of residential occupancy,  where the wall studs exceed 38 mm by 64 mm in size,  where the spans of supported joists do not exceed 4.9 m, and  where the spans of trusses do not exceed 9.8 m.

National Sentence Text: Ceiling joists referred to in Sentence  shall be fastened together with at least one more nail per joist splice than required for the rafter to joist connection shown in Table 9.23.14.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Ceiling joists referred to in Sentence  shall be fastened together with at least one more nail per joist splice than required for the rafter to joist connection shown in Table 9.23.13.8.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , ceiling joists supporting part of the roof load from the rafters shall be not less than 25 mm greater in depth than required for ceiling joists not supporting part of the roof load.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , ceiling joists supporting part of the roof load from the rafters shall be not less than 25 mm greater in depth than required for ceiling joists not supporting part of the roof load.

National Sentence Text: When the roof slope is 1 in 4 or less, the ceiling joist sizes referred to in Sentence  shall be determined from Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-C to 9.23.4.2.-F and 9.23.4.2.-L for roof joists.
P/T Sentence Text: When the roof slope is 1 in 4 or less, the ceiling joist sizes referred to in Sentence  shall be determined from the span tables for roof joists.

National Sentence Text: Roof trusses which are not designed in accordance with Part 4 shall be capable of supporting a total ceiling load (dead load plus live load ) of 0.35 kPa plus two and two-thirds times the specified live roof load for 24 h, and not exceed the deflections shown in Table 9.23.14.11. when loaded with the ceiling load plus one and one-third times the specified roof snow load for 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Roof trusses that are not designed in accordance with Part 4 shall, be capable of supporting a total ceiling load (dead load plus live of 0.35 kPa plus two and two-thirds times the specified live roof load for 24 h, and  not exceed the deflections shown in Table 9.23.13.11. when loaded with the ceiling load plus one and one-third times the specified roof snow load for 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Where the ability of a truss design to satisfy the requirements of Sentence  is demonstrated by testing, it shall consist of a full scale load test carried out in conformance with CSA S307-M, Load Test Procedure for Wood Roof Trusses for Houses and Small Buildings.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the ability of a truss design to satisfy the requirements of Sentence  is demonstrated by testing, it shall consist of a full scale load test carried out in conformance with CSA S307-M, "Load Test Procedure for Wood Trusses for Houses and Small Buildings".

National Sentence Text: Where the ability of a truss design to satisfy the requirements of Sentence  is demonstrated by analysis, it shall be carried out in accordance with good engineering practice such as that described in TPIC 2014, Truss Design Procedures and Specifications for Light Metal Plate Connected Wood Trusses (Limit States Design).
P/T Sentence Text: Where the ability of a truss design to satisfy the requirements of Sentence  is demonstrated by analysis, it shall be carried out in accordance with good engineering practice such as described in TPIC, "Truss Design Procedures and Specifications for Light Metal Plate Connected Wood Trusses".

National Sentence Text: Subflooring described in Sentence  shall have its upper surface and all edges treated to restrict water absorption, where the subfloor is used in bathrooms, kitchens, laundry rooms or other areas subject to periodic wetting. (See Note A-9.23.15.2.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Subflooring described in Sentence  shall have its upper surface and all edges treated to restrict water absorption where the subfloor is used in bathrooms, kitchens, laundry rooms or other areas subject to periodic wetting. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , subfloors shall conform to either Table 9.23.15.5.-A or 9.23.15.5.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , subfloors shall conform to Table 9.23.14.5.A. or 9.23.14.5.B.

National Sentence Text: Asphalt-coated or asphalt-impregnated fibreboard not less than 11.1 mm thick conforming to CAN/ULC-S706.1, Wood Fibre Insulating Boards for Buildings, is permitted to be used as a roof sheathing over supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c. provided the roofing consists of a continuous sheet of galvanized steel not less than 0.33 mm in thickness, or a continuous sheet of aluminum not less than 0.61 mm in thickness.
P/T Sentence Text: Asphalt-coated or asphalt-impregnated fibreboard not less than 11.1 mm thick conforming to CAN/ULC-S706.1, "Wood Fibre Insulating Boards for Buildings", is permitted to be used as a roof sheathing over supports spaced not more than 406 mm o.c., provided the roofing consists of, a continuous sheet of galvanized steel not less than 0.33 mm in thickness, or  a continuous sheet of aluminum not less than 0.61 mm in thickness.

National Sentence Text: Where wall sheathing is required for the purpose of complying with this Section, it shall conform to either Table 9.23.17.2.-A or 9.23.17.2.-B. (See also Article 9.25.5.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where wall sheathing is required for the purpose of complying with this Section, it shall conform to TableÃ 9.23.16.2.A. or Table 9.23.16.2.B.

National Sentence Text: Where the bottom portions of mansard style roofs are vented, the vertical framing members behind the sloping portions shall be considered on the same basis as exterior wall studs and shall conform to Articles 9.27.3.2. to 9.27.3.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the bottom portions of mansard style roofs are vented, the vertical framing members behind the sloping portions shall be considered on the same basis as exterior wall studs and shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Articles 9.27.3.2. to 9.27.3.6.

National Article Title: Cladding, Sheathing and Interior Finish Required
National Sentence Text: Cladding or sheathing, and interior finish shall be installed on steel stud framing and shall be fastened with screws spaced at the appropriate spacing described in part 9., and penetrating not less than 10 mm through the metal.
P/T Article Title: 9.24.1.5. Cladding, Sheathing and Interior Finish Required
P/T Sentence Text: Cladding or sheathing, and interior finish shall be installed on steel stud framing and shall be fastened with screws, spaced at the appropriate spacing described in Section 9.29., and  penetrating not less than 10 mm through the metal.

National Sentence Text: Where openings for doors in non-loadbearing fire separations required to have a fire-resistance rating do not exceed 1 200 mm in width, the width of steel studs shall be not less than 63 mm, and the metal thickness shall be not less than 0.46 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where openings for doors in non-loadbearing fire separations required to have a fire-resistance rating do not exceed 1.2 m in width, the width of steel studs shall be not less than 63 mm, and  the steel thickness shall be not less than 0.46 mm.

National Sentence Text: Where openings described in Sentence  exceed 1 200 mm in width, the width of steel studs shall be not less than 91 mm, and the metal thickness shall be not less than 0.85 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where openings described in Sentence  exceed 1.2 m in width, the width of steel studs shall be not less than 91 mm, and  the metal thickness shall be not less than 0.85 mm.

National Sentence Text: All walls, ceilings and floors separating heated space from unheated space, the exterior air or the exterior soil shall be provided with sufficient thermal insulation to prevent moisture condensation on their room side during the winter and to ensure comfortable conditions for the occupants. (See Note A-9.1.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: All walls, ceilings and floors separating heated space from unheated space, the exterior air or the exterior soil shall be provided with thermal insulation in conformance with Section 12.2. to prevent moisture condensation on their room side during the winter and to ensure comfortable conditions for the occupants.

National Sentence Text: Except where the insulation provides the principal resistance to air leakage, thermal insulation shall be installed so that at least one face is in full and continuous contact with an element with low air permeance. (See Note A-9.25.2.3.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where the insulation provides the principal resistance to air leakage, thermal insulation shall be installed so that at least one face is in full and continuous contact with an element with low air permeance. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.25.2.4. to 9.25.2.4.(6), loose-fill insulation shall be used on horizontal surfaces only.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to , loose-fill insulation shall be used on horizontal surfaces only.

National Sentence Text: Loose-fill insulation is permitted to be used in wood-frame walls of existing buildings. (See Note A-9.25.2.4.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Loose-fill insulation may be used in wood frame walls of existing buildings. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Wall, ceiling and floor assemblies separating conditioned space from unconditioned space or from the ground shall be constructed so as to include an air barrier system that will provide a continuous barrier to air leakage from the interior of the building into wall, floor, attic or roof spaces, sufficient to prevent excessive moisture condensation in such spaces during the winter, and from the exterior or the ground inward sufficient to prevent moisture condensation on the room side during winter, ensure comfortable conditions for the occupants, and minimize the ingress of soil gas.
P/T Sentence Text: Wall, ceiling and floor assemblies that separate conditioned spaces from unconditioned spaces or from the ground shall be constructed so as to include an air barrier system that will provide a continuous barrier to air leakage, from the interior of the building into wall, floor, attic or roof spaces sufficient to prevent excessive moisture condensation in such spaces during the heating season, and  from the exterior inward sufficient to prevent moisture condensation on the room side during the heating season. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation, the assembly shall be designed according to Part 5. (See Appendix A.).
P/T Sentence Text: Where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation, the assembly shall be designed according to Part 5. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.25.5.1. to 9.25.5.1.(4), sheet and panel-type materials incorporated into assemblies described in Article 9.25.1.1. shall conform to Article 9.25.5.2., where the material has an air leakage characteristic less than 0.1 L/(sÂ·m2) at 75 Pa, and a water vapour permeance less than 60 ng/(PaÂ·sÂ·m2) when measured in accordance with ASTM E 96/E 96M-13 Water Vapor Transmission of Materials using the desiccant method (dry (see Note A-9.25.5.1.(1)(a)(ii)), and the intended use of the interior space where the materials are installed will not result in high moisture generation.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to , sheet and panel-type materials incorporated into assemblies described in Article 9.25.1.1. shall conform to ArticleÃ 9.25.5.2. where, the material has,  an air leakage characteristic less than 0.1 L/(sÃ¢Ëâ¢m2) at 75 Pa, and  a water vapour permeance less than 60 ng/(PaÃ¢Ëâ¢sÃ¢Ëâ¢m2) when measured in accordance with ASTM E96Ã /Ã E96M, "Water Vapor Transmission of Materials", using the desiccant method (dry cup), and (See Appendix A.)  the intended use of the interior space where the materials are installed will not result in high moisture generation. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where a material has a water vapour permeance not less than 30 ng/(Pa s m2) and a thermal resistance not less than 0.7 (m2Â·K)/W and the heating degree-days of the building location are less than 6000, the assembly need not comply with Sentence 9.25.5.1.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Sheet and panel-type materials need not comply with Sentence  where, the material has,  a water vapour permeance not less than 30 ng/(PaÃ¢Ëâ¢sÃ¢Ëâ¢m2), and  a thermal resistance not less than 0.7 (m2Ã¢Ëâ¢K)/W, and  the heating degree-days of the building location, in degrees Celsius, are less than 6 000.

National Sentence Text: For walls, the air space described in Clause  shall comply with Clause 9.27.2.2.(1)(a).
P/T Article Title: 9.25.5.2. Position of Low Permeance Materials (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: For walls, the air space described in Clause  shall be drained and ventilated and shall be not less than 10 mm deep behind the cladding, over the full height and width of the wall.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.26.3.1. and 9.26.3.1.(3), the slopes on which roof coverings may be applied shall conform to Table 9.26.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , the slopes on which roof coverings may be applied shall conform to Table 9.26.3.1.

National Sentence Text: Profiled metal roof cladding systems specifically designed for low-slope applications are permitted to be installed with lower slopes than required by Sentence 9.26.3.1.(1), provided they are installed in conformance with the manufacturerâs written recommendations.
P/T Sentence Text: Profiled metal roof cladding systems specifically designed for low-slope applications are permitted to be installed with lower slopes than required in Sentence , provided they are installed in conformance with the manufacturerÃ¢â¬â¢s written recommendations.

National Sentence Text: Except where back-slope will not adversely affect adjacent supported or supporting constructions due to water ingress, roofs and constructions that effectively serve as roofs shall be constructed with sufficient slope away from exterior walls, and guards that are connected to the roof, or to a construction that effectively serves as a roof, by more than pickets or posts. (See Notes A-9.26.1.1.(1), A-9.26.4.1. and A-9.27.3.8.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where back-slope will not adversely affect adjacent supported or supporting elements due to water ingress, roofs and elements that effectively serve as roofs shall be constructed with sufficient slope away from, exterior walls, and  guards that are connected to the roof, or to an element that effectively serves as a roof, by more than pickets or posts.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.26.3.1. and 9.26.3.1.(3), the slopes on which roof coverings may be applied shall conform to Table 9.26.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: See Sentence 9.26.3.1.(2).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.26.3.1. and 9.26.3.1.(3), the slopes on which roof coverings may be applied shall conform to Table 9.26.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: See Sentence 9.26.3.1.(3).

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence , when underlay is used beneath shingles, it shall be asphalt-saturated sheathing paper weighing not less than 0.195 kg/m2, or No. 15 plain or perforated asphalt-saturated felt.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence , when underlay is used beneath shingles, it shall be, asphalt-saturated sheathing paper weighing not less than 0.195 kg/mÃÂ², or  No. 15 plain or perforated asphalt-saturated felt. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Fasteners referred to in Sentences 9.26.7.4. and 9.26.7.4. shall be located 25 mm to 40 mm from each end of each strip shingle with other fasteners equally spaced between them.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners referred to in Sentences  and  shall be located 25 mm to 40 mm from each end of each strip shingle with other fasteners equally spaced between them.

P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners referred to in Sentences  and  shall be located not less than 12 mm above the tops of the cutouts.

P/T Sentence Text: Eave protection shall conform to Subsection 9.26.5.

P/T Sentence Text: The inner boundary of the drainage plane shall comply with, Articles 9.27.3.2. to 9.27.3.6., or  Subsection 9.27.13.

National Sentence Text: Flashing material and its installation shall comply with Articles 9.27.3.7. and 9.27.3.8.
