P/T Sentence Text: Flashing material and installation shall comply with Articles 9.27.3.7. and 9.27.3.8.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.27.3.4. to 9.27.3.6., at least one layer of sheathing membrane shall be applied beneath cladding.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.27.3.4. to 9.27.3.6., at least one layer of sheathing membrane shall be applied beneath siding, stucco or masonry veneer.

National Sentence Text: Sheathing membrane is permitted to be omitted beneath cladding when the joints in the cladding are formed to effectively prevent the passage of wind and rain in conformance with Sentences 9.27.3.6. or 9.27.3.6.(3), as applicable.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheathing membrane is permitted to be omitted beneath cladding when the joints in the cladding are formed to effectively prevent the passage of wind and rain in conformance with Sentence  or , as applicable.

National Sentence Text: Flashing need not be installed as described in Sentence  where the upper cladding elements overlap the lower cladding elements by not less than 25 mm, where the cladding above and below the joint is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space (see Clause 9.27.2.2.(1)(a)), and the horizontal detail is constructed so as to minimize the ingress of precipitation into the air space, or at horizontal construction joints in stucco, where the joint is finished with an expansion-contraction strip, and the cladding is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space (see Clause 9.27.2.2.(1)(a)).
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing need not be installed as described in Sentence , where the upper cladding elements overlap the lower cladding elements by not less than 25 mm,  where,  the cladding above and below the joint is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space, and  the horizontal detail is constructed so as to minimize ingress of precipitation into the air space, or  at horizontal construction joints in stucco, where,  the joint is finished with an expansion-contraction strip, and  the cladding is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space.

National Sentence Text: Backer rod shall conform to ASTM C 1330, Cylindrical Sealant Backing for Use with Cold Liquid-Applied Sealants. (See Note A-9.27.4.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Backer rod shall conform to ASTM C1330, "Cylindrical Sealant Backing for Use with Cold Liquid-Applied Sealants".

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  to , cladding shall be fastened to the framing members or furring members, or to blocking between the framing members.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences ,  and , cladding shall be fastened to the framing members or furring members, or to blocking between the framing members.

National Sentence Text: When applied without sheathing, furring referred to in Sentence  shall be not less than 19 mm by 64 mm lumber on supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., or 19 mm by 89 mm lumber on supports spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: When applied without sheathing, furring referred to in Sentence  shall be not less than, 19 mm by 64 mm lumber on supports spaced not more than 406 mm o.c., or  19 mm by 89 mm on supports spaced not more than 610 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Furring referred to in Sentence  shall be securely fastened to the framing, and spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Furring referred to in Sentence  shall be, securely fastened to the framing, and  spaced not more than 610 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding referred to in Sentence  shall be protected with batten strips or sealant when the plywood joints are not matched.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding referred to in Sentence  shall be protected with batten strips or caulking when the plywood joints are not matched.

National Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding described in Sentence  shall be protected with batten strips or sealant when the joints are not matched.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding described in Sentence  shall be protected with batten strips or caulking when the joints are not matched.

National Sentence Text: OSB conforming to O-2 grade applied directly to framing or over furring strips shall conform to the thickness shown for plywood in Table 9.27.8.2. (See Note A-9.27.10.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: OSB conforming to O-2 grade applied directly to framing or over furring strips shall conform to the thickness shown for plywood in Table 9.27.8.2. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding described in Sentence  shall be protected with batten strips or sealant when the OSB and waferboard joints are not matched.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding described in Sentence  shall be protected with batten strips or caulking when the OSB and waferboard joints are not matched.

National Sentence Text: Aluminum sheet cladding shall conform to CAN/CGSB-93.1-M, Sheet, Aluminum Alloy, Prefinished, Residential, and shall have a thickness of not less than 0.58 mm, except that siding supported by backing or sheathing shall have a thickness of not less than 0.46 mm. (See Note A-9.27.11.1. and .)
P/T Sentence Text: Aluminum sheet cladding shall conform to CAN/CGSB-93.1-M, "Sheet, Aluminum Alloy, Prefinished, Residential" and shall have a thickness of not less than 0.58 mm, except that siding supported by backing or sheathing shall have a thickness of not less than 0.46 mm. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The attachment of vinyl siding shall conform to the requirements in part 9. for metal siding.
P/T Sentence Text: The attachment of vinyl siding shall conform to the requirements in Subsection 9.27.5. for metal siding.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , this Subsection applies to exterior insulation finish systems  that are covered in the scope of CAN/ULC-S716.1, Exterior Insulation and Finish Systems  - Materials and Systems, and have a geometrically defined drainage cavity with a minimum cavity depth of 10mm and an open area equal to not less than 13% of the area of a full-size EIFS panel. (See Note A-9.27.13.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , this Subsection applies to exterior insulation finish systems that, are covered in the scope of CAN/ULC-S716.1, "Exterior Insulation and Finish Systems  Ã¢â¬" Materials and Systems", and  have a geometrically defined drainage cavity with a minimum cavity depth of 6 mm and an open area equal to not less than 13% of the area of a full-size exterior insulation finish systems panel. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where applied beneath stucco, sheathing shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Where applied beneath stucco, sheathing shall conform to Subsection 9.23.16.

National Sentence Text: Nailing patterns other than those required in Sentence  are permitted to be used provided there are at least 20 fasteners per square metre of wall surface.
P/T Sentence Text: Nailing patterns other than those required in Sentence  are permitted to be used provided there are not fewer than 20 fasteners per square metre of wall surface.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence , for single-layer application on walls, screws shall be spaced not more than 300 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports where the supports are more than 400 mm o.c., or not more than 400 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports where the supports are not more than 400 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence , for single-layer application on walls, screws shall be spaced,  not more than 300 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports where the supports are more than 406 mm o.c., or  not more than 400 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports where the supports are not more than 406 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: In cold weather, heat shall be provided to maintain a temperature not below 10Â°C for 48 h prior to taping and finishing and maintained for not less than 48 h thereafter.
P/T Sentence Text: In cold weather, heat shall be provided to maintain a temperature of not below 10ÃÂ°C for 48 h prior to taping and finishing and maintained for not less than 48 h after that.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.29.6.1. and 9.29.6.1.(3), the minimum thickness of plywood interior finish shall conform to Table 9.29.6.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , the minimum thickness of plywood interior finish shall conform to TableÃ 9.29.6.1.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.29.9.2. and 9.29.9.2.(3), the minimum thickness of O-2 grade OSB used as an interior finish shall conform to that shown for plywood in Table 9.29.6.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , the minimum thickness of O-2 grade OSB used as an interior finish shall conform to that shown for plywood in Table 9.29.6.1.

National Sentence Text: Where water permeable finished flooring in bathrooms, kitchens, public entrance halls and laundry areas is supported by a subfloor of a type that would be damaged by water, such flooring shall be installed over a membrane with a water permeance not exceeding 18 ng/(Pa·s·m2) when tested in accordance with ASTM E 96/E 96M, Water Vapor Transmission of Materials. (See Note A-9.30.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Finished flooring in bathrooms, kitchens, public entrance halls, laundry and general storage areas shall consist of resilient flooring, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings, concrete, terrazzo, ceramic tile, mastic or other types of flooring providing similar degrees of water resistance. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Medical gas piping systems shall conform to part 3.
P/T Sentence Text: Medical gas piping systems shall conform to Subsection 3.7.5.

National Sentence Text: Every dwelling unit shall be supplied with potablewater.
P/T Sentence Text: Every dwelling unit shall be supplied with a water distribution system where a drinking water system is available.

National Sentence Text: Fuel-burning service water heaters shall be connected to a chimney flue conforming to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Fuel-burning service water heaters shall be connected to a chimney flue conforming to Section 9.21.

National Sentence Text: Every residential occupancy shall incorporate provisions for non-heating-season ventilation in accordance with Subsection 9.32.2., and except as required by Sentences  and , if supplied with electrical power and a heating system, provisions for heating-season ventilation in accordance with Part 6.
P/T Sentence Text: Every dwelling unit that is supplied with electrical power shall be provided with a mechanical ventilation system in accordance with Subsection 9.32.3.

National Sentence Text: Every residential occupancy shall incorporate provisions for non-heating-season ventilation in accordance with Subsection 9.32.2., and except as required by Sentences  and , if supplied with electrical power and a heating system, provisions for heating-season ventilation in accordance with Part 6.
P/T Sentence Text: The mechanical ventilation system required in Article 9.32.1.2. shall comply with, Part 6, or  this Subsection for a mechanical ventilation system in a Type I, Type II or Type IV dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: The principal ventilation fan shall be capable of operating at an exhaust capacity complying with Table 9.32.3.3., referred to hereinafter as the normal operating exhaust capacity. (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: A principal exhaust fan shall be installed and shall be rated to provide not less than the capacity given in TableÃ 9.32.3.4.A.

National Sentence Text: Where the principal ventilation fan is controlled by a dehumidistat or other automatic control in addition to the manual switch required by Sentence , the manual switch shall be capable of activating the fan regardless of the setting of the automatic control.
P/T Sentence Text: A principal exhaust fan required under this Article may be controlled by a dehumidistat or other automatic control device where the manual switch required in Sentence  is capable of activating the fan regardless of the setting of the automatic control.

National Sentence Text: Exhaust air intakes for principal ventilation fans located in kitchens, bathrooms and water-closet rooms shall be located in the ceiling or on the wall not less than 2 m above the floor. (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(10).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exhaust air intake for the principal exhaust fan is located in the kitchen, it shall be located in the ceiling or on the wall within 300 mm of the ceiling.

National Sentence Text: Where a kitchen or bathroom is exempted from the requirement to install a supplemental exhaust fan by virtue of Sentences 9.32.3.7. or 9.32.3.7.(3), the principal ventilation fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located in the kitchen or bathroom and wired in parallel with the manual switch required by Sentence 9.32.3.3.(5).
P/T Sentence Text: Where the supplemental exhaust is provided by an exhaust fan serving multiple exhaust air intakes required in rooms described in Sentence , the exhaust fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located in each room served by that exhaust fan and wired in parallel.

National Sentence Text: Where a kitchen or bathroom is exempted from the requirement to install a supplemental exhaust fan by virtue of Sentences 9.32.3.7. or 9.32.3.7.(3), the principal ventilation fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located in the kitchen or bathroom and wired in parallel with the manual switch required by Sentence 9.32.3.3.(5).
P/T Sentence Text: Where the supplemental exhaust is provided by a principal exhaust fan serving multiple exhaust air intakes required in rooms described in Sentence , the principal exhaust fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located in each room served by that exhaust fan and wired in parallel with the manual switch required in Sentence 9.32.3.4.(4).

National Sentence Text: Where a supplemental exhaust fan required by this Article is controlled by a dehumidistat or other automatic control in addition to the manual switch required by Sentence 9.32.3.5.(6), the manual switch shall be capable of activating the fan regardless of the setting of the automatic control.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a supplemental fan required by this Article is controlled by a dehumidistat or other automatic control device in addition to the manual switch required by Sentences  to , the manual switch shall be capable of activating the fan regardless of the setting of the automatic control.

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air
National Sentence Text: Provision shall be made for the free flow of air to or from all rooms by leaving gaps beneath doors, using louvred doors or installing grilles in doors.
P/T Article Title: 9.32.3.7. Ventilation Systems Not Coupled With Forced Air Heating
P/T Sentence Text: Provision shall be made for the free flow of air to all rooms by leaving gaps beneath doors, using louvred doors or installing grilles in doors.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air

National Sentence Text: Mechanical ventilation devices shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 113-10 Fans and Ventilators
P/T Sentence Text: Mechanical ventilation devices shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 113, "Fans and Ventilators".

National Sentence Text: Joints in all ventilation system ducting shall be sealed with mastic, metal foil duct tape or the manufacturers specified sealants.
P/T Sentence Text: All ducting connected to supply and exhaust fans shall be constructed so as to inhibit air leakage at joints.

National Sentence Text: Where a heat recovery ventilator is used to provide one or more required fans, it shall have a low-temperature ventilation reduction factor of not less than 50% when tested in accordance with CSA CAN/CSA-C439-09 Rating the Performance of Heat/Energy-Recovery Ventilators at an outdoor temperature at least as low as the outdoor design temperature for the location where the ventilation system is to be installed, but the outdoor design temperature need not be lower than -25Â°C.
P/T Sentence Text: Heat recovery ventilators shall be designed to provide a minimum 55% sensible heat recovery efficiency when tested to the low temperature thermal and ventilation performance test method set out in CAN/CSA-C439, "Rating the Performance of Heat/Energy-Recovery Ventilators", at a Station 1 test temperature of Ã¢â¬"25ÃÂ°C at an air flow not less than 30 L/s.

National Sentence Text: A means for the free flow of condensate shall be provided in accordance with the manufacturerâs recommendations or, in their absence, a condensate drain of at least 1/2 inch nominal pipe size pitched in the direction of flow and complete with a trap or condensate pump of sufficient capacity shall be installed and connected to the dwelling unitâs drain, waste and vent system.
P/T Sentence Text: Free flow of condensate shall be provided in accordance with the manufacturer's recommendations or, in their absence, a condensate drain of minimum ÃÂ½ inch nominal pipe size pitched in the direction of flow and complete with a trap or condensate pump with sufficient capacity shall be installed.

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Used in Conjunction with Forced Air Heating
National Sentence Text: With the principal ventilation fan operating at its normal operating exhaust capacity, the airflow in the outdoor air supply duct shall be measured and the flow-regulating damper required by Sentence  shall be adjusted and permanently fixed so that the airflow in the outdo r air supply duct is within ±10% of the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the principal ventilation fan.
P/T Sentence Text: When operating at the rate required in Article 9.32.3.4., the supply and exhaust airflow rates of the heat recovery ventilator shall be balanced so that the value of the lesser flow shall be at least 90% of the value of the greater flow, unless otherwise recommended by the manufacturer.

National Sentence Text: The design and installation of heating systems, including requirements for combustion air, and air-conditioning systems other than those described in Sentence  shall conform to Part 6. (See Note A-9.33.1.1. and Subsection 9.10.10.)
P/T Sentence Text: The design and installation of central heating systems, including requirements for combustion air, shall conform to Part 6 and this Section.

National Sentence Text: The required capacity of heating appliances located in a dwelling unit and serving only that dwelling unit, shall be determined in accordance with CSA F280, Determining the Required Capacity of Residential Space Heating and Cooling Appliances, except that the design temperatures shall conform to Subsection 9.33.3.
P/T Sentence Text: The heating and cooling equipment capacities shall be determined in accordance with the requirements of CSA F280, "Determining the Required Capacity of Residential Space Heating and Cooling Appliances".

National Sentence Text: At the outside winter design temperature, required heating facilities shall be capable of maintaining an indoor air temperature of not less than 22Â°C in all living spaces, 18Â°C in unfinished basements, 18Â°C in common service rooms, ancillary spaces and exits in houses with a secondary suite, and 15Â°C in heated crawl spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: At the outside design temperature, required heating facilities shall be capable of maintaining an indoor air temperature of not less than, 22ÃÂ°C in all living spaces,  22ÃÂ°C in unfinished basements, and  15ÃÂ°C in heated crawl spaces.

National Sentence Text: Carbon monoxide  alarms required by this Article shall conform to CAN/CSA-6.19, Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices, be equipped with an integral alarm that satisfies the audibility requirements of CAN/CSA-6.19, Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices, have no disconnect switch between the overcurrent device and the CO alarm, where the CO alarm is powered by the dwelling unit s electrical system, and be mechanically fixed at a height recommended by the manufacturer.
P/T Sentence Text: A carbon monoxide alarm shall be mechanically fixed, at the manufacturerÃ¢â¬â¢s recommended height, or  in the absence of specific instructions, on or near the ceiling.

National Sentence Text: Carbon monoxide  alarms required by this Article shall conform to CAN/CSA-6.19, Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices, be equipped with an integral alarm that satisfies the audibility requirements of CAN/CSA-6.19, Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices, have no disconnect switch between the overcurrent device and the CO alarm, where the CO alarm is powered by the dwelling unit s electrical system, and be mechanically fixed at a height recommended by the manufacturer.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the building is not supplied with electrical power, carbon monoxide alarms are permitted to be battery operated.

National Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall conform to Subsection 9.9.12.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in this Subsection, foundations conforming to Sections 9. and 9. shall be provided for the support of carport and garage super-structures, including that portion beneath garage doors.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in this Subsection, foundations conforming to Sections 9.12. and 9.15. shall be provided for the support of carport and garage super-structures, including that portion beneath garage doors.

National Sentence Text: Detached garages of less than 55 m2 floor area and not more than 1 storey in height that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction are permitted to be supported on wood mud sills, or a 100 mm thick concrete floor slab.
P/T Sentence Text: Detached garages of less than 55 m2 floor area and not more than 1 storey in height that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction are permitted to be supported on, wood mud sills, or  a concrete floor slab having a minimum thickness of not less than 100 mm.

National Article Title: Protection from Damage due to Soil Movement
National Sentence Text: In clay-type soils subject to significant movement with a change in soil moisture content, the foundation depth of carports or garages connected to a dwelling unit directly or by a breezeway shall be approximately the same depth as the main building foundation.
P/T Article Title: 9.35.3.2. Protection from Damage Due to Soil Movement
P/T Sentence Text: In clay-type soils subject to significant movement with a change in soil moisture content, the foundation depth of carports or garages connected to a house or an individual dwelling unit directly or by a breezeway shall be approximately the same depth as the foundation of the main building.
Variation Label: Protection from Damage Due to Soil Movement

National Sentence Text: Columns for garages and carports shall conform to part 9., except that 89 mm by 89 mm wood columns may be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Columns for garages and carports shall conform to Section 9.17., except that 89 mm by 89 mm wood columns may be used.

National Sentence Text: Garage or carport walls and columns shall be anchored to the foundation to resist wind uplift in conformance with part 9., except that where a garage is supported on the surface of the ground, ground anchors shall be provided to resist wind uplift.
P/T Sentence Text: Garage or carport walls and columns shall be anchored to the foundation to resist wind uplift in conformance with Subsection 9.23.6., except that where a garage is supported on the surface of the ground, ground anchors shall be provided to resist wind uplift.

National Article Title: Requirements for Low to Moderate Wind and Seismic Forces
National Sentence Text: Bracing to resist lateral loads shall be designed and constructed as follows: exterior walls shall be clad with panel-type cladding in accordance with Section 9.27., sheathed with plywood, OSB, waferboard, fibreboard, gypsum board or diagonal lumber sheathing complying with Subsection 9.23.17. and fastened in accordance with Table 9.23.3.5.-A, or finished on the interior with a panel-type material in accordance with the requirements of Section 9.29., or in accordance with Articles 9.23.13.4. to 9.23.13.7., Part 4, or good engineering practice such as that provided in CWC 2014, Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction.
Variation Label: Requirements for Low to Moderate Wind and Seismic Forces

National Article Title: Requirements for High Wind and Seismic Forces
National Sentence Text: Bracing to resist lateral loads shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Articles 9.23.13.4. to 9.23.13.7., Part 4, or good engineering practice such as that provided in CWC 2014, Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction.
Variation Label: Requirements for High Wind and Seismic Forces

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.23.13.1. and 9.23.13.2., this Article applies in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 1.8, greater than 0.70 and the lowest exterior framewall supports more than 2 floors in buildings of light construction, or greater than 0.70 and the lowest exterior framewall supports more than 1 floor in buildings of heavy construction, or the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is equal to or greater than 1.20 kPa.

National Article Title: Braced Wall Panels in Braced Wall Bands
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to  and Article 9.23.13.7., braced wall panels shall be located within braced wall bands, extend, as applicable, from the top of the supporting footing, slab or subfloor to the underside of the floor, ceiling or roof framing above, and conform to the spacing and dimensions given in Table 9.23.13.5.
Variation Label: Braced Wall Panels in Braced Wall Bands

National Article Title: Braced Wall Panels in Braced Wall Bands
National Sentence Text: Walls in detached garages and in accessory buildings serving a single dwelling unit, and the front wall of attached garages serving a single dwelling unit need not comply with Sentence  where these walls do not support a floor
Variation Label: Braced Wall Panels in Braced Wall Bands

National Article Title: Braced Wall Panels in Braced Wall Bands
National Sentence Text: Braced wall panels in the braced wall band at the front of an attached garage serving a single dwelling unit need not comply with Sentence , provided the maximum spacing between the front of the garage and the back wall of the garage does not exceed 7.6 m, there is not more than one floor above the garage, not less than 50% of the length of the back wall of the garage is constructed of braced wall panels, and not less than 25% of the length of the side walls is constructed of braced wall panels.
Variation Label: Braced Wall Panels in Braced Wall Bands

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , one exterior wall of the uppermost storey in each orthogonal direction may be set back from the exterior wall of the storey below, provided the adjacent interior braced wall band of the storey below the setback is spaced not more than 10.6 m from the exterior wall of the storey below the setback wall, consists of braced wall panels that are constructed of a wood-based material in conformance with Sentence 9.23.13.6.(2), extends to the foundation, and is not taken into consideration when providing braced wall panels constructed of a wood-based material at spacing intervals of not more than 15 m as per Sentence 9.23.13.6.(6)

Where the exterior wall of the uppermost storey is set back from the exterior wall of the storey below, the exterior walls perpendicular to the setback wall shall have their top plate connected with nails that are spaced at no greater than half the spacing required in Table 9.23.3.4., and have their top plate splices fastened with twice the number of nails specified in Sentences 9.23.11.4. and .

For each orthogonal direction of the building, the length of required braced wall panels of one exterior wall given in Table 9.23.13.5. may be reduced from 40% to no less than 25% of the length of the braced wall band, provided an additional parallel and adjacent interior braced wall band is constructed that is spaced not more than 10.6mfromthe exterior wall, consists of braced wall panels that are constructed of a wood-based material in conformance with Sentence 9.23.13.6. and whose lengths sum to no less than 25% of the length of the braced wall band, extends to the foundation, and is not taken into consideration when providing braced wall panels constructed of a wood-based material at spacing intervals no greater than 15 m as per Sentence 9.23.13.6.(6).

Where the length of required braced wall panels of an exterior wall is reduced as described in Sentence , the ratio of the length of braced wall panels in the respective upper braced wall bands to the length of braced wall panels in the reduced exterior braced wall band shall not exceed 2.

National Article Title: Design of Guards to Not Facilitate Climbing
National Sentence Text: Except for guards in industrial occupancies, guards required by Article 9.8.8.1. that protect a level located more than 4.2 m above the adjacent level shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm abovethe level protected by the guard facilitates climbing. (See Note A-9.8.8.6.(1).)
P/T Article Title:
9.8.8.6.
Guards Designed Not to Facilitate Climbing
P/T Sentence Text: Guards required by Article 9.8.8.1., except those in industrial occupancies and where it can be shown that the location and size of openings do not represent a hazard, shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above the floor or walking surface protected by the guard will facilitate climbing.
Variation Label: Design of Guards to Not Facilitate Climbing

National Sentence Text: Words in italics are defined in Article 1.4.1.2. of Division A.

The barrier-free path of travel on the entrance level described in Sentence  need not be provided where the difference in floor elevation between the entrance level and every dwelling unit exceeds 600 mm.
If resilient material is used to cover the nosing of a stair tread, the minimum extension of the rounded or beveled edge required by Sentence  is permitted to be reduced to 3 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: If resilient material is used to cover the nosing of a stair tread, the minimum radius or bevel required by Sentence  is permitted to be reduced to 3 mm.

National Sentence Text: Children s custodial homes and convalescent homes for ambulatory occupants living as a single housekeeping unit in a dwelling unit with sleeping accommodation for not more than 10 persons are permitted to be classified as residential occupancies (Group C).

The space above a mezzanine conforming to Sentence  is permitted to include an enclosed space whose area does not exceed 10% of the open area of the room in which the mezzanine is located, provided the enclosed space does not obstruct visual communication between the open space above the mezzanine and the room in which it is located.

All gypsum board joints in the assemblies described in Sentences  and  shall conform to CSA A82.31-M, Gypsum Board Application, and penetrations in these assemblies shall be sealed using flexible sealant or tape to maintain the integrity of the smoke-tight barrier over the entire surface.

National Article Title: Exterior Walls Meeting at an Angle
National Sentence Text: Where interior walls between dwelling units, ancillary spaces or common spaces in a house with a secondary suite are not constructed as fire separations, the exteriorwall of each dwelling unit, ancillary space or common space referred to in Sentence  within the 1.2 m distance shall be finished on the interior with not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board.
Variation Label: Exterior Walls Meeting at an Angle

National Article Title: Providing for the Rough-in for a Subfloor Depressurization
National Sentence Text: Floors-on-ground shall be provided with a rough-in for subfloor depressurization consisting of a gas-permeable layer, an inlet and an outlet as described in Sentence , or clean granular material and a pipe as described in Sentence .
Variation Label: Providing for the Rough-in for a Subfloor Depressurization

National Article Title: Providing for the Rough-in for a Subfloor Depressurization
National Sentence Text: The rough-in referred to in Clause  shall include clean granular material installed below the floor-on-ground in accordance with Sentence 9.16.2.1.(1), and a pipe not less than 100 mm in diameter installed through the floor, such that its bottom end opens into the granular layer required Clause  at or near the centre of the floor and not less than 100 mm of granular material projects beyond the terminus of the pipe measured along its axis (see Note A-9.13.4.3.(2) and (b)(i)), its top end permits connection to depressurization equipment and is provided with an airtight cap, and the pipe is clearly labeled near the cap and, if applicable, every 1.8 m and at every change in direction to indicate that it is intended only for the removal of radon from below the floor-on-ground.
Variation Label: Providing for the Rough-in for a Subfloor Depressurization

National Article Title: Ground Cover in Heated Crawl Spaces
National Sentence Text: All penetrations of the ground cover required in Sentence  shall be sealed against air leakage. (See Subsection 9.25.3.)
Variation Label: Ground Cover in Heated Crawl Spaces

National Sentence Text: Chimneys and flue pipes other than those described in Sentences  and  shall conform to Section 6.3.

National Article Title: Connections of More Than One Appliance
National Sentence Text: The connection referred to in Sentence  for a liquid-fuel-burning appliance shall be made below any connections for appliances burning natural gas or propane.
Variation Label: Connections of More Than One Appliance

National Sentence Text: Fastening of roof sheathing and sheathing in required braced wall panels shall conform to Table 9.23.3.5.-B, where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure  is equal to or greater than 0.8 kPa and less than 1.2 kPa and the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not more than 0.90, or the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.70 and not more than 0.90.

Anchor bolts referred to in Sentences  to  shall be fastened to the sill plate with nuts and washers, embedded not less than 100 mm in the foundation, and so designed that they may be tightened without withdrawing them from the foundation.
P/T Sentence Text: Anchor bolts referred to in Sentence  shall be fastened to the sill plate with nuts and washers and shall be embedded not less than 100 mm in the foundation and so designed that they may be tightened without withdrawing them from the foundation.

National Article Title: Air Leakage Control in Masonry Walls
National Sentence Text: The masonry course or flashing described in Sentence  shall be located at the level of the adjoining floor and be sealed to it in accordance with Article 9.25.3.6., or in the absence of a floor, be located at the level of the ground cover required by Article 9.18.6.1. and be sealed to it.
Variation Label: Air Leakage Control in Masonry Walls

National Sentence Text: Aspects of mechanical ventilation systems not specifically described in this Subsection shall be designed, constructed and installed in accordance with good practice such as that described in the ASHRAE Handbooks and Standards, the HRAI Digest, the HRAI Residential Mechanical Ventilation Manual, the Hydronics Institute Manuals and the SMACNA manuals.

Ventilation system equipment installed to meet the requirements of this Section shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturers instructions and recommendations except that, where such instructions and recommendations are in conflict with the requirements of this Subsection, the requirements of this Subsection shall govern.

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air
National Sentence Text: Any tempering device installed to comply with Sentence  shall be installed in accordance with Articles 9.33.4.1. and 9.33.5.2.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air

National Sentence Text: The outdoor makeup air required by Sentence  shall be introduced to a normally unoccupied area in the dwelling unit, or tempered to at least 12°C before being introduced to occupied areas or to a supply duct system.

If the outdoor makeup air required by Sentence  is not tempered upstream of the supply fan, the supply fan required by Sentence  shall be approved by the manufacturer for the handling of untempered outdoor air.

The provision of makeup air as described in Sentence  is not required in a dwelling unit with solid-fuel-burning appliances, where all other fuel-fired appliances are direct-vented or mechanically vented.
Stucco lath shall conform to Table 9.28.4.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco lath shall conform to Table 9.28.4.3.

except where the size of a duct can be determined using Table 9.32.3.11.-A or Table 9.32.3.11.-B, duct sizes shall be determined according to Subsection 9.33.4.

National Sentence Text: Caulked lead drainage joints shall not be used except for cast iron pipe in a drainage system or venting system, or between such pipe and, other ferrous pipe, brass and copper pipe, a caulking ferrule, or a trap standard.

P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel welded joints shall conform to ASME B31.9, "Building Services Piping".

National Sentence Text: Underground piping shall be protected in the absence of the pipe manufacturer s instructions for backfill, by backfill that is (see Note A-2.3.5.1.(1)(a)) placed and compacted to a height of 300 mm over the top of the pipe, and free of stones, boulders, cinders and frozen earth or other material capable of damaging the piping, or by concrete that is at least 75 mm thick and at least 200 mm wider than the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Where piping is installed underground, the backfill shall be carefully placed and tamped to a height of 300 mm over the top of the pipe and shall be free of stones, boulders, cinders and frozen earth.

National Sentence Text: The smoke referred to in Clauses 2.3.6.6. and 2.3.6.6. is permitted to be omitted, provided the roof terminals are closed and the system is subjected to an air pressure equivalent to a 25 mm water column maintained for 15 min without the addition of more air.
P/T Sentence Text: The smoke referred to in Clauses  and  may be omitted provided the roof terminals are closed and the system is subjected to an air pressure equivalent to a 25 mm water column maintained for 15 min without the addition of more air.

National Sentence Text: Fixtures shall be directly connected to a sanitary drainage system, except that drinking fountains are permitted to be indirectly connected to a sanitary drainage system, or connected to a storm drainage system provided that where the system is subject to backflow, a backwater valve is installed in the fountain waste pipe (see Note A-2.4.2.1.(1)(a)(ii)), drainage pans on heating/cooling units are permitted to be connected to a storm drainage system, provided that where the system is subject to backflow, a backwater valve is installed, a floor drain is permitted to be connected to a storm drainage system, provided it is located where it can receive only clear-water waste or storm water, fixtures or appliances that discharge only clear-water waste are permitted to be connected to a storm drainage system or be drained onto a roof, and the following devices shall be indirectly connected to a drainage system: a device for the display, storage, preparation or processing of food or drink, a sterilizer, a device that uses water as a cooling or heating medium, a water operated device, a water treatment device, or a drain or overflow from a water system or a heating system (see Note A-2.4.2.1.(1)(a)(ii)).
P/T Sentence Text: Every fixture shall be directly connected to a sanitary drainage system, except that, drinking fountains may be,  indirectly connected to a sanitary drainage system, or  connected to a storm drainage system provided that where the system is subject to backflow, a check valve is installed in the fountain waste pipe,  laundry plumbing appliances may be indirectly connected to a sanitary drainage system,  fixtures or plumbing appliances, other than floor drains, except as provided in Sentence 7.1.4.2.(2), that discharge only clear water waste may be connected to a storm drainage system,  the following devices shall be indirectly connected to a drainage system:  a device for the display, storage, preparation or processing of food or drink,  a sterilizer,  a device that uses water as a cooling or heating medium,  a water operated device,  a water treatment device,  a drain or overflow from a water system or a heating system, or  a drain line from an HVAC system or equipment, and  floor drains within walk-in coolers shall be connected to a sanitary drainage system,  indirectly with an air break, or  directly with a backwater valve installed on the drainage system before connection to the sanitary building drain.

National Sentence Text: The connection of a soil-or-waste pipe to a nominally horizontal soil-or-waste pipe or to a nominally horizontal offset in a soil-or-waste stack shall be not less than 1.5 m measured horizontally from the bottom of a soil-or-waste stack or from the bottom of the upper vertical section of the soil-or-waste stack that receives a discharge of 30 or more fixture units, or receives a discharge from fixtures located on 2 or more storeys.
P/T Sentence Text: The connection of a soil or waste pipe to a nominally horizontal soil or waste pipe or to a nominally horizontal offset in a soil or waste stack shall be respectively at least 1 500 mm measured horizontally from the bottom of a soil or waste stack or from the bottom of the upper vertical section of the soil or waste stack that, receives a discharge of 30 or more fixture units, or  receives a discharge from fixtures located on 2 or more storeys.

National Sentence Text: Two or more fixture outlet pipes that serve outlets from a single fixture that is listed in Sentence 2.4.2.1. are permitted to be directly connected to a branch that has a size of not less than 1.25 inches, and is terminated above the flood level rim of a directly connected fixture to form an air break.
P/T Sentence Text: Two or more fixture outlet pipes that serve outlets from a single fixture that is listed in Clause 7.4.2.1.(1) may be directly connected to a branch that, has a size of at least 1¼ in., and  is terminated above the flood level rim of a directly connected fixture with a minimum diameter waste of 1½ in. to form an air break.

National Sentence Text: Fixture drains from fixtures that are listed in Subclauses 2.4.2.1. and  are permitted to be directly connected to a pipe that is terminated to form an air break above the flood level rim of a fixture that is directly connected to a sanitary drainage system, and is extended through the roof when fixtures on 3 or more storeys are connected to it (see Note A-2.4.2.1.(1)(a)(ii)).
P/T Sentence Text: Fixture drains from fixtures that are listed in Subclauses 7.4.2.1.(1)(d) and  may be directly connected to a pipe that, is terminated to form an air break above the flood level rim of a fixture that is directly connected to a sanitary drainage system, and  is extended through the roof when fixtures that are on 3 or more storeys are connected to it.

National Sentence Text: Fixture drains from fixtures that are listed in Subclauses 2.4.2.1. to  are permitted to be directly connected to a pipe that is terminated to form an air break above the flood level rim of a fixture that is directly connected to a storm drainage system, and is extended through the roof when fixtures on 3 or more storeys are connected to it.
P/T Sentence Text: Fixture drains from fixtures that are listed in Subclauses 7.4.2.1.(1)(d) to  may be directly connected to a pipe that, is terminated to form an air break above the flood level rim of a fixture that is directly connected to a storm drainage system, and  is extended through the roof when fixtures that are on 3 or more storeys are connected to it.

National Sentence Text: Where a fixture or equipment discharges corrosive or acid waste, it shall discharge into a neutralizing or dilution tank that is connected to the sanitary drainage system through a trap, or an indirect connection.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fixture or equipment discharges corrosive or acid waste, it shall discharge into a neutralizing or diluting tank that is connected to the sanitary drainage system through, a trap, or  indirect connection.

National Sentence Text: One trap is permitted to protect all the trays or compartments of a 2- or 3-compartment sink, a 2-compartment laundry tray, or 2 similar single compartment fixtures located in the same room.
P/T Sentence Text: One trap may protect, all the trays or compartments of a two or three compartment sink,  a two or three compartment laundry tray, or  two similar type single compartment fixtures located in the same room.

National Sentence Text: One trap is permitted to serve a group of floor drains or shower drains, a group of washing machines or a group of laboratory sinks if the fixtures are in the same room, and are not located where they can receive food or other organic matter.
P/T Sentence Text: One trap may serve a group of floor drains and hub drains, a group of shower drains, a group of washing machines or a group of laboratory sinks if the fixtures, are in the same room, and  are not located where they can receive food or other organic matter.

National Sentence Text: Where a storm drainage system is connected to a combined building sewer or a public combined sewer, a trap shall be installed between any opening in the system and the drain or sewer, except that no trap is required if the opening is the upper end of a leader that terminates at a roof that is used only for weather protection, not less than 1 m above or not less than 3.5 m in any other direction from any air inlet, openable window or door, and not less than 1.8 m from a property line.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storm drainage system is connected to a public combined sewer, a trap shall be installed between any opening in the system and the drain or sewer, except that no trap is required if the opening is the upper end of a leader that terminates, at a roof that is used only for weather protection,  not less than 1 000 mm above or not less than 3.5 m in any other direction from any air inlet, openable window or door, and  not less than 1 800 mm from a property line.

National Article Title: Location and Cleanout for Building Traps
National Sentence Text: Where a building trap is installed, it shall be provided with a cleanout fitting on the upstream side of and directly over the trap, be located upstream of the building cleanout, and be located inside the building as close as practical to the place where the building drain leaves the building, or outside the building in a manhole.
P/T Article Title: 7.4.5.4. Location and Cleanout for Building Traps
P/T Sentence Text: Where a building trap is installed, it shall, be provided with a cleanout fitting on the upstream side of and directly over the trap,  be located upstream of the building cleanout, and  be located,  inside the building as close as practical to the place where the building drain leaves the building, or  outside the building in a manhole.

National Article Title: Hydraulic Loads from Roofs or Paved Surfaces
National Sentence Text: Where the height of the parapet is more than 150 mm or exceeds the height of the adjacent wall flashing, emergency roof overflows or scuppers described in Sentence 2.4.10.4. shall be provided, and there shall be a minimum of 2 roof drains.
P/T Article Title: 7.4.10.4. Hydraulic Loads from Roofs or Paved Surfaces
P/T Sentence Text: Where the height of the parapet is more than 150 mm or exceeds the height of the adjacent wall flashing, emergency roof overflows or scuppers described in Clause   shall be provided, and  there shall be a minimum of two roof drains.

National Article Title: Conversion of Fixture Units to Litres
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.4.10.3.(2), where the hydraulic load is to be expressed in litres, fixture units shall be converted as follows: when the number of fixture units is 260 or fewer, the load is 2 360 L, and when the number of fixture units exceeds 260, the load is 9.1 L for each fixture unit.
P/T Article Title: 7.4.10.5. Conversion of Fixture Units to Litres and Gal/min
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 7.4.10.3.(2), where the hydraulic load is to be expressed in litres, fixture units shall be converted as follows: when the number of fixture units is 260 or fewer, the load is 2 360 L, and  when the number of fixture units exceeds 260, the load is 9.1 L for each fixture unit.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.4.10.6.(2), the hydraulic load that is drained to every soil-or-waste stack shall conform to Table 2.4.10.6.-A.
P/T Article Title: 7.4.10.6. Hydraulic Loads to Soil or Waste Pipes
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the hydraulic load that is drained to every soil or waste stack shall conform to Table 7.4.10.6.

National Sentence Text: The hydraulic load that is drained to a branch shall conform to Table 2.4.10.6.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: No horizontal sanitary drainage pipe of less than 3 in. size shall have a fixture loading in excess of that permitted by Table 7.4.10.7.

National Article Title: Hydraulic Loads on Sanitary Building Drains or Sewers
National Sentence Text: The hydraulic load that is drained to a sanitary building drain or a sanitary building sewer shall conform to Table 2.4.10.6.-C.
P/T Article Title: 7.4.10.8. Hydraulic Loads on Sanitary Horizontal Drain
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 7.4.10.7., the hydraulic load that is drained to a horizontal sanitary drainage pipe shall conform to Table 7.4.10.8., based on the size and slope.

National Sentence Text: Drainage systems may require additional protection as provided in Subsections 2.5.4 and 2.5.5 by the installation of branch vents, vent stacks, stack vents, vent headers, fresh air inlets, relief vents, circuit vents, yoke vents, offset relief vents, additional circuit vents, wet vents, individual vents, dual vents, or continuous vents.
P/T Sentence Text: Drainage systems shall be protected by the installation of a system as provided in Subsections 7.5.4. and 7.5.5. by the installation of, additional circuit vents,  branch vents,  circuit vents,  continuous vents,  dual vents,  fresh air inlets,  headers,  individual vents,  offset relief vents,  relief vents,  stack vents,  vent stacks,  wet vents, or  yoke vents.

National Sentence Text: A trap that serves a floor drain need not be protected where the size of the trap is not less than 3 inches, the length of the fixture drain is not less than 450 mm, and the fall on the fixture drain does not exceed its size.
P/T Sentence Text: A trap that serves a floor drain or hub drain need not be protected by a vent pipe separately where, the size of the trap is not less than 3 in.,  the length of the fixture drain is not less than 450 mm,  the fall on the fixture drain does not exceed its size, and  the trap is connected to a horizontal drainage pipe that terminates at its upstream end in a 3 in. stack.

National Sentence Text: A soil-or-waste stack that has a nominally horizontal offset more than 1.5 m long and above which the upper vertical portion of the stack passes through more than 2 storeys and receives a hydraulic load of more than 100 fixture units shall be vented by an offset relief vent connected to the vertical section immediately above the offset and by another offset relief vent connected to the lower vertical section at or above the highest soil-or-waste pipe connection, or extended as a vertical continuation of the lower section.
P/T Sentence Text: A soil or waste stack that has a nominally horizontal offset more than 1 500 mm long and above which the upper vertical portion of the stack passes through more than 2 storeys and receives a hydraulic load of more than 100 fixture units shall be vented by an offset relief vent connected to the vertical section immediately above the offset, and by another offset relief vent, connected to the lower vertical section at or above the highest soil or waste pipe connection, or  extended as a vertical continuation of the lower section.

National Sentence Text: The trap arm of a fixture that has a hydraulic load of not more than 1½ fixture units may be connected to the vertical section of a circuit vent, additional circuit vent, offset relief vent or yoke vent, provided not more than 2 fixtures are connected to the vent pipe, where 2 fixtures are connected to the vent pipe, the connection is made by means of a double sanitary T fitting, and the section of the vent pipe that acts as a wet vent is not less than 2 inches in size.
P/T Sentence Text: The trap arm of a fixture that has a hydraulic load of not more than 1½ fixture units may be connected to the vertical section of a circuit vent, additional circuit vent, offset relief vent or yoke vent, provided that, not more than two fixtures are connected to the vent pipe,  where two fixtures are connected to the vent pipe, the connection is by means of a double fitting, in accordance with Table 7.2.4.5., and  the section of the vent pipe that acts as a wet vent conforms to the requirements regarding wet vents.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 2.5.6.3. and 2.5.6.3.(3), vent pipes that protect a fixture trap shall be located so that the developed length of the trap arm is not less than twice the size of the fixture drain, the total fall of the trap arm is not greater than its inside diameter, and the trap arm does not have a cumulative change in direction of more than 135°.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , a vent pipe that protects a fixture trap shall be located so that, the developed length of the trap arm is not less than twice the size of the fixture drain,  the total fall of the trap arm is not greater than its inside diameter, and  the trap arm does not have a cumulative change in direction of more than 135°.

National Sentence Text: A vent pipe that protects a water closet or any other fixture that also depends on siphonic action for its proper functioning shall be located so that the distance between the connections of the fixture drain to the fixture and the vent pipe does not exceed 1 m in the vertical plane, and 3 m in the horizontal plane.
P/T Sentence Text: A vent pipe that protects a water closet or any other fixture that also depends on siphonic action for its proper functioning shall be located so that the distance between the connections of the fixture drain to the fixture and the vent pipe shall not exceed,  1 000 mm in the vertical plane, and  3 m in the horizontal plane.

National Sentence Text: Except for a fresh air inlet, where a vent pipe is terminated in outside air, the terminal shall be located not less than 1 m above and not less than 3.5 m in any other direction from every air inlet, openable window or door, not less than 2 m above and not less than 3.5 m in any other direction from a roof that supports an occupancy, not less than 2 m above ground, and not less than 1.8 m from every property line.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for a fresh air inlet, where a vent pipe is terminated in open air, the terminal shall be located, not less than 1 000 mm above or not less than 3.5 m in any other direction from every air inlet, openable window or door,  not less than 2 000 mm above or not less than 3.5 m in any other direction from a roof that supports an occupancy, and  not less than 2 000 mm above ground.

National Sentence Text: Where a vent pipe passes through a roof and may be subject to frost closure, it shall be protected from frost closure by increasing its diameter at least one size, but not less than 3 inches in size, immediately before it penetrates the roof, insulating the pipe, or protecting it in some other manner.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a vent pipe passes through a roof or an outside wall of a building, it shall be protected from frost closure by increasing its diameter at least one size, but not less than 3 in. in size, immediately before it penetrates the roof or the wall.

National Article Title: Additional Circuit Vents and Relief Vents
National Sentence Text: The size of the soil-or-waste pipe acting as a relief vent in accordance with Sentence 2.5.3.1. shall be in conformance with Tables 2.4.10.6.-A, 2.4.10.6.-B or 2.5.8.1., and Article 2.5.7.1., whichever size is the largest considering the hydraulic load drained into the soil-or-waste pipe.
P/T Article Title: 7.5.7.3. Additional Circuit Vents and Relief Vents
P/T Sentence Text: The size of the soil or waste pipe acting as a relief vent in accordance with Sentence 7.5.3.1. shall be in conformance with Table 7.4.10.6., 7.4.10.7. or 7.5.8.1. or Article 7.5.7.1., whichever size is the largest considering the hydraulic load drained into the soil or waste pipe.

National Sentence Text: A pressure-relief valve and temperature-relief valve may be combined where Sentences  and  are complied with.
P/T Sentence Text: A pressure relief valve and temperature relief valve may be combined where Sentences  and  are complied with.

National Sentence Text: Pipes that convey water from a temperature-relief, pressure-relief or combined temperature- and pressure-relief valve shall be of a size at least equal to the size of the outlet of the valve, be rigid, slope downward from the valve, and terminate with an indirect connection above a floor drain, sump, or other safe location, with an air break of not more than 300 mm, have no thread at its outlet, and be capable of operating at a temperature of not less than 99°C.
P/T Sentence Text: Every pipe that conveys water from a temperature relief, pressure relief, or a combined temperature and pressure relief valve shall, be of a size at least equal to the size of the outlet of the valve,  be rigid, slope downward from the valve, and,  terminate with an indirect connection above a floor drain, sump or other safe location, with an air break of not more than 300 mm, or  terminate at a distance not less than 150 mm and not more than 300 mm from a floor and discharge vertically down,  have no thread at its outlet, and  be capable of operating at a temperature of not less than 99°C.

National Sentence Text: The temperature-relief valve required in Clause  shall have a temperature-sensing element located within the top 150 mm of the tank, and be designed to open and discharge sufficient water to keep the temperature of the water in the tank from exceeding 99°C under all operating conditions.
P/T Sentence Text: The temperature relief valve required in Clause  shall, have a temperature sensing element located within the top 150 mm of the tank, and  be designed to open and discharge sufficient water to keep the temperature of the water in the tank from exceeding 99°C under all operating conditions.

National Sentence Text: Provision shall be made to protect the water distribution system from the adverse effects of water hammer. (See Note A-2.6.1.9.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Provision shall be made to protect the water distribution system from the adverse effects of water hammer. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where thermal expansion can occur, protection shall be provided for check valves required by Article 2.6.1.5., backflow preventers required by Sentence 2.6.2.1.(3), and pressure-reducing valves required by Article 2.6.3.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Protection against thermal expansion shall be required when a check valve is required by Article 7.6.1.10., a backflow preventer is required by Article 7.6.2.2., or a pressure reducing valve is required by Article 7.6.3.3. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Backflow preventers shall be selected and installed in conformance with CSA B64.10, Selection and Installation of Backflow Preventers (See Note A-2.6.2.1.(3).)

Except as required by Sentence 2.6.2.4.(4), potable water system connections to fire sprinkler and standpipe systems shall be protected against backflow caused by back-siphonage or back pressure in conformance with Clauses 2.6.2.4. to 2.6.2.4.(2): residential partial flow-through fire sprinkler/standpipe systems in which the pipes and fittings are constructed of potable water system materials shall be protected by a dual check valve backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.6.1-11 Dual Check Valve Backflow Preventers for Fire Protection Systems  Class 1 fire sprinkler/standpipe systems shall be protected by a single check valve backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.9, Single Check Valve Backflow Preventers for Fire Protection Systems  provided that the systems do not use antifreeze or other additives of any kind and that all pipes and fittings are constructed of potable water system materials, Class 1 fire sprinkler/standpipe systems not covered by Sentence 2.6.2.4. as well as Class 2 and Class 3 fire sprinkler/standpipe systems shall be protected by a double check valve backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.5.1, Double Check Valve Backflow Preventers for Fire Protection Systems  provided that the systems do not use antifreeze or other additives of any kind, Class 1, Class 2 and Class 3 fire sprinkler/standpipe systems in which antifreeze or other additives are used shall be protected by a reduced pressure principle backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.4.1, Reduced Pressure Principle Backflow Preventers for Fire Protection Systems  installed on the portion of the system that uses the additives and the balance of the system shall be protected as required by Sentence 2.6.2.4. or 2.6.2.4.(2), Class 4 and Class 5 fire sprinkler/standpipe systems shall be protected by a reduced pressure principle backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.4.1, Reduced Pressure Principle Backflow Preventers for Fire Protection Systems  or Class 6 fire sprinkler/standpipe systems shall be protected by a double check valve backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.5.1, Double Check Valve Backflow Preventers for Fire Protection Systems  or where a potentially severe health hazard may be caused by backflow, by a reduced pressure principle backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.4.1, Reduced Pressure Principle Backflow Preventers for Fire Protection Systems (RPF)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence , potable water system connections to fire sprinkler and standpipe systems shall be protected against backflow caused by back-siphonage or back or  where a severe hazard may be caused by backflow, by a reduced pressure principle backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.4.1, "Reduced Pressure Principle Backflow Preventers for Fire Protection Systems (RPF)", and  backflow preventers on fire sprinkler and standpipe systems shall be selected and installed in conformance with Table 7.6.2.4.

National Sentence Text: Where a reduced pressure principle backflow preventer is required on a water service pipe at a fire service connection located on the same premises as the fire service pipe in Class 3, 4, 5 and 6 fire sprinkler/standpipe systems, a reduced pressure principle backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.4.1, Reduced Pressure Principle Backflow Preventers for Fire Protection Systems  shall also be required on the fire service connection.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a reduced pressure principle backflow preventer is required on the water service pipe at a service connection located on the same premises as the fire service main in Class 3, 4, 5 and 6 fire sprinkler/standpipe systems, a reduced pressure principle backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.4.1, Reduced Pressure Principle Backflow Preventers for Fire Protection Systems  , shall also be provided on the fire service connection.

National Sentence Text: Where an atmospheric vacuum breaker is installed, it shall be located on the downstream side of the fixture control valve or faucet so that it will be subject to water supply pressure only when the valve or faucet is open, and for periods of continuous use not exceeding 12 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an atmospheric vacuum breaker is installed, it shall be located on the downstream side of the fixture control valve or faucet so that it will be subject to water supply pressure, only when the fixture control valve or faucet is open, and  for periods of use not to exceed 12 h continuous.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.6.3.2.(3), the hydraulic load of a fixture or device that is listed in Table 2.6.3.2.-A shall be the number of fixture units given in the Table.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the hydraulic load of a fixture or device that is listed in Table 7.6.3.2.A. shall be the number of fixture units given in the Table.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 2.6.3.2. and 2.6.3.2.(3), the hydraulic load of a fixture that is not listed in Table 2.6.3.2.-A is the number of fixture units listed in Table 2.6.3.2.-D.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , the hydraulic load of a fixture that is not listed in Table 7.6.3.2.A. is the number of fixture units listed in Table 7.6.3.2.D.

National Sentence Text: The hydraulic load of urinals and water closets with direct flush valves shall be the number of fixture units listed in Tables 2.6.3.2.-B and 2.6.3.2.-C. (See Note A-2.6.3.2.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: The hydraulic load of urinals and water closets with direct flush valves shall be the number of fixture units listed in Tables 7.6.3.2.B. and 7.6.3.2.C.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.6.3.4.(3), the size of a supply pipe that serves a fixture shall conform to Table 2.6.3.2.-A.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , the size of a supply pipe that serves a fixture or device shall conform to Table 7.6.3.2.A.

National Sentence Text: Where both hot and cold water is supplied to fixtures in residential buildings containing one or two dwelling units or row houses with separate water service pipes, the water system may be sized in accordance with Table 2.6.3.4., where the hydraulic loads for maximum separate demands on water distribution system piping are not less than 100% of the total hydraulic load of the fixture units given in Table 2.6.3.2.-A, 2.6.3.2.-B, 2.6.3.2.-C or 2.6.3.2.-D for private use, the minimum water pressure at the entry to the building is 200 kPa, and the total maximum length of water system is 90 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Where both hot and cold water is supplied to fixtures in residential buildings containing more than one dwelling unit, the water system may be sized in accordance with Table 7.6.3.4. provided,  the hydraulic loads for maximum separate demands on water distribution system piping are not less than 100% of the total hydraulic load of the fixture units given in Tables 7.6.3.2.A., 7.6.3.2.B., 7.6.3.2.C. and 7.6.3.2.D. for private use,  the minimum water pressure at the entry to the building is 200 kPa, and  the total maximum length of the water system is 90 m. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: An outlet from a non-potable water system shall not be located where it can discharge into a sink or lavatory, a fixture into which an outlet from a potable water system is discharged, or a fixture that is used for the preparation, handling or dispensing of food, drink or products that are intended for human consumption.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 7.1.5.3.(3), an outlet from a non-potable water system shall not be located where it can discharge into, a sink or lavatory,  a fixture into which an outlet from a potable water system is discharged, or  a fixture that is used for a purpose related to the preparation, handling or dispensing of food, drink or products that are intended for human consumption.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Sentence 1.2.1.1.(1), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in Table 2.8.1.1. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)

P/T Sentence Text: In a building under demolition that is over 84 m in height, the primary water supply serving the standpipe system, including fire pumps, shall be maintained in operating condition.
Except as permitted in Sentence , the maximum travel distance from the bottom of an unenclosed stair to an exit along a main aisle on the ground floor level shall not exceed 45 m.
