Keys to operate the switches required in Sentences  and  shall be located at, the annunciator required in Clause 3.13.5.5.(1)(a), and the collector s booth designated in Clause 3.13.5.5.(1)(b).
Except as provided in Sentence , all buildings shall be designed to conform to the CO2e emission requirements set out in MMA Supplementary Standard SB-10, "Energy Efficiency Requirements".

P/T Article Title: 11.4.3.4. Change in Major Occupancy (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Sentence 11.4.2.3.(4), upgrading of the fire separations shall be required in conformance with the applicable requirements of Article 3.1.3.1. and Table 11.4.3.4.B.

Despite Sentence , in a building not greater than 6 storeys in building height, a sprinkler system may be installed in accordance with NFPA 13R, "Standard for the Installation of Sprinkler Systems in Residential Occupancies up to and Including Four Stories in Height".

In a building containing an interconnected floor space,  waterflow alarm signals from sprinkler systems shall be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.8.(4), and  sprinkler systems shall be electrically supervised as required by Sentence 3.2.4.10.(3).
If plugs or caps are missing, the fire department connections shall be examined for obstructions, back-flushed when conditions warrant and the plugs or caps replaced.

Prior to backfilling, the stone layer required by Clause  shall be protected in such a manner so as to prevent soil or leaching bed fill from entering the stone by completely covering it with, untreated building paper, or  a permeable geo-textile fabric.
The surface of the ground in the area of the cesspool shall be graded such that surface drainage in the area will be diverted away from the cesspool.
Make-up water may be supplied to the non-potable water system by, a reduced pressure backflow preventer, or  an air gap.
Play activity rooms in a child care facility and work areas in live/work units shall have one or more windows that conform to Clause (a).

A Life Safety Study is a proposal to the Chief Fire Official that consists of a detailed assessment of the life safety performance requirements, clearly identifying items not meeting the requirements of this Part, a detailed description of how an acceptable level of life safety can be achieved, and a detailed time schedule to implement the provisions of Clause (b).

Exit signs required by Sentence  shall have the word "EXIT" in block letters and such letters shall be internally or externally illuminated, coloured red on an opaque or contrasting field, and at least 115 mm high with a 19 mm stroke.
A screw cap or test cap shall not be used as a cleanout plug or cover.
At least one egress doorway shall be located within 23 m from any point in the dispensing room.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: The slab shall be reinforced with 10M bars spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. in each direction, with 30 mm clear cover from the bottom of the slab to the first layer of bars, and the second layer of bars laid directly on top of the lower layer in the opposite direction.
A quench tank shall be designed so that the maximum workload is incapable of raising the working temperature of the cooling medium to within 28°C of its flash point.
The requirements in Section 5.13 for dip tanks shall also apply to flow-coating operations described in Sentence .
Except as provided in Sentence , escalators conforming to the requirements of Sentences 3.13.4.5. and 3.13.4.6. shall be acceptable as part of a required means of egress in a rapid transit station.

Where sleeping accommodation or meeting rooms are not provided in the basement, an existing fire separation between the first storey and basement is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence  where  the basement is sprinklered,  the building contains not more than four guest suites and provides sleeping accommodation for not more than 10 persons, and  interconnected smoke alarms are installed in conformance with Clause 9.9.4.1.(3)(c),  doors connecting the basement and first storey have a fire-protection rating not less than 20 min and are equipped with self-closing and latching devices, and  fire stopping of the wall space at the basement level is in conformance with Article 9.10.15.3. of the 1994 Building Code, or  the building is 1 storey in building height, not more than 600 m2 in building area, and  each guest suite has direct access to the outdoors by a door near ground level,  doors connecting the basement and first storey have a fire-protection rating not less than 20 min and are equipped with self-closing and latching devices,  fire stopping of the wall space at the basement level is in accordance with Article 9.10.15.3. of the 1994 Building Code, and  an approved early warning system is installed consisting of fire detectors in the basement interconnected with alarm signalling devices that are audible in all guest suites.

Subject to Sentence , a tank that is used as a treatment unit in a Class 4 sewage system or a holding tank in a Class 5 sewage system shall conform to the requirements of CSA B66, "Design, Material, and Manufacturing Requirements for Prefabricated Septic Tanks and Sewage Holding Tanks".

In this Part, Building system means a combination of elements or components that form a complete major division of construction in the design of a building or part of a building, including a structural or framing system, a waterproofing system, a drainage system, an exterior cladding system, a roofing system, a window system, a partition system, a corridor system, a stair system, a fire alarm and detection system, a sprinkler system or a heating, ventilation or air-conditioning system, a foundation system, a standpipe and hose system, a flooring system, a plumbing system, a sewage system or an electrical system.
Waste cellulose nitrate plastic materials such as shavings, chips, turnings, sawdust edgings and trimmings shall be kept under water in metal receptacles until removed from the premises.

P/T Article Title: Buildings over 4 storeys but not more than 6 storeys
P/T Sentence Text: Where only the roof assembly is of combustible construction, the building is deemed to be in compliance with Clause  the ceiling membrane has a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min and the attic space is fire stopped in accordance with Article 3.1.11.5. of the 1994 Building Code, the roof assembly is of heavy timber construction in conformance with Article 3.1.4.6. of the 1994 Building Code, or the top storey and attic space are sprinklered.
For the purpose of this Article and Sentences 11.4.2.1. and 11.4.2.5.(4), the change of use set out in Clauses  to  is also deemed to constitute a change in major occupancy.
The occupant load for calculation of the number and width of access to exits and exits referred to in this Section shall be determined in accordance with Subsection 3.1.16. of the 1994 Building Code.

P/T Article Title: 3.11.5.2. Public Pools in Group B, Division 2 or 3 Major Occupancies
P/T Sentence Text: Despite Sentence 3.11.3.1.(25), a warning notice, on which are printed in letters at least 150 mm high the words CAUTION NO DIVING, shall be posted conspicuously on each wall or fence line enclosing a pool described in Sentence .
This Article sets out the simplified method for calculating the ASTC ratings of separating assemblies and adjoining construction referred to in Subclause 5.8.1.2.(2)(b)(ii).

An annunciator shall be installed, in a location that is readily accessible to firefighters entering the building, and in the rapid transit station, in a designated collector s booth, or within viewing distance of a designated collector s booth.
For fires involving combustible metals, extinguishers or extinguishing agents with Class D fire ratings suitable for the combustible metal shall be provided.

Despite Clause (a), the performance level of an existing building is reduced where proposed construction will result in the change of the major occupancy of all or part of an existing building to a Group C major occupancy in a building over 3 storeys in building height, except in a building conforming to Subclause 3.2.2.44.(1)(a) and having an egress facility conforming to Sentence 3.3.4.4.(8).
Sentence  does not apply to a fuel-fired appliance that serves only one bedroom.

A privy vault or a pail privy shall be constructed in the following manner: the container or structure that is to be used for the holding or storage of sanitary sewage shall be watertight and made of a material that can be easily cleaned,  the soil or leaching bed fill around the base of the sides of the superstructure shall be raised or mounded to a height of at least 150 mm above ground level, and  the surface of the ground in the area of the privy vault or pail privy shall be so graded that surface drainage will be diverted away from the privy.
Steel beams supporting masonry veneer and wood stud walls above openings shall conform to Table 9.20.5.2.C.
Fuel-fired appliances shall be enclosed in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

In anaesthetizing locations, electrical systems shall be designed, constructed, installed and tested in conformance with CSA Z32, "Electrical Safety and Essential Electrical Systems in Health Care Facilities".

P/T Article Title: 7.6.2.5. Backflow from Buildings with a Solar Domestic Hot Water System
P/T Sentence Text: Where a solar domestic hot water system includes a single wall heat exchanger and contains only a relatively harmless heat transfer fluid as described in CAN/CSA-F379.1, "Packaged Solar Domestic Hot Water Systems (Liquid-to-Liquid Heat for All-Season Use", the backflow prevention required in Sentence  is permitted to be a dual check valve backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.3, "Dual Check Valve Backflow Preventers with Atmospheric Port (DCAP)".
Flashing shall be of material specified in Article 7.2.10.14. and on a shingled roof shall have a minimum dimension of 500 mm by 500 mm.
Sawdust, chips and other waste material shall not be accumulated in piling areas in storage yards.
Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Subsection 11.4.2., compensating construction shall be carried out in accordance with this Subsection.
Fire separations required under this Section to have a fire-resistance rating shall comply with Subsection 3.1.7. and Articles 3.1.8.1., 3.1.8.3., and 3.5.4.2. of the 1990 Building Code.
A flashing may be omitted when the masonry at the sill of a wall opening or the top of a wall is protected by an impervious non-jointed masonry coping that conforms to Article 9.20.13.12.

Where openings in the vertical service space, including the top and bottom, are sealed with noncombustible materials having the same fire-resistance rating as the existing construction, the vertical service space is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence .
The test prescribed in Article 6.5.5.5. shall be conducted after any sprinkler system control valve has been operated.
Heavy timber construction that complies with Article 3.1.4.6. of the 1990 Building Code is deemed to have a 45 min fire-resistance rating.
Coating operations referred to in Sentence  shall be performed in  ventilated and enclosed powder-coating rooms of noncombustible construction, or  spray booths.
In a retirement home, a dead end public corridor is permitted provided it is not more than 3 m long.
Not more than 50% of the total perimeter of a public spa may be replaced by one or more ramps that permit a bather seated in a wheelchair to enter the water with or without the wheelchair.
Except for suite doors opening directly to the exterior, every exit serving a hotel shall have an exit sign placed over it or adjacent to it.

P/T Article Title: Fire separations between bedrooms and corridors
P/T Sentence Text: Corridors serving bedrooms shall be separated from adjacent rooms, except sitting areas, lounges, nurses stations and washrooms, by fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

Fire detectors shall be installed in storage rooms, locker rooms, service rooms, machinery rooms, heating rooms, incinerator rooms, linen and refuse chute intake compartments, janitors" closets and refuse storage rooms, at the tops of elevator shafts and exit stair shafts and in any room or area where hazardous or combustible materials may be used or stored.

Where a door from a service room opens onto a means of egress less than 5 m wide, the service room shall be sprinklered, or there shall be a vestibule between the service room and the means of egress.
Where a rapid transit station is not staffed during operating hours, a washroom is not required in the station.
Ammonium nitrate shall be stored only in buildings equipped with an automatic sprinkler system installed in conformance with NFPA 13, "Standard for the Installation of Sprinkler Systems".

Compressed gas stored in accordance with NFPA 55, "Standard for the Storage, Use and Handling of Compressed Gases and Cryogenic Fluids in Portable and Stationary Containers, Cylinders and Tanks", is deemed to comply with Subsection 5.6.2.

P/T Article Title: 3.13.4.3. Number and Location of Means of Egress
P/T Sentence Text: Where a continuous level walking surface is provided between two adjacent platforms, they may be considered as one platform for the purpose of conforming to this Subsection.
All areas where automobile undercoating is used shall be kept clean of undercoating deposits and refuse, which shall be placed in covered metal receptacles.
Sprinkler protection shall be provided under all platforms and walkways.

P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.10. Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used Underground
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Clauses  and (i), plastic pipe used as described in Sentence  shall have a stiffness equal or greater than 320 kPa.

P/T Article Title: 3.2.2.48A. Group C, Retirement Home, Any Height, Any Area,
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.48B. to 3.2.2.48E., a retirement home shall conform to Sentence .

Areas where cellulose nitrate plastic finished products are stored shall be ventilated so that any decomposition gases produced by the plastics will be vented outdoors to an area where they will not re-enter the building.
An approved record shall be kept of inspections of each system.
Despite Sentence , where a building is 3 storeys in building height, the third storey shall be served by at least two exits unless approved alternative measures are used.
A camp for housing of workers shall have a minimum area of 3.72 mÃÂ² per employee in every room used for sleeping purposes.
Bottom drains from dip tanks shall be trapped and shall discharge to a closed, vented salvage tank.
A Type B dispersal bed shall not be located in an area that has an average slope that exceeds one unit vertically to seven units horizontally.
For the purposes of Sentence , reduction of performance level shall be determined in accordance with Subsection 11.4.2.
Salvage tanks shall be provided with vent pipes that meet the requirements of Subsection 4.3.5. for aboveground storage tanks or Subsection 4.3.10. for underground storage tanks.
This Subsection does not apply to the bulk storage of unpackaged grain, coal or similar commodities.
Except as permitted in Sentences  and , every walkway or platform level shall be provided with no fewer than two exits conforming to Section 3.4.
Reference shall be made to Parts 2, 3, 4 and 5 for requirements of portable extinguishers for flammable liquids and combustible liquids, hazardous materials, processes and operations.
Heating equipment shall be separated from any storage area in conformance with the requirements of the Building Code.
Subject to Sentence , fire compartments referred to in Sentence  shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

P/T Article Title: Exemption for educational facilities and hotels
P/T Sentence Text: This Section does not apply to a building or part of a building regulated under Section 9.9.
Existing fire separations consisting of membranes of lath and plaster or gypsum board are deemed to be in compliance with Sentence .

The water service pipe may be closer than 2 440 mm or be placed in the same trench with the building drain or building sewer if, the following conditions are met:  the bottom of the water service pipe at all points is at least 500 mm above the top of the building drain or building sewer, and  when in a common trench with the building drain or building sewer, the water service pipe is placed on a shelf at one side of the common trench,  the water service pipe is constructed of a single run of pipe with no joints or fittings between the street line or source of supply on the property and the inside face of the building, or  the building drain or building sewer is constructed of piping which is pressure tested in accordance with Subsection 7.3.7. at 345 kPa.
Existing underground storage tanks that do not comply with Sentence ,  or  shall be refurbished in conformance with Article 4.3.1.10. or be replaced.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: Notwithstanding Sentences  to , where a public pool is constructed on any level surface with walls rising above that surface and has a constant water depth not exceeding 1 100 mm and a water surface area not exceeding 100 m2, the pool deck may be an elevated platform surrounding the pool if it has, an unobstructed width of not less than 900 mm, a height of at least 75 mm above grade or pavement elevation, 6 mm wide openings for drainage, and a non-slip surface that is capable of being kept clean and disinfected.

P/T Article Title: Extinguishers for flammable and combustible liquids
P/T Sentence Text: No more than three portable extinguishers shall be used to satisfy the requirements of Table 6.2.6.B.

P/T Article Title: 8.2.1.6. Clearances for a Class 4 or 5 Sewage System
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 8.2.1.4. and , the centreline of a distribution pipe or leaching chamber shall not be located closer than the minimum horizontal distances set out in Table 8.2.1.6.B. and these distances shall be increased when required by Sentence 8.7.4.2.(11).
Fuel-fired appliances shall be enclosed in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

Where a Level II, Level III or Level IV treatment unit as described in Table 8.6.2.2. is used in conjunction with a filter bed, the effective area shall be such that the loading on the surface of the filter medium does not exceed 100 L/m2 per day.

Ventilation shall be provided in all spraying areas to maintain  the concentration of flammable vapours at or below 25% of their lower explosive limit, and  the concentration of combustible dusts at or below 50% of their minimum explosible concentration or 15g/m3 when the minimum explosible concentration cannot be established.

The requirements in this Subsection apply to a shelf and rack storage system intended for the storage of Class I, II, III and IV commodities as defined in NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems".
Service pipes passing through a storage bin for solid fuel shall be protected or so located as to avoid damage to the pipes.
Mechanical rooms containing refrigeration equipment shall be ventilated in accordance with CSA B52, Mechanical Refrigeration Code .

P/T Article Title: Exemption for convents, monasteries and hotels
P/T Sentence Text: This Section does not apply to convents and monasteries.

Sprinkler systems required by this Section shall have provision for notifying the fire department in accordance with Article 3.2.4.7. of the 1990 Building Code that the sprinkler system has been activated.

Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Sentence Text: Electrical hazards identified during an inspection required by Sentence  shall be repaired in accordance with the Electrical Safety Code made under the Electricity Act, 1998.
In buildings containing a hotel, the intervals referred to in Articles 6.6.3.3. and 6.6.3.4. are permitted to be once per month.

The annual CO2e emission level from a building required to comply with Clause 1.1.2.1. (c), shall not exceed the level achieved by complying with Sections 7.1, 7.2.a, 7.3 and 7.4 of 2014 ANSI/ASHRAE/USGBC/IES Standard 189.1.

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Closures in fire separations shall comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.1.6.4.(2), 3.1.6.7. and 3.1.6.8. and Article 3.1.6.9. of the 1986 Building Code.
Each lavatory in a washroom with fixtures for public use shall be equipped with a device capable of automatically shutting off the flow of water when the lavatory is not in use. (See Appendix A.)

Where an attic space, a crawl space, a corridor ceiling space or any other concealed space is used as a plenum, the concealed space shall be lined with noncombustible material, material having a flame-spread rating of 25 or less or other approved material.
Each door opening into an exit stairway shall be identified with the number assigned to that floor in accordance with Article 3.4.6.17. of the 1994 Building Code.
Subject to Article 5.12.4.3., a clearance of 457 mm shall be maintained between unprotected combustible materials and ducts venting spray booths and spray rooms.
Where a washroom required in Sentence 3.13.6.2. contains only one water closet and one lavatory, the washroom shall be designed in conformance with the requirements in Article 3.8.3.12.

Except for a modified pool and wave action pool and except as provided in Sentence , a public pool shall be surrounded by a hard-surfaced pool deck that shall, except for a pool described in Sentence 3.11.5.2.(1), be not less than 1 800 mm wide, in the case of an outdoor pool, be sloped away from the pool to waste drains or to adjacent lower ground at a slope of between 2% and 4%, and in the case of an indoor pool, be impervious and sloped away from the pool to waste drains at a slope of between 1% and 4%.

In every dining room, restaurant, cafeteria and alcoholic beverage establishment having more than 40 seats, separate sanitary facilities shall be provided for employees, in addition to facilities provided for patrons, and the number of water closets and lavatories required shall conform to Table 3.7.4.3.F
The mechanical ventilation described in Sentence  applies to rooms containing water closets, urinals, basins, showers or slop sinks.
Except as provided in Sentences  and , stud posts shall be designed in accordance with Part 4.

Where an occupancy is not listed in Table 8.2.1.3.B., the highest of metered flow data from at least 3 similar establishments shall be acceptable for determining the total daily design sanitary sewage flow.
An owner or the owner"s agent, within five days of being notified of a refusal to grant an extension of the time to submit a Life Safety Study, may request the reasons for the refusal in writing.
Smoke alarms required by Sentence  shall have a visual signalling component conforming to the requirements in 18.5.3. (Light, Color and Pulse of NFPA 72, National Fire Alarm and Signaling Code .

P/T Article Title: Access to exits; number and location
P/T Sentence Text: An existing room with one doorway is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence  where the occupant load does not exceed 100 persons, the floor area is sprinklered and the sprinkler system complies with Article 9.2.5.2., and the travel distance does not exceed 23 m.
Each hose required in Sentence  shall be connected to a water supply capable of supplying 1140 L/min of water to it at a pressure that will allow the hose stream to reach the top of the chip pile.

Except as permitted by Sentence , in a Group B, Division 3 occupancy, walls separating corridors serving sleeping rooms from adjacent rooms shall be constructed as fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, except that the fire-resistance rating need not be more than 45 min where the floor assembly is not required to be more than 45 min.
The trip time for the tests described in Sentences  and  may exceed the acceptance trip time by not more than 10%.
A public spa shall be constructed to have a water depth of not more than 1 200 mm.

In-service fill piping systems that do not comply with Sentences  and  may remain in-service if the piping does not leak and if the fill piping system met the requirements of this Code on December 31, 2014, as it read on that day.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: Where a sprinkler system is installed, the system shall conform to the requirements in Articles 3.2.5.13., 3.2.5.16. and 3.2.5.18.

If combustible fibres are stored in a building, automatic smoke venting hatches that are manually operable from remote locations and have a combined opening area of 64 cm2 for each square metre of floor area shall be provided.

Emergency lighting required in Sentence  shall be designed to provide illumination for a duration of at least 30 min, supplied by a source of energy separate from the primary electrical supply for the building, and designed to be automatically actuated when the power to the building is interrupted.
Tents shall not be erected closer than 3 m to the property line.
For the purposes of this Section, 1986 Building Code means Ontario Regulation 419/86, as it read on February 11, 1987; existing means in existence on February 11, 1987.

Fire detectors shall be installed in every part of a building that requires a fire alarm system in Article 9.9.4.1., other than corridors, washrooms, closets in guest suites, saunas, refrigerated areas and swimming pools, at the tops of elevator shafts, and at the tops of exit stairs.
Public amusement areas located in buildings shall be designed so that they do not create a fire hazard to the public using the facility.

P/T Article Title: 7.1.5.5. Private Sewers and Private Water Supply
P/T Sentence Text: Private water supply pipes shall be designed and installed according to MOE PIBS 6881e, "Design Guidelines for Drinking-Water Systems".

In buildings constructed in conformance with Articles 3.2.8.4. to 3.2.8.11., the unprotected openings through floor assemblies in an interconnected floor space shall be of sufficient size and shall be positioned relative to each other so as to be capable of containing, within the full height of the interconnected floor space, a cylinder conforming to Sentence .
Sentence  does not apply to floor assemblies between different levels of the same multi-level guest suite.

The performance level of an existing building is reduced where the existing building is extended or subject to material alteration or repair, and plumbing in the existing building is adversely affected by the extension, alteration or repair.

Where a component of a plumbing system is required by this Code to comply with a standard and the compliance is not certified by a testing agency accredited by the Standards Council of Canada for the testing of the component in question and, when an inspector requests proof of the compliance, proof of compliance shall be produced by the person proposing to install or have installed the component, and without such proof the component shall not be installed as a permanent part of any plumbing system.
This Section applies to the construction of a Class 1 sewage system.

Every area where food is intended to be processed, prepared or manufactured and where equipment or utensils are intended to be cleaned shall be equipped to provide illumination to a level of not less than 500 lx measured at the floor level.

Employees in a hotel establishment shall be instructed on  the procedures outlined in Article 2.8.2.1., and  the use of fire fighting equipment, including portable extinguishers and, where applicable, standpipe and hose systems.
Except as permitted in Article 9.8.2.5., a wall or floor assembly required to be a fire separation shall be constructed as a continuous barrier against the spread of fire.
Sentences  and  do not apply to existing fire alarm system components.
Sentence  does not apply where the building is sprinklered.

Sentences  to  do not apply to a building not greater than 3 storeys in building height that provides sleeping accommodation for not more than four persons, if the building is equipped with smoke alarms that comply with Article 9.5.4.4. and that are interconnected so that the activation of any smoke alarm will sound a similar signal in each of the interconnected smoke alarms.

When odour removal equipment of the adsorption type is used it shall be, installed to provide access so that adsorption material can be reactivated or renewed, and  protected from dust accumulation by air filters installed on the inlet side.

Except as permitted in Sentences  and , automatic sprinkler protection shall be provided in each spraying area, spray booth and spray room in conformance with NFPA 13, "Standard for the Installation of Sprinkler Systems".

Except as provided in Section 10.4., a building or part of a building subject to a change of major occupancy shall conform to the requirements of Subsection 3.2.6., Sections 3.7., 3.11. and 3.12., Sentences 6.2.2.1.(2), 6.2.3.9. and 6.2.4.7.(1), Subsections 9.5.1. and 9.5.3. to 9.5.10., Sentences 9.6.1.4.(3),  and  to , Article 9.7.2.3., Sentences 9.8.8.1. to  and 9.9.10.1. to , Subsection 9.10.17., Sections 9.31. and 9.32., and Subsections 9.34.1. to 9.34.3. as they apply to the new major occupancy that the building or part of a building is to support.

Standpipe system piping shall be hydrostatically tested for 2 hours at a pressure of not less than  1400 kPa (gauge), or  350 kPa  in excess of the normal hydrostatic pressure when the normal hydrostatic pressure is in excess of 1050 kPa (gauge).
Explosives shall not be used to break up caked ammonium nitrate.

Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided by Sentence , cladding for buildings or fire compartments where the maximum permitted area of unprotected openings is more than 10% but not more than 25% of the exposing building face need not be noncombustible where the wall assembly complies with Article 3.1.5.5.
Platform and walkway levels shall not be of open construction.
Despite Sentence 9.4.4.2.(2), smoke detectors shall be provided in bedrooms, corridors, lounges and sitting areas.
Buildings to which Sentence 9.9.2.2. does not apply and that are not more than 4 storeys in building height shall comply with Sentences  and .

Every waste pipe carrying waste from a device for the display, storage, preparation or processing of food or drink shall be trapped and have a minimum diameter equal to the diameter of the drain outlet from the device.

The occupant load of a public pool, except a wave action pool, shall be determined by the following formula occupant load= D/2.5 + S/1.4 where, D =	the water surface area in square metres of the part of the pool that is deeper than 1 350 mm; and S =	the water surface area in square metres of the part of the pool that is 1 350 mm in depth or less.
The number of water closets required for non-residential college buildings shall be at least one fixture for each 100 males and one fixture for each 75 females.

This Article does not apply to,  a building or part of a building of residential occupancy that is within the scope of Part 9 and is intended for occupancy on a continuing basis during the winter months,  a farm building,  a building that does not use electrical power or fossil fuel,  a manufactured building described in Article 9.1.1.9., or  a seasonal recreational building described in Section 9.36. or 9.38.
Each guest room or suite of rooms shall have interior walls having a fire-resistance rating not less than 30 min.
If a part to be coated is preheated prior to the application of the powder, the temperature of the part shall not exceed the ignition temperature of the powder being used.

The septic tank effluent filter required by Sentence  shall, conform to the requirements of NSF/ANSI 46, "Evaluation of Components and Devices Used in Wastewater Treatment Systems",  be sized to filter particles of 1.6 mm,  have a minimum area of 550 cm2, and  be installed in accordance with the manufacturer s recommendations.
Closures in stairway fire separations shall conform to Article 9.4.2.8.

Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Sentence Text: Fixed seats designated for adaptable seating required by Sentence 3.8.2.1. shall be,  located adjoining a barrier-free path of travel without infringing on egress from any row of seating or any aisle requirements,  equipped with a movable or removable armrest on the side of the seat adjoining the barrier-free path of travel, and  situated, as part of the designated seating plan, to provide a choice of viewing location and a clear view of the event taking place.
A modified pool is exempt from Sentences 3.11.3.1. to , , , , , , , , ,  and , Sentence 3.11.8.1. and Article 3.11.3.3.
Except as permitted in Article 3.3.2.10., pallets and dunnage not in use shall be stored outdoors and be located so as to avoid an exposure hazard.

Where a fire alarm system is required and sleeping accommodation is not provided for more than 14 persons, an interconnected smoke alarm system in accordance with Clause 9.3.4.1.(1) is deemed to be in compliance with Article 9.3.4.2.
A copper water distributing pipe of 1 in. size or larger may be mechanically swaged to permit the joining of other copper pipe of equal size.

P/T Article Title: Compliance time for health care facilities, care occupancies and retirement homes
P/T Sentence Text: It is the responsibility of the owner of a building containing a home described in Section 9.4 to comply with Article 9.4.5.5. as of January 1, 2025.
Floor assemblies shall be fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
Existing fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 30 min are deemed to comply with Sentence  if the other major occupancy is sprinklered.

P/T Sentence Text: The general ventilation system described in Sentence  is not required when tail pipes of vehicles are directly connected to local mechanical exhaust systems that terminate outdoors.
Joints between floors and walls shall be coved in areas described in Sentence  and in dressing and locker rooms.

Industrial ovens shall be constructed of noncombustible materials with smooth interior surfaces to permit cleaning.

Where risers are used they shall conform to the requirements of CSA B66, "Design, Material, and Manufacturing Requirements for Prefabricated Septic Tanks and Sewage Holding Tanks", and shall have adequate access openings to allow for regular maintenance of the septic tank.

The water supply requirements for an existing sprinkler system shall be based on the hazard classification, as determined in Table 9.2.5.A., and the minimum sprinkler discharge density, area of application and sprinkler spacing, as determined in NFPA 13, "Standard for the Installation of Sprinkler Systems", that corresponds to the hazard classification determined under Clause (a).

A fire escape permitted under Sentence  shall be constructed to comply with the requirements of Article 3.4.7.13. of the 1986 Building Code, except that the fire escape shall not be less than 1100 mm in width when serving floor areas with non-ambulatory residents.
Except as provided in Sentence , where the leaching bed is constructed as a shallow buried trench, the total length of leaching chamber shall not be less than the value determined by Table 8.7.3.1A.

In making a screwed joint, the ends of the pipe shall be reamed or filed out to the size of the bore and all chips and cuttings shall be removed.
Drainage facilities shall be tested to ensure that the drains are capable of taking the full flow from the main drain pipe without overflowing.

Except for a mezzanine within a dwelling unit, every mezzanine that is not required to terminate at a vertical fire separation in Article 3.2.8.2. shall have two egress facilities placed in such a manner that one facility could provide egress from the mezzanine if the other facility becomes inaccessible to the occupants of the mezzanine due to a fire that might originate in the room or suite in which the mezzanine is located,  where the occupancy of the mezzanine, room or suite is classified as Group F, Division 1,  where the mezzanine is intended for an occupant load of more than 60 persons,  in a floor area that is not sprinklered if,  the area of a mezzanine is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.A., or  the travel distance to an egress doorway or an egress facility is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.A., or  in a floor area that is sprinklered if,  the travel distance to an egress doorway or an egress facility is more than 25 m, or  the area of the mezzanine is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.B.
Unless otherwise approved, combustible insulation shall be protected as prescribed in the Building Code.
Fire alarm systems shall be electrically supervised.

Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Article 11.4.2.5., upgrading of a sewage system which is adversely affected by the construction, increase in occupant load, increase in the total daily design sanitary sewage flow or change in amount or type of sanitary sewage shall be required in conformance with Part 8.
After any alterations or repairs, an inspection shall be made to ensure valves are returned to the fully open position and are sealed, locked or electrically supervised.
This Section also applies to recreational camps regulated under the Health Protection and Promotion Act.
The total length of leaching chamber shall, not be less than 30 m when constructed as a shallow buried trench, or  not be less than 40 m for any other absorption trench.

A sign containing the words NON-POTABLE WATER, DO NOT DRINK shall be in letters at least 25 mm high with a 5 mm stroke and posted immediately above a fixture that is permitted to receive non-potable water.

Where a lift-gate is incorporated along an egress route, a maximum of two lift-gates may be within a single egress route, each lift-gate shall be equipped with a positive lock when open, and it shall be designed to automatically stop the conveyor belt that it serves when the lift-gate is open.

A treatment unit is deemed to comply with Sentences  and  if it has been certified to CAN/BNQ 3680-600, "Onsite Residential Wastewater Treatment Technologies" using a temperature condition listed under option or of Clause 8.2.2. of that standard. (See Appendix A.)

Despite Sentence , if a building containing a residential occupancy that is governed by this Section contains, in addition to its residential occupancies, one or more other occupancies that are not governed by this Part, this Section does not apply to the fire safety systems, devices or structural elements of any of the other occupancies that do not affect the life safety of the residential occupancy.

In a rapid transit station, a public address system shall be installed and shall include loudspeakers that, can be operated from the central supervising station, can be operated from the rapid transit station in which they are located, and designed and located so that voice messages can be heard intelligibly throughout the public area in a rapid transit station.

The energy supply to hand-held spray guns shall be controlled by a switch that also controls the coating material supply.

Where a closure is installed in the fire separation separating the room from the remainder of the building in accordance with Clause (a), it shall be,  equipped with a self-closing device that keeps the closure closed when not in use, and  constructed so as to prevent the migration of gases from the room into other parts of the building.
Sentences  and  do not apply to dust collectors having a capacity of less than 0.47 m3/s and used on wood working operations, except for wood flour manufacturing.

Except as provided in Sentence , in every dining room, restaurant, cafeteria and alcoholic beverage establishment having not more than 40 seats, employees are permitted to share the sanitary facilities provided for patrons, and the minimum number of water closets shall conform to Table 3.7.4.3.D. based on,  a male occupant load of 50% of the number of seats plus the number of male employees, and  a female occupant load of 50% of the number of seats plus the number of female employees.
Only one stairway enclosure described in Sentence  may be used as an exit.

P/T Article Title: 3.2.3.1. Limiting Distance and Area of Unprotected Openings

P/T Sentence Text: The design of the smoke control system shall assume an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis.
Hydrostatic pressure tests shall be conducted at the original test pressure as stated on the nameplate.

The requirements of Sentence  need not be applied where a floor area that is a portion of an interconnected floor space and that has a floor level more than 18 m above grade is separated from the remainder of the interconnected floor space by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of at least 1 h, except that no fire-resistance rating is required for such fire separation where all of the major occupancies contained within the interconnected floor space may be classified as light hazard occupancies in conformance with Appendix A of NFPA 13 Installation of Sprinkler Systems .
Every Class 5 sewage system shall be operated in accordance with the agreement referred to in Sentence 8.8.1.2.(2).
The maximum travel distance on an elevated platform to an exit serving that platform shall not exceed 45 m.

If a fire alarm system in a building is required by Sentence 3.2.4.9. to have an annunciator, valves controlling water supplies in a standpipe system, other than hose valves, shall be electrically supervised in accordance with Sentence 3.2.4.10.(2).
Infiltration due to corridor pressurization is permitted into a residential occupancy from a public corridor.

Where the travel distance in Sentence  exceeds 45 m, an egress system serving the shelf and rack storage system shall be designed on the basis of a time-based egress analysis using the following criteria: occupant egress speed of 1 m/sec shall be used for horizontal egress routes within the shelf and rack storage system, occupant egress speed of 0.6 m/sec shall be used for vertical egress routes within the shelf and rack storage system, measured on the diagonal along the nosing of the stairs, occupant egress speed of 1.3 m/sec shall be used for horizontal egress routes along a main aisle on the ground floor level, each lift-gate shall be accorded an egress time of 10 seconds, each at-level conveyor cross-over shall be accorded a time of 5 seconds, and a safety factor of 1.5 shall be used in calculating the total egress time, the total egress time shall be calculated using the following formula:Total Egress Time = (Hp + Vp/0.6 + Hm/1.3 + 10Nlg + 5Nlc ) · 1.5 (in where: Hp = horizontal travel distance on the shelf and rack storage system, in metres, Vp = vertical travel distance on the shelf and rack storage system, in metres, Hm = horizontal travel distance on the main floor, in metres, Nlg = number of lift gates in the means of egress, Nlc = number of at-level cross overs in the means of egress, the total egress time from any point in the shelf and rack storage system shall be a maximum of 4 minutes, a fire alarm and detection system conforming to Subsection 3.2.4. shall be installed in the building, smoke detectors shall be provided under all solid decking and walkways, clearly identified and easily accessible pull stations shall be provided at egress stairs, conveyor cross-overs or lift-gates located along egress paths, and the occupant load on each level of the shelf and rack storage system shall not exceed 10 persons per egress stair. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used Underground
P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.10. Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used Underground
P/T Sentence Text: Plastic pipe, fittings and solvent cement used underground outside a building or under a building in a drainage system shall be certified to, ASTM F628, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene  Schedule 40 Plastic Drain, Waste and Vent Pipe With a Cellular Core",  CAN/CSA-B181.1, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene  Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings",  CAN/CSA-B181.2, "Polyvinylchloride  and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride  Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings",  CAN/CSA-B182.1, "Plastic Drain and Sewer Pipe and Pipe Fittings",  CAN/CSA-B182.2, "PSM Type Polyvinylchloride  Sewer Pipe and Fittings",  CAN/CSA-B182.4, "Profile Polyvinylchloride  Sewer Pipe and Fittings",  CAN/CSA-B182.6, "Profile Polyethylene  Sewer Pipe and Fittings for Leak-Proof Sewer Applications", (g.1) CAN/CSA-B182.8, "Profile Polyethylene  Storm Sewer and Drainage Pipe and Fittings", for Type 1 joints and non-perforated pipes,  CSA B137.2, "Polyvinylchloride  Injection-Moulded Gasketed Fittings for Pressure Applications", or  CSA B137.3, "Rigid Polyvinylchloride  Pipe and Fittings for Pressure Applications".
Municipal and private hydrants shall be maintained in operating condition.
Automobile undercoating materials shall have a flash point of not less than 37.8°C.

Except as provided in Sentence 3.11.6.1. for a modified pool, all fittings below the water surface that provide suction or gravity flow in a public pool shall, be provided with a minimum of two suction or gravity outlets interconnected to a full size manifold, and be separated by a clear distance of not less than 1 200 mm.
The requirements of Subsection 3.7.6. apply to all food premises.
Automatic sprinklers shall be installed in each linen or refuse chute at the top, at alternate floor levels, and in the room or bin into which the chute discharges.

Where a Class B pool is equipped with a diving board 600 mm or less in height above the water, the water depth shall be at least 1 350 mm at the horizontal arc having a radius of 7.5 m measured from any point on the front end of the diving board, and a warning notice, on which is printed in letters at least 150 mm high, the words DANGER AVOID DEEP OR LONG DIVES, shall be posted in a location clearly visible to divers.

Openings provided for access between an interconnected floor space and a building or a portion of a building containing Group B major occupancy sleeping rooms shall be provided with vestibules that are provided with a mechanical air supply and that are designed, to restrict the passage of smoke from the interconnected floor space into the area containing sleeping rooms in accordance with the limits described in Sentence 3.2.8.4.(1), and in conformance with Clause 3.2.8.4.(3)(a).
Except as permitted by Sentence , fire separations separating fire compartments required by Sentence  shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

A voice communication system conforming to Article 3.2.4.22. of the 1990 Building Code shall be provided in every building where a floor area that is more than 18 metres above grade contains a care occupancy or a retirement home.

The percolation time shall be determined by, conducting percolation tests, or  classifying the soil according to one of the following methods,  the Unified Soil Classification System as described in MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-6, "Percolation Time and Soil Descriptions", or  the Soil Texture Classification as described in Chapter 3 of USDA, "Soil Survey Manual". (See Appendix A.)

Buildings of combustible construction shall comply with the provisions of Sentence  where the building is 1 storey in building height and not greater than 1000 m2 in building area, or 2 storeys in building height and not greater than 500 m2 in building area.

All pumps used in a public spa shall be capable of being deactivated by an emergency stop button that is, clearly labelled, and located at a point that is, readily accessible to and within sight of persons using the public spa, and within 15 m of the public spa.

A building containing a hotel shall be separated from a directly connected adjacent building that does not contain a hotel by a noncombustible fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.
Each fire escape used as an exit shall comply with Articles 3.4.7.2., 3.4.7.3., 3.4.7.5. and 3.4.7.6. of the 1990 Building Code.
Facilities shall be provided at battery charging installations for flushing and neutralizing spilled electrolyte and for protecting charging apparatus from mechanical damage.
In buildings greater than 6 storeys in building height, a voice communication system shall be provided in accordance with the requirements of Article 3.2.4.16. of the 1986 Building Code.
Where two platforms are considered as one platform as provided in Sentence 3.13.4.3.(2), the required egress capacity for each platform shall be determined separately.
Except as provided in Sentence , the minimum number of water closets for tents shall be determined in accordance with Table 3.7.4.3.E.
The recirculation system of a public pool shall be designed, constructed and equipped to comply with Sentences  to .

Except as permitted in Sentence  and Article 3.2.2.3., storage sites for lumber and other forest products shall consist of level and solid ground that is paved or surfaced with noncombustible material.
Dead end corridors in Sentence  shall contain no door openings to service rooms containing fuel-fired appliances or rooms that may be considered a hazard.

Existing conditions are acceptable with respect to Articles 4.3.2.1., 4.3.2.2., 4.3.2.3. and 4.3.8.2. and Sentence 4.3.8.1. until replacement or relocation of a tank is carried out, at which time these requirements shall apply.

Despite Sentence , one exit from a floor area may lead through a lobby if  the path of travel through the lobby to the outdoors at ground level is not more than 15 m,  a fire separation, constructed in accordance with Sentence , is provided between the lobby and any exit permitted by this Sentence to lead through a lobby,  the lobby is not located within an interconnected floor space described in Article 9.9.2.7.,  from the interior of the exit stair that leads through the lobby, there is an unobstructed path of travel not leading through the lobby to an alternate exit such that  it is not necessary to travel up or down more than 1 storey to reach the alternate exit by means of a protected access to exit, or  the path of travel is entirely within the same storey as the lobby and is separated from the lobby by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, and  approved provisions are made to direct occupants to the alternate exit described in Clause  in the event of a fire condition in the lobby.

Except for skimmers and gutters, all submerged suction and gravity fittings shall be clearly and permanently marked with a 50 mm wide band in a contrasting colour.
Each exit stairway shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

Any appliance, device or component of a device that does not operate or appear to operate as intended when checked, inspected or tested as required by this Code shall be repaired or replaced if the failure or malfunctioning of the appliance, device or component would adversely affect fire or life safety.

A fire alarm system shall be installed in accordance with Articles 3.2.4.2. to 3.2.4.6., 3.2.4.8., 3.2.4.9. and 3.2.4.17. and Sentences 3.2.7.8. to  of the 1990 Building Code, where the building is greater than 3 storeys in building height, or sleeping accommodation is provided for more than 10 persons.

In addition to the requirements of this Section, a building not greater than 6 storeys in building height shall comply with Subsections 9.5.2. to 9.5.5., and a building greater than 6 storeys in building height shall comply with Subsections 9.6.2. to 9.6.5.

Except as provided in Sentences  and  or otherwise permitted, every room used for sleeping in any building, and every principal room such as living room, dining room or combination of them in dwelling units shall be provided with windows having areas conforming to Part 9, except that Article 9.9.10.1. does not apply.
Article 3.5.1.7. does not apply where the fire protection that is provided by the municipal hydrants and mobile pumping equipment is approved as being adequate in the circumstances.

This Section applies to buildings up to and including 6 storeys in building height with residential occupancies and containing  more than two dwelling units where  at least two dwelling units share common exit facilities and have interior access to one another,  there is at least one dwelling unit located above another with interior access to one another, or  there is at least one dwelling unit located above another and the dwelling units share common exit facilities,  sleeping accommodation for more than 10 persons, in one or more dormitories,  boarding, lodging or rooming accommodation for more than four persons where Sections 9.3 and 9.4. do not apply, or  one or two dwelling units in combination with boarding, lodging or rooming accommodation for two, three or four persons, excluding the operator s residence.

A fold-down grab bar installed in accordance with Sentence  is permitted to encroach into,  the clear turning space described in Clause (a), or  a clear transfer space described in Subclause (a) or Clause (b).

A voice communication system is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence  if it  consists of loudspeakers operated from,  the central alarm and control facility, or  another location that is accessible to the fire department and supervisory staff required under Subsection 2.8.2. and that is approved,  provides a clear verbal signal throughout the building, except within elevator cars, and  provides for automatic silencing of the fire alarm devices when the loudspeakers are in use.

Except as required in Sentence , if the building contains major occupancies that operate under independent control from the hotel establishment, this Section does not apply to fire safety systems, devices and structural elements of those major occupancies that do not affect the life safety of the hotel occupants.
Dip tank covers as required in Articles 5.13.6.2. and 5.13.6.3. shall be of noncombustible materials.

P/T Sentence Text: This Section does not apply to a building or part of a building regulated under Section 9.9.

Visual signal devices permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.19. shall be installed so that the signal from at least one device is visible throughout the compartment in which they are installed. (See Appendix A.)
Despite Sentences  and , the minimum clear width of a means of egress shall be not less than 1100 mm for corridors, 900 mm for stairs, and 750 mm for doorways, ramps and all other areas.
Sprinkler heads shall be checked at least once per year to ensure that they are free from damage, corrosion, grease, dust, paint or whitewash.

Where multiple tanks are to be used to meet the requirements of Sentences  and , the tanks shall be connected in series such that, the first tank in the series shall have at least a capacity as calculated in Clause (a), however at no time shall a tank having a working capacity of less than 3 600 L be used,  all additional tanks after the first tank, excluding pump or dosing tanks shall have at least a working capacity equal to the volume required by Clause (b),  the pipe between the outlet of one tank and the inlet of the next tank in the series shall have a minimum slope of 2 percent,  there shall be no partitions in the tank except where a partition is required to maintain the structural integrity of the tank, in which case openings within the partition shall be provided to allow the free movement of sanitary sewage throughout the tank, and  all piping between tanks shall be continuous and shall be connected to the tank through the use of flexible watertight seals that will permit differential movement between the tanks.

An air-supported structure is permitted to be attached to another building provided the building to which it is attached,  has a building area not more than 200 m2,  conforms to the requirements of other Parts of the Code based on the building area of the attached building, and  is sprinklered or separated from the air-supported structure by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.

P/T Sentence Text: In a Group C major occupancy apartment building, not less than 15% of all suites of residential occupancy shall be provided with a barrier-free path of travel from the suite entrance door into the following rooms and spaces that shall be located at the same level as the barrier-free path of travel:  at least one bedroom,  at least one bathroom conforming to Sentence ,  a kitchen or kitchen space, and  a living room or space.
The fusible link referred to in Clauses  and  shall comply with ULC-S505, "Standard for Fusible Links for Fire Protection Service".

Where material alterations to a public pool or the equipment installed in a public pool affect the bottom slope, the water volume or the capacity of the recirculation system, the adversely affected portions shall comply with the requirements of this Division.

The calculation of water velocities for the purposes of Clause  and Sentences  and  and the calculation of water flow rates for the purposes of Sentence  shall be based on the assumption that all possible sources of suction flow are present at the same time.
Where an elementary or secondary school is subdivided by a firewall, a horizontal exit shall not serve as an exit but is permitted to serve as an access to exit.
Except for a modified pool, one or more hose bibbs shall be installed near the perimeter of the pool deck in locations convenient for flushing the pool deck.
Revoked: O. Reg. 256/14, s. 354 .

Where the quantity of combustible material present is such that fires of small size may be expected, such as in offices, schoolrooms, churches, assembly halls and telephone exchanges, the occupancy shall be graded as light hazard.
In the workrooms of factories where cellulose nitrate plastics are being processed, operators shall be stationed not closer than 1 m apart.

Individual bathtubs that are provided for the use of patients or residents in buildings of Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy shall,  be located in a room with a clear floor space not less than 1 500 mm in diameter,  be not less than 1 500 mm long,  be capable of being accessed along the full length of the bathtub with no tracks mounted on the bathtub rim,  have faucets that,  are operable using a closed fist and with a force of not more than 22.2 N, and  are located on the centre line of the bathtub or between the centre line of the bathtub and the exterior edge of the bathtub rim, at a maximum height of 450 mm above the rim,  unless the bathtub is free-standing, have three grab bars,  conforming to Sentence 3.8.3.8.(7),  that are not less than 1 200 mm long,  two of which are located vertically at each end of the bathtub, mounted between 80 mm and 280 mm above the bathtub rim, and  one of which is located horizontally along the full length of the bathtub, mounted between 80 mm and 280 mm above the bathtub rim,  have a slip-resistant bottom surface, and  be equipped with a hand-held shower head with not less than 1 800 mm of flexible hose that can be used in a fixed position at a height of 1 200 mm and 2 030 mm and does not obstruct the use of the grab bars.

An existing sprinkler system is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence  where the average sprinkler discharge density over the design area is at least equal to the minimum density corresponding to the area for the hazard classification as defined in Table 9.2.5.A.
Except as provided in Sentence , a Class 1 sewage system shall be designed to receive only human body waste for disposal.
