Despite Sentence , a fire department connection is not required where a booster pump equipped with emergency power is provided.
All shower heads shall be supplied with potable water at a pressure of at least 140 kPa.

The dry portion of the fire department connection piping of a standpipe system shall be hydrostatically tested at a pressure of not less than 1050 kPa  for 2 hours at intervals of not more than five years where  the fire department connection piping has been in service for more than thirty years, or  the age of the fire department connection piping cannot be determined.

This Section also applies to buildings or premises  containing 4 storeys or more, counting storeys below grade,  to which Subsection 3.2.1. applies,  to which Article 4.1.5.6. applies,  to which Article 4.12.4.1. applies,  to which Subsection 5.14.11. applies,  to which Section 9.3 applies,  to which Sentence 9.5.3.1. applies,  used as a convalescent home or children s custodial home providing sleeping accommodation for more than three persons, or  that have a contained use area or an impeded egress zone.

Equipment shall be installed to continuously disinfect the water in a public pool by means of, a chlorination or hypochlorination system provided with a chemical controller for regulating the dosage of chlorine and capable of providing not less than, in the case of an outdoor pool, other than a wave action pool, 300 g of chlorine per day per 10 000 L of total pool capacity, in the case of an indoor pool, other than a wave action pool, 200 g of chlorine per day per 10 000 L of total pool capacity, in the case of an outdoor wave action pool, 1 200 g of chlorine per day per 10 000 L of total pool capacity, and in the case of an indoor wave action pool, 800 g of chlorine per day per 10 000 L of total pool capacity, or a bromination system capable of maintaining in the pool water a total bromine residual of 3 mg/L.
Piping and equipment shall be mechanically secure and accessible for cleaning and maintenance.
Notification shall be served either personally or by mail.

P/T Article Title: 3.7.4.6. Plumbing Fixtures for Other Residential Occupancies
P/T Sentence Text: In recreational camps and camps for housing of workers, no fewer than two lavatories or provision for a pail or other portable container of sound construction shall be provided for each of the water closets or privies required in Sentence .

Operations involving materials that have been freshly coated with a liquid containing solvents having a flash point of less than 43°C shall be located in sprinklered rooms that are separated from other occupancies by fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.
Incinerator rooms shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.
The number of water closets required for drive-in theatres shall conform to Table 3.7.4.3.H.

P/T Article Title: Hose stations in lieu of extinguishers
P/T Sentence Text: Up to one half of the number of portable extinguishers required in Table 6.2.6.A. may be replaced by hose stations.

Transformer vaults to which the Electricity Act, 1998 applies shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h and shall be provided with heat detectors connected to the fire alarm system.
A storage yard shall be provided with a hydrant system or mobile pumping equipment that can reach all parts of the storage yard with no more than 60 m of hose.
Where a door is provided between a suite having a barrier-free path of travel required by Sentence  and an adjoining suite, the door shall conform to Sentences 3.8.3.3. and .
A walkway between a building and  a tent occupied by the public is permitted provided, the tent is not closer than 3 m from the building, and  the walkway conforms to Article 3.2.3.19.
The slope of the bottom of any portion of a public spa shall not exceed 8%.

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Closures that are in compliance with Sentences 3.1.6.4. and 3.1.6.7. of the 1986 Building Code shall be provided in fire separations.
Despite Sentence 9.9.2.1.(6), a floor assembly in a storage garage does not need to be a fire separation.

The requirements in this Subsection apply to a shelf and rack storage system intended for the storage of Group A, B and C plastics and rubber tires as defined in NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems".

A building is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence  where the building is not more than 3 storeys in building height, each guest suite is served by an exterior exit facility leading to ground level, each guest suite is separated from adjacent rooms by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, and\n each guest suite is equipped with a smoke alarm.
Leaching chambers shall comply with the dimension requirements for either a Type I or Type II leaching chamber listed in Table 8.7.2.3.

Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Sentence Text: Buildings where the vertical distance between the floor of the top storey and grade exceeds 18 m shall have smoke control measures in accordance with Article 3.2.6.2. of the 1990 Building Code.
The maximum permitted water velocities shall be those recommended by the pipe and fitting manufacturer.
Access doors or panels shall be provided to permit inspection, cleaning and maintenance of ovens and associated ductwork.

P/T Article Title: Clearance for bulk volume over 4800 m3
P/T Sentence Text: This Article applies if the bulk volume of stored tires and shredded tires in a storage yard is more than 4800 m3.

Openings for other than stairways, escalators or elevators are permitted to penetrate the fire separations required in Sentences  to  provided the openings are protected by a closure having a fire-protection rating not less than 45 min.

In determining the leased area in Sentences  and , it is not necessary to include a leased area that is separated from the public area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than, 2 h where the leased area contains a mercantile or medium hazard industrial occupancy, or 1 h where the leased area contains any other occupancy.

The slope of the bottom of a public pool having a diving board or diving platform shall not change by more than 17% where the water depth is less than the applicable depth set out in Sentence  and greater than the depth set out in Sentence  or , as applicable.

Compliance with the inspection, testing and maintenance provisions of NFPA 25, "Standard for the Inspection, Testing and Maintenance of Water-Based Fire Protection Systems", for standpipe and hose systems is deemed to satisfy the requirements of Articles 6.4.2.1. to 6.4.2.5. and Subsection 6.4.3.

Visual signal devices required by Clauses  and  are not required in,  a classroom, and  a Group B, Division 3 occupancy that contains sleeping accommodation for not more than 10 persons and not more than six occupants require assistance in evacuation in case of an emergency.

A universal washroom shall have, an emergency call system that consists of audible and visual signal devices inside and outside of the washroom that are activated by a control device inside the washroom, and an emergency sign that contains the words IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY PUSH EMERGENCY BUTTON AND AUDIBLE AND VISUAL SIGNAL WILL ACTIVATE in letters at least 25 mm high with a 5 mm stroke and that is posted above the emergency button.

P/T Article Title: 9.1.1.9. Site Assembled and Factory-Built Buildings (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of this Code shall apply to, building components designed and constructed outside the place of manufacture, and  site installation of such buildings.

P/T Article Title: 1.1.1.4. Division B, Acceptable Solutions of the 2015 NECB
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in this Chapter, the energy efficiency of a building shall conform to all requirements of Division B Acceptable Solutions of the 2015 NECB and this Chapter.
This Article applies to construction for which a permit has been applied for before January 1, 2017.
If the bulk volume of stored tires and shredded tires is between 300 m3 and 1200 m3, the water supply system shall be capable of supplying at least 1860 L/min for a minimum of 3 h.

Except as otherwise provided in this Section, where special fire suppression systems have been installed, inspection and maintenance shall be provided in conformance with the appropriate standards set out in Sentences 6.8.1.1. ,  and .

If compliance is not possible by the date required under Article 9.1.3.1. because of a strike, material shortage or other circumstances beyond an owner"s control, the Chief Fire Official may grant an extension of the time for compliance.
The emergency stop button in Sentence  shall, when used, activate an audible and a visual signal located by the emergency stop.
Revoked: O. Reg. 256/14, s. 375.
A sign shall not be located so as to obstruct openings required for light and ventilation, any required means of egress or required access for firefighting in accordance with Sentence 3.2.5.3.(2).

Electrical components, including transformers, power packs and control equipment for electrostatic spray applications, shall be located in an area where the vapour concentration of flammable liquids or combustible liquids cannot exceed 25% of the lower explosive limit.

P/T Article Title: 7.4.5.3. Connection of Subsoil Drainage Pipe to a Sanitary Drainage System
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storm drainage system is not available or soil conditions prevent drainage to a culvert or dry well, a foundation drain or subsoil drainage pipe may connect to a sanitary drainage system.
The annual inspection referenced in Sentence  shall be recorded and kept in accordance with Subsection 1.1.2.

This Section applies to art galleries, auditoria, beverage establishments, bingo halls, clubs, community halls, dance halls, enclosed arenas, exhibition halls, gymnasia, halls in religious establishments (excluding areas of worship), lecture halls, lodge rooms, movie theatres, museums, opera houses, restaurants, television studios, and theatres.
Except as provided in Sentence , a system for solar heating of potable water shall be installed in accordance with good engineering practice.
The maximum depth of water to a seat or bench in a public spa shall be 600 mm.
Class I liquids shall be dispensed or transferred inside buildings only in conformance with Subsections 4.1.7. and 4.1.8.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: Where a 30 min fire-resistance rating is required, existing wall assemblies and floor assemblies consisting of membranes of lath and plaster or gypsum board are deemed to be in compliance with Sentence .
Portable extinguishers shall be located so that there is one portable extinguisher having a 20B:C rating immediately accessible to each work station described in Article 5.14.5.2.

Except for a modified pool and wave action pool, at least, one ladder or set of steps shall be provided in both the deep and shallow areas of a public pool for entry into and egress from the pool water, and one barrier-free access shall be provided for entry into and egress from the water of a public pool as required by Article 3.11.3.3.
Except as provided in Article 8.8.1.2., a Class 5 sewage system shall not be installed.
Where it is not practicable to support piping as required in Sentence  on undisturbed soil, it shall be supported on not less than 150 mm of clean sand, pea gravel or washed, crushed stone.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: Despite Clause (a), where storage consists of a single product, placards that identify the liquid using the UN Product Identification Number  shall be acceptable. liquids stored as flammable liquids or combustible liquids, and capacities of the storage tanks.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Article Title: Duty to maintain in operating condition
P/T Sentence Text: Primary and secondary power supplies that serve smoke alarms shall be maintained in operating condition.
Variation Label: Duty to maintain in operating condition

P/T Sentence Text: Open flames may be used to heat piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids if the heating is carried out in furnaces or ovens that comply with NFPA 86, "Standard for Ovens and Furnaces".
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: All other buildings intended for occupancy in the winter months on a continuing basis should be insulated and shall be equipped with heating facilities to maintain a minimum indoor air temperature of 18°C or commensurate with the use of the building at the outside winter design temperature described in Article 6.2.1.7.

Where privacy screens are installed for a urinal described in Sentence , they shall,  be mounted a minimum of 460 mm from the centre line of the urinal, and  have a clearance of at least 50 mm from the grab bars required by Clause (b).
Standpipe system piping which normally remains dry shall be hydrostatically tested in accordance with Article 6.4.3.2. at intervals of not more than five years.

The performance level of an existing building is reduced where the occupancy of all or part of an existing building of combustible construction is changed to a new major occupancy that would require the building, if it were a new building, to be of noncombustible construction or to be constructed in accordance with Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A.

In a Group B, Division 3 occupancy which contains sleeping accommodation for not more than 10 persons, which has not more than six occupants who require assistance in evacuation in case of an emergency and which is equipped with a fire alarm system, a duct need not be equipped with a fire damper at a fire separation, provided duct-type smoke detectors have been installed to control smoke circulation as described in Article 3.2.4.13.

A beam may be considered to be laterally supported if,  the wood joists bear on its top flange at intervals of 610 mm or less over its entire length,  the load being applied to this beam is transmitted through the joists, and  19 mm by 38 mm wood strips in contact with the top flange are nailed on both sides of the beam to the bottom of the joist supported.
Fire dampers are permitted to be used within the exhaust duct system of the ventilation system for a power-ventilated enclosure referred to in Article 6.2.13.3.

Except for a modified pool and wave action pool, a public pool shall be equipped with overflow gutters or surface skimmers connected to the recirculation system that are capable of removing surface film from the surface of the water and withdrawing each day and discharging to the waste drains up to 15% of the total volume of pool water.

Upon receipt of the application referred to in Sentence , the Chief Fire Official shall, within 10 days, review the application and either grant or refuse an extension of the time for compliance to permit submission of a Life Safety Study.
Except as provided in Sentence 6.2.2.1.(3), exhaust air shall be provided for fixtures in dwelling units in accordance with ANSI/ASHRAE 62.1, "Ventilation for Acceptable Indoor Air Quality".
Sentences ,  and  do not apply in rapid transit stations which comply with the Building Code.
The supply duct shall contain a tight-fitting damper that shall be located close to the interior outlet and be operable from the room containing the fireplace.

Except as provided in Sentence , all holding tanks shall be provided with a vent that, is not less than 3 in. trade size,  terminates at least,  300 mm above finished grade with a vent cap, or  600 mm above finished grade with a vent cap when the holding tank is located in an area subject to flooding, and  terminates at least 3.5 m away from any air inlet, window, or door.
Openings adjacent to fire escapes shall comply with Sentence 3.4.7.13. of the 1986 Building Code.

A building is deemed to comply with Sentences  to , if the building design meets the applicable prescriptive requirements set in Article 1.1.2.1. for the energy efficiency of  the cooling equipment, fan power limitations for cooling and ventilation systems, and interior lighting power density, if the building s peak electric demand occurs in summer, or  the space and water heating equipment, fans, pumps and interior lighting power density, if the building s peak electric demand occurs in winter.

P/T Article Title: Maintenance of certain fire emergency systems
P/T Sentence Text: The firefighters' elevator symbol shall be maintained in identifiable condition.
Sprinkler control valves shall be accessible and maintained in operable condition at all times.

The openings required between compartments referred to in Sentence  shall have a total cross-sectional area of at least three times the area of the inlet pipe and be located between the top and a level 150 mm above the liquid level at the outlet to provide for the free flow of air between compartments.
Quench tanks shall not be located on or near combustible floors.

Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Sentence Text: Electrostatic spraying shall have an exhaust air velocity of at least 18 m/min at any opening in a spray booth.

Except as provided in Sentence , a drain port shall be provided on the water distribution system immediately downstream of the building control valve required by Sentence  and if there is a meter, the drain port shall be installed immediately downstream of the meter on the water distribution system.

If a building containing a care occupancy or retirement home also contains one or more other occupancies that are governed by other Sections of this Part, the fire safety systems, devices and structural elements of all the occupancies governed by this Part shall comply with the requirements that provide the greatest protection for life safety.
For the purposes of this Section, "1994 Building Code" means Regulation 61 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990, as it read on June 23, 1994; "existing" means in existence on January 1, 2007.
The requirements of Subsection 3.2.8. do not apply to a shelf and rack storage system conforming to this Section.

Egress doors from a rental space are not required to swing in the direction of exit travel or swing on a vertical axis provided,  the area of the rental space is not more than 50 m2, and  the distance of travel within the rental space is not more than 10 m.

Where a water closet is located in accordance with Clause (a), a grab bar conforming to Sentences  and  shall be provided on the side wall referred to in Subclause (a)(i), a fold-down grab bar may be provided and, if one is provided, it shall conform to Sentence  and be provided on the side of the water closet opposite the grab bar described in Clause (a), and a grab bar conforming to Sentences  and  shall be provided on the wall behind the water closet.

This Article does not apply to,  a building or part of a building of residential occupancy that is within the scope of Part 9 and is intended for occupancy on a continuing basis during the winter months,  a farm building,  a building that does not use electrical power or fossil fuel,  a manufactured building described in Article 9.1.1.9., or  a seasonal recreational building described in Section 9.36. or 9.38.
Means of egress from a roof for personnel servicing rooftop equipment or for a below ground service room that is not normally occupied, is permitted to be provided by stairways or fixed ladders.
Dust-collecting systems shall be designed for an air velocity in the ducts of at least 1068 m/min.

Where multiple shower heads installed in a public showering facility are served by one temperature control, each shower head shall be equipped with a device capable of automatically shutting off the flow of water when the shower head is not in use. (See Appendix Note A-7.6.4.1.(3))

P/T Article Title: 3.13.4.3. Number and Location of Means of Egress
P/T Sentence Text: Means of egress from platforms shall be located so that the travel time from the most remote point on a platform to a protected route does not exceed 4 min based on travel speeds of, 38 m/min for horizontal travel, and 21 m/min for vertical rise.
A protected route shall be provided with emergency ventilation conforming to Subsection 3.13.7.
Except as provided in Sentence , the requirements of this Subsection shall apply to all tents.
The shower water system shall have one or more tempering devices capable of being adjusted to ensure that water supplied to shower heads does not exceed 40°C.

Interconnected smoke alarms required in Sentences 9.8.2.2. and 9.8.3.3. and Clause 9.8.3.4.(1) shall be installed on or near the ceiling in each storey within a residential unit, including every basement, and shared means of escape.
With the exception of charging electrodes and their connections, transformers, power packs, control apparatus and all other electrical components shall be located outside the powder-coating area.
The combustion air shall be supplied by a noncombustible and corrosion-resistant supply duct.
Uncontaminated material may be rebagged in suitable slip-over bags and sealed to prevent spillage.

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Openings in fire separations required by Sentences 9.8.2.2. and  and 9.8.3.3. shall be protected with closures conforming to Articles 9.10.13.2. and 9.10.13.10. of the 1994 Building Code.

A fire escape shall not be erected on an existing building unless it is not practical in the circumstances to provide one or more exit facilities, described under Article 3.4.1.2. of the 1986 Building Code, and provided that the fire escape does not serve floor areas above the second floor.
The earth around the perimeter of the pit shall be raised or mounded to a height of at least 150 mm above ground level.

Where the energy efficiency compliance of a building is achieved using the Energy Cost Budget Method of 2013 ANSI/ASHRAE/IES 90.1 and Chapter 2, or Building Energy Performance Compliance Path of the 2015 NECB and Chapter 3:  the annual design CO2e emission level from the building shall be calculated, and  the annual design CO2e emission level of the proposed building shall not exceed the annual CO2e emission level of the corresponding baseline or reference building using the CO2e emission factors listed in Table 1.1.2.2.
Logs used in a vertical position shall have a plate at the top and a plate at the bottom and the plates shall be at least as wide as the largest end diameter of any of the logs.
Measures identified in Sentence  shall be implemented in conformance with good engineering practices to prevent fires and explosions from occurring.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: At least one elevator shall be provided for use by firefighters in accordance with Articles 3.2.6.8. and 3.2.6.9. of the 1990 Building Code in buildings where the vertical distance between the floor of the top storey and grade exceeds 18 m.

The spraying equipment for spray booths and spray rooms shall be interlocked to shut down in the event of  a failure of the ventilation system,  a failure of the circulating water pump of a water-wash filtration system, or  a failure of the filter roll-down mechanism of an overspray collection system.

Except as permitted by Sentence , in Group C apartment buildings other than retirement homes, if a pull station is not installed on a floor area in accordance with Sentence  or ,  a manual pull station shall be installed in every dwelling unit in the floor area near each egress door leading from the dwelling unit,  smoke detectors shall be installed in the floor area in public corridors and stairwells, and  fire detectors shall be installed in the floor area in all common public areas and in rooms not located within dwelling units.

P/T Article Title: Measures in a fire safety plan
P/T Sentence Text: Before demolition or construction, including hot surface applications, commences in or on the building or premises, the fire safety plan shall be revised to incorporate  temporary alternative measures for the fire safety of the occupants during the demolition or construction, and  temporary procedures to control fire hazards associated with the demolition or construction, including procedures to mitigate risks to adjacent buildings.

P/T Article Title: 8.9.1.2. General Requirements for Operation and Maintenance
P/T Sentence Text: Clause  does not apply to the use of a sewage system designed and operated such that properly treated effluent is discharged into soil.

A carbon monoxide alarm shall be mechanically fixed, attached, plugged in or placed at the manufacturer's recommended height or, if the manufacturer has not recommended a height, on or near the ceiling.

This Section does not apply to  private-home day care, as defined in the Day Nurseries Act,  an extended day program or a third party program operated under section 259 of the Education Act, or  a day nursery or part of a day nursery, as defined in the Day Nurseries Act, that is operated in a school, as defined in the Education Act, and that provides services only to children who are pupils of a board, as defined in the Education Act.

P/T Article Title:
6.2.3.18. Construction and Installation of
Ducts and Plenums
P/T Sentence Text: All round duct joints shall be tight-fitting and lapped not less than 25 mm.
If a component of a plumbing system is required to be certified to a standard, the certification shall be made by a testing agency accredited for that purpose by the Standards Council of Canada.
Closures in stairway fire separations referred to in Sentences  and  shall be equipped with self-closing devices.

The anchor system material shall be made of stainless steel, or other corrosion resistant base material, or from steel that is hot dipped galvanised, in accordance with CAN/CSA-G164-M, Hot Dip Galvanizing of Irregularly Shaped Articles .

P/T Article Title: 9.9.10.1. Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
P/T Sentence Text: Except for basement areas, the window required in Sentence  shall have a maximum sill height of 1 000 mm above the floor. (See Appendix A.)
Variation Label: Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms

P/T Sentence Text: A building classified as Group A, Division 2 occupancy that is not more than 1 storey in building height, and in which the building area is not more than 3 200 m2 if not sprinklered, or 6 400 m2 if sprinklered, is permitted to be constructed with a roof of heavy timber construction and have columns of heavy timber construction.
Subject to Sentences  and , hay, straw, shavings or similar combustible materials shall not be used within a tent or air-supported structure used for an assembly occupancy.

A septic tank shall be of such design and construction as will permit the collection and holding of sanitary sewage in it to a depth of not less than 1 000 mm, except that a depth of not less than 900 mm is permitted where the excavation is in rock, or to avoid rupture or displacement of the tank due to ground water pressure.

The building shall be of noncombustible construction and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less 1 h, roof assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and all loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
Nails used in attaching the materials listed in Sentence  shall be not less than 3.2 mm diam with a minimum head diameter of 11 mm.
No vertical leg of the drainage pipe from a water closet or other fixture that has an integral siphonic flushing action shall exceed 1 000 mm.

A diving board or diving platform greater in height than 3 m above the water surface shall be equipped with a gate, barrier or other device capable of preventing access to the diving board or diving platform.

The release device required in Sentences  and  shall be installed as an ancillary device to the fire alarm system and shall release immediately, upon activation of the fire alarm signal, in the event of a power failure or ground fault, or upon actuation of a manually operated switch accessible to authorized personnel and located in, a fare collector s booth or kiosk at the station, or the central supervising station.
Disconnect switches for power supplies which serve only fire alarm systems or interconnected smoke alarms shall be in a locked secure area or otherwise secured in an approved manner.
No bore of a vent stack or stack vent shall be reduced or obstructed by the installation of a flashing.
Sentence  does not apply where the building is sprinklered.

Where any part of a return duct will be exposed to radiation from the heat exchanger or other radiating part within the furnace, such part of a return duct directly above or within 600 mm of the outside furnace casing shall be noncombustible.
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Sentence Text: Cylinders stored inside buildings shall conform to the requirements in Section 5.6.

The space above a diving board or diving platform shall be unobstructed and shall consist of at least, a space having a width of 2 500 mm on each side of the centre line of the board or platform, a length equal to the sum of the horizontal distance the board or platform projects over the water plus 3 m, and a height of, 3.65 m above a diving board 3.65 m or less in length, 5 m above a diving board greater than 3.65 m in length, or 3 m above a diving platform, and the space below the planes originating from the front and sides of the uppermost horizontal plane of the space determined under Clause  and sloping downwards at 30° from the horizontal.

This Section applies where proposed construction, in respect of an existing building will result in any of the following changes of use of all or part of the building: a change of the major occupancy of all or part of a building that is designated with a "Y" in Table 1.3.1.4. of Division C, a suite of a Group C major occupancy is converted into more than one suite of a Group C major occupancy, a suite or part of a suite of a Group A, Division 2 or a Group A, Division 4 major occupancy is converted to a gaming premises, a farm building or part of a farm building is changed to a major occupancy, a building or part of a building is changed to a post-disaster building, a building or part of a building is changed to a retirement home, or the use of a building or part of a building is changed and the previous major occupancy of the building or part of the building cannot be determined, or in respect of an existing building of combustible construction will extend the building by adding a storey or storeys such that the extended building will be more than four storeys in building height.
Portable extinguishers shall be provided in buildings under demolition in accordance with Subsection 6.2.6. as if the buildings were graded for ordinary hazard under Subsection 6.2.5.

The automatic sprinkler system shall be electrically supervised to indicate a trouble signal on the building fire alarm system annunciator or where the building does not have a fire alarm system, to notify the person controlling the operation of the building for each of the situations listed in Sentence 3.2.4.10.(3).
In a building that is not sprinklered, venting of floor areas required in Sentence  shall not be provided by the building exhaust system.

Hose cabinets shall be of sufficient size to accommodate a hose, hose rack, hose valve and portable extinguisher, conspicuously identified, by lettering at least 50 mm high or by the provision of a sufficiently large glass panel in the door to ensure that the equipment in the cabinet is readily visible,n equipped with a door without locks, constructed to open easily, unless otherwise approved, and\n so located that the door, when open, will not obstruct any doorway.

The performance level of an existing building is reduced where the early warning and evacuation systems requirements of other Parts for the proposed major occupancy exceed those of the existing building.
This Subsection does not apply to  blasting agents, or  ammonium nitrate and ammonium nitrate mixture storage on railways regulated by the Canadian Transport Commission.
Full sprinkler protection shall be restored or the provisions of Article 6.5.2.6. maintained when work on the system is discontinued.

Booths and kiosks that are not more than 20 m2 in area and are used only by the transit agency for fare collection, dissemination of information or similar non-mercantile occupancies shall be of noncombustible construction and are not required to be separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation.

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Closures in fire separations shall be in conformance with the floor area is sprinklered, or the part of the building containing the major occupancy is equipped with fire detectors and connecting corridors are equipped with smoke detectors as part of the fire alarm system of the building. Sentences 3.1.8.4. and 3.1.8.10. of the 1994 Building Code, and Articles 3.1.8.11. and 3.1.8.13. of the 1994 Building Code.
Every pharmacy shall be provided with a sink with hot and cold potable water for washing utensils used in the preparation, service or storage of drugs.
Dry-pipe valves shall be trip tested at least once every three years with the control valve fully open.

Construction in respect of a Group B, Division 3 occupancy, a hotel or a retirement home may be carried out in accordance with Sentence  only if the construction will be in conformance with the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997.

Barrier-free access for entry into and egress from a public spa shall be provided by, a ramp conforming to Article 3.12.3.1., a pool lift conforming to the manufacturer s specifications and installation instructions and conforming to Sentences 3.11.3.3. to , or a transfer wall conforming to Sentences  to .
Access routes for fire fighting shall be provided in conformance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.5.5. to 3.2.5.7. of the 1994 Building Code.
The soil or leaching bed fill around the perimeter of the cesspool shall be raised or mounded to a height of at least 150 mm above ground level.

The total daily design sanitary sewage flow shall not exceed, 5 000 L where the treatment unit is a septic tank, or  10 000 L where the treatment unit is a Level II, Level III or Level IV treatment unit as described in Table 8.6.2.2.

For the purposes of Sentence , doorways and other openings shall be protected with closures having a fire-protection rating not less than 45 min if located within 3 storeys below, within 10 m below, within 1.8 m above or within 3 m horizontally of an exterior exit stairway, fire escape or exterior exit passageway.
Where galvanized steel pipe is used in a drainage system, it shall be used with drainage fittings.

The corridor subdivision referred to in Clause  shalln subdivide the corridor into at least two zones using fire separations that contain smoke-tight doors equipped with self-closing devices that act as closures, be arranged so that each subdivided corridor zone is able to accommodate, in addition to its own occupants, the occupants from any single adjacent zone, based on the requirements of 1.6 m2 per person, unless otherwise approved, and be arranged so that the travel distance from any point in a subdivided corridor zone to an adjacent zone is no more than 15 m.

Existing in-service aboveground atmospheric storage tanks that do not comply with Sentence  may remain in-service if the tanks  are not leaking,  have no dents greater than 30 degrees or 35 mm in depth from the normal configuration,  have no pitting in excess of 3 mm, and  have metal thickness of at least 50% of the minimum permissible thickness specified in an applicable standard referred to in Sentence .
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: At no time shall the maximum occupant load determined in Sentences  to  exceed the occupant load calculated on the basis of  0.60 m2 of floor space per person in dining, alcoholic beverage and cafeteria space, and  0.40 m2 of floor space per person for all other uses.
This Article applies to rental suites of residential occupancy.

Where a bedroom or a compartment containing related rooms is served by an exit door leading directly to the outside or to an exterior passageway, a doorway leading to an interior corridor served by one exit is deemed to be in compliance with Sentences  and .
Spray booths and spray rooms shall have walls and ceilings that consist of steel frames covered with sheet steel having a minimum thickness of 1.14 mm or be of equivalent noncombustible construction.

P/T Article Title: Use and storage of flammable liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Flammable liquids may be used as a local application to remove spots and stains if the liquids  are stored in containers that have a capacity of not more than 1 L,  do not exceed more than 25 L in aggregate quantity, and  are dispensed from plastic containers that have a capacity of not more than 0.5 L.

Where a public pool is equipped with a diving board or a diving platform not more than 3 m in height above the water surface, the pool shall be designed and constructed in conformance with Sentences  to .

A diving board or a diving platform 600 mm or less in height above the water surface shall project over the water a horizontal distance of at least 900 mm from the vertical projection of a pool wall under it.
Ventilating systems shall be arranged so that the failure of any ventilation fan as sensed by air flow will automatically stop the dipping conveyor systems and sound an alarm.

P/T Article Title: 3.11.5.2. Public Pools in Group B, Division 2 or 3 Major Occupancies
P/T Sentence Text: The curb required by Sentence  shall have, a height of 50 mm, rounded edges, a coved base, and a raised nosing at the top to serve as a fingerhold for a bather in the water.
A standpipe and hose system conforming to the requirements of Subsection 3.2.9. shall be installed in a rapid transit station, except as otherwise required or permitted in this Article.
Every pipe that supplies a fixture shall have a capacity that will produce a flow in the fixture that will flush the fixture and keep it in a sanitary condition.

Except as provided in Article 9.5.7.3., at least one bedroom in every dwelling unit shall have an area of not less than 9.8 mÃÂ² where built-in cabinets are not provided and not less than 8.8 mÃÂ² where built-in cabinets are provided.

Except as provided in Subsection 9.38.3., a manufactured building used or intended to be used as a seasonal recreational building of residential occupancy is deemed to comply with this Code if it is designed and constructed in conformance with CAN/CSA-Z241 Series, "Park Model Trailers".
Sentence  does not apply to fuel-fired appliances that serve only one dwelling unit or suite.

A Type B dispersal bed shall be, rectangular in shape with the long dimension parallel to the site contours,  not more than 1 000 mm in depth measured from the bottom of the stone layer to the finished grade when installed in soil with a percolation time that exceeds 15 min, and  backfilled with leaching bed fill so as to ensure that, after the leaching bed fill settles, the surface of the leaching bed will not form any depressions.
Curb ramps described in Sentence  do not require handrails or guards
Aisles between individual piles shall be at least 1.8 m wide.
Standpipe and hose system equipment shall be used for fire protection only.
Except for suite doors opening directly to the exterior, every exit serving a hotel shall have an exit sign placed over or adjacent to it.
The requirements in Section 5.13 for dip tanks shall also apply to roll-coating processes described in Sentence .

Duct penetration of fire separations separating exits from the remainder of the building is permitted if the duct,  is designed for the purposes of Subsection 3.2.6., or  only serves the exit from a dedicated rooftop air make-up unit.

P/T Article Title: 3.2.7.7. Fuel Supply Shut-Off Valves and Exhaust Pipes
P/T Sentence Text: Where pipes for exhaust gases from emergency power systems penetrate required fire separations, they shall be enclosed in a separate service space having a fire-resistance rating equal to that of the penetrated floor assembly, but not less than 45 min.
Section 9.9 does not apply to a building or part of a building that satisfies the requirements of the Building Code as it read at any time on or after July 1, 1993.

Cylinders containing compressed gases that may react with each other and are heavier than air may be stored in the same fire compartment if they are separated  by a distance of at least 15 m, or  by a concrete or masonry wall having a height of at least 1.5 m, and projecting such that the minimum distance that vapour can travel between two cylinders of gases that may react with each other is not less than 15 m, measured horizontally.
Smoke alarms shall be installed in each guest suite.

Where an emergency power supply is supplied by a generator, it shall supply at least one emergency power receptacle in at least one of the suites having a barrier-free path of travel required by Sentence . (See Appendix A.)
The combined thickness of the sand layer and the stone layer if utilized of a Type A dispersal bed shall not be less than 500 mm.

The width of an egress doorway or an exit leading directly from the seating area shall be not less than the required width of the widest aisle or converging aisle plus 50% of the total required width of the remaining aisles and converging aisles that it serves.
If a firewatch is required, the areas shall be toured by firewatch personnel at least once each hour.
One 75 m length of 65 mm hose and two portable extinguishers having a 2A or higher rating and conforming to Section 6.2 shall be installed in each hose house or cabinet.

The flow rate through a grease interceptor shall not exceed its rated capacity and the flow rate shall be determined using the following: where: Q is the flow rate to a grease interceptor in L/s. V is the volume of the fixture in L. DDT is the drain down time, 60 or 120 seconds. PD is any pump discharge in L/s. N is the number of fixtures to go through the interceptor.
Despite Sentence , where the building is sprinklered, a fire-resistance rating is not required for floor assemblies or for walls, columns and arches supporting floor assemblies.
Protective breathing apparatus shall be made available at the premises undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging for all persons in case of emergency.
Electrical installations conforming to the requirements for dip tanks in Article 5.13.5.6. shall be provided for quench tanks of over 1900 L capacity whose liquid surface area exceeds 2.5 m2.
A diving platform greater than 600 mm in height above the water surface shall project a horizontal distance of at least 1 200 mm from the vertical projection of the pool wall under it.
The protection required by Sentence  is permitted to be waived if the building is sprinklered.

National Article Title: Warm-Air Supply Outlets and Return Inlets - General
P/T Article Title: 6.2.4.13. Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings

P/T Sentence Text: The bottom of a modified pool shall be marked with continuous black contour lines, 150 mm wide located where the water depth is 600 mm, and 300 mm wide located where the water depth is 1 200 mm.
Combustible residue from cleaning operations shall, on the same day as the cleaning operations, be removed from the premises or placed in receptacles conforming to Sentence 2.4.1.3.(3).
Each room into which a linen or refuse chute discharges shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

P/T Article Title: 6.2.2.3. Ventilation of Storage and Repair Garages
P/T Sentence Text: A repair garage shall have a mechanical ventilation system designed to limit the exposure of workers to, (a)	carbon monoxide to below the time weighted average concentration of 25 parts per million for a normal 8 hour workday or 40 hour work week, and (b)nitrogen dioxide from diesel powered vehicles to below 0.72 parts per million for a normal 8 hour workday or 40 hour work week.

Every pressurized distribution pipe within a leaching chamber shall, extend over the entire length of the leaching chamber,  be not less than 1½ in. trade size,  have orifices of at least 6 mm in diameter, spaced equally along the length of the pipe to provide even distribution of the effluent,  be supported,  be self-draining so as to prevent freezing of its contents, and  have cleanouts installed at the downstream end of each line of leaching chamber to allow for servicing of the system.
A tire storage location shall be classified as a medium hazard industrial occupancy.
Bottom drain sizes for dip tanks shall conform to Table 5.13.3.B.
Where leased areas are located on opposite sides of a means of egress, the width of the means of egress shall not be reduced to less than 5 m.

This Article does not apply to,  a farm building,  a building that does not use electrical power or fossil fuel,  a manufactured building described in Article 9.1.1.9., or  a seasonal recreational building described in Section 9.36. or 9.38.
After any alterations or repairs, valves shall be inspected to ensure they are in the fully open position and are sealed, locked or electrically supervised.

Except as provided in Sentences 11.4.2.5. and , the performance level of an existing building is reduced where proposed construction will increase the occupant load of an existing building by more than 15%.

Where a building is not more than 3 storeys in building height and not greater than 600 m2 in building area, alternative measures to Sentence  may be used if they are approved, and in the opinion of the Chief Fire Official, will provide protection for life safety similar to the protection provided by compliance with Sentence .

A single exit from a basement, first or second floor is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence  where the exit does not serve more than four dwelling units, the exit does not serve more than 10 persons and the building is not more than 3 storeys in building height and is not greater than 600 m2 in building area.
Each building shall not have more than one fire alarm system, unless otherwise approved.
Where egress doors from a rental space open onto a corridor and do not swing in the direction of exit travel, the corridor shall be not less than 1 100 mm in width.
All other controls installed in a shower described in Sentence  shall comply with Subclauses (h) to (iii).
Every sanitary building drain shall be provided with at least one vent that is not less than 3 in. in size.

Every exit and access to exit shall be equipped to provide illumination to an average level of at least 50 lx at floor level and at all points such as angles and intersections at changes of level where there are stairs and ramps.
Revoked: O. Reg. 256/14, s. 407 .

Insulating materials and adhesives for pipes, ducts, plenums and other components of heating and air handling systems shall be noncombustible or shall have a flame-spread rating of 25 or less or shall be of some other approved composition.
Buildings described in Article 9.38.1.1. shall be supported and anchored in conformance with the manufacturer's installation instructions.

Approved hardware designed to release the latch and allow the door to open in the direction of exit travel when a force of not more than 90 N is applied to the hardware is required on  every door in an access to exit from a room or suite of assembly occupancy having an occupant load of more than 100 persons,  every exit door from a floor area containing an assembly occupancy having an occupant load of more than 100 persons,  every door leading to an exit lobby from an exit stair shaft in buildings having an occupant load of more than 100 persons,  every exterior door leading from an exit stair shaft in buildings having an occupant load of more than 100 persons,  and every exit door from a floor area containing a high hazard industrial occupancy.

P/T Article Title:
6.2.3.18. Construction and Installation of
Ducts and Plenums
P/T Sentence Text: Where the installation of heating supply ducts in walls and floors creates a space between the duct and construction material, the space shall be fire stopped with noncombustible material at each end.
Hose stations shall be located so that every portion of the rapid transit station can be reached by a hose stream and is within 3 m of a hose nozzle when the hose is extended.

For locations not listed in Table 1.2 of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-1, Climatic and Seismic Data , the heating degree-days and climatic data of the climatologically closest location is permitted to be used.

The surface of the leaching bed shall be shaped to shed water and together with the side slopes of any raised portion, shall be protected against erosion in such a manner as to not inhibit the evaporation and transpiration of waters from the soil or leaching bed fill, and to not cause plugging of the distribution pipe.

Except as permitted in Sentence , exterior marquees, not greater than 7.5 m from ground level to the top of the marquee, having combustible elements, other than fabrics or films conforming to Sentence 3.1.16.1.(1), are permitted on a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided every opening in the exposed wall of the building above the marquee is protected with wired glass in accordance with MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, Fire Performance Ratings where these openings are within  4.5 m horizontally of the marquee, and  9 m vertically above the marquee.
The water supply to each fixture in a washroom for public use shall be individually valved and each valve shall be accessible.

Except as required in Sentence , this Section does not apply to a hotel establishment where every building that contains a hotel is not more than 1 storey in building height, and has a building area of 300 m2 or less.

Except for a modified pool and wave action pool, the perimeter of the pool deck shall be clearly delineated by a tactile attention indicator conforming to Article 3.8.3.18. and located where any area contiguous to the pool deck may be confused with the deck.

P/T Article Title: 3.2.2.48E. Group C, Retirement Home, up to 3 Storeys, Sprinklered,
P/T Sentence Text: The building referred to in Sentence  is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and,  floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min,  mezzanines shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, and  loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
Despite Sentence , battery-operated smoke alarms may be used.
Except as provided in Sentences  and 7.6.5.3.(1), the maximum temperature of hot water supplied by fittings to fixtures in a residential occupancy shall not exceed 49°C.
The distribution pipes shall, be self-draining so as to prevent freezing of their contents, and  have orifices of at least 3 mm in diameter, spaced equally along the length of the pipes.

Except for a modified pool and wave action pool, the pool deck shall be separated from any adjacent spectator area or gallery and from any spectator access to such area or gallery by a gate or other barrier.
Fire alarm and detection systems shall be installed in compliance with Subsection 3.2.4., excluding Article 3.2.4.7., of the 1986 Building Code.
Wood lattice or skirting around porches shall be separated from piers and soil by at least 50 mm.
The installation, operation and maintenance of hot work equipment shall be carried out in accordance with Section 5.17.
Despite Sentences  and , an existing fire escape may be approved.
The gateways shall be locked when the storage yard is not staffed.
Except where the platforms or walkways are of open construction, any openings for egress stairs shall be protected by noncombustible draft stops not less than 450 mm below the floors above.
Standpipe systems shall be kept in such condition that they may be connected near street level, to a fire department pump, so as to supply water to every outlet on each floor.
Non-potable water piping shall be identified by markings that are permanent, distinct and easily recognized.
Despite Sentence 9.9.2.12.(3), the lobby described in Sentence  may contain a fireplace or a space heater.
Where an existing building is extended, this Part applies to the existing portion of the building, and  the extended portion of the building shall comply with all other Parts.

P/T Article Title: 3.3.6.4. Storage and Dispensing Rooms for Flammable Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: A dispensing room in an occupancy or facility described in Sentence  which has an area greater than 15 m2 or in which the travel distance from any point to the nearest egress door is more than 4.5 m shall,  be located in a floor area that has at least two exits, and  have at least two egress doors.
A motion sensor shall not be used to control emergency lighting.
Except as provided in Sentences  and , the requirements in Subsection 3.2.4. shall apply.

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Where the floor area is sprinklered, existing closures in fire separations to which Article 9.9.2.8. applies are deemed to be in compliance with Clause  and Sentence .

Exits are deemed to comply with Sentence  if the floor area is divided by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min so that it is necessary to pass through the fire separation to travel from one exit to another exit.

Every person operating a treatment unit that is used in conjunction with a leaching bed constructed as a shallow buried trench, Type A dispersal bed or Type B dispersal bed shall, take a grab sample of the effluent to determine the level of CBOD5 and suspended solids in the effluent,  carry out the sampling required by Clause  in accordance with the methods described in the APHA/AWWA/WEF, "Standard Methods for the Examination of Water and Wastewater", and  promptly submit the results of the sampling required by Clause  to the chief building official.

Prior to backfilling, the leaching chamber shall be, installed level over the length of the absorption trench,  securely connected together, section to section,  free of structural damage, uncut and used full length,  equipped with end caps installed on both ends,  equipped with an integrated splash plate at the inlet end of each line of leaching chamber, to prevent soil scouring, and  protected in such a manner so as to prevent soil or leaching bed fill from entering the leaching chamber.
All electrically conductive objects in a spraying area shall be grounded.
Where an elevator is used to comply with the requirements of Article 3.3.1.7., the provisions of Clause 3.3.1.7.(1) do not apply where the elevator system complies with Article 3.13.8.3.
If the checkout counters or control posts exceed 914 mm in height, there shall be a clear width of at least 550 mm.

Variation Label: Piping for Heating and Cooling Systems

P/T Sentence Text: If only the roof assembly of a building is of combustible construction, the building is deemed to comply with Clause  if the top storey and attic space are sprinklered, or the ceiling membrane has a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min and the attic space is fire stopped in accordance with Article 3.1.9.3. of the 1986 Building Code.
An owner or the owner"s agent may apply to the Chief Fire Official for an extension of the compliance date to permit time for a Life Safety Study to be submitted.

P/T Article Title: 7.4.9.4. Minimum Size of Building Drains and Sewers
P/T Sentence Text: Every storm building drain and every storm building sewer shall be at least 4 in. in size.
An emergency power supply conforming to Article 3.2.7.8. shall be provided for the fire alarm system.
The pump chamber shall be sized to provide sufficient storage volume so that the effluent is evenly dosed on an hourly basis over a 24-hour period.

Explosion venting to the outdoors is deemed to comply with Clause  if the venting  was installed on or before November 21, 2007, and  provides not less than 0.1 m2 of vent area for each cubic metre of dust collector enclosure volume.
Each floor area shall be served by at least two exits.

P/T Article Title: 3.8.2.3. Washrooms Required to be Barrier-Free (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: The number of universal washrooms conforming to Article 3.8.3.12. provided in a building in which a washroom is required by Subsection 3.7.4. shall conform to Table 3.8.2.3.A. (See Appendix A.)
A shelf and rack storage system shall not exceed 7 m in height.
No double Y, double TY, double T or double waste fitting shall be installed in a nominally horizontal soil or waste pipe.

This Article applies  as of April 15, 2015, in the case of buildings that contain no more than six suites of residential occupancy, and  as of October 15, 2015, in the case of buildings that contain more than six suites of residential occupancy.
Except in a modified pool, a black disc 150 mm in diameter on a white background shall be affixed to the bottom of a public pool within the area of its greatest depth.
Voice communication systems are not required to be tested in conformance with Sentences  and  where the systems are regularly used as part of a paging system.

P/T Article Title: 8.2.1.6. Clearances for a Class 4 or 5 Sewage System
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 8.2.1.4. and , a holding tank shall not be located closer than the minimum horizontal distances set out in Table 8.2.1.6.C.

Illumination from emergency lighting shall be an average of at least 10 lx at floor or tread level, or 1 watt/m2 of floor space. designed to provide illumination for a duration of at least 2 h in buildings whose highest floor level is more than 18 m above grade, and 30 min in buildings whose highest floor level is not more than 18 m above grade, supplied by a source of energy separate from the primary electrical supply for the building, and 2 h in buildings whose highest floor level is more than 18 m above grade, and 30 min in buildings whose highest floor level is not more than 18 m above grade, designed to be automatically actuated when the power to the building is interrupted.
Piping systems shall be used only for the transfer of products.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: A standpipe and hose system shall be installed in conformance with NFPA 13, "Standard for the Installation of Sprinkler Systems".
In addition to the requirements of Subsection 3.13.3. the steel truss enclosure of an escalator shall be sprinklered.

P/T Article Title: 7.6.2.5. Backflow from Buildings with a Solar Domestic Hot Water System
P/T Sentence Text: A potable water system that is directly connected to the heat transfer loop of a solar domestic hot water system that serves a residential occupancy within the scope of Part 9 shall be provided with a backflow preventer selected in accordance with CAN/CSA-F379.1, "Packaged Solar Domestic Hot Water Systems (Liquid-to-Liquid Heat for All-Season Use".

P/T Article Title: 3.4.6.18. Emergency Crossover Access to Floor Areas
P/T Sentence Text: In a building not more than 6 storeys in building height, doors providing access from exit stairs to a floor area containing a hotel are permitted to have locking devices to prevent entry into the floor area provided the requirements in Clause  are complied with.
If no standpipe system exists in a building under demolition that is 8 storeys or more in building height, a temporary standpipe shall be provided.

P/T Article Title: 9.1.1.5. Proximity to Existing Above Ground Electrical Conductors
P/T Sentence Text: Where a building is constructed in close proximity to existing above ground electrical conductors, the requirements of Subsection 3.1.19. shall apply.
Variation Label: Proximity to Existing Above Ground Electrical Conductors

P/T Sentence Text: Where a Life Safety Study is not approved, the Chief Fire Official shall advise the owner or the owner"s agent of the decision and the reasons therefor in writing.
Where a washroom required in Sentence 3.13.6.2. contains more than one water closet, the washroom shall be designed in conformance with the requirements in Articles 3.8.3.8. to 3.8.3.11.
A water distribution system supplying hot water to plumbing fixtures shall conform to the requirements in Subsection 7.6.5.

Space shall be maintained between chip piles and exposing structures, yard equipment or stock equal to  twice the pile height for combustible stock or buildings, or  the pile height for noncombustible buildings and equipment.
Openings for stairways and escalators used by passengers are permitted to penetrate the fire separations required in Sentences  to .
The depth of the water in any portion of a modified pool shall not be more than 1 800 mm.

Where openings in the vertical service space, including the top and bottom, are sealed with noncombustible materials having the same fire-resistance rating as the existing construction, the vertical service space is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence .
The liquid level in a dip tank shall be kept not less than 150 mm below the top of the tank.
Despite any other Order that requires compliance with this Part, the Chief Fire Official shall, within 30 days after receiving a Life Safety Study, review the Life Safety Study for implementation.
All leaching bed fill added shall be stabilized against erosion.

Existing aboveground atmospheric storage tanks that comply with ULC/ORD-C142.16-1994, "Protected Aboveground Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids", are deemed to comply with Clause (l).
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Article Title: Exemption for MCSS residences and hotels
P/T Sentence Text: This Section does not apply to a building or part of a building regulated under Section 9.9.
Except as provided in this Section the requirements in this Division apply to rapid transit stations.

P/T Article Title: Fire separations between dwelling units and corridors
P/T Sentence Text: Existing fire separations having less than a 45 min fire-resistance rating are deemed to be in compliance with Sentences  and  where the floor area is sprinklered.

Where one water closet is required for males and one water closet is required for females, the following may be provided in lieu of the water closets otherwise required by this Subsection: one universal washroom conforming to Sentence 3.8.3.12.(1), and one washroom containing one water closet that is permitted to be used by both sexes provided the door to the room can be locked from the inside.
Precautions shall be taken to prevent any mixing of foreign materials with dusts or overspray residues resulting from the sanding or spraying of finishing materials containing organic peroxides.

Where only the roof assembly is of combustible construction, the building is deemed to be in compliance with Clause  where have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h for floor assemblies and walls, columns and arches supporting floor assemblies, and be sprinklered, where the building is of combustible construction. the ceiling membrane has a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min and the attic space is fire stopped in accordance with Article 3.1.11.5. of the 1994 Building Code, the roof assembly is of heavy timber construction in conformance with Article 3.1.4.6. of the 1994 Building Code, or the top storey and attic space are sprinklered.

Where a basement does not contain a bedroom, recreation room, meeting room or hobby room, a fire separation having no fire-resistance rating between the basement and first storey is deemed to be in compliance with Clause 9.3.2.2.(1)(b).
If a standpipe system is required in a building, 38 mm diam hose connections shall be provided in each storey in the building.
Section 11.5. applies in respect of the requirements of Sentences 11.4.3.4.(1),  and .
This subsection applies to hazardous extraction operations.

Where a building drain enters a building above the elevation of the bottom of the wall of a building, the building drain may be deemed to terminate at the first point that the drainage pipe changes direction from the horizontal to the vertical.

When the gauge or alarm indicates that the air velocity is less than that required by Article 5.12.3.2. or 5.12.3.3., immediate corrective action shall be taken to remedy the condition that has resulted in the reduction of the ventilation.

An individually pressure-balanced or thermostatic-mixing valve is not required for shower heads having a single tempered water supply that is controlled by an automatic compensating valve conforming to CSA B125.3, "Plumbing Fittings".
Fire alarm systems equipped with a monitoring service that complies with CAN/ULC-S561, "Installation and Services for Fire Signal Receiving Centres and Systems" are deemed to comply with Sentence .
Exits required by Article 9.3.3.1. shall comply with the requirements of Articles 9.9.2.2. and 9.9.2.3. of the 1986 Building Code.
Where the manual pull stations are relocated, alternate approved measures shall be used to maintain the level of life safety.
Except as provided in this Subsection, tents are exempted from complying with the requirements of this Division.
Hydrant water flow shall be inspected annually in accordance with Article 6.6.5.7.
Insulators shall be kept clean and dry.

The sprinkler system in Sentences  and  shall be electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.10. and, upon operation, shall cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.8. when the corridor serves a Group E or Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancy.
Discharge outlets for special fire suppression systems shall be kept free of dirt and residue.
Doors in the fire separation or in the wired glass assembly in Clause  are not required to have latches where close spaced sprinkler protection is provided on the station side.
The requirements of this Section apply to a shelf and rack storage system.
The opening required in Sentence  shall not contain doors or windows.

P/T Article Title: 6.2.4.3. Construction and Installation of Ducts and Plenums
P/T Sentence Text: Rectangular panels in plenums and ducts more than 300 mm wide shall be shaped to provide sufficient stiffness.
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Sentence Text: For each means of egress, the required egress capacity at the platform shall be maintained for the entire length of the means of egress.

Emergency lighting on walkways, platforms, unenclosed egress stairs and exits providing means of egress shall conform to not less than, the illumination level in Sentences 3.2.7.3. and , and the duration in Sentence 3.2.7.4.(1).
The filter medium shall be unsaturated for its entire depth.
The lack of certification markings on a product or plumbing component shall be regarded as proof, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, that no certification exists.

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Closures in fire separations shall be in accordance with Sentences 3.1.8.4.(2), 3.1.8.10. and 3.1.8.11. and Articles 3.1.8.13. and 3.3.4.5. of the 1990 Building Code.
Pneumatic test pressures applied to underground storage tanks shall be measured by an instrument calibrated in increments of not more than 1 kPa.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: Recirculating air handling systems that serve more than one guest suite or storey shall be arranged to shut down upon actuation of the fire alarm system, except where continued operation of the air handling system serves as part of a smoke control system.
Radioactive nuclear substances and equipment shall be returned to storage after use.
The minimum distance between exits shall be 9 m or half the maximum diagonal dimension of the floor area, whichever is less.
The distance between buildings shall be not less than 9 m.

The inadequacy of the existing structural floor or roof framing system and its supporting members to support the proposed dead loads and live loads does not reduce the performance level of the building if the portion of the floor affected by the proposed loads is restricted to the loading it will support and signs stating the restrictions are posted.

The link load for each platform shall be the sum of the link loads for each track serving that platform and, except as provided in Sentence , the link load for each track shall be based on the link load per train headway multiplied by, a factor of 1.3 to account for surges, and in the peak direction for each route, an additional factor of 2 to account for a missed headway.

Except as required in Sentence , in an elementary or secondary school, where the occupant load of a room exceeds 200 persons, the room and any ancillary rooms of a complementary use shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than,  1 h where the building is not sprinklered, or  30 min where the building is sprinklered.
Signs in exits and underground walkways shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 25.
Heavy timber construction conforming to Article 3.1.4.6. of the 1994 Building Code is deemed to have a 45 min fire-resistance rating.
Thinners and solvents shall be dispensed only from listed and labelled safety cans.
Insulators shall be kept clean and dry.
A building that is sprinklered is deemed to be in compliance with Sentences  and .
A shelf and rack storage system may be designed for the storage, accessing, retrieval, packing and distribution of commodities.

P/T Article Title: 11.4.2.6. Extension of Buildings of Combustible Construction
P/T Sentence Text: The performance level of an existing building of combustible construction is reduced where the existing building is extended by adding a storey or storeys such that the extended building will be more than four storeys in building height.

No compression fitting connecting to plain end pipe or tube shall be used in a plumbing system unless the pipe or tube and fittings are sufficiently stayed, clamped, anchored or buttressed so as to prevent separation during normal service of the system allowing for surge pressures.

In floor areas where the manual pull stations are located in dwelling units, a legible sign stating FIRE ALARM PULL STATIONS LOCATED IN APARTMENT UNITS shall be posted near every exit in a public corridor.
The procedures described in Sentence  shall be made available to the Chief Fire Official upon request.
The annual CO2e emission level from a building required to comply with Clause 1.1.2.1. (b), shall not exceed the level achieved by complying with Sections 1 to 7 of the 2015 NECB and Chapter 3.
The distances set out in Column 2 of Table 8.2.1.6.B. shall be increased by twice the height that the leaching bed is raised above the original grade.
Electric motors for exhaust fans shall not be placed inside spray booths, spray rooms or ducts.
A building shall not be located beneath existing above ground electrical conductors.
Any distribution boxes, header lines, absorption trenches, distribution pipes or leaching chambers shall be installed only after the leaching bed fill has been compacted in accordance with Sentence .

A modified pool shall be surrounded on all sides by a hard-surfaced pool deck that shall, be at least 3 m wide, have a continuous crest surrounding the pool at least 100 mm above the pool water surface, and be sloped to shed water from the crest to the outer perimeter of the pool deck.

Exit signs required in Sentences  and  shall have the word "EXIT" or the words "EXIT/SORTIE" in red letters on a contrasting background or white letters on a red background, letters with strokes at least 19 mm wide, letters at least 150 mm high when the signs are externally illuminated, and letters at least 114 mm high when the signs are internally illuminated.

P/T Article Title: 3.2.2.44. Group C, up to 4 Storeys, Noncombustible Construction
P/T Sentence Text: The dwelling units described in Subclause (a) shall be separated by continuous vertical fire separations that extend through all storeys and service spaces of the separated portions.
Sprinkler systems shall be equipped with local electric waterflow alarms.
Electrically conductive objects within the charging influence of the electrodes of electrostatic fluidized beds shall be grounded.

The slope of the bottom of any portion of a wave action pool, shall not exceed 1 in 12 where the still water depth is less than 1 000 mm, and shall not exceed 1 in 9 where the still water depth is 1 000 mm or more.
This Section applies to the operation and maintenance of all sewage systems.

Every chamber or leaching chamber shall be as wide as the shallow buried trench in which it is contained, and the cross-sectional height of the chamber or leaching chamber at its centre point shall not be less than half the width of the trench.
Where the building area conforms to Clause 3.10.4.2.(1)(b), the limiting distance requirements shall not apply between individual buildings.
Organic peroxide pressure tank inserts shall be constructed of stainless steel, polyethylene or a material that is equally inert to organic peroxide.
Cellulose nitrate plastics shall not be stored  in rooms containing fuel-burning appliances or electrical heating elements, or  within 600 mm of any steam pipe, radiator or chimney.

P/T Article Title: Requirements for locking, latching and fastening devices
P/T Sentence Text: The controls for the remote release of a locking device permitted by Sentence  shall be in an area that is readily accessible to supervisory staff.
The water velocity in a pressure pipe shall not exceed, 3.0 m/s for plastic piping, and 1.8 m/s for copper piping.

Lighting installed to provide the minimum illumination levels required by this Code may be controlled by motion sensors except where the lighting, is installed in an exit,  is installed in a corridor serving patients or residents in a Group B, Division 2 or Division 3 occupancy, or  is required to conform to Sentence 3.2.7.1.(6).
Incinerator rooms and refuse storage rooms shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.
Each exit door, except those serving a single dwelling unit, shall open in the direction of exit travel and swing on its vertical axis.
All portions of a barrier-free path of travel shall be equipped to provide a level of illumination in accordance with Sentence 3.2.7.1.(1).

A door shall be equipped with a power door operator where the door serves,  a washroom for public use required to be barrier-free, or  a Group A occupancy within a Group C major occupancy apartment building.

A dead end corridor is permitted in a low or medium hazard industrial occupancy where, the dead end corridor, serves an occupant load of not more than 30 persons, is not more than 9 m long, and is provided with doors having self-closing devices, or there is a second and separate egress doorway from each room or suite not leading into a dead end corridor.

Each fire compartment referred to in Sentence  shall be capable of accommodating, in addition to its own occupants, the occupants of the largest adjacent fire compartment based on a clear floor space of 1.5 m2 per resident in the adjacent fire compartment.
A sleeping room or sleeping area shall not open directly into a room or area where food is intended to be stored, prepared, processed, distributed, served, sold or offered for sale.

Except as permitted by Sentence , a floor area containing residentsÃ¢â¬â¢ sleeping rooms in a retirement home where sleeping accommodation is provided for more than 10 residents shall be divided into no fewer than two fire compartments, each not more than 1 000 m2 in area.

A tenant of a rental suite shall notify the landlord as soon as the tenant becomes aware that  a smoke alarm in the unit is disconnected,  a smoke alarm in the unit is not operating, or  the operation of a smoke alarm in the unit is impaired.
The design procedures described in 4.2. are permitted to be used in lieu of the design procedures in this Subsection.

Material for the manufacture of cellulose nitrate plastic articles that is not kept in containers may be placed on tables, workbenches or at machines provided the quantity does not exceed one day"s supply.
A ventilation duct or opening, that penetrates the fire separation to the outdoors, need not be protected by a closure at the penetration.
