Where a foundation is erected on filled ground, peat or sensitive clay, the footing sizes shall be designed in conformance with Section 4.2.

Separate fire compartments required by Sentence  need not be provided, if the area intended for the storage of cylinders containing compressed gases that are heavier than air is separated by a concrete or masonry wall having a height of at least 1.5 m and projecting such that the minimum distance that vapour can travel between two cylinders of gas that may react with each other is not less than 15 m, measured horizontally.

P/T Article Title: 3.8.2.1. Areas Requiring Barrier-Free Path of Travel
P/T Sentence Text: The number of suites described in Sentence  having 1, 2 or 3 or more bedrooms shall be in proportion to the number of suites of residential occupancy having 1, 2 or 3 or more bedrooms in the remainder of the building.
Water supply systems used for fire protection shall be kept free of ice accumulations that may interfere with flow.

The path of exit travel may lead from an exit door or exit enclosure through open air parking that is located below a roof or floor assembly that is part of the building served by the exit door or exit enclosure where,  the portion of the path of exit travel that leads through the open air parking is not more than 9 m in length measured from the exit door to a point at ground level at the perimeter of the building,  measures are taken to prevent vehicles intended to park in spaces adjacent to the path of exit travel from encroaching on the path of exit travel, and  an alternate means of egress not leading through the open air parking is available from the interior side of the door opening onto the path of exit travel through the open air parking area.
A lavatory that does not have an overflow shall be equipped with a centre outlet waste fitting.

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Openings in fire separations required to have a 30 min fire-resistance rating shall be protected with closures having a 20 min fire-protection rating.
Waste water from a kitchen equipped with a garbage grinder may be directed to the sewage system provided the system has been designed to accept such waste water.
The side slope of the leaching bed fill may be increased up to one unit vertically to three units horizontally if measures are taken to prevent erosion and ensure stability of the leaching bed fill.
A clear space not less than 810 mm wide and 1 830 mm long shall be provided in each universal washroom for an adult-size change table.
The treatment unit shall be connected to a leaching bed constructed in accordance with the requirements of Section 8.7.
Buildings with limited combustible components may be approved as noncombustible construction.

A lockable, break-front glazed cabinet may be used for security purposes to store portable extinguishers and where portable extinguishers are located in a fire hose cabinet, an approved lockable, scored glass break-front cabinet may be used.

An existing standpipe and hose system capable of delivering a minimum flow rate of 265 L/min for at least 30 min at a minimum discharge pressure of 345 kPa  at the two highest and most remote hose valves is deemed to be in compliance with Clauses  (a), (c),  and  if not less than 132 L/min can be supplied from each of the two outlets simultaneously.
Type K or L copper tube shall be used for the potable water side of a heat exchanger in a pre-engineered wastewater heat recovery system.

P/T Article Title: 7.3.4.9. Thrust Restraint of Water Service Pipes )
P/T Sentence Text: Pipe clamps and tie-rods, thrust blocks, locked mechanical or push-on joints, mechanical joints utilizing set screw retainer glands, or other suitable means of thrust restraint shall be provided at each change of direction of a water service pipe 4 in. or more in size and at all tees, plugs, caps and bends.

A hot and cold water supply shall be provided to,  every plumbing appliance and fixture required by Article 3.7.6.4.,  every area where food or drink for human consumption, or an ingredient of food or drink for human consumption, is manufactured, processed or prepared, and  every area where utensils are washed.

Hot water pipes that are vertically connected to a hot water storage tank shall have heat traps on both inlet and outlet piping as close as practical to the tank, except where the tank, has an integral heat trap, or  serves a recirculating system.

P/T Article Title: 7.4.10.6. Hydraulic Loads to Soil or Waste Pipes
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical sanitary drainage pipe shall be designed to carry no more than 29% of its full capacity.

The operator of the outdoor public amusement area shall develop and implement written fire safety procedures that include  a means of alerting the persons in the public amusement area of a fire emergency and notifying the fire department,  evacuation of endangered persons,  appointment and instruction of supervisory staff to carry out fire safety duties, and  fire prevention and control of fire hazards.
Checkout counters or control posts in retail outlets may be used within access to exits if there is a clear width of at least 450 mm up to a height of 914 mm.
For the purposes of Sentences ,  and , carbon monoxide alarms shall be tested by activating the carbon monoxide alarm test feature.
Access routes for fire fighting shall be provided in accordance with Articles 3.2.5.5. to 3.2.5.7. of the 1990 Building Code.

In addition to the requirements in Sentence , if a standpipe system is required, 65 mm diam hose connections shall be installed in each storey in the building if the building, is more than 25 m high, measured between grade and the ceiling of the top storey, or has a building area of more than 4 000 m2.

Except as permitted in Sentences  and , a buried water service pipe shall be separated from the building drain, building sewer and a private sewage disposal system, by not less than 2 440 mm measured horizontally, of undisturbed or compacted earth.
A shelf and rack storage system intended for the storage of rubber tires shall conform to, Article 3.3.6.5., and the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997.

Where motion sensors are used to control minimum lighting in a public corridor or corridor providing access to exit for the public, the motion sensors shall be installed with switch controllers equipped for fail-safe operation and illumination timers set for a minimum 15-minute duration.

For the purposes of this Section, "1994 Building Code" means Regulation 61 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990, as it read on July 14, 1994; "existing" means in existence on July 14, 1994; "row house" means is one of a group of three or more horizontally attached residential structures, and is separated vertically from one or two of the other structures by common walls which do not provide for internal access from the living space in one structure to another; semi-detached house means a residential structure which is one of two horizontally attached residential structures, and is separated vertically from the other residential structure by a common wall which does not provide for internal access from the living space in one structure to the other.

A hose cabinet referred to in Sentence  shall be of sufficient size to, contain the equipment referred to in Sentence , contain a listed fire extinguisher, and provide sufficient clearance to permit the use of a standard fire department hose key.

Emergency power shall be provided for a standpipe system that is designed with at least one pressure zone located above another, such that the water supply for the booster pump in the upper zone must be supplied from the pump in the zone below.

Where a grease interceptor is required by Sentence 7.4.4.3.(1), the interceptor shall conform to,  CSA B481.1, "Testing and Rating of Grease Interceptors Using Lard", or  CSA B481.2, "Testing and Rating of Grease Interceptors Using Oil".
Where an exhaust duct passes through or is adjacent to unheated space, the duct shall be insulated to prevent moisture or condensation in the duct.
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentences  and , cylinders containing compressed gases that may react with one another shall be stored in separate fire compartments having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

Dead-end aisles are permitted to be more than 10 m long, but not more than 13 m long if, the seating area is separated from other seating areas and adjacent occupancies, including a corridor serving any seating area, by a fire separation in accordance with Sentences 3.3.2.2. and , the travel distance is not more than 25 m measured along the path of travel from any seat to an exit, to an egress doorway or to an opening into a vomitory, at least one means of egress, comprising not less than 30 per cent of the required exit capacity, is through an exterior exit, an exit stairway or a corridor not containing an occupancy, each row served by a dead-end aisle has a minimum unobstructed width of 400 mm plus 6.1 mm for each additional seat above seven seats in a row, but not more than 550 mm, the activation of a fire detector or a sprinkler head in the seating area will, cause the shutdown of the projection system serving the seating area, and turn on the normal lighting in the seating area, a voice communication system is installed in conformance with Article 3.2.4.23., a smoke control system is installed to control movement of smoke in the seating area or a smoke exhaust system is provided so that, in the event of detection of smoke by a smoke detector in the seating area, air handling equipment is activated to extract air directly from the seating area at the rate of at least six air changes per hour, and the floor area is sprinklered.

The flame-spread rating required in Sentence  is permitted to be greater than 25 if an automatic special fire suppression system conforming to an applicable standard set out in Article 6.8.1.1. is provided inside the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: Notwithstanding the requirements of Sentence , the plastic portion of an interior sign placed over or forming part of an interior wall surface in corridors, covered or enclosed walkways at or above grade in buildings shall, not exceed 15% of the wall area in, or over which it may be installed, be supported by a device that will not detrimentally affect the fire-resistance rating of the interior wall to which it is attached or of which it may form a part, and encase the edges of the plastic sign face in metal, not be positioned or sized in such a manner that it is less than 600 mm from the vertical line separating two adjacent premises, be placed so that there is at least 600 mm vertical separation of noncombustible material between the top of the plastic sign surface and the ceiling surface, be permitted to have an increase of 100% in area required in Clause  and a decrease of 50% of the separation distances required in Clauses  and  if the area is sprinklered, and have a flame-spreading rating not more than 250.

P/T Article Title: 3.17.2.1. Change of Use and Compensating Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Where proposed construction will result in a change of use described in Subclauses 3.17.1.1.(1)(a) to  and (vi), additional construction shall be required in order that the building or part of a building subject to the change of use conforms to the requirements of Subsection 3.2.6. and Sections 3.7., 3.11. and 3.12. as they apply to the new major occupancy that the building or part of a building is to support.
A public pool shall be equipped with clean water inlets arranged in conjunction with surface skimmers or overflow gutters to provide uniform distribution and circulation of clean water.
Buildings containing a home described in Clause 9.4.1.1.(1) or  that is a care occupancy or a care and treatment occupancy shall be sprinklered in conformance with Sentences  to .

Where unit masonry columns are used, the height of such columns shall not exceed, in the case of hollow masonry units, 4 times the least dimension of the units,  in the case of solid masonry units or hollow units with voids filled with concrete, 10 times the least dimension of the column, or  where the column is reinforced with at least four 13 mm diam bars and filled with concrete, 18 times the least dimension of the column.
Resistance to forced entry into dwelling units shall conform to the applicable requirements in Articles 9.7.5.2. and 9.7.5.3.

The requirements of Subsection 3.16.3. apply to a shelf and rack storage system for the storage of Group A, B and C plastics and rubber tires as defined in NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems".

The minimum number of water closets, urinals and lavatories shall be determined from Article 3.7.4.3. and Table 3.7.4.3.C. for an occupant load based on, the formula in Sentence 3.1.17.3. for all public pools, except a wave action pool, or the formula in Sentence 3.1.17.3. for a wave action pool.
The scope of this Part shall be as described in Subsection 1.1.2. of Division A.

Sentence  does not apply in buildings 3 storeys or less in building height that provide sleeping accommodation for 10 or fewer persons, and in buildings where all of the corridors referred to in Sentence  are subdivided in accordance with Sentence .
Explosion venting as outlined in Sentence 4.2.9.6. is only required in the distillation areas of a distillery.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: A power-ventilated enclosure required by the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997 shall be designed and constructed to conform to Articles 6.2.13.4. and 6.2.13.5.

Where the vault ventilation system in Sentence  is a mechanical system, it shall be separate from the system for the remainder of the building and shall be designed so that,  the vault temperature is thermostatically controlled,  the fan is located so that it may be serviced without danger to personnel,  a high temperature alarm is provided in the vault,  the system is automatically shut off in the event of a fire in the vault, and  a filter is provided in the air inlet if there is a possibility of dirt being drawn in.
The requirements in this Subsection apply to all buildings except a 1 storey building that does not contain a basement or mezzanine.

If wood wall studs or sheet steel wall studs enclose the main bathroom in a dwelling unit, reinforcement shall be installed to permit the future installation of the following:  for a water closet, a grab bar described in Clauses 3.8.3.8.(3) and a grab bar described in Clause 3.8.3.8.(3)(c),  for a shower, grab bars described in Clause 3.8.3.13.(2)(g), and  for a bathtub, grab bars described in Clause 3.8.3.13.(4)(e).
Spill control procedures shall be prominently posted and maintained where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored, handled, processed or used.
The operability of the interconnected system shall be confirmed monthly, by testing at least one smoke alarm using its test function, on a rotational basis.

P/T Article Title: Compliance time for health care facilities, care occupancies and retirement homes
P/T Sentence Text: It is the responsibility of the owner of a building to which Section 9.7 applies to comply with Article 9.7.4.3. as of March 1, 2014, Articles 9.7.3.1., 9.7.4.1. and 9.7.4.2. as of January 1, 2015, Articles 9.7.2.1. and 9.7.4.4. as of January 1, 2016, and Article 9.7.5.1. as of January 1, 2019.
The pool lift shall be, designed to be operable without assistance from both the deck and water, and designed so that, when in use, its controls and operating mechanisms are unobstructed.

Except in a high hazard industrial occupancy, an exit door need not swing in the direction of exit travel where it serves,  a room, suite or floor area having an occupant load of not more than 60 persons, or  as part of a means of egress from more than one floor area and the floor areas so served have a total occupant load of not more than 60 persons.

If a fuel-burning appliance associated with building services is installed in a building, but not within a suite of residential occupancy, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed  in the service room or area where the appliance is installed,  adjacent to each sleeping area in each suite of residential occupancy that has a common wall or common floor/ceiling assembly with the service room or area where the appliance is installed, and  adjacent to sleeping rooms that are not within a dwelling unit.

Except where exits serving the floor area are at ground level, the increased travel distance to exits permitted by Clause 3.4.2.5.(1) shall not apply to a floor area within an interconnected floor space.

Hose stations shall  be located so that all areas  are protected by a hose station on the same storey, and  can be reached by a hose stream and are within 6 m of a hose nozzle when the hose is extended,  be provided with a 38 mm hose valve, unless otherwise approved,  be equipped with not more than 30 m of 38 mm hose on a hose rack, unless otherwise approved,  have the hose attached, ready for use at all times and equipped with a shut-off combination fog and straight stream nozzle,  be within easy reach of a person standing on the floor, with the hose valve connection located no more than 1.5 m from the floor, and  be located  in corridors where possible, and  in hose cabinets.
For storage tank buildings protected by automatic sprinklers in conformance with NFPA 13, "Standard for the Installation of Sprinkler Systems", storage capacities shall not be limited.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: Maintenance and testing of portable extinguishers shall be in conformance with NFPA 10, "Portable Fire Extinguishers".
This Article does not apply to a retail food premises described in Sentence 3.7.6.4.(3).
The solid fuel-fired appliances in Sentence  shall conform to CSA B366.1, Solid-Fuel-Fired Central Heating Appliances .

High voltage circuits in electrostatic fluidized beds shall be designed so that any discharge produced when the charging electrodes of the bed are approached or contacted by a grounded object will not be of sufficient intensity to ignite any powder-air mixture likely to be encountered or result in any appreciable shock hazard.

If dispensing or hand-operated washroom accessories, other than those located in water closet stalls or enclosures and those described in Clause (g), are provided, they shall be mounted so that, the dispensing height is not less than 900 mm and not more than 1 200 mm above the finished floor, the controls or operating mechanisms are mounted not less than 900 mm and not more than 1 200 mm above the finished floor, and a minimum 1 370 mm deep floor space is provided in front of the controls or operating mechanisms to allow for a front approach.
The record shall be kept for at least 12 months after the fire drill.

Electrical components, including transformers, power packs and control equipment for the electrostatic removal of excess coating material (detearing), shall be located in an area where the vapour concentration of flammable liquids or combustible liquids cannot exceed 25% of the lower explosive limit.
After flushing and scrubbing contaminated areas very thoroughly to dissolve all material, the residue shall be washed away with hoses.
The landlord shall test carbon monoxide alarms that are connected to an electrical circuit after any change is made to the electrical circuit.
No pipe fitting, joint or connection that would tend to intercept solids or reduce the flow through a pipe by more than 10 percent shall be used in a plumbing system.
Sentence  does not apply to a tank that is an integral part of a prefabricated Class 1 sewage system.

P/T Article Title: Buildings over 4 storeys but not more than 6 storeys
P/T Sentence Text: Where smoke detectors are provided in corridors serving guest suites, a building of heavy timber construction conforming to Article 3.1.4.6. of the 1994 Building Code is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence .

Except as otherwise permitted in Sentences  and , every public pool shall be equipped with dressing rooms, locker rooms, shower heads, water closets, urinals, lavatories and drinking fountains that shall be designed, constructed and equipped to comply with Sentences  to .
Live/work units shall be mechanically ventilated in accordance with the requirements of Sentence .
This Part applies to resource conservation and environmental integrity in the design and construction of buildings.
Sentence  does not apply to a gas or oil-fired appliance installed on the roof of a building of noncombustible construction.

A water distribution system supplying hot water to any bathtub, shower or hand basin that is accessible to a patient or resident in a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy or a resident of a group home, home for special care or residence for adults with developmental disabilities shall have one or more temperature gauges and control devices that are,  accessible only to supervisory staff, and  capable of being adjusted to ensure that the temperature of the water supplied to the fixtures does not exceed 49°C.
Hydrants shall be maintained free of snow and ice accumulations.
Permanently installed access walkways at least 1.8 m wide and constructed of noncombustible material shall be provided so that hose streams may be directed on any part of the piles.
Vertical service spaces shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

Existing access to exits through dead end corridors are deemed to be in compliance with Sentence  where the occupant load does not exceed 20 persons, and the travel distance does not exceed 6 m plus the width of the dead end corridor to a point where a choice of two directions of exit travel are available.

In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, a mezzanine located within a live/work unit is permitted to be of combustible construction, provided the area of the mezzanine is not more than 25% of the floor area of the live/work unit or 20 m2, whichever is less, and has no obstructions more than 1 070 mm above the floor.
Sawdust and shavings may be used if kept damp.

Portable extinguishers shall supplement fixed fire protection in Part 5 in accordance with Article 6.2.6.9. where a flammable liquid or combustible liquid is stored in an open container and where the liquid surface area exceeds 0.4 m2.
Energy efficiency requirements do not apply to buildings or parts of buildings described in Article 1.2.1.1.

Seats may be arranged in a manner that does not meet the requirements of Sentence  where the aisle widths are increased by 50% above the requirements set out in Sentences  to , and where the maximum occupant load of the space is based on not less than 1.2 m2 of floor space per person.
Separators shall be used to prevent tramp iron or other spark-producing materials from being introduced into the powders being applied.

The annual CO2e emission level from a building required to comply with Clause 1.1.2.1. (a), shall not exceed the level achieved by complying with Sections 5 to 10 of 2013 ANSI/ASHRAE/IES 90.1 and Chapter 2.

P/T Article Title: Fire separations between dwelling units and corridors
P/T Sentence Text: Existing fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 30 min are deemed to comply with Sentences  and  if smoke detectors are installed in public corridors.
Where notification is by mail, it is deemed to have been served on the fifth day after the date of mailing.
Clause  does not apply to a sprinkler system that met the requirements of this Code on December 31, 2014, as it read on that day.

P/T Article Title: Fire separations between bedrooms and corridors
P/T Sentence Text: A fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 30 min is deemed to comply with Sentences  and  if smoke detectors are installed in bedrooms, sitting areas, lounges and corridors serving bedrooms on the floor area, and heat detectors are installed in other rooms opening onto corridors serving bedrooms.

Except as required in Article 3.5.1.8., where a municipal hydrant system exists and is adjacent to the yard, the hydrant system shall be extended into the yard area so that all parts of the salvage yard can be reached by using not more than 60 m of hose.
Except for a shallow buried trench, the distribution pipe within a leaching chamber shall be not less than 3 in. trade size for dosed systems.

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Despite Sentence , closures in fire separations to which Article 9.5.2.7. applies do not require self-closing devices, except as required in Sentences 9.5.3.1. and 9.5.3.3.(3).

P/T Article Title: 11.4.3.4. Change in Major Occupancy (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the performance level is reduced under Sentence 11.4.2.3.(5), the requirement for the building to be of noncombustible construction or to be constructed in accordance with Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A. is satisfied if the building is sprinklered.
Except as provided in this Subsection, the requirements in Section 3.8. apply to rapid transit stations.

Existing doors that have the floor level identified in plain legible block letters or numbers at least 114 mm high with a 19 mm stroke on both sides of the door are deemed to be in compliance with Sentence .

Except as provided by Sentence , combustible piping and tubing and associated adhesives used in a building within the scope of Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A. shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 25.
The supply duct shall have,  a diameter of not less than 100 mm or equivalent area, and  an exterior intake for entry of air from the outdoors.

Except as provided in Sentence , where no direct connection exists between the auxiliary water supply and the potable water system, premise isolation shall be provided by a dual check valve backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.6, "Dual Check Valve  Backflow Preventers".

Where electric space heating, other than forced-air electric heating system, is provided in buildings of residential occupancy within the scope of Part 9, the mechanical ventilation system shall include heat recovery ventilators designed to provide a minimum 55% sensible heat recovery efficiency when tested to the low temperature thermal and ventilation performance test method set out in CAN/CSA-C439, Rating the Performance of Heat/Energy-Recovery Ventilators , at a Station 1 test temperature of -25°C at an air flow not less than 30 L/s.

Where a garage is detached from the house or the individual dwelling unit it serves but attached to another garage on the adjacent property, the party wall so formed shall be constructed as a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.

If there is a firewall in an elementary or secondary school, the travel distance shall not be measured to a door in the firewall, but shall be measured to an exterior exit door or an exit door to a stairway.

All exposed potable water piping and chlorine piping within a public pool water treatment service room shall be colour coded by means of, painting the entire outer surface of the piping, or coloured bands at least 25 mm in width that are spaced along the piping at intervals of not more than 1 200 mm.

P/T Article Title: 3.3.6.4. Storage and Dispensing Rooms for Flammable Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum distance between the egress doors described in Clause  shall be not less than three-quarters of the maximum diagonal dimension of the room.
Except as provided by Clause 3.2.4.23.(3)(a), in a care and treatment occupancy an alert signal is permitted to be silenced automatically after 1 min.
A voice communication system shall be provided where the vertical distance between the floor of the top storey and grade exceeds 36 m.
Unless otherwise approved, manual pull stations shall be installed at the main reception area, and near every exit.

Booths and kiosks that are more than 20 m2 in area and are used only by the transit agency for fare collection, dissemination of information or similar non-mercantile occupancies shall be, sprinklered, and separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation of noncombustible construction that is not required to have a fire-resistance rating.
Portable extinguishers shall be provided to protect every building, each hazardous occupancy inside the building and each hazardous process or operation located outside.

Each room, guest suite, podium, terrace, platform, contained open space or other area intended for occupancy shall have two egress doorways placed in such a manner that one doorway could provide egress from the room or area if the other doorway becomes inaccessible to the occupants due to a fire which might originate in the room or area where  the space is intended for assembly occupancy, and  the distance of travel to an egress door from any point in the space exceeds 15 m, or  the occupant load exceeds 60 persons,  the space is intended for storage, and  exceeds 200 m2 in area, or  the distance of travel to an egress door from any point in the space exceeds 23 m, or  the space is intended for a use other than that described in Clauses  and (b), and  exceeds 100 m2 in area, or  the occupant load exceeds 60 persons.
The Chief Fire Official shall be notified within an approved time period before every fire drill carried out under Sentence 2.8.3.2.(6).

Except as otherwise required in Subsections 3.11.4., 3.11.5., 3.11.6. and 3.11.7. or otherwise exempted in Sentences  and , Class A pools and Class B pools shall be designed and constructed to comply with Sentences  to  and Articles 3.11.3.2. and 3.11.3.3.
A high hazard industrial occupancy shall not contain a shelf and rack storage system.

Where a service room is separated in accordance with Article 9.5.2.10., sufficient combustion air shall be brought directly from the outside for the proper combustion and safe operation of the appliances.

Except as provided in Sentence , if the hazard index of the new major occupancy is greater than the hazard index of the existing major occupancy, the performance level is not reduced where the hazard index of the new major occupancy is not greater than the construction index of the existing building.
Matches shall be classified, packaged and labelled in accordance with the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Act (Canada).
All indoor and outdoor incinerators shall be maintained in accordance with NFPA 82, "Standard on Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment".
Cast iron, copper and aluminum floor flanges shall be suitable for the purpose.

Where an adult-size change table is installed, it shall,  when fully loaded, have a surface height above the finished floor that can be adjusted from between 450 mm and 500 mm at the low range to between 850 mm and 900 mm at the high range,  be designed to carry a minimum load of 1.33 kN,  have a clear floor space parallel to the long side of the table not less than 760 mm wide and 1 500 mm long, and  in the case of a fold-down table,  be installed so that it does not encroach into a clear transfer space described in Clause 3.8.3.8.(2) or (b), and  have no operating mechanisms higher than 1 200 mm.
A sign shall be conspicuously posted near the detearing area indicating the minimum clearance space required.
Subject to Sentences  and , this Section applies to suites of residential occupancy and sleeping rooms not within a dwelling unit.
A separate lavatory for the handwashing of employees shall be constructed in a location convenient for employees in each manufacturing, processing and preparation area.

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Existing operable transoms and glass lights shall be fixed shut and shall meet the fire-protection rating requirements of Sentences  and .

P/T Article Title: 8.2.1.5. Clearance Distances for Class 1, 2 and 3 Sewage Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 8.2.1.4. and , no Class 1, 2 or 3 sewage system shall have a horizontal distance of less than that permitted by Table 8.2.1.5.

P/T Article Title: 3.3.6.4. Storage and Dispensing Rooms for Flammable Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: The travel distance within the room to the nearest egress door described in Clause  shall be not more than 23 m.

P/T Article Title: 9.10.19.3. Location of Smoke Alarms (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.19.8., within a house that contains an interior shared means of egress or common area, a smoke alarm shall be installed in each shared means of egress and common area.

Solid fuel-burning stoves, furnaces and hydronic heating systems designed to burn solid fuels, other than coal, shall conform to the particulate emission limits of, CSA B415.1,  Performance Testing of Solid-Fuel-Burning Heating Appliances , or (b)the Standards of Performance for New Residential Wood Heaters , set out in Subpart AAA of Part 60 of Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations, published by the United States Environmental Protection Agency, as it read on March 16, 2015.

Dip tanks having a capacity in excess of 550 L or having a liquid surface area in excess of 1 m2 shall be equipped with a properly trapped overflow pipe that leads to a safe location outside the building or to a closed, vented salvage tank conforming to Subsection 5.13.4.

Except as required by Sentence , combustible piping is permitted to penetrate a vertical or horizontal fire separation, provided the fire compartments on each side of the fire separation are sprinklered and the piping is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop in conformance with Clause 3.1.9.1.(1)(a).
The effluent shall be distributed through a pressurized distribution system having a pressure head of not less than 600 mm when measured to the most distant point from the pump.

Dead-end public corridors in residential occupancies and business and personal services occupancies shall contain only suite door openings arranged so that not more than two such doors have to be passed to reach the nearest exit.

Where the water supply is to be metered, the installation of the meter, including the piping that is part of the meter installation and the valving arrangement for the meter installation, shall be according to the water purveyor s requirements.
Visual signal devices are permitted to be installed in lieu of audible signal devices in the compartments referred to in Article 3.3.3.6.

For the purposes of this Section, every reference to a public pool or a recirculation system in a definition in Article 1.4.1.2. of Division A, or a Sentence or Clause in Section 3.11. that is made applicable to public spas by this Section, is deemed to be a reference to a public spa or water circulation system, respectively.
Notification shall be served either personally or by mail.

In elementary and secondary schools, a door assembly conforming to Articles 9.10.13.2. and 9.10.13.3. is permitted to be used as a closure in a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of 30 min.

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Despite Sentences  and , fire dampers or fire-stop flaps are not required in ducts at penetrations of a fire separation.
The flame-spread rating of interior finishes on walls and ceilings within a means of egress shall not exceed 200.
Rubbish shall not be burned on the premises unless permitted in accordance with Article 2.4.4.4.

Despite Sentence , if a building containing a care occupancy or retirement home also contains one or more other occupancies that are not governed by this Part, this Section does not apply to the fire safety systems, devices and structural elements of any of the other occupancies that do not affect the life safety of the care occupancy or retirement home.

P/T Article Title: 10.2.1.2. Classification According to Construction and Occupancy
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Part, existing buildings shall be classified as to their construction and occupancy as provided for in Sentence 11.2.1.1.(1).
Despite Sentence , Articles 5.6.2.1. to 5.6.2.4. apply to any amount of poisonous or corrosive compressed gas.
Every installation of an x-ray machine or of x-ray equipment in a building shall be shielded to protect any person who could be exposed to radiation inside and outside the building.

In the 2015 NECB, references made to the CCBFC NRCC 53301, National Building Code of Canada or CCBFC NRCC 53302, National Plumbing Code of Canada are deemed to be references to corresponding provisions of the Building Code.
Signs prohibiting smoking that meet the requirements of Article 2.4.3.2. shall be conspicuously posted in all powder-coating areas and powder storage rooms.

This Subsection applies to roll-coating processes in which flammable liquids or combustible liquids are applied to products or materials by bringing them into contact with a roller that is coated with the coating liquid.
During alteration of a building required to have a standpipe and hose system, the system shall be installed or dismantled progressively so as to provide protection to all floor areas.

Sentence  does not apply to the use of an appliance that  meets the requirements of the Technical Standards and Safety Act, 2000,  is for outdoor use,  if assembled, has been assembled in accordance with the manufacturer s instructions, and  if installed, has been installed in accordance with the manufacturer s instructions.

Where up to three portable extinguishers rated for Class B fires are used to satisfy the extinguisher rating specified in Table 6.2.6.B., the sum of the basic extinguisher ratings shall satisfy the requirements in Table 6.2.6.B.

In-service underground piping systems that do not comply with Sentence  may remain in-service if the piping does not leak and if the piping system met the requirements of this Code on December 31, 2014, as it read on that day.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: The cesspool shall be provided with a tight strong cover that shall remain over the cesspool except when it is necessary to remove it for the purposes of adding sanitary sewage to or removing sanitary sewage from the cesspool or for purposes of maintenance of the cesspool.

Each dwelling unit or suite in a floor area shall have a doorway leading to the outside at or near grade, an outside passageway where it is possible to go in opposite directions to separate exits, or a public corridor where it is possible to go in opposite directions to separate exits.
Leaching chambers shall conform to the requirements of IAPMO PS 63, "Plastic Leaching Chambers".
Portable extinguishers having a gross weight of 18 kg or less shall be installed so that the top of the extinguisher is not more than 1.5 m above the floor.

A vault, that is part of a building and houses electrical equipment indoors, shall have,  roofs or ceilings consisting of reinforced concrete of adequate strength for the conditions and not less than 150 mm thick, and  floors consisting of reinforced concrete of adequate strength for the conditions and not less than 150 mm thick, except that floors that are at excavation level are permitted to be of reinforced concrete not less than 100 mm thick.
Each floor area shall be served by a minimum of two exits.
Floor assemblies and walls, columns and arches supporting floor assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

Hazardous materials, processes and operations shall be located and the premises maintained so that the means of egress will not be obstructed in any manner that would interfere with evacuation of the floor area in the event of a fire.

This Part applies to individual dwelling units in a supported group living residence or an intensive support residence regulated under the Services and Supports to Promote the Social Inclusion of Persons with Developmental Disabilities Act, 2008.

P/T Article Title: Measures in a fire safety plan
P/T Sentence Text: The revised fire safety plan prepared under Sentence  or  shall be implemented.
The public address system and the communication system described in Sentences  and  shall be interconnected.
Vertical service spaces shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.
Except for a modified pool and wave action pool, where a pool deck projects over the water surface, the projection shall not exceed 50 mm.

All structural framing elements not considered to be part of the SFRS must be investigated and shown to behave elastically or to have sufficient non-linear capacity to support their gravity loads while undergoing earthquake-induced deformations calculated from the deflections determined in Article 4.1.8.13.
Smoke detectors shall be provided as fire detectors in public corridors serving dwelling units in buildings of combustible construction.

P/T Article Title: 6.2.4.3. Construction and Installation of Ducts and Plenums

P/T Sentence Text: A public pool shall be equipped with lockable doors or other barriers capable of preventing public access to the pool deck.

For purposes of Sentences  and , the volume of an interconnected floor space need not include the aggregate volume of those floor areas or portions of floor areas designed to have zoned air extraction in accordance with Sentence .
Fire alarm and detection systems shall comply with the requirements of Subsection 3.2.4. of the 1986 Building Code.

Except as permitted by Sentences  and , where required by the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997, an area intended for the storage of cylinders containing compressed gases that may react with one another shall be divided into separate fire compartments having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.
Recreational camps shall have an area in the sleeping quarters of at least 3.72 mÃÂ² per camper or, if double or triple tier bunk units are used, 2.79 mÃÂ² per camper.
The sump area and any area on which coating liquid flows shall be considered as the dip tank area.

Except for a modified pool, a wave action pool and a pool used exclusively for scuba diving, the slope of the bottom of any portion of a public pool shall not exceed, 8% where the water depth is 1 350 mm or less, 33% where the water depth is more than 1 350 mm and less than 2 000 mm, and 50% where the water depth is 2 000 mm or more.
Floor assemblies and walls, columns and arches supporting floor assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.
Any material used to support or form the sidewalls of the cesspool shall be an open jointed material of a type that will permit leaching from the cesspool.

Ducts, stacks and associated insulation in systems for the removal of flammable vapours shall  be constructed of noncombustible materials,  not pass through firewalls, and  discharge outdoors not less than  1.5 m from unprotected building openings, and  6 m from air intake openings.

Each room, guest suite, podium, terrace, platform, contained open space or other area intended for occupancy shall have egress facilities leading directly to a public thoroughfare, an approved open space that has access to a public thoroughfare, or a corridor where it is possible to go in opposite directions to separate exits, except as otherwise permitted by this Article or Article 9.9.3.3.

Auxiliary rooms, mechanical rooms or storage rooms are permitted to be ventilated into a storage garage, provided that, they are accessible only from that storage garage,  they have no openings or duct penetrations through the walls separating the room from adjacent spaces other than that storage garage and other auxiliary, mechanical or storage rooms,  the exhaust contains no contaminants that would adversely affect the air quality in the storage garage, and (See Appendix A.)  they are provided with,  carbon monoxide monitoring devices in accordance with Sentences 6.2.2.3. and , or  a light switch which is interlocked with the operation of the exhaust fan serving the room. (See Appendix A.)

P/T Article Title: Exhaust and fire protection systems in cooking operations
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  does not apply to  an individual suite of residential occupancy, or  a cooking operation producing insignificant amounts of smoke or grease-laden vapours that are controlled by other approved measures.
The unobstructed glass area of a door or skylight is considered equivalent to that of a window.
Sentence  does not apply where a silencing switch is part of an approved integrated voice communication system and signal silencing takes place to allow fire emergency instructions to be heard.

P/T Article Title: Requirements for locking, latching and fastening devices
P/T Sentence Text: A locking device permitted by Sentence  that is electrically operated shall be  designed to operate on emergency power, and  capable of being manually unlocked by supervisory staff.

Where the fire alarm system monitoring referred to in Sentence  is provided by a central station, the building owner shall obtain written documentation from the central station operator that the monitoring service complies with  NFPA 71, "Standard for the Installation, Maintenance, and Use of Signaling Systems for Central Station Service", or  CAN/ULC-S561, "Installation and Services for Fire Signal Receiving Centres and Systems".
At the time of installation, aboveground storage tanks and associated piping shall be tested for leakage in conformance with Subsections 4.3.15. and 4.4.6.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: When not in use, cellulose nitrate motion picture film shall be kept in closed, single-roll containers.

Sections 9.2 to 9.9 do not apply to a building with respect to which the Chief Fire Official has granted an exemption under a predecessor of this Regulation during such period as the exemption is valid.

Changes in equipment or occupancy that might result in temperatures at sprinklers being more than 38°C or less than 4°C with wet pipe systems shall not be made without previously making provisions to alter the sprinkler system to prevent premature operation or freezing.
Not more than 20 suites need comply with Sentence .

A treatment unit that is used in conjunction with a leaching bed constructed as a shallow buried trench, Type A dispersal bed or Type B dispersal bed shall be designed such that the effluent does not exceed the maximum concentrations set out opposite a Level IV treatment unit in Columns 2 and 3 of Table 8.6.2.2.

If, on December 31, 2014, any appliance, equipment, system, installation or construction met the requirements of the edition that was designated in Table 1.2.1.A. of this Code as it read on December 31, 2014, the appliance, equipment, system, installation or construction is deemed to comply with the requirements of the edition referred to in Sentence .
A clearance of at least 914 mm shall be maintained between the tops of piles and sprinkler head deflectors.

A building is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence  where all guest suites have access to an exterior balcony, the length of corridors serving guest suites does not exceed 30 m between exits, corridors serving guest suites are equipped with smoke detectors connected to the fire alarm system, corridors serving guest suites are subdivided in conformance with Sentence , or the building is sprinklered.
The number of water closets required shall conform to Table 3.7.4.3.C. for, motion picture theatres, Group A, Division 3 occupancies, Group A, Division 4 occupancies, and outdoor pools.
The requirements of Subsection 3.16.2. apply to a shelf and rack storage system for the storage of Class I, II, III and IV commodities as defined in NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems".
For the purposes of this Article, mezzanines, tiers and balconies shall be regarded as part of the floor area.

For the purpose of Clauses  and (d),  if the room or suite in which the mezzanine is located is permitted to have one egress doorway, the travel distance is measured from any point on the mezzanine to that doorway, or  if the room or suite in which the mezzanine is located is required to have more than one egress doorway, the travel distance is measured from any point on the mezzanine to the nearest egress facility leading from the mezzanine.

Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the requirements in Subsection 3.2.4. shall not apply.
If a fuel-burning appliance or a fireplace is installed in a suite of residential occupancy, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed adjacent to each sleeping area in the suite.
Water flow alarm tests using the most hydraulically remote test connection shall be performed annually on wet sprinkler systems.

Where a water closet is located in accordance with Clause (b), a fold-down grab bar conforming to Sentence  shall be provided on each side of the water closet, and a grab bar conforming to Sentences  and  shall be provided on the wall behind the water closet.
Carpeting may be used in areas where food is served.

P/T Article Title: Repair, replacement, alterations, inspection, testing and maintenance
P/T Sentence Text: Sprinkler systems shall be maintained in operating condition.
Variation Label: Repair, replacement, alterations, inspection, testing and maintenance

P/T Sentence Text: Automobile undercoating spray operations shall conform to the requirements of Section 5.12 or to the requirements in this Subsection.
Floor separations shall be maintained at interior stairways that are not required exits.
An aisle serving a shelf and rack storage system shall have a clear-aisle width of not less than 760 mm.
Forest products shall not be piled on refuse-filled or sawdust-filled land except where the site is covered with a layer of compacted earth to a minimum depth of 150 mm.
Piles or containers with metal shavings, turnings and dusts shall be stored in an area separate from other salvage materials and identified with warning signs.

Emergency electric power shall be provided in accordance with Articles 3.2.7.5. and 3.2.7.8. of the 1990 Building Code if the power is provided for\n fire alarm and detection systems referred to in Sentence 9.6.4.1. and Article 9.6.4.8., booster pumps serving standpipe systems referred to in Sentences 9.6.5.2. and 9.6.5.3.(2), and elevators referred to in Clause 9.6.5.6.(3)(c).
Reserved

Electrostatic spraying equipment shall be provided with automatic controls that will operate without a time delay to disconnect power to high voltage transformers and to signal the operator of the equipment if  the air supply system, the ventilating fan or the conveyor system stops,  a ground occurs at any point on the high voltage system, or  any clearances are reduced below those required by Article 5.12.10.5.

In a rapid transit station that is erected entirely above the adjoining finished ground level and is a stand-alone building, where the leased area on any floor level exceeds 20% of the public area on that level, the public area shall be sprinklered.
Smoke alarms required in Sentence  shall be installed in accordance with CAN/ULC-S553, "Standard for the Installation of Smoke-Alarms".

A normally occupied floor area that is not required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel shall meet the following requirements: interior walking surfaces throughout the normally occupied floor area shall comply with Clauses  to (e), and where the headroom of an area in a corridor or aisle in the normally occupied floor area is reduced to less than 1 980 mm, a guardrail or other barrier with its leading edge at or below 680 mm from the finished floor shall be provided. (See Appendix A.)

An elevator is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence  where the elevator is capable of providing transportation from the street floor to every floor served by the elevator system, the elevator is identified on the street floor as an elevator provided for use by firefighters, the elevator satisfies the requirements of Sentences 3.2.6.8. to  of the 1990 Building Code, and other elevator cabs in the same shaft as the elevator for use by firefighters satisfy the requirements of Sentences 3.2.6.8. and  of the 1990 Building Code.

P/T Article Title: 3.8.2.1. Areas Requiring Barrier-Free Path of Travel
P/T Sentence Text: Bathrooms required by Clause  shall,  contain a lavatory,  contain a water closet,  contain a bathtub or a shower,  have wall reinforcement installed in conformance with Sentence 3.3.4.9.(1), and  be designed to permit a wheelchair to turn in an open space not less than 1 500 mm in diameter.
Portable extinguishers shall be installed near spraying areas in conformance with Section 6.2.

On every floor where work will be performed and within 100 m of any area where work will be performed, potable water shall be provided from,  a fountain with an upward jet,  a tap from a piped water supply, or  a tap from a covered vessel.
Smoking shall not take place in a room where pin refinishing occurs.

P/T Article Title: 6.2.4.3. Construction and Installation of Ducts and Plenums
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Sentence Text: Bedroom spaces in combination with other spaces in dwelling units shall have an area not less than 4.2 mÃÂ².

The emergency stop button required in Sentence  shall, be a switch separate from the public spa s timing device, activate an audible and a visual signal when used, and have an emergency sign conforming to Sentence 3.11.10.1.(14).

If freezing of piping may occur, a dry standpipe system may be provided and so arranged through the use of listed devices to,  automatically admit water to the system by opening of a hose valve, and  transmit a signal to an attended location.
Sprinkler systems shall not be used to support anything that will interfere with effective sprinkler system performance.
The firewatch personnel shall be equipped with portable illumination and protective equipment.
In mixed storage areas, matches shall be stored in a specific area separated from the remainder of the storage by a clear space of at least 2.4 m.
The bottom of the cesspool shall be at least 900 mm above the high ground water table.

P/T Article Title: 3.4.1.11. Exterior Stairway for Long-Term Care Homes
P/T Sentence Text: No open exterior stairway shall serve as a means of egress for residents above the second floor of a long-term care home.
Portable extinguishers shall be provided for storage rooms described in Article 4.2.9.1. in conformance with Section 6.2.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: When alterations or additions are made to underground mains and lead-in connections of a sprinkler system, the mains and lead-in connections shall be tested by  flushing for sufficient time to remove foreign material at a minimum water flow as specified in Table 6.5.1.A., and  a 2 h hydrostatic pressure test of 350 kPa  in excess of the maximum static pressure, but not less than 1400 kPa  and leakage shall not exceed 2 L/h per 100 joints for pipe laid with rubber gasketted joints, and 30 mL/h per 25 mm of pipe diameter per joint for pipe laid with caulked lead or lead substitute joints.
Signs incorporating the International Symbol of Access shall be installed where necessary to indicate the location of a barrier-free means of egress.
Sprinkler heads in spray booths and spray rooms shall be protected with lightweight paper bags or cellophane bags having a thickness of not more than 0.08 mm.
Where approved, manual pull stations for a fire alarm system in a building may be relocated if there is a high incidence of false alarms in the building.

Warning signs required in Sentence  shall  be visible from all directions of approach, and  have the name of the metal and the words "COMBUSTIBLE METAL " DO NOT USE WATER" displayed in plain legible letters as described in Sentence .
Sentence  does not apply to the front edges of stages.
Despite Subclause (a)(i), a penthouse may be protected by a hose station located in the storey below.

Where a pump or siphon is required, the pump or siphon shall be equipped with a device that shall produce an audible and visual alarm signal that indicates a high water level in the pump or siphon chamber.

Subject to Sentence , material standards, access and construction methods and practices for a tank used for other Classes of sewage systems shall conform to the requirements of CSA B66, "Design, Material, and Manufacturing Requirements for Prefabricated Septic Tanks and Sewage Holding Tanks".

Except as provided in Articles 9.5.7.2. and 9.5.7.3., bedrooms in dwelling units shall have an area not less than 7 mÃÂ² where built-in cabinets are not provided and not less than 6 mÃÂ² where built-in cabinets are provided.
A clearance space that is equivalent to twice the sparking distance shall be maintained between the articles being painted and any electrodes or conductors.

An existing chute installation is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence  where the chute outlet in the discharge room is protected by an automatic, self-latching closure held open by a fusible link in buildings greater than 6 storeys in building height, the room into which the chute discharges is sprinklered, and\n at least one sprinkler head with a minimum discharge rate of 66 L/min is located at the top of the chute.
A carbon monoxide alarm shall be replaced within the time frame indicated in the manufacturer's instructions.

Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Sentence Text: Where the total length of distribution pipe or leaching chamber required is 150 m or more, the sewage system shall have at least one pump or a siphon contained in a dosing tank that may be a separate compartment within the tank structure, for distribution of the effluent. (1.1) Where the total length of leaching chamber is 150 m or more, a distribution pipe shall be installed at the centreline of the leaching chamber and extend the total length of leaching chamber to allow for dosing of the effluent.
In this Subsection, a converging aisle is an aisle into which the occupants of two or more aisles converge in travelling to an exit.
The flow rates of fittings that supply water to a fixture shall not exceed the maximum flow rates at the test pressures listed for that fitting in Table 7.6.4.1.

Despite Sentence , the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation above the service room is not required where the required vertical fire separation to a service room is provided, and the service room area is sprinklered, with a spacing not exceeding 9.5 m2 per sprinkler head, or providing a minimum average density of 6.5 L/min/m2 over the room area.

Every exit door shall be designed and installed so that, when the latch is released, the door will open in the direction of exit travel under a force of not more than 90 N, applied at the knob or other latch releasing device.

Where the plenum clearance is 75 mm or less, the clearance between a supply duct and combustible material shall,  be equal to the required plenum clearance within 450 mm of the plenum, and (b)be not less than 12 mm at a distance of 450 mm or more from the plenum, except that this clearance may be reduced to zero beyond a bend or offset in the duct sufficiently large to shield the remainder of the duct from direct radiation from the furnace heat exchanger.
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Sentence Text: Despite Sentence , the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation above the room is not required where the required vertical fire separation to the room is provided, and the room area is fully sprinklered, with a spacing not exceeding 9.5 m2 per sprinkler head, or providing a minimum average density of 6.5 L/min/m2 over the room area.

Except as required in Sentences  to , in an elementary or secondary school, a hazardous classroom shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire-separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than,  1 h where the building is not sprinklered, or  30 min where the building is sprinklered.

National Article Title: Fire Blocks in Horizontal Concealed Spaces
P/T Article Title: 3.1.11.5. Fire Blocks in Horizontal Concealed Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided by Sentence , a horizontal concealed space within a floor assembly or roof assembly of combustible construction in a building within the scope of Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A. shall be separated by construction conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. into compartments not more than, 600 m2 in area with no dimension more than 60 m, if the exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating not more than 25, and 300 m2 in area with no dimension more than 20 m, if the exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating more than 25.
Dip tanks shall not be located in basements.

A high temperature limit switch shall be provided to sound an alarm, shut off heat and stop conveyors when a flammable liquid or combustible liquid reaches 28°C below its flash point in a quench tank.
Overspray collectors shall be inspected after each period of use and clogged filters shall be discarded and replaced.
Despite Sentence , bitumen kettles may be located on concrete roofs if roof openings within 15 m are diked to prevent spilled asphalt run-off.

P/T Article Title: 6.2.4.13. Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior openings for outdoor air intakes and exhaust outlets shall be shielded from the entry of snow and rain and shall be fitted with corrosion-resistant screens of mesh having openings not larger than 15 mm, except where climatic conditions may require larger openings.
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Article Title: 3.8.2.1. Areas Requiring Barrier-Free Path of Travel
P/T Sentence Text: The suites described in Sentence  shall be distributed among storeys that are required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel, having regard to the height of the suite above grade.

No plumbing serving a dwelling unit shall be installed in or under another unit of the building unless the piping is located in a tunnel, pipe corridor, common basement or parking garage, so that the piping is accessible for servicing and maintenance throughout its length without encroachment on any private living space, but this Sentence does not prevent plumbing serving a unit located above another unit from being installed in or under the lower unit.
The power supply shall be checked weekly.

Where only the roof assembly is of combustible construction, the building is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence  where the ceiling membrane has a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min and the attic space is fire stopped in accordance with Article 3.1.11.5. of the 1990 Building Code, the roof assembly is of heavy timber construction in accordance with Article 3.1.4.6. of the 1990 Building Code, or the top storey and attic space are sprinklered.

P/T Article Title: Maintenance of exhaust and fire protection systems
P/T Sentence Text: Exhaust and fire protection systems required under Article 2.6.1.12. shall be maintained in accordance with NFPA 96, "Standard for Ventilation Control and Fire Protection of Commercial Cooking Operations".
The hydrant barrel shall be inspected to ensure that no water has accumulated within the barrel when the main valve is in the closed position.

Main entrance doors and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they,  control air leakage,  resist the ingress of insects and vermin,  resist forced entry, and  are easily operable.

P/T Article Title: 11.3.1.1.  Material Alteration or Repair of a Building System
P/T Sentence Text: Where an existing building system is materially altered or repaired, the performance level of the building after the material alteration or repair shall be at least equal to the performance level of the building prior to the material alteration or repair. (See Appendix A.)

Where a service room is separated in accordance with Article 9.6.2.8., sufficient combustion air shall be brought directly from the outside for the proper combustion and safe operation of the appliances.
Unsalvageable material shall be removed by sweeping and burial.

A universal washroom need not conform to Sentences  and  if,  it is located in an individual suite that,  is used for an assembly occupancy, a business and personal services occupancy, a mercantile occupancy or an industrial occupancy, and  meets one of the following requirements,  it is located in a building that is less than 300 m2 in building area, or  it is less than 300 m2 in area, if located in a building that is at least 300 m2 in building area, or  another universal washroom conforming to this Article is provided on the same floor level within 45 m.

P/T Article Title: Indoor storage of flammable compressed gases
P/T Sentence Text: Cylinders of flammable compressed gas which are heavier than air may be stored in rooms other than those described in Sentence  if they are stored in a fire compartment having a fire-resistance rating of at least 45 min and  the aggregate capacity does not exceed 100 kg,  the number of cylinders does not exceed three,  the cylinders are not located in the basement or other areas below grade, and  the fire compartment has ventilation conforming to Sentence .

The energy rating and the overall coefficient of heat transfer required for windows and sliding glass doors shall be determined in conformance with, CSA A440.2, "Fenestration Energy Performance", or  NFRC 100, "Procedure for Determining Fenestration Product U-factors" and NFRC 200, "Procedure for Determining Fenestration Product Solar Heat Gain Coefficient and Visible Transmittance at Normal Incidence".
No trough urinal shall be used as part of a plumbing system.

The pit shall be provided with a tight, strong cover that shall remain over the pit except when it is necessary to remove it for purposes of adding greywater to or removing greywater from the pit or for purposes of maintenance of the pit.
A grease interceptor shall be located as close as possible to the fixture or fixtures it serves.
The peak electric demand of a building required to comply with Clause 1.1.2.1. (a), shall not exceed the level achieved by complying with Sections 5 to 10 of 2013 ANSI/ASHRAE/IES 90.1 and Chapter 2.
The a.m. and the p.m. peak period occupant loads for each platform shall be based on the simultaneous evacuation of the entraining load and the link load for that platform.
Floor areas containing residentsÃ¢â¬â¢ sleeping rooms in a retirement home shall conform to Sentences  to .
A standpipe system shall be installed in every basement of a building that requires a standpipe system above grade.
This Subsection applies to carbon monoxide alarms in buildings containing a residential occupancy.

The compliance equivalency described in this Article is not applicable in respect of any acceptable solutions to which objectives and functional statements have not been attributed in OFMEM Fire Code Supplement FCS-1, "Objectives and Functional Statements Attributed to Acceptable Solutions".
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: A firewatch shall be conducted from the beginning of a hot surface application until  at least 3 hours after the application ceases, or  at least 2 hours after the application ceases if a hand-held thermal scanner is used to assist in detecting hidden hot spots.

Unless otherwise approved, emergency electric power provided by generators for fire alarm systems referred to in Sentence 9.9.4.1. and for elevator cars referred to in Clause 9.9.5.3.(3) shall be provided in accordance with CSA-C282, "Emergency Electrical Power Supply for Buildings".
Revoked: O. Reg. 256/14, s. 317.

P/T Article Title: 3.13.4.3. Number and Location of Means of Egress
P/T Sentence Text: Each platform in a rapid transit station shall be served by no fewer than two means of egress that are independent of and remote from each other from the platform to the exterior of the station.

Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Sentence Text: Where a building or portion thereof is required to be sprinklered, the sprinkler system shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Articles 3.2.5.13. to 3.2.5.16. of the 1990 Building Code.
There shall be identification on a fire department connection for a sprinkler system in a rapid transit station to indicate that the connection is part of the station system.
The floor area on either side of a horizontal exit conforming to Article 3.4.6.10. is permitted to be considered as a fire compartment in applying the requirements of this Article.
Each hose connection in a dry standpipe system with no permanent water supply shall be provided with a legible weatherproof sign reading: "DRY STANDPIPE FOR FIRE DEPARTMENT USE ONLY".
The checking, inspection and testing of fire safety devices shall be conducted in accordance with this Code.
Except as otherwise provided in this Part, fire protection equipment and life safety systems shall not be decommissioned or permanently taken out of service without approval.
An automatic means shall be provided for grounding the electrode system when it is de-energized.

P/T Article Title: 11.4.3.3. Increase in Occupant Load (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Sentence 11.4.2.2.(1), additional construction shall be required in order that the building or part of the building subject to the increase in occupant load conforms to the requirements of Sentence 6.2.2.1.(2), Subsection 3.7.4. and Article 9.31.1.1.

This Section applies to a detached house, semi-detached house or row house containing two existing residential units, if the building is 3 storeys or less in building height, the building area does not exceed 600 m2, and one residential unit or a portion of a residential unit is situated above another residential unit, or two residential units side by side share a common interior means of escape.
A building that is sprinklered is deemed to be in compliance with Sentences  and .
Corridors and stairways shall be lighted to the intensity of 50 lx measured at the floor level, or 5 watts/m2 of floor area.
Where a canopy is provided to protect outdoor storage in Sentence , the canopy shall be of noncombustible construction.

Where a fire alarm system is monitored by a central station to meet the requirements of the Building Code or this Code, the operator of the central station shall provide, upon request by the owner or Chief Fire Official, a document attesting that the monitoring service is in compliance with one of the standards identified in Sentence .
Cellulose nitrate motion picture film shall not be used, stored or handled in a place of public assembly.

Storage rooms, refuse storage rooms and laundry rooms that open directly into an exit stairway shall be sprinklered and separated from the exit stairway by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

Sentence  does not apply where the fire alarm system or interconnected smoke alarm system has provision for notifying the fire department in accordance with Article 3.2.4.7. of the 1990 Building Code that a fire alarm signal or alert signal has been activated.

A fire alarm system complying with Articles 9.10.17.4., 9.10.17.5., 9.10.17.11. and Subsection 9.10.18. of the 1986 Building Code shall be installed where sleeping accommodation is provided for more than 10 persons, and the floor assemblies have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min and public corridors or corridors serving sleeping rooms not within a dwelling unit are separated from the remainder of the building by fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 30 min.
Objects being coated shall be maintained in contact with the conveyor or other support.
This Section applies to the construction of a Class 2 sewage system.
Battery-operated smoke alarms are deemed to be in compliance with Sentence 3.2.4.21. of the 1994 Building Code.
Panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring on waferboard or strandboard subflooring.
Fire alarm systems shall operate in conformance with Article 3.2.4.4. of the 1994 Building Code, unless otherwise approved.

Storage rooms for the use of occupants, not contained within a dwelling unit or suite, shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and sprinklered in accordance with Article 9.6.5.5.

Except as permitted in Sentence , each building situated on property that abuts on a street in which a public or municipal water main is located shall be provided with or have accessible to its occupants a plumbing system including a potable water supply, a sanitary drainage system and plumbing fixtures.
When a building is not supplied with primary power from a public utility, two approved independent sources of power shall be provided to the fire alarm system.

No person shall operate a treatment unit other than a septic tank unless the person has entered into an agreement whereby servicing and maintenance of the treatment unit and its related components will be carried out by a person who, possesses a copy of the literature required by Sentence 8.6.2.2.(6), and  is authorized by the manufacturer to service and maintain that type of treatment unit.

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Where a 1 h or 45 min fire-protection rating is required, existing closures are deemed to be in compliance with Sentence  where they consist of hollow metal or kalamein doors in hollow metal frames, with openings, if any, protected by wired glass, and equipped with self-closing and latching devices, or wired glass screens set in fixed steel frames.

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Where the floor area is sprinklered, existing closures in fire separations to which Article 9.6.2.5. applies are deemed to be in compliance with Sentence  and Sentences 3.1.8.4. and 3.1.8.10. of the 1990 Building Code.
Throughwall flashing shall be provided in a masonry veneer wall such that any moisture that accumulates in the air space will be directed to the exterior of the building.
The clear width may be less than that required by Sentences  and  if an alternative means of egress is adjacent to and plainly visible from the restricted egress.

Vertical service spaces shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating equivalent to that required for the floor assemblies within the building in accordance with Articles 9.5.2.2. to 9.5.2.5.

The minimum stock of spare sprinkler heads to be kept on hand shall be  6 sprinkler heads for installations containing not more than 300 sprinklers,  12 sprinkler heads for installations containing from 301 to 1000 sprinklers, and  24 sprinkler heads for installations containing more than 1000 sprinklers.
If a standpipe system is required in a building, hose stations shall be provided in each storey in the building.
Except as provided in Sentence , the requirements in Subsection 3.2.3. shall apply.

A leaching bed shall not be located, in an area that has an average slope that exceeds one unit vertically to four units horizontally,  in soil or leaching bed fill having a percolation time of,  less than one minute, or greater than 125 minutes if constructed as a shallow buried trench, or  less than one minute, or greater than 50 minutes for all other leaching beds, or  in or on an area that is subject to flooding that may be expected to cause damage to the leaching bed or impair the operation of the leaching bed.

Where a separate employee washroom is provided, the same room may be used by both female and male employees provided that,  the total number of employees is not more than 5, and  the door to the room can be locked from the inside.
This Section applies to portable oxygen systems used for medical purposes in residential occupancies and health care facilities.

The water supply for the sprinklers referred to in Clause  may be taken from the domestic supply where the supply provides sufficient density for the largest fire compartment and where the supply is approved.

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Despite the requirements referred to in Sentence , fire dampers or fire-stop flaps are not required to be installed in existing noncombustible ducts at penetrations of a fire separation.
Fire separations shall be provided between assembly occupancies described in Subsection 9.2.1. and other major occupancies in compliance with Article 3.1.3.2. of the 1986 Building Code.
Tank heating equipment and accessories shall be checked daily during freezing weather to ensure that they are in operating condition and that heater valves are open.

Emergency lighting shall be provided in exits and access to exits in buildings required to have a fire alarm system, and rooms containing an assembly occupancy with an occupant load of more than 60 persons.
Smoke alarms shall be installed in each dwelling unit and in each sleeping room not within a dwelling unit in accordance with Article 3.2.4.21. of the 1990 Building Code.

Where flammable liquids and combustible liquids contained in dip tanks are heated or have a flash point below 43°C, the electrical installation shall conform to the Electrical Safety Code made under the Electricity Act, 1998.

Where hot and cold water are mixed and the temperature is regulated by a single, unmarked, manual control, a movement to the left shall increase the temperature and a movement to the right shall decrease the temperature.
Every wave action pool shall have a public address system that shall be clearly audible in all portions of the pool.
In a building within the scope of Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A., the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation referred to in Sentence  shall not be less than 1.5 h.

Except as provided in Sentence , all suction or gravity fittings installed at or below the water line of a public spa shall, have a maximum opening of 7 mm in one direction, and be designed so that the flow of water through the openings does not exceed 0.45 m/s.

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Despite Sentence , fire dampers or fire-stop flaps are not required in ducts at penetrations of a fire separation.
This Part does not apply to a building that contains a residential occupancy, consisting of no more than one dwelling unit, and no other major occupancy.
Tanks supplied by a potable water supply shall be inspected every five years and scraped and repainted as required.

P/T Article Title: 7.3.4.9. Thrust Restraint of Water Service Pipes )
