P/T Sentence Text: Thrust blocks shall not be used to restrain vertical pipe.
A second means of egress as required by Sentence 3.13.4.3. is permitted to be not less than 1 100 mm wide.
Sentence  does not apply to a force main.
For all other occupancies, the total daily design sanitary sewage flow shall be at least the value in Column 2 as determined from Table 8.2.1.3.B. (See Appendix A.)

P/T Article Title: 11.4.3.4. Change in Major Occupancy (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Sentence 11.4.2.3.(3), the building shall be evaluated, and the early warning and evacuation systems shall be upgraded, in conformance with the applicable requirements of Table 11.4.3.3.
Extinguishing equipment shall be located not more than 25 m from the Class D fire hazard.
Unless otherwise approved, each storage yard shall be provided with at least two fire access routes in conformance with Sentence .

The building shall be designed and constructed to facilitate future installation of means to measure and monitor energy consumption of the following types of energy supplied by an energy provider or a plant that is not within the building:  natural gas,  fuel oil,  propane,  steam,  chilled water, and  hot water.

P/T Article Title: 7.1.5.5. Private Sewers and Private Water Supply
P/T Sentence Text: Private sewers shall be designed and installed according to MOE PIBS 6879, "Design Guidelines for Sewage Works".
No person shall disable a carbon monoxide alarm.

P/T Article Title: Requirements for locking, latching and fastening devices
P/T Sentence Text: A locking device with a local release permitted by Sentence  shall be capable of being unlocked with a key from both sides of the door.
Every grease interceptor shall have a vent pipe that is not less than 1½ in. in size connected to the outlet pipe, that connects to the plumbing venting system.
Illumination from emergency lighting shall be an average of at least 10 lx at floor or tread level, or 1 watt/m2 of floor space.
The requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83. do not apply to this Part.

Where two or more tanks are used to meet the requirement of Sentence , they shall be deemed to be one holding tank provided they are connected in such a manner as will allow the sanitary sewage contained in them to flow between the tanks.

Where a building containing an interconnected floor space is more than 75 m in height, measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey, the exit stairshaft protection required in Sentence  shall be accomplished by the provision, between each floor area and each exit stairshaft, of a vestibule provided with a mechanical air supply or with a vent opening to the outdoors.

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Closures in fire separations shall be in accordance with Sentences 3.1.8.4.(2), 3.1.8.10. and 3.1.8.11. and Article 3.1.8.13. of the 1990 Building Code.
A hydrant located within 45 m of a fire department connection, as required by Sentence 9.6.5.3.(1), is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence .
Bags of ammonium nitrate shall not be stored closer than 400 mm from walls and partitions and not closer than 900 mm from a roof, overhead supporting beam or a sprinkler head deflector.

Dip tanks with over 550 L capacity or with over 1 m2 liquid surface area shall be protected by  a cover actuated by a device that  automatically closes the cover in the event of a fire, and  permits manual operation of the cover, or  an approved automatic extinguishing system of a water spray, foam, carbon dioxide or dry chemical type.
Ventilation shall be provided to confine all flammable vapour concentrations exceeding 25% of the lower explosive limit to within 600 mm of the dip tank, drain board and freshly coated work.

Except as provided in Sentence  and Article 11.3.3.2., construction may be carried out to maintain the existing performance level of all or part of an existing building, by the reuse, relocation or extension of the same or similar materials or components, to retain the existing character, structural uniqueness, heritage value, or aesthetic appearance of all or part of the building, if the construction will not adversely affect the early warning and evacuation systems, fire separations or the structural adequacy or will not create an unhealthy environment in the building.

Hose stations shall be located, so that every portion of the building can be reached by a hose stream and is within 3 m of a nozzle attached to the hose required in Sentence , not more than 5 m from every required exit serving a floor area, except, for the first storey, or if additional hose stations are required to achieve full coverage of the floor area, and in a conspicuous location where they are not likely to be obstructed.

Where a means of escape provided by Sentence  serves a residential unit situated entirely on the third storey, the detached house, semi-detached house or row house shall be equipped with interconnected smoke alarms conforming to Article 9.8.4.1.
Exterior exit stairways leading across roofs shall be provided with handrails on both sides of the walkway leading to the stairway at the edge of the roof, unless otherwise approved.
Dressing and locker room floors shall have non-slip surfaces that permit convenient and thorough cleaning and disinfecting.
The requirements of this Subsection are in addition to the requirements of Subsection 8.9.1.
Rooms or areas that are sprinklered in accordance with Article 3.2.4.16. of the 1994 Building Code are deemed to be in compliance with Sentence .
Revoked: O. Reg. 256/14, s. 372 .

P/T Article Title:
6.2.3.4. Duct Coverings, Linings,
Adhesives and Insulation

P/T Sentence Text: If a fire-resistance rating of 1 h or less is required, existing wall assemblies, floor assemblies, ceilings and their supporting assemblies that consist of membranes of lath and plaster or gypsum board are deemed to be comply with Sentence .

Except where located in and serving only the dwelling units, a fuel-fired appliance shall be located in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

P/T Article Title: 11.4.3.7. Extension of Buildings of Combustible Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Article 11.4.2.6., the building shall be sprinklered.
Except as permitted in Sentences  to , plumbing fixtures in a building regulated by the provisions of Subsection 3.2.6. shall have a smoke developed classification not more than 300.

If a fire escape serves any storey above the second floor, doorway openings and window openings shall be protected in accordance with Sentences  and  if located within 3 m horizontally of any balcony, platform or stairway of the fire escape, within 3 storeys below or 10 m below any balcony, platform or stairway of the fire escape, or within 1.8 m above any balcony, platform or stairway of the fire escape.

Despite Sentence , a manual pull station may serve two exits where the exits are not more than 9 m apart, the exits are located on the same storey, and the manual pull station is readily accessible and visible from each exit.

Where a means of egress from a rapid transit station leads through an adjoining building, any alarm signal originating in the building within 2 storeys above a connection to the station shall, be indicated on the rapid transit station annunciator, and cause a message to flash a warning on a sign located in conformance with Sentence , that the means of egress shall not be used as an exit from the station.
Where the total number of exits and the total width of exits comply with Articles 9.2.3.6. and 9.2.3.7., existing corridor and stair widths are deemed to be in compliance with Article 9.2.3.8.
For the purposes of this Section and Sentences 11.4.2.1. and 11.4.2.5.(4), the changes of use set out in Subclauses (a) to  and  shall also be deemed to constitute a change in major occupancy.
Water supply pressure and system air pressure for automatic dry standpipe systems shall be checked weekly by using gauges to ensure that the system is maintained at the required operating pressure.

National Article Title: Fans and Associated Air Handling Equipment
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.15. Fans and Associated Air Handling Equipment

P/T Sentence Text: In a storage area with an aggregate volume of piles of stored matches that exceeds 3 m3, shipping cartons containing matches shall be arranged in piles not exceeding 3 m in height or 40 m3 in volume, with each pile separated by aisles at least 2.4 m wide.
Hose stations shall be inspected monthly to ensure that the hose is in proper position and that all of the equipment is in place and in operable condition.

Except as provided for in Sentences  and , all valves supplying fixed location shower heads, shall be individually pressure-balanced or thermostatic-mixing valves, conforming to ASME A112.18.1 / CSA B125.1, "Plumbing Supply Fittings".

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Openings in a fire separation that is required to have a 30 min fire-resistance rating shall be protected with closures having a 20 min fire-protection rating.

P/T Article Title: 9.5.5.1. Area of Dining Rooms or Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: A dining space in combination with other space shall have an area of not less than 3.25 mÃÂ².
Variation Label: Area of Dining Rooms or Spaces

P/T Sentence Text: In addition to the requirements of this Subsection, public spas shall comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.11.10.1. to .

Existing manually operated, non-electric alarm systems employing mechanical gongs are deemed to be in compliance with Sentence 9.5.4.1.(1), where the building is not more than 2 storeys in building height, not more than two manual fire alarm stations are required in the building, and each gong is audible in every location in the building.

Each zone required in Sentence  shall contain at least one acceptable exit, and be able to accommodate, in addition to its own occupants, the occupants of the adjacent zone, based on the requirements of 0.5 m2 of clear floor space per person, 1.6 m2 per person in a wheelchair, and 2.4 m2 for each bedridden patient as the occupancy requires.

P/T Article Title: 3.8.2.3. Washrooms Required to be Barrier-Free (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Where a washroom required by Subsection 3.7.4. is provided in a storey that is not required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel, the washroom shall, conform to Article 3.8.3.9. and Sentences 3.8.3.10. and 3.8.3.11.(5), and be provided with at least one ambulatory water closet stall or enclosure conforming to Sentence 3.8.3.8.(10).

P/T Article Title: Fire separations between bedrooms and corridors
P/T Sentence Text: Where the floor area is sprinklered, an existing fire separation is deemed to be in compliance with Sentences  and .

An access to exit from an elevated platform level may be provided by means of open unenclosed stairs serving, not more than four platform levels, the highest of which shall be not more than 12 m above the main floor, where the shelf and rack storage system is intended for the storage of Class I, II, III and IV commodities, as defined in NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems", and not more than two platform levels, where the shelf and rack storage system is intended for the storage of Group A, B and C plastics and rubber tires, as defined in NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems".
Sentence  does not apply to a fuel-fired appliance that serves only one dwelling unit or suite.

If a guest suite has access to a second exit or if a guest suite is in a building that is permitted to be served by a single exit in compliance with Article 9.9.3.3., a doorway from the guest suite may open onto an exit stairway, a fire escape, a corridor served by a single exit, or an exterior passageway served by a single exit stairway.
The classification of an existing building of multiple occupancy under Article 11.2.1.1. shall be applied according to Articles 3.2.2.5. to 3.2.2.8.
If no fire department standpipe connection exists in a building under demolition that is 4 storeys or more in building height, a temporary standpipe connection shall be provided.

A carbon monoxide alarm that is installed adjacent to a sleeping area shall be equipped with an alarm that is audible throughout the sleeping area, even if any doors between the carbon monoxide alarm and any parts of the sleeping area are closed.
Manholes shall be located at all junctions and all changes in grade, size or alignment (except for curvilinear on a sanitary building sewer that is 8 in. or larger in size.
The port caps shall be removed and the connections inspected for wear, rust or obstructions that in any way hamper easy removal and corrective action shall be taken as needed.

Despite Section 2.16, when a carbon monoxide alarm is replaced in a suite of residential occupancy constructed on or after August 6, 2001, the replacement  shall not provide a lower level or type of carbon monoxide protection than that required by the Building Code as it read on the day the suite was constructed, and  shall comply with CSA-6.19, "Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices" or UL 2034, "Single and Multiple Station Carbon Monoxide Alarms".
Slabs for conditions other than described in Sentence  shall be designed in accordance with Part 4.
Escalators forming part of a required means of egress shall not comprise more than one-half of the required egress capacity from any one level.
Storage areas described in Article 4.2.7.1. shall be ventilated in conformance with Subsection 4.1.7.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: Despite Sentence , the lighting provided for illumination may be controlled by motion sensors installed in accordance with the Building Code.

Where an access is provided between a rapid transit station and an adjacent building, and the building is regulated by the provisions of Subsection 3.2.6. or 3.2.8., these provisions are not required in the rapid transit station.
Walls and ceilings of spray rooms that are susceptible to paint residue accumulations and interior surfaces of spray booths shall be smooth and continuous.
Except as provided in Sentences  to , the sewage system shall be designed and constructed to receive only sanitary sewage of domestic origin. (See Appendix A.)
Within the first storey, manual pull stations are required only in corridors.

P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.4. Vapour Barriers Used as Air Barriers
P/T Sentence Text: A vapour barrier used as an air barrier shall comply with the requirements of this Subsection.
Variation Label: Vapour Barriers Used as Air Barriers

P/T Sentence Text: Floors of spray booths and spray rooms and the operator"s working area shall be of noncombustible materials.

Despite Sentence , in a building not greater than 3 storeys in building height that provides sleeping accommodation for not more than 10 persons, a sprinkler system may be installed in accordance with NFPA 13D, "Standard for the Installation of Sprinkler Systems in One- and Two-Family Dwellings and Manufactured Homes", except that the minimum quantity of available water shall be adequate for a demand duration of at least 20 minutes if stored water is used as the sole water supply source.

The performance level of an existing building is reduced where the existing building is extended or subject to material alteration or repair and a sewage system serving the existing building is adversely affected by the extension, alteration or repair of the existing building.
Oil or grease shall not be used for lubrication of hot work equipment.
The number of water closets required for dance halls and recreational establishments shall be at least one fixture for each 100 males and one fixture for each 75 females.
Automatic detection devices referred to in Sentences  and  shall be installed and connected to the fire alarm system required in Sentence 9.6.4.1.(2).

P/T Article Title: Maintenance of certain fire emergency systems
P/T Sentence Text: Firefighters' elevators shall be maintained in operable condition.

A ramp shall have, along each side a handrail that, has a height of not less than 865 mm and not more than 965 mm, and runs parallel to the slope of the ramp, a width of at least 1 100 mm, a curb or other means to prevent a wheelchair from falling off the side of the ramp, surface finishes capable of being kept clean, sanitary and free from slipperiness, and a landing at the bottom at least 1 500 mm in length and the same width as the ramp.

A trouble signal sounding device and, where the trouble signal sounding device has a silencing switch, a trouble light shall be installed in the main reception area, or a continuously supervised area.

P/T Article Title: 1.1.1.9. Enhancements to Division B, Part 6 Service Water Systems of the 2015 NECB
P/T Sentence Text: Except where 25% of the annual service water heating requirement is provided by site-recovered energy and except for water heaters installed in individual dwelling units, where a service hot water system has a total installed gas water heating input capacity of 293 kW or greater, the gas service water heating equipment shall have a minimum thermal efficiency  of 90%.

6.2.3.18. Construction and Installation of
Ducts and Plenums
P/T Sentence Text: Ducts shall be securely supported by metal hangers, straps, lugs or brackets, except that where zero clearance is permitted, wooden brackets may be used.
A vent pipe shall be provided within 1 500 mm of the inlet to a grease interceptor complete with a cleanout to provide cleaning of the vent pipe.

Where the percolation time is determined by a percolation test, there shall be a minimum of 3 locations selected, suitably spaced to accurately evaluate the leaching bed area, with the highest percolation time of the tests being used. (See Appendix A.)

Access routes that do not comply with Sentence  may be approved where available fire department equipment has access to the building or alternative provisions are made under Subsection 2.8.2. for such access.
In buildings that are greater than 3 storeys in building height, a standpipe and hose system shall be installed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.9. of the 1994 Building Code.

If a fire pump is required by NFPA 13 or NFPA 13R, it shall be installed in accordance with NFPA 20, "Installation of Stationary Pumps for Fire Protection", if it has a rated net head pressure greater than 280 kPa.

Variation Label: Piping for Heating and Cooling Systems

P/T Sentence Text: Where combustible sprinkler piping is installed, it shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.2.5.14.
Horizontal exits to any one building shall not comprise more than one-half of the required egress capacity from any area within a rapid transit station.

P/T Article Title: Repairs and alterations to fire alarm systems
P/T Sentence Text: Repair, replacement and alterations of fire alarm system components shall be in accordance with CAN/ULC-S524, "Standard for the Installation of Fire Alarm Systems".

Except as provided in Section 10.4., the performance level of a building or part of a building is reduced where the early warning and evacuation systems requirements of the building do not meet the early warning and evacuation systems requirements set out in Table 10.3.2.2.A. for the new major occupancy that the building is to support.
If plugs or caps are missing, the fire department connections shall be examined for obstructions, back-flushed when conditions warrant and the plugs or caps replaced.
Gauges or alarms that indicate when the air velocity is less than the air velocity required by Article 5.12.3.2. or 5.12.3.3. shall be installed for spray booths.

Unless otherwise approved, exterior exit stairways, fire escapes and exterior exit passageways serving any storey above the second storey or any basement below the first basement shall be protected against fire exposure from the building in accordance with Sentences  and .

Where a sprinkler protected glazed wall assembly is installed in an exit fire separation permitted in Sentence ,  the building shall be sprinklered, and  the exits protected with the sprinkler protected glazed wall assemblies shall not comprise more than one-half of the required number of exits from any floor area.

A daily check of the temperature of the tank enclosure for tanks in buildings shall be carried out during freezing weather to ensure that the temperature of the tank enclosure does not fall below 0°C.

In a detention occupancy, portable extinguishers are permitted to be located in secure areas, or in lockable cabinets provided  identical keys for all cabinets are located at all supervisory or security stations, or  electrical remote release devices that are designed to open upon power failure are provided for the cabinets.
This Section does not apply to tents that have an area of 30 m2 or less and that are used for camping, personal or other non-commercial uses.
The space between the duct and combustible material shall be sealed with noncombustible insulating material.

The requirement in Sentence  is considered to be met where the wires and cables,  exhibit a vertical char of not more than 1.5 m when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test ¬ Cables in Cabletrough in Clause 4.11.4. of CSA C22.2 No. 0.3, "Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables", (FT4 Rating), or  exhibit a flame-spread of not more than 1.5 m, a smoke density of not more than 0.5 at peak optical density and a smoke density not more than 0.15 at average optical density when tested in conformance with the Flame and Smoke Test in the Appendix to CSA C22.2 No. 0.3, "Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables", (FT6 Rating).
Where a mechanical device is installed to furnish water to a trap, the pipe or tube conveying water from the device to the trap shall be at least 3/8 in. inside diameter.

P/T Article Title: Requirements for locking, latching and fastening devices
P/T Sentence Text: An egress door that serves a contained use area or impeded egress zone may be equipped with a locking device that can be released either locally or remotely in accordance with Sentences  to .

Where a pump or siphon is required, the pump or siphon shall be designed to discharge a dose of at least 75% of the internal volume of the distribution pipe within a time period not exceeding fifteen minutes.

Fire department connection piping shall be inspected annually with any plugs or caps removed to ensure that  the fire department connection is physically unobstructed and readily accessible,  the fire department connection identification sign is in place and visible,  the fire department connection is free of wear, rust or obstruction,  couplings or swivels are not damaged and rotate smoothly,  gaskets are in place and in good condition,  the check valve is not leaking,  the automatic drain valve is in place and operating properly, and  fire department connection clappers are in place and operating properly.
The emergency reporting devices required in Sentence  are permitted to be public telephones with an emergency no charge capability and their location shall be plainly indicated by appropriate signs.
A combustible solar collector system is permitted to be installed above the roof of a building required to be of noncombustible construction.

The peak electric demand of a building required to comply with Clause 1.1.2.1. (c), shall not exceed the level achieved by complying with Sections 7.1 to 7.4.7.5 of 2014 ANSI/ASHRAE/USGBC/IES Standard 189.1.
A public spa shall be equipped with a water circulation system that is capable of both completely and partially draining and refilling the public spa water.
This Subsection applies to the installation of storage tanks in buildings.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: A fire separation is not required under Sentence  where the travel distance between exits does not exceed 9 m and the number of occupants on the floor area is not more than 10 persons, or the floor area is served by exterior exit doors leading directly to the outside.

Each exit door, except for the main entrance to a building, dwelling unit or suite, shall have an exit sign when the exit serves a building exceeding 2 storeys in building height, a building having an occupant load greater than 150 persons, or a floor area other than a single dwelling unit with a fire escape as part of a means of egress.

Despite Sentence 9.9.2.1.(6), in a building that is not more than 3 storeys in building height and not more than 600 m2 in building area, a floor assembly is not required to be constructed as a fire separation between 2 contiguous storeys where the interconnected floor space consists of the first storey and the storey next above or below, but not both, the interconnected floor space is sprinklered, andn the sprinkler system is equipped with a water flow device and electrical supervision in conformance with Sentence 3.2.8.7. of the 1994 Building Code.
An electric storage-type service water heater shall have a minimum set storage temperature of 60ÃÂ°C.

Staples are permitted to be used to fasten wood strip flooring not more than 19 mm in thickness and not more than 83Ã mm in width provided the staples, are not less than 51 mm long,  have a shank diameter of not less than 1.82 mm,  have a crown of not less than 12.7 mm, and  are spaced not more than 400 mm o.c.

Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Article Title: 8.9.1.2. General Requirements for Operation and Maintenance
P/T Sentence Text: Every sewage system shall be operated and maintained so that, the sewage system or any part of it shall not emit, discharge or deposit sanitary sewage or effluent onto the surface of the ground,  sanitary sewage or effluent shall not emit, discharge, seep, leak or otherwise escape from the sewage system or any part of it other than from a place or part of the sewage system where the system is designed or intended to discharge the sanitary sewage or effluent, and  except as provided in Sentence , sanitary sewage or effluent shall not emit, discharge, seep, leak or otherwise escape from the sewage system or any part of it into a piped water supply, well water supply, a watercourse, ground water or surface water.
Sentence  does not apply where the building is sprinklered.
In addition to the requirements of this Subsection, the water circulation system of a public spa shall comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.11.8.1.(2), , , , , , ,  and .

P/T Article Title: 6.2.4.3. Construction and Installation of Ducts and Plenums
P/T Sentence Text: Where a supply duct is located in a conditioned space, the ductwork shall be sealed to a Class C seal level in accordance with the SMACNA, HVAC Duct Construction Standards Metal and Flexible .
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Sentence Text: Partitions separating the septic tank into compartments shall extend at least 150 mm above the liquid level at the outlet, and there shall be one or more openings through or above the partition.
The occupant load in Sentence  shall be not more than that determined by using an area of 0.6 m2 per person.
If the caps are missing, the hydrant shall be examined for obstructions or accumulated refuse and flushed in accordance with Article 6.6.5.7. and the port caps shall be re-installed.

Where the building is sprinklered, doors in a public corridor do not require to be equipped with self-closing devices and latches provided that the travel distance is measured from inside the rental space to the nearest exit.
Except for Article 9.4.5.5. and Sections 9.7 and 9.9, this Part does not apply to a building or part of a building that satisfies the requirements of the Building Code.
The capacity of a salvage tank shall be 20% greater than the capacity of the dip tank or tanks to which it is connected.

A clear deck space located parallel with the seat for the pool lift and on the side of the seat opposite the water shall, be at least 915 mm wide, and extend forward not less than 1 220 mm from a line located 305 mm behind the rear edge of the seat.

Existing laboratories in basements may store, handle or use flammable liquids and combustible liquids if the quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids that are stored, handled or used does not exceed 300 L, of which not more than 250 L are flammable liquids, continuous mechanical ventilation to the outdoors is provided to ensure that flammable vapour concentrations do not exceed 25% of the lower explosive limit, an audible alarm is provided that will be sounded in an attended area upon shutdown of the mechanical ventilation system, the building has a fire safety plan in accordance with Section 2.8, Class IA liquids are not stored in containers greater than 4 L in capacity, all sources of ignition within 0.9 m from the floor are eliminated or the room is equipped with a flammable vapour detection system that will alarm in an attended location upon detection of vapour concentrations exceeding 10% of the lower explosive limit, and the laboratory is designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in accordance with NFPA 68, Standard on Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting , unless all dispensing of flammable liquids is carried out in a power-ventilated enclosure in accordance with Articles 4.12.8.3. to 4.12.8.5., and Class IA liquids are stored in cabinets in accordance with Article 4.2.10.5.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: Where existing interior walls or ceilings or floor assemblies or roof assemblies are substantially removed and new interior walls, ceilings, floor assemblies or roof assemblies are installed in an existing building or part of an existing building that is a retirement home, the following requirements apply: the retirement home shall be sprinklered, a voice communication system conforming to Article 3.2.4.23. shall be provided in the building, if Clause 3.2.6.8.(1) or (c), as applicable, requires that such a voice communication system be provided in the building, and doors to suites and sleeping rooms not within suites in the retirement home, other than doors leading directly to the exterior, shall be equipped with self-closing devices.
Quench tanks shall be provided with a noncombustible hood and vent exhausting to the outside to prevent the accumulation and condensation of vapours from the process.
Fire alarm systems shall have provision for notifying the fire department in accordance with Article 3.2.4.7. of the 1990 Building Code that a fire alarm signal or alert signal has been activated.
Access to fire escapes shall be from corridors.

The performance level of a building or part of a building is reduced where, after a change of major occupancy, the total daily design sanitary sewage flow of the new major occupancy, calculated in accordance with Article 8.2.1.3., exceeds the capacity of any component of a sewage system serving the building, or  the type or amount of sanitary sewage that will, under the new major occupancy, be discharged to a sewage system serving the building is prohibited by Article 8.1.3.1.
Supplemental exhaust required in this Article may be provided by means of a heat recovery ventilator installed in accordance with Article 9.32.3.11.

Single or multiple exhaust ducts serving the principal exhaust fan required by Sentence  shall be sized according to Part 6 except that they may be sized according to Table 9.32.3.4.B. where,  the longest total duct length, from intake grille to outdoor hood, does not exceed 12 m, and  the number of elbows does not exceed 4, but, in any case, they shall not be smaller than recommended by the manufacturer of the fan.

Except as provided in Sentence , the performance level of an existing building is reduced where a change in use will result in a change of the major occupancy of all or part of an existing building to another major occupancy of a greater hazard index.
A tank shall not be covered by soil or leaching bed fill having a depth greater than the maximum depth of burial that the tank is designed to withstand.

Where it is necessary to change elevators to reach the entrance described in Sentence , the elevator system shall be designed so that not more than one change of elevator is required between, a platform and a fare-paid area control, and the fare-paid area control and the entrance.

The visual signalling component required by Sentence  need not,  be integrated with the smoke alarm provided it is interconnected to it,  be on battery backup, or  have synchronized flash rates, when installed in a dwelling unit.

Where quantities exceed 3400 kg but do not exceed 9000 kg, cellulose nitrate plastics shall be stored in a vault that  has a fire-resistance rating not less than 4 h,  is designed to resist an internal pressure of 28 kPa,  has explosion venting of 650 cm2 of venting area to the exterior for every cubic metre of vault volume, and  is ventilated to the exterior to provide 200 cm2 of ventilating area for each cubic metre of vault volume.
Where gravity drainage to a sanitary drainage system is possible, a floor drain shall be installed in a basement forming part of a dwelling unit.
Smoke alarms shall meet the requirements of CAN/ULC-S531, "Standard for Smoke Alarms", and CAN/ULC-S553, "Standard for the Installation of Smoke-Alarms".
This Subsection applies to coating operations involving the use of combustible dry powders applied by fluidized beds or electrostatic fluidized beds.
Dressing rooms, locker rooms, shower rooms, washrooms and passageways shall have an illumination level of at least 200 lx at floor level.
A door acting as a closure in the fire separation in Clause  is not required to be equipped with a self-closing device.
In calculating the required width of egress routes, one escalator at each level in a rapid transit station is deemed to be out of service and not available for egress purposes.
Other anchor systems may be used where such systems provide an equal level of safety.

This Section applies to buildings higher than 6 storeys in building height with residential occupancies and containing more than two dwelling units, sleeping accommodation for more than 10 persons in one or more dormitories, or boarding, lodging or rooming accommodation for more than 10 persons.

The treatment unit used in conjunction with a leaching bed constructed as a Type A dispersal bed shall provide an effluent quality that does not exceed the maximum concentrations set out opposite a Level IV treatment unit in Columns 2 and 3 of Table 8.6.2.2.
Emergency lighting shall comply with Article 3.2.7.3. of the 1986 Building Code.
One of the barrier-free entrances required by Sentence  shall be the principal entrance to the building.
Despite Sentence 9.3.3.5.(1), not more than one required exit from the basement may lead through the first floor floor area.
Each exit door shall open in the direction of exit travel and swing on its vertical axis.
The stone layer or bottom of the leaching chambers shall be not less than 900 mm above the high ground water table, rock or soil with a percolation time of more than 50 minutes.

Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Sentence Text: In a building where the building height is greater than 2 storeys or the building area is greater than 400 m2, a furnace room that is located on a floor area that contains a bedroom, recreation room, meeting room or hobby room shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

A therapeutic bathing system in a Group B occupancy need not comply with Sentence 3.1.13.7. if the room in which it is located,  does not open directly into patients or residents sleeping rooms, and  is sprinklered.

P/T Sentence Text: A minimum clearance of 22 m shall be provided around the perimeter of each group of storage piles.
The weep holes required in Sentence  shall be in a location such that any water that collects in the cavity or space will be directed to the exterior of the building.
All buildings shall conform to the water efficiency requirements of Subsection 7.6.4.

Except as provided in Sentence , where existing interior walls or ceilings or floor assemblies or roof assemblies are substantially removed on any storey in an existing building and new interior walls, ceilings, floor assemblies or roof assemblies are installed, the storey shall be sprinklered if,  the storey will contain a Group C major occupancy, and  the building is over 3 storeys in building height.
During the pin refinishing process, a receptacle that complies with Sentence 2.4.1.3. shall be provided for waste rags and materials used in operations involving flammable finishes or solvents.
Buildings containing a hotel where the vertical distance between the floor of the top storey and grade exceeds 18 m shall have smoke control measures in conformance with Sentences  and .
The landlord shall test smoke alarms annually and after every change in tenancy.
Rooms or areas that are sprinklered in accordance with Article 3.2.4.16. of the 1990 Building Code are deemed to be in compliance with Sentence .

Section 9.7 does not apply to a building or part of a building that contains a care occupancy, if the building or part of the building satisfies the requirements for a care occupancy contained in the Building Code as it read at any time on or after April 6, 1998.
Overflow pipes shall be connected to dip tanks by a flared outlet.
Means shall be provided to prevent tramp iron or other spark-producing materials from being introduced into the powders being applied.
Buildings are deemed to be in compliance with Sentence 9.5.2.2. where the building is sprinklered, or the building is 1 storey in building height and is not greater than 600 m2 in building area.
Except as permitted in Sentence , an automatic sprinkler system shall be installed in accordance with NFPA 13, "Standard for the Installation of Sprinkler Systems".

The performance level of an existing building is reduced where proposed construction will increase the occupant load by 15% or less and the new occupant load will be more than 15% above the existing exit capacity as required under Article 3.4.3.2.
Areas in the vicinity of dip tanks shall be provided with portable extinguishers in conformance with Section 6.2.

Portable extinguishers that are provided to protect a hazardous occupancy shall be those required in this Section for fighting Class A fires, Class B fires, Class C fires, Class D fires or Class K fires.
A holding tank shall have a working capacity of not less than 9 000 L.

Despite Articles 9.3.3.1. and 9.3.3.2., alternative measures may be approved where, in the opinion of the Chief Fire Official, they will provide protection for life safety similar to the protection provided by compliance with Articles 9.3.3.1. and 9.3.3.2.
The door in the fire-separation required in Sentence  is permitted to be equipped with a roller latch and need not be provided with a self-closing device.

Existing fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 30 min are deemed to comply with Sentence  if the building is sprinklered and the sprinkler system complies with Article 9.5.5.3., or the part of the building containing the other major occupancy is equipped with heat detectors and connecting corridors are equipped with smoke detectors as part of the fire alarm system of the building.
Sentence  does not apply where the building conforms to Subclause 3.2.2.44.(1)(a)(ii), and contains dwelling units having means of egress conforming to Sentence 3.3.4.4.(8).

Additional supplemental exhaust capacity shall be installed as necessary so that the total capacity of all kitchen, bathroom, water closet room and other supplemental exhaust air intakes is not less than the total ventilation capacity, as required in Article 9.32.3.3., minus the principal exhaust fan capacity, as required in Article 9.32.3.4.
Hay, straw or similar combustible materials may be used if necessary for the daily feeding and care of animals.
If a fire hose station is located in a cabinet, an approved lockable, scored glass break-front cabinet may be used.

Automatic sprinklers shall be installed at the top and at alternate floor levels in each linen or refuse chute and in the room or bin into which the chute discharges.
The water level in gravity tanks shall be inspected monthly.
When the conditions of Article 2.9.3.3. apply, an approved communications system shall be provided.
Portable extinguishers having defects shall be repaired and, if necessary, recharged to ensure the extinguishers will operate effectively and safely.
Except as otherwise specified in this Part, this Section applies only to dwelling units that are intended for use on a continuing or year-round basis as the principal residence of the occupant.

P/T Sentence Text: The record required in Sentence  shall be available for examination by the Chief Fire Official.
Access routes for fire fighting shall be provided in accordance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.5.5. to 3.2.5.7. of the 1990 Building Code.

If a building that is governed by this Section contains, in addition to its residential occupancies, one or more other occupancies that are governed by other Sections of this Part, the fire safety systems, devices and structural elements of the other occupancies governed by those Sections shall comply with the requirements of this Part that provide the greatest protection for life safety.
The annual CO2e emission level from a building shall be determined in accordance with good engineering practice using the CO2e emission factors listed in Table 1.1.2.2.
Where a diving board or a diving platform in a public pool is more than 600 mm above the water surface, the board or platform shall be equipped with one or more adjacent handrails.

Where a furnace room is separated to comply with the requirements of Article 9.4.2.10., sufficient combustion air shall be brought directly from the exterior for the proper combustion and safe operation of the appliance.
The water level in the fire pump reservoir shall be checked weekly.

Where a fire alarm system is monitored to transmit a signal to the fire department, the owner shall record whether all signals from the tests conducted in Sentence , or other events, are received by the monitoring station, and records shall be kept in accordance with Subsection 1.1.2.
A wave action pool shall be equipped with a first-aid room located within 50 m of the pool.

Any single platform or walkway in a shelf and rack storage system may be served by a single unenclosed stair leading to the platform or walkway level immediately below provided, the platform or walkway does not exceed 200 m2 in area, the travel distance on the platform or walkway to the level below, including the travel distance along the single unenclosed egress stair, does not exceed 25 m, and the platform or walkway below is provided with two separate egress stairs or exits.
Chlorination equipment for a public pool shall contain a mechanism whereby the chlorine feed shall automatically terminate whenever the recirculation system ceases to supply clean water to the pool.
Where a barrier-free bathtub is provided, a clear floor space at least 900 mm wide and 1 500 mm long shall be provided along the full length of the bathtub
Where smoke detectors are provided in public corridors, a building of heavy timber construction conforming to Article 3.1.4.6. of the 1990 Building Code is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence .
The Chief Fire Official shall be notified when bowling alleys are to be resurfaced.

Where the hydrant barrel is found to contain water under Article 6.6.5.3., the drain valve shall be inspected for operation.
Exhaust ducts directly connected to laundry drying equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.

P/T Sentence Text: An interconnected floor space is permitted in an elementary or secondary school provided,  the interconnected floor space consists of the first storey, and the storey next above or below it, but not both,  the interconnected floor space is sprinklered,  the portions of the upper floor area that do not terminate at an exterior wall, a firewall or a vertical shaft shall terminate at a vertical fire separation extending from the floor assembly to the underside of the floor or roof assembly above,  except as provided in Clause (e), the fire separation required in Clause  need not have a fire-resistance rating,  where a corridor is located immediately adjacent to the fire separation required in Clause (c), the fire separation shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 30 min, and  where a portion of a floor area is not within the interconnected floor space, the required access to exit from this portion of the floor area shall not lead through the interconnected floor space.
Gravity tank expansion joints shall be repacked and adjusted if binding or leaks develop.

An elevator is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence  where the elevator is capable of providing transportation from the street floor to each floor normally served by the elevator system, the elevator is identified on the street floor as an elevator for use by firefighters, the elevator satisfies the requirements of Article 3.2.6.3. of the 1986 Building Code, and other elevator cabs in the same shaft as the elevator for use by firefighters satisfy the requirements of Sentences 3.2.6.3. and  of the 1986 Building Code.

Fuel-fired appliances shall be enclosed in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min if the building height is greater than 2 storeys or the building area is greater than 400 m2. the building contains not more than four dwelling units and provides sleeping accommodation for not more than 10 persons, and sleeping rooms are not located on the same floor as storage rooms.
The egress capacity in Sentence  need not be cumulative after converging where it can be shown that the platform clearance time in Sentence  is not exceeded.

The requirements in Sentences  to  and  do not apply if,  the minimum clear width of an aisle is in accordance with Article 3.3.1.16., but is not less than 900 mm if serving seats on one side only,  the minimum clear width of an aisle is in accordance with Article 3.3.1.16., but is not less than 1 200 mm if serving seats on both sides,  the minimum clear width of a converging aisle is in accordance with Article 3.3.1.16., but not less than the width of the widest aisle leading to the converging aisle,  the minimum clear width of an exit leading directly from the seating area is in accordance with Article 3.4.3.2.,  except as provided in Clause (f), the minimum clear width of an egress doorway leading directly from the seating area is in accordance with Article 3.3.1.16., but not less than the required width of the aisle or the converging aisle leading to the doorway, and  if more than one vomitory is provided,  the minimum total clear width of the egress doorways leading from one vomitory is not less than the required width of the aisle or the converging aisle leading to the doorways, and  the minimum clear width of egress doorways from additional vomitories is in accordance with Article 3.3.1.16.
Existing openings are deemed to comply with Sentence  if each opening is sprinklered and the sprinkler system complies with Article 9.2.5.2.
Facilities for flushing and drainage shall be provided where filters are designed to be washed in place.
Spray booths and spray rooms shall be provided with overspray collection, such as filters or water wash, to prevent the build-up of combustible deposits on the exhaust fan and ductwork.
Except as provided in Sentences  and , a washroom for each sex, containing at least one water closet and one lavatory, shall be provided in each rapid transit station for use by employees.
Except as provided in Sentence 3.11.6.1. for a modified pool, water in all public pools shall be capable of being emptied through the pool drains in 12 hours or less.

Except as permitted in Sentence , the climatic zone number of a location shall be determined in accordance with Table 1.3.1.1. based on the corresponding heating degree-days  for locations found in Table 1.2 of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-1, Climatic and Seismic Data .
Loudspeakers described in Sentence  shall be tested monthly as an all-call signal to ensure they function as intended.

P/T Sentence Text: Lighting power allowances listed in Table SB 4.2.3.1.-B 2017, Table SB 4.2.3.1.-C 2017 and Table SB 4.2.3.1.-D 2017 of this Chapter shall supersede the lighting power allowances listed in Table 4.2.3.1.-B, Table 4.2.3.1.-C and Table 4.2.3.1.-D of the 2015 NECB, respectively.

Sanitary sewage shall pass from one compartment to another of the septic tank as follows: by means of a device similar to that described in CSA B66, "Design, Material, and Manufacturing Requirements for Prefabricated Septic Tanks and Sewage Holding Tanks" for outlet devices, or  through two or more openings through the partition located in a horizontal line, and evenly spaced across the width of the partition, centred at approximately 40% of the liquid depth below the surface of the liquid, and having a total area of between three and five times that of the cross-sectional area of the inlet pipe.
Columns in excess of the height limitations of Clauses  to  shall be designed in accordance with Part 4.

P/T Article Title: 11.4.3.4. Change in Major Occupancy (See Appendix A.)

Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be supplied by  direct low pressure pumping arranged to shut down automatically by means of listed and labelled devices in the event of fire, or  a gravity tank not exceeding 45 L in capacity.

An owner or the owner"s agent who feels aggrieved by a decision not to approve a Life Safety Study may, within 30 days of the refusal, appeal the decision in the same manner as though it were an Order.
A standpipe system is not required to be installed in a rooftop enclosure if this enclosure has an area not more than 50 m2.

Drip plates and screens subject to paint deposits shall be removable for cleaning.

Except as provided in Sentence , the performance level of a building or part of a building is reduced where the existing structural floor and roof framing systems and their supporting members are not adequate to support the proposed dead loads and live loads of the new major occupancy that the building is to support.
For the purposes of Sentences  and , a retirement home is deemed to be a separate major occupancy.

Despite Articles 3.2.1.4. and 3.2.1.5., other approved storage pile arrangements may be used to prevent the spread of fire.

Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

Oil interceptors are not required for a drain in a hydraulic elevator pit, parking lot, car wash or a garage used exclusively as a motor vehicle parking area.
Every emergency power supply shall be equipped with an emergency audible and visual trouble indication.

This Section does not apply if smoke alarms have been installed in the dwelling unit or sleeping room not within a dwelling unit in accordance with the Building Code as it read on or after April 6, 1998.

P/T Sentence Text: Where the heat transfer loop of the solar domestic hot water system consists of direct flow-through of potable water only, protection against backflow is not required.
Piles shall not exceed 18 m in height, 90 m in width and 150 m in length unless temporary water pipes with hose connections are laid on the top surface of the pile.

Where sleeping accommodation, recreation rooms, meeting rooms or hobby rooms are not provided in the basement, an existing fire separation between the first storey and basement is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence  where  the basement is sprinklered, or  the building contains not more than four dwelling units and provides sleeping accommodation for not more than 10 persons, and  interconnected smoke alarms are installed in accordance with Article 9.5.4.4.,  doors connecting the basement and first storey are in compliance with Sentence 9.5.2.8.(4), and  fire stopping of the wall space at the basement level is in accordance with Article 9.10.15.3. of the 1990 Building Code.

Outdoor lumber storage shall have fire protection provisions consisting of  200 L vessels with lids, having an opening of 457 mm least dimensions, located so that no person will have to travel more than 25 m from any part of the storage yard to reach a vessel, and  three 12 L standard fire pails at each vessel.

P/T Sentence Text: Each dwelling unit and sleeping room not within a dwelling unit shall be separated from adjacent rooms and areas by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

The requirements of Articles 1.1.2.1. to 1.1.2.3. of this Chapter do not apply to  a building or part of a building of residential occupancy that is within the scope of Part 9 of Division B of the Building Code,  construction trailers, tents and air-supported structures,  a building or part of a building where the environmental condition within the building is governed by the process, operation of the building or permanent openings to the outdoors or to unconditioned environments,  a building or part of a building where it can be shown that meeting the requirements of Article 1.1.2.1. does not conserve any energy,  equipment or processes that use energy for manufacturing, industrial and commercial purposes, and  occupancies listed in Table 1.2.1.1.

Except for overhead lighting that is totally enclosed and sealed with gaskets, electrical wiring and equipment within the area of hazard described in Article 5.14.5.3. shall conform to Article 5.1.3.1.

(See Appendix A.)

P/T Sentence Text: Where more than one telephone is provided for public use in a normally occupied floor area that is not required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel, a built-in shelf or counter that conforms to Sentences ,  and  shall be provided for at least one telephone.
